I got the mushroom cheese steak wit onion and with cheese wiz. All for 10.50. If you ask them to cut it in half, they will do it. But to not make it as messy while you eat it, it's best to ask for it to go and get a fork while you're at it. 

The meat was tender, gave you a good amount. Cheese was evenly smothered, and the bread was soft enough to chew. 

If someone wants to try out Cheese steaks in Philly, I will highly suggest to check out Pats. The best part of our visit was that there was no line!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Piss poor cheesesteak. Extremely overrated and way too expensive for what you get. Skip Pats and Genos, there are better sandwiches at a  minimum of  two dozen other spots in Philly. Do yourself a favor and drive past Philly  all together. That town is a shithole, just like Pats.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Generic south Philly cheesesteak joint. Better than Genos but not the best place.  Great for late night munchies.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Being from Chicago  I had to try Pat's and Geno's when I was in town. If we ever had anyhting like these 2 joints in Chicago we would all be 400 pounders instead of 300 pounders !! Price is just right for artery cloggers like the sanwiches I consumed. Cheez Whiz....Mmmmmmm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I ordered cheese steak, at first the beef is over cooked so it's hard to chew, but the rest part is good and the taste is very good in the end!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Geno's is better.  I know people deem it too flashy and a "tourist spot".  Well this tourist prefers a "Cheese Whiz Wit" at Geno's.  Love you Pat's...you are good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap and no good for any reason. Meat is bland and overcooked, never met staff that hated customers more, and I'm a local. Haven't been there in a while, ain't going back. Yech.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I agree with all the criticism about this place.  It is not the most friendly as they do throw the food at you.  It is not the most sanitary either as the condiments are left out in the open for some bug to come along and contaminate it all.  But with all that said it is simply the best cheesesteak you can buy.  Also you have to understand this place is in south philly.  this is a working class sandwich for a working class part of town.  If you are willing to venture down here for a sandwich then you should be able to handle a little tough talk and grime.  so quit your wining and enjoy your sandwich.

Now to be fair I did go and try that other philly cheesesteak (Genos) and I must say that one was good too.  But if you were to hog tie me and threaten me with a hot iron rod to actually make a choice I still would choose Pats because they have a few more options and nicer condiments than that other place across the street.  That's my humble opinion, take it for what it's worth.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Awesome cheesesteak!! Love the peppers! The fries are must-try!!! Make sure to get the cheese fries!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I first moved to Philly 5 years ago, a few friends from NYC visited and wanted to try Pat's and Geno's.  They're across the street from each other.  They seem like mostly tourist places.  At that point, I had never tried either.  I don't think I will again, because now I know that there are much better cheesesteaks in the city!

Most of my friends ordered steaks at Geno's first, because it's the first place we encountered on our walk there.  So, I waited in line with my friends (prepared to order my own), but was shocked by all the extremely prejudiced and ethnically/racially hostile signs all over the place.  Seriously, I'm embarrassed this is a celebrated Philadelphia "establishment," we should all be embarrassed about that type of "in your face" prejudice.  The people working behind the counter also seemed rude, so I went across the street to Pat's and picked up a cheesesteak.  

On the upside, Pat's wasn't full of offensive signs. That already makes them much better than Geno's. But both steaks were comparable, and not that great. I expected better!

Finally, I've learned from experience that Jim's on South St. and Steve's Prince of Steaks in NorthEast Philly are the best classic cheese steaks in Philly.  If you want a good cheesesteak, try Jim's or Steve's: They're much better (delicious) cheesesteaks.  But if it's a choice between Geno's and Pat's, then Pat's has my vote!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: ehh I don't get what all the fuss is about. If you ask me Geno's or Pat's, I say Pat's hands down but there are better steaks in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is virtually the same sandwich you can get across the street.  If you can set aside any emotional attachments, you'll see that they're quite the same in terms of quality and taste.

Only real difference is that Pat's lacks a good hot sauce to use as condiment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Want a real traditional Philadelphia Cheese Steak? This is it!  My 8 year old son won't leave Philadelphia without stopping here. He doesn't care how long the line is.  We both like it plain (no cheese)... I like mine "wit" (with onions)... his is wit-out.  My husband gets the provolone and onions. All of us cheer when we're done.  My son begged for a second sandwich after plowing down the first one... but they are HUGE and there's no way most adults could eat 2 cheese steaks... let alone a lanky 8 year old. We just get in line, order from the pros, grab a seat anywhere (even with strangers if they don't mind) and chow down.  Don't miss the giant hot peppers at the bar.  I go nuts for 'em.  If you don't like the meat, then you don't like a traditional cheese steak meat.  The bread is chewy and a perfect complement to the gooey stuff piled on.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When in Philly you have to have a cheesesteak ... right!?   Pat's won because of the shorter line which moved quickly.  The sandwich  could have used a bit more cheese, yet was delicious.  I've had the experience and it was good!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I know that opinions vary on this, but in my mind,  Pats is the THE place to get a cheesesteak in Philly. The bread is perfect, loaded with tender steak and smothered in cheese. Greasy and delicious. Whiz-wit, of course.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Recent trip to Philly tried several cheese steaks and this one has the toughest steak not impressed or anything I would go back for
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was so excited about a real philly cheese steak ..One word.. meh...overhyped... had better cheesesteaks at home... cold bun cold steak cheese not melted and over 30 bucks for two sandwiches and fries.. also. got hounded by homeless people the entire time we ate...

Very under welmed
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What can't I say that hasn't been said before.  For such a simple menu,  the food IS Philadelphia. Cheese steak with onions and cheese fries.  Perfection on a plate! I love the street atmosphere,  parking sucks,  but trust me,  the wait is worth it!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Having been a city resident since halfway through college (not counting the 6 months I lived in Orlando and the 2 years that followed before I moved out of my parents' house in the suburbs and got my own city apartment), I had never taken on the duel of the coveted Philly Cheesesteak.  However, while I still cannot vouch for the quality of Geno's, a friend of mine took me to Pat's one day and treated me to one of their steaks.  We were lucky that it wasn't super crowded, being that it was a Monday afternoon!  Even as someone who generally gravitates towards chicken cheesesteaks as opposed to beef, my Pat's steak was yummy (not too dry like some beef steaks tend to be, and with just the right amount of American cheese) and I polished the whole thing off!  Something to be said for that, I guess! Now once I conquer the other half of the duel of the coveted cheesesteak (*cough* Geno's *cough*), I'll be able to report to the masses which steak REALLY is the better one.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats or Geno's? 

Pat's is slightly better but neither is great. Much respect to Pat's for being the originator but i think its time to reinvent their classic sandwich. I honestly believe that Great Steak and Fries in shopping malls are even better.

Pat's meat was dry, bread tastes stale, and service was poor. I don't understand it. Iit is quite tough to make ribeye tasteless. I have no idea  how to do it....So pat, please tell me your secret...

Needless to say, it was a big disappointment to come to these 2 tourist traps to fill my cheesesteak craving when on my roadtrip. I ate half a sandwich from Geno's and half from Pat's and int he end, i was still dissapointed and my craving for GOOD cheesesteak was bigger than ever...I should have done more research instead of just going with the most well known places. Maybe Tony's Luke's next time..

Where do the locals go?? 

Please tell me that the best cheesesteak is somewhere in philly. I still believe there has to be a great one that can hold redeem the name that Pat's and Geno's has made a mockery of.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Me and my boyfriend were on our way back from Pittsburgh and decided to re route to try the famous "Philly" cheesesteaks. We couldn't decide on which spot to choose from (Genos or Pats) so we got one cheese steak from both places and split each one. I have to say, I was very disappointed with Geno's cheese steak. With all those lights, you would think their cheese steak would hold up to it's store front appearance. The cheese steak was cold, the provolone cheese wasn't even melted! It had no flavor really, had to add ketchup to make it better. Pat's on the other hand was awesome!! Their cheese steak was piping hot and loaded with steak and cheese wiz!!! It was flavorful and juicy! For those of you having trouble choosing, Pat's is definitely the way to go. Sometimes, less is more ;) 

My boyfriend and I both wish we each had gotten a whole cheese steak from Pat's. Well, there's always next time!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Over price this a tourist spot . It's cool go take a picture outside the spot but if you from Philly you know a better place
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better seasoning. Better quality meat. Better service than the sub par competition across the street. I got mine with mushrooms, onions, ketchup, and cheese. Yummers!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I literally had just went to genos and I had the philly Cheesesteak with the wiz and it was so soggy this place at pats (we walked across and went here) and it was AMAZING and the regular with American and it as bomb amazing!!!! Hands down
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was great flavor but we were freezing sitting outside and didn't order fries or drinks because you had to at a different window and we couldn't be bothered.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I tried both pat's and Geno's in the same trip to philly (also in the same sitting actually), and while both are good I preferred Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This was stop number 2 of 3 in our morning jaunt to try some cheesesteaks, they finished first in both our opinions.  We split a cheesesteak in each location that wonderful morning.

I don't get some of the complaints about the cash only policy, I live back in NY and even I knew about this.  Besides, this isn't Peter Luger's, my wife and I split a cheesesteak for $10, maybe you get two - you don't have $20 in your wallet?

Same goes for the supposed rudeness of the staff, I'm ordering a cheesesteak, not asking about the nose on a '07 Pinot Noir.  My wife and I completely New York'ed the order and just told them what we wanted, instead the wit' or wit' out stuff - they were fine about it.  There was no cheesesteak Nazi here.

And lastly, there is no indoor seating.  They don't tell you that there is, how do you fault them for this?  My wife and I sat outside at 10AM on a Sunday morning in mid-December, after siting outside at Geno's for ten minutes.  We knew what we were getting into and had a blast.

At the end of the day, this was the sort of thing we were hoping for out of all three spots.  The thinly sliced meat, gooey whiz, with onions on some tasty bread.  We got it here.  What separated them from Geno's was the bread, the rest seemed similar to me as a rookie cheesesteak eater.

People talk about it being commercial, but it's still a damn good cheesesteak.  If we never tried Shorty's up in NY they would have received 5 stars.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is actually pretty good.  Infinitely better than Geno's.  If you find yourself at 9th and Passyunk 10 times... go to Pat's 10 times and Geno's 0.  Geno's is terrible.  A lot of locals will bash this place as a tourist trap.. but they're just locals trying to be ahead of the curve and act like they actually have superior knowledge of something.  Pat's is a quality cheesesteak... and if you haven't tried it with whiz... try the whiz.  I know it doesn't sound appetizing... but trust.. .it's infinitely better with whiz.  I was also reluctant to get whiz the first time... once I got it, I've never had anything else again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: hell no do not go, Pats is the king of terrible steaks, but definitely go to Gino's across the street as there steaks were fantastic!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Very good cheesesteaks. Bread toasty. Nice and soft on the inside. Got 5 meat, onions and whiz cheesesteak. The best. Don't get anything else. Lines are long but move pretty quickly. The guy at the register is legit. You put in your order, hand them the money and he hands you your cheesesteak. No bullshit. 

I wanted mine to go but didn't tell him. I told him to go after he gave me my first sandwich unwrapped. Say no more. He grabbed my 1st sandwich wrapped it up and wrapped the rest of my cheesesteaks to go. This guy was LEGIT. No words were spoken. Love it. Line up, order, hand over the money, bye. Transaction took about 20 seconds. 

Cheesesteaks are 10 bucks. Imagine back in the day when these cheesesteaks were way cheaper. Back when they weren't popular. Good for them. They're doing great and they don't have to have me write a yelp review to validate them. Go Pat's !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This was our first stop during our weekend in Philly and while it wasn't bad, I wasn't blown away by it either.  Most 1000 calorie sandwiches (this was probably close) are usually pretty tasty and this was no exception.  With that said, I've spent 1000 calories better before.  

I got the Wiz Wit (cheese wiz plus onions).  The bread was soft, and the steak portions were generous, but a bit dry for my taste.  The onions were raw too, and I prefer them cooked so the taste isn't quite so strong.  I loved the cheese wiz though, haven't had that since I was a kid!

Anyway, this is a Philly rite of passage so I would definitely recommend you go once, but for me at least, no need to return.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Between Pat's and Geno's, to me there is no comparison. Pat's wins hands down. I only give it 4 stars becuase I am always in the midst of an exhaustive search for the perfect sandwich, and though I'm not sure what that is yet, Pat's doesn't quite reach that pinnacle. The steak and bread are of higher quality than what they use at Geno's, or at Jims on south street in my opinion, and if you don't go when it's ridiculously busy, service is not as bad as I've seen described on many a forum. I mean, how hard is "wiz wit" to comprehend as an ordering procedure?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tried out Pat's today, because everyone told me it was better than Geno's.
Well...it doesn't take too much to be better than Geno's.
It was better than Geno's but not by  a whole lot.
This is the LAST time I'm coming to South Philly for cheesesteaks....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Its not surprising that all the hype is for naught. A good cheese steak is really an easy thing to do. Head down to Steaks on South to get a great steak without all the hassle.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am sad to say I was completely underwhelmed by the supposed originator of the cheesesteak.  The employees were too interested in their own conversation about the bars they had hit the night before to pay me any mind.  The cheese was so generic to almost be insulting and the steak was anything but lean.

I felt an obligation to try a cheesesteak from here so long as I was in town, and I can honestly say my visit to Philadelphia would have been better had I skipped this bland, unexciting stop for dining.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is DEFINITELY the way to go!  Chopped steak (not sliced...which I loathe), great fresh rolls, and ya gotta go with the "Wiz wit".  The fries are also super yummy if you want to go all out on the fatty wagon.  I'm hungry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I finally made it to Philly to have a Cheese steak. The line was super long at Pat's (as I expected), but not as long as Geno's. They had rules for ordering at the window and the were very quick to get you ordered. I don't blame them... with a line like that I would be doing the same thing. I took my first bite of my Cheese Steak and instantly became hooked. I ordered it "Wit Wiz". I kept it basic and wanted to experience a classic. 

To me it seems like the Cheese Steak is the same as it was when they first started serving it there, very basic. No fancy seasonings and toppings. I loved my sandwich. I thought the whole experience was great, waiting in a long line with strangers to eat a classic that calls Philly home. 

I will be back to Pat's next time I am in Philly. I might even try Geno's too...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
While in Philly, we decided to get an original Philly cheesesteak at Pat's.  The line was long, but went quickly.

I got a steak 'wit' onions and provolone.  The meat was great, the roll was a perfect vehicle, but the provolone was not the best choice.  I shoulda got cheese whiz.  I will next time.

I didn't get peppers on mine, but they looked good.  Again, next time.

P.S. Geno's may have great signage, but don't be fooled.  My sister's BF got a steak from Pat's and another from Geno's, and he felt that Pat's was superior.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ever since I was a kid my older cousins used to go here for cheese steaks and bring them home, I've always enjoyed it but I've never went. 

On Friday night I took a quick trip with my boyfriend who has been here many times and always told me it's a good sandwich but not worth the 3 hr drive. I listened to him but had to see for myself. 

I went around 1 AM and the lines were LONG even though it was raining. I automatically knew this was a tourist spot sort of how the halal guys are in New York. I stood in line listening to everyone talk about what's good and I ended up ordering the pepper steak "wit wiz" which means with onions and cheese. 

The service was great, the employees were very nice and polite for the late night serving they had to endure. The place looked clean from what I could see and the ambience was typical sandwich spot. There was outdoor umbrella and chair seating and nice music playing. The menu was posted on the wall with limited options but that's what made it good, you had to order a signature item. 

I ENJOYED my sandwich, it was well cooked and pretty tasty. The bead was warm and the meat was flavored, I think the pepper is what made the sandwich. If I had to do it over again, I would do it without wiz aka cheese. I am not a fan of American cheese and the cheese was sort of like the cheese you dip nachos in at the movies. It was tasty but not satisfying for me.

I think their food is WAY over priced which is a down side. Hey, I get its a tourist spot but what about the locals? Can't they enjoy some tradition for less? Mt sandwich was about $13 for three sandwiches we paid $36 which is a bit much if you ask me. I usually don't watch the price of food if it's tasty but in this case I thought it was robbery.

The neighborhood this spot is located didn't appear to be great but wasn't unsafe. I found parking less than a block away and there were LOTS of people outside so it wasn't a desolate area. 

I'd go again, but I won't go out of my way to go. It was a good experience and if you're an American cheese lover & don't mind spending $12 on a sandwich then hey go for it!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Similar to my previous review of Geno's, we split a cheese steak hero only with onions this time. I think the sandwich is always better with onions. The sandwich was great, About the same size as Geno's. Probably not to compete with each other, they serve small sandwiches.
It was nice trying both places and fun to eat at iconic places. As the same, Pat's was pretty crowded. Prices are the same too.
Cash only and no bathrooms.
Same deal about ordering, follow the rules and you wont make people angry, lol. People come here hungry like us.
Be careful when your trying to take a picture from the street view because it is a busy road and cars will run you down, almost like Brooklyn.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm new to the cheesesteak game but Pats made me a believer. Their meat is perfectly spiced and seasoned but next time I might ask them to go a bit lighter on the wiz as it overpowered the initial top bites. Their self-serve peppers are pretty awesome too. I know their a few options in this area for cheesesteaks but if you're in to spicy I would totally choose Pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I remember my first time visiting Pat's I was in Philly touring Temple-my future college at the time. It was winter. Not knowing how to navigate the public transit system since we were just a couple of girls from the middle of Pennsylvania, my friends and I walked all the way from Temple to Pat's on a fairly cold winter day for one of their famous cheesesteaks. When we got these beloved sandwiches the grease on the cheesesteak quickly coagulated due to the cold weather and became a disgusting mass of hardened fat. 

Since that day I've been back to Pat's and Geno's for tourism sake with newcomers to the city, but haven't ordered anything myself. 

I know there's a lot of hype, but there are much better places to eat in our city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Last April, I traveled to Philly to sample Pat's and Geno's steaks in my quest for the most authentic, delicious, cheeze-whizzyish cheeseteak in the city of brotherly love and limited beer sales.

Geno's was good, tidy, almost genteel. A nice mix of  whiz, onions, and meat.

Pat's, on the other hand, won points for sheer abundance. This thing was big. And messy (see photos). With about twice as much filling as Geno's, the flavor of the steak took center stage. I found Pat's to be a bit tastier, probably because the beef flavor came through more clearly. However, the bread was overwhelmed. I was overwhelmed too, with Cheese Whiz, mostly. Too much of the whiz is not necessarily a good thing.

I gave a marginal win to Pat's on the basis of bounty, (and because they had a better selection of condiments and ruder staff), but I would really need to eat a few more steaks to decide on a definite favorite. Right now, Geno's sounds pretty good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The only reason it gets a second star is for historical landmark status. I threw away half the sandwich. No flavor at all. It's like I'm eating canned meat. I get better cheesesteaks at Denny's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A Southern girl's first cheesesteak. Southern philly accents are funny and they were super sweet after finding out I'm a cheeseteak virgin and that I am from the South. They just all chimed in "YOU'RE FROM TEXAS? ALL MY EXES LIVE IN TEXAS!" 

I devoured the entire sandwich myself. Pat's is very welcoming while their neighbor across the street is very bright and obnoxious. You don't need all that to advertise that your food is good. If it's good, it's good. Pat's doesn't need all the gimick and it is still a kick ass sandwich. I thought cheesesteaks were all hype. I was wrong. Thanks for making my first cheesesteak experience an awesome one, Y'ALL!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Whenever I am in Philly, I always need to stop by Pat's and get the mushroom pepper steak accompanied by the pizza fries.  I am set after that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes I/we are fans. We like Gino's also,but Pat's is still our #1-especially since we live a few blocks away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to pat's king of steaks for lunch. Good food,rude cashier,fast service. Rough neighborhood location.Overall I loved it!!..iam surprise they dont accept credit cards..even though making ton of money
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I can only base my review on the cheese fries, since it's all I've had there. It was midnight and I wanted cheese fries, I think it was during the week and ishkabibbles was closed so where's a girl to go? Both the fries and the cheese were hot, I added a little salt because that's what I do and trotted on home satisfied. I know they'll always be there when I need cheese fries at odd hours and I'm happy to avoid the ridiculous line that gathers for steaks on the weekend.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you are visiting Philly, skip it.  There are much better cheese steaks around with shorter lines to get them (Tony Luke's, Jim Steaks, Cosmi's Deli).  That said, if it's 2 am and you're drunk, Pat's steaks taste like heaven.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Mediocre and expensive cheesesteaks. Terrible, rude, and offensive service. The bread is the best part of the sandwich and it's shipped in. They treat their customers like a number. I recommend trying Dinic's Roast Pork Sandwich, I also hear Sonny's and Jimmy's are better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've have better cheesesteaks in suburban Boston. How disappointing. BTW this is the 21st century: take credit cards!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: In college we used to drive here at all hours of the day and night and stand in line wrapped around the block. Now that I'm almost two hours away, I don't get to go as frequently, but when the mood strikes, It's still fun to circle the block a couple times to find a spot (ugh parallel parking - we don't do that in south jersey!) and then wait in (a much longer than geno's) line for a "cheez with"
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Always been a Pat's fan over Geno's. Always juicy and delicious, and quick service with friendly people. Go every time I'm in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'd never had a cheesesteak and was told pats was the place. Ha! It's a factory, the meat was dry and flavorless not to mention the staff treats you like um crap if you don't  speak cheesesteak. I bet you were quite something when you first started Pat. Go back to your roots. WEAK.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's but not the best as they claim! I've been here several times and have been served unseasoned meat which is a number 1 mistake when it comes to steaks! Especially when your in competition! They should really step it up and be the best regardless of the amount of customers they get because of all the Geno's vs. Pat's hype. Why not try a bit harder and stand up to their slogan!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great quick steaks hot meat and cheese but the hoogie is always cold maybe thats how they do it at Pats but other than that no issues. ;-)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
See my Geno's review also.  Finally after 40 plus years of procrastinating I went to these places.  Pat's was decent.  Not great but the better of the two by far.
More cheese and less grease.  Worth the extra $1.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So we roadtripped all the way to Philly to get some of Pat's famous cheesesteaks. I ordered mine "provolone, wit", and was disappointed that the cheese was cold and never melted into the steak, but the meat itself was good. I also had some of my boyfriend's "American, wit" sandwich, which was A LOT better than what I ordered.

I'm not sure if it's worth the price, but they were good sandwiches. A star off for when us having later ordered identical "American, wit" sandwiches IMMEDIATELY after each other and getting one with whiz, one with American cheese.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had mine "wiz wit." What is there to say that hasn't been said already on here? The cheesesteak was delicious but from $9.50, I wish it was a bit bigger.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't get the attraction. It's meet on a roll with cheese wiz. The meat on the cheese steak is really dry. I don't understand why people are told somethings good and they tell themselves that it is. It could be that they can't go against what someone else said because its against the grain. Just say it's not that great! Really mediocre in fact. I just don't get it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Awesome cheesesteaks the meat was super moist and the bread was awesome. So worth the drive from NYC.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love Pat's anyday over Geno's. I visit Philly all the time to spend time with my family and everytime I go to Philly I have to stop pass Pat's to get me a Philly Chessesteak. The give you more meat than you can imagine on the sandwiches. The only downside is becase the sandwiches are so good the line is always out the door.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: CHEESESTEAK!!! Everytime I got to Philly I make it a point to stop at Pat's! It's cheesteak is the benchmark to which I measure all others. The meat is done perfectly covered with onions and most importantly of all.................... WHIZ!!! It's always worth the trek into the sketchy area to get one of these prized cheesesteaks.  If you're going to Philly you haven't had the real Philly experience without having Pat's!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As a tourist in Philadelphia, you want your dose of the famous philly cheesesteak. Since our stomachs can't really handle eating two at a time, we had to pick one between the two rivals. Comparing Pat's and Geno's, we decided to go to Pat's. 

We filled our wallets with cash and came to Pat's on a chilly Monday, ordering our cheesesteaks as professionally as we could without screwing up. There were no lines. Service is friendly and our food came out super fast. 

The beef is slightly on the dry side and the bread is quite chewy. I ordered mine with onions but skipped the Whiz and opted for American cheese instead. Just not a fan of Whiz. Personally, I don't think there is very much to say in terms of the taste factor. It was decent but nothing amazing. I do think this is still a place to eat and check it off your list of things to do when in Philadelphia. 

Also, along the order window of Pat's is a plaque of where Rocky stood in the movie. A nice old man pointed it out to us as we were eating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I hear all the time the hype about Pat's Cheesesteaks.   I'm from Cali & came to Philly on a business trip & forced my co-workers to bring me to this unicorn of cheesesteaks & walked away feeling like a lame tourist & let down.  The meat was SO greasy!  I think all the flavor actually came from the grease vs. the meat!  A piece actually fell on my leg & the stain literally never dried out until I washed my pants later in the week when I arrived home.  Do not waste your money on this or time trying to find parking!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Puke.  Tourists: really, there is much better food in Philly.  Might be worth feeding to your grandpa if you think you might get a good inheritance...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First experience with a real Philly cheesesteak didn't disappoint!  Got it "wit" onions and whiz.  The meat just kind of melted in your mouth and it was the perfect size.  It's a no frills kind of place (cash only!) but he's the King, doesn't need a flashy sign or anything.  I would definitely go back on my next visit...still having flashbacks about the yumminess of it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Steak was juicy, bread was soft, whiz was not overly cheesy. It was your typical cheese steak,  not too special. The reputation precedes the food giving it a 4 and not a 3 from me
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So much better then Gino's. We had to try both and decided that Pat's was better. Tried both with wizz and onions on one and provolone and onions on another.  The difference was that Pats caramelized the onions and Gino's was almost raw.  Both places were rude when trying to order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have gone here maybe 6-7 times in the last 25 years
It's not at all what it used to be, and certainly much better places around
Overpriced, over-rated, and pretty crummy environment with an ocean of trash swirling around your feet.(much of Philly has gotten like that)
Maybe I'm more critical now, but I remember them being pretty good.
This time, the steaks were gritty, very chewy, very fatty
It had to be choked down, not enjoyed.
Not meat I would ever serve my family
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was in the area & thought I should try an "authentic" Philly Cheesesteak.  Maybe this was an off-day, but I was charged $12 for a cold sub with grilled onions & cheese.  Maybe I should have gone for the cheese-whiz version, but I just couldn't do it.  The meat had little to no flavor.  The fries were good & if you wanted fixin's there were unlimited hot peppers as well as ketchup & different mustards.  Next time I will try Sarconne's down the street.  They have a sign about how good the bread is & their bakery is just a few doors down.  And when I went in it smelled wonderful.  And this was after eating a whole sub + fries + a drink.  Imagine the enjoyment if I was actually hungry.  Regretfully yours, in the city of brotherly love.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best i was in my way to New York we  went to see what was better geno or pats pats wins best cheesesteak in a long time
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: No sample? WTH. I ended up getting a fish cake. The place looks nice, but not as nice as Geno's. I'll swing by next time for a real cheesesteak here. Please note that off menu orders are not really available here. Attempts to get a 6 inch will get shot down. Oh, bring cash. No credit cards, food stamps, or any other currency except for USD accepted.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
genos or pats?
i think they both rock
i have probably eaten here over 100 times
chipped steak with whiz?
or pulled pork with provolone?
i miss you guys, please open up in california soon!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's will do. Good press to keep the tourists going so long lines aren't a problem at the real fantastic cheesesteak spots!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I should have gone with the cheese whiz. Next time! Onions were a good add. The fries were awesome!! The sandwich was so greasy. But glad we checked it out.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As good as "advertised" Order properly, add peppers, fries are amazing too!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Gets one star for a the food. The cashier copped an attitude when I asked for cheese. Miserable douche. Eff him bald ass dumbshit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had to compare the two, second time through Philly, so may as well.

I thought it was good, not great.  The bread was alright, not great.  I liked that the steak was a bit more chopped up, less chewing.  Wiz wit of course, have to keep it classic.  The wiz is so good and makes the steak.  All the extras are expensive and not that great.  Don't expect a lot of soda with your ice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
One of the places that I will occasionally take out-of-town friends to. Who knows if it's our city's "best" sandwich?... but it's darn good, and certainly as authentic and full of tradition as you can get. A great neighborhood feel to the place.

(One of my favorite childhood memories was standing in line with my Grandpop at Pat's one summer Saturday afternoon in the mid-1980's. The Dodgers were in town. A limo pulls up on 9th St., and out comes Tommy Lasorda and joins the line!)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was super unimpressed. It was sad.
We were in Philly for my grandmother's 90th bday party. On our site seeing day, I dragged my husband and 1 year old daughter to do the great cheesesteak challenge. It was a Saturday. Bad idea. The lines wrapped around each place and since we were parked closer to Pat's (and Gino's had some slightly racist stuff posted up about speaking English and whatnot) we went with Pat's.
I expected the ordering process. I watch a lot of food tv. I had no problem with service or anything. It was the actual sandwich. It just wasn't that good. It was kind of flavorless and dry. The whiz wasn't even gooey. It was pretty sad.
They did have some pretty bomb french fries. But are you really going there for their fries???
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've seen Pats on TV and wanted to find out myself if this place was really as good as people say. So on the way home from NY and passing through Philly we decided to make a side trip and check it out. 

And I have to say ... I am now a fan. It wasnt very busy when i went .. maybe cuz it was freezing outside (went here a little bit over a week after the biggest snow storm on the east coast in years!) but there were still folks sucking it up and eating outside in the cold. 

I liked how they had directions on the side of the window on how to order your cheesesteak,,,. another way of saying "know what ya want and order it quick cuz we dont have time to wait for you" hahaha which i respect cuz youre not exactly going for the whole dining experience. 

But anyways i had mushroom cheesesteak with cheese whiz which was delicious especially since it was our first meal of the day. The right Ratio of meat, chees, and bread... well for me at least and the fries were just ok... Hot sauce  and peppers definitely made it even better.

I'd visit again the next time im on the eastcoast ... so as far as my checklist for my must eat placest....  I'm happy to check off Pat's King of Steaks! =)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is definitely tastier, flavorful, and juicier when compared to Geno's.  Overall, they are both ok.   Locals prefer Jim's steaks as their favorite but, still need to try it to confirm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
cheesesteak with onions and cheese whiz.  was a satisfying cheesesteak...bread was good, cheese whiz good, onions cooked nicely....meat was a bit tough, however.
overall a decent cheesesteak. 

Geno's right next door, so you can get one of each to compare...which is better? you gotta try both at the same time!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great for tourist to visit. IMO the best of the two on the corner. Make sure you read on how to order, before you get to the window.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Doing a one day cheesesteak-a-thon, my friends and I stopped by Pat's for their famed fare.  I ordered the regular wit whiz (regular with onions and cheese whiz).  Great stuff!  The bread was soft, which I liked.  The pile of meat was rather substantial, as was the whiz.  The meat was soft and succulent, not too fat.  The whiz was thick, lending to a cleaner cheesesteak eating experience.  A must stop if you are in the Philly area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
King of steaks, invented them, improved upon them and consistent. 
If any of you retards from NYC or other areas leaving negative reviews because you are unhappy because Pat's steaks serves peppers and mushrooms cold and not grilling them with your steak meat then stay home in 12oz soda land. 
There's a reason they have been open since 1030 serving great sandwiches for 85 years, oh yeah open 24/7, have spurned many other steak places, and a Las Vegas style neon lighted Geno's across the street. 
The bread is made 2 blocks away 3 times a day and this is no-frills, blue collar real Philly people great food. No the steak isn't fillet and if you have a problem with Wiz then get Provolone or shut your face and don't be some crybaby being another tourist idiot in front of me holding me and other locals who love this place up
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: King of steaks....I'd consider false advertisement. It's hard to express to people that haven't lived in philly all their life that Pat's and Gino's are just name dropped places. Just because it's in S. Phila doesn't mean it still has the charm of a corner pizzeria from a local business. Skip this place all together to get a REAL cheese steak experience. But if you must choose...go with this.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On a recent impromptu trip to Philly, my bf, best friend, and her hubby decided to stop by Pat's when they found out that I had never had an authentic  "Philly Cheesesteak". My best friend and her husband had tried Geno's twice before so we decided to eat at Pat's so they could try the OTHER cheesesteak.

Circling the place a few times we got a spot close by. It was a weekday afternoon and the line wasn't bad. I was briefed by my friends on how to order. I kept repeating to myself, "American Cheesesteak Wit". I placed the order, paid my $9, and not even a minute later, my cheesesteak was ready! It was just okay. The cheese wasn't melted and the onions weren't hot. I can honestly say that the cheesesteaks I've had in NYC, NJ, or at baseball stadiums have been better. Perhaps my expectations were way to high, but from a place that specializes in cheesesteaks, I was definitely expecting more. 

I wanted to try Geno's to be able to compare, but I was stuffed from snacking all day prior to arriving in Philly, not to mention the line was ridiculous! My next time in Philly, I will def be trying out Geno's and hopefully trying Pat's a 2nd time to see if that time will be better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Everyone always says, "When you go to Philadelphia, you HAVE TO GO to Geno's and Pat's"  

Well during  my trip to Philadelphia, I WENT TO Tony Luke's, Pat's, and Geno's so I can honnestly say I have had the "big 3" in Philadelphia!

Pat's it DEFINATELY better then Geno's, but nothing fancy.  This place had friendly service, fresh meat, great cheese, and overall was a great expierance. 

HOWEVER, if you are in philadelphia DEFINATELY GO TO TONY LUKE'S!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! - AMAZING!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best steak in Philly. They are the original and still the best. They cook real beef with full flavor. They have a condiment bar that includes cherry peppers. Be prepared to give your order quickly and then stand around outside at the bar or a pic-nick table to eat. It is a real treat to visit these guys.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You gotta choose and I've chosen Pats and never regret coming here.  Its greasy, meaty goodness.  I've been to the non "tourist trap" places in philly and they are not that great.  Only if you want all kinds of bells and whistles with your Cheesesteak.  Me, I'll stick with the main event.  Give me steak, whiz, w/ onions.  And Pat's makes it best for me. 

There is always a line so you really have plenty of time to figure out what you want, also the menu is pretty straight forward, cheesesteaks.

Being from NYC I understand the no nonsense attitude of the staff here.  When there is a line of drunks stretching down the block there really isn't time to answer 20 questions about the age of the of cheese and consistency of the steak used here.  Just order and keep it moving, there are people waiting.

To avoid a bad experience know what you want, order, pay, and eat it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A cheesesteak wit wiz is the only way to go.  And this place makes a damn good cheesesteak.  Pat's is cash only, so be prepared for that.  Also, make sure you read the sign on how to order, so you don't like like a mega chump getting to the window to order and have no clue what you are talking about.  This process is in place to make the line move quickly and efficiently.  It's been used for years and it works.  Now onto the food.  It's good.  It's make right there on a piping hot grill, so take a beat before diving in, because that soft bread is a vessel of steaming hot meat, cheese and in my case, onions.  This place gets really crowded, so be prepared to not find a place to sit and maybe have to cross the street to sit on a divider.  Don't let all the rules and crowds deter you though.  The cheesesteaks are good and the line moves fast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came here when I was full already, so my review might not be accurate. Located in an interesting crowded area with lots of characters and across the street from it's rival, Geno's. Came here instead since it had a higher review on yelp and we only had a day to spend in Philly.

 I had the philly cheesesteak (about $8 price) with onions and ate only 1/3 of the sandwich. It was delicious, especially adding their hot sauce and eating hot peppers on the side with it. I love how they have so many hot peppers in the condiments area and a tub of hot sauce for the spicy lovers. mmm. I don't remember the taste of the sandwich anymore which is why I'm giving it 3 stars. I would love to come back here and try it again on an empty stomach. My bf and his family enjoyed it very much though. I remember the meat was a bit rough and dry, didn't really taste like quality meat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This was a lot of fun for me, since I never really had a proper Philly Cheese Steak.  One time before this I tried to have one, but it didn't work out as I had hoped it would.

Past unpleasantness aside, this place provides a unique experience.  You have to know what you're ordering, specifically.  It doesn't help that the names posted on the menu differ from what you actually have to tell the guy in the window.  You have to have your money out.  If you fail at these objectives, you will return to the back of the line and try again.

Mind you, there are two different windows at this place.  The first window is the one you line up at for your steak.  The second window is where you go for fries, soda, etc.  Make sure not to choke on your sandwich while you're waiting in line for your soda.

The coolest thing of all for me was this: as you wait in line for your soda, look at the ground.  There's a marble plaque commemorating the fact that Sylvester Stallone was filmed standing at that spot in Rocky.  How much more freakin' sweet does it get than that?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's isn't the best and it isn't the worst... it's passable. Now, I do prefer Pat's over Geno's but mostly because I can't stand Geno's garish presence. I do like Pat's cheesesteaks but sometimes I'll get a sandwich that is too cold for my liking. This may be due to the speed in which they fill orders. 

During the height of the Geno's "Speak English" controversy, I noticed that when me and a group of friends were treated nicely and the workers showed an interest in our ethnic backgrounds. 

I didn't notice this until the Geno's controversy, but Pat's also has a sign to assist non-English speaking visitors in ordering a cheesesteak. I'm not sure if that was there before the hoopla, but it was a nice gesture

I pass by here on Passyunk often, so if you're driving, be VERY careful of all the people and the cars at the intersections. It gets pretty crowded..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's steak are truly mediocre. They are flat, don't have that much meat, and the onions are often burnt. Not to mention that you are unlikely to find a space to eat. Keep walking down Passyunk to South Street and get a steak from Ishkibbibles, or from Cosmi's by the Italian Market.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Never the judge or a juror, just a foodie .We were not thorough with Geno's critique, because it wasn't worth the memory... to rehash the nightmarish experience naah , but Pat's was better. This will help you greatly, if you trust our experience , We went to 6 spots, Pat's was one of them, of course, considering the hype. Meat, cheese and toppings, bread, and overall sandwich considered.  BREAD: was fresh, and a good texture, on a scale of 1-5 , the bread was a 4........MEAT: the meat had no seasoning, as if it were frozen, then on the grill, the natural steaming process was a problem , on the =15 scale it was a 2.5.....CHEESE AND TOPPINGS: though not a fan of cheese whiz , it did compensate for the lack of flavor of the meat, and the WIT(onions)  was WHAAAT???? enough said, scale 1-5 it was a 2.75. OVERALL SANDWICH: though better than Geno's, that's not saying much, on the 1-5 scale it was a 3, Pat's and Geno's isn't the real Philly battle that's needs the hype, they are close to throwing in the towel, because they know people will come anyway, and that's sad .Give other places not so publicized a chance, and you will be surprised. I'm not wacking Pat's , but, a horse head is in the bed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If Pat's steaks were no good, they would not have been in business so long since the 30's. There is plenty of competition. Pats is full of local people eating outside. There is no inside and just a few tables alongside. Learn how to stand and eat a steak sandwich so that the drippings don't get on your shoes. Marone!!!

If you put ketchup or mayonnaise on your sandwich (you would have to have your own supply) you should be thrown into the Delaware River.   Meat, roll, onions, cheese. That's all. enjoy it like the locals. we go there often and I'm 78. a lifetime of cheese steaks wit cheese (different types)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The sandwich was good, love the wiz/with and the fries were good and hot, the issue I had was the price.. $17.50 for a sandwich, fries and drink, I don't consider that cheap
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is a nasty meal with bad service and terrible value. Don't let the fact it's better than Genos make it worth your money.
Both are to be avoided at all costs.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is definitely better then Genos. Ahhh, brings me back to my childhood when I use to live in Philly. Man I miss the place. 

Had both cheese steak side by side to do a taste test and pats come out ahead. 

Wizz with onions is the way to go. Dang I wish i was in Philly right now. 

Cheers, 
-Herbal Tea
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I guess this and the one with the flashy sign across the street are like some of those trendy tourist trap places in the city to get a cheesesteak at I could careless what it is that's said as Pats is like soo scrumptious the two times I've gotten to visit here in the past decade!

It's Philly so you know parking is going to suck wherever you try to go and if you park in the wrong spot they will ticket you so fast you won't know what hit your car so good luck on that endeavor just make sure you make it back to Pat's because it's just what's sooo good!

They have their own way of saying what you want here so read the signs to figure out what it is that you really want because you know you want everything on your Cheesesteak anyway so just get it wit it!

Cheesesteak oh so yummy like so much so that I wasn't even that hungry when I was passing through here I just remembered how amazing it was when I came here years ago that I just had to come back and get one seeing that I was in the area and who knows when I'll get back to Philly!

Cheesesteak oh so good just get then go to the next window and get fries or pizza fires like I did because what's better than pizza fries and cheesesteak!

There's like a little area to the side that has peppers those huge round ones that are so good when you take huge bites of the peppers and cheesesteak that combo you can't just get anywhere away from Philly!

Pat's is awesome no need to visit anywhere else when I come here but who knows I might have to go to Pat's and some other place in the same day just because I'm here and yeah cheesesteak I love you come to Cali in better ways then you are!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's you are my first love! I love wiz without accompanied by the large wiz fries!  I went to college 7 hours away.being a Philadelphia native...I missed you so much that whenever I came home on a break you would be my first stop(subsequently many a visit would follow). 

This being said... Lately you've been slacking.  At dinner/ tourist time (I mean jersey time) you got my order wrong according to my fiancé.  He ordered, so hopefully he ordered wrong;)  I usually go after midnight.

In the event of  his possible mistake.... 5 out of 5.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Expected more. Very light on the steak. For 11 bucks you would think you would get more. It felt more like a tourist destination and they were just hiking up the prices for a Philly cheese steak because they could. Staff were pushy too, kept insisting we ordered more drinks then we did. Parking was terrible, but given the tourist feel to the whole experience I guess it should have been expected.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A Philly landmark.

Ok I eat at Pat's and Geno's now what? Well now you can have a good cheese steak. You've been through WHIZ, was treated like crap, and learned what "with" means. You're ready! 

Clearly better the Geno's which means.... you guessed it, nothing!! If your a Philly native you can name about 5 better cheese steak places at a moments notice.
You also know that you have to take your friends from out of town here.  

When I think of pat's and Geno's, I think of the rocky statue down by the art museum. Sweet we got our pictures with rocky!! Now can we go in the actual museum?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My girlfriend and I put Pat's and Geno's cheesesteak war to the test, and got subs from both stands. I don't know if Geno's ignorant ass got in the way of swallowing the food, but I like Pat's better. We got the pizza fries, and it was good. Loved how the fries we drenched with sauce and cheese, and stuck together as you pull them out. The cheesesteak tasted fine with a hint of acceptance. 

If you have to do the food war, then by all means do it. However, if you want to have a good, traditional Philly cheesesteak and/or might not speak English well, then come here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Considered the best cheese stake, I came here expecting more. I have to give them 4 stars for being so dang fast. I loved the attitude too. Totally
Philly style.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Way too much bread.  No where near enough steak.  Took me almost 30 years to finally give this place a try and after having tried many cheese steaks elsewhere, this one was average at best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is something to try if you are around, but completely overrated. 

I do prefer Pat's over Geno's as they have a larger menu [for the nonconformist who may like bacon or mushrooms, etc], serve a lot more meat that is tender and chopped up.

The cheesesteaks are a lot bigger [and heavier] than Geno's, but the bread is a lot harder and tore up the inside roof of my mouth. 

Like Geno's, lines can get absurdly long and [close] parking can be hard to find.

Service is about the same as Geno's except I resented it when the server questioned me ordering 'without' (aka 'without onions).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A few years ago, when I was flying back and forth every week from California to Philly, my client asked how I liked the City of Brotherly Love?  I looked at them like they were crazy.  They had me working early morning until late after dark on the project.  I had no time to play tourist.  They agreed and, on my very last day on the project, proceeded to whisk me away to the Liberty Bell and to Pat's.  I laugh to think that these were the two landmarks a surfer girl like me needed to see, but who am I to argue?  Actually, I appreciated the visit to Independence hall and to the bell - it struck a little known patriotic chord I didn't think I had in me.... but on to Pat's... Wow!!  I had some trepidations about having a greasy cheesesteak sandwich, but you only live once, right?

I was told it was THE place to go!  Darn if it wasn't the best cheesesteak I ever had.  Sure, I'm a *only* a tourist, but heck, I have taste buds too!! ...and they were cheering that day!!  I was warned not to look across the wannabe-Pat's, neon calamity across the street... but I had to... and went temporarily blind.   

Many thanks to my new friends in the east for bringing this California girl to see the Bell and to experience Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've eaten a thousand steak sandwiches in my time. Pat's is near the bottom.
I'm sure they enjoy being on TV for every MNF game, but it's just a tourist trap.
Throw a dart at a map and you will get a better cheesesteak. If you just come to Philly  and only eat a Pat's cheesesteak, then please don't judge all ours by theirs.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The philly cheesesteak is always better Wit Whiz. The sandwich is really good but a bit overpriced.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not as good as they make it seem, the bread is cold and the meat is a little blend. Also not such a clean place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: On a recent drive through Philly my friends and I decided to compare genos and pats. We should have known it wouldn't be much of a battle considering that Pat's had a long line and crowded tables and Genos had 2 people waiting by their window. Pat's was much better than Geno's based on softer bread, hotter ingredients, better meat and more of it on the sandwich, and more whiz. The people at Pat's were also much nicer. When I return this will be where I get my cheesesteak. Try this place and don't waste your time on Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Find me a person complaining Pat's steaks is not amazing and I'll show you the face of an idiot... Pat's steaks are awesome, plain and simple.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fun tourist trap but the steak and cheese was good. Not gourmet but it met the expectations.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went here during a trip at 6am and it was the best thing I could ask for, delicious steak, sharp provolone and peppers was incredible!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's it the King.  Me and a buddy took 1/2 each of a Gino's and half of a Pat's.  Pat's won hands down plus they have more menu options.  I come from a "Lehigh Valley Cheesesteak" which tends to be a Chipsteak vs. what you have served in Philly, I prefer mine "wit whiz"  only way to go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I first had Pat's cheesesteaks in 2014 and I did a comparison with Geno's back then. This time I did it again with the pepper steak. I prefer Pat's this time just because of their bread. It wasn't soggy like Geno's. To me, their meat was comparable...they seem a bit dry when I compare it to Tony Luke's or others I've had but I'd eat Pat's any day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm going to have to factor in the sanitary issues i saw with Pat's. Yea yea, I know it's probably unfair cause they have to make the food quick cause the line is outrageous, but it still affects my experience when I see them making sandwiches with no gloves and dipping their fingers into the cheese buckets.

I'm not in Philly a lot, but when I am, I feel obligated to try the philly cheese steaks. And where better to go than the touristy attraction Pat's or Geno's. They are seriously across the street from each other and the only deciding factor for me was which line was shorter. I don't know which genius decided to continue the line onto the street rather than around the block, but when I got there, both lines were almost touching each other and clearly blocking traffic left and right. A cop had to come by and tell us to shift the line. They probably should have an employee come out once in a while to make sure the line isn't going crazy. 

That being said, while there were like 50 people in front of us, the line moved very fast. Their sign gives you the steps on how to order and at the end it says if you mess up, you have to move to the back of the line. All business, nothing personal. The guy didn't even look at my face when I ordered. Well, excuse you.

A sandwich cost about $10 and I believe it is cash only. Literally 5 seconds after you pay, your sandwich is ready. They obviously make this in bulk. I saw the guy scrape the cheese off the knife with his bare finger and smeared it onto the side of the bucket. I almost didn't want to eat the sandwich.

After I got over the initial shock, I sat across the street on a ledge (hard to find seats) to eat my sandwich. I got a steak with onions and cheese whiz, side of fries and soda. The steak was good, made well-done and sliced pretty thin. The onions I didn't taste at all. But the whiz really made the sandwich. Something about that cheese made me feel nostalgic and very happy. Definitely recommend the whiz rather than the other choices they had there. The bread was also soft and well toasted and went well with the combination. Overall, it was a good sandwich. The fries were crispy and tasty, but they glisten with oil. 

Don't be scared of how long the line looks. It actually moves very fast. And if you stand at the front of the line, you can see exactly why it is so fast. If you are in Philly and want to try some "authentic" (I guess? What do I know.) cheese steak, I'd say come to this street and take your pick between Pat's and Geno's. I didn't try Geno's, but I would say it should be similar. I'm glad I didn't love it because I can't afford to come all the way to Philly for sandwiches all the time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's ok, it's only perfect for the amature street-food specialist, a nice hot street pretzel with that special mustard is a better tourist recomendation.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is getting by on it's name alone.  Tourists flock here for what they think is a good cheese steak.   Honestly, you could probably find a better cheese steak in San Francisco, or Acme's frozen-food isle, or maybe even China.  The roll is great - but this is Philly, that's a given.  As or the sandwich as a whole - it's just a tasteless, greasy belly-stuffer. Geno's is a little better, but I really do think Jim's serves up the best cheese steak in the city. Go there if you want to taste something great.  

It'll be a while before I eat a Pat's steak again...but some day, I'll probably have to get another one just to remind myself why I don't eat them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's (and Geno's) steaks aren't overrated so much as over-hyped.

They aren't bad. If you want a run-of-the-mill cheesesteak in under a minute and are willing to fork out 6 or 7 bucks for it, then Pat's will get the job done. Unless you have an aversion to greasy food (and, if you do, why on earth would you eat a cheesesteak?), you'll most likely enjoy it.

If you're looking for something that's truly delicious and fulfilling, you're better off making your own (they're so easy!) or going elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Every cheesesteak I've ever had from here has been totally disappointing. Nothing special about the meat, bread or other ingredients. However, I recently was on Passyunk Ave with some friends and had a craving for cheese fries, so despite my better judgement I walked up to the window to order some. The group I was with was heading back to someone's house and I didn't really want to eat hard cheese and soggy fries when we got to our destination, so I politely ordered cheese fries and asked that they put them in a bag to go with whiz on the side. The guy at the window looked at me like I was nuts and said "We don't do that". I inquired again, sort of confused "You can't put the whiz in a souffle cup on the side for me" and he promptly replied "no". Now, don't get me wrong I am NOT fan of Geno's either but out of sheer curiosity I walked across the way and made the same request. The guy behind the Geno's window cheerily said "no problem hun" and put everything in a to-go bag for me. 

If I'm paying over $5 for cheese fries, there should be NO PROBLEM with putting the whiz on the side for me. Right....?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my first time to Philly and I've only been here for 45mins.  I already found Pat's King of Steaks down in the middle of all the neighborhood action.  Very authentic Philly vibe and ambience when you eat here.  There's even a plaque on the ground where Rocky once stood during the movie shoot.  The food was average but super quick.  You won't wait long here but make sure you bring cash.  I got the extra cheese steak.  It's basically cheese whiz, meat and bread served hot!  It was worth it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ok so I knew when I was in town I had to try this place or Genos now I scoped out both and I'm sorry Genos you looked like you were holding back on the steak also I like the fact that Pats cuts up the steak that makes it so much better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Over rated, skip the trip- take pictures that you 'been to Pats' but save your stomach and wallet. Ten bucks for their cheesesteak was highway robbery, much better places in Philly for a good cheesesteak. Service behind counter was sub par- pompous idiots.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was so excited for this.  I love LOVE LOVE food.  I waited in line, got the wiz wit and the cheese fries.  I actually threw the sandwich away!  It was flavorless and bland.
