text: This place is totally overrated. Their bread wasn't fresh. The staff on the register was so rude. When i ordered, he was rushing me. I said can i have a cheese steak with onion and...  I was going to say what kind of cheese i want to have but he did not even let me finish my order. He was calling the next customer. Then i said provolone chese please. He said I need more experience to order cheese steak. Also, they are really over priced place. $10 for a cheese steak, and $5 French fries. WTF? It was my first and last time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have to say this place sucks I asked for fresh fries and got an attitude when I asked the person to remake them he kept feeling the fries saying they were hot they weren't they were sitting the food was cold and so was the steak sandwich I was better off going to a steak sandwich spot in a local mall the food was cold it obviously has been sitting not fresh food and 10 dollars for a steak sandwich and 750 for fries the price wasn't worth it save your money don't eat here
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Here we go with the big cheese steak debate. I did take the Philly cheese steak challenge and I have picked my favorite out of the bunch. For me Pat's was just OK compared to some of the others. The meat just seemed bland and a little on the dry side to me compared to others. You won't be dissappointed with a "Whiz Wit" but there are betters. However I did think their frie's were better then thier neighbors.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Surprisingly, there were only 3 people in front of us when we came here!! My cousin parked his car illegally, we hopped out, got in line, ordered, got our food all in 7 minutes!!! 

You pick what kind of cheesesteak you want-- cheese, onions, order... pay. Ca$h only.
The condiments station is right behind you from where you placed your order. You have to get into a different line if you want french fries, which we didn't try.

Outdoor seating. Very vintage haha. Geno's is literally right across the street. Talk about competition. They are very generous with the amount of meat they put into your sandwich. It gets pretty greasy so load up on napkins. The bottom part of the bread gets soggy too, so it'll just make you want to inhale the sandwich before it gets too soggy.

I got to check off authentic philly cheesesteak from from bucket list!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Having a genuine Philly cheesesteak was on my bucket list.  Got my wish today.  We were lucky to get parking nearby.  No wait.  Just went up to the window and ordered (Cheez) Whiz wit (with onions).  The size of the sandwich was perfect, not humongous -- and shareable (ask them to cut it in half for you).  No gristle, all tender meat. The gooeyness of the Cheez Whiz all over the tender steak and onions and the juices of everything incorporating in the bread is sheer goodness.  My husband got in line for another sandwich (our third one purchased). I didn't find the cheesesteak greasy like other reviewers did.  We came early around lunchtime on a workday.  Maybe that helped.  My only regret was not ordering the cheese fries as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The pits!

What scam.  Simpy put this place is only slightly better than the atrocious Geno's accross the street.  Too bad there isn't one more steak place on the other corner it could be known as the Bermuda Triangle of Philly Hell.

This was my second time to PA in the last 10 years years.  The first time I went to place closer to Valley Forge.  That was OK but didn't leave a lasting impression.   

The bread stunk, the meat was dry and sparse.  No flavor!  And $10 a pop, what rip off!  In Chicago if your beef (which is huge BTW) costs more than $6 people complain a lot!

So I'm from the Midwest, not terribly far from Chicago.  Sorry Philly but you got nothing on Chi town and certainly nothing on beef sandwiches.  The beloved Chicago Italian Beef (pick your place, Al's #1, Johnnies, even the chain Portillos) beats the Philly cheese so completely if I lived in Philly I'd mail order from Chicago instead!

Don't waste your time at either of these places.  It's just a tourist trap (now I know!).  Instead go to John's Roast Pork where the pork is on a par with Chicago and I presume the cheese steak is also good.  

Finally, big city brusque is perfectly fine, rude is not.  Pat's was just plain rude... there is no charm in a chain smoking lady barking orders to people in line.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We were in Philly and we had to go... we thought it was required to eat a cheese steak at Pat's when you visit. The bread was fabulous but everything else was "Meh". Parking is a zoo. 

Maybe it was the big build up from the food channels but we both thought the steak was over cooked and they were pretty stingy with the portions. 

There are better places to get this Philly staple, these guys have gotten too big and their lack of quality shows.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fine tourist attraction (bring your camera), Lousy cheesesteak.  Most neighborhoods in Philly have spots that are much better. Genos, across the street not much better. Take your photo and ask friends for local recommendations.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Okay so I settled the South Philly cheese steak battle between pats and genos Pats is better bread and meat Gino's has better lights in pictures so take pictures of Gino's building and eat at pats the battle is now solved from the number one yelper in the United States lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of the top cheese steak spots in Philly! Good amount of meat, whiz, and onions on some good bread. The best spot? I don't know.. it's all really a toss up and based on personal preference. In no particular order I would say try, Pat's, Tony Luke's, Jim's, and one from John's Roast Pork.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was expecting a lot more, kinda disappointed. Very expensive for what I got. They may be the original but doesn't mean they're the best. Still I'm glad I stopped in to check it out. Line was long but it moved quickly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My favorite cheesesteak spot. Yes, it's a tourist trap, and yes the lines are ridiculously long, but it's still one of the best original cheesesteaks. Plus, there's a reason why its touristy - because its famous - and a eatery is always famous because the food is good. 

Cheese whiz with onions. Get the cheese fries and drinks at the other window. BEST cheese fries, you gotta try em. They have small containers of peppers on the the side you can help yourself too. Seating is outdoor on benches and is limited, but you never have to wait more than a few minutes to grab a seat. Much better than their rival geno's across the street. Staff is friendlier too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We did the Pat's vs. Geno's challenge and my mom chose Pat's! I chose Geno's, but overall, Pat's Cheesesteaks are very good! I got a cheesesteak with mushrooms, onions and wiz. It was flavorful, the onions definitely added to that. I'm not a big fan of their bread, that's why I chose Geno's. I will definitely be making another trip up to Philly to re-do this challenge! Haha!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's been awhile, but I'm sure nothing has changed.  Absolutely the finest Cheese Steak on planet.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I definitely did a Pat's vs Geno's challenge here and to be honest I was kind of disappointed with both. Pats is definitely far more low key than Geno's and to be honest I liked Pat's over Geno's although I find Jim's on south street to be my fav! 

Pat's felt a little big more cheesier and meatier. The service is super fast, know how to order, have your CASH (only!) up front and ready to go. As soon as you place your order is as soon as they will slap some cheese steaks down on the counter - it goes that quickly!

Oh yeah, order your drinks and sides down the counter at a different cashier. Weird, Yes. But it keeps the line moving.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So I decide last Saturday to take a trip to Philly with my wife and sister to have a famous Pat's Cheesesteak. The whole ride down I was praising how good it was going to be. We arrived and waited on line for about 45 minutes that was fine its going to be a great sandwich who cares. I decide to order 2 sandwiches (what the hell you only live once) We sit down and start eating the sandwich was ok not great but i was still excited to eat at such a well know place then I started on the other sandwich my wife had finished hers but was taking bites of mine. I am about to have my last bite and notices something ( A LONG PIECE OF HAIR IN THE CHEESE WIZ) i almost puked but I held my composure I didn't want to make a ruckus because there abput 30 people on line waiting. I should have went to Geno's or Tony Luke's I was definitley heart broken.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A trip to Philadelphia is never complete without having a Philly cheesesteak. My mission ? To experience and give my two cents on the great debate on which  of the two iconic Philly cheesesteak places is better ... Pat's or Geno's. 

Before we left Philadelphia, we headed to both places, and because parking was difficult, my friend drove around to look for a spot , while I patiently stood in a loooong line ( at both places) to get my hands on the iconic sandwich . I ordered 6 sandwiches from both places to split with my friend , to bring back home and to devour in the car on our drive back to the DMV. 

Tip.... Before you even stand in line , make sure you know how to order what you want... Order like a pro and not like some newbie and have people behind you give you THE LOOK... say how many, WID OR WIDOUT (meaning with or without onions) , and if CHEEZEWHIZ, provolone or American cheese...,when my turn came, I said it like a pro - 6, WIDOUT, CHEEZEWHIZ! (Thank God for Yelpers' tips who came before me!!)

The verdict? Well, while I found the competitor's shop to be more hip and actually cleaner,  and their  bun better, I felt Pat's sandwich to be the better of the two... The meat to bread ratio was substantial, the cheeze whiz oozing so beautifully , the beef was not dry and was actually flavorful because of the fat marbling. The competitor had their meat arranged on the bun, as if each slice of meat was counted.....at Pat's the meat was piled on generously! It made for a heavier sandwich I felt. 

Try Pat's and even the other guy across the street when you make a trip to Philly, especially if it's your first time there and your touring the place so you can have a say on this great debate.......But if you're out for a gooood Philly cheesesteak, the locals recommend other places much better. In fact we have some good ones too here in the DMV area, but not iconic like Pat's and Geno's. 

By the way , why I'm giving four stars? Pat's deserves it for being OG!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Maybe I'm just not that big a fan of cheesesteaks? With that said, this place was better than Geno's. Their cheese wiz from an industrial sized can was good as any and their meat was actually pretty tender. If you're looking for a offer bread then Geno's chewier bread, then Pat's has that.

They're pretty quick here to give you your order and they have more seating then at Geno's. Unfortunately because the place is also more popular than Geno's, the seating is also pretty hard to get too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: pat's sandwich was disappointing. the meat was very dry and the overall sandwich was not great at all. dont know if coming at 330am made a difference but was not impressed
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was super disappointed with Geno's so I assumed Pat's had to be better and I was just as disappointed except their meat is better. Everyone should just ditch these places and go straight to Cleaver's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Disappointed again although this steak and cheese was a tad bit better than Geno's. I think with these steak joints, they don't add any spices or anything at all for that matter to the meat which really ends up tasting like rubber. The "how to order a steak" sign at the front made me laugh.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's all the way. I always get an American wiz without. Unreal every time. And I give Pat's 5 starts because not only is it obviously delicious, but the key words there were EVERY TIME. Can't say the same for another cheese steak establishment within walking distance..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very good, possibly the best in Philly. Somewhat touristy. Not as bad as Geno's. The cheesesteaks are greasy, cheesy, and with a good chewy roll they put in on. Parking is tough. Fight the pigeons while eating your lunch on the outdoor tables. If you really want the best, Pat's should be a top choice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Filthy tables never wiped down, and one is asking for trouble with its clientele.  Dangerous area at night where one can get shot eating grease and a heart attack on a roll.
The staff is as rude as Joe Pesci in Good Fellas.  Way overpriced for something that will have one on a toilet bowl in one hour afterwards.  I'll pass going forward.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was the first place that we stopped in Philly to try a cheesesteak.  I do have to say that this place is overrated.  The cheesesteak was pretty decent.  They don't toast their bread here either.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I will keep this review short and simple,  if your not a tourist and you rate this place higher then a one star you Philadelphia privileges are revoked.  Turn in your Ben Franklin wig and stop eating soft pretzels.  So many better steaks then this one (and Geno's) got somewhere else.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They are not that good!. Just got one from both Geno's and Pats. Along with Geno's, they are the worst ones I've had since I started eating steaks... I met my wife at King of Pizza in Gloucester NJ while on leave from the Army in '91. I've been back to Jersey two or three times a years since then and eat steaks for breakfast lunch and dinner while I'm here, since I can not get them where I live in Texas. I have to say the South Jersey steaks are far better than the two famous places in Philadelphia. I recommend skipping the tourist trap! Go to King of Pizza or Sal and Pats in Gloucester or even Mr. Bees in Gibbstown. I'm sure there are other great places too but don't waste time at either of the above!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Trap trap, tourist trap. Geno's  on the other side of the  street is a little better.  Prices are high. Nobody puts that crap cheesewhiz  on a steak except out-of-towners. 

It's not a bad steak, it just that you can get better and at a better price almost anywhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was recommended this place and I regret not having more cash (no credit card accepted, hence 4 stars). Really brings the best of the meat. The bread didn't get  soggy and the cheese had a great taste. I wish they had some spicy quick of sorts in the menu (didn't find one). Will definitely come back again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I wanted to enjoy this place. But it was a total letdown, just like Geno's.

Service was rude, which I was already warned about and yes, I got their specialty with the cheese whiz and all but eh, I probably would never bother coming back here which is a good thing because parking here sucks. Doesn't matter when you go, it sucks. I came here a few times with other people and went to Geno's (literally across the street) and it's always packed.

Meat is precooked. Food is not made to order so be forewarned (yes, I'm talking to you, you tourist).

Check out my list of Philly cheesesteak spots to hit up (or avoid).

Cash only.

Parking: Sucks
Price: Cheap
Wait: Not long once you order
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I guess I had higher expectations just given the history and hype. The steaks come out so alarmingly fast. At night, there was just one window open where you pay and in a matter of seconds got your steak assembled. The meat was pretty bland and underseasoned. Not sure if I get the hype, or want to pay $10 for a steak again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I must admit, that at first i was all about Geno's (you know the racist people across the street). 

People kept telling me to try Pats, try Pats, try Pats, so I did, and YES IT IS BETTER, and I would argue the best cheese steak in Philly for a straight "provolone with".

Fyi out of towners that is how you order a cheese steak here, you state your cheese choice, american, provolone, or whiz, and with or with out onions, i.e. (as above) "provolone with" = a cheese steak with provolone and onions...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm from So Cal, so cheese steaks are mostly average here. I did not have high expectations visiting for the first time, cheese steak is cheese steak right? Well...Pat's was surprisingly very tasty, the meat is very good, doesn't taste like any cheese steak in Cali or anywhere else. My friend is such a loyal Pat's customer she would not allow me to taste Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: While nowhere near the best steak in the city Pat's get unfairly hated on by locals who only see it as a tourist trap.  The fact is their steaks are above average and worth the visit.  Much better than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This was recommended by my friend as a spot to try on our trip to Philly. She had been dying to go to Philadelphia, so in the spirit of Xmas I told her I would drive. 
 
Pat's King of Steak was average to me. I'm not an expert but I have sampled a few places and I don't feel they lived up to the hype. There wasn't as much flavor in the steak as I expected. The fries on the other hand was good, well seasoned. 

The service was what you would expect from a food shack. Their process works in regards to getting people in and out quick, but I feel the flavor suffers because of that. 

I was expecting a more mom and pop shack, but this seemed more franchised.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Now the hype about this place is for the birds.. i don't see why this would be king... i always give the benefit of saying maybe an off day but idk... the line moves quickly so just know what u want and have your cash ready ...ok so the meat was pretty dry & i asked for provolone instead of whiz and got 2 pieces that where so small in comparison to the meat and bread that I forgot it was on there ...thank God for those peppers at the condiment stand which were so good by the way it saved the sandwich.. i should have went to genos while my friend stayed here for comparison but genos line was ridiculously long .. the cheese fries were okay if you like them clumped together as one... convenient? ... I love how the guys behind the counter spoke up along with me when some drunk? dude bumped my friend and tried to start shit by saying my friend bumped him ..the guys were like that's BS he never touched you get outta here.. really cool guys much appreciated
(10/1)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm a fan of Pat's and always make a habit of stopping by when traveling through Philly. They certainly aren't the best cheese steak in Philly or the universe but they make a tasty terrible for you treat. Tastes best late night, covered in hot peppers, and while other terrible decisions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's. Wit provolone. Hold the wiz
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Visiting Pat's for me was like a kid wanting to visit Disney World so badly all his life only to find out the Disney castle was in ruins from a nuclear explosion.  Earth shattering, heart breaking and emotionally distressing. Visit to Pat's was a total buzz kill!

While walking enroute to the landmark of the two most infamous steakhouses in all of Philly I asked several locals which was better and 6 out of 8 I asked said Pat's was best.  If Pat's is best I don't want to know how God awful Geno's is.  Here is how their garbage is put together and I paid for it...

When I placed my order, steak with onions mushrooms and peppers the guy at cashier turned around grabbed a hero from a stack of fresh heroes.  He turns around to slap a piece of cheese into hero, grabs mushrooms from a bin along with my peppers and tosses them right into the hero.  I'm thinking, "Uh are you going to grill that?"  Nope! He rolled up my ghetto boot-leg knock-off Philly cheese steak and handed it to me.

Now I'm thinking, "Well this place is infamous so they must know what they are doing right?" WRONG! I sat down to enjoy my cheese steak only to have utter disappointment in my first bite. The peppers and mushrooms were stone cold as I expected because they don't make the steaks "to order", meaning simmering the mushrooms and peppers with the meat to have all those flavors marinated together.  It just tasted like God awful canned mushrooms.  Also, more importantly my strips of steak had fat linings on it. I get that it's steak but for the amount of fat my sandwich had it impressed upon me that they used inferior crap steak product. Totally grossed me out but I closed my eyes and ate.

Never again, total tourist site.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just because you invented something doesn't mean you are the best at it. Don't visit this tourist trap if you are actually looking for the best cheesesteak in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bravo Euro-toting, Pound-wielding, guidebook consulting tourists!  You've contributed to the semi-demise of an American institution.  Alas, we appear to have another casualty of the rising restaurant operating costs phenomenon.

It pains me to take Pat's down a star, but they've slipped a bit based on my recent visits.  I know they often get long lines, which causes assembly-line/rapid fire food prep quality issues, but it seems like lately the meat is either cold, dry, or saturated in something other than grease (?).  But curious Brits sustain demand enough to breed cheesesteak-preparation complacency.  

I still like the place, and the cheese fries especially, but it saddens me that the quality and consistency aren't what they used to be.  Oh, and they seem to be stingy with the cheese lately.  Ugh.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The Philly true classic a cheese steak "Whiz With" aka a cheese whiz and grilled onions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wiz provolone with! For $5 I skip over to genos for the same $5 cheese fries that pats sells for $6. Chopped meat separates pats from genos steaks
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's cheesesteak is better than Geno's hands down. I do think Geno's has better fries though. DO NOT TRY THE HOT SAUCE AT EITHER!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: These are the best steaks in Philly.  Do not get provolone; you must get the whiz. A must when in Philly.  The line migh be long but it goes very quickly.  The soda and fries are a seperate line, so you might want to send your girl to wait in that line while you wait for the good stuff.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On my way to Virginia( from Boston), I decided to do the Pats vs Genos Cheese Steak challenge.  I tried Pat's on my way down, then Geno's on the way home.  First of all, u do need to be prepared to order correctly, dont ask 2 much Qs and have ur $ ready.  The service is not the friendliest, cuz honestly they dont have 2 b.  U are warned on the wall while waiting in line on how to order so if u pay attention, u will b aiight.  

Your cheese steak will b ready in mere seconds after u order, and will surely hit the spot.  Proportions r just rite, although a bit pricey.  Spice fanatics will love the roasted chilli peppers in their condiments section, i had 2 grab a handful 2 take back home with me 2 Boston.  Not exactly for the over sensitive or very timid as they may not like Pat's direct and no BS style.

   I cant believe the low score avg, they deserve better.  Its fun 2 try both Genos and Pats but if u could only eat at one, its gotta b Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
the 1 or 2 star reviews come from easily intimidated or confused tourists (and locals). as a native southeastern Pennsylvanian I had to give a nod to Pat's. people will rage & debate that there are other places that are better in Philly, or that the sandwiches here are no better than wherever. truth be told you go to Pat's because it is iconic & delicious.

the place is open 24-7 because IT CAN BE. bring cash, for the folks here are smart enough to bypass the thousands of hours that would be wasted on people fumbling for their credit cards. the service is lightning quick even when there's a line around the block. TIP: know what you want & how to order it. if all else fails read the ordering instructions while you are in line. be prepared to laugh at the tourist southerners/midwesterners on vacation who are puzzled by the speed & efficiency in effect here.

savor the bread, because it's one of the reasons a "Philly" is the real deal here. that means a tad crusty on the outside, warm, soft & chewy on the inside. that means fresh baked bread like you only find in the northeast, not the wonder bread crap other people are used to. a steak from Pat's tastes great with grilled onions, mushrooms, peppers & "Wiz".  there's chicken or no meat if you wish to expand/limit your options, but there's no excuse for even a vegetarian to not eat here at least once. 

have a coke to wash it all down/aid with digestion. don't count on getting a seat at one of the outside tables. if you do get a seat soon as you're done eating get your lazy butt up and move on so someone else can sit. that's right - welcome to Philadelphia. be sure to get plenty of napkins and have a few hot cherry peppers on the side. 

for the Teabagger peoples: if you want to order "in English" try Geno's across the street. they'll be happy to accommodate you.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of the most famous cheesesteaks in town. Delicious indeed, but super oily. And yes, need to learn the jargon while waiting in line. I would say don't come with a high expectation, then you will be fairly happy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the best place in Philly to wear some Giants Super Bowl Champions shirts and hats. The locals really enjoy seeing the out of towners enjoying the local neighborhood fare. The sandwich is kinda good, better when you've been boozing all night. They chop the steak here, which they don't across the street. It's kinda fun to come here once, but I wouldn't come back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious sirloin steak, always fresh and soft! Love it. Especially softness is important for me since I always have the issues with my teeth.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Underwhelming. I got a mushroom whiz wit and I took a bite and tasted nothing but the ketchup I had put on top, and not because I had put too much on. When I tried a bite of the meat itself, it was juicy but not at all seasoned. This place might be good to visit to say you've been, but you can get better steaks elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is not a tourist trap. Tourist traps are like Jims on south street in tourist areas. South philly around pats is a residential neighborhood with locals supporting local businesses and Pats is not only iconic for their cheesesteaks but the best there is hands down. American without on a classic Italian roll from Liscios bakery from south jersey (south jersey water makes amazing bread due to its natural artesian well water) and some hot cherry peppers. Add cheese fries to your order for dessert and your golden. Add a burp later on and you can still savor and taste how good a Philadelphia cheesesteak is really supposed to be.
*not for the kosher at heart or those on a diet, please consult with your physician before eating, once eaten, floss afterwards and make sure you work out to balance yourself. Please repeat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We were in Philly for Jesse's bachelor party and had to do the Cheesesteak challenge.  We ordered steaks from Jims on South Street, Geno's and Pats.  Pats was dads favorite.  We had them with whiz and onions.  We added red and green cherry peppers.  Pats is the original but also looks it.  The may want to consider a remodel to clean up a little bit.  Parking was not a problem since there are 2hr spots all around.  The steak was meaty, flavorful and won the cheesesteak challenge two to one.  I will be back next time I am in Philly for the rematch.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The only thing worst that a Geno's Cheese Steak is a Pat's one. I just can understand why people make such a big deal about them other than local rivalry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There are hundreds of better places to get a cheese steak in and out of the city. This is a tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First thing, if coming here and expect at least a descent customer service, think again. You are nothing but a number to them, they have plenty of customers who don't mind this and are there simply for the food, which brings me to my point. The cheese steak is marginal at best. It shouldn't be that much colder after a couple of minutes but it is. I also expected the quality of the meat to be better, it wasn't. I've tried both the provolone and the melted cheese one, neither one of them is anything to brag about. This is a review for this place and although there are other places with better quality steaks, I won't mention them here. I won't be coming back here for sure, not that it matters to them either way.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
gross!

I should be more specific.  
I have been told that the day I went was clearly a bad day; however, the quality was consistent at both Pat's and Geno's.  My boyfriend and I went to pick up a cheesesteak from both Pats and Geno's so as to compare.  EACH of them was cold!!!  the bread was stale and like ripping off a bite of beef Jerky when eating them.  The provolone was cold.  it was like eating a cold roast beef sandwich with no flavor.  Nobody was at either place so i am not sure if we just went on an off day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was my first time in philly and of course my family and I had to stop and try the king of cheese steaks, and it was delicious! The cheese oozing in the sandwich was perfect!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not worth it.  Just another tourist spot.  If I "HAD" to choose one between the two "TOURIST" cheesesteaks then I would pick Geno's.  If I  had to choose, there would be so many others within downtown or other places I would go to before these 2 tourist cheesesteaks.  Don't know how they got famous, but I wouldn't go there again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Please stop frequenting the tourist traps when you come to Philly.  Pat's and Geno's may be the most famous, but they are some of the worst.  Pat's basically makes these on a conveyor belt.  It's like being served at a high school cafeteria.  The ingredients are shoveled onto a dry hoagie instead of being prepared.  Most locals don't eat here and for good reason.  This doesn't represent real cheesesteaks.  I tried this place after living in Philly for about a year and only because my friend came into town and insisted.  Never again.

If you travel to Philadelphia (and the only reason you'd go here is if you're visiting from out of town), ask a local what place is his/her favorite.  They'll be glad to tell you.  Ask a few and get an idea of what places are good and try those. Not one local will say Pat's or Geno's despite what TV shows try to tell you.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I like any place where you park 4 blocks away and can still smell the cheesesteaks wafting down the alley you are walking through. Be sure to have cash because they don't take cards. I have had a lot of cheesesteaks since moving to Philly and this was by and far the best. Probably not the best idea to have someplace important  to be after eating here as I promise you will smell of meat and onions when you leave.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Okay.. So I'm not from Philly and of course this was recommended.. And I went to try it... Yeah the steak meat is different from what you get from Subway, Wawa, or any deli outside philly.. They are thick and tastes good! Very good with wiz and onions! Pair it with hot peppers and you're good to go! By the way I tried Genos after I ate my steak here and Pat's is way better.. After two days I did the opposite Genos first then Pats.. My vote still goes to Pats..

Great experience
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When I think of the worst cheesesteak I have ever had pat's comes to mind. Just go right across the street to geno's. Trust me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was a good tasting sandwich. Everything was crazy expensive. $9 for a sandwich? $4 for fries? Yes it was good, but hmmm. I feel like part of the appeal is the history of the place. I would go for the nostalgia but if it weren't for that, I wouldn't necessarily beat the door down.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is certainly better than Gino across the street but it is basically a tourist trap. The best part of the sandwich was the bread.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went to school in Philly for four years and recently visited.  My boyfriend had never been and wanted to try a cheese steak and he stumbled upon Pat's on the Internet.   Since it said home of the ordinal or first (can't remember) we tried it.  The sub was a little less than average tasting and a bit over priced.  The steak wasn't good and the sub didn't seem like it was made fresh.  Maybe because of the mound of steak that they already have pre made.  The bread was chewy and I could tell they leave it sitting out all day.  Moral of the story you can get a better and less expensive cheese steak else where.  Def a tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
OK, so you're in Philly. Shouldn't you try some of the storied places?  Hell yeah.

The way we came down Passyunk, we got to Pat's first. We saw the lights of Geno's, but it was like 40 steps away, we're from LA (so we don't do that kind of heavy walking), and we were already here. So.

The bread is good. These steak places all take pride in sourcing their rolls locally. I liked the taste of the steak here but it wasn't stove hot. Not sure why, because the turnover is so high nothing should be sitting back there getting cold.  As someone else said, you just finish your sentence ordering, and the steak is there waiting for you. Steak only lukewarm.  Fries stone cold.  WTF?  Going to ding them on food temp, but I'd give them another chance.  

Woe Unto Him who asketh for fries at the steak window. Authentic rudeness at no extra charge - laughed it off, as the rudeness is part of the experience. 

The Cherry Peppers were utterly awesome to this native Californian tourist.  

We were also utterly amazed that it was OK to park the car right in front of the restaurant in that narrow little street, and that we could even find a spot there. Must have been dumb tourist luck.

I'd go again, and I'd want to try the competition.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is not only the originator of the cheesesteak, but also the BEST cheesesteak place I have ever been!  When I used to live outside of Philly, I would go here at least 4 times a month.  The lines are long on the weekends or after a game, but definitely worth it. I've tried many cheessteaks all over the city and the surroudning areas and have always chosen Pat's over the rest.  I've even done my own Pat's vs Geno's challenge with a few of my friends (have a cheessestaek at one and then go across the street and have one from the other) and Pat's ALWAYS wins!   Now I always make it a point to go there if I am only in town for a 1 day trip or just passing through.

I always go with the whiz wit!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Used to always get Geno's bc that's what my friends wanted. I realized how much of a  mistake that was when I tried Pats for the first time in years the other day. I had a mushroom pizza steak and it was delicious! I'm never going to Geno's again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The steaks were so good!!!! Traveling from California to try an original phili cheese steak I must say it was all I expected the bread was so soft and the steak so tender and juicy and good. If you haven't tried you have to come and try it left very satisfied!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Disappointing for a place with such a reputation.  It was only average with the meat being rather tasteless and tough.  The others I was with agreed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not worth the 10 bucks, people that work there look like robots. My cheesesteak was missing cheese. The only thing that was good was the bread. Will not return.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible! They don't use gloves and that's gross. The service is rude and the bread was barely fresh. Better cheese steaks in NY!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Those pictures really don't do your Cheesesteaks any justice. Between Pats and Geno's all I can say is dry Cheesesteaks a truly good Cheesesteak shouldn't have to be smothered with yellow crap cheese. These places are only for tourist if u live here and really would walk or drive to eat from here that's crazyyyyy. I just drove by there and thought who eats at those 2 places!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I honestly think the only reason Pat's is popular is because it is directly across the street from geno's.  Now I'm not expecting fine dining when it comes to this food but I was pretty disappointed overall.  Did not see what the big deal was about pat's, let alone cheese steaks at all.  Sure it would be something that tasted great when you are hammered at 2am but when I'm stone cold sober at 1pm on a saturday afternoon it's a different story.  I won't be coming back here because frankly this food doesn't do anything for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here because my sis wanted to make a stop...first off we were greeted with a "Yo move up" before ordering our food. In my opinion the steak sandwich is not something to drive to Pennsylvania for. It's was a cool experience and the sandwich was ok but won't be coming back anytime soon. I'd rather go to the corner bodega for a better tasting steak sandwich and spend way less money lol lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philadelphia Landmark. Does not matter about the food, just look at the lines.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ate at Geno's and Pat's.  Wow, Pat's is so much better.  Ordered wiz wit and it was tasty, juicy and flavorful.  I like the steak chopped here rather then the whole slice at Geno's. They were pretty generous with the wiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Average cheese steak I had I got a steak with onions and wiz there was a decent amount of steak which was dry but almost no wiz or onions
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes, Pat's is the best!  The steaks are thick, the bread is big and crusty and the toppings are delicious.  Just wish we were down there more often to experience the juice dripping down our arms.    

Not sure of his name, but the owner came out to chase away a drug addict who was harassing us incessantly for money.  He chased and threatened this drug addict so magnificently, I'd pay to have a video of the incident.  This gentleman is my hero.  It's experiences like this that add to the wonderful ambiance of this place!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely the best cheesesteak in Philly. What else can you expect from the originators of the cheesesteak? My favorite: mushroom pizza wit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is the iconic Cheez Steak palace that started it all. For $10 you get a fresh made sliced steak sand w/provolone on a perfectly fresh crusty baguette. Totally delicious, I'm in Philly heaven.

It's open 24/7 so you can make your pilgrimage anytime. Yes, gawk, pinch yourself and take a lot of pics!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visiting Philly for the first time and came here for my very first Philly cheese steak. They have 2 separate windows to order. One for just the steaks and another for fries and drinks. You get your sandwich as soon as you order it. Very good steaks! Unfortunately it was super cold outside and there is no covered seating. We ran to our car to eat and they got cold before we could really get to taste it hot. But still very good! AND the cheese fries!!! Yuuuuum!! Must get that to go with!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
this is what I'm talking abt! Cheese steaks SMOTHERED in cheese. Good quality steak! With a side of fries drowning in cheese too? I'm sold. I've been to 4 different cheese steak places. Left 3 of them disappointed, wondering what the hype was for these philly cheese steaks. Finally, Pat's has showed me the light. 

Just a side note, we actually went to tony lukes RIGHT before going here.  All I have to say is I still finished my cheese steak and fries. Oh hey, gluttony!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know what all the hype is!!!! My husband makes better cheesesteaks at home!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overpriced, rude, greasy fast food. You'll spend too much, be treated badly, and feel like crap afterwards. I suggest exploring philidelphia a little more and you'll have a much better experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A step up from Geno's. Still not that amazing of a steak. 

But let me drop some real knowledge. 
STAY AWAY FROM THE PIZZA FRIES. 

I should have known what I was signing myself up for. The concept sounded like it could have been awesome. Fries, marinara, mozz or prov. But nope. It's fries, marinara, and CHEESE WIZ. 

DIS....GUSTING. What a waste of $4. 

But yeah, stay away from those, and you ought to be golden. Still, what a letdown in terms of steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: While visiting Philadelphia we felt that we must find some authentic cheesesteaks, and to our disappointment we found Pat's. We had found various places recommending them, so we decided to try there's. We will not go again. I am sure there are far better places as the meat was on the dry side, the cheese very minimal, bread stale, and both the cheesesteaks and drinks cost a premium that they failed to warrant. The employers seemed distant and and disinterested. All in all it wasn't terrible, but it was certainly subpar.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had to go to Pat's while we were in Philly! We went on a rainy night around 9pm so there was absolutely no line which was great.  The signage is cheeky demanding you know what you want and better say it right or go to the back of the line. 

We ordered a cheesesteak with provolone "witout" onions and our order was ready almost instantly. You have to go to a separate window to order drinks and fries and everything is cash only.  The only good thing about that is once tax is added every item is a round dollar or to the 50 cents.  

I would definitely recommend ordering a traditional cheesesteak "wit" onions and wiz for an authentic experience. There is a condiment bar to add ketchup and peppers but skip it all together and just go for the classic. 

We didn't get a chance to go to Geno's across the way but why would you when Pat's is so yummy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was so disappointed with Geno's that I came across the street and ordered a steak with whiz and onion. 

I was treated with a much better sandwich with a much more generous portion of whiz. Additionally, the line was much shorter than at Geno's. 

Please note this is a cash only establishment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Went here for lunch last Sunday (3/14/10) to figure out which place was better: Geno's or Pat's.

And the winner is Pat's....by a long shot.  For this review, I want to describe only Pat's Cheesesteak sandwich and I'll have a separate review for Geno's.  We arrived at Pat's around 11am and there wasn't any huge lines.  I ordered the cheesesteak "wit" whiz, which is chopped steak with grilled onions and cheeze whiz on a french roll (maybe italian). The order came out to around $8. The people who worked there were very cool and nice...no-nonsense type of guys.  There was even a cop sitting back there, chillin' with some of the employees.  Back to the cheesesteak, it was very good.  The steak was nicely seasoned and chopped up, the onions were nicely grilled, and the cheese whiz was thick but fluid.  I liked the roll as well but I can't say if it was french or italian bread.  I really liked the different textures...it was soft inside and had a nice crunchy outside.  After sharing some of my Pat's cheesesteak with my wife, I went to Geno's and came back to the car to share it with my wife also. After eating maybe a third of the Geno's cheesesteak, I went back to Pat's to order another one to take home.  I told the guy that his (Pat's) was better and he said, "it's ok, they got the pretty lights over there."  But yeah, Pat's reigns supreme in my eyes regarding who has the best Philly Cheesesteak on this block.  Try it if you ever get the chance.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The actual sandwich wasn't even that great and it's still a highlight of my trip to Philly. Pat's is the original and now I can say I've done it, I've been to Cheesesteak Mecca!

I got my cheesesteak "wit" and there were plenty of peppers and onions to go along with the thinly cut steak and cheese wiz. The soft bun was nice and it's a good size hoagie. All in all, the steak itself was a little lacking and I couldn't help but think, I don't so much like cheese wiz. It's my own fault, I wanted it authentic...

I think I'm the opposite of my Yelp friend Liz T. on this one though. I think it was well worth the cab fare to check this off my culinary bucket list. I've been to the original Ben & Jerry's in Burlington, where you can get 'seconds' for a buck - the pints they ruined with too much chocolate or something; Pepe's Pizza in New Haven, AKA Frank Pepe Pizzeria Napoletana, the best pizza on earth; and the original Starbucks in Seattle, which I'll put on the b-list for quality, but it is legendary and the only Starbucks with any originality in terms of decor. Pat's King of Steaks is worthy of being on the list. Now...where do I go next?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whiz wit forever. 

We did the typical tourist thing and tried Geno's and then Pat's and I have to say Pat's won me over. It's all about the steak and the whiz and Pat's does it right! They don't solely rely on the cheese or onions to give the sandwich flavor and truly focus on the seasoning of the meat. 

For someone not from the area and not familiar with the proper way of ordering, they had a helpful little sign outside by "I.M. Hungry" (haha) on how to order a cheese-steak. The staff were considerably nicer and weren't rude or in a hurry to get you out of the line. 

It did not receive 5 stars because there was less whiz on my cheese-steak than I wanted. I would also recommend that they serve half-sizes so you can have the option to do the Geno's/Past's tasting and even try different menu items.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The orginal and best in Philly!!! I dare you to compare to Gino's.... You must get THE WIZ!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
How could you not try this place after all the publicity, hype and foodshow features?

On a less busy day, it is about a 25 minute wait... the lines can get really long.  i like the cheesewhiz a lot more, though.  The bread is fresh too.  It is not the same size as a normal hoagie, it is thinner. 

Oh, the neighborhood is also so-so, be sure to stay safe and park in a more lighted/exposed area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Great taste, less filling.

Yeah, it's pretty darn good, but when you compare what you get for $9.50 to what you get for the same or less at other places, you feel kinda cheated. Perhaps you even feel like going directly to Geno's across the corner because you're still hungry, like I was after I went here. Go ahead and go here just to say that you did it, but be warned that it's kind of a tourist trap.

Good, but overrated.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is a must for anyone who hasn't experienced a real Philly Cheese Steak! Although the parking is horrible and at times it can be extremely busy/crowded it's still definitely worth the efforts.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I lived in Philly (2000-2006) I was never a fan of this place. Long lines, no parking, and mediocre food for the price. I was younger and poorer then.

As a visitor to the city...it's just one of those things you gotta do while in Philly. I certainly can't add much value to the already 1663 reviews so I won't bother. Only thing I wonder now is who will be the 1776th reviewer!

Certainly the food was much better than I remembered when I lived here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I think it's ok. I know cheese stake is a must have in Philly. That's why I go to this place. I ordered a cheese stake and mushroom stake. I have to say that it tastes a lot better with the cheese. I haven't eaten cheese stake in other restaurants, so I can't compare. But I just think the stake is kind of dry. The mushroom stake tastes bland. I think the Sicilian Steak in Al's in Boston south station tastes a lot better than the cheese stake here. It is also cheaper with bigger size as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheese sauce + Steak + onions= one yummy cheesesteak. I came here for the first time the other day, and it was delicious. In the past, I had been to this area at night, but at 3pm it was really quiet and pleasant. I found parking easily and didn't have to wait in line. After dinner, though, it gets really crowded and parking is impossible...so I recommend coming on the earlier side! This place knows how to make cheesesteaks... you gotta try this if you're in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was in the area and decided to stop at Pat's. I was immediately alarmed by the ignorance of the staff and the lack of friendliness displayed. I was reluctant to complete my order after being rushed to make a decision, but continued since I was already in line. Upon eating the sandwich, I was disappointed with the size considering the cost ($9-$12). Having been in Philly all my life and eating steak sandwiches from across the city, I can not subscribe to the hype that this place receives. There are plenty of sandwich shops that have tastier steaks and treat their customers with more respect.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Don't be taken in by the fact that Pat's is called the "King of Steaks" when it's not even in the same courtyard as the jester. This place serves sub par meat (usually fatty and dripping with grease) that only tastes "ok" when it's 1:30am and you need some thing to eat. For all of you tourists, don't make the mistake and go here. There are much better cheesesteak places in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was surprisingly good. I was in Philly for a conference and figured I should get the local delicacy. I was simultaneously excited and grossed out by the concept (the grossed out part mostly because of the cheese whiz. The cheesesteak was actually really good. I got it with onions, they are huge though- definitely shareable
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place has gone down hill over the past few years.  The meat quality seems to go down every time I eat here.  The person handling the money was the one cutting the rolls last time I was here.  If you are a tourist I'm sure you will enjoy it and it would be worth the experience but for those of us who live in or near Philly there are much better options.  Check my other reviews for those places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I thought there would be something more to their cheesesteaks since they're so famous for them but I felt it was a little lacking. However in comparison to Geno's across the way, Pat's wins. Their meat and grilled onions have a better flavor to them than Geno's does. People there certainly have their preference though. Each line was equally as long with happy customers on both sides.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I had to try this famous landmark since 1930 while in Philly.  The line for this crap was 20 minutes long.
H.L. Mencken wrote "Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public".   Never a truer word was spoken when it comes to Pat's.
I had a cheese steak with provolone.  $10....overpriced for what it is.  
More importantly, most of the meat was not soft.  I am not a fan of tough, disgusting, molar grinding chewy meat.  The meat was similar looking to shoe leather.
Would never go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteaks are subpar, and the gimmick of "wiz wit" is and always was old. Please, allow me to speak normal, American English if I'm the one giving you my money.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes, it's a tourist trap.  Yes, it's below the Italian Market and not exactly easy to get to.  Yes, you can get a better cheesesteak at dozens of places. 

But.

BUT.

It's Pat's.  It's good.  There is something about the line, eating a hot cheesesteak on a cold morning on the sidewalk that is so right.  I bring all my out-of-town friends here eventually (and it is just a few blocks south of the Italian Market) and they all love it...and then I take them to Dalesandro's and get them a REAL cheesesteak.  

But it's Pat's.  It's good.  It's a classic for a reason.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: simply said, in the battle between pat's and geno's.. PAT'S wins!!! i like that they chop up the steak, makes the sandwich have a better "bite" and it also allows the meats to cook separtely instead of as one big piece of dried overcooked meat. def will be back the next time i'm around philly! although lines are always long, it's pretty civilized
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
the debate can end NOW!
I have spoken!
Dont bother with anyone but Pat's!
And yes, I HAVE tried all the other steaks in town (once!) and no one will ever make one as tasty as Pat's!
Hey Geno's... put some friggin meat on that thing!
and for future reference... Tony Luke's is close, and makes a KILLER spicy pork w Broccoli Rabe!
HEADS UP!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's funny to me that Geno's is right across from Pat's! Extreme-Competition-to-the-max!

Brother wanted to try Pat's instead of Geno's sooooooooo~ that is what we decided to do! Line was long but it went by quickly

Parking- find street parking

REMEMBER, CASH ONLY SO COME PREPARED WITH THE $$$ BILLS

A philly cheese steak ranges from $9-11(?), depending on what toppings you include on your sandwich. I ordered their Mushroom Philly cheese steak with onions & cheese whiz. It was pretty darn good. They offer condiments and picked peppers on the side which complements well with the sandwich!

To be honest with you, I can't compare Pat's Philly cheese steak to anything else since I've never really tried any other Philly cheese steak other than this one. If I had more time, I would love to try every Philly Cheese steak in Philadelphia to compare & figure out which one is the best. I will save that for next time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I make frequent trips to Philly from NYC and every time I get there I make sure to grab a cheesesteak. 

I've tried Pats, Genos, Tony Luke's and a local spot called Dalessandros. While Genos and Tony's steaks are mediocre.. Delessandros is simply amazing and Pats has its on and off moments.

Last night was one of its off moments, which is why I give this place a 1 star rating: because of it's horrendous customer service. The skinny bearded-guy with tats behind the counter was a complete dick to multiple customers, including an "Uber eats driver". 

There's so many cheesesteak spots in the area and I would say save your money and time with this place... It's not worth the attitude... I like my food made with love and you won't get any of that here..

Pats really need to improve and work on this because clearly it isn't the 1930s anymore...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's describes Philadelphia in a nut shell. Its small its rough around the edges ,yet mighty. You have to go there around 2 a.m. to see how ggreat  it is. There will be a line wrapped around the whole building in the 10 degree south philly Winter. The rolls they use are my favorite , the service is philly tough, and the cherry hot peppers are the best. I prefer it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I ordered two provolone without.  I'm sorry I had the kids with me and they do not like onions and I don't call wiz cheese.  So perhaps I didn't have a true philly cheesesteak, but I had it the way I wanted.  Well, it was really bland and dry.  The bread was chewy, but not bad.  But the meat was chewy as well.  It was actually too lean.  Much more tasty after adding salt and pepper, but just meh.  Next time, to give it a fair shake, I should probably try a wiz wit.  A little overhyped, not sure it was worth the detour but it was a part of our Philly experience.  Just wish there was more to write home about!  Will be back next month and continue my search for the ultimate Philly cheesesteak :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Real good cheesesteak as they say.  Being in NY most of the time, I went to "99 miles to philly" on 3rd ave to try an authentic 'wiz wit' only to be disappointed by the saltyness of the wiz, overpowering the entire sandwich.  I'm happy to say that the wiz wit at Pat's is quite delicious and the truly authentic Philly cheesesteak is as great as they say.  Also, the french fries are pretty delectable as well.  Be wary of the ordering system as they will send you to the back of the line if you don't know your order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: For years I have been hearing about Pat's and Geno's.  Flying from San Diego to Philly all I could think about was sinking my teeth into the thinly sliced steak smothered with the best condiment ever created (Cheese Whiz) the anticipation was killing me.  So soon as I got off the long flight my friend and I drove straight there stomach growling the whole way. Finally I could see the neon lights from a distance and my mouth started to water. I decided to start with half of  "Whiz, wit" at Pat's and then half of the same from Geno's after the first bite of each I realized what I have been fantasizing about for the last 5 hours on my flight was all for nothing it was just OK I can honestly can say I have made better cheese steaks in my dorm room back in the day with a George Foreman grill and Steak-Umms. Besides the OK flavor of the meat at both joints I would have to say Geno's had better bread but less meat and If I had to decide between the two I would say Geno's but probably only because the cheese whiz covered up the bland taste of the meat. But if you love food it is a great landmark to visit but beware don't go into it thinking it will be the best thing you have ever sunk your teeth in...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Therefore, we have our trip to Philadelphia to look around and try a famous Cheesesteak. People that I work with said try Pats or Geno's, so we tried both at the same time to compare what we liked and disliked. Parts had better bread, chopped steak and better fries overall. Geno's has strip steak, which was good, but we liked the chopped steak better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: OK--but, I prefer, Geno's...!    I guess it's a matter  of taste-
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wow, the hype kills the experience.  Bread was dry and the meat was blah.  Great Steak at the mall tastes so much better.  The cheese fries at least made this two stars.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Since growing up in Chicago, I'm partial to a beef with provolone & giardiniera as opposed to beef with cheese whiz, & there was no au jus to dip it in. 
That said, as far as a beef sandwich with cheese whiz goes, I'm still not a fan. I stopped eating cheese whiz when I was 12. Maybe I should have tried it with provolone, but I wanted to do it like the locals. 
I guess I would go back to try the provolone, but It's definitely not tops on my To Do list. There's also the fact that I spent almost $15 on a sandwich & fries in a To Go window.
It was a good amount of food. but the bread was a bit too much. Should cut the bread size down to bulk up the meat in the rest of it. 
Then there's the line. I waited in line for 20 minutes before finding out that they are cash only. 1. Who doesn't accept cards these days?! 2. Why couldn't they put signs up towards the back of the line that say cash only. I had to get out of line, go to an ATM, & get back in line, which took 30 min the 2nd time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Rude rude rude! We were looking at the menu  and the guys there were yelling at us to hurry up!  we walked over to Geno's and they were much nicer! Geno's all the way!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yeah, it's a tourist trap.
Yeah, it's pretty dirty. 
Yeah, it's expensive.

Those are all true, but it don't matter. Maybe it's cause I wasn't born in philly, but I think Pat's is the best. Nice to get once in a while. In fact, I think the dirt adds to the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What can I say people. I had a craving for a really good cheese steak and that day nothing else was going to do. NOTHING............

So I do a little bit  of research to see where I could go and google suggests Pats. I decide to put it in my google Maps to see how long it would take to get there.

Imagine my surprise when it said 4.5 hours away..............Now to explain why it would take that long is because I LIVE IN New York City, Bronx to be be exact.

Still, I wasnt going to back down from a challenge, I had to have my cheese steak sandwich.  After a long drive Pats did not disappoint.  Now I just wish I bought one for the road back as when I got back to NYC I was hungry again.

Luckily this time it wasnt for a philly cheese steak sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Amazing time. Great tasting cheesesteak. We loved it this was our second time there and the food was so good. We liked it better than the rival across the street, I'm not going to knock the other place. But Pat's King of Steak has us as customers forever. 

I live in Bergen County and I make the trip to go because I know I will get quality and quantity of food. 

Thanks Pat's it was awesome.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not a local, so I can't speak to the Pat's vs. Gino's debate.  I went with Pat's, 1) because a friend recommended it and 2) because I was scared by all of the neon lights at Gino's.

Best cheesesteak I've ever had.  I haven't had that many, so take that for what its worth.  Cheese Whiz appears to be the way to go (a friend got American, didn't look that awesome).  They do have soup-nazi style ordering, so you have to be prepared for that.

I will definitely come back next time I'm in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: please, if you are really looking for a cheesesteak, DO NOT get one from here.  Soggy, gristle-filled awefulness.  There are so many good options in the city- none of which are anywhere near this intersection.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Go for the experience if you want but the cheesesteaks were meh-- totally forgettable. Being a NY'er, I am no stranger to "street meat". The food here is truly nothing special. Staff is rude but I guess it's part of their schtick. I don't ever plan on returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you're going to Philadelphia, you have to try a Philly cheese steak. Good food, great ambiance. The people watching is great - feels like you're in a movie.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I still have to try Geno's, but I think the hype is just hype. I lived in Philly for almost five years before I tried this place, and it'll probably be another five before I try Geno's. If you're looking for a solid cheese steak, do yourself a favor and go to your local lunch truck, it'll be light years better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak here is just alright, not any better than other cheesesteaks out there. We think it's slightly overrated. It's worth going at least once just to say you've been to a place where a cheesesteak came from...  

The cheese fries were good though. It's so good... lots of melted cheese....

When we were there, there wasn't any line. We were there around 6pm on a Tuesday evening... maybe that's why...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We wanted the Philly experience so we checked with Yelp and other sites to see what the locals thought was the best.  They said it was Johns Roast Pork so that's where we went. Johns is listed as #1 for Cheese steak in Philly even though their signature sandwich is a pork sandwich. All I can say about that is read my review on them and walk the other way. DO NOT BELIEVE IT. OH MY GOD IT WAS HORRIBLE. DO NOT GO THERE. GOD, WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY! GROSSNESS.

Anyway, we headed across town and since Genos and Pat Kings are literally 50 feet from each other we ordered a sandwich from each. IMPORTANT: CASH ONLY!

At Pat Kings we ordered a steak, onion and sharp provolone sandwich. The service was Soup Nazi casual. We wanted fries, but were so intimidated by the guy that opened the window a whole 2 inches wide that we forgot to order them. The place is a little dull with fading pictures of celebrities that had been there over the years. It made us sad to see these iconic photos fading away.
