From Genos we ordered a steak, onion and "whiz". Their place is bright, shiny and flashy with lots of neon.  They also have pictures of famous visitors that are well taken care of and they have an impressive display of police patches from all over and a tribute to a local fallen police officer. 
Their service, while a little cold, was at least amusing. We heard someone ask if they had mustard and someone yelled "For What?!!!" I guess they don't think their sandwich needs condiments. They have the "When ordering speak English" signs and the freedom fries on the menu. Call it what you want, but we are in America, people, and if you speak another language its hard to get your order right, right? At Genos, it was a little inconvenient to order and pay for our sandwich at one window and then move two windows down to order and pay for our fries at another window. I dont know if the same applies for drinks. 

First, the fries from Genos were excellent; we loved them. The provolone sandwich from Pat Kings was a little bland and not too exciting. The "whiz" sandwich from Genos was better. My husband is, but I am not a "whiz" kind of person. I did find  the "whiz" at least brought out the flavor of the meat and was a better, less dull experience. The meat from both places was about the same.  I wish it were more of a grilled meat with some crusty edges instead of a kind of water saturated been sitting in a warmer, waiting for the crowds flavor. The bread used from both restaurants was excellent. It stands up to the juice and maintains its form. The onions......the onions on both sandwiches left a little to be desired. They both seemed to be lightly sautéed chopped onions. If they had been grilled rings of onion and were just slightly caramelized they would have added so much flavor.  I get it about the tried and true recipes handed down from generations before, but come on, if its better, its better. Be a little more open-minded to improvement. 

Our opinion: 
Me: Meh, the cheese steak sandwich at Tubby's in Charlottesville, VA is so much better than anything we had in Philly, but if I had to choose, it's Genos steak, onion and whiz.
Dave: Johns- waterlogged in the seediest part of South Philly, we gave one of our sandwiches to a homeless guy downtown.  Pat's sandwich was good, but Geno's was a lot better with the whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love pats steaks. In a city famous for its cheese steaks this is a great option. The food is always consistent and the service is prompt
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I know, I know, I also reviewed Geno's and I gave them 4 stars too... What can I say, cheesesteaks are delicious! Chopped steak, smothered with cheese on a delicious roll... You can't go wrong here. Lacking the neon of Geno's, but not lacking in taste. Pat's is awesome!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: very good. i like  cheesesteaks from both places
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is what it is, a place you take outsiders to grab a steak when they are in town and a late night mecca.  Tasty steaks that are even more delicious when its 2 AM, everything is closed and you are in the mood for something greasy and yummy.  

Don't expect friendly service, you don't need it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
4.5 stars!

Soo take a guess as to where I got cheesesteaks when I was in philadelph recently. Yup, Pat's, Geno's and Tony Luke's.  Much like the Anchor Bar in buffalo is not the only place to get good wings, I'm sure there are countless other places in Philly to go for a good cheesesteaks.  But tourist is as tourist does. 

After having a perfect "wiz wit" at pat's, I tried geno's.  The taste was almost exact, but how in the he'll does anyone enjoy thier steak all flat like lunchmeat? Thumbs down for geno's!  We then went back to pat's the following day.  Being from the north, I kinds enjoy when the fast-pace of these places make the employees kinds rude. Ain't nothin personal. I also think a root-beer accompanies a cheesesteak pretty well. Pat's woulda gotten 5 stars from me, except that I work in a restaurant cooking up steak-hoagies all day, so I knew what to expect. So all in all, Pat's not Geno's dat's all I gotta say
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My fiance and I had to check out the famous South Philly Cheesesteak places, so we went to Pat's first, and got one "wit provolone" and a birch beer.  We liked Pat's style more.  It was a whole lot simpler looking than Geno's, which was lit up like Clark Griswald's house in Christmas Vacation.   It was definitely a good cheesesteak, but we were a bit underwhelmed, given all the hype it gets.  The meat wasn't as moist as I wanted it to be, but was still flavorful. The bread was excellent. We wondered if going the cheese whiz route would have made the steak better, and concluded it probably would.  Overall, a pretty good cheesesteak, and a really cool neighborhood.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Alright - well - it appears the that true Philly loals are a little fired up about this whole Geno/Pats thing.  And I agree with them.  My friend and I did the two-steak comparison.  I will say that Pat's won the Battle, but both sides lost the war...

Pat's was fast.  The line was about the same, as it was at Geno's, but the fact that Pat's crew dumps about 1,000 pounds of steak onto a water/grease filled surface at a time had the line moving fast.

The steak was good.  I'm not much for wiz, so I went american and mushroom without.  Decent.  I guess at the end of the day I felt like I could get a comparable steak anywhere. 
 
Now, having been there, I think I would 100% agree with Alex M. "there are 2 reasons to go to Pat's...1. you have friends in from out of town who've never had a cheesesteak, and 2. its 2:12 AM and you're drunk"
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great place, no complaints. To be truthful there are a few better places around to get a good cheesesteak. Most of them are local joints. Anyway you cut it, Pat's King of Steaks will not dissapoint, even the cheesesteak connoisseur.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came all the way from NY to get a cheesesteak. I went to Geno's first and decided to come here. The sandwich was excellent. The motto is Don't Eat A Mistake. And they are correct. I should have went here first. But I am taking some sandwiches back to Ny for dinner.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been a Pat's fan for many years. I've tried Geno's cheesesteak but Pat's cheesesteak with onion and cheese exceeds in flavors. 

Right, this place is a tourist trapped, especially when the weather is nice and warm. I suggest going when is cold so there's no lines just to avoid lines. 

There are signs to help you order in steps. You just need to know what you are ordering because these guys move fast. Pat's accepts cash only. It is $10 for a cheesesteak now. It used to be a lot less.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I like this place a bit better than Geno's because even though I find both places a tad rude and a wee bit racist (ironic hello it's Philly home of brotherly love) Pat's tastes better to me and I appreciate the lack of flashiness. When we go we never have to wait too long and the sandwiches are not too greasy and just the right size.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's steaks are good only when there is a long line waiting to be served. Provided there was a long line then the food remains good even after you take it home so you can sit down to your favorite show on tv. If you go during a time when there is a very short line (about 5 people in line) the cheese steak is kind of dry and not very good. 

Go to Geno's for better cheese fries. Their steaks are better than Pat's when the press is watching (they have some sort of promotion going on like raising money for our troops or something like that) but the rest of the time Pat's takes the cake.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My family is from PA originally, so I was basically raised to be a Pat's person!  Every time I visit now, it's the first place I go straight from the airport.

Pat's is open 24 hours, and is a haven for drunk people in the wee hours of the morning. Pat's is a truly Philly cheese steak experience. From the fresh baguettes, to the cheese wiz, to the torn up greasy flavorful beef and sauteed onions. Pat's is family run, and as long as you follow the ordering rules, they'll have you in and out of the line, no matter how long, in no time with your giant cheese steak simmering on the paper napkin they hand it to you on.

Notes: Just make sure you 'follow procedure' when ordering! It helps get you what you want and through the line quickly! Also, pay attention to what line you are in- 1 is for steaks, and 1 is for fries!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Everybody from philly raves and rants about Pat's and Geno's... I really dont think there cheesesteaks are really worth it. And I live about half a mile away....

Good price and its real quick service, but honestly i have had better cheesesteaks in NY and NJ...

Skip in my opinion... unless u just want to say i ate at Pat's.

I realize it is the same review as Geno's but lets be real they practically the same. I apologize to all the geno and pat fans...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Fast service, hot steaks!!! Delicious!!!!

Wit onions and whiz! Could not have asked for a more delicious cheese steak! 

It was my first time trying it and I will definitely be back!

Cash only and you can't mess up your order :D
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's popped my cheesesteak cherry. 

Visiting from NYC for the weekend, me, bf & best friend stopped in.

Don't know why, but I've just *never* had a Philly cheesesteak, here or anywhere else till this weekend.  It just never appealed.

After our drive from Queens, early check-in at the hotel and a few minutes pumping the a/c as cold as it could get, we realized we were HUNGRY.

We decided to head to one of the 2 biggies to sample the local legendary foodz.  Walked from the Doubletree on Broad in CC through the italian section (quite amusing!) and finally, after what seemed like forever in the sickening heat and humidity, arrived at the intersection of Cheesesteaks.  

We got on Pat's line because Geno's seemed a touch longer and we are lazy.  After 20 minutes of waiting we were all starving.  I ordered mine wit' and with provolone, then got on the soda line, which for some reason was the BIG hold-up that afternoon.  Seriously??? But anyways - clearly there were no seats to be had, so we ate em standing up. 

It was pretty yummy, I'll admit.  The steak wasn't overly chewy, the onions were good, but I would have liked a little more cheese (ok I love cheese.)  I wasn't blown away, but I would definitely eat one again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrrated. Just don't get what the big deal is about the Philly Cheesesteak. Had better steak and cheese subs in other cities.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Returned to Pat's for a cheesesteak sandwich exactly one year after my last visit. I was excited about it until I went to order the sandwiches for me and my family. I found the the counter man abrupt in the way he was handling the food, sliding each unwrapped sandwich toward me like they were hockey pucks. I spent a long moment after that requesting bags from the cook because the counter man had stepped away.  With respect to taste, it was just okay, but I can't mark down Pat's on that because I'm recovering from a cold and my tastebuds are off (my family enjoyed their sandwiches). However I absolutely did not like discovering sizable pieces of gristle in the meat. That and the counter man's behavior turned me off from eating at Pat's or eating cheesesteak any time soon.  I'm 90% raw vegan and it definitely wasn't worth braking my normal eating regimen to eat here today.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I know I did a lot of stupid things my freshman year of college in the Illadelph. Thinking that "Pat's King of Steaks" was worthwhile was one of them.

There's nothing wrong with it, but there's nothing right either. For the price of a cheesesteak here, you could get... I dunno, like a real steak somewhere? Lunch trucks sell cheese steaks of _the exact same quality_ for three dollars. And you don't have to wait in line. Or submit to condescending signage.

Besides, cheesesteaks are terrible for you anyway. If you want to experience Philadelphia, eat a goddamn pretzel.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: TERRIBLE!!  DID I say TERRIBLE!!  Just read a review where their DOGS would not even eat it.  I know why.  This place is SO OVER RATED!!!     Another disaster all pumped up by TV.  I can't say enough bad stuff bout this $@#*&%.  Seriously folks,  try Subway!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Just came from there.  And for the first time very disappointed.  Much smaller than than they used to be, probably half the size and they cost more, $11, really!!!!!
See yea!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Don't believe the hype.  Tony Luke's is better.  Actually Philly Cheesesteaks made in San Francisco are better :).  Gooooo Gigantes!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 5 stars. No question. It's iconic. If you're from out of town and skip Pat's, it's the same as skipping the Liberty Bell. Just go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best of the best for CHEESESTEAKS! The only down side is the line around the block but so well worth waiting!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3.5 stars

Not a whole lot to write... We went to both Genos and Pats to try out both variations. 

Pats was chopped, which was a plus for me. The sandwich was moist, roll was fresh, meat was seasoned and definitely more of the style I prefer compared to what we tried across the street. 

Id go back, but next time I plan on checking out Jim's as I heard its close to or better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Chi' wit please.  Quintessential Philly Establishment and Personnel.  Always an experience....and the Cheesesteak beats all others too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went to this place last week.  I had my first cheesesteak at Tony Luke's, but didn't review because I had no real comparison. Anyway, went there on a saturday night at around 10 ish. Waited online for about 15 minutes and when I finally got to the counter there was an old thuggish man at the cashier who mumbled my order. Just to make sure, I repeated myself and he gave me a ridiculous attitude, trying to play me like I was a teenage kid. Anyway, I stupidly said I was from NY and he started babbling about the Phillies and how the Yankees suck. He said, "We're gonna get another ring this year. One for each finger." And he stuck up his middle fingers in my face. Is that a joke? I mean I don't expect much class, but I don't expect to be given the finger while I'm trying to order dinner. I'm there for a sandwich, not to talk about your loser life and how baseball is the high point in your day. I hated the service, it was slow(er than Geno's even though the line was twice as long) and this guy just really irked me...

 I gotta say though, out of Geno's and Pat's their steaks are better. More meat, more cheese. It was pretty tasty. Not to mention their fries are nice and crispy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Iconic restaurant of american food culture, so I had to make a slight detour coming home from Washington DC to Northern NJ.  I chose Pats over Geno's because of the slightly higher online reviews.  Service was very quick as my brother jumped out of the car from the cramped streets and pulled around the corner he was back to the car within 120 seconds.  Literally.  Cheese steak with provolone was VERY greasy.  But pretty good.  I think the biggest disapointment for me was the bread it was on.  Lacked the right texture, and taste and was a bit to dense and chewy which interfered with the cheese steak peppers and onions.  There were a few other cheese steak joints that had better reviews than Pats or Genos but if I go back I get one from Geno's and one from Tony Lukes or another place, because I love me some cheese steaks and this is the home of the cheese steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak tasted like what you expected a cheesesteak to taste like. It was good, but the bread was really tough. Geno had better bread. Overall a 3.5. I've been to a better cheesesteak place in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A Philly Classic... The original owner recently passed but, the family and the rest of the crew run this philly original.  Just be careful how you order!  

Don't forget the wiz...  And you should always get it wit!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Meh, I have had better Cheese Steaks at other place in Philly than in here. I came here because it had approx. 3196 reviews at the moment of this review. So it was worth coming here to try it out. But the Cheese Steak was ok, not impressive, not bad. The meat was ok, the bread was ok...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
i was down in philly recently over the weekend last week and well i went down to both geno and pats and i have to write a review for both of them. i am not a philadelphian so i really do not know what a good philly cheese steak taste like, all i know they are better than other states cheese steak who they all try to replicate it. one thing i like about phillies philly chease steak is that there are more meat than veggies which i did not expect that which that was awesome because i had "fake" philly cheese steak where i live in colorado and colorado have less meat and more veggies. but one thing is that i am not going to compare both places because 1. i do not know what is a good philly cheese steak taste like. 2. both pats and geno are good well not good but awesome! 3. for sure when i go back down there i will buy some more from both restaurant and bring them home as well. haha.
overall if i have to pick 1 then just go to both of them because they are just across the street. if there is a line i will just wait even if it will be all day just to get both geno and pats because philly cheese steak are worth waiting for.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Of course I had to try a Philly Cheesesteak when in Philly!

Pat's was recommended to me by friends who had previously lived in Philly so of course I trusted their expertise and went with their recommendation. Take that Geno's!

There was a long line that extended onto the street intersection but it moved quickly.

I ordered my cheesesteak wit (onions) and with cheese whiz which cost me $10 cash. 

You can add peppers yourself. These are delightfully drippy, messy sandwiches. I definitely enjoyed the cheesesteak and the touristy experience!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Geno's Vs. Pat's?   Neither.  Don't go to Philly for a Philly steak. 
 Just because they invented it, doesn't mean it was great.  The 'steaks' are basically steamed.  They cook them for so long they dry out, and have to add water to them periodically.  Not to mention they use canned mushrooms and peppers.

Someone must have tasted Pat's one day, and said, 'this is bad, but has a great idea.  I can easily make this great.'  --after a few years, philly steaks were famous from someone else's doing.  Go to Jersey Mikes for a great 'philly' steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Maybe its the hype or my lack of authentic cheesesteaks back home but damn THIS WAS BOMB.  The cheese whiz hit the spot!! And the fries to.go with it bomb dot com!! The meat was also really savory and wet. Their bread was alright nothing special.    

Location? Its smack in the middle of.. philly which I probably wouldn't be caught dead there in the middle of the night.  It's pretty ghetto.  But definitely worth a try if you're in the philly area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Place is a landmark.  Service is fast.  Known all over the city as one of the best places to get a great cheesesteak.  A South Philly treasure. They are open all the time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I finally tried the traditional cheese steak, wit onions and whiz and it was pretty good. The whiz was just water by the time I got to the end of the sub. Next time I will order it wit provolone, for a more melty, gooey cheese instead of the whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There are two types of people who come here: Tourists and drunk people. The two groups are not mutually exclusive. I've many times been a part of the latter group, and from what I can remember, these are excellent cheesesteaks. Go to Jim's if you're sober. Just never go to Geno's, because they're racist.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've enjoyed steaks at plenty of random and not-so-random establishments across Philadelphia, and realized it was time to give Pat's or Geno's a try. After walking by Geno's display case of racist paraphernalia (motorcycles with "ain't scared" rebel flag decals, what I'm pretty sure was a nazi/white power teddy bear, etc. Seriously, wtf?) I opted for Pat's.

This was the crappiest cheesesteak I've ever had, which makes me wonder just how terrible Geno's must be, considering the consensus appears to be that Pat's is superior. The bread was cold and going stale, the onions were barely cooked and cold, the meat was tough and dry and the cheese (provolone) was just slapped on the roll and not warm or melted at all. I realize whiz is the gold standard but that isn't an excuse to not know your way around a slice of real cheese. Considering the hype, I was shocked at how mediocre it was. The only thing saving it from a 1-star is the cheese fries, which were hot, crispy and smothered in whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best place in town to get a cheesesteak. Geno's is a close second, but Pat's is the place. Wiz with..... amazing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A must stop if you are going through withdrawals for a true Philly Cheese steak Hoogie. Cheers
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've officially tried Pat's and Geno's side by side.  Although I've yet to do a more tightly controlled blind taste test, I have to say I like Pat's just a SMIDGE better.  I can't really tell you too well why, I feel like maybe the meat is a bit juicier and onions a bit more tasty. 

Best eaten semi-drunk at 2am.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A bit overrated maybe, but I thought it was still pretty good, and I don't even really like cheesesteaks! But if you're in Philly, you have to try it, right?? The line was very long, but moved pretty quickly. Finding a place to sit for a big group is hard to find, but it's possible. I think it's worth a try if you're in the area!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not impressed. Meat was dry, bread was cold, the provolone cheese didn't melt. What a letdown.

I guess I should have gone for the cheese whiz, but really, that's beside the point. Couldn't they make a simple10-second effort to melt the cheese with the steak on the griddle? Also, couldn't they have toasted the bread? Put it on the griddle for a few seconds to get warm, or god-forbid, get toasty?

I have no idea how that chopped up crap they call "steak" is passable to put in a sandwich and charge you $7.50 for a plain cheesesteak. And it was overly greasy.

They're also a bunch of jerks, wanting you to use some cut-up version of English to order. Great way to make your customers feel like a jackass.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was in Philly and I definitely had to do my own taste test to see who was better : Geno's or Pat's.To start with the outside of Geno's looked really,really, gaudy.Honestly, it looked like Snookie & Jwwow from Jersey Shore owned it. I think they spent more time with decorating the outside of the store than with trying to make their Cheesesteaks good.Pats is hands down the best. The bread is better bc its not chewy,the meat is juicier and I think they put more meat & cheese on their sandwiches. I went to both of them on the same day to compare & ate one after the other because I didn't want to forget what they each tasted like.At Pat's I had the Mushroom Cheesesteak add Provolone,American & onions.Afterwards,so it wouldn't mess with my taste test I added Whiz on it just because I love cheese and that's the way I wanted to eat it.Earlier at Genos I had the same thing minus the Mushrooms bc they don't have that option.I had 2 other ppl with me & the general vote was that Pat's was better.I'm sure there are better Cheesesteaks in Philly than these 2 but between these 2 Pat's is the clear winner.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simply put, the best cheesesteaks anywhere!! This is the place that started it all! Employees and staff are wonderful hard working people.Food is always great and consistent. No trip to Philadelphia would be complete without stopping here first.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is the thing I most miss about not living in the NJ/Philly area.

REAL CHEESESTEAKS.

Get it with Wiz, and you'll be in heaven.

Enough said.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Besides the underground Mom and pops (delisandros) Pats is the king. Geno's stinks bread sucks meat is smaller portioned. go to Pats tourists. don't wear Mets or Boston stuff(they will break your balls). they will break your balls and don't ask to cut in half they will tell you we don't do dat. Peppers onions wiz wit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Definitely worth the trip if you want to seem like a tourist and try Philadelphia's top 10 best. 

As many others probably know, Pats and Gino's were heavily popularized by the food channel and made appearances on multiple food networks. 

Verdict: B- 
pros
+ Very hot sandwich open 24 hours
+ Not too busy at right times
+ Wiz is strong and creamy 
+ Does not disappoint 
+ Homey atmosphere with celebrity photos littered around to keep you occupied
cons
- Located in middle of an urban neighborhood and inconvenient to travel to
- wiz and steak juice can make a mess if not cautious with bites
- it's outdoors and in Philadelphia: bring full winter gear 

Tips: Don't go in a critique, Go in starving and ready to enjoy yourself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bread: okay
Onion topping: didn't like the flavor
Cheese whiz: yummy!
American cheese: yummy!
Steak: very good

I prefer with american cheese b/c it's not so runny and messy.  The cheese does a great job of accentuating the flavor of the steak.  I personally think the cheese whiz kind of masks the other flavors.  But Pat's cheese whiz does taste less salty than Geno's.  Do they use different brands?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Prices are high and the bread is stale. Staff try to make it a nice experience but the food leaves more to be desired. Novel they are for being the first to make a cheesesteak. But they could at least rely on more than their name to hold value.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A great institution and a must-eat when coming into town for a ballgame. The first bite isn't nearly as good as the last, when the flavors seep into the bun, but that's part of the experience. Always go to either Geno's or Pat's (or both!)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not as good as it was many years ago. Cheese fries are still decent, bu when I want a GOOD Cheese steak I go to Steve's now. It's a shame but they just can't hold a flame to the way they used to be.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Once again, not sure what the hype is. I'm a foodie, and I know good food when I taste it. Liked it better than Genos, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it again. I think Jims is the best I've tried yet. Can't wait to eat another one soon. South street here I come.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Years ago, I went to Philly, but only had a cheesesteak from a cart that wasn't very good. I dreamed of going back to have a real cheesesteak. And I did. And it was everything I dreamed of. The ordering was not very complicated (One wiz wid). Have the cash ready. I highly recommend those blackened peppers-full of flavor and the heat is not at all unbearable.

Usually, things that you build up in your mind end up disappointing you. Well, this place did not disappoint me ONE BIT. Happy camper.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Genos for sure but they are very different so it's all about preference. I enjoy this place every time I'm here. The fries with cheese are also really good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's IS the quintessential cheesesteak joint in Philly.

Whenever one of my friends even utters the word "Pat's" I usually just put my shoes on because we're going. We've gotten to the point where we'll just look at each other and say, "You know where we SHOULD go..."

Winter, summer, spring, or fall - it is my understanding this place is open 24/7. No questions asked. There's usually a line at 3:00 a.m. and my brother bought one at 8:30 a.m. once on his way to a business meeting. Yummy any time of day. 

Geno's is across the street, and they apparently make a very similar steak, but I refuse to eat one. The line at Pat's is always longer, so that must mean it's better, right? We've dubbed Geno's "The Circus" due to their over zealous neon lights. It's ridiculous, actually.

There's a homeless guy who wonders around Pat's cleaning up and giving people napkins if they need them. He's awesome. We usually give him a couple bucks. Don't be nervous. He's polite and friendly.

The steaks:

Order a heart attack. It's Whiz, provolone and American cheeses. It's delicious. The rolls are on the softer side, and the cheese and grease will drip so exercise caution. 

My friend always orders a "pizza pepper with" that has hot peppers and pizza sauce. He loves it. They have a few specialty steaks like that one on the menu, but you should really go with something standard like a "whiz with" for your first time.

Steaks are like $6 or $7 these days. 

My brother decided he was going to eat five heart attacks in one sitting. It was December. I left after he put three down because I was freezing my ass off. (The seating is all outside.) He ate five, didn't swallow the last bite til he was going over the Ben Franklin Bridge. I don't think he returned for over one year.

The cheese fries are bangin'. Order EXTRA cheese fries and get the "swimmers" at the bottom using a fork. So much cheese. So much delicious.

After years of Coke products, they recently switched to Pepsi. I was sorta upset but I'm over it now. They still have a good variety of sodas to choose from. You can bring your own bottle of water or something. No big deal. Be discreet if you are drinking alcohol. I'm pretty sure it's illegal. 

Bottom line, Pat's is the place you should go if you are from out of town and want to get the "Philly cheesesteak" experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good cheesesteak.  I got mine wit-out.  Generous wit the Whiz too.  Came in from LA and I'm doing the challenge.  On my way across the street to try Geno's now.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I do not understand why this place has so much hype.  I can only assume the majority of it is generated to attract tourists, because I feel like people who have lived in Philly for more than 6 months know that there are much better cheesesteaks available.  I was let down the first time I went, but I went back a second time hoping it would be better.  Again, I had a negative experience.  The staff was unpleasant and rushed both me and my boyfriend (FYI, they were not busy either time that we went).  The food is grossly overpriced, especially considering the quality.  I paid close to $30 for two cheesesteaks, a small fry--and I mean small, and a small drink for the two of us to split.  Both my boyfriend and I got sick that night--probably because the cheesesteaks were DRIPPING with grease.  I understand that cheesesteaks are not the equivalent of a salad, but the amount of grease really turned me off.  Do yourself a favor and go to Jim's Steaks instead.  There are multiple locations but I love the food at the South St. restaurant.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Sure, Pat's is the home of the Philly Cheese Steak but it's important to recognize that with iteration comes development. To me, there are many other places that are superior to Pat's. 

To start with, the service sucks. But I guess that's part of the experience, and shouldn't be a negative point. 

The meat is not cut at all, so its very lumpy and chewie. Often while you eat it large portions of the meat come out, leaving an uneven sandwich. What's more, the meat is EXTREMELY greasy. This sandwich has the most oil / grease than any of the competitors. To the point where it's just gross. You can't even hold it as a sandwich because fat drippings will slide down your arm; and if you go in the winter, that fat instantly solidifies. GROSS.

The bread is often a little stale, and when combined with the meat makes one hard sandwich to chew through. 

The one good note is that the cheese fries are phenomenal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is better than Geno's. There, I said it. Still, I can't get too excited about a cheesesteak. You have to go if you're in Philly, just for the experience, but that's all.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After a disappointing exp. at Geno's, my friend and I walked across the street to Pats.  Pat's didn't have any of the flash that Geno's has, but when they presented us our steak, mushroom and whiz sandwich, we knew we were in for a treat.

Most townies told us that the best Philly Cheesesteaks are at the small, mom and pop joints, but for us, this was good enough.  The steak was overflowing from the sandwich, and call me crazy, but that cheez whiz really hit the spot on that sandwich.  In addition to the sandwich, we got some cheeze friez and a drink (like the excessive use of Z?  Zure you do).

Overall- While I'm sure there are better Cheese steak places in Philly, by comparison to the other place across the street, this place gets the higher ranking.  Go Pats (the sandwich place, not the football team)!

Chuck Norris Rating- Ridge Hand.... to the face!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrated! Jim's Steaks in West Philly and Tony Luke's are waaay better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Obligatory review of this place. Super fast no matter the line. $10 for a quick sandwich that you'll enjoy no matter what. Even if you're a vegetarian.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
How can there even be a question, the original is always the best. Pats is the king of steaks. 
Stop looking.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Whenever I'm craving for cheese steak, Pat's always come into my mind. Their cheese steak is delicious even though it's a bit pricy but totally worth the price. Thumbs up
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had a "Whiz Wit" and liked it better than Geno's. Their hot sauce is NOT hot at all. 
OK, and here's my verdict. As far as "Philly Cheesesteaks" go, this was probably the best one I've had, but definitely not by leaps and bounds. The crispy bread was real nice, and the warm sandwich in the cold wind was very pleasant. 

However, I've had "Deluxe Cheesesteaks" here in Chicago that I like better, I guess it's more of the style than anything. It's like a Philly but with cooked peppers and mushrooms too. Drip some buffalo sauce on it and it's amazing!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap cheesesteaks but with lots of character -- convenient location to the Italian Market and that its open like 24/7. Take out-of-towners here, but you know the real locals go to John's Roast Pork, Tony Lukes, Dalessandro's, etc.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I would choose Pat's over Geno's, which is right across the street. But ultimately, I would choose Max's, which is in north Philly. For this review I'll just focus on Pat's compared to Geno's. 

Pat's:
Sandwiches are $1 more expensive than Geno's
Bread requires more chewing than Geno's
Meat is in shredded pieces 
Sandwich seems to have a lot more meat than Geno's
Meat has slightly more seasoning than Geno's

Geno's: 
Sandwiches are $1 cheaper than Pat's
Bread is softer than Pat's 
Meat is in slices rather than shredded pieces

Parking here is horrendous so I recommend arriving during mid afternoon or some time that's not peak meal time. 

Also, get provolone cheese. Please don't get cheese whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The only reason to go to this place is because of tourism. The cheese steaks are always soggy and over greased. honestly there are a bunch of other places that you can go to if you really want a cheese steak. Just go here to take your picture and leave, don't go for the food. The only reason why I didn't give it one star is because I realize that it has been around forever and is kind of a staple. But realize that because it has been around forever the quality is not the same as it used to be.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philly cheese steak is a must to try in philly. The food is pretty good, i love the cheese taste
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  The cheesesteak (wit whiz) was spectacular and totally worth the trip.  For traveling foodies, hit this place up and do not miss it. Ok, the staff is a little curt.  That's fine. So are the great asian restaurants I go to and both staffs speak about the same amount of english (that I can understand, at least)

Why not go to Geno's?  Well, I don't like supporting allegedly racist proprietors (and when most of the brown people around you confirm it, I trust their opinions rather than the lighter skinned brethren that say the brown folk are crazy).

If I were to live in Philly, I'd prolly discover another joint that served up a better cheese steak.  But I don't.  And it's still totally worth it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Phenomenal    Mmmmmm....
Every bite was perfection...perfectly melted provolone with onions.  The steak itself was solid.  It was just right for this sandwich goodness.  
The staff behind the windows were surly on Sunday evening around 10pm.   But the fella sweeping outside in the cold/advising where us to park was smiling, friendly and funny.  
If Stallone thought it was worth including in Rocky, it must be good. 
Disclaimer: I have not compared to Geno's. I've had many cheesteaks in my time but this was my first official - in Philly - Philly cheesteak  And I gotta say, it completely lived up to the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You can get a better cheesesteak literally anywhere else in the city (except for the place next door, it's equally bad).  Those dirty  little carts in Center City have better food than this.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's used to be my favorite cheesesteak place in highschool.  Three weeks ago I returned to get a cheesesteak after about 10 years of not being here and was pretty dissappointed.  Both Pat's and Geno's quality declined.  Geno's bread was good but that was about it.  Pat's cheesesteak however, didn't really taste that good at all and the cheesefries looked skimpy with barely any fries and/or cheese.  The meat in the cheesesteak was lacking.  Not sure what happened but the quality has declined.  Hopefully, things will improve.  Tony Lukes was better but I still need to try Jim's steaks - can't wait.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've been here about 2-3 times. I've never been across the street to Geno's for obvious reasons. The service sucks at Pat's but I think the workers play into that. Yes, this is a bit of a tourist trap but the cheese-steaks are good! You gotta order it with grilled onions and whiz!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So, I just moved to the area and was driving through the middle of Philly yesterday for the first time. I'd finished what I was there for, hadn't eaten a thing yet, and figured I might as well try a cheesesteak. 

Of course I've heard of Pat's and Geno's, so that was where I gravitated towards. In retrospect, I should have just pulled over, got on Yelp and checked some of the many helpful cheesesteak lists...but no. My belly's impatience pretty much dictated when and where I'd be eating, and as I happened upon a parking spot across from Pat's, that was place.

I hit the bar across the street for some cash (was tempted to get more than just cash there, but was being responsible), strolled back and ordered two pepper cheesesteaks (one to bring home for the fam), handed over $20, and was promptly handed two sammys. Sat down to eat...

...and was not impressed. The roll was so-so, the steak & peppers weren't very flavorful (steak seemed to lack much seasoning at all), and the "cheese" was sorta gummy and sticking to my teeth. I'm going with two stars here, because "Meh. I've experienced better."...is pretty much spot on. And at $10 per, the value equation wasn't quite there for me. But hey, I did it...and I'll probably do Geno's at some point and probably have a very similar experience, and that's just fine and dandy. 

I will say this, however...my 10 year old daughter, who calls herself a carnitarian, certainly enjoyed hers last night after it came of the panini grill. I'm thinking I may have enjoyed mine a little more that way, too, crisping up that roll and giving it some crunch. As for the "King of Steaks" title, though...I'm thinking something along the lines of "Esquire of Steaks" may be a little more appropriate.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I promised the hubby I would get a legit cheese steak while in Philly, cheese wiz and all. Disappointed doesn't really even begin to describe my experience. The meat was super chewy, chopped in chunks as opposed to thinly sliced, and tasted more like gamey lamb. The bread was definitely not fresh, at least a couple days old. I was sick for 24 hours after eating only half of the sandwich. My mom is still not feeling well 3 days later. I would definitely avoid this place. Only good part of the experience were the hot peppers. Now those were 5 star worthy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
MY FAVORITE IN PHILLY
"This was my favorite cheesesteak of the trip (see all listed below). Yes, it was greasy.. THAT'S THE POINT. I got the whiz with onions and it was fantastic. The thing I liked best about Pat's was that they put the whiz ON TOP. All of the others I had they put the whiz on the bun and then add the meat. WIth the cheese on the top, it sinks in all of the meat and you get some in every bite.. ooey cheesey-meaty goodness. We must have lucked out because we got a table and only 4 people in line in front of us on a Sunday at noon (November). 

My Favorite Cheesesteaks in order: 
1. Pat's 
2. Jim's Steaks 
3. Geno's 
4. Campo's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'll never get a cheesesteak anywhere else! My personal favorite is a mushroom pepper whiz wit. Can't go wrong. But I recently tried the mushroom pizza provi wit and was not disappointed! I look forward to coming here anytime I'm in Philly! Better not get your order wrong or "No soup for you!", in this case cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is over rated. I went there with my brother and his friends. The head worker was rude and rushing us and yelling inappropriately. There was no need for that. The steak was par at best. But this is better than Geno's across the street. I would find another steakhouse on south street instead.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes it's a tourist trap which is expected and fine but if you're going to be catering to tourists at least have a second thought about customer service and the way you're business is portrayed. On top of that the cheese steak I ordered was very average tasting, cold meat and the bread was stale.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I think there's a lot of hype about this place because it's such a Philly landmark. I got the cheesesteak with mushrooms and peppers. Not super amazing but pretty good! The fries on the other hand are amazing but expensive
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ehhh it's all hype or maybe my taste buds are more refined. Had the steak mushroom wiz witout. Meat bland cheese wiz as good as I remember as a kid. Might be good after a night of exploring the bars.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Pats today with my wife and not was it only a great cheese steak they noticed I was in my uniform so because I am active duty military everything was on the house!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Speedy service, tailored to your liking - & very filling. I recommend sharing a order of fries cause good lord one sub will put you to sleep like grandmas good food. If you're in town, you have to try it out. They lost a star from me cause the steak lacked some flavor in my opinion, but my taste buds may be altered due to years of Sazon haha
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Maybe Philly has a reputation for being rough around the edges.

Maybe I'm being a sensitive wussy, but the cashier cussed at me when I failed to order correctly, "come on man, you're f*cking up my line"

The line was not even long and the cheesesteak didn't even taste great.  
If they're so dead set on getting the order right, they should make a touch screen ordering system to minimize the confusion.

They'd surely have a shorter line if it usually was long since your cashiers are now helping with the cooking.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is food for poor people who can not afford a real meal. Avoid it at all costs. It may have been symbolic of Philly at one point in time or an iconic tourist spot, but today it is neither of these. Today, it is a cesspool of the worst food you will ever find in this city.

This is NOT the only place to get an authentic philly cheesesteak. It is however one of the dirtiest most ghetto places in the city that simply reeks of filth 24/7. The food is sickening and tastes like it was cooked over a sewer vent on the street. I wouldn't be surprised if that's actually what they're using. 

Again- stop going here. It has nothing to do with Philly anymore. It is absolutely disgusting and you WILL waste your money by being here.

If you don't believe me just ask any random person on the street who has lived in Philly for more than a year.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
1. despite being toothless, the man taking my order had one of those friendly, unpretentious smiles that I could totally get down with
2. never liked cheeze whiz... until I ate it on a Pat's sandwich
3. please note the lack of neon lights on this establishment
4. now note the douchebaggery going on over at Geno's
5. the paperbags are waxed - PURE GENIUS - don't wanna risk that delicious sandwich greasing it way out of a weakened corner
6. meat is well seasoned without being oversalted, even when combined with aforementioned cheeze whiz
7. the bread is pretty damn good

all in all, A++ would eat again
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wow! All I can say is wow, they are what a cheese steak should be! I know their is a war on who's better, genos or pats. Key me tell you it's Genos! I tried both and hands down, from the cheese to the juices coming down my cheek it's fantastic! If your in Philly you have to go to Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 2nd time there, once as a guest and now with the family. Average at best, but worth going to experience. Be ready to order, sub fries and drink will be 15.00, be ready to pay.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tasty cheesesteak but I've had better and for a lot less. $10 for a 6 inch steak is ridiculous. Tourist trap. Try a mom and pop place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best thing on the menu is there French fries. This Philly cheese steak crap is disgusting!!!! Over priced processed meat with salty disgusting cheese.  So mad I had to spend my money on this crap!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If I could rate it lower I would.  This was my first time there.  I ordered a pizza steak (which means they added pizza sauce) with American cheese, onions and mushrooms.  Steak was very low quality and too thickly cut and it wasn't even warm enough to melt the cheese.  The sauce was runny and tasteless - so runny, in fact that the juice ran everywhere over the paper they give you and spilled out all over my shirt.  Roll, too, was tasteless.  
I will say their service was very efficient.  
I will never eat there again and would not recommend anyone do so, either.  There are far better Philly cheesesteaks elsewhere!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheese steak was ok. Dont see what the big deal for this place is. Very over priced and bland. Better cheesesteaks in jersey.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I gave my cousin and girlfriend the whole Philly cheesesteak experience. They ordered their steaks with everything on it. To them it was subpar.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
No. No. and No.
This place is great for drunk food because everything is good when you are drunk. I feel bad for tourists that Pats and Genos are known for their cheesesteaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Best! Cheesesteak! EVEEEEEER!

Never had Geno's, and don't plan to. Pat's is the best tasting thing you can eat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went there against our better judgement for nostalia's sake....what a waste of time, money and empty calories....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: oh man i love pats cheesesteaks they're amazing. i drove up to philly from maryland with a couple of friends for this and after the 2 1/2 hour drive we got to pats and man it was worth it. the meat is so good and the peppers they have compliment it very well along with their other sauce. the service that i and my friends received was simply outstanding along with how quickly our food came (it was almost instant) every one should defidently try one of these things before they die its a MUST!!! I plan on coming back soon with more of my friends :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to have a cheese steak from Philadelphia! So we stopped here and it was delicious! We were gonna share half and half but we each ended getting our own! They make it so fast! It's so convenient and so worth it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Long line. Bland cheese steak. Costly for what it is. Overpriced. Over hyped. But ya gotta go  at least once right? right? I give the food 1 star and the legend 4 stars
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We went late Friday night. They were super fast and friendly. They definitely made it evident that there was a rivalry with Gino's. But a great experience and delicious cheese steak with peppers onions and provolone!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yup it's good and fun to visit the south side of town to eat at Pat's and Gino's.  Quite frankly the best thing that happened to Pat's was Gino's and vise versa.  Make sure you know how to order...one whiz with = a steak sandwich with cheez and grilled onions.  That's the real way to do it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've tried Geno's cheese steak across the street and when I finally got to try Pat's, I could definitely tell the difference. They have many condiments to choose from and you cannot go wrong with any of them. It is a place to go to after a night of partying. They are open 24/7 so whenever you're hungry, this is the place to go to for a quick grub.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The guy taking the orders for the steak was very rude, he was a jerk, when i called he hung up on me before even i finished sentence. And i was calling because i forgot something on one of the tables. 
But to be fare, they have one of the best cheesesteak sandwiches i ever had!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Being a native to the suburban area...it was always Pat's.  I've learned my lesson.  I found others that blow it away from the meat, to the cheese, to the bread.  The one thing that is the stigma is the price.  $9!  Nine freaking dollars for a cheesesteak!  Shame!  Good bye Pat's.  Thanks for the memories.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It is true that many of the lesser known cheese steak joints in the city can be superior... I still enjoy a drive into South Philly to Pats. I have lived in the Philly area for 8 years and I have done the Pats vs Gino's test a few times and Pat's has won my vote each time.

Delicious meat, not over-shredded, fresh bread that is firm but fresh and soft inside.

A true treat!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Terrible, Terrible, Terrible! Bad service (not that I was expecting top notch), horrible cheesesteaks (YUCK!) and is no comparison to Tony Lukes. Nuff said.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you go to Pat's go with a friend and split the cheese steak and go to Geno's and see which you like better. It's a religious war, but I fall in the Pat's is better camp!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had Geno's so I had to have Pat's too.  The service is not the most friendly but for as many 'steaks as they have serve a day you can see why they want to keep it moving.  The meat is sliced perfectly.  I ordered a wiz without and was impressed with how well together the cheesesteak stayed together with the wiz.  The biggest knock on Pat's for me was the bread.  It was a lot harder then I was hoping for.  Other than that a great cheesesteak!  Definitely would recommend trying.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Ginos because the bread is better.   But I think Tony Luke's is better than Pat's.  I am sure there are better ones in Philly but I wasn't fat enough to eat 4 in one night.  3 was all I could handle.  lame
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Slightly better than Geno's across the street. 

Meat seems to be of marginally better quality here and sliced in longer thinner strips which I prefer. Everything else I found to be nearly identical to Geno's.

Also, the staff was a lot nicer than at Geno's. Those guys at Geno's are hardcore dickheads. Yeah I said it, dickheads. You got a problem with that?

Finally, there is a scene in Rocky where Sylvester Stallone is chilling here. In fact, there is a engraving in the cement block signifying the exact spot he stood at in the movie! I rented Rocky just to see this scene. And it was well worth it! Take that Geno's! BOO-YA!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Also Overhyped just like Genos. I tried Pat's and Geno's both and Pat's had more meat on the cheesesteak compared to Geno's and the onions were slightly more cooked but still relatively crunchy/raw. Philly tourist stop but definitely not worth it for $10 a cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Super lecker. Leider war es etwas kalt und regnerisch und man kann nur draußen sitzen.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's vs Geno's, definitely Pat's but I think Subway has a better cheese steak than these two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wow, this place is busy, busy, busy.  I would hate to live in the area.  Parking and traffic are bad.  Service is super fast, but the line for food is confusing with one line for sandwiches and another line for everything else.  We weren't very impressed with the Philly Cheese Steak, but when in Philly, you have to have one.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteaks are pats are great! Meats is soft and tender, bread has just the right strength to hold all the juices and has a good bite to it. Only thing I'd say is parking can be a pain, and sometimes the peppers can be a little suspicious just because it's in a can outside in a self serve stand. Other than that it's delicious.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious cheesesteaks.  Get it with onions and provolone with a side of peppers picante! Try to stop by during the week when lines are not so crazy long.  I love cheesesteaks but I refuse to wait behind more than 5-10 ppl.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
While in Philadelphia for New Year's my boyfriend and I decided to do the taste test.  We began at Geno's and ended at Pat's.  Overall, I was not impressed with Pat's.  

I ordered a "Whiz Wit".  They give you more "whiz" than Geno's but the bun wasn't that impressive, the meat was rubbery and a bit tasteless to me, and the onions tasted and felt very strange.  I couldn't finish my sandwich, which is a first because I'm definitely an eater but I couldn't stomach or bring myself to swallow anything so bland with such a strange aftertaste.  I definitely did not think it was worth the $7.50 paid.

The atmosphere was friendly and amusing and they were definitely quick with the order but I know when I return I'll just stick with Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not the very best cheese steak in the world. It's just a place for a quick bit late at night. They open 24 hrs for this that are coming from the clubs. Try it if you must.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great cheese steak! Dove to Philly with my dad and brother just to compare pats and Genos cheese steak and Pats def won!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For the amount of publicity that Phily cheese steaks get, you'd think the flavor would be on par with the fish from Tsukiji Fish Market or something.  It is sadly not even close.  

I ordered the famous "whiz wit" and it was amazingly bland and lifeless.  there just wasn't anything to it.  If the king of steaks comes up with this, I'm happy being a pauper.  

to top it all off, the fries were greasy and overall, it was expensive.  With more bun than meat, paying $9 for the sammich really didn't provide anything worth noting, except in a meh review on yelp.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I tried Tony Lukes and Gino's...then Pat's.  Pat's kicks ass.  Any time I am in Philadelphia, Pat's is a must !!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came out to philly my first time and the first cheesesteak "jawn" I tried was pats. Wasn't really too impressed. They're pretty rude but everyone was sayin that's just how people are in philly so whatever. Place is really touristy, all outdoor seating but it's pretty limited. The cheese steak was aight at best
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I feel like this is one of those places that people go to more because its iconic rather than super tasty. The line was super long which makes you expect it to be amazing, so when its not your annoyed that you wanted so long and that it wasnt as delicious as the line would make one think. Dont get me wrong the cheese-steaks are not horrible but I would never imagine a line to be that long for some bland steak and cheesy sandwich. 
I think go to say you've gone, but dont expect too much people you may be let down.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I did not care for this place.

Gristly meat. Chewy bread. American cheese added almost as an afterthought (not melted on the meat, just kind of falling off, like cheese you buy at the grocery store that is close to its expiration date so it starts to get crumbly and falls apart). 

Maybe my boyfriend and I offended the delicate sensibilities of the staff by asking for a side of hot pepp--

"THEY'RE BACK THERE. YOUS CAN HELP YOURSELF."

Well. Thanks. Gentlewoman.

I guess a whole hot pepper works, but how do I put this on my sandwich? Do I bite off little pieces and spit them onto my hoagie? Do I take a bite of the cheesesteak and then a bite of the pepper while my mouth is still full of meat gristle and stale bread? Or do I just throw it all out and go somewhere else to eat?

Turns out, the latter was the best option. 

Unfortunately, before we learned our lesson, we had to part ways with $20 for one cheesesteak, one soda, and the ATM fees for this cash-only place ($15 for the food, $5 for the exorbitant ATM fees not associated with this place).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What can I say that probably hasn't already been said?   If theres a better place to get a cheesesteak, I'm game to try it.  Better than any deli, corner store, high end restaurant, Jims steaks on south street, or anything else I have ever had (haven't had Genos yet either).  

But it comes at a price too.  This is a tourist trap, they know people will pay what it costs.  Exactly how much that is?  It's close to $20 per person to eat here.  I took my friend from Baltimore here late night, we got 2 steaks wiz wit, about $11 each, 2 cheese fries (massive portion btw) almost $6 each, 2 bottles of water probably $5 for both.  So with tax its about $37-38.  Totally worth it, just a once in while type-of thing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I just went there today.  Line was in street, but closer to sidewalk corner on the diagonal.  Took about 5-10 minutes to finally get food.  Once ordered, took about 30 seconds to get.  I got a mushroom pepper cheesesteak wit onions.  

I had genos after and I must say the addition of the peppers and mushrooms made the sandwich better than genos.  Otherwise they're about the same.  I gotta say I think the cheesesteaks in Raleigh, NC at Phillys are tastier and better IMHO, but these originals were not that bad.

The only real complaint was that its CASH ONLY and that fact wasn't really obvious until you got to the counter.  Perhaps not enough tables either.  Too many tourists coming there and hogging tables for far long after they're done eating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What is to say that hasn't already been said really... I've been here twice both times in the Winter.  Bring a jacket as all seating is outside.  Pat's is my fave in the Pat's Vs. Geno's war.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I mean what person from Philly hasn't been here because it's open all hours of the night, however it's the worst. 

The cheese steak comes to you quick but the cheese is not melted and the meat is cold. 

Everyone from Philly knows this place is for tourists, I'll go to one of my many other favorites around and skip Pat's and Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Definitely can feel the rivalry between here and Genos, which is just a stone throw away. Big deciding factor was the shorter line and Geno's flashing lights just wasnt calling out to me.
The wait was alright, moved at a good pace. 
One "beef" with this place was one of the servers gave us some uncalled for attitude for ordering pizza fries (I find out later, thats part of the Pat's charm). Shrug
I ordered the pepper mushroom cheesesteak. The meat was good but not filling nor amazing. The rolls werent great, thought they should be thicker. Main thing i liked was the cheese whiz? 
Pizza fries... no worth it, had small meat bits, wtf. for $6
Doesnt live up to the hype and I've had better at bars where you can even order beer (like Lickity Splits) and get better service
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As many do, we opted for a taste test between Pat's and Geno's.  

Pros:
*The bread was definitely superior.
*We preferred the onions being cooked on the flattop
*The atmosphere was more old school.

Cons:
*Found the meat to be flavorful but dry.
*Wiz not as flavorful

So, what was our verdict? For a true original and Philly experience, Pat's is the way to go!

Enjoy the Ride,
Baker and Biker Monkey
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fantastic! Both places are really great! You cant go wrong at either cheese steak place. Be sure you know what you want prior to getting to the window to order!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Obviously we came because it is a must do when you visit Philly. The line wasn't that long, we probably only waited 5 minutes. Typical philly cheesesteak menu. I opted for a mushroom and onion cheesesteak with provolone - $10. Their bread seems to get soaked and soggy by the time you dig into it. I do like how they cut their meat better than the competition across the street though.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Still may favorite in Philly.  Sorry, Geno's, Tony Luke's and Jim's.  Pat's is the best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you're reading this review, this is a comparison (and the same review for Pat's Steaks, Ishkabibbles, Jim's Steaks, and Geno's).  

I came to Philly with, what I believe are, pretty realistic expectations regarding cheesesteaks.  Yes, I knew coming into it that Genos and Pats were tourist traps and that their might be better cheesesteaks elsewhere throughout Philadelphia.  But at the end of the day, after trying four different places, a cheesesteak is a cheesesteak and it didn't really live up to the hype at all.  With that said, and amongst the 4 places, I would have to rank these in the following order:

1) Jim's Steaks (3 stars):  Best place to sit and eat. They had the largest dining area with an upstairs area.  It was not air conditioned though.  As for the cheesesteaks, it was the best in terms of flavor, service, bread consistency. Bread wasn't too chewy or hard.I had it prov/wit (provolone cheese and onions) and mushrooms.  Better service than Geno's and Pats.

2)  Ishkabibbles (solid 2.5 stars, maybe 3):  Very comparable to Jim's but there's absolutely no where to sit with the exception of 6 barstools.   The gremlin drink is overrated too...but I had to try it.  I had it wiz/wit (cheese wiz and onions) and mushrooms.  Better service than Geno's and Pats.
