3)  Geno's (1.5 stars due to lack of smiles/service, but I'll round up to 2 for the hype and flourescent lights):  I like the bread but the meat was pretty flavorless.  Meat was in big slices and not chopped up.  I had it both with wiz/wit (cheese wiz and onions) and prov/wit (provolone chesse and onions).  This was, by the way, the first place I tried.  They have outdoor seating so if it's cold, it's not the best place to eat there.  

4)  Pat's (solid 1.5 stars.  I won't round up to 2 since it's the least favorite of the four places):  The bread is softer and the meat definitely had more flavor than Geno's. The meat was chopped up.  BUT it was sooooo greasy that it gave me an upset stomach.  I had it with prov/wit (provolone cheese and onions).  They also have outdoor seating only.  

All in all, and if I'm in Philly again, I'm going to try Tony Luke's, Campos, Dalessandro's, and maybe a street vendor next time.  

BOTTOM LINE:  Skip the hype at Genos and Pats.  One of them may have started the cheesesteak craze, but the other establishments have made it better. It's time for Genos and Pats to catch up to the 21st century.  Word of advice to Genos and Pats:  SMILE and appreciate your customers!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is horrible & I won't waste too much time on a review. Bland, practically tasteless steak & rude staff. The fact that this place receives any national attention and people come here expecting an acceptable cheesesteak really disappoints me. A tourist trap & nothing more. If you know Philly you know the best steaks are in the Northeast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's and Geno's have good steaks, both owners do a lot for the city, and they are nationally known... If you only have a few days in Philly, try both places.... If you live around the area, there are better options.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A great "cheesy" spot in the 'hood of South Philly adjacent to a little ballpark (which would be uber sketchy if not well-lit) and near another great spot, Geno's.  However, Pat's is historic because a scene from Rocky was filmed there (look for the plaque) and they are notoriously strict on ordering etiquette.  If you don't do it smoothly, firmly & quickly, they'll send your ass all the way back to the end of the line.  This can make for one nervous-as-hell-slightly-inebriated visitor who is in dire need of midnight munchies.  So, during the long wait I struggled with "Whiz wit... or was it wit Whiz... well, that makes more sense... but wait...oh shit!" because, before I knew it,  I was at the head of the line and some big guy was yelling at me in a thick Philly accent so I blurted out the first thing I could think of... and I guess it was the right one because they served me up a pipin' hot steak'o'cheese!!  I can't really tell which one is better in PHL... Jim's was pretty damn good with a great location but a monstrosity of a line... yet Pat's is worth the trek into the 'hood just for experience's sake.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great Philly experience.  A fun splurge if you are visiting, but I wouldn't be a regular if I lived there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
All of my expectations were met or exceeded during my first ever visit to Pat's! Why my 5 star rating... the fact that you're reading this means you are "looking before you leap". Therein lies the key to YOUR positive experience with Pat's! More than any restaurant I've ever visited, I studied up on Pat's before I came. To thoroughly enjoy this unique cultural experience I needed to get the following expectations set:
- Parking - you're in downtown South Philly, it's street parking, no parking meters (it's free), plan to drive around side streets for a while within 2 or 3 blocks, practice parallel parking, don't drive your Bentley (although I saw one)
- Before you get in line - Know the sandwich menu, know what sandwiches your party wants, and what options on each sandwich (drinks and fries are ordered at a separate window). Nobody, (Pat's or customers) will tolerate you deciding at the counter. 
- Order like a local - optional, but highly recommended... while I fully expected to fumble this one, I found that the instructions worked flawlessly which I found through a Google search "how to order at pat's king of steaks"!
- Cash only - the prices are not low. Since you already know the menu, and know what you're getting (right?), have cash ready (at each window)
- Seating - it's all outdoors, under awnings, at picnic tables, right in the ambience of a busy city street, you might have to wait for a table to vacate 
- Appearance of food - let's just say, a paper wrapped cheese steak that was assembled in less than 5 seconds is, ummm, less than photogenic (see photo of my sandwich saying "cheese!")
- Diving in - the rolls, oh that first bite, those glorious chewy rolls, the culinary fireworks display of flavors and textures and aroma! It was worth the studying, the driving, the parking, the walking, the waiting, and the price! Wow, just wow!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
where do i begin...

the employees work on a fast pace so you have to order quick and correct. seriously you will get your fresh cheese steak in 5 seconds.

once i recieved my super fast cheese steak i sat down and took my very first bite.....oh my gosh!!! it was soo delicious!!! 

soft toasted bread, the jucy meat with dripping flavor, the cheeze wiz, everything.....was to perfection.....

i must say that this is indeed the best cheese steak sandwich i have tired...kudos to pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's or Geno's? Totally Pat's if that's the choice. Cheesesteak with whiz and onions; nice amount of all three and a tasty sandwich. Sunday morning there's not a line; great breakfast idea. Not worth waiting in line for though; other places do it better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Living in many different areas, it's nice to comeback to real cheesesteaks. These are the best cheesesteaks i have ever had! No one compares! Some people would say they are expensive but paying 14.00 for a cheesesteak in cali is expensive. I have heard that this place has been offered different services that would be cheaper for them but they will not change service or vendors if it compromises there product. Thank you for sticking to your high level of quality.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good, not as racist as Geno's. In comparison to Geno's it's greasier and less salty. So it's up to you which of the dueling Philly Cheesesteaks you want to get. I prefer to get Cheesesteaks elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is definitely the best place for Philly cheese steak. We went to Geno's before and it was a disappointment. Pats was great the bread was fresh and the steak juicy. And they have great selection in chooses when it come to cheese steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
LOVED that they had a sign with directions of how to order a cheesesteak for tourists. My friends and I partook in this Pat's and  Geno's cheesesteak challenge. Between the two, I'd have to say Pat's won it for me.  The meat was seasoned much better and chopped up more (which is how I like it), but the onions were more on the raw side. I left the intersection feeling unsatisfied on this quest to try a real Philly cheesesteak. 

If you get a chance and are searching for really good cheesesteak, try Jim's Steaks on South St. I enjoyed it MUCH better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fast service hot food but I was expecting a better cheese stake  meat needs more flavor cheese wiz was good . I like to have the same flavor all through my sandwich
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good cheesesteak, classic Philly experience. I like Geno's better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Way over priced, unfriendly service, and the meat was a little dry and lacked flavor. Kind of a tourist trap. Kind of fun if you're a tourist ;)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overrated, i dont think locals go here

Just plain does not taste that good, beef is a little thick, slightly tough, and lacks flavor, rather than thin and tasty - not impressed at all. Provolene cheese is fine.

There was a line but itmoves decently fast

For the price and the hype, this was not terrible but it was certainlh disappointing, i dont plan on returning. 

I do think its worth visiting once just to ssy youve been there.

Pats is slightly better than genos due to meat quality.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simply amazing. I came here still tipsy after a Flyers game at the Wells Fargo Center after they handed the Buffalo Sabres an appropriate beatdown. I got one with wiz and grilled onions, and another with provolone. Both were delicious but I LOVED the wiz/wit one. But just saying their provolone cheese was rich with flavor, so so good. Recommend trying both. Would go back after every Flyers game. I plan to make this a tradition. Beer. Flyers. Pat's. You cannot do better. Also: the cheese fries were so hot and delicious. You should get some with your steak. Staff was friendly too but I was so focused on my sandwich and fries on the walk back to the car. What a night.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The hype happens to be just that- hype. I went to Pat's for the first time last night as part of a graduation party. Their menu style is the hack, no-bullshit, cash only, if you don't know what you want, then leave type. Very assholelish, but whatever. I ordered  a mushroom pepper cheesesteak (explicit name of menu item) wit it  (aka with onions- this is a menu rule), and I said cheese wiz, please to clarify. They placed my steak on the counter: it was steak and cheese only. I stood there thinking it wasn't mine, but was told it was mine. The only thing they got right was the cheese. No onions, no pepper, no mushrooms. They were an upcharge btw. I notified the guy at the register (seemed to be owner/manager) and he told me that they were on there. I took the steak and fingered through  it. Nothing was  there. They finally added my toppings after bothering them enough. Terrible place. Overpriced ($11 total). Please don't go. They fooled me once; never again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have only heard stories about Pat's from my girlfriend who lived in Philly while going to grad school, so on our visit through Philly, we went.  I was very interested in trying this "hype."  So, we tried the original cheese steak with onions and whiz.

As I was in line at Pat's, my girlfriend was in line at Geno's across the street.  We both waited in line and met about the same time.  What I could not believe was that it was hot hot hot out, 95 degrees and sweltering.  For a Sunday at 2:30pm, I could not believe what I was actually waiting in line for, a sandwich.

When we both met back up, with both sandwiches, we did a taste test between the two.  I thought Geno's was better, slightly, I could barely tell the difference.  Truthfully, Geno's and Pat's tasted the same to me as an outsider from Denver, CO.  My girlfriend liked Pat's better.

Personally, I think the hype is much more popular than the food and everything has just blown up.  I've heard locals tell me that the bar between the two is better than both Pat's OR Geno's.

It was a good lunch, but I'm not sure I would ever wait more than five minutes for either again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Out of the three big tourist cheese steak places (Pat's, Geno's, and Jim's) in the Philly area Pat's is truly the King.  It has the best tasting cheese steak which is fueled by great options and the most flavorful/ steak.  It also has the most options for your sandwich.

My personal choice is the pepper cheese steak with provolone.

If you can only make one cheese steak joint I highly recommended Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Since Geno's and Pat's were right next to each other, my friends and I decided to try them both. We first went to Geno's and got a cheesesteak with provolone, and then went to Pat's and got the cheesesteak with cheese whiz. I guess if we were really doing to do a taste test contest, we should have gotten the same things on both- oh well.
In any case, Pat's was by far the better of the two. The meat was more flavorful than Geno's and the bread was soft and delicious. The peppers that they had on the side were the perfect accompaniment for the sandwich.  Their fries were also pretty tasty. 
I also thought the workers seemed nicer than Geno's.  The Geno's workers just plain scared me.  And although the workers at Pat's didn't seem all that friendly either, no one yelled at me when I fumbled with my cash (oops, I didn't have my money ready in advance... but I didn't expect a spontaneous fry order). 
Overall, as far as cheesesteak places go, I give Pat's a 4 star because it's the best of the 3 places I've been too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tell 'em the cheese type and wit or wit-out (onions), they already know you're getting a steak sandwich genius!  

I always get a WIZ WIT!

Don't even think about going to that other place across the street.  

Best to come here after a night of drinking.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Really disappointing tourist trap. I've actually tasted better cheesesteaks in chains. Meat was dry, entire cheesesteak was relatively flavorless.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steaks makes my favorite Philly cheese steak. Yes, it is a tourist trap, and yes, every since person who lives within 20 miles of the place will tell you not to go there and name off 5 places that make a better cheese steak. BUT, it is still my favorite. 

Nothing can beat the atmosphere, the red metal picnic tables, and of course the food. Here's what you need to know:

- Know your order, when you get to the register they move FAST
- The first window is for cheese steaks only, you can order fries and drinks by sliding down to the second window
- Have cash, they don't take credit or debit
- Be ready to spend at least $10 (Cheese Wiz without is $10 flat)
- Get the cheese wiz, I know it sounds gross but it's really delicious
- The steaks here are thinly shredded, unlike their competition across the street who serves a thicker cut of meat
- You can ask for your cheese steak to go, they'll wrap it up nicely 
- Be ready to stand in line if you go at a peak time; this goes beyond just tradition lunch and dinner, be ready for long lines after any Philadelphia sports game.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Luckily didn't have to stand in a long line due to the weather.  I got the sandwich with cheese whiz and onions and it was pretty good.  While I would never eat cheese whiz for any other reason, I think it's the best bet for a cheese steak.  Was hoping to be yelled at by the order taker for my lack of ordering expertise, but he was really nice. All in all, I would go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's verse Geno's? 

Service is no good.  Geno's is better.

Steak is OK, but Geno's is softer.

Topping ...  well Pat's has more choices and I do like that more than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not great...definitely not worth making a trip to south philly from center city!!
Still do not understand why is this place so popular given that it offers a 'not-so-great' cheese steak in the same city which is world famous for cheese steaks!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is the King of Cheese-Steaks. I have to give the edge to Pat's because is all done right. The meat is hot and fresh. The toping are over the top. The taste leaves you wanting one more. You can not beat the amount of good stuff in this sandwich. A must see & try place in south Philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Decent cheesesteak. Super greasy. Some grease to be expected, it adds flavor! But it should not be squirting our all over the place every time you take a bite. It's a must for tourist which is cool, it's a historical place. But there are better cheesesteaks in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
i am so glad, that when i went there was a group of kids split up between pats and genos, most went to genos so there was actually some place to sit. so we picked pats to try first. 
thankfully no line so we ordered like total rookies and messed it up and the guy just laughed at us and smiled. 3 words.... it was like mind blowing lol. but he did tell us to 'enjoy' after thanking him when we got the food ((unlike genos))
the meat, small but it had flavor, wasnt dry but wasnt overly moist, and i just wanted a touch more cheese seemed like the middle of my cheese steak was perfect while the ends dry. 
and it travels well !!!!!!!!!!!! went to ny and the bread wasnt even soggy, while genos went across the street to the car and the bun was soaking wet and we had to toss it before finishing.

i pick pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What is with the negative reviews of this place?

It's a lot like the other cheese steak places in Philadelphia. You can't find it different from those places. Remember people this is Philadelphia, the KING of CHEESE STEAKS so of course there will be a lot of places that taste great. 

Don't expect something unique or out-of-this-world taste and that's what makes this place and once again a lot of other places great. It's a simple recipe with fresh meat.

You won't be overwhelmed nor underwhelmed. You just have to try Pat's for the rich history.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was fine the bread is great. However the cheese wiz wasn't melted enough and I could hardly taste the mushroom. The meat was also a little hard too bite
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my favorite Cheesestake place in the city.  The food was good enough to outweigh the rude service and over priced food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I was all amped up about going to Gooey Looies about a mile away for one of their overstuffed cheesesteaks that have gotten rave reviews from the locals... So long story short Gooey's was closed and a short drive later I'm at Pat's........... Am I stoked and super grateful that Gooeys was closed? Um, well at first I was, there was none of the much talked about dreadful line, the weather was nice and the atmosphere? Classic Philly charm. 
 
 As for the ordering regime it was fairly basic for me, as follows: With/whiz/ the end, I'm not  fan of anarchy ordering practices or being shouted at for improper ordering but it's efficient and keeps things moving along. About 15 seconds later my cheesesteak arrives as ordered, I sit on my picnic style table loaded cheesesteak in hand and dive into it like I'm heading to the chair. The meat was a little chewy, slightly bland, meaty tasting and somewhat tender, needed salt, bread was ultra fresh, Whiz was Whiz..... Onions undercooked and I burped them up for about 10 hours even after several Pepcid AC's. 

 Overall the atmosphere is fantastic, the locals are amazing, the working class feel of the location was epic, the cheesesteak it's so well known for? A bit mediocre, sorry Pat's I'm a little bummed the Gooey's was closed, doesn't mean I won't be coming back; just not as good as I had hoped and dare I say tourist trap?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious cheese steaks!! I read a lot of good reviews and decided to try this place. I was torn between their competitors accross the street. Great choice, will come back! Only downside is that they dont accept credit cards.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is awesome. Simple cheese steak that leaves you full and happy. I could eat two ! :) they're the best. I don't know why people on yelp are critiquing them so closely. It's a cheese steak, not filet mignon. Anyway I've been coming for years and every time I visit they are the same, delicious. They are very consistent with quality and deliciousness.

 And I'd take the steak over filet mignon any day.

Please come to california pats. There is no good cheese steak place ! :( 

Love pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So glad I went to Pats for my first ever Cheesesteak!! If your visiting Philly there are so many choices but Pats is fantastic!!! Historic, Real Deal cheesesteak place!! The atmosphere made it worth finding a parking spot!! Warning CASH ONLY! Plenty of ATMs around though! There is also another place across the street, Genos, if you wanna try more than one.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Way to expensive for ok Cheesesteak.  Living on its reputation.  There are literally hundreds of places better, and for less money.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I think I was excited to eat at a place that is considered one of the best Philly steak sandwiches in Philly.
Kinda disappointed.  Just very average and I thought over priced.  $12 for just the sandwich?  Really.  Didn't even give you a small cup for any condiments.  
Bummer to waste a meal and the drive down for this.  There has got to be better examples of a Philly steak sandwich somewhere else.  
These guys have been open since 1930!  Take only cash!  Use your imagination on that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came here due to there reputation and was slightly disappointed. Seems as though the competition has caught up with them and exceeded them. I still enjoyed my visit, but it was more like going to see a historic site. In this case I was going to see the history of cheese steaks past. 

If you're a cheese steak fanatic that wants a taste of history, than by all means make sure to visit this place. If you want the best cheese steak in Philly, there are other competitors within driving distance that do it better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: over rated.  Sometimes pats is a 5, sometimes its a 4, other times its an abysmal one.  Went last week and had to give it a 3.  Bread as usual, is great.  Its fast, so thats also good.  But the meat is so dry as its just sitting on a huge pile of cooked meat losing its flavor as its evaporating away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My fiancé and I stopped here while in the city during our road trip at the end of April 2017.

I had seen Pat's on TV, of course, and I was surprised that it is found at a normal-sized intersection - the area looks a lot bigger and more open on TV. Be prepared to park a decent distance away and walk through a quasi-shady neighborhood. 

The restaurant is everything it appears to be. Service is very quick, but check your order before you leave because I didn't want onions and got them anyway. We were lucky and didn't have to wait in a long line. The food was good, and I enjoyed Pat's chopped steak (despite the onions) more than a certain other establishment across the road. I would've given four stars if it weren't for the fact that I got onions when I specifically asked for a sandwich without them. It's also fun to eat at one of the cheesesteak establishments I had seen on TV (there's nothing wrong with acting like a tourist sometimes, especially when you are one).

It's just one of those things you have to try! :-)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I gotta give Pat's a 4 just off the strength of the MEAT, the WIZ (which oozes so beautifully), and the speed of service. The bread and onions were fine too. It's no time or reason to bullshit and small talk. Take your order and it'll be ready in less than a minute. This place is a staple for a reason. The food is solid. Nothing out of this world in terms of seasoning and flavorfulness but the actual meat is actually very quality and plentiful. Only downside to me really is the price. I wish I didn't have to spend $20 to a cheesesteak, fries and a drink but I understand it.

Not saying it's the best cheesesteak in Philly but it's definitely worth trying at least once. It's a fun experience anyway being in South Philly and seeing Pat's and Geno's right across from each other.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I honestly don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars. I'm not even a big fan of philly steaks but I knew I had to try while visiting. This place does not disappoint!!! Honestly, I've never had a philly steak taste SO DAMN good. Excuse my caps, I get very excited when I find an amazing food spot. And this was definitely it. So good in fact, that I came here the next night and ordered even more than the night before. It's your typical philly steak sandwich that you've had the imitations before, but never really knew how exactly it should taste. Steak, cheese, onions on bread. Bread was amazing and so was the meat. Everything was amazing honestly. I couldn't put the sandwich or the cheese fries down. 

Also, I tried Gino's as well. 100 times better at Pats. I was legit mad cause I wasted a few bites at Gino's instead of Pats. 

Oh philly, I miss the hell out of your good food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Everytime I come back to my old stomping ground I make sure to visit Pat's and Geno's. It's always Pat's for the win.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We meandered over to the Pat's sign with the neon crown, but when I saw the line, I felt very discouraged. Luckily, the line moved fairly quickly. As a non-local, I didn't bother to learn the nomenclature; wiz, wit, whatever, but the people working there didn't seem to give us or the other patrons in line a hard time about that. Why make a simple menu complicated?
All the sandwiches are around $10. I tried a cheesesteak with a little cheese whiz, peppers, and onions. The sandwich itself was not bad, but I just don't think I am someone who craves cheese steak sandwiches. Also, I think chopped steak is a little tough. Luckily, the bread had a little crunch to it, which I like. Good bread is important to a sandwich. 
The downside is there was only outdoor seating, which was not great for a hot day. Also, they only accept cash, which I think is inconvenient and doesn't speak positively to a longstanding sandwich spot that probably has high margins and high volume.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had Pat's and Gino's and liked Pat's overall. The steak was better and easier to eat plus there are more places to sit. I did like the bread at Gino's. I know their not known for their fries but get them! Plus you can't go wrong with a place that's in Rocky!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite Cheese steak place in Philly. Nuff said.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Geno's is better!!

Sure sure some people will want to kill me for this but.. sorrt Pat's.. your steak was gross. 

It was my first time in Philly and as a huge foodie (I hate when people say that but...it gets the point across) I had to take the Cheesesteak challenge. 

One night we went out and had half of each, pats and Geno's. Pat's failed epically: the bun was dry, the meat was not flavorful or juicy. 

basically it can be summed up as such: Bleh
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came into Philadelphia and really wanted to have a genuine Philly Cheesesteak. After a great deal of research, I landed on Pat's and I have to say I was not disappointed!

I opted for a cheesesteak - provolone "wit-out" onions. The service was fast and the food was hot and fresh. Great cuts of steak were included in the sandwich and the bread was soft and acted as a great compliment to the sandwich. 

If I had to do it all over again, I'd probably get it with the onions, because I did find myself wanting another flavor included,  but overall, it was spectacular!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I wanted to take my fiancé for an authentic cheesesteak while in Philly, so why not get the original cheesesteak?  I was very disappointed that we trekked across town for this.  There wasn't any flavor in the meat or the onions.  They don't offer any sautéed peppers or other toppings that I'm used to.  It was a very bland sandwich.  Next time, we're searching for the best cheesesteak in Philly rather than the oldest.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What kind of sell out would I be if I didn't write a review in my hometown, Philadelphia?  :)

With that said, if you ever decide to do the hop and a skip away for cheesesteaks in the city of cheesesteaks, PAT'S is it!  Don't be fooled by the neon lights and celebrity photo hangings across the street at Geno's, PAT'S is where it's at!  Don't believe me?  Get one of each and witness the faceoff for yourself.  

With that said, getting the cheesesteak could be more of a challenge than finding the place (if you're from out of town).  My personal favorite is the original "cheese wiz, wit", which rougly translates to "I'd like a cheese steak, with cheese wiz, with saltee onions, please".  

If there's one catalyst for the fame of the "Philly Cheesesteak", it's the CHEESE WIZ.  Trust me, this is cheese wiz at its best and all you provolone, cheddar, non-cheesey folks need to give it a shot cuz honestly, when else do you get to have cheese wiz compared to all the other cheeses?  

In sum, Pat's the KING OF STEAKS, which is pretty self-explainatory.  And my golly, I'll be queen to that throne anyday!....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the best cheesesteak place in Philly. I have been coming here since I was 5 years old. There is something about the place that is just amazing. I love standing in the street waiting for the line to move so I can get a wiz wit. If you know what that means. If not they send you to the back of the line. The line can be quite long. Anyone that visits must try here. This place is an icon.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
FOOD: Definitely hits the spot!   I wish they made the food upon order so the meat would be more fresh.   The bread was amazing and the cheese was just right.  

SERVICE:  They were super nice and no wait for the food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Going to a game, after a game, later into the night, just driving on 95 near exit 20: all the right time to go to pats.  They live up to the name King of Steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 4 stars even though I didn't really like my cheesesteak. I've only had fake "Philly cheesesteaks" in other parts of the country, so I had to try the real thing and was told to come here. I got the real thing and didn't like it. Mainly the steak, which was dry and bland to me. The fries were damn good. The collection of people milling around the outside was pretty entertaining... a nice mix of high school students, workers, businessmen and Japanese tourists. By the end of the meal, I decided that I don't really like cheesesteak but that Philly's a cool town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overall mediocre food. Pat's and Geno's are both overrated. The lesser of the 2 evils is Pat's. Don't waste a trip to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tourist trap!  

If you've made it this far, then you've probably already decided that you're going to do the touristy thing and see the lights. Well, at least you're here instead of across the street. Pat's is the better of the two evils in my book. I've said it before: "Geno's, has the better fries while Pats across the street is the king of (very average) cheese steaks."

There are better steaks out there but if you want the experience to cross it off your bucket list, then by all means. I'd say you should go to Tony Luke's. 

Parking is a mess and the lines for steaks can stretch long. Never fear though, the line moves quickly since they're making food in bulk. It comes out immediately as you pay.

The steaks are far smaller than most in town which was disappointing. 

Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: "One wiz without". Line seemed long, but it moved really fast! Have  your money and order ready when you arrive at the window. Great cheesesteak. My stomach enjoyed every bite! Hopefully willl visit again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great tourist spot. My bread seemed a little stale but I loved the meat and cheese. It is cash only!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love Pat's!!  I took a break from my mad moving rush to try the dueling cheesesteaks.  Pat's was the first one we went to.  We ordered and received our sandwich within seconds.  It had a generous amount of cheese and was delish!! Even in the rain, people were eating outside and living it up.  Fun time, good sandwich!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats Steaks is "Way Over Rated" I cant believe I have to give it a one star.  I ate a cheesesteak about 2 months ago because my Bro-in-Law forced six of us to go there for his birthday.  Well, the cheesesteak was dry no flavor - the condiments are outside in jars where all the lovely flies and insects can get to them. The cheesesteak meat was cool so it couldnt of been just cooked .  I didnt even finish the garbage. I have no Idea why people still want to go to this place still.  Please dont think this is what a philly steak should taste like.  I also ate there about 7 years ago and same results.  I thought they would correct there problems but people keep coming so why bother.  You are what you eat.   I recommend Tony Luke - Prince of Steaks or any place but here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Agree with many reviewers here. Went here a few days ago during my first visit to Philadelphia because of the history of the establishment; however, the  steak sandwich is no big deal. The price for sodas and fries is ridiculous. Glad I went but never again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I really don't see what the big deal is, especially for $10 each. I've tried a few different cheesesteaks in Philly and this place, along with Geno's, were the worst. 
I suggest saving your money and time and go someplace else. 
However, I liked the bread.
In summary, it's overpriced, lacks flavor, and parking is a nightmare. 
Reading terminal has better options.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Visited here and Geno's on two separate trips to Philadelphia.

Had Cheese Whiz and Onions on mine...wasn't sure how I was gonna feel about the Whiz but it was actually pretty good.  The meat was perfectly cooked and the onions were caramelized and sweet. 

Bread was nice and soft but sturdy enough to handle the meat. Also, the staff there were not douchebags like they were at Geno's.

It tasted especially good since it was 11 o'clock at night. Yum!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap.  Big chunks of fatty, gristle filled "beef", but don't worry because there is much more bread than meat.  Go to Tony Lukes.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went on October 5,got there about 11:30am,service quick.Had the original,with onions and mushrooms and cheese whiz,Trish had onions and American cheese.Sandwiches were not hot warm,F.F where ok, would I go back yes to try Geno's, My opinion Jersey Mike's has a better cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Go at an off time to avoid the lines.. 

I find both Pat & Geno's highly overrated but I do suggest going at least once. Go with at least one friend and order the same items at each spot and share to compare! You'll probably get a few interesting looks and laughs haha  

These guys have gotten too commercialized.. I prefer the more momnpop hole in the wall feel. It seems like their are many less hyped but higher quality spots all over the city.. AND lots of places with vegetarian friendly options! My review is mostly based on going repeatedly with friends... and their reactions. 

But I have tried their cheese fries.. ultra processed cheese so you definitely need a fork to eat these babies.. so synthetic and bad.. but ooo so good all at the same time. I'm lucky I don't live in Philly.. they are like crack (not just at Pats but the cheese fries in general) 

I like the condiment bar.. it has that over Geno's! Although you could probably sneak over.. idk how kosher that is with the locals :P
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
(+) waited a total of 2 seconds for my order
(+) juicy steak, mouthwatering cheesewhiz, fresh bread

(-) intimidating cashier
(-) very greasy

Overall, I was satisfied with my cheesesteak! Pat's over Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Drove way outta my way to eat at the famous king of steaks. Hubs dropped me off so he can find a parking space. I called him a minute later to tell him to pick me up. He was shocked...."You're done?"

Theres a bunch of guys working like a well oiled machine to crank out these sandwiches. I decided to try their provolone cheesesteak. It was ok....bland. Needed more salt...hint hint. The cheese was bland...thus you need more flavor in your steak to counteract. I got everyone else the whiz which they all loved. In retrospect, I shoulda got that too. The whiz deserves 4 stars, but provolone gets 3 stars. I decided to give them an overall rating of 3 stars because when you order, it feels like the coldest conversation on earth. How about a smile? A how's it going ? Something! They want you in and they want you out....money is their game...not customer service. Hate to break it to you, but you need good food AND good service for a winning restaurant.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ive had both Geno's and Pat's and I gotta say Pat's just is better in all aspects. You get more meat, it's not as greasy, and the cheese just tastes better, and they offer a ton of extra condiments. It's apparent that geno's tries to pull you in with the flashiness of their neon signs while pat's just sticks to the basics because they know they're rocking' a mean cheesesteak!  While I can't say it's the best cheesesteak Philly has to offer,  it's definitely worth checking out this Philly staple!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I hate this place.  Sorry, but I do.
First off, DO NOT yell at me like I am some common drunken jackass.  I was not drunk or rude.  I simply asked you a question and you, you toothless, miserable schmuck, opted to yell at me.
Plus, your sandwich SUCKED.
Greasy.  Flavorless.  Awful.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We bought into the which one is better challenge and bought one from each Geno's directly across the street.   Hand's down Pat's was much better in texture and the freshness of the roll. My husband said both were over hyped and the experience was anticlimactic but admitted that Pat's was better to Geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I finally made the trip to Philly to try a "real" cheesesteak at both Pat's and Geno's. I'm sorry to say but I was humbly underwhelmed. While it was better than most cheesesteaks I have had outside Philly, it was not worth the 2-hour ride from NYC. The legend was better than the real thing.

I did however, prefer Geno's over Pat's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: By far the best cheesesteak i have ever eaten! Pats ALL THE WAY
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: In my opinion Pat's is better then the place across they way but there are many other places in and around Philly to get a better cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Eh. Tried Pat's because it's the original place (looking at Geno's with all those neon lights, you can see they are trying too hard!) and it was just OK. Got an "American wit" which is a steak, with American cheese, and onions, on a roll. The steak was so dry, I almost choked on the first bite. It doesn't help that I had to sit out in the freezing cold, which made those cheese fries real gunky after a while. Ah well, nice for the experience, but wouldn't run back here!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was headed up to Penn for a wedding and we decided to stop at Geno's and Pats. Pats had a shorter line so I went here first. The cheese steak was real good, The only problem was the bread got so soggy after a couple of bites I liked the peppers they had to put on the sub. I just didn't like the flies!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: E encanto el sabor de los steaks!!!! Además que me agrado el modo del servicio donde puedes agregar la salsa y pepinillos que desees!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Who cares if I don;t live in Philly???

I've had them once, twice, and so on. Each and every time I was there ...except that one time they were closed for some national holiday. Which was strange because tacky Geno's were the ones with the looney Nationalist signs up.
If you want the full experience of the whole rich to poor hunting down the best in philly .. PAT'S WIN. hands down.
The lines are worth the wait and it's civilized so don't be scared to wait around and eat on the metal school cafeteria style tables. 
Anyways... we even once drove down there from NYC for an hour or two to just have that melting in mouth sensation again.
That soft chewy bread and cut of steak... 
WITH WHIZ!!!!!!!!! and a side of CHEESE FRIES! HAVE A SODA WHILE YOU ARE AT IT! PERFECTO!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A ghetto ass racist boy was there. Taste nothing... No seasoning at all. Just really shitty place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not terrible, not mind-blowing.  It's a novelty, a Philly tradition. Fun photo-op!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely not the best I've had. Neither was Geno's.. it was exciting just to experience an authentic philly cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Great tourist attraction. Let the outsiders come into the city for what we're known best for! You just better hope they don't base their opinion solely on this place. It's a dive, it's greasy, it's heavy, it's gross. Not somewhere Philadelphian's go or would even consider. 
Do yourself a favor, go to Steve's Prince of Steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is brilliant for post drinking adventures.  My mate's and I usually make a pit stop in the wee hours of the morning.  We usually don't debate between which is superior, pats or genos, we usually eat one from pats then walk around for a bit, then go to genos afterwards....

There is also a fantastic bar smack in the middle of pats and genos which has quality local brews and beverages with lots of eagles fanatic gear.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Better than Geno's. I tried both and found that I definitely enjoy Pat's steaks more.

The cheesesteak was just your average Philly cheesesteak that you could get from any food cart. The bread was correct (Philly bread that was so soft w/o falling apart), and the meat was properly chopped up into small pieces and fried w/ oil. It could be that this was the type of cheesesteak I was used to eat, but I felt that this cheesesteak worked better for me overall because the chopped up pieces of meat from Pat's melted and absorbed the cheese well, giving the entire sandwich a well rounded balance. Nothing special about the onions, and I did not get any other toppings. 

Overall, I think Pat's just packs a bit more flavor and a better texture, given how the meat is cooked. Neither side were particularly polite, although it was somewhat understandable given how long the lines were.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than the guy across the street. Higher quality meet, better bread fresher veggies and not quite as greasy. The kings are very long, it's expensive and, yes, it's a total tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: In Philadelphia today and decided to take a taste test of Pat's King of Steaksand Gino's across the street. No questions, no doubt, and no dispute that Pat's is The King Of Philadelphia cheesesteaks.  Pat's wasWell prepared and tasty whereas Gino's was greasy  unappealing. I threw Gino's away Enjoyed Pat's as my afternoon treat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Its always a toss up with pats and genos. Genos is right across the street.  I have always prefer pats but its so close.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Listen, if you want a steak.. you're gonna walk away happy. That is, if you try Geno's soon after.  Once I tried Geno's ... it all came down to the bread for me. Something abt Geno's was better. . Geno's VS Pats- I go with GENOS.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The first bite of gooey whiz wonderfulness is something which cannot be described, it must be experienced.  Odds are if you are looking at the review you are wondering which is better, Pat's or Geno's.  Honestly ... your best bet is to bring a friend and each of you get a steak from one of the locations and you split them.

For my money I think Pat's wins on the "initial taste" barometer.  It hits you just right and makes you crave a 2nd and 3rd bite.  That being said, I think Geno's sits in the stomach better and is a better "total experience".
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overall Pats is not King.  The people are friendlier at Genos.  Not much of a selection. Why do you have to ask for a to go bag when you already tell them it's a to go order.  After waiting on line the sandwich was ok.  Ishkabibbles steaks on south street are much better even though the restaurant has limited seating.  I'm over it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Mediocre...I hate to say it.  I tried out both Pats & Genos.  Both were ok....im giving Pats one more star than Genos.  The steak had no chewy fat which was great.  The sandwich still lacked flavor. ..I had it with provalone and onions...also thought they could have used more cheese. 

I wouldn't come back again...but it was fun comparing the two legendary steak places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's, but still not the best around. It's the original, so it's definitely worth a try, but I would recommend other spots like John's Roast Pork for a less stressful and more delicious experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Philly on a whine and had to try the famous Pat's. I know it's kind of touristy but still had to try. The sandwich I thought was a little over priced for the amount of meat that was in it. Nothing special, chopped meat with onions, peppers and provolone cheese. I did like the free spicy peppers you can get on the side table. They were tasty and not to spicy. But prefer this sandwich over Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I think Steak and Cheese I think about:
South Philly, Rocky 1-5, the Liberty Bell, and brotherly love. 
That's why when I was in Philly this past weekend I ventured off to Pat's to have the original steak and cheese. 
Being very well aware of the rivalry they have with the other steak & cheese spot directly across the street, I opted to dine at Pat's. 
I'm not a fan of racist propaganda especially when it comes to dining. 
I was looking for segregated water fountains, but they must've been in the back
**foot note :
http://www.phillymag.com/foobooz/2013/08/30/joey-ventos-dying-wish-keep-the-speak-english-sign-at-genos/  **

Pat's Wiz Wit is a good traditional sandwich. 
It is solid, there was nothing gourmet about it. 
Sometimes that's what you need;
Basics!  And that's a good thing!
You can not appreciate exotic eclectic flavors without having a foundation. 
With that being said I couldn't judge 1 steak & cheese 
With out trying the other. 
Yup, I sold out! 
I had the same Wiz Wit across the street to have an equal baseline. 
I left my beliefs at Pat's and and took my first bite. 
It was good. Slightly better, a little bit more flavorful. 
The guilt was to much of a burden on my conscience. 
It was better, but not worth my integrity better. 
I've had steak & cheese more flavorful than both of these, it was a cool experience and when I'm back in Philly
I'll probably return (to Pat's).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After moving to South Jersey I was instructed to head down to South Philly for the taste test: Pats vs Geno's. 

As a former outsider I thought Pat's was run by pompous A-holes, dictating without mercy or understanding even HOW the paying customer places his order (Standard english shunned.) You would think you were ordering mana from heaven, but it's only a mediocre sandwich that should only really be experienced when you are cold and hungry if you hope to enjoy it. 

Now having lived here for several years, this type of Philly attitude is less abrasive to me, but I still do not count myself a fan. All that said, I still like their steak better than Geno's, but there are far better steaks to be had in and around the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have tried Pat's and Geno's, both during trips to Philly. I am from Texas and maybe I have an odd view of what a philly cheesesteak should taste like. I felt that Pat's was better than Genos but I still was not sold. But hey, I got my Philly experience!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I salivate just thinking about a Pat's Steak. Soo damn good. I've compared it to the other one across the street and there is no comparison. The bread, the meat, the whiz - Pat's is the King.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Iconic food for Philly we stop there for the nostalgia not the sandwich, Geno's isn't any better but it is part of the charm of the city.  Go there to say you did!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Been there, done that, won't ever do it again. Purchased a cheese steak from Pat's today. The meet was so tough that I threw it in the trash. I threw $11.00 in the trash. I remember what the steaks tasted like back in the day. The meat was so juicy and tender.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The Pat's and Gino's debate rages on, but I say there is room in the sandbox for both. I enjoy taking friends, colleagues, or anyone willing to spend time with me here. Some will say it is just a tourist destination and other cheese steak places are far superior, but I say take it easy we are talking cheese steaks here not South of the Border. 

In closing there is nothing to say.... errrr write that hasn't been written and all the pictures have been taken (yes this is a challenge). If you are visiting Philadelphia check it out and order onions wit!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Down right beat's all the others in Philly. What the hell are those guys thinking? Ha.

The line went around as if we were waiting at Six Flag's for a roller coaster ride. WELL WORTH THE WAIT.

Parking-is tough- as expected. 
Seating - we went in between Pat's and Geno's and sat by that park's fences.... just fine =)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Between the two competing shops, I definitely liked Pat's the best. I think it comes down to how the meats are sliced. Pats is shredded while Geno's serve round thin slices which is not how I usually have my cheese steaks. Regardless tho, I thought their sandwiches were ordinary, nothing special. I could probably make the same quality at home. I did enjoy the novelty of the shop, it was interesting to hear of their competition and try both to compare the two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What can you say about the King of Steaks? He deserves the title, that's what. I love it here, just don't forget to get some of the hot sauce on the side and to try it with provi.I much rather come here than to that other gaudy one across the street, ugh. If you're a girl, just watch out. The guys working the window are not very good at hiding the fact that they are checking you out....can be a little uncomfortable.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time to Philly so I had to see what the fuss is about.  Being a rookie I went to the wrong window where you order fries and drinks. "Steaks ova dare" he says. After ordering my cheesesteak they send me away again to the window I was just at. Whatever freaks, forget the fries and drink. Sat down to eat. No frills, Just a hoagie roll with chopped steak and cheese wiz. Bun a little tough. I did like the hot sauce and pepper bar. Overall not impressed. I've been to a dozen places with better steaks and better service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Have eaten here many times in my life and always order Whiz witout. Good steaks. (Not as good as Geno's, though.)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Got a cheese-stake at Pat's today which cost close to $10 and was 7.5" long and average at best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
In the Cheesesteak corner war Pats beats Genos. It's a Philly institution of which you must partake.

Best rolls, more meat, better experience, killer fries, the original!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fell for the hype. Stay away from this spot. The sandwich as a whole is very bland. Not to mention there are many mosquitos on the tables and smells like garbage truck is there. Very unappetizing!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Drop from islip, ny. Just to eat some cheese steaks. Way worth the 3+ hrs drive. Just make sure you have cash.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: it's 1:40 am and we were hungry so my first choice would be Jim's steak but they closed at 1:00 am.  So my second choice was Pat's Steak, since Geno is racist for putting up signs about "speak english".  So i went there and i went to the first window and started ordering 2 mushing cheese steak and they all ignored me and laughed.  I was like what?!  They said where did you see on the menu that has mushroom cheese steak?  So i am kinda angry already but went to the OTHER restaurant and ordered the steaks.  I lastly ordered cheese fries they said you have to go to the other window, i was looking around and NO BODY was here except for me.  REALLY?  Not only you mock me for ordering at the wrong window but as a customer sending me to another window that is 8 feet away? Are you that freaking lazy? I should i of said screw you guys and walked to Genos' but i don't' know who's the lesser evil..  I will never go back to Pat's NOR Genos.  ONLY to Jim's steak on south street.  At least they treat me like a human being and actually cook their food there and then.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Geno's is racist.  Pat's is only okay.  Go to Jim's for the best cheesesteaks in Philly.

Even in the dead of December winter, this place had a massive line, and I'm still not sure why.  Their strict ordering instructions had me shaking in my UGG boots but luckily, I was with several locals who emotionally supported me through the ordering experience and I didn't get sent to the back of the line (which, apparently happens quite often).

The bread was decent, but the meat was greasy and far too thick.  I'm allergic to onions so I can't really judge how they did those, but I will say that Provolone is vastly superior to Whiz.  

I guess the tourist experience of ordering from one cheesesteak place across the street from the one you hate is part of enjoying Philly, but I feel no need to go back.  Like I said, go to Jim's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My brother and I were real excited to try this place but unfortunately it was just hype to us. Bread was extremely chewy, meat wasn't so satisfying, and I really don't know what it was but I bit into something That made me think I really cracked a tooth. Fries were at another window but they were cold and stale. I understand the concept of having separate Windows for that but I don't know why it's cold..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very good cheese steak. Go for the cheese whiz. Bread was a little chewy, hence only 4stars.  Would eat here again.  Line moves very fast. Be ready to order and pay when you get to window...no dillydalling.  Not a lot of seating or parking but that was expected.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was in Philly and had to drop by for a cheesesteak. Ordered the Mushroom Cheesesteak with onions and provolone at the register and it literally took 3 seconds for the cashier to hand me my sandwich. How? What? Huh? 

The sandwich didn't seem that warm and the mushrooms looked like they were straight out of a can.  Gross.  Taste-wise, the sandwich was bland.  It needed a lot more sauce or salt & pepper.  The only redeeming factors were the large size of the sandwich and that the meat was really juicy.  I can get a better tasting Philly at my local deli in NYC.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My family would kill me if I walked across the street. I love the juicy (greasy) steak with mushroom and onions.  Cheese wiz the only way to go. I remember the days of the $5.75 Steak.  But that's long gone.  The only thing better is watching the drunk fools falling over or trying to order at the window. Classic.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I must say, as much as it's a tourist destination, it is good, and depending on how you order it, it becomes it's own thing. His was with wiz, mine with extra provolone and onions, Both were delicious but oh so different from each other. The bread is rocking and the steak is big and beefy. We arrived at 10 am New Years day, no line, the pickled cherry peppers, mayo, garlic sauce, ketchup are nearby with help-your-self service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So there was no line!  Got a wiz wit. It had some great flavors especially the onion but I thought the meat was a little over cooked.  Still you can't beat the combo of the wiz, onions and meat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's Pat's Pat's.....definitely much better than Geno's, which is across the street.  Pat's puts a generous glob of cheez whiz on TOP of the meat, as opposed to the microscopic layer of whiz on the bun at Geno's.  When the cheez is on top, it has a chance to sink through the rest of the meat on its way to the bread.  I could barely taste any cheez on Geno's.  I tried Pat's, Geno's, and Jim's and Pat's is definitely the best of the three.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Better than Geno's because 1. The bread is better 2. They slice up the meat. 3.They give you directions on how to order.

Best cheesesteaks in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ok, husband and I tried both Pat's and Geno's and we definitely prefer Pat's philly steak over Geno's.  But it's more of a 'fun' thing to do as a tourist instead of really coming to Pat's because we truly believe it's absolutely the best philly cheesesteak.  The instruction to place an order is hilarious though....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was the hype even worth it?? I guess so.. It's pretty legit...
Could be very touristy.. but as i said.. it was pretty legit from whatever cheesesteak we have here in CA.

AND if you really want to know... my boyfriend and i went here and next door to compare and see which one is better... both of us.. ate two sandwiches. EACH.

PAT'S KING OF STEAKS is better than it's neighbor. There. that saves you money and room in your stomach.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love the mushrooms option, unlike Geno's. The line looked long but it was really quick, like ten minutes and we were down the street so it is worth the wait! The bread is better than Geno's, but the meat is a little on the chewy side for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's and Geno's are famous more for their rivalry than for anything they do. It's like Yale/Harvard. At one point in time, it was relevant to a lot of people, but now, nobody except the people who go there give a crap.

Also, let's get something straight. Cheesesteaks inherently taste good. But, as far as these meaty, gooey sandwiches go, Pat's is near the bottom of the list. I mean, it's got way too much gristle and the meat is flavorless. Also, I don't care if whiz is the original, it doesn't compare to a melted slice of american cheese. "Original" doesn't necessarily mean "best."

However, if you do somehow happen to find yourself between a rock and a hard place (aka Pat's & Geno's), Pat's is the better choice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was disappointed by their cheesesteak - I was impressed by how quick they made their line move however the fact that they serve cold bread made me realize that was one of the reasons. 

If you're in philly, I guess going here is a must - just to cross off of your list but in my opinion their city has better cheesesteaks to offer.  

It is cash only and make sure to study the menu to know how to order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Philadelphia = Philly Cheesesteaks. Boom.

Naturally, I had to make a stop at Pat's during my short stay in Philly. With Pat's being the founder/creator of the locally-famed concoction, I knew this place would satisfy my hopes for the traditional cheesesteak experience.

Now the real interesting part is that I could only squeeze in a stop to Pat's around 7am as we were headed out of town...so yes, I had a gigantic Philly cheesesteak at perhaps the most unusual hour ever. All thanks to the fact that Pat's is open 24/7!

Regardless, the sandwich - cheese wiz steak wid onions - was pretty tasty. I was pleasantly surprised by the freshness of the bread, the quantity of the steak, the flavor of the cheese, and the balancing effect that the onions had in melding all of the sandwich components into one cohesive unit. Overall though, I must say that this famed combination of the cheese wiz and onion steak was just pretty good and not nearly as spectacular as some of the other reviewers have noted. I think I may have enjoyed the sandwich more had I gotten it with provolone and no onions - as that is more of the type of flavor profile I'd dig...next time!

For it being so early, the worker was pretty chatty....must be a morning person. that PLUS he had a wonderfully thick Philly accent! 

such a tourist :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak IS Philadelphia!  We invented it!  And Pat's does us proud.  Ask ten people in Philadelphia who is the best and you may get 5 answers, but hey, Pat's has its own great style.

Juicy, oily, shredded beef.  The sandwich makes a huge mess because it's so sloppy good.  The bread for me however is too soft, almost gummy.  I kinda wish they would use Geno's bread, and their steak, ha ha.  But a Pat's cheesesteak just feels so good going down.  I get mine wiz wit.  (that's Kraft Cheese Wiz and onions, for those who don't know)  Then I go to the hot peppers counter and add my own blend of "extras."  Yum.

But don't take my word for it.  Ask my 10 year old nephew who weighs 55 pounds and devoured an entire cheesesteak on a recent visit with me, almost as fast as I did.  VERY impressive!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went to the one at 16th and Chestnut.  Delicious!!!!  It was super busy, the staff was hustling and they didn't LOOK too friendly.  But, they were very nice and very professional.  I think they were just seriously working hard.  I will be back!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible...very rude...overpriced...bones in the steaks...don't go...wawa has better cheese steaks than these clowns
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I prefer Pat's over Geno's! 

I had it with mushrooms and american cheese ~ and let me tell you it was deliciousssssssss! The fries were yummy as well! You definitely have to have a soda to wash it down though. 

I would highly recommend trying BOTH Pat and Geno's in order to pick your favorite :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went there on vacation and ate my first Philly Cheesesteak! It is made on a foot long piece of French bread. Cheese is optional. Jesus! It was so amazing! Too bad we don't have these in Chicago!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The service here is really bad, but I guess that is somewhat expected at places like this. The cashier was not rude to my party, however, I could hear him saying... "next! c'mon guys talk to me..." over and over again. Geez, give some people a minute to at least look at the different options they have! It's a tourist attraction, so clearly most people who are visiting are not locals..

Food is okay-- nothing special. The cheesesteaks I make a home taste just the same. It's also overpriced, but I suppose that is also expected that this is probably the one "food" attraction Philly has to offer! I think the sandwich cost $9.50? If you want to add other toppings (i.e. mushroom, extra cheese) it's another $.50. The place is cash only.. AND they charge tax. I personally have an issue with places that are cash-only and charge tax. I don't expect that a place like this needs to take credit cards, but honestly guys?! Don't charge tax! 

I also tried Genos which I perfer over Pat's. If you like soft, very thin sliced meats.. then Pat's may be better. Otherwise, I think Genos is better. Pat's meat was juicer though! 

Probably will not eat here again.. but had to try it given that we were in Philly! It's nothing special but one of those things you want to cross off on your list of to-dos!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is just OKAY. If you're okay with "okay" while waiting in a long line then be my guest. Don't like the cheesesteak corner.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Disappointing. 
It was blend and the bread was hard. 
The guy that took my order had an attitude.
I should have punched him in his big mouth.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's and Geno's have run their course and frankly there are better steaks around. problem is that the city is tied to both of these locations as the "got to go" places for cheese steaks. I'd suggest to anyone coming in to this area to take your guests to the steak place of your choice and don't be tied into "having" to go here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We asked all the Uber drivers where is the best Philly CheeseSteak in Philly, the answers we got were either Geno's or Pat's. After trying both at the same time. I'm not sure why these two places are considered "the best". Not impressed :(
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks
