Yes! If you are in Philly, you MUST get this cheesesteak. It is incredible and if you have friends, either bring some back home for them or do not tell them you went or else you will be in big trouble. This is a steak sandwich that I almost cried about after it was gone. 

I dream of this steak sandwich. Seriously.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You just know that those people who gave Pat's one star are Geno's fans in disguise. I don't know how anyone can possibly not like this place unless you're vegetarian, in which case they shouldn't have eaten here in the first place.

The line is long but it's SOOO worth it. If you go later at night, there's no line and you can enjoy this goodie in a comfortable seat, taking your time. If you do go during the peak hours, I just suggest you wear warm enough clothes and everything will be good once you put that cheesesteak in your mouth.

Looove the peppers you can grab on the side. LOVE the cheese fries. Definitely the best cheesesteak I've ever had in my life. Yum!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Awe.....My childhood :) Best evah! I get it whenever I'm back in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My friends and I are from MD and we drove to Philly just to have cheesesteaks. Pats was worth that gas money. And Gas is like over $3, so that's saying something. Ya feel? Although the aesthetic and price isn't as great as Genos... their Cheesesteaks are sooo good. My friend and I fell in love with it. I am seriously going back to Philly this week just to get more. Also the workers make you feel like family. Only thing is, I wish it wasn't Cash Only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Did the Geno's - Pat's challenge. Pat's wins hands down.  The meat is thicker, bread chewier, and whiz more liberal.  On top of that, more places to sit and a topping bar. 

Had a cheesesteak wit whiz, and a cup of cheese fries. 

I will be back.  I cannot say the same for the "Freedom Loving" Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Cool looking place in South Philly (about 15 min cab ride from downtown.  Lot's of activity going on all around the place.  There's Geno's across the street and a seafood restaurant and bar on the other side.  A public basketball court is on the other side...it's a diagonal intersection, so a lot goes on.  The steak is chopped really fine and has a lot of flavor...and a fair amount of grease.  I had onions and provolone on mine and it was devoured in 5 minutes.  I sat at one of the benches as I ate and had sparrows and pigeons eating every little bit of meat/onion/bread that fell to the ground.  They do a great job of keeping the corner clean.  
Pricing is $9 for a sandwich and condiments are located on a stand right across from the order window.  All in all, fast service, good food, and cool environment.  I will be back.
Read Geno's review for comparison.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was in Philly in Aug 07 for my sisters wedding and decided to check this place and Geno's which is across the street from Pats. This place is very quick . You order and in about 20 seconds your cheese steak appears. It was good but I let my cheese melt a little bit more because when they give it to you the cheese is not melted at all . You can get yours with cheesewiz but I love provolone.I was lucky to find parking as someone was pulling out when we arrived or it would have been a challenge.....Between Pats and Geno's....Geno's was better...
   Both these places are better than those chain places they have around the country.. So if your ever in Philly try'em out
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wiz with is what I always go with. After you grab your sandwich grab some cherry peppers, little bit of ketchup and enjoy a awesome steak sandwich. Have been here numerous times and enjoyed every one of them. I have also been to both pats and genos but pats usually comes out on top. Saying that,  I love genos, jims, AND tony lukes. Each one does something slightly different to make it unique.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's OK....
Line was fast hogie was good, but not great.
I've had better....
Next time i'll try Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Lived in Philly my whole life, worst cheesesteak I've ever had. Bland, soggy, expensive, and had to wait in line 30 minutes for it. Pat's and Geno's both get by on the name alone, you can get a better cheesesteak just about anywhere else in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: great drunk food on the walk home. i just recently discovered they have hotdogs and they're also delicious !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Gross and expensive excuse for a cheesesteak (same with the place across the street).  I know, I know - it's a landmark and an experience.  And I suppose that one might think it's a really good sandwich if they didn't know any better.  But if you really want a GREAT cheesesteak, look around and you can find hundreds that are better than this place.  Anyone who tells you this is good simply does not know what they are talking about.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I didn't have high expectations for such a popular tourist spot to begin with, but even then I was very underwhelmed by the food. There's not much I can say about it; the food is average. They stack their sandwiches with meat so it's worth the price, even if it's inexpensive in the first place, that's about the only good thing about their sandwich. 

Their only redeeming quality is their quick service. The staff might not sound the friendliest but they definitely get their food to you very quickly. You'll be in and out within minutes of standing in line.

While I wouldn't deter people that are new to Philly to try out Pat's (and I do hope you enjoy this place more than I did) I would also tell you that you could probably find a street vendor that has a sandwich that's equally good, maybe better. The walk over there just isn't worth it when there's places just as good closer to my apartment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Dat's a good sandweech. Had to dock a star for the tourist trap pricing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's not as bad as most locals claim.

Now, that off the bat doesn't seem promising, but hear me out. Many native Philadelphians loathe both Pat's and Geno's (and Jim's on South for that matter) because they're thought of by many as tourist traps. Despite that, a cheesesteak isn't a terribly hard thing to make and they do a pretty good job. The roles are great, whiz is whiz and that's good and the beef...well, two out of three ain't bad. The kicker is they're open 24/7, well past when pretty much everything else is closed. Sure, you can get a better cheesesteak at Ishkabibbles, Max's or Jim's in West Philly, but if you're in the area and hungry late at night, Pat's will hit the spot.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: took me 4 months after moving to the illadelph but I finally tried Pats, and I must say.... I don't think I like Philly cheesesteaks much.  But as plain and unseasoned as it was, as greasy and unhealthy as that mass-produced chopped steak and melted processed cheese product on top of an enriched bleached flour hoagie roll can be, I still find myself craving the soft, chewy, cheesy, meat juice dripping sandwiches time and time again. With ample hot sauce and a couple pickled bonnet peppers of course... And although I don't usually act on those cravings, I must admit, Pat's has left its mark on me now and forever more.  Kudos to you, Pat, it's good to be the king.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ordered the Philly Cheesesteak with Cheese Wiz, there was no line so we walked right up and the sandwich was ready in 5 seconds. 

The bread seemed a little soggy but the sandwich was good. 

We parked next to Geno's and walked the entire 1/2 a block to try Philly Cheesesteak Sandwiches from each location. 

Have to say in my opinion - Geno's was a little better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: OVER-RATED!!!  Wow.  Really disappointed in the quality and the workers are rude!  There are way better cheese steak places in the suburbs. If you are from out of town, save your money as the prices are ridiculous and you can find a much better steak in the suburbs. I feel bad for tourists who think this is a real "Philly" cheese steak. Also, they only take cash.  What is up with that???  This isn't the 1970's. IRS?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The black fried chillies were better than the cheesteak and soda is half the price of steak. I asked a local should i get geno's or pat's (respond - go to pats cuz genos r racist) lol. Wow
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So to continue down the checklist for my Philly tourist visits...my buddies and I did an about face at Geno's and in front of our face was the competition...Pat's! It's pretty cool that at 12am cars/taxis were pulling up to both places and were packed! Great experience!

Taste test time! We wanted to be fair so we ordered the same at both establishments and got a plain old cheesesteak sandwich split into thirds (because there were three of us). We got a funny looks asking to split our sandwich in thirds, but it was for taste testing purposes. See whichever sandwich tasted better (from our 1/3 sample size) we would then buy a full cheesesteak to ourselves from the best tasting spot w/out trying to fill our stomachs with two full samples from each. 

First thing I noticed right off the bat was the flavor from the meat! Better than the competition and my buddies agreed. Overall taste was close, but not as good. I think the bread separated the two. Pat's bread was thick and created dry spots for me.

I will say Pat's has more of a quality fresh flavor, but I want my cheesesteak messy and flavorful! Pat's got 1 of 3 votes from our trio.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We tested Pat's and Geno's consecutively. We tried Pat's first.

Customer service is definitely not their priority. But the vibe is very mom and pop type of shop. My rating is in large part due to their fries and ambiance. The line here was a bit shorter and I think it's in large part because the staff need to up their game with how they interact with customers. 

Great, crispy fries.

The bread was fluffier here than Geno's. Although the meat was a bit more tender here it was a bit more thick. 

At the end of the day, both stops are worth the try.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteaks were okay. Nothing special. It's really all hype but just went since we were visiting Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is totally living on reputation.  They're not friendly to say the least, but that doesn't even matter to me with cheesesteaks.   The tourists all want to come here,  let them have it.  To the discerning individual, its just bad.  The steak is as mediocre as it gets.  It's typically super crowded.  This is not a sandwich crafted with care, it's just a slapped together waste of money.  It's only useful for a late night visit after a night of heavy drinking.  Even then, go to Wawa or something.  At least you can find SOMETHING decent there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When it comes down to Pats and Genos, I always just go to the place with the shorter line.

I'm going to drop Pats rating a point because they usually have the longer line.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to try the side by side comparison of rival cheesesteaks while in Philly! Pat's cheesesteak was pretty good not great with a decent amount of meat, onions and cheese wiz on top. I think the buttered roll was probably one of the better things about the sandwich actually. Overall it was a pleasant experience but as many had suggested to me sort of a tourist trap must do kind of thing. As mentioned it is cash only for food but the speed with which it's ready is truly something lol. I'm glad I had the chance to try it but next time in Philly I'll definitely hit up some of the other local and better rated spots.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As a Texan-American I have been all over Philly and New Jersey searching for the best Philly Cheesesteak.  I believe I have found it.

As a student and master of efficiency I thoroughly appreciated the gruff and rushed demeanor of the authentic yankee taking our order.  The orders were made lightening fast as to be magically created.

There are signs outside of the establishment explaining how to order, in case you are not a filthy yankee.

The Cheesesteak was simply amazing, the best I have ever had.  Enough said.  We also tried to the "pizza fries", which are fries with cheese and pizza sauce.  I didn't like this concept, but my yankee companions loved them.  

I would recommend this place for a great Cheesesteak and authentic Philly experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Our local friends told us Pat's was better than Geno's.  I can't say.  It's weird, because when I used to live near here, I never got cheesesteaks.  And honestly, I'm not sure there was that big of a hole in my life to fill.  If anything, I learned I'm more of a pastrami guy.  But these were pretty tasty.  The one with onions was WAY better than the one without.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My husband and I went here during our first trip together to Philly. His family in Philly swear by Pat's over Geno's. If you're not a local (like us) you have to pay close attention to how you order your food - they are very particular: i.e.  "Wit or Without Wiz" 

I'm so used to my philly cheesesteak sandwiches having provolone cheese but I was surprised that I really liked the Cheese Wiz! Sounds strange, but it really is delicious and comforting. Be ready to stand in line and don't expect to have a sit-down meal. This place is truly a grab-and-go kind of joint.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in philly and this place was recommended. I was waiting to be wowed. Instead, I got a sandwich with tasteless steak. Maybe that's the way it's supposed to be? I don't know-but I was expecting WAY more flavor for an establishment that is a "must try". Parking sucks, fries and drinks are expensive and you have to purchase separately . Weird.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yeah...not so much.
I'm not from Philadelphia but lived here for a few years so maybe I'm missing something.  I get better cheese steaks at my local dive bars and pizza parlors in Jersey.  Oh, and I think whiz is an abomination so I don't think Pat and I were meant to be...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Best cheesesteaks ever!!!!!  Juicy, tender, and extremely flavorful!!!!  Oh so good!!  Totally hit the spot for my Philly cheesesteak craving!!  I now see why they are still standing after Geno's stepped in with their big flashy decor and extravagant lighting. The taste stands out in the end!!!

Pat's King of Steaks totally earned their title!  Go to Pat's for the WIN!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Honestly, I don't see what the big deal is about the cheesesteaks in Philly. I guess when your city is a god damn toilet, you have to find something to brag about.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is a good cheesesteak. Delicious even. People learn that I'm from Philly and ask me if I prefer Pat's or Geno's. I tell them every time that Pat's has more grease and Geno's has more meat. 

Some people accept this, and plan  their meal accordingly,because my preference and theirs might not align. Some people are clever, and view my comments an endorsement of neither. When they catch me on that, I say that most Philly cheesesteaks are of similar quality, what separates close hoagies is the bread.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: How can I choose from Geno's or Pats?? I really love them both but in the past 6 months I have to say Pat's is much better. Sorry but I can't pay almost $10 for something with that much FAT inside.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: now I didn't have a Philly cheese steak but my fiance did and loved it. I had the cheese fries and just omg. I want that cheese! so delicious. of course people will whine it's touristy which I guess it is? we aren't from pa so we wanted the touristy stuff. it was delicious either way. locals complain too much. I'm sure there are other places for the best philly cheese steaks in the are that no one but locals know about but for tourists this place was great.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Well the food network got me going here. We ordered two one with whiz and one with american.
The whiz definately saved the meat... the sandwich with american was just poor, like the cafeteria food in highschool.
Thank goodness for fries and coke.
i was hoping for more and was sad that it was not.  
I really do believe Pat's the king. But hey this is america and once someone sees and steals a great idea-you gotta work harder. 
Which is why Genos is so flashy.

http://www.patskingofsteaks.com/Site/Welcome.html
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not a fan of Cheese Whiz, especially on my cheesesteak but Pat's King of Steaks has me sold. Thinking I wasn't going to like it, I ordered the steak with american cheese. My brother made me take a bite of his Wiz wit cheesesteak and I was in love. 

A must try if you are in Philly. 

If you stay in Downtown Philly and happen to be in the Reading Terminal  Marketl, don't fall for the signs for Rick's Philly Steaks. Although they claim to be from the same family as Pat's, they don't make the cheesesteaks the same way.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yay! After having one of the most disgusting Philly Cheese Steaks I've ever had (From Genos nonetheless) I was happy to come here and have something worth eating. 

The guy that takes the orders is RUDE.
I'm not from the East Coast so I was staring at him like, "Have you lost your mind!?!? Who do you think you're talking to!?" LOL.

But apparently...its a trademark type deal to be an ahole.
SO with that said; it's worth it! The sandwhiches are great!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I ordered a mushroom and peppers cheesesteak wit' onions and 'wiz and I think I lost a year or two in my lifespan but it made my stomach happy for sure.  I would say the cheese wiz made my heart melt but then I'm not sure if that's a good thing or not.  

Don't stray too far after you pay because they guys are firing em out like bullets.  My only gripe is the bread.  Wish it was more fresh and toasted but who comes here for the bread...?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nice outdoor seating, very good for the "south philly experience" but not the best cheese steak in philly.  Good customer service, very clean but very much a tourist spot.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just OK. The people working are extremely rude. The roll was cold and hard but the steak was tasty. Wouldn't be in a rush to go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
5+ Stars!

I'm from California and I wish they have it here! Surprisingly,  when I came here, the line was not long. I think this must be the best cheese steak I've ever had. This cheese steak makes the other cheese steak I've ever tried taste like McDonald. 

When you get  there, there's a board that shows tips on how to order a cheese steak. I ended up choosing a cheese steak with onions, cheese whiz, and some bell peppers. It was the most succulent cheese steak in town. Eat it while it's hot!

This place got pretty pricy just because it was featured on some show, which is ludicrous. 

Next stop...Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was in town and heard about this place.  I ordered the steak with Cheez Whiz and had no regrets.  I enjoyed my sandwich and even went back again the next day!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Recently visited Philadelphia and was starving when I landed. I asked the shuttle driver at the airport for a recommendation for a good Philly cheesesteak in the city. He immediately suggested Pat's or Geno's. I tried both during my time in the city and Pat's definitely takes my vote for the best. The meat was better and I liked that it was sliced into smaller pieces. Also, the bread was softer. YUM! Maybe it was because I hadn't eaten all day, or maybe it was truly that darn good. 

If you're visiting Philadephia, stop by Pat's for a cheesesteak wit relish, mustard, and onions. MMMMmmm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When my husband and I landed in Philly, we were absolutely starving and agreed Pat's and Geno's was to be our first stop! Apparently 2am on a weeknight is a great time to go because we had no line at either place, and no problem parking. I did not practice saying "whiz wit", I ordered my cheesesteak with whiz and onions and the gentlemen at Pat's were kind enough to excuse my blatant outsider-ness and not give me grief. 

We got a sandwich from each place and each ate a half, and we agreed without a doubt that Pat's was the winner. The meat was soooo good, the cheese whiz was perfect, even the bread was better. Yeah, it's $10 a sandwich but so worth it to me, I'm craving another!

Bring cash, neither of these places take card. Try the cherry soda, it's awesome!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
WIZ WIT!

Geno's can cram it up their cramhole.

This is the real deal right here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I saw a boiling vat of cheese I knew i was in love. Sure they treat customers like cattle--hearding them into lines, barking orders, and dismissing the weak--but the sandwich is good and there is no denying that. 

I say it is worth the trip just to see someone put cheese on your sandwich with a knife.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Everyone always says that if you're in Philly, you need to get a Philly cheesesteak. Well, after researching on yelp on where to go for the best Philly cheesesteak, my friends and I decided to try Pat's King of Steaks. After reading the reviews on yelp for this place, I was slightly nervous on ordering a cheesesteak because the reviews said you had to be quick and say the right things (wit or witout) and I was also concerned about how long the line was going to be. 

When we got there around 3pm on a weekday, I was surprised that there really wasn't a line! We ordered our cheesesteak (mine was mushroom pepper american wit) and I was excited to take my first bite. After trying it, I have to say that I was less than impressed with it. I guess I was expecting a lot more flavor and cheese but all I could think about was how much it tasted just like a plain old deli sandwich. It wasn't anything great, but I'm glad I got to try a Philly cheesesteak. It was good but nothing amazing. I guess I'll stick to my asian food flavors.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I personally like Geno's better even though Pat's was there first. This was only my second time having it. The first time I was going to college in Philly and a friend said I had to try a real cheesesteak and I was amazed.

Nothing you can really describe here. Its a perfect combination of everything especially if you order it with cheese wiz. The bread is great, the meat is cooked perfectly, and the cheese is nicely melted all over. The only reason is took away a star is because I prefer Geno's. The only time I was there the guy seemed like he had an attitude, but what can you expect when you constantly serving the same thing without a break. The guys at Geno's never do they always seem up beat and friendly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I haven't had a good Philly cheese steak for a while and Pat's is pretty good. They gave you ton's of meat and the cheese just melted on top of it. Their pickles are awesome too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've lived in South Philadelphia a long time. Please tourist do not go here or Geno's. It's super pricey. It's really thick steak. Although I prefer them over Geno's, if you had to choose between the two. Expensive prices with poor quality.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visited Philly this past weekend.  One gotta try a PCS in Philly, right?  Since we saw this place on TV and all over the tourist brochures, we decided to give it a try.  Customer service was nonexistent.  The sandwich was good, not greasy, not dry, just plain good, but not great.  On a side note, how come everybody in South Philly park on top of each other?  We left feeling like we totally fell for the tourist trap.  Totally overrated.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went here directly after having a sub-par Philly Cheesesteaj at the rival across the street, Geno's. I had the traditional cheesesteak and it was OK too. It was slightly tastier than the one form Geno's, but the service was far better. Very friendly and prompt service. If I had to pick a side, Pat's has my vote.

Know before you go - CASH ONLY
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Earlier in the day we had cheesesteaks at the Franklin Institute and they were much tastier than Pat's.  We stopped by Pat's on our way out of town and ordered two cheesesteaks, one with provolone and one with American, both wit-out.  The meat was dry and just did not taste good.  While we were there the cashier started cursing some guy out in front of us for the slight of apparently throwing his money.  Then when the guy went back to the window for some reason, he called him a "faggot" and threatened to come outside and fight.  What class.

Next time we're in town we'll have to try someplace else that's not a tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's beat Geno's hands down! How is this even a competition?? Pat's is more flavorful, more moist, and I feel like it's got more meat to bread ratio.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Being a Philadelphia local, I truly believe that you come here for the experience over the food. Visitors always want to go, and naturally, we oblige - but generally also get them a cheesesteak from one of the many better cheesesteak places in the city. Overall, I've had ok sandwiches from Pat's that were pretty tasty, and some that have been too grisly to deal with. Again, it's the experience of ordering at the window with the proper lingo and diving into a big sandwich at a picnic table with grease running down your arm that makes this a destination.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went here for lunch and the food was great. Not overly greasy but filled with flavor. I ordered my food and got it within a minute. Good service and good food. Would definitely recommend this spot
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The french fries here are better than what can be had across the street, but in two recent visits I was very disappointed by the amount of "gristle" in the steak meat.  In each case it was so bad that I had to remove the meat from my mouth because it felt like I was chewing on a rubber band.  The steak sandwich also fell apart as I ate it and my hands were covered in juices.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Service sucked, they were very very rude. and the cheesesteak was just okay. Not a great introduction to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
And the winner of the Filthy Philly Cheesesteak goes to Pat's.  

Each bit of meat had grizzle on it, which made it inedible.  The dripping oil was running down my hands and I think I used the equivalent of 50 tress to wipe it up.

I believe that all those who gave this joint 5 stars were drunk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is the much better cheesesteak spot. There is Geno's across the street that can def. lure you in cause they have all the shiny decor and lights and looks so much nicer but its def. not the better sandwich spot! PATS is!

Ordered a cheesesteak with cheez wiz and onions and had me a side of cheese fries and it was so damn good! I LOVED IT! I couldn't finish the whole thing but it was really good, now I will drive up there just for that, I don't care! It is so good.

This place is so much better than the Geno's so don't let the bright lights fool you!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I think the last time I ate at Pats was 1972, but I have yet to find a cheese steak as good (Gino's back then was not as good but I have heard they now are and that there are others in the running as well). 

Of course back then they cost about a buck sixty-five each!  Someday when I am in Philly again, I will head to Pats and test my memory!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wiz wit, cherry soda & cheese fries is my combo. Love Pats but I will not crown them King.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Heard a lot about this place from tv so we had to give it a try to see what's cheesesteak is all about. We went there at around 11 pm and the place was empty and ordering was quick and got the cheesesteak within a minute. 
Sad to say that the cheesesteak was not as impressive as I thought it would be. I got the basic one with just cheesesteak and wiz. The beef seemed like it's been cooking for a while. The quality was impressive as the sandwich was huge and could easily fill your appetite. So it's a definitely a tourist attraction but not a best place to get your dose of good cheesesteak.

3.5/5
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I ordered the following:
-2 Philly Cheesesteak with Mushroom, Green Peppers, and Onions (cheese whiz and provolone): 9/10
-Cheese Fries: 9/10

I would recommend to my family & friends!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My wife loves going to the cheese steaks shops in the city so I have waited in line many times with her at Pat's and Geno's, that is normal here in Philly. Sometimes it is a 45 minute wait because it is a definate tourist attraction. Although I have not been in Philly in the past few months,  I have tried these in the past and they were very good. They are kind of expensive at over $7 each, but you need more then one to eat and the workers are very hasty and have little patience for new customers. It is definately worth the cost, as it is great tradition that everyone must experience if you ever see Philladelphia. We usually end up here whenever we are in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came all the way just for the philly cheesesteak.
Yellow school bus dropped off a billion high schoolers when we got there and it seems like they don't know the meaning of a LINE.
We got pissed off and then I guess a couple of them noticed and allowed us back in our line seeing how we saw a shorter line but it was just for extras and drinks.

The line goes by fast but the cashier dude isn't too friendly. We I guess its known for the sandwiches and not their service.

We were able to grab one of many bright red benches. There are plenty of other areas you can eat your sandwich. 

8.50 per philly cheesesteak. Not bad. I liked mine but I didn't think it was amazing but my dad loved it therefore the 4 stars. They give you a good amount of meat.  I wouldn't mind trying out Gino's and comparing. One day....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I know, I know, cheesesteaks are very subjective, so i ain't gonna bother subjecting you to my opinion other than to say Pat's is good. It's nostalgic. Get a Provolone WIT if you are dainty or get a Whiz WIT if you want it the way it was invented.

And they have "roaches" which is how their roasted hot chile peppers are referred to on the street. Roaches make the steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You come here for the tradition, history and food. Plain and simple. The line is long but moves fast. Know what you want to order and listen to what the staff tell you because they don't like repeating themselves. Enjoy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The BEST cheesesteak.  I drive to Philly a few times a year just for their cheesesteak and then come right back home.  You must try it "wid" cheese whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrated.. the people are pompous... last time there a out of town customer criticized the price and an employee came out near my boys and I and acted like he was gona fight the guy. Go to Philips! Better and nicer people.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've know about Pat's and Geno's for years but never had the chance to visit Philly. Finally visited and decided I had to try the Philly cheesesteak. Lined up for 20mins and ordered a Provolone wit and some cheese fries. It was an average sandwich. Fairly dry meat. Boring sandwich. These cheese fries were a bit salty and I'm not a fan of cheese whiz. So maybe not for me. But it wasn't my thing. So decided to skip Geno's. I'd say just skip it all together unless you're a cheesesteak fan and then I guess you have to visit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Over all this place was great the steak was on point and the peppers were spicy but a good balance with the sub! Be aware of when your going if it is busy in the afternoon you will need to be quick and order properly
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my favorite Philly Cheese steak place ever! Do not be fooled and walk over to Geno's because of the flashing lights, they are not worth it! Pat's has been around for years and their cheese steaks are amazing. The way to go is by ordering it with cheese wiz, onions, peppers and mushrooms. No other cheese compares! The trick is to order quickly though, because they do give you that Philly attitude! Nonetheless they are amazing and are a great spot for lunch. I highly recommend coming to check them out if in the area. Especially if you have never had a cheese steak before. If Andrew Zimmern approves their sandwiches, I do too!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in philly so we had to swing by and try.  Very yummy cheesesteak sandwiches.  Much better than Geno's.  I do wish it came with fresh mushrooms, not the sliced ones from a can.

What's up with not being able to order food and drinks at the same window?  I just find it strange.  

Its in a crappy part of town.  Many pictures of celebrities hang on the walls, so I suppose its worth your time.  

The BF says the best cheesesteaks he's ever eaten were from UC Riverside.  Go figure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What?!  Pat's is my favorite of all time.  Sure it's a tourist trap and I accept that.  But what joint isn't these days!  Nobody tops these steaks.  Hey, don't cross the street to try the competition; you'll be wasting valuable calories and money.  Just buy two of Pat's w/ Wiz, then go home and digest.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If I *had* to choose between the two rival cheesesteak places, then Pat's would win the battle. 
The cheesesteak is good and I felt more comfortable eating there than at Geno's.
From what I observed the other night, when I made my first trip to either one, I noticed that Pat's was jam packed versus Geno's and I can see why. Great people, chopped up steak and way more relaxed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whiz wit'....that's what I ordered. The first half of my sandwich had so much gristle....the second half was superb.

3 star sandwich, 4 stars total for the great experience and history.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was at Pat's at around 2am with my former gf and her best friend.  The place has an old school East Coast charm (or attitude...if you're not used to it) and the cheese steaks are the best.  There's nothing like Pat's in the West Coast.

I can't throw my hat in the Geno's v. Pat's debate, but Pat's set the bar pretty high.  Be sure to bring a Philly friend if  you're visiting for the first time.  They're always busy and have rules on how to order.  I wish there was something like this in the SF Bay Area.  Gaining 10 pounds of fat couldn't be more tasty!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Amazing. Great taste. Excellent bread and meat. Kicks Geno's ass. Only flaw would be the $11 price tag and $3.50 for a fountain coke but hey you get what you pay for. Pats over Geno's ‍
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nice bread, though the grilled beef could have been more tender. Nothing fantastic despite of the hype and long queue.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've had Geno's about 4 years ago and wasn't impressed. From what I remember, It was pretty bland. Now I can say the same for Pat's. I've made better cheese steaks at home! They could at least sprinkle a little bit of seasoning on it. They must be doing something right because they always have a line. I can take my $9.50 elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Great classic cheesesteaks. Fast service. Don't forget to say "wiz" for cheese wiz. Line was shorter than Geno's. Good weather today but we found seating easily.
I think it's better with provolone cheese and onions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had to get a cheese steak sandwich in Philly. Since I was in the area, I had to try the best. I had the cheez whiz wit onions and I wasn't disappointed. The sandwich was filled with meat and the bread held it's own. Very yummy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Been going to Pat's for 20+ years , when ever we go up for the Ball or The Penn or to visit friends, Pat's is consistent and always tasty. I grew up in Delaware and Center City as I got older into my late teens early 20s. When you come for the first time its a must see/do.( I always get one for there and one for the road home)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Long line but it goes damn fast. 

You've got to get this if you're in Philly because it's a classic, but I wouldn't say it was out of the world. Make sure you get it with cheese whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As I mentioned in my other post for Geno's...you really can't go to Philly without getting a Philly cheese steak from either of these kiddy-corner spots.  It's a tourist-y thing to do but you should try it.  Grab a steak from each of the places and share with someone else so you don't get too stuffed up and compare.

I actually found Pat's a bit better than Geno's the particular night I went.  The bread was a little softer and the condiment bar was much better.  I couldn't get enough of the hot peppers here. Just the right amount of sour and spice to add to your cheesesteak.  I would've come here just for the peppers. 

But either way, when you go out of the way from the city to come here to try a cheese steak, might as well try both sides.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The birth place of Cheesesteaks, of course I had to try it. Similar to my review for Geno's though, I have to say that sadly this place does not live up to the hype. I always order "whiz/wit mushrooms" so that I can properly compare and my findings is that at Pat's the meat is so so and the cheese to meat ratio leaves a lot to be desired. Additionally, the mushrooms are scooped up and added after the sandwich is made, resulting in a soggy mess. As with Geno's I have to say that at least I gave it a shot once.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went here with a friend cause my friend who was visiting really wanted to try all the steak places in Philly. I took her to my fav local spots first. For me, Pat's is so-so. Nothing to jump up and down about. I'm a local born and raised and I've had a lot better at other places. My friend even agreed that the other places we went to had better steaks. She wasn't that over impressed (I wanted to say I told you so) Most likely we will not go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm a huge philly cheesesteak fan.  I've eaten philly cheesesteaks in San Diego, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Orlando, and Phoenix.  I've eaten philly cheesesteaks in Mom and Pop restaurants as well as chain restaurants.  When I heard in November that my daughter's club volleyball team was playing a tournament in Philadelphia, I knew I had to eat a philly cheesesteak at the birthplace of philly cheesesteaks, which was Pat's King of Steaks.

My daughter and I touched down in Philadelphia at 10:30pm and after getting our rental car, we set out to find Pat's.  After driving through a working class neighborhood and very narrow streets, we were finally able to find a parking space close to 12am.  Parking and driving through the Passyunk neighborhood to walk to this philly cheesesteak mecca is stressful and a little tough.  Pat's doesn't have their own parking area.  You actually have to be lucky at that time of night to find a spot.  Fortunately for us, we had a very tiny Toyota Yaris rental car that can fit anywhere.  We were able to find parking really close to this cheesesteak mecca.  I call it a mecca because not only is there Pat's selling cheesesteaks, but just across the way is Geno's.  Both walk up and order restaurants are brightly lit with neon lights and there are throngs of people anxious to eat a good philly cheesesteak.  Even at midnight on a Thursday very early morning, there was a line of people waiting to order.  I don't know if it was such a good idea to bring my 16 year old, but this philly cheesesteak fanatic had to try the original cheesesteak.  My kid got exposed to the homeless, foul mouth patrons, and people smoking like chimneys.  I recommend you go to Pat's in the daytime or early evening.  Despite these things, the first thing I had to have when I got to Philly was a cheesesteak.

For the uninitiated, there is a way to order a cheesesteak.  Luckily, there's a sign that explains how.  There are two windows where you place your orders.  One window just for cheesesteaks and the other for fries, drinks, and anything but cheesesteaks.  Here's how you order:  Order steak wit (with onions) or without, choose what cheese, which I went with the original cheese wiz, but there are other cheese choices, and that's it.  I highly recommend the fries.  The original Pat's King of Steaks cheesesteak was just okay.  Don't get me wrong, I engulfed my large sandwich, but it wasn't spectacular.  The meat was dry and the bread was difficult to bite.  The cheese wiz with the meat was tasty, but I like real cheese with more tender meat.  Loved the crunchiness of the fries.  After you order your food, there are plenty of picnic benches to enjoy your meal.  As you eat, you can also gaze at the framed pictures of celebrities who have experienced the famous Pat's.

The 3 stars is for my actual experience eating a Pat's philly cheesesteak.  I've definitely had better and only chose Pat's because Pat's is the OG, the pioneer, the inventor of philly cheesesteaks.  If you're a philly cheesesteak fan, Pat's is a must visit because that's where it all started.  Next time, I'll try Geno's to see which is the better of the two philly cheesesteak giants.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is better than genos ................. then you also have the ppl that will always just say somewhere else is better just to be different .  

The service is fast, proportion is good and taste great. The meat is cut up small and then comes the cheese wizzzz no onions for me tho.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Food is great they always open , their hours are so convenient to me because I work overnight so all I have to do is call and they got my order ready by the time I go to pick it up . Im definitely be going back again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came to this busy street corner from queens! I really enjoyed my extra cheese steak "WIT" (with onions)! And the cheese fries are so SO good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Headed here after the game on Sunday. There was a shorter line at pats than Geno's so went there instead of our first choice. Waited for about 3-4 mins as our group of 6 was next in line. Nobody was helping the guy in front of us so we asked the young guy at the window if they were taking orders. He made a wise crack comment but nothing bad. Waited another minute "no seriously are you taking orders?"  Some old dude inside heard us ask again and out of nowhere starts repeating what we said and then tells us to "get the f out of here". Okay. Done. We complimented him on his attitude and level of customer service before we headed over to Geno's and took another 5-6 people with us.  Being a city staple and a tourist trap apparently allows you to be an a-hole?  No thanks. Won't be going back there again. Recommend the tourists find other places (that are better anyway).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The day after going to Geno's we came back to try out Pat's. It was pretty close between the two but I think Geno's bread was a little better. Any local that says they are a tourist trap is right because there will be a lot of them there but they are also better than the "local steak" places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My buddy Kevin and I were on business in Philly, so of course we decided to check out the cheesesteak scene.  2 famous places in Philadelphia are Pats and Geno's.  They are conveniently right access the street from one another.  We started at Pats.  They chop the steak they put on their sandwich.  Of course we got onions, and wiz basically we asked for the cheesesteak that made them famous.  It was good.  The roll was delightful and I was very happy with a tasty cheesesteak.  We then went across the street to Geno's.  Their meat is sliced not chopped.  We asked the same of Geno's, serve us the cheesesteak that made you famous.  The meat appeared to be soaking in an au jus  which mixes amazingly well with the cheese sauce.  The texture of the meat was good as were the onions and the roll.  All in all I have to give the victory to Geno's but I can see why some prefer Pats.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Still good after all these years. My favorite was always Tony Luke's but this was always a close second and definitely better than Genos. A must to experience if you want the true experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
King of what? Give me a break.

Is that meat or plastic? And what's that yellow paste you call "Cheese Wiz"? Tastes like paint. If I had to choose between Pat's or Geno's - I'd go to Geno's. Not saying they make a stellar steak but I think the quality is a notch above this place.

So why do people come here and more importantly, why did I? Because ever since we heard of this thing called a "cheesesteak", we were told by friends and family, who themselves were duped into believing Pat's (and Geno's) was the place to go!

This place might have lived up to its' slogan 10 or 15 years ago but after taking one bite of their sandwich, you realize that ship has sailed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came to Philly for work and, of course, HAD to try one of their infamous cheesesteaks. The line was long, but moved fairly quickly. There are two lines with no signage: one for steaks and one for other necessities (fries, drinks, etc). I saw a lot of people waiting on the fries line for steaks and getting rightfully angry when the people at the registers directed them to the other line. 

The sign right before the register gives you your options: steak with cheez whiz, provolone, etc, and with/without onions. I got cheez whiz and onions and it was AMAZING! For the cheese whiz phobes, it's not the fluffy cheese that comes out of a can. It tastes/looks like melted American cheese. My co-worker got the provolone and it didn't look that appetizing, as it wasn't melted. But she said it was delicious as well. 

Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteaks are alright but meat is not as juicy as Geno's. Went to both and the workers at Pat's are rude and nasty. When I went to Geno's across the street they knew how to talk to customers. Customer service is very important along with the quality of food. I'm sure with as many sales they make a day they don't care what I think but I will not go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came here back in march, and i must say, its alot better than their competitor, Geno's. I had Geno's first, but after, even thoufh i was already full, Pats came out on top as far as taste and texture. Already being full, i still finish the cheesesteak cuz it was that damn good, pardon my french! So if ur ever in the neighborhood, trust me, go to Pats King of Steaks!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: good, but pricey! both them and genos are pricey but hey, I would be too. If people are buying, charge!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is pretty good for a must trafficked tourist cheesesteak joint. Also waaay better than Geno's.

They serve it chopped style, and a "whiz wit" style is chopped steak, onions, and wiz slathered all on top of it. Delicious, but more oily and less flavor in the meat than other cheesesteak joints I liked (like Jim's). Still, very decent and worth a visit if you are in the area. If you are a visitor and have time for cheesesteak-touring, you should give Pat's/Geno's a try but DEFINITELY try the other highly rated steak places.

Service is really nice, friendly, and they look like they are having fun here. My friend had to order a 'steak with provolone for a friend and he got hassled, but it was all in good humor.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Look, do yourself a favor and eat here. You will not be disappointed. While this place is very touristy, it's worth it. The steaks are perfect, the toppings are great, and you will be supporting a local landmark. A+++
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We got two subs with provolone. They were filled with thick, tough and grisly meat and served with complete indifference. The fries sucked and the soda wasn't even cold. And they don't have a bathroom. How does that sound for 30 bucks?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I had no idea whether to choose Pat's or Geno's. As my belly was already happy due to a stop at Five Guys (cajun fries holla!), we decided we would pick the one with the most people at lunch hour. Pat's had a few more people..not a big difference. But I found their decor to be less tacky, more classy (as classy a cheesesteak joint can be).

Ordered a whiz wit (cheese whiz + fried onions), cost $9. I was kind of upset that a huge glob of whiz was on the paper and not in the sandwich bc that shit was hard to pick up with the bun. What a waste. I still tried earnestly to mop up the lonely cheese to no avail. 

I don't know what all the hate is about. I found my cheesesteak to be very enjoyable and sharing it was perfect. Eating the whole thing would have definitely been too much and not fun. It was my goal to have an authentic philly cheesesteak and obviously it isn't going to be a gourmet dining experience, but isn't that half the fun? 

Overall three stars because it was a simple sandwich and the prices are exorbitant and I think the quality of the meat and bread were mediocre.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: GREAT PHili chesse steaks!! GREAt amount of meat, awsome seasoning and their Frys were awesome!! Loved it and and would go there again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pretty good. Steak and onions kind of watered down flavored for some reason. Staff were very nice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I will try Geno next time.   No big deal at Pat's.  The sandwiches are A-Ok, though I prefer the philly sandwiches from costco.  For $8, yeah I will go with costco.  French fries are good, cost is $5.  All cash only. 
Parking is horrific but roam around and eventually someone will leave.
In my opinion, not worth the waiting.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Way to hyped. Its solid, overpriced, below average customer service. The one across the street is not much better either. 

Had better philly's in almost every other city. So sad.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's good drunk food.  The last 2 trips out there I've had it and the meat was a little tough.  I only go there now because they make it with Wiz, which is a lot better.  but if you get one without any tough meat, it's the best AND ORIGINAL steak in town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best Philly cheesesteak in my mind!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Stop #2 in the Cheesesteak adventure.  

The sandwich was good - provalone, no onions.  The meat was a little tastier here, but the bread a little less crisp.  The outdoor temp made the sandwich cold quickly.  But it was good - not great.  Nothing to totally write home about.  

Bonus star for not having giving a heaping serving of bad politics on the side.  Minus that same star for having pepsi products.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My friend's from NY wanted to go to Pat's and Gino's to check out their fare.
Ordered a cheesesteak from each.

Turns out the bread from Pat's is better but the cheesesteak from Gino's is better..
Maybe they shold combine efforts!
Both places are reminiscent of a hot dog truck!  There is only limited outdoor seating!
Cash only and they tell you to be ready to order when it's your turn at the window with cash ready!

And though this is the place to go for cheesesteaks , I got an 'ok' hotdog

Ordered the cheesefries as well...they were oober greasy with yummy chz whiz!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was in town for the weekend of the 4th and hit up Pat's and Geno's at the recommendation of Roadside America. We bought a cheese steak from each location and split them in half to try both sides of the street. In the end we both felt Pat's had the superior cheese steak, though not by much of a margin. The meat was more flavorful and the roll was much better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not a fan of Genos or Pat's. They were both either rubbery or dry and the amt of stk used is very little.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very awesome cheesesteak!!   Lines are crazy long but move real fast.  Make sure you know what you are ordering and have your money ready.   Not the friendliest staff but that comes with the whole vibe at Pat's.  Cheesesteaks are great!!   Always on point.  Outdoor seating is limited but usually always can grab a table.  Place is open 24 hours which is a plus when spending the night in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Going to reprise my review from Geno's, as I literally feel the same way about Pat's. So much for celebrity, eh? Needless to say, my friend was not super impressed with the cheesesteaks I showcased to him on day 1. Don't worry, it got better. 

Again, definitely an experience, but not one I'd like to repeat anytime soon. You gotta see it once, you gotta do it once, you gotta put the damn thing in your mouth once, even if it's just to say you have. Philly tradition and all that. 

Problem is, the cheesesteak itself is pretty bad. Bread is ok, meat is sliced and bland and dry, can't be rescued by any toppings you choose to add to it. Brought my friend who was visiting from home, came here, and promptly left feeling a little bit more poor and a little bit more sad having wasted stomach space on this (second!) log of mediocrity.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Cheesesteak Challenge
The best thing about Pat's is that Geno's is across the street. You can have one of each and decide for yourself who is the cheesesteak king. You can only pay with cash and have it ready! The workers at Pat's won't hesitate to yell "next" if you aren't moving fast enough (decide what you want before you get to the window). Also if you want onions order it "wit." Cheese Whiz is the traditional topping, so I went with that. The steak is chopped into small pieces. Drinks and fries are ordered at the next window. Again, have your cash and order ready. Pat's gave me the philly flair and atmosphere I had expected. It put a smile on my face!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been to Pat's before, but decided to do a Geno's/Pat's taste test. So, I got a cheesesteak w/whiz and onions - or a whiz, wit (however you say that) from each one. 

Here's what you get at Pat's:
toasted very chewy bread
a LOT of thicker meat
a LOT of whiz

You know, I'm normally all for MORE, but not in the cheesesteak game. The items didn't fully mesh with each other. 

The results of my taste test? Geno's wins,. hands-down. I won't be eating at Pat's again and will keep myself across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love it. Best cheesesteak and great service. The workers are very friendly and you get your cheesesteak within seconds.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am Pat's guy.  Wizz Wit.  Cheese fries.  Heaven.  Oh and the often-neglected peppers and pickled items are damn good too.

This stuff is freakin awesome.  Every time I go to Philly I MUST eat here... typically right after I land at PHL.

Spongebob Awesomess: 4 steak krabby patties with lots of cheez wiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This could easily be 4 stars if Pat's was... cleaner. 

I stopped by Philly during my tour de East, and of course I had to try both Pat's and Geno's. I think I tried Geno's several years ago, but I can't be sure. Anyway, after stuffing my face with a mediocre sub from Geno's, I headed across the street to meet my friends at Pat's. I ordered a cheesesteak with onions and wiz. The cute cashier took my cash, handed me change and then with NO gloves (or soap), grabbed by sub, smoother it with cheese, wrapped it up and handed it to me. WTF!? I told my friends about it, and they said "so what, it's good." I said a little prayer and took a bite. They were right. It is good. I'm not sure what is it because I ordered the same exact thing at Geno's, but Pat's was way better.

I like to eat (a lot!) but I certainly couldn't down two subs in one sitting. I took two bites of Pat's, and took the rest home. I am happy to report that it was still delicious the next morning. 

If you're ever at the intersection and you can't decide, choose Pat's. Just ask them to use gloves.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had the cheese steak with provolone. It was ok and it cost more than Geno's. It was worth the trip. Give it a try for yourself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Gino's but still not the best cheesesteak I've ever had. Wouldn't waste my time coming here again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: After trying Geno's, I walked across the street to taste Pat's Steaks and get the comparison.  I liked the sandwich and it tasted great.  It's a bit different tasting than Geno's is.  I have a feeling that true Philly Steaks taste more like Pat's than Geno's.  They're pretty close as far as taste goes, it all depends on what you are in the mood for.  Try it out!  It's the debate of the century!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite cheesesteak place ever no place can beat it. It also has good cheesefries
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was told that Pat's was a must visit in Philly, so upon arriving this was our first stop after the hotel. The fact that it is open 24hrs was a even bigger plus. The location and parking of Pat's is horrible, we dove around for at least a hour looking for a spot on super small one way streets. Finally after finding parking we arrived to a line around the block. While in the line it is basically a block party going on since there are so many people everywhere and natives parking illegally wherever they could. Looking at several tables of people eating while in line we decided that we did not want the infamous cheezwiz philly cause it looked utterly disgusting with cheezwiz running down the fingers and hands of the customers eating them. We ordered the classic philly with mushrooms and onions and provolone. The amount of workers in the building was crazy, it was like an assembly line with cooked meat piled high. The sub were slapped together in a few secs and that's how they keep the line moving. The sub was was horrible, meat was cold and bread was hard. We also ordered fries with cheezwiz which was a big mistake. The cheezwiz made me sick to my stomach and not want to eat cheese ever again. Bottom line Pat sucks and the mom and pop places are better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Meh, if you love flavorless meat then check this place out!!!  Went across the street to Geno's and litlerally the identical cheesesteak with no flavor. Personally I've had better cheesestake in California lol.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
best philly cheesesteak i've ever had!! way better than Genos! Plus who wants to support a racist establishment like Genos?

Order your cheesesteak with whiz! way better than any other cheese available.

Beware: know your order before you reach the window. They'll make you go to the back of the line. so be ready!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes, this place is famous.  That is why I went there.  I had to see for myself.  I selected the cheesestake wit onions, peppers, mushrooms and provy.  It was very good.  The four others with me enjoyed theirs as well.  I took a few minutes, read the signs and watched how to order.  They guy taking the orders was not paitent with newbies like me and I didn't want to get kicked out of line for not being ready.  :)   Overall, very good.  Best cheesesteak ever?  I don't know, the jury is still out.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's and no other. The wife and I did both Pat's and Geno's, and the only way I could get Geno's steak down is with a Goose Island IPA at the Garage Bar across the street. Pat's meat is chopped, but is very tender and juicy, seasoned well. The bread has just the right amount of chew, with the wiz and onion bringing out a creamy, tangy finish. I give Pat's thumbs up!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Way better than Geno's let me tell ya!!! Bread was much better and meat was good as well. One flaw is the cheez whiz why not make ur own cheese sauce :-)
Other than that best cheesesteak hands down. Shut down Geno's :-)))
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Average at best. Slightly better than their competitor across the street but I won't rush back anytime soon. Fries were tasty. 
The meat was somewhat dry and hard to chew despite all the added grease. Flavorless. You knew it was meat, that's all. It could have been the blandest cut of all cuts. 
I wish I had done the usual check on yelp prior to going there but I'd seen this place and its competitor across the street on TV many years ago and didn't bother to second guess that. Good amount of tourists there, I thought. I would not recommend it. Way better spots here in nyc.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: DON'T SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE. At first I was very excited to eat here after seeing this place on the travel channel but my brother and I went here and had the absolute worse service. We placed our orders and everything came out except my brother's fries. We told them we were still waiting on fries and instead of finishing our order, they lied and said it was already given to us and that they refused to given them. So they laughed and said it wasn't their problem and continued to ignore us. Not only was their service horrid but their philly cheesesteaks were completely and utterly garbage. $20 for a garage sandwich and fries is a waste of money at Pat's. I highly recommend going to Geno's across the street for much better service, food, and experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is terribly mediocre. I had really high hopes (for unknown reasons) and Pat's failed to meet pretty much any of them.

Its an average sandwich at an above average price.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: From a Detroiter who would vote Lafayette Coney over American Coney ANY day, this Yelper votes hands down that Pat's is FAR superior to Geno's in the Philly Steak world. The meat is leaner, the Cheese Whiz is thicker, and the fries are tastier. Hail, Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Totally overrated.  What's the hype about this place?  I just don't get it.

The steak they use is nothing but cheap, and you can tell.  The cheese doesn't properly melt.  And those are the worst sauteed onions I've had in a long time.

Sad to say it, I think Steak Escape at the mall is tastier than this place.  And cheaper, too. 

2 stars because at least the fries were tasty.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What else need to be said.....wiz-wit........and a couple of red hots...oh yea!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The question asked was where to go for a cheese steak and answer is usually Pat's. So we went and tried the cheesesteak wit Wiz and a pizza steak. Both were very good I'm a fan and will stop by when I'm in town again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
this place is a tourist trap, not a quality steak place. You're better off going to Campo's, John's Roast Pork, Jim's, or Tony Luke's. All are far superior quality and won't treat you like garbage. Only advantage is that this place is open 24/7 so if you're a drunk college kid I guess this would serve. 

One other recommendation- if you're looking for an alternative to the classic cheesesteak, check out DiNik's Roast Pork in the Reading Terminal Market. The market itself is only open until 6pm most days so you can't run in for a late dinner, but it's worth both the lines and the tough hours. The sandwiches are outstanding, and would honestly be my preference for Philly's real sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
