text: I love the South Philly style steaks but prefer Steve's Prince of Steak and Tony Luke's to Pat's- they don't deserve the "king" in their name anymore.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yum. 
Steak, onion, whiz.  Great bread. Simple. Totally worth the stop. 

Is it the best? Probably not. But it's damn good, and hits the spot every time.  

You can argue whose is better, but I've been to Geno's, Pat's, and tons of local spots, and they're all good. But there was something a bit better about Pat's, not sure what it was, but it had a better flavor than Geno's in my opinion. 

Otherwise, it is what it is. A dumpy walk-up counter to order cheesesteaks. Not sure what people expect, but I enjoy it every time I go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was dinner time when we got here. Found an excellent parking spot right next to it. There was a short line that gave us time to decide what we wanted. We were torn on coming here or trying their rivalry Genos. (across the street) we ordered and it was ready within minutes (if that) The steaks were delicious and those cherry peppers were even better. I'm glad we made a stop here and tried the original steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
i maybe wouldn't give pat's 5 stars if it weren't the epic battle between pat's and geno's. because pat's isn't the most amazing cheesesteak i've ever had, but it definitely beats geno's, and i'll admit it's pretty darn good on its own too.
last time i was in philly, i tried both. had to see who was better. the cheese whiz was what won me over, pat's was totally cheesier and less of a mess.
so this time, i knew which one i wanted, and i was just here to enjoy, not judge. i got one without onions and with cheese whiz, my boyfriend got one with onions and cheese whiz, and we split some fries. i was jealous that somehow his had way more cheese than mine, but what can you do? the fries were super tasty too, which i was almost surprised they'd both to put effort into anything but the cheesesteaks! haha
if you've never been to a food stand (yeah, i'm going to call it that instead of a restaurant, and if you go here, you'll see why) like this, be prepared with your order and money ahead of time, cuz they don't appreciate waiting, questions, or special requests. that being said, that makes them super efficient. our sandwiches were out in less than a minute.
now, prices. 2 standard cheesesteaks is $19. our fries and 2 drinks were $9 i believe. a little on the pricey side, but then again, with all the tourists flocking here, they can afford to charge a little more, understandably. but be prepared, they're cash only as well.
you go to pat's for the food, and the food alone. not the atmosphere (a few outside tables, covered from the rain but certainly not the wind), the prices (not outrageous, but still probably three times what it actually costs them to make the food), or the people (sometimes i wonder if they actually all just hate their job). but let me tell you, if you're looking for a real philly cheesesteak in the heart of philly, pat's is where you want to go!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overpriced, outside, cheap ingredients...add to that one of the trashiest collections of patrons in the city, and you've got a real loser.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
4.5 Stars?  Oh please!

Alright, since no one else will say it, I will:

This is the worst cheesesteak anywhere in the world.  It skimpy, over priced and barely edible (on a good night).

Pats and Genos compete with each other...Yeah, they certainly do.....to see who can charge the most for disgusting inedible food!

It's embarassing that our famous (and yummy) chesesteak is so closely related with this place!

PR at it's very best.
That is all....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Because of Pat's reputation, I had to go try their cheesesteaks. I usually see an enormous line and a lot of customers, but I went on a weekday at around 4PM and there wasn't really many people. Of course, I ordered the wiz wit, cheesesteak with cheese whiz and onions. It was really good. The meat wasn't dry or too greasy. The bun could have been a little more toasted to my liking though. I had some cherry peppers on the side to add some extra spice to the overall cheesy taste of the sandwich. It tastes exactly what you expect a cheesesteak should taste. I can see why a lot of people visit. It's famous for a reason.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheese steak was dry and salty.  Tasted a bit better than Geno's, but not by much.  Order the mushroom one, but came without?!!  Place is over rated.  Not worth the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: After trying very subpar cheesesteaks in central city that were supposedly "the best" finally found the absolutely best!!! OMG! What flavor and not too much bun but even it was delicious! Pat is the King!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not all it's cracked up to be. Go to a non tourist place for a better steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So bad it's not even worth the drive. Totally overated. Don't bother. The cheese steak had essentially no flavor. Meat was bland. The only thing I tasted was the whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fun to come here once, but the meat isn't as good as you can find at other places. Haven't tried Geno's yet, but now that I live here I know I'll go there sooner or later. Plus one star for the tradition.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My brother visited me in Philly and really wanted the authentic Philly cheesesteak.  We were not disappointed.  They were made really quickly, and were juicy and flavorful.  Sadly, there was nowhere for us to sit - it was packed.  But that's a good sign, right?  I refused to go to Geno's on principle because of their sign about only serving people who speak English - and I don't think I'll be looking elsewhere.  Pat's is the real thing!  I was a little intimidated about ordering because they don't want you to dilly dally - but I guess that's all part of the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For my visit to Philadelphia, how could I skip the event of getting a hometown Philly Cheesesteak?  

I decided to go to Pat's because Geno's was a little too flashy for me with their bright Times Squre-like signs.  The lines were equally long, which made me wait in line with drool coming down my mouth from all the great greasy smells.  

After finally settling down at a table with my cheesesteak, I was happy.  Then I ate and it was tasty!  I would've liked a little more meat... the meat to bread ratio was not a good one.  The only other problem is that I've been to 99 miles to Philly in NYC now, and I like it a lot better.  It's closer to home, the sandwiches are meatier, and cheesier!  hah.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great cheesesteaks! So good to have even on a cold night (benches are outdoors). Only thing-prices are a little high. Other than that, well worth the trip and dealing with the cold. In the summer it must get packed but it seems like Wednesday nights are when to go so there's no line.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Been to Pat's too many times to count.  I consider Pats to be the yardstick to compare all cheese steakks to, and yes, many are not nearly as good or should not even be considered cheese staks, and occasinally, some joints are better.  Over all, Pat's does not ever disappoint though, the bread is a big part of it, and Pat's rolls are excellant.  Great condiments too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you're a tourist and want a real Philly cheesesteak, don't go here. The beef is dry and the roll is sub par. Go to Tony Luke's or Cleavers if you want something legit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you need neon and kitsch with your cheesesteak, go to Geno's.  Not enough "flavor" for you?  Add relish and ketchup, that's why it's out.  This isn't Tom Colicchio's gourmet cooking, it's a cheesteak.  Bread, steak, cheese, onions if desired.  Tourists, they couldn't spell out the ordering instructions any more clearly (http://flickr.com/photos/agreatnotion/172834329/) so don't act like it's super confusing and hold up the line.  Wit or witout and pick a cheese (wiz wit all the way).  If you can't handle that go back to McDonald's and hold up the line there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have not yet tried Geno's so I can't compare, but I thought Pat's was okay. I ordered a cheesesteak whiz with and mushrooms. I can't help but notice that the whiz is watered down - which makes for a very messy eating experience, more so than I already assumed it would be. 
I understand its a tourist attraction and very popular, but we barely found a place to sit down and i felt like we were being watched like hawks the whole time, which made me feel uneasy and subconsciously made me eat too fast, haha 

Next time I'll try another place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tasty cheese steak served hot and clean and fresh with crispy French fries and a cherry lemonade.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
**WHY 3 STARS?**
Their cheesesteaks are nothing spectacular, but they are good. I'm sure you can find a better cheesesteak out there, especially in Philly, but this is the original, and perhaps a cheesesteak is only supposed to taste as simple as this. It's a couple of simple ingredients put together, and it works. You learn to appreciate it, just as you would appreciate a good grilled cheese. It's not something I would want to eat too often, but I do like it every once in while.

**Favorites**  Wit. Whiz. Eat with pickled cherry peppers. Cheese fries.

**Recommend?** I would bring out-of-towners here if they're interested in trying the "original" Philly cheesesteak. I prefer it over Geno's.

The more cheesesteaks I eat from here, the more I like this stuff.  When I had my first Pat's cheesesteak many, many years ago when I was a little girl, I wasn't impressed.  At all. I thought, "This is the sandwich Philly is famous for?" That was when I didn't know how to appreciate the flavor of Cheese Whiz.

Yes, my friend, the main flavor of this famous cheesesteak is from the Cheese Whiz.  Melded together with the fatty juices of the thinly sliced beef, it provides the perfect complement for the otherwise bland meat. If they happen to skimp on the Whiz (which happens sometimes!) then the cheesesteak suffers in flavor. The bread is nothing special, IMO, but it's an Amoroso roll. In fact, it can get really soggy after the sandwich sits for a while, but it stays chewy! The soft bread allows the flavorful cheese and juices to soak into the bread and you get this soft chewy goodness enrapturing the pile of meat. Unless you can't stand onions, definitely get it "wit onions."  The finely chopped onions add a nice subtlety to the flavor profile. Go get some pickled peppers if you like spicy.  Eat them all together and it becomes the perfect cheesy meaty goodness slathered inside a bread roll.

Cheese fries are good, if you eat them fresh.  Otherwise, the cheese and fries themselves can get chewy and/or soggy.  The regular fries are only ok.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak was good, but relative to expectations and other restaurants in the area, not incredible.  Pats cheesesteak tasted familiar, like I've had it in Ohio... which was not exactly what I was looking for but, again, pretty good.

Three stars to me is good, I liked it, but I wouldn't be a regular.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As far as Philly Cheesesteaks go, Pat's really not that bad as many people I've come into contact with have claimed. I give it a 3.5 on a 5 point scale. It may not be the best out there but I would suggest if you haven't had it, are traveling to Philly, have the time to sightsee and are curious, just do it. It will be worth the experience at least once. I had the Mushroom Pepper Cheesesteak w/o Onions and with Wiz and I can say that I really don't regret it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: its way way better than the dog food Genos is serving, but they skimp on the meat and cheese, so double up on that business.  the line is insane but moves pretty fast.   worth the trip and if you are only going to try one, pick pats for sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If Philly's Best in Pasadena California Gets 4 stars then you people should be giving Pats A definite 5  Id give it a 7 if I could
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm doing a similar review for these two rivals - I loved Geno's and Pat's. They were both amazing!! Four of us went to try both of these amazing cheesesteaks, two of us got Geno's and two of us got Pat's then we just split them. We all went back and fourth on which one we liked better but both were great. Pat's bread was nice and fluffy with the meat first then the onions and then the cheese on top. There was a lot more cheese on Pat's cheesesteak and the meat was similar to Geno's but fuller and not as juicy. Both of these were awesome. You have to try these two if you are in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Genos was better than Pats

Wouldn't drive to do it again but coming from DC made for an interesting trip.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My husband is from Philly so the cheese steaks being wrong in Florida is all I here about. On a trip to Philly last Summer we hit this place up on out way back to the airport. Phenomenal! I never understood why a cheese steak in Florida doesn't taste the same, now I do! It's been about 8 months and we're both jonsing for a Pat's cheese steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm guessing though out the years their cheese steak got a bit too plain..  No offense or anything, i still love this place very much.  The beef now are less juicy and the cheese has to melt more.  As for the cheese fries, they were good but there wasn't enough cheese!  The price for one whole cheese steak is around $10 now, and the cheese fries?  I don't even know.  But it's pretty cheap of them not to give the customer more cheese.  And usually its better if you pour it out from your cup so that you're able to scoop the cheese to the fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Anytime we're in Philly, we HAVE to stop by Pat's. Cheesesteak was overcooked & dry, but still good. If you want melted cheese, get cheez whiz. Service was good, but language was a bit dirty, in both ways. I'm thinking that's probably normal in this neighborhood. Oh, and half the peppers were good, but they ran out of hot chocolate. 
:-/ If you want a really good cheesteak, go to Tony Luke's or Chinks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pros: cheesesteaks served up without racism (I'm looking at you, Geno's). The condiments are great-- hot pepper bar is great. Got my order in about 30 seconds.  

Cons: Premade and cold, which is why I got my order in 30 seconds. The cheese on my provolone with was not even close to being melty because the whole thing was cold. All this for $9.50? Fuck that.  

If you're looking for a cheesteak don't go to a tourist trap. Little local pizza places are invariably better, though I will say that Jim's on South and 4th is quite good, fresh to order as you watch.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I pretty much agree 100% with Chrissy R. and I can't think of anything I could say that probably hasn't been covered in the 539 reviews prior to me but here I go anyway.

I need to check on this but I'm pretty sure they source the same ingredients from the same places as their rival across the street. So, arguments on steaks are pretty much moot. The difference? Pat's chops their steaks up. Geno's does not.

So that awkwardly tough steak is a lot easier to eat than Geno's just due to the nature of their preparation.

Bonus: Pat's isn't lit up like a tattoo parlor and the place is generally more inviting.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I think this place is more about the experience and history than it is about the food. Don't get me wrong. The cheesesteak with Cheese Wiz and onions was pretty good. It doesn't have flavor that pops out at you. The meat I had was much more chewy than other cheese steaks that I had. 

Service is really fast. You need to know what you want and have your money ready. From the time you order and pay not one minute goes by to when you have your food. 

After you order your sandwich then you get into another line for fries and a coke.  Which cost another $7.00 

The fries are also average in taste. But we're not soggy. In fact they were a little on the crisp side.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Legendary Cheesesteak House competing with Geno's on the facing corner. Good cheesesteaks here, as for me I prefer Geno's, I think the cheesesteaks are better. The only way to know for yourself, is to try them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Touring through PA with a bunch of friends, I requested we stop by Philly for lunch as I wanted to try a true philly cheese steak that was well, from Philly. Like everyone else, I had heard about the famous Pat's and Geno's and we decided to grab lunch at Pat's. My friend, who having tried a cheese steak here before warned me that the place wasn't going to be what I expected it to be, and now, I am warning you.

This place is damn horrible. 

For 8 bucks you get a limp, tough piece of bread with some incredibly dry meet topped off with freaking cheese whiz. Eating it, I can only think to myself what on Earth makes this place famous for its cheese steak. If not for the damn cheese whiz, it would probably be impossible to take a bite out of the sandwich.

While I only stayed in Philly for lunch, I really hope this is not the best that Philly has to offer in terms of a sandwich with which its city is known for.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My single most favorite place to go at 3am on a Sunday morning with a hot Puerto Rican lady you just met!

Seriously a must stop in Philly you can go across the street to Genos and his ignorance or you can wait in the line here and be doubly satified as you would across the street.

Philly I love ya and cant wait to come back!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I do prefer Pat's over Geno's. Though even at Pat's, the food wasn't out of this world great either. Maybe they're overhyped and I expected too much before ordering? Bottom line, good to go at least once but will not go out of my way to return.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When you think of being a tourist in Philly you think of seeing the Liberty bell and weighing in on the Pat's/Geno's debate. We tried both places and while we both felt that Pat's was marginally better, these two places are essentially the same so I might as well cut and paste my Geno's review here because the same thing can be said about both places. 

"What you basically have is a bunch of grumpy people, tired of dealing with tourists, who use an assembly line to mass produce a product using low quality ingredients. Cheese whiz and steak-umms....yum. They then charge you $9 for the experience. The fact that the city of Philly demands that you call it a cheesesteak doesn't change the fact that there are half a dozen places in my Massachusetts town where you could find a better steak and cheese for a couple bucks less. " 

A tourist such as myself has to try the place but I couldn't imagine ever going back a second time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 2 stars because the man was very rude and some of my steak was burned. Me and my husband spit a large wiz wit, it was small for a large and not really worth the $10 in my opinion! It was a nice to go across the street to see the competition but we probably won't go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I hear that Pat's used to have a really good cheesesteak a really long time ago before cheese whiz was invented.  I think they have little flavor, too much grizzle , and the cheese whiz just ruins it for me.  Im my opinion Geno's is better than pats, but Geno's isn't great either.  Im my opinion both are tourist traps.

Want an eye opener.  Go through all of  the reviews and only count the ones from Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes, I like Pat's more.. They have more selections and their meat is soft and their bread is fresh.  Selections I mean you can choose to add different toppings on your cheese steak. And I love lots of cheese wiz on top !! Nobody can recreate this taste! Great for late late night hunger!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So we finally went to Pat's for a Philly cheese steak let's be realistic here the best ?hardly, It was good then again we were hungry. The people working there were acting like they were doing you a favor instead of doing their job. The sandwich was good  but small and over priced. The outside condiments bar was with peppers etc.. was not to sanitary with bugs flying around and some people grabbing peppers with their hands yuck! I am sure there are better places than this to buy a Philly cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just went there for the first time and I have never been treated so rudely in my life.  They were impatient, insulting, and tried to charge me twice.  Also it was probably the worst cheesesteak I've ever had.  I could get a better one for cheaper in bucks county.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Two thumbs up for the steak sandwich here.  The line for this place is incredible even when it was pouring rain there.  I haven't tried Geno's which is it's competitor but maybe next time when I'm in town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheese fries are great! We did the whole steak competition w my sister and her bf across the street at the rival location. I think both are very similar. I tried the one that looks more like the underdog. The rivals are a lot flashier. It's definitely worth going and trying....it's yummy and a fun thing to do. (This competition is seen on TV)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Depending on who you talk to, the OG of cheesesteaks since 1930.  Located in South Philly, this really is a haven for a good cheesesteak..  Its a greasy, tasty, artery clogging good time.  Yep, I'm a Pat's fan.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time trying Pats and Genos in Philadelphia. Pats is definately better than Genos! Tried both at the same time and you can definately taste the difference! I ordered the cheesestake with onions and provolone on both of the sandwiches. Pats has a distinct taste and it so much juicier. Genos cheesestake taste like any other stake sandwich. I feel that I can make this at home. I'm from New York and I've been to many places where they served cheesestakes including the mom and pops or whole in a wall restaurants. When in Philly, you definately have to visit Pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Please don't be fooled into going to Pat's for a Cheesestak!!!!!! They are NOT the king of Philly Cheesesteaks!!!!! Their Cheesesteaks are Horrible!!!!  We are Philly natives and have NEVER thrown a cheesesteak away but their cheesesteaks are garbage and should be thrown in the trash. They're rude, they make you put everything on your steak yourself, the meat is tough, bland, and full of grit, and the bread is cold.  The whole experience was bad.  I never write reviews, but had to today because its sad that so many people think Pats is a good Philly cheesesteak place and its not even close. There are sooooo many others that are much better.  Larry's on City Line Ave is 100% better.  This was nothing but a complete waste of time and money for me.  Please don't make the same mistake.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here after a football game after having already tried Tony Luke's. I wouldn't say it's necessarily better but, in my opinion, the Cheese Wiz is the way to go if you come by here. Definitely get the onions too as the cheesesteaks can otherwise be too overwhelming with meat
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to check out Pat's because of all the hype. For a $10 cheesesteak I was wildly disappointed. Really not that much flavor and the bread was a little too tough for my taste. I think people should go to say they've been, but I wouldn't say it's the best philly in Philly. Next time we are hoping to check out their competitor, Gino's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Come here for a "philly steamed steak". This was my first stop on my philly cheesesteak tour and I was dissapointed. The bread was good but the quality of the beef sucked.  Literally sucked.  I was expecting flavorful, nicely cooked and seasoned steak.  What I got instead was bland "steamed" steak.

Ehh... next time I'll try T/L.  If you're here... go diagonally across.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I usually come here for an AM night run. The place usually is empty, so it is east to get a steak. The steaks themselves are decent. Only 2 offputting facts: the staff is kind of rude and really just want you to order and get out of their face, which some people won't enjoy. Also, there is only outdoor seating so some might not like that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overrated at best. Staff is not welcoming at all. Sandwich is ok at best.   Genos is better. Not by much, but better. I'd rather have a great steak at a higher price than a ok steak  every
day. Tony lukes is better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I do not recommend anyone waste their time or money at this place. I'm from Jersey but have been living in California for years. I came to visit family and was excited to enjoy a good ole cheesesteak again. I wanted the best of the best and head so much hype about pats that I had to try it. 

Big mistake! We went on a Wednesday at about 2pm... only good thing about the trip was we didn't have to stand in line, there was literally no one there. Walk up to the window and give my order and before I could even finish talking my sandwich was shoved across the counter at me... I though hmm ok I guess they are used to fast service. 
Well I realized they are not freshly made, my cheesesteak was cold, and the American cheese not melted. It honestly taste like shit. Straight into the trash it went along with my $10. 
My cousins and my dads cheesesteak was also cold... my cousin got mushrooms on top of hers which warmed the sandwhich enough to make it edible at least. 

I know this is philly but I was also kinda surprised that the customer service is so crappy and rude. Please don't support this business, there's so many amazing smaller places that are clean, friendly, and actually know how to make a cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Second worse ever, many consumed.  Next worse across street for your convenience. Rude factor marginally less here, but still would not feed to the homeless in area inday time.   Surprised at the rudeness of the whole town. Brotherly what?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's was fine- mostly good for the experience. The line wasn't too long and it moved fast.  Ordering was a little stressful. :) The cheesesteak was okay (I had the mushroom steak "whiz wit"- with cheese whiz and onions).  It tasted fine, but I wasn't blown away or anything.  

I like that Pat's is a bit more "down home" than flashy Geno's across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Let's out it this way, if you like Pat's you don't know a real cheesesteak. It is a tourist trap and people are unfortunately drawn to it by name alone. There are plenty of other cheesesteak places in Philly that far surpass Pat's. It's a good place to go if you are drunk and can't tell what you are eating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It doesn't matter what the food is like..or the service, really.  Pat's is a rite of passage when in Philly.  If you like cheesesteaks, then you have to go to Pat's.  If you don't like cheesesteaks, you should still go.  'nuff said.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best steaks in town BY FAR!! You only go to Geno's when the line at Pat's is too long.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went here like 2 years ago and ordered without using their "lingo" and I lived to tell the tale. Why the fuss, guys?  Not curious to try it again, thanks. Far less creepy than Geno's but I think they have equivalent grease levels.  Not that I have a problem with that, but when I eat that much fat straight up I prefer it to have awesome, extra memorable flavor.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great cheesesteak from there last night.  Had one wit provolone.  Will go back next time in town for wit American cheese one.  Really good stuff from Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whew, what a line. Stopped by here to try out a Pat's and a Geno's in order to figure out which one I liked better.

Turns out, I liked Pat's better. 

The bread here is the same as at Geno's, and the meat quantity is about the same. They gave me around the same amount of mushrooms and onions, too. They actually had a lot more whiz, though, on my oily, greasy steak, so I had to appreciate that a bit more than others. However, it felt light for a sandwich - I wolfed it down and had plenty of room to go across the street, wait, and get some more.

The seating is outdoors here under the overhang, and there's ketchup, mustard, pickles (hot peppers too) and napkins outside. Sodas are expensive for size - just hold out and go to a McDonald's for more soda to drink if you really want one. Tables a bit messier than expected, though, I think they just hose them down at the end of the day.

Service was swift, blunt, and more or less what I expected out of somewhere so busy.

Overall, an okay cheesesteak that is greasy and filling but not really packed with ingredients. Satisfies but doesn't fill me, just like Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was running through town as a tourist for the day.  Had to stop and pick up a couple of cheesesteaks from here and Geno's as a comparison.  Prices are pretty much the same.  But I have to say Pat's is better.  The cheesesteak was wet and greasy, but oh so good.  Worth the trip, the lack of parking, and of course the huge lines.  The sandwiches are not that big. Suggest that you get a one from each place to share!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overpriced.  Rude employees.  Terrible, chewy, bland cheesesteaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am not biased and I like both Pats and Ginos. Both of them make exceptional cheesesteaks and give you unique experiences.

The fun starts with placing the order where they post a set of instruction on how to order a cheesesteak and they server it to you in matter of milli seconds.

Me and my husband ordered a Cheesesteak with Wiz and a Mushroom Cheese Steak with wiz.Both of them are really delicious and the beef is so succulent and juicy.

This place is definitely worth the hype and a must try place not just for cheesesteak lovers but in general food lovers.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Still one of the best.... Wit and Pro add some hot sauce or cherry peppers and you got the South Philly Italian steak sandwich.... Try two for the Rocky knock out!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Worst I have eaten. Rude, sandwich is dry and fries are cold Burger King knockoffs. Save your money and time. Go to Gooey Looies for the best sandwich and service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you're looking for authenic philly cheese steaks - this is the place to go. But be warned - KNOW how to order it BEFORE you go to the counter  (there is actually a sign that tells you the correct way to), otherwise you end up like many others who have frozen at order time - at the back of the line.

The food here is excellent! The service was also great. I ordered fries and basic cheese steak. The food carried just the right amount of cheese - not too overwhelming, nor was it not enough. 

I guess part of the reason why they want you to know HOW to order is because your food is given to you literally by the time you can even get your cash ready to pay. Make sure to have cash as they do not accept credit or debit cards. Not too sure if they offer any promotional or discounted rates for military, etc.

Food is also very reasonable in price - not too expensive for the quantity that you receive, either. My  cheese steak was about a foot long and my drink also quite large - for about  $10.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went to both Pat's & Geno's based on their reputation. I also saw a show on the travel channel about these 2 places & figured I would give them a chance.

My girlfriend & I split 1 Philly from each place so we could try them both.

Neither place was good.
Both places meat lacked flavor & the breads were soggy.

According to several locals, there are much better places to get Phillys in Philly.

** I think Publix in Tampa, FL makes a better Philly than both of these places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nasty attitudes from staff!! And how do you run out of fries on a busy day???? Steak wasn't that great.. TRY GENOS
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The good:
The original "wiz wit" was a good sandwich and filling. The line moves quickly and they are very efficient. The ambiance is exactly what you would think of a classic philly steak shop. 

The bad: 
For what you get it is a bit over priced. $20 for a sandwich, fries and a drink. 
They can be rude if you don't know what you want. 
Seating is limited when busy and that is normal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best Philly Cheesesteak sandwich in the world. There are very precise instructions posted on the wall on how to order, and if you get your order right, you will likely get your cheessteak in under 6 seconds. Amazingly good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: "pat's king of steaks"....those of us who are natives of philly called them...plain 'ole "pat's"...yes!!!! many...many..moon's ago their sandwich steaks was fantastic!!! but!!!! with any business, the more customers you have, your quality of merchandise...amount cheapens...or should i say "cut-backs" ...i know what a pat's (philly) cheese-steak taste like from over 20 years ago....very "healthy"    (loads of steak)....  cheese whiz ....... condiments of your choice (no xtra charge)  now, those from out of state, brag about these philly cheese-steaks...it's an insult....i wish those of you could, have experienced a true "Philly cheese steak" & "not" travel to Philly to eat an italian roll
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Are you kidding me!!  This place freaking sucks.  I went on a day trip to philly, and this so called 'famous' cheesesteak joint happened to be one of the places we were planning to check out.  I definitely came here because of yelp, and boy...it sucked!  

This place definitely lacked comfort.  While I was eating my cheesesteak, flies were flying into my face and mosquitoes were sucking my blood.  And they do not have restrooms!!  FYI, there is nothing special about the cheesesteak!!!!  You are better off making one yourself or grabbing a cheesesteak at a deli.  This was definitely not worth a visit.  I would never come here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
LET ME GET ONE WHIZ WIT!!

Translation?  I want a cheesesteak with cheese whiz and grilled onions.  There's a kitschy little sign that will explain things if you're about 10 people back in line and are looking for how to order.  Granted, the folks here won't make fun of you if you spell things out and say, "hi, may I have a steak with cheese whiz and grilled onions?"  I think they get enough tourists to understand.

All three time that I've gone were usually just to say we had "been there, done that" before we skittered off to Atlantic City in a vain attempt to double our pay checks.  Overall, it's another JDAM to the gut - it will keep you full and tastes even better while you're foraging for drunk food.

Top it up with sweet peppers, a little bit of spicy relish, and use liberal amounts of ketchup.  I also recommend baby wipes so you're keeping your fingers clean after - that grease has a way of persevering over most napkins.

I'd be lying if I said I wasn't going to do it again so I won't - but man, it's not the first stop in the quest for a good steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tried the Famous Pat's this evening after several recommendations from co-workers local to the area during a conference. After reading the "how to order" signs and being briefed by my co-workers ahead of time, I was disappointed of how rushed and rude the people taking the orders actually are to people who weren't familiar with these expectations when ordering. I know it's meant to be part of the "charm" of the establishment, but it takes away from the experience. The cheesesteak was OK, but very watery making the bottom of the bun very soggy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pets比較好吃
口味選擇種類多多
牛肉香又多汁
不用加醬料即可享受美食
去的人也比較多
分量大
女生兩人吃一個也可以
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Visiting Philadelphia  last April, my friends and I knew that we had to eat cheesesteaks at least twice.  We decided to hit Pat's and Geno's since we had seen these "Cheesesteak Corner" competitors featured on some TV shows.  (I have since been informed by a native that this was a poor choice and subsequently obtained better recommendations which I will try on my visit next month.)  

We ate steaks from both stands back-to-back and much preferred Pat's.  They had a more extensive menu, enabling me to add mushrooms and peppers.  It seemed more authentic too, without the slick orange signage of Geno's.  Ultimately though, the sandwiches at Pat's just plain tasted better.  Our whole group of seven agreed that Pat's was better.  

So even if I go on to have better cheesesteaks in Philadelphia, I will always have a special place in my heart for Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pretty awesome, definitely recommend the peppers and steak with whiz and fried onions....  they give you chopped steak while genos across street does not chop up the meet.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes, Pat's in South Philly does have the best Cheesesteaks in Philly.  If you ever visit Philly, this is where you need to go hands down!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak was good. The "cash only" policy and prices are definitely cons. $10 for an average cheesesteak seems a bit steep in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Wow, I thought this is suppose to be the spot. I guess the media does have an influence on peoples opinion.

Bread was dry, meat lacked flavor, and I think I had to drown it with ketchup to give it some moisture. 

Was definitely not worth the 4 mile walk to get here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The staff is super nice! The food is goooood mmmm.. Had the cheesesteak with american and onions, with a side of cheese fries. Both were a win.. Go here, not across the street :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yo Adrien, it is what it is and I can eat them three times a day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My childhood late night after drinking Rolling Rock with the guys hangout! Of course then I actually still ate meat. I drag my buddy Eric over here on the way back to the hotel, and we head up to the window. I was fully prepared to eat cheese fries. I stick my head in and said man that smells great but i don't eat meat I anymore... the guy replies "well your f*cked..." I started laughing, but then the kid on the grill says   you want cheese onions and peppers? DONE !!! Man that was one of the best grilled cheeses you could ever have. Good for that kid becoming creative and making me a meatless Philly Cheesesteak. I'm telling you... the bread the grilled onions, the grilled peppers, and the Whiz...   killer. Ordered some cheese fries and popped a bunch of hot cherry peppers on the sandwich too. I expected to get nothing, instead went home totally satisfied!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had been here 7 or 8 yrs ago and really enjoyed it..... I was back in Philly this weekend to visit my son and honestly it's just okay...... I can honestly say it's not bad and some people just don't like it because tourists go here, but I have to be honest and say the quality has dropped in my opinion and the value isn't there. Sonny's at Penns Landing was far better. To each his own.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: best cheese steak in the history of the world.  i went here 4x in one day and will go back every single time i'm in Philly.  it's 1.5 stars better than Geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Excuse me yuppie foodies who have posted on Pat's Yelp. This isn't fine dining, so adjust your expectations and enjoy the experience. Don't like being rushed at the window? Read the sign and be prepared. This was my first Philly cheesesteak. Got wiz and one w provolone. Wiz rocked. Much better compliment to the greasy onions. "wit and wiz" baby!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is exactly want I had in mind when I wanted to try a PHilly cheese steak. I was a little nervous about ordering but I guess I got it right because they didn't send me to the back of the line (like the sign says if you order wrong). The line was long but fast moving. The cheese fries looked good but we didn't try them. I got a philly wit wiz. My friend and I split one and it was more than enough for us. I'm so glad I got to eat a cheese steak from here. Definitely something to cross off my bucket list
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A friend and wanted to try both Pat's and Geno's.  He jumped in line at Pat's, and I at Geno's.  The plan was to each get 2 cheese stakes, and then swap one each for a taste challenge.

First clue, the length of the lines.  Got our steaks from Pats in under 5 minutes. Geno's took 20 + minutes.

As far as the stakes go, Geno's was MUCH better all around.   Pat's still made a great cheese steak and has enough history to be well worth a visit(s).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had some friends in from out-of-town this weekend (first Philly visit) and of course the cheesesteak was one of the main attractions.  I have taken loads of people to the historic King of Steaks, and they always love it - and so do I.  I have enjoyed this local icon countless times, in countless varieties.  Yesterday I had a mushroom steak, whiz wit - tasted as good as ever.

The argument is old as time.  Some will say Pat's, some will say Geno's, Tony Luke's, Rick's, Jim's, or any of the lesser know neighborhood spots throughout the city.  In reality, you'll get a good cheesesteak at any of these fine establishments.  But in the end, if you're in it for the experience it's got to be Pat's or Geno's.  I make this statement with the tourist in mind.  My local friends and I rarely visit these landmarks unless it's to indulge an out-of-town guest.  But I must say, explaining how to order, and the mystique that surrounds someone's first trip to the birthplace of the steak sandwich gives me a nostalgic feel.  

Although I've enjoyed more Pat's steaks than I can count, I get a special feeling when I approach the front of the line to order one of the greatest, most famed culinary creations in the world.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is definitely better than Geno's but these are both TERRIBLE. I'm from California (born and raised) and I can't believe I came here to try this even with advice from a recent local. 

My advice to tourists: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE. Go elsewhere. Go to Dinic's which is totally worth the wait and $.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went here at 1am or something on a cold night. The steak was good, but not so good that I wanted more. I remember it being extremely greasy. It was one of those "must try" things in Philly, which is the only reason I went.

The best part about my experience? The guy in the window asked if we wanted sushi. Yeah, because we were all Asian. Niiiice.

Try Jim's instead.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Took my kids to Pat's when we traveled to Philly this past weekend. 

Mediocre. Tourist trap.

The fries were awful battered things with cheese whiz (God help us). The steak was ok. The meat was good, the roll was good, the provolone was not melted and it was pretty miserable eating a steak with a few cold slabs of cheese on it.

Personally, my advice to you if you are in in Philly is to get a cheesesteak at Lee's Hoagie House. Much better steaks.  For the best cheese fries, go to any pizza place that has real (not battered) fries and will melt mozzarella on the fries for you--that is a real Philly cheese fries situation. 

Also, parking...what parking? A nightmare at best in South Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's has been my favorite place for cheese steaks. Despite the fact that there's always a long line, it usually moves fast. Prices are reasonable and the meat is well seasoned. I ordered a cheese steak with mushrooms, peppers and double provolone cheese. It was fantastic! I also love their cheese fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love Pat's but the only reason I gave it 3 stars is that the staff are complete low lifes.  They are so rude,  There is one woman working at the soda/fry counter who is really dirty looking and so ignorant.  She was yelling at an asian guy because she was having trouble understanding him. I was standing right next to him and understood him just fine.  Again, I like the steaks, but I think most of the people who work here are on a prison release program.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Having not lived in Philly in 28 years, I had to venture here.

I know it's a tourist trap, but wow, it was worse than I imagined.

The steak itself was great, and of course the roll was, but it was just bland.  The worst part?  The mushrooms, straight out of a can and dumped on top.  Glad I got this one over with.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As far as tourist traps go, Pat's is definitely the one you want to go to. Their ingredients are 100 times better than the joint across the street. 8 to 9 times out of 10, you will get an above average to great steak (especially if you like thick slices of meat). Their prices are getting way out of hand. It's $10 for a cheesesteak with extra cheese and of you want a small order of cheese fries and a drink, you're looking at almost another 10 bucks. For about $5-10 more, you might as well just go to somewhere where you can sit and be waited on.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This review is similar to my Geno's review.

I had this sub before my Geno's sub, the bread was hard, the cheese wasnt fully melted, and the onions overpowered the taste over anything else.
The workers were rude, too. I hate that, why you gotta be like that?

I dont go to Philly often, my stance on Philly is similar to Bill Burrs, meh.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Holy cheese steak this place has totally earned it's icon status based purely on it's expedited service which totally delivers a amazing tasting cheese steak. So good, I ate 3!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: These cheesesteaks are the best i`ve ever had! The only complaint i had is that it is a little overpriced but once I tasted it it was well worth ever penny!!! We both had it with wiz and provolone! The fries are awesome!!! My husband fell in love with this place and we`re definitely coming back again!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I may need a drug-eluting coronary stent soon...after eating one of Pat's flavorless cheesesteaks....I went there as a "tourist" to try an "original" Philadelphia cheesesteak... not impressed ...the meat tasted JUST LIKE a White Castle BEEF burger.... (so yeah, if you like White Castle then you will like Pat's! )  ... heartburn for daaaaays. I chose the cheesesteak "wit" provolone, mushrooms, and onions.. ugh. The bread was a toughy italian bread~if you wear dentures do not try taking a bite!!~  The joint across the street was much better... you will know what I mean if you have been there. ;)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: OK, So I'm a born & raised Philly girl. I bleed green just like any other die hard Philadelphian. I have heard  the ole "What's the best cheesesteak in Philly" debate many a time. I have been called every name in the book when I throw my opinion in the ring. To your average Philadelphia, I am a blasphemer, but as a true Philly girl, I gotsta keep it real. I'm just not into the famed Pat's. Its ok for a tourist visit, but I am not a fan of that flat "steak-Um"-like meat.  Some call it juicy, but it just tastes like a greasy mess to me. No thank you. There are plenty of other authentic establishments that will hook you up with a much better sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Dry and no flavor. Made me feel like I was in the lunch line in a prison somewhere. Overrated, and so was Geno's. Go to Max's on Germantown Avenue to get a good cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Thought you might enjoy this San Franciscan's answer to an Australian's query "Are Philly Cheesteaks available in LA?" in the TripAdvisor Los Angeles forum*:

Subject: Pat's Steaks
12 August 2000 03:13:36

In Wildwood [New Jersey] I had my very first Philly Cheese Steak ($5) in that part of the world. Because I told the order taker of my virginal status, he helped me construct it to my liking and it sure was. Yummy!

At the Steel Pier in Atlantic City I had a $6.25 Chicken Cheese Steak that wasn't worth half the price.

After a hot and humid evening of sweat-soaked dancing with the Philadelphia Swing Dance Society at the un-air-conditioned Commodore Barry Club, I went to Pat's Steaks to have a genuine, authentic, original and only real honest-t'-goodness Philly Cheese Steak. Even though the bars wouldn't close for another hour or so, the line was very long. I got in it behind a bunch of big guys who had the look of Hell's Angels but the sound and demeanor of Mafiosi.

When I told the lie that I was going to have my very first Philly Cheese Steak, those choir boys excitedly and agitatedly tried to give me the accurate information I needed to successfully negotiate the hazards of ordering. They were rapturous about what I was about to discover, they about to enjoy, and told stories about making special, very long, trips to Pat's for the real thing. "Want onions? Say `Wit'. That's all. Don't say nuttin' else. Give 'em yer money and move outta d'way. Don't hesitate. If you do, y're outta dere."

When my time came at the small window, I confidently said "Wit. And an order of 'fries". They coulda died. With all they had tried to do for and with me, I failed, they had failed. "No, no! Y'order the 'fries over there at the next window" which I did, along with an orange juice.

I joined them at a small sidewalk table and lied about the sandwich. It was not nearly as good as the one I had had in Wildwood. In fact, it was no better than the rather sad chicken version I had earlier at the Steel Pier.

pawriter said SwingCha
"Thank you for your entertaining and hilarious recount of your cheesesteak experience...I could see it happening as I read it, so descriptive was your narration, and it's been a very long time since I've had such a good laugh!!!"

*SwingCha posted to TripAdvisor's Philadelphia forum on February 11, 2008
http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g60795-i113-k704790-l10561177-Philly_Cheese_steak-Philadelphia_Pennsylvania.html#10561177
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On our way to South Philly, we asked the cab driver which he preferred, Pat's or Geno's, and without hesitation he said Pat's. When we got out of the cab, we seconded guessed his recommendation as Geno's seemed more appealing with its flashy lights. Do not be fooled! 

Pat's cheesesteaks were awesome. The meat was made fresh and the cheese was yummy. The cheese fries were just as good. I am so glad we listened to the cab driver. We walked over to Geno's afterward to see what the hype was about and the cheesesteaks did not look comparable to Pat's at all. The only negative thing I can say is that there is no restroom. 

If i wasn't already so full from the first one, I would have definitely gone back for another.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Drove 2 hours to try this "famous" cheese steak place, right across from Geno's  got there before 11am so no line at all, fast service, the meat and cheese wiz was great, however a little disappointed with the bread. When they hand me the 4 cheesesteak sandwiches, they all felt cold cause the bread was not toasted and tasted like day-old bread. So we had to go back to Sonny's just to make up for the undesirable bread we had at Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ok people, I have been lied to here...... I was told that this was the best, I made a special trip when on my way from the airport enroute to NJ to try this cheese steak sandwich, what a waste, it would have been better to leave myself beleiving that there was a better cheese steak out there that I had not yet tried, I often have better cheese steak sandwiches in San DIego than where it all started at in Philly, less than impressed, will not go back here again.... I hope that I was just there on a bad day, based on the reviews of this place it is never all that....can they spell MEDIOCRE that is the description that best describes this place........



By the way, if you do decide to eat at this place (wondering why???) do not go with the cheez Wiz, this crap is nasty, not even real cheese
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place was good. I would have liked it more if I ordered my own cheesesteak, I split one. The person I split it with put way to much cheese wiz on it and I wasnt into it that much. It was still really good and I look forward to going here again sometime
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I grew up in the Philly area and went to college in the city. Now that I live in Boston, I long for the unique taste of Pat's.  Not long ago, I brought my boyfriend for his first cheese steak - we both did wit-whiz sandwiches.

Yes: it's a particular kind of dive; the ingredients are not the same as those used at Le Bec; and you need to be able to read and understand simple instructions to order. But people - it's worth a try. Might even be the best cheese steak you'll ever taste. 

Pat's is an institution and an experience. True, it may not be your thing, but to at least one former Philadelphian, Pat's remains ambrosia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My girlfriend and I were in Philly this weekend and decided to go to Pat's and Geno's before we left for some authentic cheesesteaks. Went to Pat's first since it was "the original". It was exactly what we wanted it to be. Steak and onions hot off the grill with cheez whiz dripping out of the sandwich. It was amazing. So we head across the street excited to see how good Geno's was. We stood in line, got our cheesesteaks, sat down, took a bite each, threw it in the trash, and walked back over to Pat's and got another cheesesteak. True Story.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On a recent trip to DC, my daughter and I drove to Phili for this "famous" cheesesteak.... UUUUMMMM I'm a Cali girl and love our version "Cheese Steak Shop" chains. 

Its alright, a heart attack waiting to happen with all that cheese wiz stuff!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I lived around the area for a while and also go back here when travelling.  If you are from Philly, I guess with all the Cheesesteak places around, there are some that are really better.  I've been to a lot of places around the country and overseas and you will find a lot of Cheesesteaks in a lot of restaurants but not a lot come close to the original.  Yes, in Philly there are lots of choices for Cheesesteaks but you really have to try the original and I appreciate the humble beginnings of this great sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've never understood the Pat's and Geno's hype. If you're wasted drunk on Passyunk Ave and just craving greasy drunken munchies I get it, but otherwise, there are dozens, if not hundreds of better spots in the city. I've had better from corner takeout bodega-type spots.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ewww seriously?!  Why is this place so popular?!!  The roll is terribly rubbery, as if it were microwaved, the meat is bland, and the cheez whiz...well, im indifferent, I guess.  Honestly, I've had far better cheese steaks at Mr. Submarine in Richmond, VA.  At least they were flavorful and on good bread.  This place is way overrated.  The best part doesn't even come on the sandwich--the pickled hot peppers.  I truly felt like I was being tortured since my boyfriend loves this place and made me go here with him every night the whole time we were in Philly.  I'll be happy if I never eat here again.

The only cool thing is that it's open so late and packed with people chatting it up through the late night hours.  I guess that's worth one star, as opposed to the negative stars I wish I could give this place...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Meh. Maybe I'm not a real cheesesteak fan, but I didn't think that this was anything special. I never really liked the "wiz" nacho-like cheese they put on the sandwiches so I got a provolone cheesesteak to compare the "wiz" cheesesteak. Honestly, I can say I've had better cheesesteaks from the Great Steak Co. chain restaurant. If I was in Philly and I passed by this place, I might stop by if the line isn't too long and if I was feeling like eating a steak sandwich but I wouldn't go out of my way to get another one though. It's kind of expensive for just a sandwich (8$ at the time of this review). Parking is kind of a pain in the butt.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So this is the famous Pat's Philly cheesesteak??? I swear I wanted it to be good, but it's just garbage. Don't waste your time, not worth the trip. This goes for Geno's across the street as well - my colleague and I got one of each and split'em. So disappointing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Been to Pat's Steaks a few times, never disappointed. Must be the place to go because every time I have been to Pat's, there is a line around the building.
Their cheese steaks are excellent. Great place for a quick meal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've had cheesesteaks before, but this was an altogether different experience.  For starters, I learned that ordering a cheesesteak in Philly (or at least, at Pat's) requires its own language, specific syntax and all.

As an example, to obtain a cheesesteak with Cheez Whiz (really, is there any other type?) topped with onions, one would walk up to the window and state "Steak, Whiz, With."  That's it.  Pay up, your sandwich, if that's even the appropriate term, will arrive at the next window over within a moment.  They don't mess around back there.

For those looking for something a little more formulaic, it's...

[Sandwich Type], [Cheese/Faux-Cheese Selection], [With/without Onions]

-------

All that said, I didn't have any cheesesteak on this excursion.  Just their fries.  Which, considering their pricing at $2.50 and the quantity, don't seem to be much of a deal.  Particularly given the lack of overhead, since it's only outdoor seating.

On the other hand, they were amazingly satisfying fries.  Ultra-crisp on the outside, nicely salted, and starchtastic on the inside.  Just the way I like them.  Mmm.  Fried fantasticness.

Would repeat.  Perhaps after a few hours on a treadmill.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
There are few reasons that I will never come back to this place again
Service: very rude. It was my first time here and I did not have a chance to ask question. I felt like he was going to yell at me if I asked a question (I didn't not know what kind of toppings they had) :(
Food: My steak was very chewy and so was the bread. The food is kind of expensive.($4 for a frech fries)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What's the big deal??  It's another average cheesesteak.  I think I could think of two places in NY/MA that offers a better cheesesteak.  I went all the way here for some Travel Channel-hyped steak??  ahh...what a bummer.

Like I said in Geno's review, go to Jim's.  Don't bother wasting time going to Pat's and Genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap!!! Go to Phillips on Passyunk ave!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is good, but Geno's is better and cheaper for the same order.  Bring your own drink to Pat's.  A 20 oz Coke is $3.50 full of ice.  A small fries is $5.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't really understand how it got 3 stars. It's a cheesesteak place. Nothing more. It was awesome as far as I'm concerned. It may be $10 for one cheesesteak, I probably wouldn't go all the time if I lived in Philly, but just visiting I'd say it's an absolute must!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As far as I am concerned, this is hands down the best cheesesteak sandwich that I have ever tasted along with the cheese fries.  However, I am not a fan that you can pay $2.50 for a drink and not get refills. That part is a rip off. I would have given them 5 stars if they were sensible with that part.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: tried it because it was famous. it was alright, but not awesome, definitely better than Geno's across the street. if i remember right, Geno's doesn't cut up the meat enough and Pat's did, which did make a difference. had better from my own cousin who live's there. next time i'm in philly, i'll try to find a better steak spot.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is the King of Philly Cheesesteaks.
 
Out of Jim's, Geno's, & Pat's, I like Pat's cheesesteaks the best.  I order them "with" and "Whiz".  Tony Luke's cheesesteaks didn't impress me either, so I still like Pat's better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's definitely wins over Geno's.  2 nights ago marked my 243,938 time I got cheese fries, and I decided I need to quit. The cheese whiz is just entirely too salty.  I always wake up soooooo dehydrated.  Unfortunately, I live so close, and so do all my friends.  We do not make wise decisions at 3 am. We usually cave in.  Sometimes they close for whatever reason and make us go to Geno's.  It sucks when they do that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The countless times i drove from Northern Jersey to Philly just to get Pat's has finally struck me to write a review. not even to the fact that i lived around it for almost a year!!!.   Its one of those things that your speechless about every time you have it.  But honestly when it comes to Authentic Cheese steaks Pat's fills that spot for me and the other 540 yelpers. It's the kings of steaks around Philadelphia. the service is as fast as you blink, your cheese steak is ready in about 10 seconds while you get your change back. there is a lot of options to go with. personally i like the original CHEESE W/ Whiz(cheese steak with onions and Cheese whiz). Just make sure your ready before you go up and order, these guys have the patient of a Toddler!!!! And if you just felt like going across the street for a little comparison save your time and money because it does not fill the category of a Cheese steak, the lights and the show are deceiving but your taste buds will be very disappointed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Leg 3 of the unofficial cheesesteak throw down and (sorry pat) the 3rd place finisher.   The wiz was. Little thick being on top rather than on the bread.   Again, it is still a tast cheesesteak but Tony Luke's was tried first and just blew the other 2 away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's or Geno's? Both offer cheap and delicious cheesesteaks with chillies to top it off. My gf and I still can't decide which one we like better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I pulled a Guy Fieri and visited this famous cheesesteak intersection to see which I prefered. Of the two in the famous rivalry, I think I prefered Geno's to Pat's King of Steaks, but that's just because I got it with Cheese Whiz. Trust me on this point, out-of-towners: Get the Whiz. It sounds gross but it's really not bad. The upshot of my little adventure tells me I've had better Phillys in Philly. Worth a visit to gawk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Come here when I'm in the area.  The line can get really long but it moves fast.  If you plan on eating there, then I recommend telling a friend to keep their eyes open for seats while you order for that person.  There are prob only 10 tables while there can be 50 people in line.  If I'm not lucky, I just eat in the car.  The service is pretty shitty.  The guy at the window is rude and needs a chill pill.  

The cheese steaks can be some of the best sometimes depending on weather it comes out greasy or not.  I always get 1 Whiz Witout.  They use rib eye meat which gives it the perfect fat to lean ratio.  The cheese is so good cause its melted and blends into the meat so well.  The roll is nice and keeps everything together.  They have hot sauce and peppers out if you want and drinks and fries are the window over.  I'm big on consistency which this place isn't good at.  Sometimes I get it, the juices don't drip and sometimes the thing is greasy as can be.  So your hands might be greasy one time and not the next so good luck.  

They slide the cheese steak out the window right away so no wait.  One time I bought my friend here and he asked for mayonnaise on his cheese steak.  The guy at the window gave him a dirty look and threw 2 mayonnaise packs at him lol what an asshole.  Def make sure you know what you want before your at the window and you'll be fine.  For such a famous place, one would expect the service and quality to be better even its just a little.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
