text: The lesser of two evils, as they keep the xenophobia to a minimum, and they don't suck off the cops like Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
C'est touristique, c'est de la junk-food, c'est cher pour ce que c'est... Mais ça fait 70 ans que ça existe, c'est même pas la pire des nourriture qu'on puisse manger. 
Si c'est votre première visite à Philadelphie passez-y avant de retourner en centre ville par le marché italien. 

On vous conseille de bien lire les instructions pour passer commande rapidement, à la moindre hésitation le client suivant sera servi avant vous. Et votre sandwich est préparé devant vous et encaissé en moins de 30sec!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As a 1st time visitor from California I drooled for weeks thinking about what my first cheese steak experience would be like in Philly. I was SUPER disappointed. First, the lady taking my cash was the same lady that opened up my bread and laid the cheese. I wanted to say something, but decided not to because I was thinking...well, that may be their secret ingredient. Unfortunately, after taking my first bite I was disappointed. The bread was not fresh and the steak was chewy and bland. I was eating the thing w/o any enjoyment. Way, way overpriced at $9 a sandwich. I seriously could of eaten a better cheese steak in Tijuana, Mexico. Two thumbs down Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pros: Cheesesteak - Tourist trap maybe, but you know you still want it!
Cons: Pressure on ordering it correctly or be sent to the back of the line till you're ready

Thoughts: Yes, it's so touristy, but it's still good. The battle continues to see who's the best, but I think they are both equally good. Geno's flashing lights, Pat's the original... I hear you can get a really good one at a Chinese take out as well and several more around South Philly. With that being said, you haven't gone to Philly until you've had a Cheesesteak

Alternatives: There's quite a bit
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's a tradition.  We pack into cars, drive down route 1-- and enter Philadelphia.  We go shopping, walk around South Street and as a reward-- we go to Pat's for some grub.

Pat's is across from the famous Geno's (I always call it the Boyz II Men cheesesteak place), which in comparison looks awfully boring.  But to me-- is yummier.

It's quick, you order what cheesesteak want (say it right or get sent to the back of the line) from one window, pick it up at the next window. Then if you want a drink or fries, order it at the window after that.

I'd give it 5 stars for quickness and um.. deliciousness (anything with Cheez Whiz owns me).  But the lines are sometimes ridiculously long (especially when it's cold out) and outside it's filthy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak was decent. Meat a little dry, but it came out fast. Before i could finish my payment, the steak was ready to eat. 

I do however give them 5 stars because of their kindness to the military. One military guy came up, ordered, asked for the ATM, and then the register guy said it was on the house and thanked him for serving our country.

much props to that!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I got Pat's and Geno's for my first time eating cheesteaks and I thought that Pat's was better than Geno's. The sandwiches are definitely more flavorful and well textured as well. When choosing a cheese for your cheesesteak, you would have to be very careful based on your texture and taste preference. I recommend the whiz if you're' more of a soft, gooey and messy kind of person. But the American for me was the way to go. The cheese was not as melted and it didn't create a mess for me when I took my bite. Onions were good with the sandwich. But you can order the it without it if you don't like it. Simply say "with" or "without". Ordering is super fun here!

What I found was delicious was sprinkle a little seasoning on it and it really tied in the taste overall. Many people eat it with ketchup, which I tried. But the flavors didn't blend together at the end.

I love how people order here at the restaurant because you have to be really fast and correct with your order, otherwise they send you back to the end of the line. It reminds me of that one episode of Seinfeld where they were ordering soup from that small shop in New York City. They had to be quick and precise with the orders or they would send you to tne end of the line of ban you! hahaha

I recommend "american with" :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was good for me after I hit the bar.  I give it a 4.  It's meat, cheese, and bread - not rocket science.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's.   A 24 hour landmark that invented the philly cheese steak.  The hot peppers outside is a nice freebie.  Soft fresh bread and the carmelized onions makes my mouth water.  The only con about this place is the long lines which do go fairly quick and the lack of shelter eating this delicious meal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Been coming here for years every time I drive through philly I stop and I'll have to say this place don't do it for me like it used to. Prices out of sight $30 for a 2 sandwiches and a fry and drink wow. Still got a good flavor but portions keep getting smaller and more $$$ every time I stop don't know if ill be back after the last stop .
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I tried Pats and Gino's and I have to say Pat's was the better of the two!!! If you are on the fence with which one to try then get one of each like I did lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm going to have say "DITTO" to J.J.B.'s eloquent review.  Yes, service is brief and to the point - but believe me, you WANT it to be.  The brief-er the service, the quick-er you get your food, ya hear me?   

WIZ - WIT. Period. 

The-Best-Cheesesteaks-Eva. Period.

The brief-est review I've ever written.  5. Stars. Need. I. Say. More?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I will update my review because it's better than I have remembered. Pats is definitely better than genos for sure. But everyone has their own opinion. Steaks literally come out immediately! They have it down to a science. And don't be intimidated by the ordering process, not as bad as it's made out to be. No steak Nazis here. Can't wait to go back. Good luck with the parking though, it's a sh*t show.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: These steaks taste like ... Post apocalyptic food. It reminds me of what they'd serve on one of those sci fi movies where the city is full of slums and greasy food carts. The steak didn't taste right it was chewy and fatty... I almost choked on it.  Go to Tony Luke's!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Just had to try a cheese steak sandwich on a recent trip to Philly.  Looked for the places folks considered the best and most authentic.

Well to start with, I wasn't thoroughly impressed with the sandwich itself.  Nothing but a tasteless thin slice of steak chopped up, fried in oil on a baguette bread with cheese (provolone or processed) and optional onions and mushrooms.  I had mine with provolone and onions.  
The bread was fresh, the steak not too tough and the onions ok.  I had to add lots of salt and pepper to get a bit of the blandness out of it.

I then had the same sandwich from Geno across the street.

IMHO, Pat's the clear winner here.  Geno's bread wasn't as fresh. The meat was tougher and the onions way too greasy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took a trip to Philly from NY just to try Pat's cheesesteak, and I must say that it was well worth the trip.  It was good and the reviews for this place don't lie.  The service is also quick and efficient.   Will definitely be back in the future for more.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Completely underwhelmed!    Flavor was Bland, soggy sandwich with cold onions as a topping.  $17 for sandwich coke and fries and I left half on table.  I should have listened to the locals and stayed away!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak I had would've had to have been vastly better to warrant the attitude of the people in this place. My order was fine but the guy was totally out of order to the woman in front of me. Sure, they love their reputation but they should get some manners along the way.

If I'd wanted to eat an average/poor cheesesteak surrounded by extras from Jersey Shore revving the engines of their crap cars I'd have probably given it more than 2 stars... I guess I didn't.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visiting Philly and couldnt wait to try Pats. What a mistake! The meat was so dry and tasteless like an old shoe. The person who waited on me was obnoxious and rude. I wish I could rate it zero stars . Ive had betyer at Subway! Massive disappointment!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been to Pats and had their cheesesteak before few years back and I remember it being better than what I had today. I'm not a local. I even went to Genos across the street and compared the two on-the-spot years back. I liked Pats more first time around.

Coming back here today...not so much. Line was not long. Waited maybe 5 minutes. They are fast service. But they are rude and mean if you do not say your order right. I said hello to them and they don't even respond. just "NEXT!!! NEXT!!!" The cashier looked busy shuffling back and forth so i waited until he stood still and looked at me. He did not, and just kept screaming "NEXT!!! NEXT!!!" I gave up and just yelled my order at him. Ordered a mushroom cheesesteak wit wiz (mushroom cheesesteak with onions with cheese wiz). Found a spot and sat down. Bread was super chewy almost tasted stale, there was a huge chunk of meat that I bit into that was completely stuck together. I wasn't even sure if it was fully cooked. I still ate it because I was hungry. The juice from the steak sogging up my bread was good and helped to chew it easier. 

Nonetheless. the entire thing was just...OK. Didn't blow my mind. 
My experience this time around was not that good and I do not think Pats will be my first choice of cheeststeaks when visiting Philly anymore. 

Tips to owner: Try smiling and saying hello at-least.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I suppose if you want experience the Philly cheesesteak sandwich in it's natural habitat, I visit to Pat's is required.   Are there better cheesesteak sandwiches in town, yes, but Pat's has to be recognized as the most iconic.   As for the sandwiches themselves, they're as good or as bland as any review presented here, I've had both.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteak with an attitude.  They win the Pat's vs. Gino's contest. Good greasy food !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Touristy excursion that was not wholly a great experience. The ordering experience was meh -- person taking orders was simultaneously yelling at coworkers while also interrupting us mid order and not making any eye contact. Steak was good, cheese whiz was not great. Bread was nothing special. Went to a different Philly cheese steak place and the overall service and quality was much more personable and tastier
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ah, the age old debate in Philly - which is better, Pat's or Geno's?  While I can't say that either of the two are my favorite cheesesteak joints in the city, I'd have to chalk it up to Pat's.  

The sandwich itself is alright.  The meat is chopped nice & thin, which is key in marrying it to the the cheese & onions.  I'd also recommend the pizza steak, which is pretty much just the addition of red sauce.

You won't get as much lip service as across the street at Geno's, but do be prepared to know what you want at the counter, as they will give you a hard time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: May not be the "best" cheesteak, but it's darn close.  It is a classic place in Philly, and the "Original".  All the frauds go to Geno's.  Geno's has the pretty lights, and the bright signs; Pat's puts there time, effort and money into good steaks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Way overpriced tourist trap. $15+ dollars for a sandwich, fries and a drink. The sandwich wasn't even good.
I tried Tony Lukes the next day and found it much better tasting and a little less expensive.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Look, it's the King of All Things Steak on Passyunk Ave. That's where Pat's kingdom unceremoniously ends.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not a lot to say guys... if you get wasted and want late night junk food, Pat's is the place to go.  Be sure to keep that empty cup from the cheese fries you gorged on the night before so you have something to cry into once the guilt sinks in.  If you couldn't tell, I have a love/hate relationship with Pat's... kind of wishing I had some right now to be honest with you... damn it.

Oh, and Pat's is better than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Though I would agree that it is the better of two in the often made comparison between Pat's and Geno's, it is definitely not *the* place to go for cheesesteaks in Philly. Pat's is decent, and probably a must-do for many tourists, but having grown up in the Philadelphia area and experiencing many cheesesteaks before my first visit to Pat's, I assure you that you can find better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I feel that Pat's or Geno's is a personal preference.  Pat's steaks to me has less flavor than Geno's steaks.  And for god's sake don't try to order anything other than Wiz wit/ without, they don't do anything else no matter what you may have seen or heard.  It's definitely is a bit touristy.  But if your drunk at 2am and want a cheesesteak, there's always Pat's.  But there are much better places at normal hours.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love philly cheesesteaks. Whenever I have been to Philly I stop and have one. I don't particularly have a favorite. Pat's or Geno's ....like them both.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been coming here for 20 years and it is THE undisputed best cheese steak in the city!!!   Okay, it may be disputed, but it is hands down the authentic choice and damn tasty.

I always get "Whiz with", and then throw on some of that hot sauce.   The hot sauce is ridiculously hot.  Its no barrel of Texas Pete, I'll tell you that.

The fries are good also.

The prices are getting ridiculous for steaks, but I guess if you're Pat's you can charge $10 for a steak sandwich.  It is a good amount of food.   the problem is it is so good, that you just want a little more....so then you get a 2nd steak, and well that is just too much food.  You'll feel that in your gut for 2 days...when you want that 2nd steak of the night, either leave on a high note, or split it with a friend.  ;)

When you bring someone to Philly for the first time, definitely come to Pat's at the end of the night.  Don't bring them sober, it'll disappoint.  I made that mistake once...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
the oldest cheese steakhouse in philly 
the best cheese steak ever ...............
........................
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
SOO GOOD
the steak is a hearty portion
good stuff
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was our first experience there today and will definately be our last.. One of he worst experiences we have ever encountered. Employees are very rude and not helpful at all. They need to consider tourist don't really understand how it works and be a tad more patient. We were not impressed with the cheese steaks. And the rudeness added to not enjoying our food. Big disappointment....... ZERO STARS
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteak is nothing special. People that works there are very rude and will not make us come back.  Don't make good reviews fool you. If you insist, try it but please if I'm right, just kindly post it. It's worth sharing it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Oh yes! On my tour of cheeseteakville, er, I mean Philly, I had to stop at Pat's. Anyone who's ever watched anything on Food Network knows Pat's and Geno's have this "long bitter rivalry" because their right across the street from each other.

The set up is much the same as Geno's. There are two windows, one for purchasing cheesesteaks, and the other for everything. Since this was a tour my boyfriend and I were doing, we just bought one cheesesteak and split it between us. 

Before we even got to the window there was a problem. The woman in front of us held out her cheesesteaks to the cashier and was telling him she paid for extra cheese. She said there was no extra cheese on her cheesesteak. The guy, pretty rudely, told her that there was no way he could add any more cheese because once it's been cooked, that's it. He said, "You got what you ordered. We make what you order!" The woman kept saying that she ordered extra cheese and she paid for extra cheese but the argument was over. The guy shooed her away and she left upset. Not the best customer service! It would've been no big deal to drip on some extra cheese at the window like they do for all their sandwiches. But I guess customer service isn't a top priority for Pat's when they already have tons of other customers waiting. This put me off a bit but we still wanted to try Pat's.

We ordered the usual, wiz wit'. It came out super fast, with ooey gooey melty cheese wiz on top that was drizzled on fresh. We grabbed napkins and scoped out a seat around the triangle. Once we really took a bite of our sandwich, it was delicious! The cheese had formed a slight film at the top but it didn't make the cheese any less ooey gooey! The onions and the chopped meat were perfect together. The bread was soft, and ripped off easily. The cheese, was EVERYWHERE on top! It didn't penetrate into the meat like I wish it would've, but every bite was still yummy. My boyfriend basically declared Pat's his favorite cheesesteak! This was after we had eaten at Geno's, which btw tastes like ripped up old cardboard.

So, 4 stars for Pat's! It would've been 5 stars if not for the whole CS mess ahead of us with the woman, and for the cheese not quite layered into the meat. Outside of that, woweee!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just awful. Steak was tough and chewy. Spit out a huge chunk of fat from one bite. Finished half the steak and I was hungry. cheesteak w/onions, fries and bottle water, over $15. At least the water was ok. Don't go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here 2 weeks ago because we always wanted to try a cheesesteak in Philly. Stayed at the Logan and took an Uber here. Huge disappointment. 2 cheesesteaks a bottle of water and a coke came out to $28 I believe. The bread was ok but the meat didn't taste seasoned at all and to say the cheese whiz had any flavor would be an understatement. I felt ripped off. Won't promote another restaurant on this page but we had a great sandwich at Reading Terminal Market.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's was delicious !!! I had the cheesesteak with mushrooms, onions and of course cheesewiz ! It had tons of flavor and was just oozig with cheesewiz sauce . Delicious , so good i returned 3 hours later for another one !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's a classic of course to get a cheese steak "wit" at Pat's.  The ordering lingo is "quaint" and not as big a deal as people make it, but the separate windows for cheese steaks and drinks is a little screwy.  Geno's always came off as cheesy (no pun intended) in comparison, so I've never felt compelled to try it and will always go to Pat's when in town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious.  They chop the steak up, unlike Genos, which I prefer as it presents a better flavor.  Absolutely delicious--I will return soon.  The neighborhood also has a ton to see, making this a great destination.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We decided to take a detour traveling back from the Jersey Shore (1.5 hrs. out of our way!) and check out what the Travel channels tells us about Gino's & Pat's Philly Cheese Steaks....We first went to Pat's and it was cool just to be there, but how BLAND?!!! I put tons of salt on my sandwich and the raw minced onions just took over.  We strolled across the street to Geno's & found it kind of bland, but better and the sauteed onions really added to it.  I also added hot sauce to that sandwich which tasted good as well as ordering the cheez wiz (haven't had that since I was 12) - so that made it gooey & gross & pretty good!   I would say it's worth a try, and it could be that I'm just not a Philly girl, but I tried, didn't like, and wouldn't go back to either one!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I came to Philly and took the cheesesteak challenge.  After watching a special on the food network, I knew I had to take the Pats vs. Geno's challenge.  After a short drive from the philly airport I found myself at Passyunk and 9th, the home of Pat's and Geno's.  I chose Pat's first, avoiding the mass of neon lights across the street.  I picked up my cheese wit, put it in the car and moved next door to Geno's where I got yet another cheese wit.

I then ran back to my car, split them in half and dove in for the taste test that had been years in the making.  After a bite into each, there was an obvious winner, Pats handsdown blows geno's out of the water.  Although the meat from pats may have sat around slightly too long, it was still full of flavor and just plain delicious.  I know where to go when I come back to philly now.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: RIP to the old Pats King of Steaks.  The current Pats is GARBAGE compared to what you used to get here.  Now expect to pay 10 dollars for a small cheese steak with inferior quality meat and terrible service.  You will leave hungry and going back online for a side of fries. It is obvious that people are beginning to catch on since I haven't seen anyone lined up the last 3 times I came.   I will NEVER return here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: great place to eat. the cheese steak is good. and the customer sevice is good for a busy place like that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bread was good, American cheese melted, the steak could be chopped up more but not bad and the onions were cooked. Still not as good as the street vendor I went to on Chestnut street, Mama's, but I would come here again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cut your prices in half and you have a regular, but you don't need regulars. This place gets packed with tourists almost every day. The service is really nice and quick. The steaks are much better than Genos across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'll have to go Pat's over Geno's for a wiz wit.  That said, they're both tourist trap average cheesesteaks.  Tastes great, especially at 3am on a Saturday morning (they're open 24 hrs, 364 [Christmas]), but I wouldn't go out of your way to come for the food itself.  There are great cheesesteaks in every part of the greater Philadelphia area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's a five star experience!

I can't believe I never reviewed it.  It's not even about the sandwich for me.  It's 15 years of going down with my husband and two sons.  Finding a parking space, getting on line, get nervous trying to order correctly, eating amongst the pigeons etc.  We order our sandwiches four different ways which makes me crazy.  Their fries are excellent.  We've done the Geno and Pat side by side taste test and all four of us voted for Pat's.  Besides hate the look of Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is a Philly thing, you have to go once and order your steak wit or wit out...but it's not good.  Save it for when family and friends come to visit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tourist trap... should really be located in Manayunk or Old City. Seriously... any place that serves steaks with wiz is. The BS ordering protocol... it's a factory... plain and simple... hence the pile of already cooked meat / onions, etc... go here because you want to say you were there, not because you were looking for a good cheesesteak.

They get a solid 2 stars mainly because of the decent cherry peppers they have at the condiment stand... and that they are open 24 hours.

The best cheesesteak in the city is at John's Roast Pork.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Like most people who come to Pat's - I'm a tourist. Sure, I've been to Philly a dozen times, but I'm not cheese steak expert. It didn't take long to learn than mostly tourists come here, however. Of all my friends that live in Philly none come to Pat's. In fact, most haven't been here. 

if you're an out-of-towner, come here once. I've been four times, but only because other friends wanted to try it only because of the glamor the Travel Channel shows have put on it. None have left raving about it. There's much better cheese steak locally. On a positive note, it's a step up from it's caddy-corner neighbor Geno's. 

Otherwise, it's average stuff, at best, but if you're a tourist, you'll probably love it, until you taste something better, which is available in this city. Still, this is an above average spot that does taste better than some of the cheese steaks you get in the airport?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: -Great experience; the cheese wiz was piping hot and the cuts of steak were hot and tender; the speed of these guys cranking out cheesesteaks unreal; be prepared with cash as this establishment doesn't take card...and thankfully it doesn't.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: a couple of friends and myself went down to philly to visit a friend of ours who had just opened up a club there and we all had pledged that at the end of the night we had to get some authentic cheese steaks.  I've seen pat's and geno's on the food network and the travel channel and was pretty excited to visit the two places.  fast forward to 2am and the lines for both were tremendous and one of our buddies led us straight to pat's.  if you've never visited before some people might be intimidated by the speed and efficiency of the staff there. there should be noooo hesitation when ordering, be confident and quick.  the guy at the first window says to me, "first time?" and i just nod and hope not to fumble my order.  he said that the classic way is to have the cheese steak with the cheese wiz and onions.  your other choices are american cheese and provolone.  for $7 you get a tremendous cheesesteak sandwich with the softest bun. the next window is for drinks, fries and whatever. the six of us just ate and didnt say a word and loved every bite of it.  next time we will try geno's on the opposite corner
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The question when you giro Philly is Pats or Geno's cheesesteaks... Me and a buddy got a footlong from Pats and footlong from Geno's and split them... After trying both, we both agreed Pats was FAR better than Geno's... It honestly didn't even come close... Pats was juicy, Geno's was kinda dry...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My sister's and I decided to try Pat's cheese steak.  One sister liked the meat, the other said it was okay and I could have passed.  Asked for cheese and onions - hardly and cheeses and had to request that the mushrooms be removed.  While I was charged for the mushrooms based on the attitudes and freezing temperatures not worth the time to get the money refunded.  I do not understand why there is so much hype about these tasteless cheese steaks.  Overall not worth the time or effort.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had a Steak, Whiz, Without.  Great place to get a cheesesteak on the go.  It was everything I wanted in a cheesesteak - hot, cheesy, a yummy bun, and tender beef.  Be prepared to order, though.  There's all kinds of directions you supposedly need to follow!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I think of Philly, I think of Pat's. It goes hand in hand. I came here several times for their philly cheese steak with their infamous cheese whiz. Saw this place on Food Network plus Travel Channel. C'mon, you gotta give it a go with all that press! 

The meat is so succulent and the way the roll cradled the cheese whiz inside was perfection. It is the best out there. 

Parking is hard here. I took a cab multiple times. Lots of celebs graced this place before, hence their yearbook pictures plastered all on top. 

Their rival Geno's is across the street... I tried it and it's a definite 'pass' for me. I'm Team Pat.

Cash only. No money, no talk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is alright. This cheese steak place was listed as a must try at my hotel. I walked over there with a group of my friends to taste them and Geno's. This place got second place in my comparison taste wise. I would give a higher star rating for the food however the customer service is lacking. It only takes a second to cut a sandwich in half no need to bark no at me and be rude. I will not return to this place. Save yourself the time in their line and go across the street to Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Traveled through Philly on the way to Boston and trusted in Yelp that Pat's was preferable to Geno's. I got a "steak, wit, whiz" and felt like a true philly native as I stood in a giant line, handed over cash (no credit of course) and went to the next register for my fries. Success!

The cheesesteak was great, but I wouldn't say that you can't get one that good outside of Philly. But I think most places outside of the area don't offer Whiz out of an irrational fear of being gross. Everything was quite tender and juicy though. And the peppers you can put on the cheesesteak at the condiment station are an awesome compliment. I just ate them whole, stem and all on the cheesesteak, and didn't regret it for a minute even as I felt each pepper land in my stomach with increasing weight and fire.

I'll have to come back some day to try Geno's and see how the two match up; I'll also have to give John's Roast Pork a try, as I hear that it's actually the dark horse favorite for both roast pork sandwiches and cheesesteaks, but when we tried to go on this trip it was closed for the weekend. So Pat's gets an extra star for being open as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's was better than Genos.  They are similar but Pat's was juicier and the meat was chopped rather than flat which I preferred.  Geno's is blingier and has more marketing but it does not translate into better food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I always get my as "whiz wit" so I don't know why every time I'm about to step up to the counter, I start to flake and um and ah while the person behind the counter looks frustrated and drums his fingers on the counter. Whiz with, whiz wit, whiz wit.

I usually find myself here late night, I'm sure like most people, but only when I'm at Ray's Bar. I have eaten here sober before. Once. With my boyfriend at the time and my brother and his girlfriend and my dad and his girlfriend. It was December and there were surprisingly a lot of people scattered about, but we were the only ones who decided to eat outside.

My brother and I had a contest to see who could eat their cheesesteak the fastest and he held his horizontally and just shoved it right in. My dad hovered over my boyfriend, dripping the steak juices all over his winter coat, but whatever, he couldn't feel it anyway. Then my fat fuck brother finished the 2 halves of my dad's and dad's girlfriend's cheesesteaks. I came in second. My brother went home and was in the reading room for 1/2 an hour.

Whiz wit, whiz wit, whiz wit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Everyone should go to Pat's at least once. I took my daughter in law there for her first cheese steak (she is from Missouri). She loved the neighborhood, and energy between Pat's and Geno's. The steak was good, but if you are from Philly or the surrounding area there are better places to get a cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was so incredibly excited about having the chance to grab a legit cheesesteak in Philly.  When we walked up the line for Geno's was out to the middle of the street and the line for Pat's was wrapped around the building.  I picked Pat's because busier is better most times and joined the giant line.

I ordered a regular cheesesteak provolone  "wit" and it came out of the next window like 5 seconds later.  I then walked around the corner and ate my messy sandwich on the back steps.  The cheesesteak was so-so.  Overall I thought that the meat was pretty flavorless.  There's so much meat cooking at one time that it seems to just steam and it was a bit on the dry side.  Sadly, I ate a cheesesteak in Delaware a few days later and it was far superior.

While I didn't love my cheesesteak, I loved the experience.  If I lived in Philly I probably wouldn't frequent Pat's, but I will definitely stop by whenver I'm in town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's cheesesteak is awesome! I wish I had a bigger stomach.  The steak is cut up and is topped with onions and cheese wiz.  It was a little dry on the bottom because they only put the cheese wiz on top. That's the only complaint I have with their cheesesteaks, which is also the only reason why I like Geno's better.

If the cheesesteak had more cheese whiz spread throughout the sandwich, I would've rated Pat's higher than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The steaks are great, but the prices aren't. There is no need to charge $10 with the kind of business Pat's does. I understand it's costly to have a major operation, pay rent, etc. but I'm sure the volume of customers makes up for it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to do the tourist thing and try both geno's and pat's. I liked the sandwich here better. But I have a had ordered a better quality and tasting cheese steaks in center city while here on my visit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had Pat's first and Geno after. Thought both places were great!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's was my longtime front-runner in the infamous Philadelphia cheesesteak war, and still remains a top-contender. When you visit Philadelphia, people will tell you to head to Pat's for it's reputation alone, as well as it's location right next to the other top contender, Geno's Steaks. 

In my opinion, cheesesteaks are something very difficult to rate. Some people like Cheese Whiz, others prefer provolone. Some prefer their steak chopped up, others like it still in slices. 

Pat's uses a great roll for the bread, soft and as good as those used by any other place. They then slather it with Cheese Whiz and top it with chopped prime rib steak. It's a great cheesesteak, and their cheese fries are an incredible addition to an already filling meal. 


It's a little on the pricey side, but so are all of the big name cheesesteak places (Pat's, Geno's, Tony Luke's, and Jim's). It's also unfortunately a little out of the way for a lot of people, but if you are just visiting the city I would absolutely recommend you try it. 

I give it four stars simply because there are better options in the city when you have time to explore. Jim's is delicious and probably my favorite of the big-4, with Tony Luke's and Pat's tied for 2nd. 

Overall, it's a great place for tourists to visit, and the fun of choosing a side on the Pat's vs. Geno's war is half the reason to go. If you live in the city, there are better options, cheaper options, and a lot of preference to be had. But everyone should try Pat's at least once, as well as Geno's for the comparison.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The food definitely was not bad, it's also not what i was expecting. Heard a lot of hype about how good Pats was and my boyfriend and I made a point to go off our route to try it. Not very flavorful, the bread was the best part. If you've been to Charley's which is in most malls, their Philly cheesesteak is wayyy better if that helps give a perspective. The workers were very nice at Pats, definitely had a local feel to it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I wreaked havoc on my digestive system by eating both Pat's and Geno's within the hour so I could do a side-by-side comparison.

Result?  INCONCLUSIVE.

Pat's - Pros:
- Lots & lots of cheese whiz.
- Thick(er), delicious pizza fries.
- Better, softer, hoagie.
- Cheesesteak add-ons such as mushrooms, peppers, and pizza sauce.

Pat's - Cons:
- Dirtier.  No pretty tables or clean condiment bar.
- Ruder service.  If you don't get the ordering system right, you got to move to the back of the line.

Geno's - Pros:
- Thicker slices of meat.
- Stronger onion flavour.
- Clean restaurant decorated in bright orange colours.
- Neon-lit environment.  Like the Boardwalk!
- Nice service.  They actually wrap and bag your sandwich.  At Pat's, they throw it at you on a piece of wax paper.

Geno's - Cons:
- Not as much cheese.  Less cheese, less fun!
- Thin, McDonald-esqe fries.  Again, less cheese.
- Lack of cheesesteak toppings - no mushrooms, peppers, pizza sauce, or anything else.

Overall:
Better Food: Pat's!
Better Experience: Geno's!

Other tips:
- Only outdoor seating at both places, so be prepared to sacrifice the tips of your fingers to frostbite during the colder months.  Or, alternatively, order to go.
- Learn how to order.  First, specify what cheese (cheese whiz - the classic!, American, or provolone) you want.  Second, specify whether or not you want onions. For example, "whiz with" translates into "cheesesteak with cheese whiz with onions".  At Pat's, tack on the toppings you want following your order.
- Geno's & Pat's are probably tourist traps.  I definitely believe that there are better places in the city to get your cholesterol fix, but you got to try the classics at least once!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not really a big fan, quality of the meat was ok but it was cold and dry, know where near enough cheese and horrible customer service.  Sorry philly but I had Pat's years ago and it's not the same
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was drawn in to all of the hype about Pat's from the food network, etc. This is the 1st place I ever went to when I moved to Philly...I mean I still had my luggage in the car.  I ordered provolone wit. In about 10 seconds I was handed my order...I love fast but this was a little too fast. The provolone was just put on the cold bread and a spatula full of meat and onions went on top. I thought that the cheese would be all melted into the steak and onions...I was wrong. Cold bread and cold cheese do not a Cheesesteak make. I probably should have ordered the whiz. Since my 1st Cheesesteak experience, I have found great steaks at Tony Luke's and Shanks...they actually cook your steak WHEN you order...totally worth the wait. I will stay away from this hyped up place unless I find myself drunk late one night around the corner.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Unfortunately my experience at PATs was not good as the sandwich turned out to be cold =(  Maybe I should try it with Cheese Wiz next time I go. I think the sandwich would have been great if the meat was nice and hot.  Also it is not in the nice area either.  I would go ahead and try Genos next time I go or actually both.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Despite the hype and television coverage ( the nonesense of Food Network should tell it all) this is NOT the traditional Philadelphia cheesesteak,.
These steaks are tough and flat.  No real steak uses cheeze wiz.
A real steak is "scrambled" the meat is broken down, shreaded. And the cheese is real.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Touristy, average quality, long lines and wait time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When in Philly , what else to dine on other than the staple, the Philly cheese steak . And despite its much maligned reputation , what other joint to try than at one of the origjnals, pats. We got the original and the one with shrooms , wit wiz, which was melted cheddar cheese. We were expecting a sloppy soggy mess of a sandwich based on reviews. 

The presentation expectations were met, as the sandwich came in a soggy hero, with cheese slathered everywhere.  Yet we were too hungry and cold so we dug in. were we in for a surprise ! Steak was well cut , well seasoned and reasonably juicy. The warm wiz kept us warm from a chilly spring day. The vegs added a dimension thay made it seem like we weren't just eating steak with bread. 

Minus one star for rude worker
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's a good cheese steak but nothing special at all. After I ate it I said to myself, " I drove 10 miles for this?!" Also, this place and genos accept cash only. Really?! It's 2012, get with it u old fu**s.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Food: I ordered a cheesesteak wit Whiz. They have plenty of signs on their walls to tell you how to order. Order your cheesesteak at the first window and drinks at the second one. The beef was pretty tender and tasted good with onions and Whiz. The bread was also decent.

Service: If you followed their instructions, everything should be fine and work like clockwork. The order came out quickly. No muss, no fuss.

Location: Definitely had that tourist trap feel. But between the cross street rivalry, I'd pick Pat's over Geno's any day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is better than Geno's, but the steaks are below average to average. Less about quality of food than tradition. This the place to go after a concert, sporting event, or late night out.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: pretty damn weak for whats supposed to be the mother of all  steak sandwich.........its a truck stop with more efficient ordering system.........dont waste your time here
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in philly, so we had to get philly cheese steaks right? Ordered mushroom cheese steak for $10.50.

Bread - chewy
Meat - chewy and kind of dry
provolone - wasn't melted, didn't even notice
mushroom  didn't notice either

Make sure you know what you want before you get to the counter, all the servers seemed rushed. There's even a sign that says if your orders not right, get in back of the line to fix it. 
The line was shorter than Geno's but the sandwich was in my friend's hands before i could even put my change away. 
Not impressed, maybe i'll come back and try a different sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nothing special, just a tourist trap. There isn't anything wrong with the food but you can do better at other places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Four of us had a serious cheese steak hankering, so we drove from DC to Philly for the day to do some reconnaissance.  We used Man v. Food and Food Wars as our guides.  To keep it healthy (ha ha), we visited three cheese steak places in one day: Pat's King of Steaks, Geno's Steaks, and Tony Luke's.  All four of us agreed that Pat's was the best.  Why?  The beef was thinly sliced and had a little bit of seasoning flavor infused into them.  Add that fiery hot sauce, and it's the best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If Pat's "King of Steaks" hadn't been spotlighted on TV, I am 100% sure it would have been bulldozed by now.

Pros: I now know where to never go for a Philly cheese steak.

Cons: Everything else. The enormous lines that stretch well over a block, interrupting traffic and accumulating heaps of litter. Standing in the hot sun as the wafting aroma of whatever dead animal they pass off as steak makes you nauseated. All the people in the line around you are growing increasingly cranky and impatient as they too, realize they have been duped by cable programming. When you finally reach the window and get to say the "Cheese steak wit" thing you've been rehearsing in your head for 45 minutes in line, I found myself more inclined to ask them to phone me an ambulance for heat exhaustion and a tetanus shot for the rusty chainlink fence you were cut by when you collapsed against it in line much earlier. Then you get to stand in another line and wait for the food. I've had sandwiches of equal quality out of a box in my freezer, except at home i have a shamwow to absorb the grease trail that has reached your collar bone.
Sure, go to Pat's. Have a cheesesteak. Get a picture of you outside it to post on facebook. Even tell everybody it was the best sandwich you've ever consumed cause "Hey, I traveled 3 hours for this". But don't say I didn't warn you.

Visited August 2012
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats steaks blows, go to Steve's or chinks, Steak & hoagie or frusco's if u want a cheesesteak....Pats is a overrated-overpriced tourist trap that lacks taste and a quailty roll. Place sucks a bag of D's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you like your sandwich meat full of gristle, this is the place for you. Whiz wit and you're in for a chew fest. Some people are into that, so I won't hate, but if you prefer leaner meat (albeit more flavorless) head across the street to Geno's. I'm not saying one's better than the other, but I'm saying they are both exactly what expect from a tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tony Luke's is better. If you want to be a tourist, go here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Wow! Lots of delicious meat, whiz and provolone and grilled onions. Light chewy roll. Meat to bread ratio is awesome. Whiz is even better than Geno's

By far a much better tasting sandwich!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm so honored to have been able to make it to the Original home of the Cheesesteak in Philly first and foremost. I saw this on the Food Network when i was younger and always thought it was cool being right across the street from Gino's like that and having beef haha! One thing about Philly folks is that they love the 'Wiz' ....I'm not talking about the Wizard of Oz (although they might) but I mean Cheese Wiz. Us East-Side born Buffalonians don't really take to kindly to the Wiz. So when I found out that the Wiz was my only cheese option I was a little disappointed. I took my 6-hour drive home before I actually took a bite and it was a actually pretty good. The staff told me that the Wiz was better than average and they were right. As a Buffalonian, we like cheddar cheese and American cheese and provolone you know like real cheese. We like spicy peppers, onions, tons of flavor, mushrooms, sauce, and lots of meat. So I had to throw out pre judgements based on what I was used to when I tried this. But overall I hear they are better than Gino's. Now to get the Philly Sub taste I'm actually looking for someone said Max on Broad St.!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've had better. Way too pricey for what you get, starting at $8. Steak was dry, bread was stale, and of course the service was horrible. EXTREMELY rude to my mother who decided to order for our group. You want to have a mystique and style? I get that. Being rude to old ladies is just being rude.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Anyone visiting Philadelphia will eventually decide to sample a Cheesesteak.  Well, this is supposedly the birthplace of the sandwich.  There's even a historical marker on the sidewalk.  
Pat's is certainly good, although there are others that I prefer.  I always stop by on every trip for a philly here though just to pay respect to the founding fathers of cheesesteaks.
The pictures around the building are fun to look at and see all of the famous folks who have also found their way to the place.
NOTE:  Standing on the Sylvester Stallone marker and yelling "Yo Adriene" a few times does not seem to be appreciated much by the staff.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Why do people like this place?  I came to Philly to get a famous Philly cheesesteak.  The meat was tasteless and the bread was soggy.   I expected juicy slices of steak ... I think the ones at Hooters are better. Sooooo disappointed.  And yes I tried Geno's which sucked too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best, no need to try Genos. Go Cheese wit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After trying Max's, Pat's and Geno's all in the same day... I have to say Pat's was the best. The King some might say! They are very efficient with the lines that accrue. The steak was great and chopped nicely. The onions cook/carmelized just right! If you're in town and want to try the best steak in town... The buck stops here!

When you get there, tell em SRT Keef sent you. They won't know me but I'll feel special!

Also don't make the same mistake i made and over do it on the hot sauce! It's very spicy.

Parking is horrible on the weekend. Be prepared to walk a couple blocks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was in Philly for a "Street Naming" Ceremony on 9/30 in North Philly. After, the ceremony me and the family drove to South Philly to try out Pat's. It was a good sandwich...but, the steak could have used a tad bit more of seasoning. It was flavorful because of the onions...but, once you get past the onion taste the steak is pretty bland.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteak was enjoyable, albeit this is quite a touristy place and I'm sure there are plenty of better places in town, maybe without the hype but good or even better. Went for one here right after one at Geno's another.  I preferred Geno's bread, but was more a fan of Pat's steak which was filleted and just less dry, with more onions.  It dis however getting the bread a little greasy. The dried red pepper gave it that oomph!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Food - I was really looking forward to visiting Pat's Steaks for a really long time and finally had the time to come around to trying. But boyyy was I wrong and will never return again. The bread wasn't anything great, the meat was dry and overall the sandwich was dry. The only thing saving it was the condiments. However I do have to admit that the jalapeno was delicious - not what I even came there for though. 

Price - Honestly, I felt like I didn't get what I paid for. The portions weren't all that big and it didn't even taste great.

Service - The utmost worst service I have ever received. The lady at the window started with a stare that almost felt like she was staring down my soul and then proceed to have the most horrible attitude ever when asking us what we wanted our Philly Cheese Steak. This is the main reason why this spot does not deserve anything more than a 1 star.

NOT GOING TO RETURN!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Straight up tourist trap.  New to the area, but still wanted to give one of the 2 most popular places a try, needless to say, it's still better than what many other places call a cheesesteak, but it's not great compared to places like John's, or even tony lukes.  

My steak was pretty dry and bland, and the roll wasn't as good as I've had at other places.  Not to mention, it was $2 more than those places.

Overall, meh, definite tourist trap, but if you're out late and heavily intoxicated you could do worse
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm from California and was super excited to have a philly cheese steak in philly, I was highly disappointed 
The atmosphere was nice, lots of tourist and things to look at. However overall taste and look of the sandwich was mediocre. The meat lacked flavor and they didn't put  cheese !!!! How do you do a philly cheese steak without Cheese!! I did asked for cheese but the serving was non existent.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whiz wit. All you need to say when ordering.

Tourists will find it great, locals may not. But the debate over Pat and Geno's will go on I suppose. 

Overpriced but decent sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to stop here while I was in Philly. Got the Cheesesteak with onions and provolone and was very happy. The beef was tender and the sandwich was huge. I was also pleased to see the pepper bar  which offered a nice spicy compliment to the sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simple fact: Nobody from Philly goes to Pats, unless they know absolutely nothing about cheesesteaks. Steaks are poor to average and have been for years. It's a tourist trap and nothing else.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: "Give me a regular cheese steak ADD onions." Will be understood and the line will keep moving. The bottom line is to not to act like an idiot or a tourist when ordering. The Witz or Wit Out words are code for you are a tourist and if you are a tourist please order very fast and remember 1st window is steaks, 2nd window is fries & drink.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I bought one of each pats and genos, I felt pats had the better taste. Went on a Sunday and the lines on both places were long. Pats however took the win for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely won the battle between Pats & Geno's. Plenty of seating too! The sandwich was great with just the right about of cheese and onions. Sodas are a little pricey, but they have a sign explaining that haha
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm in Philadelphia for business and was told that this was the place. After going to Jim's previously I had high hopes. The line was long and the employees were friendlier than people made them out to be.

My 3 star rating is on the sandwich and fries. The sandwich was very average but the fries were fresh and good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's, Geno's, Jimmy's....all authentic Philly cheese steaks since they define the genre. All wonderful. It all depends on the ambiance you're looking for: d'ya wanna be on South Street (Jimmy's) or on Passyunk Avenue (Pat's and Geno's). 

If you don't understand the references, go try them all. You'll be glad you did.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was in the Philadelphia area for a business trip and I knew I just had to get a real Philly cheesesteak.  A friend of mine who went to school in Philly recommended Pat's over Geno's, so I gave it a shot.

Honestly I felt that it was overrated.  Maybe I was let down because I had such a high expectation.  My cheesesteak had LOTS of meat, but it was pretty dry and didn't have much flavor.  How dry?  The paper that it came on only had a couple drops of grease on it when I was done- that's how dry it was.  The cheese wiz was kinda funky and it threw me off.  I wish I had gotten it with provolone instead.

All in all, it was a good experience and still pretty damn tasty.  It is definitely a great sandwich, it just wasn't for me.  Geno's with provolone next time for sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The 3am stop was one of the highlights of my trip. I had a local bud order for me and it was so good, it may have been because I was starving. It was quick and I liked it... A LOT. do you ship to Hawaii? Lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Got a cheesesteak without onions. The bread is good but the meat is fattier and has less taste than others.  For $9.50 you can definitely get a better cheesesteak elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is a must stop if you come to Philadelphia. The popular taste testing of Pats or Genos! 

Personally I prefer pats only because you get a lot more meat in the sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: From Chicago in Philly for a day. I saw a program on the origin of the cheesesteak on PBS and wanted to check this place out. I really enjoyed the look and charm of South Philadelphia, the sandwich was pretty good, but it most certainly was not worth 9.50$. I mean 9.50$ and I don't even get fries and a drink, what is that about??
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you want a Philly Cheesesteak, Pat's is definitely the place to get it. Over the years, I have learned to order mine very efficiently. It's "with whiz" please. 

The people at Pat's even let me go behind the scenes one night to learn how to make a cheesesteak just like they do. It was all filmed for a school project. At 1 am, everyone was still pleasant and cheerful. We were even offered free cheesesteakes when the taping was finished.

Thanks so much to Kathy for allowing me back there!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I used to eat here but their service is worst than McDonald.  Asked for extra cheese and mayo. Extra cheese? Got it. Extra mayo? Nop. Gave me mayo in package. DIY mayo in my cheesesteak.  Wow this is the first. Cheese on the top and mayo can't reach the bottom. So what do I get? Dry beef inside. It's sad to see this place is getting close to Genos food and services.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yum Yum !!!   The original Philly cheese steak  , and south Philly what a BLAST !!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've heard a lot of good things about this place as compared to Gino's that's literally right across the street, so I came here with high expectations. Maybe too high..

All the meats and vegetables are already pre-cooked on the grill and then piled on the bread when you order so you get your sandwich literally right after you pay. I guess it helps with the influx of customers they have coming in, but that's specifically why I didn't like my sandwich very much. 

Sure, the meat was good, but it wasn't warm and none of my cheese was melted. What's the point of me traveling to philly for this sandwich if it's not gonna be warm in the first place...? I also don't particularly like anything that's been pickled and my peppers definitely had a tang of vinegar. I assumed my sandwich would have properly seasoned sautéed onions and peppers like a normal cheesesteak and was surprised by the vinegar. My friend liked them, I didn't. 

We both wished our sandwiches received more love and care instead of thrown together like McDonald's. Or at least at Mickey D's, they microwave the meat so it's slightly warm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When ordering a CHEESE steak, id expect to get something with more cheese then grease. 
Unfortunately this tasteless sandwich was pouring grease & had one small piece of cheese . I ordered with onions & provolone. After opening it to add ketchup the whole wrapper was covered in oil. After 2 bites i couldn't do it anymore. I ripped it open hoping the middle would be better but there was legit a puddle of grease soaking the bread. Gross. Threw it out
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's cheesesteak to me was tastier!More meat I think also. I tried Geno's at least 3 more times just to give them a few more trial runs, but still no good.  Pat's just have the taste Im looking for.  I order mine with whiz and onions.  Never a disappointment when I go here.  Yes, it is a tourist trap, but I dont care because I love cheesesteaks and I always order 3.  Two to eat there, and one to eat on my way home.  Keep up the good work guys!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Flew into PhL...really despise that airport. I feel like holding my breath for the duration of my pass through, but that's not a reality....ugh at least I was able to forget about the filth of the airport by enjoying Pats steak and wiz at 3AM. ;)) It was good..not sure how clean it truly is there though..hm I'm used to the cleanliness of Southern California...:p
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to try it! Got provalone instead of cheese whiz was good. Steak was tender. Fast service!9
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's apparently is well known across ... well, everywhere.  If you want to experience a touristy steak, feel free.  If you want a great steak, stay far away.  The meat itself is fine, if mass produced.  Unlike quite a few other places, Pat's has a huge hunk of meat cooking at any time.  The problem I found is that the steaks sure seem mass produced.  If I get a provolone wit, I'm going to get decent meat, but unmelted cheese and rather sad onions on a rather small roll.  For the same price, I can go to John's (or even Tony Luke's) and get a much more appetizing, and more bigger, steak.  The choice for me was simple.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When I get to Philly I always have to pass by for one of these.  This place is bomb.  Granted when you place the order you have to know what their talking about since you may not be used to the fast talking slur.  The best part they give you directions on how to order so the line keeps moving.  If you look around near the menu you can see an engraved area of the sidewalk where Sly Stallone stood during the filming of Rocky.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not a huge fan of their dry, flavorless cheesesteaks, however their cheese fries are to die for!  I personally like Pat's better because Geno's is not PC about the sign's he puts up around his place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well, naturally, we had to try this place.  We got their cheesesteak with onions and American cheese.  Took a bite and, well, it is just a sandwich after all.  It's not mind blowing good or something that we'd have to go eat again.  The meat seemed a little fattier than the meat at Geno's and was chopped in smaller pieces.  Overall, it just seems overhyped to us.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
YUM!   stopped here on vacation. 

Parking is horrible   be prepared to parallel park.

Totally worth it.  

Order and then have amazing things happen when you eat it.  yep that good.  
Worth the 2 hour side trip to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
wit-extrawhiz. love the messy cheesy goodness that is pat's. even though geno's had better bread, pat's wins with overall deliciousness. 

that is all.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not bad cheesesteaks, I make better ones myself at home but, when your in Philly I guess you get a cheesesteak. Cheesesteaks are ok, Employees are Rude.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes, yes, I know...Tha Yelp Daddy was told never to come here but darn it I had to...I heard so much about their history that Tha Yelp daddy needed to peep out the scene! And I must say, for an outsider, I really like this cheesesteak. I liked the cut of meat, the seasoning, the onions, the soft bread and even the cheesewhiz...It was dope to me. Tha Yelp Daddy was feeling this place. Actually, I like it more than some of the other places that the Philly natives recommended. I even like their's a little better than Geno's...like 1/2 notch, tho!
I mean, as Tha Yelp Daddy, I should try the orginals before comparing the evolution of the Philly Cheesesteak, right? Yall gotta respect Tha Yelp Daddy for that...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Genos but I only eat here when I have out of town guests. Or if I'm in the area and I'm hungry and want something late night. The only properly to eat this cheesesteak is with the cheese wiz and don't be worried if you don't have cash. Garage (garage themed bar across the street) has an atm outside. This service is super fast which is a plus.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Personal opinion but Pat's takes Geno's to the mat...wit and Whiz...only way to go. My son-in-law went with Provolone and thought it was a better choice. Need to do some walking before and after...best hangover food ever!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Geno's is way different from pats that's a good thing! The area is a great tourist spot and a lot of history. The cheesesteaks were in my favor great beefy steak flavor in the sandwich and the cheese was a great amount in my opinion but not my number one spot for cheesesteaks sandwiches. But if I had to choose out the competitors I'm a pats fan sorry geno's not sorry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
tried Pats and Geno's at the same time tonight. i was so thoroughly disappointed in this place. i really can't understand what the hype is all about. they are more impressed with handing you their sandwich before even giving you your change than making a great sandwhich. 
the meat seemed unseasoned and lacked any flavor what so ever. not to mention, i didn't even taste the provolone that was supposed to be on it. the service was also sub par, and that was very difficult considering we were only standing there for 1 minute. 
will never return to this place when in Philly again. it seems like they are settling in on their reputation as opposed to making good food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It was ok, nothing great, but definitely nothing bad.
Great steak nonetheless :)
Fast service, very funny sign with directions on how to order, and it's nice to see the steaks being made through the window.

I'd say if you only want one cheese steak, go to Genos instead!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
"OMG, you are going to Philly, you have to check out Pat's"

I heard this from most people I spoke to before going.  The people from Philly I knew, the people who went to school in Philly, the people who have recently moved there.  The majority of people I asked said this was the better of the two.

They were all correct.  Pat's puts the Wiz on top of the steaks, which makes it quite amazing.  I ordered "Wiz, Wit" and loved it.  Highly recommended.

Before going, look up how to order...or read the instructions posted to the right of the window while you are in the line.  It's not as scary as some people make it out to be.

There will always be a line, it does not matter what time of day you are there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was perhaps the worst cheese steak I have ever had.  The flavor was awful.  My wife and I both threw our sandwiches out after a couple of bites.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
