text: We did the Pat's and Geno's cheese steak challenge, since we saw mixed reviews on both.  We thought were both good and had characteristics unique to each.  Each had things we liked - Pat's had a lot more Cheese Whiz, the bread was soft and good, but did not hold together as well as Geno's.  Geno's was .50 more to add peppers, but had a lot more peppers then Pat's.  They did not have as much cheese on sandwich.  Their bread held together better, and seemed to have a butter drizzle on the outside which made it crispy.  Cherry peppers were great, but Hot!  PARKING was HORRIBLE!  Only street side, no lots that we saw.  No bathrooms that we saw, & outside seating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Of all the cheesesteak places (Geno's, Jim's and pat's) Pat's Cheesesteak with wiz takes the cake! We need a cheesesteak hopping your and loved this one the best! It's a must try!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So my girl and I decided to make a run to Philly for their famous cheesesteaks.  We got down there and walked to that famous corner where Geno's and Pat's stare eachother down.  Both places had HUGE lines but Geno's was a bit shorter so we decided to start off there.  After our first cheesesteak fix we crossed the street to Pat's.  

Personally i did enjoy both; however, Pat's steak seemed to be sliced thicker and when you bite into the sandwich you could definitely tell that there was more steak in  Pat's cheesesteak.  

Pat's is the winner!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: To be honest, I don't get it.  It's MEDIOCRE at best.  Fortunately went at an OFF/less busy time.  It has a tourist appeal; the corner (Geno's also).  A one time visit for me/us.  Meat was kind of gross, didn't love it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
In Philly for 48 hours, heard lots of recommendations but ended up here. For the people who say they ordered wrong..... Well....there's an explicit sign that dictates how to order. And if you don't follow the directions then... Well... Guess it's your bad. 

My steak sand was de-freaking-lish it was quick, it was the perfect texture and temp and I found the ordering to be pretty f-ing easy. 

5 stars.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was our 4th stop on our top 10 cheesesteak mission. If you're in the area pat's and geno's is a must. These were my 1st ever authentic philly cheesesteak experiences. No fan fare. Just straight to the point yummy goodness. Expect a line. Theres a reason these 2 places are on the top 5.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
**THIS REVIEW IS SPECIFICALLY IN REFERENCE TO MY PHILLY CHEESESTEAK TASTING ADVENTURE - Please refer to my review of Cosmi's Deli for background & stipulations of the quest**

As the "creator" of the cheesesteak, Pat's may need to revamp its original recipe. He scored worst in both meat and topping quality with dissatisfaction stemming from "flavorless", "fatty" meat and an overwhelming cry for more cheese. As the sixth place finisher scoring 6.9, Pat's forte was represented in the aroma category - where he ranked first.

Historical legacy isn't everything, apparently. Pat's delivers the worst meat quality and worst toppings of all eight competitors. Well...at least it smelled tasty?

(Full result details can be found at: http://22ndandphilly.blogspot.com/2011/06/reader-contribution-operation-whiz-wit.html)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went to Pat's a couple times when I was in Philly last week, I also went to Jim's, Tony Luke's, Geno's and also got a cheesesteak from a street vendor and I would have to say that Pat's was my favorite cheesesteak during my vacation in Philly but I've had better cheesesteaks in the bay area surprisingly I came here twice for cheesesteaks while I was visiting the city and I had the mushroom cheesesteak wit whiz and onions the first time and the 2nd time, the same thing but wit white american instead, the cheese whiz is soooo good they use, their meat has a lot of good flavor. I love their cheese fries too and their cherry soda they have is good, it's like a soda version of a cherry slurpee but it's not as sweet as a cherry slurpee. The rolls they use are great too. One thing I didn't like about Pat's is that the workers that helped me had no personality but I like how they are fast at giving you your food. Pat's rocks!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Thought this would make for great hangover food after a friend's birthday celebration. Uhhhhh no. I should have stuck with my gut and gone to Jim's Steaks on South (My boyfriend told me so, but I thought I'd try a new place). 

I ordered a pizza steak, and my friend ordered a regular steak. Both were dry and tasteless. I don't think I'll be going there again. Also, the people are rude. RUDE I TELL YOU!

S/n: The walk there was totally not worth it. The block before also has a sketchy smell and rabbits, pigeons, and rats in cages.....wtf? Don't eat the sesame chicken or General Tso's in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overheard some workers talking, and apparently they don't know what MDMA is. Also one of them said he quit smoking weed but then he forgot my order so...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Pat's.  Liked Leo's better.  I was behind a guy who screwed up his order so I got the residual attitude and therefor a sub-standard sandwich.  Not enough meat, stale bread.  Bogey.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We had this when we were in Philly and ate Pat's, Gino's, and Jim's. Pat's was WAY better than Ginos and marginally better than Jim's. 

I got mine with cheese wiz and onions (wit onions?) and it was FANTASTIC. I wish they had these back west. 

I will say, the one thing i was surprised was how good the fries were. I was expecting sysco, but these were legit. I will say the line can be a bit tough though, especially if you're only in town for like 3 days. Can't wait to come back here!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am still not sure how to rate Pat's... It's not like I have great expectations from a cheesesteak sandwich but the bread was subpar, the meat was chopped, mangled and not particularly flavorful, the onions were "meh" and cheese wiz.... Well that's nothing special.
The cheesesteak counter guy barks at you and you have to go to a different counter to order the fries (uninteresting) and drinks (soooooooo efficient) but at least there is no xenophobic bullsh*t like at Geno's and they have more sitting space
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Incredible cheesesteaks  first time in Philadelphia and heard this place was the best and it's definitely not disappointing!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I finally got to hear what the hype was all about on my first trip to Philly last week.  I've had cheese steaks before, but not Philly-style!

This place is authentic!  It was sooo good!

Service is fast, but that means you better know what you want to order too.  Parking is a bit on the crazy side since the place is so popular.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You have been warned. STAY AWAY from Pat's. This place would not exist it it were not for the Food Network/Travel Channel. The food is plain nasty which mirrors the service. The young man at cash register was mouthing off to me bc I took too long to get the money in his hot little hand all the while there was nobody else in line. 

You will not see any locals here bc they have already figured out what the tourists don't know. Save your $10 and find a shop that is not featured on TV.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is a lot better than Geno's but the sandwich itself still sucks. The meat is thin and dry, bread was ok, cheese whiz was what it is. If this sandwich was $3 rather then $8.50 I would buy again. 
BUT, if you want real cheesesteaks, go to Dalessandro's. It's farther out but worth the trek!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Food needs more seasoning, the bread was really the only thing that was good. I'm from the south and we have better philly's at wing restaurants
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Awful awful awful service. Don't go here! Please you will regret it if you do! The steak is tough, the people that work there are rude scumbags and they try to rush you through the whole process.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We went with another couple. We went across the street to Geno's and they ordered at Pat's. They preferred Pat's, we preferred Geno's when we split the sandwiches. I guess that is why both of these places can survive when they are right across the intersection from each other.

This is a fun place- the menu board teaches you how to order, and then has some fun by telling you if you do it wrong you should go to the end of the line.

We hit the place just after a hockey crowd  arrived. Parking was tough, but we squeezed in. The line was long- but it went really, really quickly. Hat's off to them for great service!

Not a gourmet meal by any means, just for fun and it was that! Warning- they don't accept anything but cash, but there is an ATM on the premises.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Enjoyed the cheese steak.  The lines move very quickly. There are restaurants on the west coast that make cheese steaks, but I feel that the cheese steaks in Philly are better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Sucks that it's outdoors. But we loved Pats wayyyyy better than Genos! More meat and more cheese! Super delicious. Fast service! And the Rocky movie did record a scene here. Good service too! Super fast made! 

It wasn't ALL bread there was plenty of meat and cheese! And the perfect amount of onions!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So we were in Philly for the day... Of course, we wanted to get some cheese steak for lunch. Well, we should've listened to the locals. This place was a tourist trap- long lines, cash only and no where to sit. And to top it off, they rush you when you order and of course, we made the mistake of not saying provolone so all of our hoagies were with cheese wiz. Not everybody in our group liked cheese wiz so when I asked for an exchange, the guys working the front just said you ordered wrong so deal with it. I just didn't like the attitude. Just very rude- 
So that was my experience... It would've been fine if the cheese steaks were actually good but sadly, it wasn't. The steak was dry and the bread stale. I don't think having provolone instead of cheese wiz would've made a difference. NEVER AGAIN!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So after eating our steaks at Geno's, we had to compare it to Pat's. Walked across the street ordered 1 cheesesteak with provolone and onions. The menu selection here is better.
My hubbie ate it while I watched cause I was full from Geno's. He said Geno's was better because the meat wasn't fatty, the cheese was already melted, and the service was a tad better. 
Oh they have more patio tables than Geno's though. I give them that!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap but very good. Ate at the park across the street and bought a $6.00 canoli next to Genos. Priciest canoli I ever had, if you want the best canoli come to Brooklyn Villabate...I promise you!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We did that taste test between Pats and Geno's. Both were good, not the best ever had. Don't let the line scare you away. They keep the line moving fast. We did With Wiz and onions. We were told the onions were grilled, thought they were a little raw. Overall good experience! CASH ONLY!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yum yum yum is all that I can say!!! Must eat here!!! Sandwich is pretty big so sharing is also great!!! If I lived in philly, this would be a place I would visit very often!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Can I start off saying that I'm from philly and I hate pats and Genos? Ask any local, we eat here. One wth, guess im wrong because today I was hungry and I decided to stop by because I remember stopping by here before the beach when I was young. Dude this steak blew my mind! It has hefty, LOADED with meat and SMOTHERED in cheese. Look at my picture and tell me that isn't a good looking steak. The bread was fresh and the onion was nice a caramelized. I think the key to coming here is to go when it's not busy like a Monday or Tuesday night. Dude I'm telling you my steak was a 11/10 and I just told you us locals DONT eat here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Long lines, no worries, at Pat's the line goes by very fast! you have to know what you're getting or else you will be holding up the line. wit-extrawhiz is heaven in my tastebuds. i've never enjoyed cheese this much until me and the gf finally got our philly cheesesteak experience last month. don't bother getting fries, the sandwich is all you would ever need. and oh, don't forget, you would need lots of napkins during and after you eat. 

extra whiz, my friend.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came to Philly for the weekend in search of the best cheesesteak and I have to say, I enjoyed Pat's a lot!!!  I got mine with peppers and mushrooms and the cheesesteak was so damn juicy and tasty!!!   I enjoyed it a lot.  The line wasn't too long and I was so surprised since I was there shortly after lunch on a hot summer Sunday!   There are also some picnic tables you to sit and eat and I thought that was cool.  

I also tried Jim's, Ishkabibble and Geno's during the same weekend and I have to say Pat's was much better than Jim's and Ishkabibble's in terms of juiciness, cheesy ness and tastiness.   Now for me to compare it to Geno's, Geno's much better than Pat's.  Read my review to find out why!   Don't get me wrong, you should still try Pat's and the other places around the city.  I think it's genius for it to be across the street from each other so you can try both at the same time. 

I drove to Pat's and I am not from Philly so I recommend driving there.  The area around there didn't look too good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My first cheese steak ever and I must say it was the absolute best! We went across the street to Geno's first because we wanted a little taste of both and wanted to compare, definitely Pat's the winner, and it is much more delicious! I'm coming back for sure!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just ok.  I was really hyped to go here. We packed the kids up for a two hour drive just to try it out. First, the streets are super narrow and parking is scarce, luckily we found one after driving for an extra 15 mins. The line to order wasn't bad nor the wait time after placing the order, in fact, it was FAST!  Since there is only outside tables to eat at but far too cold to sit at, we took it back to our car.  All of the sandwiches needed salt. Fries? Out of 5 ordered only 2 were eaten.  Is this place a repeat? Perhaps not.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My Philly friends are split between Pat's and Geno's.  So I had to try both.  Pat's definitely won the contest.  The steak was better, the bread was better, and it was just an overall tastier sandwich.  Pat's wins that battle for sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Well, on a rainy Saturday in march it was a 25 minute wait. Sadly it was still quicker than genos. 

10 dollars, cash only. 

This place is pumping cheesesteaks out like lightning though. 

I do prefer the overall experience over genos, but the sandwich was better at genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Despite my warnings, my daughter insisted we take her to 9th & Passyunk to try both Pat's and Geno's to see which was better. On a scale of 1 to 10, Pat's rated a 1, but beat Geno's which rated a 0. Steakum on a Wawa roll is better than Geno's. But as far as Pat's goes, the meat is fatty, stringy, and chewy. The sandwich itself is dripping with grease- but despite the poor quality, it actually tasted OK thus giving it 1 star more than Geno's. BTW, at $9, the price is obscene.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Frankly, a place with so much history, I expected more. When I was visiting Philly, I was eager to try Philly cheesesteak, but I must say I was not impressed.

While the food was fast and in large portions, the steak was simply too dry and the bread too greasy. Had I been intoxicated, I'm sure I would have definitely enjoyed this place, but I wasn't. Thus, I was underwhelmed. However, I did enjoy the condiment cart.

All in all, if you're looking for cheesesteak, try somewhere else -- perhaps somewhere less tourist-y with better quality.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After coming to Philly a few times now I can finally say I def like Pats the best!! The bread, the meat, and the cheese wiz is what makes this sandwich. The workers are also very friendly compared to the rude staff at Geno's who just wants your money and that's it!! 

Can't wait for my next trip!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
That was an experience! 

First timers in Philly. We tried another place the day before and enjoyed it but it felt like there was something missing. Then we came to Pat's!

We were lucky there was no long line. It was raining hard. We had our orders in a flash! Efficient system.

The bun was filled overflowing with delicious nicely cooked meat. We got FULL and were completely satisfied by the quality and quantity.

I hope we can find something close to this in Manhattan.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If You Can Deal With The Attitude These Guys Have And You Have No Were To Go Late Night Then Your In For A Mediocore Cheese Steak !
The Quilty Of There Meat Is Terrible ..........smh....I Hate When Places Like This Are Allowed To Do What They Do.

All In All - If You Need To Go Somewhere For Late Night Cheese Steak Craving Try Tony Luke's

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM HERE !!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Absolutely not! This place is terrible and overpriced. 

They do not make the cheesesteaks to order. There is a huge stack of bread with cheese already placed in the bread. Someone does a 3 second grill chop of  overcooked steak, toss in some pre-cooked onions. 7 seconds later your cheesesteak is ready. JUST AWFUL! 

Cheesesteak bread SHOULD be toasted on the grill while the steak is chopped up with onions or peppers, and the cheese melted and placed on top of steak. Made to order. NOT what happens here.

This place is serving $9.50 cheesesteaks that taste like something out of the freezer aisle. 

AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you are visiting Philly...you need to come down and get a good cheesesteak. This is definitely the place to go to. Pats over Genos anyday.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: ** Only accepts cash ** cheesesteak was extremely dry. Employees did not seem to care much. Paid and asked for extra cheese which did not receive. Definitely will only go to ishkabibble's or genos from now on.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best cheesesteak sandwich, no wonder they have long lines than Geno's. Love their hoagie, the cheese melts in your mouth and the steaks were so tender and juicy, simply the winner!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Mushroom cheesesteak wit whiz.

A quick stop in Philadelphia just to get an authentic Philly cheesesteak and where else to go but to the originator and inventor, Pat's.

You must be ready!  Have your money out and you'll get about 10 seconds to complete your order and transaction. Try not to mess up when you order, I was nervous :3. After your order, you'll have your food in less than a minute.  These guys got it down!

Thin slices of beef, a healthy drizzle of cheese whiz, onions, mushrooms, all within a warm bread roll. Perfect for cold winter afternoon.

Pat's has history on his side when it comes to Cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was okay; excited to go as we'd heard a lot about it. Experience was not awesome but not terrible, make sure to realize you'll eat outside right next to the street. The cheesesteaks are delivered in the window and they are so "hard core" that they cannot bother to wrap them. Maybe it's part of their appeal of Schlick, I dunno but it's 10 bucks and they could be a little nicer.

Taste was okay; but I've had better. I'd argue Jersey Mike's is better. 

They charge 3.50 for a soda, and then complain that it's the local taxation for soda but that's BS as the tax is only 28 cents. The rest is all in them; so they could be a little more forthright it drop that act that the high price is due to taxes.

In the end not so bad for a snack; but not worth going out of the way for.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is a lot like Ben's Chilli Bowl in DC, it's something you have to do because of it's long history, but it's a tad lackluster. Places like this rely on the fact that they will continue to get business because of tourists and the name. That is not to say that it was bad by any means, but I have had better. Many of the locals tell you to check out Max's or Cleaver's, but Pat's is something you have to do at least one. I did think that Gens's across the street was better though. My friends and i went to Pat's and Geno's and we thought Gens's was better overall. 

Also, this is all outside, with no public bathrooms and only takes cash.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Like what all first timers probably do, we had to try both Pat's and Geno's. I have to say, PAT'S TAKES THE CAKE, HANDS DOWN! The meat is marinated so well, its juicy, and all the fixins are the icing on top. We ordered our sandwich with mushrooms, peppers, and provolone cheese. I think this is where we messed up :( I believe the taditional way is with cheese wiz? Next time, we'll know. Nonetheless, still bomb!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You go to Pat's King of Stake because when you are in Philly you have to go & stuff your face! It's good but you gotta know what you want because the line is long and the guys are quick ! Enjoy & have fun!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: is Pat's&  Geno's the Philly version of the Hatfields and McCoys?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: they aren't as scary as people like you you believe.  i went here with my bf last weekend so he can try an authentic philly cheesesteak.  he thought the sandwich was good - but as expected.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My review of Geno's versus Pat's cheese steaks. 
I have to say, I wasn't overly impressed with either.  I'll say it; we can get a much better cheesesteak from any pizza place/sub shop back home in Buffalo.  That being said, here's what I thought:

Geno's:    Delicious roll.  Nice and dense and chewy, I preferred it much more than Pat's.  The steak is served whole, in slices, but there is not a lot of meat at ALL to fill up that dense, chewy roll.  I got mine "wit" onions, but they weren't cooked down enough and weren't overly soft.  Also, they were piled right in the middle of the roll, so the proportions were off until I opened it up and used my finger to redistribute it along the whole roll.  The cheez wiz on Geno's meat liquefied and melted off, dripping off onto the paper.      
The seating and atmosphere at Geno's is much nicer, it's very well lit, cleaner, and more tourist-friendly.  I have to say, though, it was awkward standing behind some foreign customers (speaking to each other in a different language) and watching as they saw the article taped to the window and the sign stating to "Speak English".  They took some pictures of the signs and laughed, but still... awk-ward.     We went in January and there was basically no one waiting in line outside.  The only place to eat is outside, too, so prepare to freeze your hands off as you devour your food!  Also:  separate ordering windows for steaks vs fries, but I didn't notice a SIGN saying such, just the irritated girl at the window telling people to go down to the next window to order fries.   Seemed weird, especially since there was no one waiting. 

Pat's:    Less inviting location, not all lit up as well as Geno's.  Signage seemed older and more beat up.    The roll was good, perfectly acceptable but not as amazing as Geno's.  There was LOTS more meat than Geno's , which is definitely more my style.  Pat's chops their steak up, which, I discovered, might be an easy way to disguise that their meat isn't as high quality as Geno's since there was LOTS of gristle in my sandwich and none on Geno's.   The cheese wiz didn't melt away into oblivion on the Pat's sandwich, which was nice.  The onions were OVERdone, however, with a burnt taste to some of them.  The onions were nicely disbursed through the chopped up meat, but that only meant I got the burnt taste through my whole cheesesteak since I couldn't scrape them off.   

So in Summary: - Pros and cons to each which made it impossible to choose which was better.  Wish I could make a combo of the two to make one perfect sandwich!   

 Geno's= Much less steak but nicer quality steak in solid slices.  Better roll.  Cheez wiz melts away and drips off the roll.  More dense/less cooked onions piled right in the middle. 

Pat's:  Much more steak, cut up/diced up and very full of gristle/fat.  Onions mixed in well throughout but overdone and some were burnt.  Cheez wiz stayed intact and blended well with the beef in each slice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Between Pat's and Geno go to Pat's

Better portion. Tastier beef. Just all around good cheesesteak. 

Whiz wit for sure!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Best of the tourist traps,  I choose it over the rude genos. 

Tried both in the same night was not impressed with the other guys
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Plenty of meat, but very bland.  Place was very dirty all around with trash everywhere and no napkins in the dispensers.  Go to Geno's across the street for a better steak and a cleaner environment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ok...I got yelled at because I did not have my money ready ...but it is part of the charm of this place. If you take that serious you should stay in the burbs!  You know what you are getting here...it has been the exact same for years! We even had to share a lunch table with strangers because it was a busy Thursday lunch on a nice day!  Love the steak sand ...wit..wit.  
Bread is always fresh...which is key!  I have had better Philly cheesesteaks but nothing like the charm of this one! Many memories too.  I will always be back!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Okay, honestly Pats and Genos suck! I'm born and raised in Northeast Philly. I usually eat at Steve's Prince of Steaks and Dalessandro's and I decided to try both Pats and Genos after going to the miracle on 13th st. Let me just tell you, Steve's and Dalessandro's are way better! They have a better ratio for everything and don't overload their cheese like Pats does and the steak is better! All in all, I recommend going to Steve's and Dalessandro's over going to Pats and even Genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
$9.56 for a wiz with onion at Pats VS. $9.50 for a wiz w/o onion at Genos.

After trying both side by side, I prefer Pats.

The cheese at Pats is a paler yellow color than Genos but Genos wiz cheese is slightly saltier than Pats.

The meat at Pats seem like fresher meat, where when you bite into it, it pulls a part easier than Genos, where the meat was tough to chew on a bit. 

The bread for both places were the same. No difference. 

I prefer Pats because it was less saltier and less greasy than Geno.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is definitely historic and has quite the feel to it. I would say, you have to either go to Pats and/or Genos on your Philly trip just to experience it. The steak was good, not great, but good. I got the extra cheese with whiz and provolone. I would recommend it. The service is spotty at best, but what do you expect... A little bit sketchy of an area, but worth the cab ride over.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First night in town and we try Pat's first and it set the bar against Geno's. 
The menu is simple, recite what you want in your head and order it. Everything includes tax already so it's a flat amount. 
The meat is nicely chopped up and the bread is superb, doesn't get soggy and every bite has some resistance. I got it with cheese wiz, not to my liking, should've gotten provolone, but that's imo. 
The pizza fries and cheese fries are awesome. Crispy and very potatoe-y, you'll know when you get a cup of the goodness. 
Sodas were pretty flat for the group. 
Plenty of seating and the napkin stand is readily stocked. 
We are fans of Pat's and will gladly wait on line for their cheesesteaks over Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ok...after years of watching the battle between Pat's and Geno's on TV, and having my mouth water because I couldn't smell or taste their sandwiches, I've finally decided for myself.  And the winner is... BOTH!  It's just a matter of preference.  Geno's steak are sliced and Pat's are chopped up.  Both are delicious in my humble opinion.  (same review for Pat's as I did for Geno's).  However, if you ask my wife and kids, they say Pat's FO SHO!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good sandwich not great, but worth the trip to see some south Philadelphia and check it off your list.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Have your money ready and know how to order.  Delicious!  Will definitely go back next time I'm in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
2.5 stars- The environment 
2 stars- The food
3 stars- The service - it is fast, but you'll be treated like an idiot of you don't know how to order the "right" way

This place and the one across the street, Geno's, sucks and 99% of the people from Philly or anyone that has tried any stake from anywhere else in the city knows so. 

When you come to Geno's or Pat's, the only reason your going is because of a big clever marketing campaign and not because they have good food or service. 

Most of the people inline are:
Drunk - so they don't care that whey will have diarrhea from the dirty grade F meet, or everything else is closed that late so they settle
From out of state - so they don't know any better
Just moved into Philly - so they don't know any better

You'll notice most of the higher reviews are from out of state...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I can see why this place COULD be good but when I went it was very underwhelming and mediocre. I got the steak with cheese whiz and it was nothing that blew my mind. I wish the steak was warmer (it tasted too room temperature) and the flavor really lacked. The only thing that gave it a kick where the chili peppers I added on. 

Ya know the Costco philly cheese steaks that come frozen? Yup those were way better than pat's LOOL but come here for the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's or Geno's. Which one is it? 

I came here on a Saturday afternoon and both places were packed with people. Out of town tourists looking to try the famous Philly cheesesteak, no doubt. I would know, I was one of those people. The Travel Channel told me this was the place to be. After a few minutes of debating, my friends and I decided to line up at Pat's, the less flashy looking place of the two. The line was long, but it moved fairly fast. We waited for about 15-20 minutes before our orders were taken by Pat. Yes, Pat of Pat's King of Steaks. I got a "cheese, wit" (Cheez whiz, onions, meat and bread) and it was pretty good. I don't know if it was the best I've ever had, but it was good enough. It's best eaten piping hot or else the cheez whiz will start to congeal (yuck). You can add ketchup or peppers to your steak but I prefer to consume it as I ordered it. Pure, unadulterated meat, cheese and bread. 

Also, if you order your steak with any other cheese other than cheez whiz, the cheese won't be melted onto your steak. My friend ordered her steak with provolone and they just slapped some cheese between the bread and meat. She ended up taking some cheez whiz from our cheese fries and pouring it onto her steak. The lesson here? Don't mess with the original.

The service is curt and impersonal, but what do you expect? I would be like that too if I had to serve hundreds and hundreds of people all day long. The seating is limited. You can circle the premises and try to grab one of the tables surrounding the building or you can bring it back to your car to devour it. The choice is yours.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A complete waste of time. Me and my girl decided to take a day trip to philly, do some sight seeing, hit some tourist traps, hang on south street and get a cheesesteak. We decide to go to this place a few hours before a Phillies game which was a mistake. Line was wrapped around the entire restaurant. After standing in line for about 35 minutes, we get our steaks and luck up and grab half a table. The cheesesteaks were wet, soggy and flavorless. It was so bad I was actually shocked. Quite honestly, this was one of  the worst I've ever had. Ghetto carryouts in DC have WAY better "steak and cheese".  We sat next to a couple from Idaho who were also unimpressed. This place is nothing more than a tourist trap. If you want to take some pics and say you wen there, cool, but don't expect to get any good eats.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I FOUND A HAIR IN MY STEAK!
Along with the onions, which I didn't order on my pepper cheesesteak, I found a hair!!!!  
Man taking orders was too busy complaining about the people before me not ordering right and trying to move the line to get the order right.  The bread left something to be desired, the steak seemed fatty to me.  Picking onions out of half melted cheese is no fun....
Then I get my surprise....I'm picking onions out as I eat the sandwich - not much else to do....so whatever.  I'm almost done eating and I find a hair - a black hair.  My hair is red....it is most definitely not mine.  
When I complain, I get the following "Well, your sandwich is almost gone"  It's my fault I apparently started eating at the end without the hair in it?  
Then "It probably blew into your sandwich from the wind outside".  I'm sorry - it blew into my sandwich and got  all ingrained into the steak and cheese?  I think not.
No apologies, definitely no money back.  I think next time I'll go to Geno's across the way - or just eat the cheesesteaks here in NYC.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I waited years to visit Philly and compare Pat's with Geno's. Have to say I liked this more than their competitor across the street. The onions were too strong at Geno's, and the bread was better at Pat's. I'm definitely a Pat's gal more than a Geno's gal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Way better than Geno's but not better than Jim's...I think it's a tad overrated. Came to philly and tried both pat's and geno's on the same day and wasn't overly impressed with either but thought pat's was better. It was juicier than geno's and I thought the bread was better quality
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is for the tourists you don't want coming back to Philly.  Sampled six Philly steak places with some friends.  Where Pat's and Geno's steak sandwiches offer chewy gristle, Jim's Steaks and Tony Lukes offer high quality fresh ingredients.  Don't waste your time here when there are so many superior choices available.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you're interested in taking part in the ultimate Philly rivalry between the original titans of cheesesteakery, look no further. I recommend Pat's over Geno's for their higher quality, but you'll have to decide for yourself. If you're looking for the authentic, original cheesesteak, you've got it right here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Cash only.

I am not a cheesesteak connoisseur by any means, however I did find this to be the best one I've had! The meat was perfectly flavorful and tender, the bread was soft and a great vessel to hold all of the cheese and toppings I added. I thoroughly enjoyed Pat's and would definitely come here again if I was in philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: In the Pat's vs. Geno's debate, I am always on the side of Pat's. Their meat is tender and the cheese whiz is melted just right and the bread is phenomenal. Perfect cheesesteak and I have yet to find a better one in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Too touristy for its own good. Jims is still my favorite plus there is indoor seating at Jims. Go for the sake of saying you've been; however, if you want a truly delicious cheesesteak, then just go to Jims.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Here's my take on the whole Pat's vs Geno's thing: I think that Pat's has the better sandwich overall, and think that the meat is a bit better, but Geno's has a slight edge on the bread.  But I don't get a cheese steak to eat the bread, so I give the overall edge to Pat's. 

I once paid a $14 cab fare to go from a hotel in downtown to Pat's, wait for me, then take me back just to get a sandwich here.  And I'll never forget waiting in line with hundreds of others at 3 in the morning after a night of drinking.  Good times!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is really good! I ordered it "wit" onions and cheese whiz. I usually prefer all the lettuce, tomatoes, mayo, peppers...but all that would take away from the simple yet exquisite flavors of this world famous cheese steak sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm so glad that I ordered correctly as per the instructions. Otherwise I would have been shamed. 

I'm going to say that I don't like Philly. Never really had a particularly great time here with the exception that I visit longtime friends, but the city itself isn't my favorite. However, Pat's steaks made it almost worth it. My friend took me there, it was so out of the way I didn't know where the hell we were, and it was beat up, kind of reminded me of the town ballpark stand upstate. I got two and smushed the beef in my eyes. It stung like tender greatness. I didn't get a chance to go to Geno's. But whatever. The cheese was delectably nasty, and it was just a soft, easy to eat with dentures hoagie. The guy's hands and apron were dirtier than the toilet on the overnight express train from Moscow to Latvia. You also might want to figure out how to get back to where you need to be. That is if you can find a bathroom first.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
SO, my boyfriend and I were road tripping and decided to make a stop at both Pat's and Geno's.  We went to Pat's first.  Their signage describing how to order a sandwich was really intimidating.  Even though I know it was there to help us know how to order, it just got me all sorts of nervous.  But then again, I am all sorts of nervous anyhow, haha.  

We ordered one sandwich with onions and provelone and another with onions and cheese whiz.  It's def. better with the cheese whiz, but, the cheese was only on one part of the sandwich which left a lot of the meat whiz-less.  And there weren't too many onions.  :/ 

I think both places are worth the venture.  It's a fun thing to do!  My vote is for Geno's but you should give the original its fair chance and try both!  You may like one better than the other or both the same!  :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simply disgusting. Every bite was filled with grease.. the fries were soggy and staff are rude. There is way to much hype for this establishment. The steak was flavorless. Very sketchy how fast the sandwich was made so most likely pre made. Nothing was fresh. Cannot emphasize how greasy the sandwich was.. Try going to a restaurant instead.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is across the street from Geno's so get one of each & share it.  I liked Pat's a bit better - more minced up meat, plus I got it last so it was still hot & meat wasn't cold & dried out.

It seems there was a bit more Whiz in this sandwich.  I saw pepper on the side of the stand, didn't get any.  Maybe it would have made the sandwich better.

I wouldn't go out of my way again, but it was nice to try.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You know I got the original and while it was good, I wasn't that impressed. My wife raved about it! 
So what do I know?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What can I say that all the 5-star reviewers haven't already said?  Pat's is where it's at.  Geno's is run by rednecks and bullies, who are def anti-immigration.  Hey, it's the immigrants who invented the cheese steak (maybe not the wiz part.). Never ate a Geno's steak, and will never need to, because Pat's will be here forever.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I love Pat's...their  fries are way better than the competition! There are no indoor seatings so if you go during winter, like I did ( took a cab)  you will be eating that cheese-steak out in the cold ....but it's worth it!!!!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I dropped by while picking my girlfriend up from the train station.  I came straight from work so was still in my Air Force uniform.  Being tourists, I bought one sandwich from Pat's and one sandwich from Geno's.  Difference is, Pat's wouldn't take my money and gave me a sandwich and cheese fries on the house.  I tried to give them some money but they wouldn't hear of it.  Thanks for the great food guys!  We always appreciate it!  You have my vote in the battle between your restaurant and Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A classic!  I've converted to them over Geno's, mostly because their bread is much better.  They are a bit pushy with your order, but when there's a line down the street...who isn't?!

I just wish they would accept credit cards...but it would move a lot slower!

Probably my favorite cheese steak in the city, but if you go during lunch, don't expect to sit down!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is the Best Cheesesteak I have ever had in my life!!
Gino's across the street is a very close 2nd. 
This is the Big Debate in Philly.
My wife prefers Gino's by the narrowest margin

I would suggest getting a cheesteak from both places and sit down eating them while they are hot and deciding for yourself. Also they have amazing hot peppers you can put on yourself over by the condiments. So make sure you put a couple of those on with you ketchup or however you like it.

Inside Tip: Make sure you read the sign on wall of how to order proper so you don't feel like a tourist 
I like a "Provolone With"
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Out of my top 3 favorite cheesesteak places in Philly, Pat's ranks 3rd. Don't get me wrong, I still love me a wiz wit from Pat's and certainly go there as part of all cheesesteak tours, but the combination of the meat and bread isn't my favorite.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
How much did Pat pay these people to write good reviews about this joke shop ? 

The staff is rude 
The meat was cold
The cheese wasn't melted 
The bread was hard 
Plain AWFUL

Geno's for the win !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: C'mon, waddya gonna do, go across the street? If you want the wiz wit, this is the best. Shoulder to shoulder with locals and tourists, anxiety over ordering correctly, but when you grab you side of cherry peppers and put the straw into your cherry cola, you're ready to eat the original. Don't get fancy, say "wiz wit" at the counter and step to side to pay. You're not looking for Swiss cheese and bell peppers here. Just go for the original. Don't forget to check out the Rocky plaque on the sidewalk near the fixin station. Even for a local it'll take ya back. Go Phils!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you are a tourist and are looking for a good cheesesteak do not go here. It is a tourist trap and cheesesteaks they hand out are sub-par. 

Save yourself some time and go somewhere else.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is the wosrt place to get a steak.It`s a 5 star slop house.Worse off is the employee`s look like they are on dope.Eatin a frozen dinner from a dollar store is far better than this dump.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Without getting into the depths of the Pat's vs Geno's vs Everywhere Else debates, the place is as advertised. If you want the simple, true Philly cheesesteak, this is your first stop. 

The opinions/complaints you'll find on Pat's are mostly correct - it's not the best cheesesteak you can get, there are no frills, it's a little overpriced, and don't expect any friendly banter at the counter. You say your "wiz wit" and fork over cash (it's cash only), take your cheesesteak and move out. If you're fussy or want something special, you can go pretty much anywhere else for that. And of course if you're the type that insists on putting a fried egg on top of everything and riding whatever food trend, this place will just hurt your feelings. 

I give it 5 stars for it's unmatched consistency. The food and the process hasn't changed in my lifetime, which is almost unheard of in a world where even Coca-Cola and Oreo cookies feel the need to change things up. You'll probably be able to come back to this review 20 years from now and it will hold up just as well. Tradition is worth something. 

This here is a utilitarian, working-class meat sandwich with cheese and maybe onions on it. It isn't good for you and it's served with an air of arrogance and rudeness, in a so-so neighborhood with crappy parking. It's the perfect food and place to represent Philadelphia. Either you get it or you don't.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've been to Philly many times, but hadn't been to Pat's or Geno's. I finally tried Pat's, King of Steaks. It was good, fresh bun, steak had a good flavor, good portion. I got provolone wit., which means with grilled onions. A good traditional steak and cheese.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I feel like Pat's (as well as Geno's) get touted as some of the best cheesesteaks in Philly, but to me it seems as if it got to this point based on it being more of a tradition or tourist attraction rather than the actual food.

I've only been there once, so perhaps I need to go back to double-check.  The one time I've been, the cheese was not melted AT ALL and the meat was actually a little cold as well.  

I'm not sure if it's because they are so used to dealing with larger crowds that they have just become sloppy (there were only a few people there when I went) or if the steaks have always been made a certain way, but it just wasn't all that great.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went their wasted and LOVED it. Went back the next day sober and was like-- are you kidding? Its great drunk food but dont think I could frequent it. THOUGH EVERYONE SHOULD TRY PHILLY'S STAPLE FOOD.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes, the original.

I stopped by on account I had a rough experience at Max's in North Philadelphia. Ironically, the experience was better here. Well, at least in terms of not being hassled.

In addition to it's traditional ways, I have been to Pat's before and have a general idea of how to order. First off, no credit cards, cash only. I got myself a cheesesteak with provolone cheese. No frills. 

Unlike Jim's, the cheesesteak is just okay. Edible? Yes. Not the best cheesesteak, but not terrible. I guess I am paying for an experience, and that is okay. It is not terribly expensive either. It probably would have been had I ordered fries. Thankfully, I refrained. 

Considering the history behind this restaurant (these are the folks that are credited for inventing the darn sandwich), come check it out. but that is completely up to you. You would not be missing much if you did not. I prefer Tony Luke's, except they are harder to get to if you do not own a car.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You better.be ready to spit out your order in the proper Pat's syntax once you get to the window or you'll get the once over scowl from the guy taking your order in addition to the people behind you in line. This place is an assembly line of cheese steaks so you better not slow up progress.  Nonetheless, once I got my steak and provolone wit onions ten seconds later, I ran to a just vacated picnic table seat.  It was like musical eating chairs. Once I sat down, it got really ugly because I was sooo hungry.  I devoured my sandwich in two minutes.  So despite the hype and commercialization, you do get a good sandwich despite the hazing you get from the staff and customers.  I can now say that I am no longer a Philly Cheesesteak novice/virgin.  If you are in Philadelphia, Pat's is a rite if passage.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is superior to Geno's for two reasons.  First, their meat appears to be of a much higher quality than Geno's, which is important when it is the primary ingredient in 95% of the foodstuffs that are consumed here.  Second, it is far less tacky, having more of a South Philly neighborhood feel than the Reno-esque Geno's.  

Also, a friend of mine ate 8 banana peppers here one night to win a bet.  Note: when involved in a bet about who can eat more of those things, no one wins, except maybe the guy who pocketed one when they left tied at 7 peppers so he could eat it triumphantly in the cab on the way home.  He later vomited for 2 hours.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We were excited to try a Philly Steak, as tourist traveling through Philadelphia.  At first, my husband found Geno's online and as we were getting closer to Geno's, he read that Pat's King of Steaks (Pat's) had greater reviews than Geno's.  The parking is limited and circled around the neighborhood until we found an open spot.  

The line circled around Pat's and my thought was 'let's go some place else', because Geno's line also circled around their place.  I was wrong, it was quick, we ordered our steaks at the first window.  The second window is where you order our french fries and drinks.  Sadly, there were no french fries available, but the steaks were worth it.  It was very fulfilling and the only reason I give them the four stars is because we didn't get to try there french fries. :(  Also, they only accept cash and if you do not have cash on hand; there is an ATM between Pat's and Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Unfortunately I do not like Pats as much as Genos, Steves or Jims!!! For me the beef is a little too fatty and thin. More then once when I went here you can see the fat balls on the steak just hanging out. Yes these balls of fat probably provide flavor but for me, it freaks me out and gets caught in my teeth sorry!! 

But if you come to the area definatly go with a friend and get both Genos and Pats, and see for yourself
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is a joke!  Their sandwiches are average, taste the same as any of the other 1,000 places in Philly that serve them.  They think that by being complete assholes when you order that you will think their sandwhiches must be so good that people actually take that sh*t.  Don't be fooled, they suck and you pay extra to be treated like sh*t and if they f*ck up your order cause you don't talk in "Philly guido slang", they absolutely will not exchange it or change anything once you order it.

Walk across the street to Geno's or better yet try another, smaller, non-commercialized place and get a real taste of Philly.  I argued with those pricks and tried to exchange my sandwich and they told me to get the f*ck out of here??? I did, and I threw their sandwich in their trash and walked across the street.  Seriously, if you have a measurable amount of intelligence don't eat there and don't fall for their gimmick!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place never disappoints! Always will goto Pats every time I goto Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
2000+ reviews so what's more to add??

It only boils down to one...... *wait for it* LEGENDARY question: Which is better Pat's or Geno's?

The bread, the wiz and the meat... Pat's is better than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Gross! I had my first cheesesteak at Pat's today (I'm new to Philly) and was bitterly disappointed.

The guy at the window actually wasn't so bad, didn't feel like I was in "Soup Nazi" territory. But the quality of the cheesesteak (I had one 'wit' with cheese whiz) was a complete letdown. The meat was pretty dry and tough, because it had been sitting for a while. It was in the middle of the afternoon, so no lines... that might be different when there's more business. The cheese whiz was ok, and the bread was actually good.

BUT the quality of the meat was AWFUL - disgusting, with lots of pieces of gristly fat in between. It almost made me puke... I have no idea how Pat's came to have this reputation. Never again!

BTW, I liked Steaks on South a lot better! Go there if you are looking for a good cheesesteak. They make them fresh, so you're not in for nasty surprises like at Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My father brought me here since I was 6 years old. I used to eat Pats and Geno's in the same day. Pats is the best because of they way it's cooked and chopped. Best cheesesteaks in the world! The creator of the cheesesteak! Wiz-Wit
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When I visited Philly I was taken to Pats. Fine by me, I was kinda turned off by that whole "Speak American" thing going on at Geno's anyway. The steak was GREAT, but I did sneak over to Geno's and swipe some hot sauce.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For a touristy cheesesteak place, the better of two choices. Better wiz-to-beef ratio than Geno's, crispier fries, no xenophobia, and no recoiling at the sight of a partially-eaten Geno's cheesesteak on their property. It needs no glamour or glitz or neon or motorcycles or signs worshiping dead cops as it was still early 1982, it just gets the job done while being surprisingly old school. Kind of like the Action News theme.

Seriously, the fact that Pat's uses some sort of seasoning on their meat kind of makes the sandwich and soaks up some of the grease well unlike across the street where it's meat slices mixed with a wiz/grease combo.

If I had to choose one of two of the big places for a cheesesteak, it'd be Pat's. Of course, a small neighborhood hole-in-the wall could do just as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Drove almost 3 hours to do the Pat's/Gino's comparison. Well, I mean I never had a real Philly Cheesesteak and Pat's was first and it was good. Liked it better than Gino's. Tough drive in (kinda rough neighborhoods) and no parking. I seriously doubt either Pat's or Gino's would be in business without the other one there. Not sure it was worth it, but spent time with family, so that's important. And price, cash only. $11 at Pat's, $10 at Gino's. That's only for the sandwich. $3.50 for a coke. Forgot how much fries are, I think it was $4-$5. Take cash (there's an ATM, but I didn't use it, I'm sure there's a hefty fee to take money out).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Did the tourist thing and went to both Pats and Geno's.
Went with the basic offering "Whiz wit-out" to gauge fairly. 

Hands down Pats wins. Meat is tastier and the fries were crispier.

Not as gawdy as Geno's because it doesnt have to be... the flavor is what counts. 

Try both as they are local establishments,but if you were to take one to go.... well... Pats is the choice.

Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not quite sure how Pat's is the "King of Steaks?"
Cold, dry meat & bread. Provolone couldn't even melt based on the meat barely being warm... Damn shame... Was really looking forward to enjoying what I thought was a going to be a great meal but in all reality, I get better cheese steaks in CA!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I challenge anyone who wants to tell me there's a cheese steak better elsewhere. I can agree with you that it may not be the best however I think it's pretty up there. Definitely compared to Gino's at least. Do I think it's worth the $11-12....ehhhhhhh you pay for the name more so than the product I guess. 

I had mushroom pepper cheese steak with onions and provolone cheese. Yummy. After a 2-3 hour drive from DC - it's all worth it for me. 

I'll just leave it at that since there's over 1500 reviews already lol. I'll leave it up to you mysterious yelp reader what you think. 

~happy eatings!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is famous for it's cheesesteaks but also know that you have to be ready to order as soon as you reach that window. The move people very quickly which is great because you can be in and out in 10 minutes when there's a long line. I only gave it 3 stars because the steak was more slab-like than chipped which I like chipped better. It was still good though!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I know there are many bad reviews on this place and I understand why, it is expensive for what you get, it is cash only, they aren't the nicest people around, but it's a very distinct taste and I do enjoy it on occasion, one of those things I get a craving for and nothing else will do. You should give it a shot at least once, maybe share it with someone.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Extremely fast service. Your order is in, you pay, get your change and your sandwich. The sandwich itself was decent, though greasy, and you started tasting the grease rather than the good. There's other choices, but I'd go back if in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
They sucked just as much as Geno's did.
Bad cuts of meat.
No seasoning.
Nasty tasting.
Staff were rude. 

When we drove up on this place... it looked so cool but I soon realized ... well after my first bit that these two places are a tourist trap. 

Nasty.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well the hype was let down for me. I've heard of the Pat's vs Geno's steak sandwich. So I decided to go with Pat's since I heard it was much better. Well going there I didn't know it was cash only. Luckily I had exact amount for a cheese steak sandwich. Which cost me $10. And it sucks they don't take credit or debit cards. They would get so much more business if they did. Well finding parking was a pain first of all. Such a small area that I was lucky to get a spot across the road. Then the line on a weekday was super short. It does go by quick. However the guy at the register seems to not care about waiting cause he makes you order so fast. You need to know you're order and how to order before you get up to the register which is annoying cause being a first time customer you don't know. So I unfortunately ordered the wrong cheese cause I was rushed. The guy just wanted the money and for you to leave. Then I got the cheese steak and it lack flavor. The cheese wasn't melted which sucked. Overall the hype of Pat's was so bad. I possibly might return but probably try Geno's. or neither and find another place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Sooo.. finally got to see what the whole "philly" cheesesteak hype was about! A friend of mine brought us here and had us get one from here and one from Gino's across the street to compare and contrast how good and nasty these are! 

I have to say that the bread and the meat both are MUCH better at Pat's and actually would never go back to Gino's. The line is about the same length in both (I'm assuming people have the same mentality as us to compare?). 

I can't give 4 or 5 star because of two reasons:
- They use their bare hands for everything, how do people not get hepatitis, diarrhea, food poisoning? The cashier guy collected money, licked his fingers to count my change, put meat on our sandwich, added cheese -- all with his bare hands. 
- This sandwich was good -- but $10? Not worth it. 

Overall, the sandwich was pretty decent and next time visiting Philly, I'd probably come again. It's more-so a "good experience" kind of like the 53rd and 6th Halal carts in NYC.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Do I really have to write a review? I have been at least 20x.  Simply the best! Have tried others-non compare!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the best reason to leave Geno's line! Lol! Their line may be shorter, but theres a reason for that. Pat's cheesesteak was far superior. It has more meat, and seasonings on the meat and the whiz, well that just steals the deal. It was hot, fast, and the line flies. My bf and I tried Geno's first, (as we suspected Pat's would be better), and we were right!! Geno's steaks were dry, chewy and the bun was practically empty. There was no seasoning or flavor to the meat. You have to hit Pat's and order a "wit whiz" and youll be very satisfied. I cant wait to get back there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The age old question...Pat's or Geno's. Personally I think both places make good cheesesteaks, it really depends if you like your steak chopped up (Pat's) or   kept in slices (Geno's). My preference was Geno's because it was easier to eat, the bread seemed a little better and I liked my meat in slices instead of chopped up.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Amazing food. I loved my sandwich. I drove all the way from upstate New York just to get an authentic Philly cheesesteak. It took less then a minute to get my food and they o my take cash.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Regrettable, lackluster food and experience. I came here after perusing through the Italian Market, and after eating my sandwich, I regretted not eating somewhere - anywhere - at the Italian Market instead.

100% touristy and gimmicky, overpriced, greasy and messy, tastes like a waste of space, provolone not melted, not enough places to sit and eat, distasteful clientele.

I know that this isn't the local favorite for cheesesteaks in this city, but my tourist intuition told me to go here for a memorable experience. My sister had recommended against Geno's ("I've had better in Burbank, CA," she said), and I personally didn't care to financially support their political agenda anyway, so I chose Pat's. I'm guessing that there may not be much difference in quality or service, however.

Sorry, cheez whiz is disgusting in general. I instead ordered "one provolone wit." I paid my $9.50, and literally within 5-10 seconds, my sandwich appeared at the window. They spend more time and care making my sandwiches at Subway. I should have paid attention as soon as I picked up my cheesesteak from the counter, because the worker took out his towel and wiped down the greasy juices from the counter top where my food had just been... and as I walked around the building to find a table to sit and eat, the same greasy juices spilled right over my shirt and jeans. Gahh. Thank you, Pat's, for letting me walk around like this for the rest of the day (I spent the evening trying to scrub down my clothes in my hotel sink with a bar of soap).

I found a seat at a table as soon as a couple of other patrons finished their sandwich and left, and then sat about to eat my cheesesteak. I didn't like that the provolone wasn't melted, probably because they just slap a couple slices on the bread in the 5 seconds after your order. The meat tasted flavorless to me and the whole thing tasted like a waste of stomach space and calories to me. I rarely ever do this, but after eating my way 2/3 through the cheesesteak, I decided I was better off just tossing the remainder. Yes, I suspect that the cheesesteaks probably do taste better in Burbank...

And while I was sitting at my little table, a group of six Asian guys decided that there was nowhere else to eat, and just sat down and crowded the table with me and hovering around me as I ate. I get it, you guys are so awesome and badass that you can just overtake a lone girl's table without the shred of decency to ask if it's OK, or any sense of how uncomfortable and weird it is for me to have to sit among your thug selves as you swear up a storm talking about your cars and your women. Yes, you guys are so thug in your American Eagle Outfitters t-shirts. Pat's, if this is in any way representative of your normal patrons, I think I hate your dumb clientele more than your food.

Never again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was my second visit to Pat's and they didnt fail me. The meat is soo delicious and flavorful, and the service was quick despite the line I stood in (a cocktail before you stand in it helps a lot late at night ). It is cash only so beware, and parking is a little crazy. I ordered the mushroom pepper steak with provolone cheese, and onions. I didnt add any condiments except those additional peppers (they're delicious) because you dont need any. The meat makes the sub so moist.  I love Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They have become arrogant. Bread was hard as a rock...steak unflavored.. Saving grace was cheese and onions.. Well...anything will taste good with cheese and grilled onions. And very overpriced...10 bucks for less than extraordinary cheesesteak! I believe JerseyMikes are better
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Finally made it to Pats... I've been dying to try an authentic cheesesteak for years and yesterday I got it and it did not disappoint. I got mine with mushrooms and whiz, fries and a lemonade. Omg I was in heaven. After running a 9.3 mile race earlier that morning this was the perfect end to my trip to Philly. 
The service was great. Long line that moved quick. Can't wait to visit again
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Favorite steak place in all of Philly! Great staff, delicious steaks. They have several options for cheese, with our without onion, and it's decently priced. Pats is king
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in Philly so I went here to grab the original cheese steak. The cheese steak was honestly low quality and the eating environment kinda stunk. I had to go to a Dunkin Donuts just to take a piss.... Thriving on just its merit is the only thing about this cheese steak that keeps people coming. Jim steaks south street, Spataro's, or Molly Malloy's can make you a cheese steak that's 10x better. Don't make the same mistake that I made, listen to every local and don't go there. Being the first is great but it doesn't make it the best. The Wright Bros brought us the airplane but Glenn Curtiss made the aircraft what it is today.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tried Geno's and Pats. I hate that they only take cash... So be prepared or you'll have to withdrawal $20 which is actually $23 after the ATM fee for a mediocre sandwich that cost $9.50.
