Everything about a cheesesteak counts and the only way genos is better than pats is they have better bread.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I can deal with the whiz on the steak because its supposedly what makes it a philly steak (all though I've lived in philly my whole life and pat's and genos are the only places that do this as standard). My issue is that the meat is thick and chewy.  its kind of like a roast beef sandwich with whiz instead of au jus.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap in Philly, steak sandwich was decent, tasted like a Steak-Umm meat product from the 1980's with nacho cheese and a surly order taker. Cool experience, but I think it's mostly hype. Sandwich was okay, hot, and not terribly greasy, but the walk from downtown was long and next time I'll go to Sonny's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Stopped by when in town because I heard decent reviews. Food wasn't bad but customer service was! And woman who prepared food did so with bare hands...no gloves. Had a bad attitude from the get go. Won't go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 3.5 stars but I will round up.  This was the second time in my life I had been here.  The first time was with my brother about 10 years ago.  Tonight I came with my buddy.  Ordered a whiz with.  A little pricey for a sandwich at $9.50 but it is the original cheesesteak so I found it worth it.  They hand you your sandwich within seconds of placing your order.  Speedy service for sure!  The sandwich itself was really good.  The steak was meaty, the cheese was gooey and melty and the onions all tied it together.  The bread could be a tad softer but it didn't take away from anything.  This was a greasy delicious mess.  I wouldn't hesitate to come back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went here right after Geno's (sorry to name drop). And the bread is way better than Geno's but the steak/meat in the sandwich wasn't as good as Geno's. Plus the line and hype is not all that. But it's definitely good to try different spots to compare. The price is just the same at $10 or so.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Occasion:  Lunch with European friend

So, I have a friend from Ukraine visiting the area who has never been to Philly...seemed logical to get him a cheesesteak.  Pulled up to the corner and chose Pat's, mainly because I parked closer to it and I don't really know the difference yet.  

Huge line, but moved fast.  Friendly, efficient service.  Why the one star?  At the risk of getting hate messages from Pat's lovers, the sandwich was a HUGE disappointment.  The meat was scarce and tough/dry, and the bread was excessively chewy.  Those combined to form a sandwich I could barely bite through.  I've had MUCH better cheesesteaks in many other places, without paying $11 for them.  

To add insult to injury, there was a huge shortage of seating mostly caused by people holding seats forever while the rest of their party waits in line for the food.  Where I come from, the custom is to NOT hold seats and let the people with the food have the tables!  If executed properly and courteously (meaning don't linger after eating when you can see the place is slammed), this system works well such that by the time you get your food there will be a table for you.  Sheesh people amaze me sometimes!

To recap, we ended up eating our shitty sandwiches standing by our cars and my European friend now think's I'm even crazier than the average American for even bringing him here.  

Nope.  Never again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As a native Philadelphian I pretty much dismiss Pat's (and Geno's) as overly crowded, overpriced tourist traps. Their little steak sandwiches bear no resemblance to the tasty behemoths you can get at Jim's Steaks or at countless steak shops in the city for the same price or less (and with less attitude). Can't knock their hustle but there are too many better options in the city for me to ever do Pat's again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
O god, another review about Pat's. Just what the world needs.... However, I'm going to do it in a different way. Proper etiquette behavior when there.

Rule #1 when going to Pats or Geenos or even Tony Lukes. Watch Seinfield's Soup Nazi ahead of time, don't ask question just do it. Because you don't want to be that Eileen... EVER! Know what you want, understand the lingo, listen to how the locals and people ahead of you are ordering, and practice it while you're in line. Don't talk to your friend while you're in line, just keep repeating silently it until you're up to the cashier and your tongue/throat has been physically trained to say those magic words. "Steak wit wiz and onion"

Then have the money and more specifically the paper bill ready in your hands, with appropriate speed when handing to the cashier, and ready to receive change. Then proceed on to receive your cheesesteak, and move to your left if you require additional fussing to pick it up properly. Use both hands as you will need it to hold the torpedo of joy that will invade your mouth, hmm that was dirty....

At this point your interaction with the cheesesteak woman or man is done, and god help you if you for one second decide to try and strike up a conversation. Then proceed on to your left to the french fries and soda section. This is less formal, and you may be given leniency on how you order, as long as there is no line. Otherwise its simply fries and soda wit wiz. No they will not put wiz in your soda, unless you're a complete idiot who engages them in mindless drivel.  

Finally, sit down at a seat or bench and enjoy your food. Follow these rules or you will be given the "No-Soup-For-You!" equivalent of South Philly. A quick verbal beat down, followed promptly by a not so kind reference on your mother followed by something which can only be characterized as you and an animal in compromising positions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We went here on a Segway Tour of philly cheese steaks so we got to taste all 5 different locations in the area. This was our first stop on the tour and we liked the sliced meat but the cheese wasn't melted. For our first try it was good but not our favorite. The location is super cool and we lucked out with no line. Don't forget napkins. It's a must if in Philly and we are glad we tried it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Loved Pat's.  This will be a must everytime I am in Philly.  

Pat certainly knows how to run his shop.  Although the wait is a little long, it is well worth it.  Know what you want to order a head of time.

Had a regular sandwich drenched in cheezwiz.  Or as Pat refers to it as, "The Wiz".  Couldn't complain!  Nothing like a Philly Cheeseteak to preceed a Springsteen concert.

100% recommended.  Lots of cool celebrity photos too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My second trip to Philly and first to the cheesesteak corner between Pat's and Geno's.  Based on the reviews here, I chose to eat at Pat's and I was not disappointed.  I sat down with my mushroom steak with the Whiz smothered atop it and chowed down in touristy anticipation.  Overall, I liked it, but I think I still prefer Jim's steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: DId the pepsi challange with this place and ginos twice now when going through town.  To me there is no comparison.  This place is the king of steaks.  Still the best cheese steak ive had to date.  Next time im in town I am am going to try some of the less known places in the city and compare again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Does this place need another review? Sure...why not?! Out of the Big 3 in Philly (Pat's, Geno's, Jim's), Pat's is my favorite. The meat is sliced thinner than Geno's, but thicker than Jim's. Also, the amount of Whiz they give you is more than any of the other places. I think their onions are better too.

Make sure you have your order ready and don't mess it up. Keep the line moving. Steaks at the first window, fries and drinks at the second. You pay separately, cash only! I always get the Whiz Wit. Minus one star because last time I was here, a steak is now $9.50. C'mon man!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Excellent food in a neat part of town. I highly recommend going. I know next time I'm in Philly, it will be a dinner stop for sure!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was in Philadelphia this past week on vacation seeing some friends of mine and they suggested I at least try one of the tourist spots.  Between Geno's and Pat's, they suggested Pat's.  I was satisfied with what I had (cheesesteak "wiz wit").  It wasn't just mind blowing or anything, but it was very good!  There wasn't too much wiz, the steak portions were generous, and the availability of those red peppers adds a nice touch to the sandwich.

I'd give it a 3.5 if Yelp would let me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visited Pats today while on business in Philly.  It had been 6-7 years since my last visit and was as good as ever!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was disappointed at this machine of cheesesteak shop. They had sandwiches with slices of provolone waiting for the meat to be cooked but once the meat was added it didn't melt the cheese. The fries were not crisp... Pretty disappointing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak I had at Pat's was my first, maaaaybe second, with cheese whiz. As my tastebuds were drowned by the imitation cheese, I thought a quick prayer to St. Peter for the lost slices of steak I could barely taste--for they were truly lost. 

The proportion of meat to whiz to bread was out of balance. The whole experience was a rather quick affair. Jump in line, report your order, shuffle money through the window, receive foil-wrapped bundle in return, sit under twilight zone lights, watch male companions scarf unceremoniously. The end.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great costumer service ! They aren't super rushy like Geno's! I don't eat meat but they did have an excellent fish sandwich! My boyfriend ate the steak it was a lot more juicer ! Go to Pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time here, very good, got ours with provolone cheese  may have been better with cheese whiz or American cheese , definitely next time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Context: Dinner with an Out-Of-Towner
Time of Visit: Monday, 8:00PM

So a friend visits from out of town and wants an eponymous cheesesteak sandwich: where do you take them?  Jim's, Geno's, Pat's, or other?

We decided on Pat's.  My friend was a little nervous about their ordering rules (wit or witout onions, second window for fries & drinks), which was exacerbated by the fact a class-trip sized group of school kids got off a bus after we got to the window.  I'm not afraid to admit it: I need more than 5 seconds to make sure I say my order correctly...sue me.

The staff at the counter, while not the most friendly people on the planet, were not as mean as some other yelpers have encountered in their visits.  My mushroom pepper steak with provolone was pretty good: it came out very hot, with a lot of steak.

If you're going to Pat's, you're going for the cheesesteak only; nothing else.  While I appreciate tradition and longevity as much as the next person, that doesn't mean you can lower your level of service (read: treat your customers poorly) and assume everyone will continue to flock to your establishment (excluding 8th graders on field-trips).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Everyone is raving how Philly has the best cheesesteaks. OVERRATED!!! Can't believe we walked from Center City East, the hotel, and tourist attractions to eat this. It was certainly a long walk for almost nothing. I think the walk was about 30-40 minutes from we were toured around Center City East. Definitely long lines and a lot of people, but for what. The cheesesteak was cold, bland. Taste nothing. I don't see the big deal about this place and people say its one of the best in Philly. Definitely would've had a better cheesesteak from a local place near our hotel. Actually I rather have a cheesesteak in New York where I live than eating one in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You have to eat here!
The place that started it all. It will change the way you see any other Philly Steak Sandwich. 
Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Would've given 5 stars but i have to consider every aspect...been trying different philly cheesesteaks every visit to philly and its all about preference...i prefer cheddar so cheez wiz is my choice...the number 1 accdg to philly people is johns but they dont have cheddar so I'd still prefer pats...geno's is a grade below even though they say its the same...its only better for background in pictures because of the bright lights....1star less because they could improve on thevstore itself...dine in customers will still get their sandwich wrapped so somoe of the cheese will go to the wrapper...better to be eaten immediately so bread wont be soggy. Cash only and they try to make the lines fast...separate line for fries and drink which is good when you think of adding those while eating...its overpriced considering what you're getting but still worth when visiting
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My first biting into Philly's Philly cheesesteak. I have not tried any of the other famous cheesesteaks in Philly. My review is just my experience at Pat's, not in comparison to the other eateries.

My my it was delicious!! The beef was hot and super tender. I got a mushroom pepper steak wit wiz. Mushrooms - good. Peppers - good. Soft hero bread - good. Cheez Wiz - makes everything that much better! No complaints! I left full and satisfied! I also tried to eat one of the peppers but holy crap, wayyy too spicy for me!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What is the big deal? I waited 15 minutes on line for an unflavored cheese steak. The fries were good. I think Steak-ums are better because I can put a little Worcestershire sauce and some adobo on it. I did enjoy the experience of it all though. That's whats it is all about., I guess.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Sandwich was delicious! But the parking was awful (NOT SURPRISED) fastest food I've ever gotten!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Of all the highly overrated cheesesteak spots in Philly that really only tourists go to, I would have to say Pat's is one of the better ones.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pure tourist trap. It's serviceable and edible but extremely overrated. There are so many better, true Philly Cheesesteaks in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had a cheesesteak with wiz and onions. It wasn't bad, but I have definitely had better. The guy that used his bare hands to touch my sandwich also used the same hands to grab a customer's cash. I still ate my sandwich, but I know from working in the food industry that this is a violation...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Loved their cheesesteaks. So my husband and I did the challenge, although I have to admit I thought based on reviews Geno's would win, they surely lost miserably. I wouldn't recommend getting the "extra" cheese whiz from pats though, it makes eating very difficult. I would definitely make the drive over from NYC for their cheesesteaks again! ALSO THEY ONLY ACCEPT CASH!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took a $15 cab ride and ordered their famous cheese-steak which was just ok.  I truly have had better back home.  I believe this is more of the hype that anything else.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good place for a chees steak. Liked it better than Genos across the street. Not the best we found on our quest but good
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
One of the reasons I wanted to come to Philly was for the cheese steaks. A couple of my friends recommended that I go to Pat's. I was really excited and hungry to go get one but the lines were long. I could understand long lines for such a place, same thing happens for Pink's in LA.

Finally got my cheese steak with onions and cheese whiz. Some people would say that the wait isn't worth it but this time it was. There have been other cheese steak places I have gone to on the west coast but they don't compare. When you go to Pat's you get an authentic Philadelphia Cheese steak. I could have gone for another cheesesteak but I didn't want to wait in the long ass line again.

One of the best experiences of my east coast trip. Definitely go to pat's when you're in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yum.  Get the Cheez-wiz one.  They are ooooy and gooy and delightful.  Worth the ride from Cleveland Ohio to Philly!! lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I ordered a cheese steak sandwich, WIT onions and provolone.  Bread wasn't soft all around, not enough meat, and not a lot of flavors. I think this place is over rated.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yummy cheesesteak!  My husband and I decided to get one of each Pat's and Geno's to have the ultimate face off of who's Philly cheesesteak was better.  Well I loved Geno's fresh bread and my husband loved Pat's flavorful meat.  Both are good!  Miss it already! (Back in Cali)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Good god, this place the absolute best. I cannot get enough of their Whized ones.  Such a nice flavor that takes me back to my roots.

Every time I'm in town for business I pretty much only eat here. Love it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Going to Pat's was definitely experience. Grumpy employee who is probably sick of tourists not ordering the correct way, which was actually amusing after seeing someone struggle and then giving up on ordering. Cheesesteak was good, but not so much better than a cheesesteak you'd get outside of Philadelphia. Quality meat, but I'd like to rather pay in the $7 range, not $9.50. Did not try Geno's, but overheard people talking about how they thought Pat's was better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: you know how cereal tastes like cereal, milik tastes like milk, and cereal+milk tastes like cereal+milk?  Cheesesteaks here, wit or no wit, are like that.  They are the sum of their parts, and no more.  Some people out there will swear this place is heaven on earth.  Again, I miss another opportunity for Rapture.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Service was fast but expensive for not that great a sandwich,  honestly don't get the appeal of this place i ordered and in seconds had a sandwich,  no way that steak was fresh and wasn't great.  Will not be returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm mainly reviewing Pat's because I want to include it on a list. When faced with a decision between Pat's and Geno's, I immediately curl up in the fetal position and rock back and forth. I'm kidding, of course. I actually choose Geno's if forced to eat at one of them, but I prefer to avoid that conundrum altogether and get my sandwiches at George's a few blocks north.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
meh.
my brother lives near the italian market in south philly.  I went for a visit.  Luckily for me my brother and his girlfriend are foodies.  I was able to taste many different cuisines in Philly.  Coming from San Francisco, there are places I don't go due to the tourist trap aura, due to the non-authenticity of it all (fisherman's wharf, chinatown etc).  But when I was in Philly I had to have a cheesesteak...and I had to go to the two most famous places, which of course are right across the street from one another,  in a big rivalry, and featured on the Food Netowrk!  How cheesy, but essential.  
We split two, both "wit whizt '?(cheese whiz)One from Geno's and one from Pat's.  
Pat's was much tastier than Geno's.  The meat was seasoned and the bun and cheese with much more flavor...
Better of the two...it seems.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Honestly, this is just a hype. It wasn't anything that I expected. It's nothing special. I am visiting and expected Pat's to be known for some good Philly cheese steak. I would recommend going somewhere else. This and Gino's is a tourist attraction, don't get fooled.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The Pat's vs Geno's cheesesteak debate is one that people love to talk about. Honestly, I thought that Pat's, Geno's, and Jim's cheesesteaks where all about equally as good, which is to say, I enjoyed them, but don't have a burning desire to return for more. 

The draw of Pat's is that it is the origin of the whole Philly cheesesteak phenomenon (although Geno's claims that they were the ones who started putting cheese on them). As other's have mentioned, Pat's is rather unassuming compared to Geno's across the street; this, when combined with Pat's historical signpost, lends an air of authenticity that some may find attractive. 

Like Geno's (and unlike Jim's) I didn't find the wait to be terrible here, but they do rush you through. The cheesesteaks and the drinks are a bit overpriced, which I suppose is to be expected for such a tourist draw. When I went here, the cashier tried to short change me $10. 

To be honest, I'd rate Pat's as just about the same as Geno's. I think it's worth going once, but it's not a place worth visiting with any degree of frequency.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Meh...I've been waiting a while to try Pat's. Sadly, I wasn't impressed. The onions were delicious and cheese was good, but the meat had no flavor and the bread was so so.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was debating to give this a 2 or a 3 but guess i am feeling alittle happy right now so i just give them a 3 instead. Anyway I was trying both Geno and pat's right next to each other and from the look of it,. I knew i would going like pat's more. It look juicy and tender and the cheese whiz was awesome...ok ok anywhere they sell whiz then it pretty much taste the same. The line was alittle longer at pat's and I want up there and order 1 whiz /wit...it might be the other way around but i got thru ordering it correctly or at least want thru quick enough not to be send back at the end of the lines so i was a happy camper. I got a few picky pepper's and it tasted well with my sandwich. Overall I like pat''s alot better but it isn't the best cheesesteak that I ever tasted so i was disappointed enough where I didn't even want to go to Jim or Tony Luke because it is all hype for television such like Pink's hotdog in LA or Rosecoe Chic & waffle or NYC pizza are the best so I am not going listen to anymore what television say about food because they are just FULL of Sh$T!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So here's the thing about this place...it's touristy. So if you want to go to say you've been then go right ahead. That being said, parking is horrible (although we lucked out and got a pretty good spot), the sandwiches are a bit expensive ($9.50 each), and the sandwich itself was....well it was a traditional Philly cheesesteak but it certainly wasn't mind blowing or awesome or even great.
Would I go back? Probably not
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Definitely a tourist spot, but when in Rome?

Did a side by side with Geno's and think they both had pros and cons at each establishment. Can't say I would come back based on the number of higher reviewed places in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Parking is not available !
The steak they cut too thick !
Price is $10 @ sandwich  (little bite high ) !!
The sandwich bread is tough !
Well , most of the business came from tourism, how many customers will return !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteaks in Philly- way better than Genos!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: way better the genos. i dont know what they do, but these steaks seem to be more full and taste better. love pats.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I had to!  Based on recommendations from multiple people, I decided to try Pat's rather than Ginos.  I got the classic cheese steak with mushrooms and onions and a soda.  
The sandwich was GOOD! The only thing I wish was it was a little more 'fresh' tasting... I went at a very slow time, no lines whatsoever.  I would recommend going at a busy time so you know the food is being made fresh.
It is cash only, so I had to be sure I had cash on me, which I usually don't!  
You order the food at a separate window than beverages... which was just odd and annoying to do two transactions. 
All in all, I would say it is a great stop if you are in the area! Love me a good Philly Cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So this is the place... My fiancé brought a sandwich home from a work trip. She picked it up on her way to the airport. Even hours later, it was pretty good. 

Then a month or two ago, we flew in together and I had the chance to eat a fresh cheesesteak. It was by no means the best I've ever had, but it was meat, cheese, and bread. Hard to fuck that up. In other words, I enjoyed it. 

The signage out front was a bit intimidating. It was ordering instructions. They were uncomplicated, but it had a "hurry the fuck up" vibe to it. Also, when I ordered through the window, it seemed like they were a little rude. Not that I expected great customer service from an assembly line worker feeding faceless cattle, but I guess that adds to the authenticity... rudeness. I'm sure it's necessary when it's busy and there's a line down the street. It was pretty empty when we were there. 

The sandwich wasn't so much lovingly crafted as it was just scoop, plop, schluuuurp, wrap, and shove out the window. Part of the experience. 

Well, it was the same basic cheesesteak you could get anywhere. Nothing special about the meat or the bread. Same shit you can get any place. The cheese was wiz, so not even really cheese. It comes out of a can. Regardless, it's tasty. I would get another one. However, I don't think you need to travel all the way here from wherever you live to get "the best" or "most authentic" or whatever. There's probably a place near you with eats just as good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Man.. the portion of Meat they give you was good.... the Bread was so good.. I would love to have that for Breakfast. I am a Fan of Cherry Soda. Although the line was long it sure moves fast. We got lucky on a parking spot but if it wasn't there.. it would have been tough.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When in Philadelphia a must try. The bread was fresh n chewy steak was very flavorful not rubbery at all and the wiz!!! Onions put it over the top..... I didnt get to try ginos but honestly dont care this cheesesteak was so good
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Good. Nothing stellar, people talk it up but it's obviously more about tradition and the culture of it than the actual food. 

Make sure you check your order before walking away... they messed up 2 of our 3 sandwiches but when we went back to point it out the guy argued back that that's what we ordered (which was definitely not true).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yuk, yuk, yuk, yuk! Go to Delasssandros instead! Did not like Genos or Pats. OVERATED1
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Don't wast your time and 11 bucks.  More hype than sandwich.  A little more meat than Geno next door but cheese pretty non existent and onions tasted prefab. Meat was also chewy.  Hold on ... don't waste your time at genos either.  Where's the beef?  Wow two lightweights.  No parking.  At $10 not gonna make me as happy as Jersey mikes or even wawa.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats is a true Philadelphia landmark They use top grade beef it has the best atmosphere in the city they ship to anywhere is the USA
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best of the 2 most famous and definitely the original cheese steak. Next time I will probably go to both again. But Pats is the better of the 2.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came here all the way from CA excited to finally get a taste of the real Philly cheesesteak -- only to be DISAPPOINTED on so many levels. We ordered 3 Philly steaks but we weren't allowed to ask any questions. Customer service not only lacked to say the least but we were told you get what you get and if you don't like it don't come back and go to GENO's across the street. We didn't ask many questions but the 5 seconds we did take to ask since it was our first time they were RUDE!!! I have 2 guys refer to me as 'honey' - very demeaning! 

I got my Philly cheesesteak with what was supposed to be grilled onions (mind you the other two had grilled onions but mine did not and it was barely grilled and still white and crunchy. I asked them about it and that's when I was told 'you get what you get honey and if you don't like it, go somewhere else.' I've never been yelled at as a customer for asking questions but whoa this place thinks they're above it all...seriously??!!

Philly cheesesteak: everyone in our party was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED by how it tasted or the lack of. It was bland to start with and we couldn't understand the line in the front or why it's supposed to be popular. I've had much much much better ones in the past so I think they won't have many return customers thus the overall 3.5 rating of this place now, soon it'll be lower. 

GO SOMEPLACE ELSE -- AVOID THIS PLACE!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Can't believe I paid 11 for a steak that probably cost them 2 to push out.  Then the fountain soda 3.50.  a worthless non nutritious meal for 14.5.  Never again from this overrated joint
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteaks are delicious! Very quick - one of the best in Philly. Only taking a star off because the guy working the window was an obnoxious asshole :-)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Okay, this is a touristy thing to do, so I guess you have to try it if you visit Philadelphia. I honestly thought the streetcart cheesesteaks smelled better but you have to try this place. It wasn't bad...I guess the cheese whiz made me a little sick and my cholesterol didn't like it too much. But please try it if you're a tourist.

They have instructions on how to PROPERLY order a Philly cheesesteak!

I much prefer putting the steak and onions over rice but I guess one would call that Yoshinoya...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Super disappointed!!  Always heard that we had to have a cheesesteak in philly and this was the place to go.  1st they dont take cash and then the food was just way too bland.  Nothing special but atleast i got to mark it off the bucketlist.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Soft juicy meat, nice chewy bread, gooey whiz cheese, what else can I say? Don't make a mis-steak! Pat's is the way to go!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was kind of disappointed with the food and service after so much hype from watching them on Food's network & Travel Chanel. For $9.50 for a cheese steak with mushroom, there were no mushroom and the bread was stale! Plus the cashier was so ghetto, they treated the customers like we should be grateful for their food. This probably will be the last time I eat here
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 100% the best cheesesteak place around ! I'm from NY and contemplated bringing some back!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Gross tourist trap. The pizza place up the block has better steaks, without the attitude.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Philly last weekend for Sierra Nevada's Beer Camp and decided I had to have an authentic cheese steak before I headed back to New York. After debating, my friends and I decided to go to Pat's since the line was shorter than Genos. There was a solid 30 minute wait but it was definitely worth it. I had the cheese steak with American cheese and it definitely exceeded any cheese steak I've ever had in NY. It was hot, the cheese was melted, and the grease was dripping. My only mistake was not ordering two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So you need a cheesesteak, and you're down here.  Which one... which one... Pat's or Geno's?  It doesn't really matter.  They both basically taste the same.  That is to say... not that great.

My friends from out of town like Pat's.  So I come here sometimes to meet up with them.  Mushrooms are definitely essential.  Hopefully, your steak is thoroughly warm throughout.  Mine usually isn't.  Hopefully, the bread you receive is a revelation.  Mine is usually bland and dry.

Hey tourist, do you have the ordering gimmick down, hmm...?  Be afraid.  Be very afraaaaaaidddd!!

If you like grizzle steak, come here.  If you want to experience an "authentic Philly cheesesteak" (!?!?!), come on down.

Again, the best thing about Pat's and Geno's is that they are both open 24/7.  Pat's only closes one or two days a year.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteaks! When I go to Ocean City Maryland or A.C., I will go out of my way to go over to Philly just to eat Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We drove for an hour to get here. WORST PHILLY CHEESE STEAK EVER. I am not sure how and why they are famous. Meat was not good. It was chewy and tasted weird. The cheese was disgusting. The onion was not even caramelized it was something else. It's a poor sandwich. What a waste of time to drive all the way up to try this indigent sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Here on vacation and decided to do our own challenge, Geno's vs Pat's.  Hands down, Pat's was the winner.  Bun, peppers, whiz, fries, and meat all better. Geno's was still good, but no match for Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's, if you're trying to decide, but there are FAR better cheesesteaks in this fair city.  Pat's is overly greasy, has bug infested condiments and is not worth the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Takeaway: must-do if in Philly more than a day. 

Great: experience, very fast (sandwich at window before ordering drinks) 
Good: loved both sandwiches I tried, 10 minute walk from Subway station
Meh: Geno's was closed for the day so I can't offer a comparison
Bad: a few guys were loitering and soliciting the Pats diners
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I did what everybody does. Cheese steak off...

As soon as I got into Philly, my first meal had to be a cheese steak. I think I have to say both places are tied.

My pluses of Pat's:

-Sandwich is thick with meat
-PROVOLONE, ONIONS and STEAK...TOTAL WIN.
-Bread flavor is overall better than of Geno's
-More flavor balance...just the right amount of cheese and onions to complement the meat.

Negs:
-Meat here is a little dry. More moist and tender at Gino's
-I might be a minority on this, but I ain't feelin' the wiz and onions, too plastic tasting. However, here they're lighter on the wiz and it doesn't overpower the sandwich like Gino's. 

Overall, I prefer Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 3 stars only because it's better than gen os and I just like sitting at their picnic tables watching that intersection. the steaks alone get 2 stars at best
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
better than geno's, worse than pretty much every where else in the city.  if you're coming in to visit the city and want a cheesesteak, do yourself a favor, go to john's roast pork, jim's, dellasandro's, chubby's, reading terminal, some pizza place, etc.  

good things: the hours, cheese fries, hot peppers, and the fact you can say you ate there.

bad things:  cheesesteaks, prices
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats definitely makes the best cheesesteaks in Philly. I just don't know if I can go there anymore. The fries are 4.00 (up from 3.50 last time I went) and the cheesesteaks are 9.00 (up from 7.50 when I first started going). It is definitely not worth the price but the cheesesteaks are still amazing and I still try to go every few months.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!
This was the worst cheesesteak I've ever had. The meat was dry and had no seasoning. It wasn't even hot so the cheese didn't melt. The bread was subpar. Completely disappointed. Don't waste your time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is pretty good, way better than Geno's. Way better. Wit Whiz with those peppers they have outside are the way to go.

These steaks are much juicier and more flavorful than the guys across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As good as they get. Friendly staff and helpful with ordering for us first timers! Definitely worth the trip from Miami!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The fact that it's touristy doesn't mean that it's not good.  It's kind of how Skyline Chili in Cincinnati, Primanti Bros. in Pittsburgh, or Nathan's Famous in New York.  You do it right and you keep doing it right.  Someone else comes along and does it a bit differently and the locals like that as well - sometimes better.  It doesn't make the original a bad thing.  I still go to Pat's when I'm on the South Side, although I'll also hit up Tony Luke's or Jim's if I'm near there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Dog meat on a dinner roll.  This place lives on its legacy alone and is a tourist trap.  If you want a real cheesesteak go a few blocks away to cosmi's deli and you'll have the best sandwich you've ever eaten.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been coming to Pat's ever since I was little.  It has always and will continue to hold a special place in my heart.  More often when I return, I don't go for the food, but for the sentimental value I have attached to this world-famous South Philly cheesesteak stand.  In the battle of Pat's versus Geno's, I'm definitely Team Pat's.  But while Pat's dominates the local neighborhood, there are much better (and far less crowded) cheesesteak stands in Philadelphia.

By all means, if you have friends coming in from out of town and they want to get a cheesesteak, Pat's should be your go-to.  After you wait in line for what seems like forever, the steak comes out fast and dripping in velvety cheez whiz and grease.  Don't even think about ordering it without onions, and for extra cheesesteak deliciousness, ask to remove the insides of the soft-yet-sturdy Amoroso roll ("guts out" in linespeak).  Next, get in the other line and grab yourself a red cherry soda (and fries if you must, though certainly not required), help yourself to some ketchup for your steak and some hot peppers and find a table.  Begin by eating the peppers whole to put some heat in your mouth, then sink your teeth into a time-honored tradition.  The meat is incredibly tender and the cheese acts both as a complement and a sauce to hold the sandwich together and accentuate the flavors.  Nevermind that it is mustard yellow and doesn't resemble a food product: this is far and away the best kind of cheese to put in your steak.

But there are many other great cheesesteak places outside the Pat's and Geno's sphere that demand your attention and put Pat's to shame.  You can find them at Reading Terminal Market, in Roxborough, farther down in South Philly, and even in West Philly.  Furthermore, unless you know how to order the right way or know what you want before getting in line, do not attempt ordering at the window.  Pat's is the quintessential Philadelphia Cheesesteak experience, but it is definitely not the best.  While it is arguably the standard by which cheesesteaks in this city are judged, there are many options that exceed the quality and flavor that Pat's serves.  Nevertheless, Pat's is consistent.  And consistency is good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not worth it! Rude youngsters who can't complete the order with all toppings. And...smaller and less juicy than Gino's!! My wife stood in line for Pats while I waiting in line for Gino's. 

Gino's hands down!!!

Still...folks, both these are the equivalent to seven 11 hot dogs!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Love the Chopped Steak... That is exactly why I like Pats better then Genos!

Whiz With! That is how it is suppose to be! Great sub... In a hectic part of the city, but if you have patience it is well worth the parking and line nightmares that it can have! 

CASH ONLY!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Dear Cheesesteak Lovers:

I won't say which $9 cheesesteak I liked better.

Stop being a wuss, and reading endless reviews about whether Pat's or "the other place" is better.  Order one from each.  You know you want to.  Eat both cheesesteaks back-to-back, and decide for yourself.  MAN UP.

Sincerely,
K. W.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to bring some work friends here for their intro to cheesteaks.  Cheese was abundant, but wish my onions were cooked a little more.  Good flavor overall.  Nice tender meat.  A bit expensive for the size of my sandwich... I feel that's tourist tax
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Saw them on food network, yes this is THE place for Philly Cheesesteak.

And I have to say I am glad that we've come a long way. I would not say it is the worst but it is down there. There is hardly any steak, it is in a ghetto, takes only cash. The other one we ordered, the fish steak, really cant find worse one, ended up mostly in the trash. People are rude too, maybe they figure customers like it to be yelled at, ghetto like experience.

I still treasure the experience, but as food, nah.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is the real deal. Ordering is fun and the workers give you a window into the language of the locals. Food is exactly what the Philly cheesesteak is all about.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
25 years in Philadelphia.  Number of cheesesteaks consumed: countless.  Pat's rank?  Near the bottom.

Poor roll, bad meat, generally poor service, long lines, small portions, high prices.  The calling cards of a tourist trap.  They know they'll get the business so they put out a crap product.  

If you've never been, I guess go.  You'll likely not want to go back.  Try a truck for a better cheesesteak at a lower price.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steaks was a place that I had no real plans to pay a visit, but we found ourselves in the area and decided to give both Pat's AND Geno's a shot, trying and splitting a Philly from each location.  We began our adventure at Pat's.  

You can find Pat's off of Wharton street, and literally a stone's throw away across the street is Geno's, so these guys are competitors in the truest sense of the word. It also makes it easy to sample both at the same time if you desire (we did). 

From the moment you stand in line, there's a series of steps on how to order a steak (i.e. learn to use "wit" a lot).  We did decide on getting their Cheese steak ($11).  Pat's does have some optional toppings you can add opposite their store front which are all on the house.  

The Philly meat comes chopped and in terms of flavors, I preferred Pat's over Geno's.  Their meat was packing a little more flavor to me than Geno's, and if I had to pick between the two, i'd go to Pat's first. The sandwich is served whole, so if you want to share with someone, you'll have to tear it in half (staff would not cut the sandwich for us).

Flavor, ironically is the only win that Pat's has over Geno's, which some would argue is all they need...flavor.   Geno's has it all over Pat's in terms of price, cleanliness, customer service (they happily cut our sandwiches), but flavor is all Pat's .

So, in the war between Pat's or Geno's, I wouldn't travel to Philly to experience either of these two popular tourist spots. Truth be told, there are much more tasty sandwiches in other parts of Philly, but if you find yourself in the area, you probably will get a little more flavor squeezed out of Pat's.  But don't take my word on it.  

Give these guys a try if you're close and willing!  

P.S. cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philly is the place to be and no trip is complete without a real chessesteak. Go to pats and enjoy he is king
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What's the bruhaha about  Philly cheese steak especially this Pat.  Workers definitely have attitude serving customers and not even a thank you.  Come on Cheese Wiz?  The taste and smell of Cheeze wiz kill the steak. It's not worth the visit and cost. It is horrible and stale.  Cheese steak sandwich and foods overall are definitely more delicious in Los Angeles area.  It's not worth $12 for a 6 inch sandwich.  Subway or makes better sandwich for $6 footlong.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you like a Pat's cheesesteak, you have no taste. This was be far the worst $10 sandwich I have ever had. Tasteless overcooked meat, cheap cheese, gross bread, flavorless onions. Maybe if I added some salt and pepper it would have been acceptable. 

This was my first cheesesteak in philly. I guess I should've know better than to go to a tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Boy do I regret not visiting this landmark sooner. Can't speak for how they compare to their rival a french fries throw away which I will try eventually but they are now the silver medal of cheesesteaks in my opinion edging out tony lukes which is now my bronze medal...Staff for starters was as friendly as I could ask for and it is exaggerated that they are not nice if you don't order properly. Ready in ten seconds or less I was satisfied to the bone for  what I paid for. Parking can be tricky just like any other neighborhood street in philly but worth it whether the line is huge or not. I recommend coming on a weekday day or night where there aren't really any tourists making a huge line happen. Not the best cheesesteak but worth trying nevertheless being a pioneer of the food that makes this town renowned thank you pat's I will miss you when I move to florida.........................
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took the challenge, and I had a philly at both Pat's and Geno's. The one thing I liked better about Pat's was there were more sandwich options, as in there there were multiple "add ons" you could order for your sandwich, such as the mushroom cheesesteak, pizza cheesesteak or other options like the hot dog. Also I prefer diet Pepsi over diet Coke, so I was happy to see Pat's served Pepsi. Overall quality sandwich, but if I was in the area again I would choose Geno's over Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Let me start by saying, that I can only describe our experience. Feel free to make your own judgements. Went here yesterday and our experience was terrible. We found that it was pure hype, rude cooks and staff, and in our opinion, the food was "bland" at best. In our experience, they were as impatient as I've ever seen at any establishment. Went to Geno's last time. At least we were treated like people. I'll NEVER darken the window of the place ever again! If you're thinking about going to this place, think twice about how you wish to be treated.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: AWWWWWFUL.....this place thrives on the hype. this isnt even good enough to be dog food. do your self a favor and go to steves prince of steaks and get a chicken philly and a pizza roll.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Visiting Philadelphia for the first time, I knew I couldn't leave without having a cheese steak. So of course I had to pay a visit to two of the most famous spots in the city, Pat's and Geno's.

I came right over to this spot across the street after trying Geno's. I ordered the steak with whiz and onions. The service was fast, as my sandwich was literally out as I was paying the cashier. The moment I sat down and opened the sandwich, I knew this was what a Philly Cheese Steak should look like. The sandwich was HOT and came loaded with cheese. The meat was chopped up instead of sliced thin and with plenty of onions. 

I took a bite and was instantly hit with the taste of cheese, onions, and meat. I knew from that moment Pat's was my winner between the two. To me, Pat's felt more like a real cheese steak compared to Geno's. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Pat's. I liked the fast service and their sandwich was better in my opinion. Pat's doesn't look as clean and new as Geno's, but I think it adds to the authenticity of the place. You come for the food, not for a lavish dining room seating. I would recommend this spot especially for those visiting Philadelphia for the first time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was fine but I have had about the same at a diner in Brooklyn. Go to say you did it but don't expect to be wowed
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The original is still the best. Nobody beats Pats. From the atmosphere to the delicious taste, these guys do steaks right. Whiz wit please.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yeah this place is just all right. For a quick bite it's ideal and between Pat's and Genos I did enjoy Pat's more but that being said it's certainly not the best cheese steak. Each were a little lighter on the steak than I would have hoped. As a tourist in Philly I get the appeal but wouldn't say "you have to go".
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This will likely not be an overly popular opinion... Oh well... This place serves up some SERIOUSLY over priced shit. With a side of major attitude. Wow. 

Having gotten that off my chest- I understand it's famous and all and sure it's a Philadelphia land mark of sorts, a place to go and say you went, you saw, you partook, etc. But for me it really ends there. 

The cheesesteak (wit & cheez wiz) was decent, the meat is good quality at least and that's really the best thing it has going for it. It was not so much as even luke warm. My Husbands roast pork sub was decent, but meh, as well. I'm not really going to waste time on going much more in depth than that. Expect to pay a minimum of $50 for 3 people to eat a sub, small side of fries and a medium fountain drink. It would be worth while if it were packed to the brim and mind blowing, however it's far from. All hype for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You come to Pat's for the experience.  The long, somewhat disorganized line, the apprehension of the order as you approach the window, and the gruff service you get before taking your first bite are part of this tradition.  You meet a few people in line, stare at the ridiculous, over the top light show that is Geno's across the street, and wonder if waiting in the cold is worth your time.

This review is for the food, and it's just a pretty good sandwich.  I think the bun is a little dry here, they don't put enough cheese or onions on it, and it's overpriced.  There's better within a mile radius and not nearly as long a line.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3.5 stars**

Cheesesteaks with cheese whiz was much better and flavorful than Geno's. Bread was not chewy. Overall, the cheesesteaks were average.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: According to the Food Network, Philly Cheese Steaks divide the town between Geno's and Pat's. They're right across the street from each other, so I brought an empty stomach. I felt both had their pros and cons but Geno's had an overall better flavor. They're much flashier which made me not want to choose them, but they won. By no means did I feel they were the best I've ever had though. They're definitely a tourist trap! Pat's barely lost between the 2.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bad attitude of the cashier !! It was our first time in the establishment so my wife really didn't know how to order for instance what kind of cheese or toppings . And the cashier was rushing her and mocking her and told her she doesn't speak English. She got really she wanted to speak to the manager but I told her it's ok because we're not from around the area we will not go back there next stop Geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Really fast service! Affordable prices! Delicious cheesesteak! What more can you ask for! :) I will recommend to others that are visiting philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I can't say I ever chewed on leather before but I imagine it would be similar to what Pat's Steaks uses for their meat. I can't give them 1 star because that is what I would give Geno's, their neighbor. My vote would be for either Jim's or Steve's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you're looking to get in your sodium for the week this is your place! Besides that the regular Philly is solid. Second favorite is the pizza and cheese fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm not sure what the big deal to this place is.  The cheese seem artificial to me and the steak had absolutely no flavor. The price for all this taste is outrageous ! I happen to be visiting PA and had to give it try well glad I'm crossing this one off my list for good
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place takes the cake for serving the leatheriest cheesesteaks on the planet. 

For over $9 with tax, you can practically get a better cheesesteak anywhere else, including at a shoe store.  

Ketchup does nothing to mask the flavorlessness. 

I ate here about five years ago and developed a strong aversion toward cheesesteaks that I still can't forget.

It's sad to know that so many unknowing tourists come here and subject themselves to the torture of waiting in long lines, paying high prices, followed by eating leathery and flavorless matter.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Make sure you get whiz. If you order your cheesesteak with provolone, you'll regret it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been eating at Pat's for about 15 years now. 

There are a lot of people writing reviews about Pats that make solid points.  I won't go into another detailed review. But I will point out the things I have read from other reviews that are true and false in my opinion.

True: 
-You can get a "better" cheesteak somewhere else. Just research on yelp. 
-Pat's is STILL a good place to eat despite getting a "better" steak somewhere else. 
-The steak line will be long, but moves fast. Fries and soda line never long. 
-Pat's is better than Genos. 
-Parking is not always available right up front you tourists, not everyplace can be like your beloved Applebees. This is South Philly, not Orlando. 
-They have never won any customer service awards. So stop reviewing their "service." They hand you a freaking steak and you hand them money. Don't be stupid. 
-Yes, you need to know what you want before you get up there. It's not like you were not informed about this requirement. 
-Yes their cheese fries are spectacular

False:
-whoever says that locals don't go here and only tourists do, doesn't actually know any locals. Locals still go to both Pat's and Geno's. 
-if you are from California, and say that these steaks are expensive, go fist yourself. I've never eaten a meal under $30 in that entire state.  
-regardless of your dining expectations, these guys are not here to coddle your balls. act accordingly and simply eat your steak. 
-the staff, is actually quite pleasant if you are not a dipshit. 
-Pat's or Geno's do not have terrible sandwiches. 
-this is not fine dining. and 3 stars means exactly that: A-ok
-pats is never dirty
-you did not eat a better cheesteak in California. Tofu steaks are not cheesteaks. 



Bottom line is this is a good place to go.  So try it out for the atmosphere,  with a group of friends. And then yelp a better cheesesteak if you are still hungry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We did the Geno's vs Pat's challenge. We ordered the exact same style sandwich "wit" (cheese whiz, mushrooms, onions) at both locations then cut them in half and shared. Pat's had more cheese and meat, but their cheese was way more concentrated. Geno's flavor was more prominent for the sandwich. The cheese was also not as thick and more enjoyable. However, the steak at Geno's was watery. 

Overall, both locations are quite similar and great choices. We would have to say we liked Geno's more. 

If you want a cheesesteak away from the tourist traps then go to Cleaver's. Their sandwiches are almost twice the size and fully loaded. There are many more places still to try! Every time we come to Philly we will try somewhere new.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you are looking for a great cheesesteak, this is a guaranteed hit. The roll is perfect, the steak, onions and cheese blend together just right, and adding your favorite condiments to cap it off? Never fails! There are plenty of other places that have good steaks too, but Pat's is an experience that you'll remember with a smile....and you'll be ready to do it again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overpriced, greasy, fatty cheesesteaks with homeless people around. So over rated!  Would not recommend at all.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
TOTALLY overrated - both Pat's and Geno's. Sad. 
It's a touristy thing these days, not so much for a great cheesesteak wit or wit-out.
It's marketed well for their sake, but that's not much of a benefit to their customers.
When I was a teenager, Pat's was so worth it, we'd hop the El at Margaret and Orthodox, then take a bus, and then still walk 4 blocks just to get there.
They used to be Rock Stars.
I miss what it once was.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Their meat comes frozen, then they boil it before they throw it on the griddle.  It's the real thing.

One time when I was eighteen, my friend and I came back to pat's from show n' tell butt-faced drunkypants and we made friends with a drunk guy in a wheelchair who we convinced that we would drive him home.  He agreed, but we could tell he got scared of us and just picked any old place to let him out.  I bet he thought we were in for a night of the good ole' ultraviolence.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Some people like the fat and tendon on their cheese steaks.  I don't.  There are so many other places to get a good cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great Cheesesteak. Went here oh about 4 years ago and just now reviewing. We drove up here from DC whilst on vacation, grabbed a steak sandwich and headed out to the ballpark to watch the Phillies play. I did notice the so-called competition across the way but Pats had the longer line. Parking for me wasnt easy, 1st  time in Philly, its a wonder our rental car wasnt towed. So if your ever way out of town, stop by, they make a great cheesesteak. I hope to go back someday.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
More of a 3.5 and better than Geno's.

Maybe I just don't get the hype about cheesesteaks because I thought this place was just alright. I guess I fell into the tourist trap of trying Pat's and Geno's and I must say, it's nothing too great to rave about. I thought the meat was thin and lean, which is good. But the bread felt like it was just meant there to hold the meat and whiz. I guess since I live in Philly now, I gotta try the more local joints and hopefully, it'll change my mind about cheesesteaks :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
sentimentality aside, being first does not always mean you are the best.  

had a couple of hours to devote to a wiz wit taste test: pat's, geno's, and jim's.

pat's was the lowest quality overall.  not enough meat and what was there was fatty and hard to chew.  as if to hide it - drowned in wiz.  

in fairness, i have had pat's before (years ago) and was more impressed then.  perhaps a bad day?  or they've gone downhill.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
In the debate between Pat's vs Geno's, Pat's wins hands down. There is no debate.

The beef at Pat's is sliced thinner and more chopped up, the meat is much juicier, and they offer a larger variety of options on the menu such as with mushrooms, peppers, or mushroom pepper etc. 

The cheesesteak was tasty, I had it with onions and Cheez Wiz. I'm happy I was able to experience cheesesteak here for myself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Good.
It was pretty good. 
I came to eat famous cheesesteaks and it was better than I thought
But service is dry. Don't expect smiles
But if you want a tasty sandwich, that's exactly what you will get
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A long time Delaware Valley resident, I went to Pats for the first time.  I can't say I was disappointed as it was a good steak.  Good but not quite great.  The meat was slightly dry.  There was abundant cheese, but the meat was a little lacking compared to some of the local shops in Blue Bell.  Fries are delicious and deadly.  Service was quick and friendly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's mediocre but the best thing about his place is that if it's 5am and you don't mind the drive you are sure to be fed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've never seen so many one and two star reviews for a place I consider to be a treat every time I go.

I stopped most recently a few weeks ago after landing at PHL around 10PM on an empty stomach.  And holy shit, did this hit the spot.  My girlfriend and I just sat at one of those benches shaking our heads at each other about how tasty our sandwiches were.

Don't worry about these reviews saying "ooh the meats a little fatty" or "I never liked cheese whiz" or "why do they have to be mean to me just because I can't decide what to eat."  Everyone should try this for themselves to form their own opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is more a place to go for the experience than for the steak. You wait in a long line, enjoy the ambiance (or not) while you gawk at those standing in line at the quasi-racist Geno's (where they serve slightly less tasty cheesesteaks), and for your effort, you are rewarded with a solidly good cheesesteak. 

This is all to say, the steak is good, but not the best; if you're going to be in Philadelphia for a while, you'd be remiss for not making it here (when you have free time). 

(Why is it not the best? Ishkabibble's serves a bigger and meatier steak.)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simply awful. Honestly, some of these so-called "dives" are absolutely gross and disgusting. The Philly cheesesteak sandwiches were tasteless, soggy, and lacking in every way possible. I appreciate a good hearty sandwich as much as the next guy, and I understand that splurging with grease and meat can be the objective, but here, this place has a reputation built on folks simply regurgitating a myth.  Stay away, honestly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Note:  This is part 1 of a 4 part series of an unhealthy weekend cheesesteak tour.

BAH!  How is this famous?  It's bad enough that I couldn't chew this steak-ems/rubber band shreds wannabe.  Then comes the hygienic factor.  After getting the sandwich, the guy wipes his nose precariously close to his hand.  As I looked in disbelief, my friend rightly points out that I shouldn't expect too much from a cheesesteak establishment, in fact, it probably adds to the flavor.  Tragically, I went along with his reasoning.  After two overly chewy bites, I called it quits and chucked the sandwich.  Then I was off to Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The food is great the service is fast, the location was fairly close to me just a bus ride away. That's worth taking the trip for, also the prices are not bad either.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Know how to order, go during the hours that aren't as busy. Order more than one.

Necessary rules for Pat's experience. And it's not just a sandwich, it's an experience. They're not always gushing with customer service they're just perfect at making a cheesesteak, so enjoy it. 

Forget about the place across the street. It's all about the King of Steaks, wiz wit! But seriously it's damn good. Just follow those rules and your experience will be 5-star one)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Called the King of Steaks for a reason. Let the rival continue as Ginos tries to compete with their bright lights and fancy cheez wiz. Pats is the OG of Philadelphia. Open always, no matter when you're craving. It's old school, so cash is king. Fries are a must too. Make sure you know what you're getting when you get to the window because these guys mean business and have a job to do. 

Its a must when visiting Philly... or driving home from the airport after a long flight!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It used to be a 5,  but recently has declined, what makes it worse is rotten kids walking around trying to sell candy and being rude and you refuse to buy it.  I won't be returning there anymore
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Way over rated, though it was better than Geno's, which we went to right after Pat's. Starting with the bread, which had a rubbery crust, right through the meat, which was good but minimal, ending with the whiz, which was runny, everything was noticeably a little sub-par. Line moved quickly, but not worth $11. My local lunch counter in Narberth was better on every count, lots of meat, crusty bread and only $8.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: MUST READ: After reading the reviews I was eager to come here with my girlfriend. As me and my girlfriend were waiting online we witnessed one of the cooks rubbing his noise as he was standing over the meat he was cooking .
