I understand your human but if you're going to rub your nose step aside do watever change ur gloves and continue . Who would still want to eat there after seeing that I know I didn't !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So #4 on the search for the Best Philly Cheesesteak stop was Pat's.
We walked from our VRBO to South Philly to try the Famous Pat's. 
The Cheesesteaks was good.   Bread was nice and soft but held the Whiz.
We loved how it dripped down our hand!!!
We missed the big crowds which was great.  We could sit and enjoy and take it all in.
They have instructions on how to order so follow the rules.  If you mess it up, just go to the back of the line and try again!!
Also, they have a separate line to order the fries and drinks.
Cash Only!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: All you need to say is one "wiz wit" and you'll be on your way to tasting what a classic cheesesteak should taste like. We decided to stop by here on our way out from the city for a little early morning breakfest for champions on our way back to NOVA, and I'm glad I did. After reading reviews between this place and Geno's we opted for here based on the reviews. The place may not be as flashy as Geno's, but as they say, never judge a book by its cover. The establishment had some wear and tear to it, but if they have been around for this long, then you know they must be doing something right! Since we were early, there was virtually no line, we ordered, and it seemed just as the cashier handed me my cash back, he was handing me my sandwich right after, talk about some of the quickest service I've ever received! Now onto the sandwich, was it life changing? No. Was it the cheesesteak to end all cheesesteaks? No. But it was juicy, cheesy, delicious, and I ate it to every last bite. I think what makes certain cheesesteaks stand out from the rest are the breads and Pat's just had it going for them, compared to some of the last places I've visited in Philly for cheesesteaks. So in the end, this was the perfect quick pit stop to have some food to combat my hangover, and it did exactly that as we all left the place feeling satisfied.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Gristle and grease. Fries, steak and water $17. Just plain bad food at tourist trap prices. The city has so much more to offer.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What...the...heck? How does overcooked, dry pieces of meat covered in plastic cheese sauce with a few pallid onions on a bland roll of bread become a world renown food? How is Pat's even in business? Is this Philly's joke on the food world to hype something this bad? I was skeptical of the low Yelp ratings believing that those who prefer Geno's were leaving bad reviews for Pat's, but after visiting both, they both deserve less than 1-star ratings. The best part of the meal was the pickled red peppers and the fried red chiles they offer to go along with the cheese steak sandwich. Beyond the ridiculously bad cheese steak sandwich, Pat's only accepts cash. Between Pat's and Geno's, at least Geno's has invested in a lot of outdoor lighting whereas Pat's looks like the owners are spending all of the profits elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yup! Good stuff for a late night run.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered the fantastic Mushroom Pepper Steak.  It was a hit!  They prepare the food quickly and the service is great. Friendly people and they were quick to make local recommendations for other places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Worth the walk through the historic Italian Market to this old school joint that has the best cheese steak.  Just do the cheese whiz and then top with picked peppers!!  Grab a Americano a block away at the Cafe Crema Connoli
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of the bests cheesesteaks that you will ever have. I like my prov without. My girlfriend at the time went here and Geno's to have a cheesesteak at both locations and the thing they both have in common is the long line. It was cold and worth it as a few hours later she agreed to marry me. Was it me or the cheesesteaks? I will let you decide.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is the king of steaks . 
I love how fast they food your food and get it .
The bread was amazing to soak up all that cheese and meat .
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: After a ton of anticipation, and very high expectations of eating this incredible cheese steak I was left very disappointed.  Been looking forward to this sandwich for a very long time and it was all for nothing. Steak was dry, cheese was ok. Best part of the sandwich was the nice soft hero bread it came on. But other then that I wouldn't go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I found the meat in the sandwich to be a bit tough. The bread roll was good, but overall the sandwich was really soggy. The location looks nice and clean. The customer service wasn't great, the cashier was rude and not very friendly. While sitting on one of the benches reading the menu we were approached by a man (not sure if he was a customer or employee) and told us the "tables are only for Pat's customers".
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The funny thing about Philly cheesesteaks is that other cities actually do them better than Philadelphia does them. Exhibit A. 

I mean, come on.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Likes:
+The cheesesteak I ordered was meaty and moist.
+The wait time in line isn't too bad. You get your food within one minute of ordering. 
+++There isn't a sign at the ordering window that is meant to offend people that can't speak English or speak it well **cough** Geno's **cough**. 

Dislikes: 
-NONE

If I ever visit Philly again, I will definitely come back here for a cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very crappy cheesesteaks and nothing but tourists. Also very crappy workers, I'm sure that's their number one specialty though.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was in Philly during a vacation so wife and I decided to try the famous Pat's and Genos and put them up against each other.   We got one sandwich from each shop (catty corner from each other).   We came here at the off hour of around 3PM on a weekday so they weren't busy at all and should have had time to make our cheese steaks properly. 

Verdict:  Meh.

Meat: Dry and tough
Bread: Not bad
Cheese: Provolone wasn't even melted
Toppings: Obviously canned mushrooms.

We've had better in San Diego.

Cut and paste this from my Genos review because they were interchangeable as far as we were concerned.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm in the military and Pat's took care of us tonight. We REALLY appreciate it. Thanks guys! Coming from Georgia, it's always great to have a REAL Philly cheese steak.  We hope to see y'all soon!!!!   We had a steak with onions, peppers, mushrooms and cheese whiz - POW that was some excellent grub!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is ok I would place Pat's 3rd out of Geno's and Jim's. Cool spot worth going to. And their cheese fries are really good better than Geno's in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We finally had the chance to swing by Pats after living in Philadelphia for about a year. We had some friends in town and of course they wanted to try a cheesesteak. We were in the area of Pats so we swung by and it was everything that I expected it to be. Good cheesesteak but there after better in the city. I ordered mine witout onion and provolone. Good bread, fast service, and a good 3 start place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better steaks than geenos didn't like the fries no parking cash only but unique experience
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place was super tasty, incredibly efficient, and was a fun place to meet others from all over the country / world in line. Definitely would recommend it! It's better than Geno's across the street in my opinion (tried Geno's on prior trip to Philadelphia).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's an alternative to Geno's. I like neither place. But if I have to pick, I will go to Pat's, because I don't agree with Geno's business practice.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not phenomenal, but better than Geno's. I like how they have several different kinds of cheesesteaks. I don't know if it's a Philly thing or just a cheesteak restaurant thing, but the workers were pretty obnoxious and looked annoyed at guests who didn't know what to order. I guess service doesn't really matter at a place popular for their cheesesteak sandwiches and not for making friends. The sandwiches were good, but I don't have to have them again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whiz whit!

Quick, awesome service. Cheesesteaks and cheese fries here are really tasty without the political baggage of Geno's. Also I tried the compared the cheese steaks here to Geno's a couple times and prefer the ones sold at this place each time. Bread is tasty also.

Since this is Philadelphia, and this is the east coast, definitely make up your mind before you come up to order. The line goes by pretty quickly but people get pretty impatient when you take your time to order. 

There is definitely plenty of seating, the only tough thing about this place is that there is only neighborhood parking, however that is the same case with Geno's as well across the street. Anyways definitely check out this place if you haven't already for an experience!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Crappy neighborhood and a bad sandwich. The bread was mushy. The fries were even bad. My kids sandwich was cold. It was all around bad.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Part of our road trip, we took a detour for some philly cheesesteak.  First time trying Pat's and OMG! Heaven!  Kids enjoyed it and was happily pleased with it.  The juice from the meat, onions and cheese, peppers, bread . So delish!!  The kids took a vote and Pat's was our winner!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was my first time to Pat's. Being the original, I felt that I had to check the box. I was ready with cash and knew the lingo for ordering. Since it was my first time there I thought I had to pick up the Sandwich from the next window, vs the one I ordered at. As I stepped away, I was literally  screamed at, telling me to come back. I understand there is an up front brashness that often comes with east coast interactions, but this was flat out rude and unprofessional. The cheesesteak was pretty good, but I wouldn't say it was anything special. Due to the rude workers, I would not go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A must for any foodie in the Phialdelphia area is to compare the Titan's of Phialdlephia cheesesteaks. Here goes: For a purely objective taste test, I ate a Pat's steak and Gino's steak side by side simultaneously for direct comparison. Pat''s came out on top primarily because the meat is better and chopped vs. layered, and beats Gino's's by at least a full star. Did it again two years later and came to the same conclusion. For you non-believers, bring a friend and order one cheesesteak from both steak joints, split them so you have half from both. Try a bite of one then try the other, then do it again . If you still think Ginos is better you may need to have your taste buds examined. It makes sense that Gino's needs the glitz in a desperate attempt to pull people away from Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well Guy Fieri and myself disagree once again. I can make better cheese steaks at home and not have to struggle to find parking or have the same bum ask me for money 20 times.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tried Geno's wasn't great so went to try Pat's.  Can see why it had more people in line.   Food was hot and delicious.   Fries were okay.   Preferred Pats over Geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Although I much prefer a chopped, wiz, witout, I have to give the edge to Genos. Pats is just a little too grisly for my taste and tons of grease. Still good though.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well, I figured if I'm going to try a Geno's, I'll have to try a Pat's. So I'll preface again by saying I got this delivered. To keep things fair, I did ordered the exact same thing as I did from Geno's. A cheesesteak with cheese whiz and onions. Order of cheese fries also. The bread from Pat's I thought had a little more bite to the crust and chew to the dough, which I liked. They also diced up their rib eye more. There was more flavor to it than Geno's...almost a sweetness to the meat. The fries were a thicker cut with I think an extra crispness either from double frying or a flour coating. I probably would've given this about a 3.5, but I felt it was more than okay...just not mind blowing. If it came to the battle between Pat's and Geno's, I'd pick Pat's. I've also been told these 2 are tourist traps so I'm pumped to try some other places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We knew it was a tourist trap when we went (Yelp gave us all the info we needed to know), and the line took a little longer than we wanted. (We went around 7:30p on a Friday, and we waited in line maybe 20-30 minutes.) So we were hungry when we finally ordered. 

All that being said, we ordered the "whiz wit" (a cheesesteak with cheese whiz and onions) and a cherry soda, and we downed both! So fast. We added some salt about halfway through, and it was a little better. But it was very good. Much better than we were expecting because of the hype (and our hype-skepticism). The bread was chewy enough for me--definitely more baguette than I was expecting from all the reviews about it being soft--and the whole sandwich melded together into a beefy, salty, cheezy, wet tastiness. There are probably better cheesesteaks in Philadelphia, but Pat's was not a waste of time or calories.

(And who knew? The cherry soda was a great pairing!)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Much better than the competition, Genos. Their ingredients are fresh, unlike Genos. Much more authentic than Genos as well. Actually enjoyed their food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I hate to say this as I was hoping for a different outcome, but this wasn't good at all. It's fun to say we tried it but that's it. To be honest we have better Philly cheesesteak in Utah!! Not kidding. The meat was bland and they gave me my order wrong and wouldn't correct it. Service is rude and short tempered! Because this sandwich was so bad I went across the street to Gino's, I couldn't imagine it was this bad. The service was better at Gino's they were more patient. The facility is more up-to-date, which I don't usually care about! The bread is different, a little bit more chewy for the texture which I liked and The meat had better flavor but not much. Now that might be because the cheese sauce over at Pats covered my entire sandwich so all I could taste was the cheese.  There is absolutely no flavor in this sandwich. If in my life I ever have to eat between one of these two places again I would drive someplace else instead. Not my favorite, wasn't worth my time And I would go someplace else! Not really even fun to say I ate here!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good Cheesesteaks.  Expensive. Rude rules... I mean... I get it... It's an establishment, and well known - Not only for their cheesesteaks, and lines, but for the way you order and stand in line and go to the back of the line if you're not ready... It's good stuff, but... Well... Go for the cheesesteaks, and the experience.  Once... I'm sure there's just as good, if not better somewhere in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: More like Pat's Crap O Steak ! You should have seen the cashier and cook, no teeth one was picking his nose and the cashier asked me for my wife's number wtf!!!! This place is a sh&%$ hole
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's first time in South Philly. Wanted to try famous cheesesteak-. It has a good flavor with sweet onion but under seasoned. Service was super fast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philly Native and I have never been here until last year...simply because it's for tourists. But I must say the cheese steaks make excellent full snacks...like before you go bar hopping or after you leave the club. NOT the best cheese steaks in Philly but damn good. just don't expect friendly warm service..but expect your sandwich to come really fast and Delicious
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Geno's or Pat's?  Pat's or Geno's?  I guess that is the question.  Well, I'm just visiting from Los Angeles, so I tried both back-to-back within 5 minutes of each other (they are located across the street from each other).
I ordered a "Wiz wit" from each one (what's with the stupid ordering system?) and I thought Pat's was the winner.  Geno's wasn't bad, but I liked the steak better at Pat's.

BTW, I've had better cheesesteak sandwiches in California.  I think these places are more for the experience, rather than the actual cheesesteak...similar to Pink's in LA.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came to Pat's after literally finished eating a cheesesteak sandwich from Geno's. I have to say...the king crown for the better Philly cheesesteak definitely goes to Pat's. It was delicious.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in Philadelphia so I thought I'd try their famous Philly Cheese Steak.  Didn't know which to pick, Pat's or Geno's.  Flipped a coin.  Pat's it was.  After all the hype, stories and building it up, I just don't get it.  It was just a chopped steak sandwich with onions and cheez wiz on a roll.  Wasn't bad, just wasn't some heavenly experience.  Not to mention the price.  $11 for an approx 12" sandwich.  The only up side, was watching all the freaks walking in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visited here while on vacation. The lady behind the cash register was rude and short. The sandwich came out fast, that's the only good thing. Went to the other station to get a soda and the guy scratched his ass right before pouring my drink. Disgusting. The Philly was definitely not all that it was up to be. Bread was hard and the steak was flavorless. DO NOT GO HERE
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As good as I expected. I made sure to see the correct way to order so I didn't look like a rookie. I got one "Wit Whiz". Went to the next window and ordered a birch beer. The cheesesteak was delicious! Right amount of juice, not too much cheese to be messy, good amount of onions. Birch beer was good too! I felt good as a local, that brought his friends, made faces as they ordered "I'll have a cheesesteak with grilled onions and cheese whiz". He said, "why can't you do it like the NY'er?"

Yay me!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Stopped by Philly last weekend on a random road trip and... when in Philly, get cheese steak!

This place had lots of good reviews and it makes sense, the food is delicious and the food is served extremely quickly, probably because they're so used to large orders daily. I recommend the mushroom pepper pizza steak and adding more peppers from the condiments section.

Not too pricey, I just wish they had some kind of indoor seating, or outdoor heating now, especially since winter is coming.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I am definitely going to come back here for their cheesesteak. The melted cheese and soft cooked onion mixed in the cheesesteak was deliciousssss! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to get the fries but I will definitely get it on my next visit. Overall 8/10
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Hungover after a wedding in Philly? Then this place is sure to be the cure for your brunch (or lunch) after stumbling out of your hotel room.

I've been here once back in October 2010 (see above). It was Football Season and the Eagles were playing so it was probably a bit busier than usual...but that's fine. I'm an out-of-towner wanting to sample the local fare and first on the agenda was the legendary Philly Cheese Steak...

Let's just say that Pat's was well worth the 45+ minute wait.

Mushroom Whiz Wit....PERFECTION
Cheese fries...they are fries smothered with Whiz...what's not to love?
couldn't find anything wrong "wit" either.

$10 or whatever it cost (I can't remember)...I consider it an investment into broadening my perspectives on food, local culture, and for the experience...and the overall experience was great. Pat's receives 4 stars from me until I get a chance to come back and try Geno's, Jim's and Tony Luke's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's: I refuse to eat anywhere where I am going to be treated like a redheaded stepchile because I can't speak their stupid lingo-I don't work there, I am not a waitress, so why do I have to be trained to comply and submit to this? Stupid. (This is not to say anything against waitresses anywhere.) 
Geno's: To post a sign requiring English would make me boycott  anyplace. Yeah, this IS America-the only way you are not an immigrant YOURSELF is if you are American Indian.
I'll try Jim's next time I'm in town, always heard good things.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Birth place of the Philly cheesesteak! 
I went with a Philly local who grew up decades ago with this family. I thoroughly enjoyed walking up to this restaurant with him and seeing it from a true local's point of view. Essentially, I saw  all these tough guys behind the counter pause for a minute to welcome me as an outside, talk more about their restaurant and neighborhood's history and love for the blessings they have had in life.  

Maybe not the best sandwich I have ever had...but I am definitely glad that I tried out this American original at the original restaurant and experience it with a true local. 

(insider tip: cash only)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was my first Philly cheeseteak and I'm not sure if this is what I'm supposed to be basing my opinion off of. Either way I know I didn't enjoy this.  Dry meat, undercooked onions, canned mushrooms, and weirdos working the counter. Meh.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of the best in Philly!  I suggest a "Provy Wiz Wit," an order of cheese fries topped off with a birch beer.  Provy wiz wit = Cheesesteak with fried onions, Provolne and Cheese Wiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The OG cheesesteak in Philly. You have to try it during your visit, the atmosphere and experience is worth it even if the cheesesteak is OK. Plus it's pretty cheap and cheesy so worth it
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What can I say.  There's the rest, then there's the best!  Pat's is the King of Steaks!

Provolone wit is my pick every time!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You can't beat the cheesesteak we did a side-by-side comparison, with the people catty corner from them. There was no comparison we were sad we spent the money across the street. Solid with a lot beefsteak, best bread.  Wow!!! The peppers!!!! Don't forget the peppers.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Food is great, area and location is great!!! Can't complain, food is overall good. Expect long lines on weekends but they tend to move quickly! I approve this message!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overated Rip Off. Never coming back.
Not impressed with flavor at all - standard at best. Also very expensive $60 for 4 people. Fries $6 for an 8 oz cup.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wayyyyy to much hype for Pat's and Geno's. Overpriced and doesn't meet expectations.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So like it's my first time visiting Philadelphia and heard about Geno's and Pats having great Philly cheesesteaks. We came here as a group and decided to get both to compare. Neither of them were that good. Both looked like beat down old fast food joints. The cheesesteak wasn't horrible, but don't deserve to be mentioned at all to anyone who's coming from out of town and looking for a good cheesesteak. Like please, don't tell anyone about this place unless you know for a fact they want to waste their time eating a less than mediocre Philly cheesesteak in Philadelphia. I got one from the airport and it was better than both.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 來芝加哥就不要錯過，幾乎每個遊客都會來吃Geno跟Pat's King然後做個比較，我個人是覺得都很好吃，但每個人心中都要自己的喜好，這部份的樂趣請自己去嘗試。
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had to be a tourist and come give this place a go, my initial thoughts were overwhelming because of the plaque on the floor and the recommendations from friends. Quite the long drive from NYC to get here but it was worth it in my opinion. 

Had to order a philly cheese steak when I arrived. The hero was nice and toasty with the steak steaming hot off the grill with the cheese slathered over the top of the steak and I topped it off with some ketchup. 

Overall had a good time and the philly steak was great. But make sure you have cash, that's all they accept. CASH IS KING
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteak spot in Philly. Leaps and bounds over geno's . The sandwich was packed of meat and full of flavor. Cant beat it
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
People always say that Pats and Genos are not the place for the most authentic sub steaks but I am from Brooklyn NY and I have been here maybe 8 to 10 times. Each time I come here I do not get disappointed. Their whiz cheese is great and that is always what I am going to order according to some Philadelphia friends. 

Expect a fast and rushed experience. They are not being rude or anything.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I believe this was my first cheesesteak I've ever had in Philly. 

Really cool location, awesome that it's across the street from Geno's and they have the rivalry thing going.

The cheesesteak was good, I cannot complain. Fresh bread, tender meat, American cheese all served fast, I could eat here and be happy. It's not my favorite but it's pretty good... and if it's near, I'll come by again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bum ass employees being mad disrespectful to my family. Nobody was in line when I got there and I get rushed to order when reading the menu out of line. Food came out cold and they're completely overrated who pray off of tourist.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not the best but it's OK compared to the over-rated Genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious. Historic. Character. Get the Wiz Wit and a Cheese fry. The long lines and limited seating are the only reasons I didn't give 5-stars. But those things are part of the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went to pats because it has better reviews than Geno's. This is the only cheesesteak I've had in philly and I got the cheesesteak with onions with cheese wiz.  There might be a line but it moves fast. When you get to the ordering station you should know your order because they do everything fast!  

The cheesesteak was a little messy but they do give you a decent amount of meat. It's definitely shareable between two people especially if you've been walking through the Italian market and sampling things along the way. The meat is tender and juicy but there's still too much bread. I added some ketchup and relish ( I know that's weird) but i think that added dimension to the meat and cheese. 

I'm not sure if this is the best cheesesteak but it's decent. It's my first time exploring Philly so I had to get a cheesesteak at its source.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ok. Sandwich? Good. 

Customer Service? Terrible. I politely asked for a cup of water with my fries at the "Fries, etc" window, and the guy said "No."
He was so terse/blunt that I thought he was kidding and laughed. Then I looked at his face, and realized he was completely serious. He followed that with, "Sorry, no can do, babe." (Babe?! Really?).

I'm sorry, but if you can't take 5 seconds to give me a paper cup of water after I just paid $13.50 for a sandwich and fries (overpriced if you ask me) with unheated outdoor seating in November, I won't be returning. But maybe I'm just missing the point of the experience?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was told that Pat's was a good (although touristy) place for a philly cheesesteak, so we went for a late night trip around 1AM. There was a small line but it moved very quickly. You go to the window, pay in cash, and they hand you a hot and freshly wrapped cheesesteak before you leave. It's a quick and easy process.

Personally, I really enjoyed my cheese steak. The meat was juicy and tender. The bread was soft and fluffy. The melted cheese was hot and is essentially the type used for nachos - which was definitely really tasty. 

This location is also open 24/7 so that's another plus. Unfortunately, it's cash only so it can be a bit inconvenient if you don't like to carry cash. 

However, I will definitely stop by again if I'm ever back in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visited Philly so def had to try Pat's. Line can get pretty long but they move extremely fast. So when you get to the front, know how to order and have your cash in hand. Then just enjoy your greasy goodness. Whiz wit is def my favorite.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in Philly, had to try despite the 3 star average on Yelp. In short, I was unimpressed. I ordered the steak with onions, peppers, and provolone. They handed me the sandwhich practically as soon as I paid. The meat felt dry and overcooked. I was prepared for salty meat, but no need. It wasn't terribly bland, though. I suppose that's safer if they expect most people choose the whiz (which is unpalatable to me). I tried it, don't completely regret it, but probably will go other places in the future
The fries were fresh and hot. I ate there around 630 PM on a Sunday night.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats is delicious, but Im a Genos man. Definitely give them both a try though. The only reason I go with Geno's is the peppers. Otherwise they're on the same level.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Just got to Philly from VA, heard about the dispute over Pat's and Geno's and how it's a famous philly cheesesteak landmark. So my boyfriend ordered from Pat's and got the regular philly cheesesteak which was about 1 foot long for $10.00.  You can add other ingredients to your philly steak, but for additional costs. They have a unique way of ordering your food without telling them a whole paragraph of your choosing, they have it posted on their menu.

The place is a fast food place that you walk up to and order. They have picnic tables for seating that surrounds the entire place. You can see their rivalry right across from them.

I finally got to try a Philly cheesesteak in Philly.  I thought it was mediocre, but I really liked their bread it had a nice texture. 

It's funny, when you bring their opponents food over their territory, they will say "thats garbage" (with a jersey accent).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was this the best Philly cheesesteak in the world? Maybe not, which is too bad because a) that's what you'd hope for when in Philadelphia and b) this place is highly renowned. It was still very good though. I got mine "Provolone wit" and thought it was definitely pretty tasty. I think one risk you run with Philly cheesesteaks is dryness, but this was overall a pretty good amount of moist. It was kind of greasy, which was okay for the time being, but I do think that detracted a little bit from the sandwich. The bread was fine. Could have been a little firmer. By nature they have very efficient service (necessary when there's a ton of people lining up into the street) and the sandwiches are really big, with a ton of meat packed in them. It was a little expensive but fair enough considering the status Pat's holds in the area. I'm not sure that I would go back, but it was worth the experience as a tourist.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For the same price as Geno's, you get a cheese steak sandwich that has more meat (and the meat is actually warm!), and the provolone had a nice, sharp taste. Overall this sandwich packed more flavor.

Although not a huge fan of cheese steak in general, I was happy and satisfied with what Pat's had to offer.

I would come again.
----------------------------
PS: If, like me, you're planning a nice, long walk from downtown to get to this neighborhood in the evening, think again. Although not necessarily unsafe, you'll walk through dilapidated neighborhoods with completely empty streets before reaching your destination.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: mom and brother work there . I love the cheese fries and pizza steaks !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I give this place four stars because they are good, but I favor Ginos.  Maybe its the flashy lights.  Part of me believes they are owned by the same guy who sits across the street, watching the daily chaos and listening to a healthy rotation of Frank Sinatra and Mario Lanza records.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I'm going to start this review by saying that if this was the only cheese steak I had while living in Philly for a few months it would be great.  Now with that said I will say don't believe the hype. I had a wiz wit and I have to say that it wasn't that good. The meat was chewy and a little tough. As far as the construction of the sandwich was subpar.  I mean if I am eating a cheesesteak I want my sandwich to be loaded with meat and I have to say my first two bites were just bread no meat or wiz.  The meat had no real flavor like it wasn't seasoned at all.  As far as the atmosphere goes wow!  The line was outrageous which wasn't bad though you are standing in the middle of the street but it does move quickly.  The customer service was as expected very fast and rude.  If you don't order right prepare to get looked at like your stupid.  When sitting to eat I have one word for you PIGEONS! Everywhere. So if you're looking for a good cheesesteak go to Tony Luke's that's the best I've had so far here in Philly  

PS- parking is a pain. So be careful and be on the lookout for the PPA
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When in Philly! I stopped by Pat's for none other than an actual Philly Cheesesteak. Luckily and surprisingly, there was no line. We figured out what we wanted and hopped on line to order. Something to know before coming is this place is CASH ONLY. It's 2019. I thought we would be past the cash only spots by now, but I guess not.
We ordered a Cheesesteak "wit" Onions and Provolone ($11). It was ready as soon as we finished paying. Talk about quick service! We walked over to the other window to order French Fries ($5).
There were tons of grilled onions in there which really enhanced the cheesesteak. The provolone was barely melted and the steak was just mediocre. It didn't have too much flavor. I liked the fries; they definitely enhanced this cheesesteak meal.
Overall, it is the touristy thing to do but I wouldn't come back. There are definitely better cheesesteak spots in Philly that are both better in flavor and quality.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well.... this is my first time in philly and I couldn't wait until I tried a Philly cheesesteak. The line went into the street which was expected. The service was sooooo fast. The food was fresh. The fries were hot. BUT there was nooooooooooo seasoning on the steak in the Philly cheesesteak. I had a pepper cheesesteak wit onions and provolone. After the first bite you can't taste the cheese anymore. After eating there I regretted not trying Geno's instead. Hopefully I'll be able to find a good cheesesteak before I leave the city. If you go here bring your own seasoning since they don't have any.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They did not wash there hands. They don't take credit cards.  Over rated.  Forget the cheese wiz. Terrible stuff. THEY DO NOT WASH THERE HANDS.  They touch money and then your sandwich. Don't do it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They had delicious Philly cheese steaks, I'd recommend anyone visiting philly to make a pit stop here. it's a must! The sandwiches are hot and delicious, the line was long but it went fast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not your typical beef eater (plz refrain from dirty thoughts. : O) and as such I rarely eat beef now.  So when I was in Philly you just simply have to get a PHILLY CHEESESTEAK.  I came to Pat's King of Steaks after a previous soiree and I expected a line especially since it was Halloween (drunk people got to eat too right?).  There were none which was a mixed blessing in disguise I suppose.  

So...

I ordered Pat's Pepper Steak wid (yes it is wid down in Philly and not WITH up in NY) onions and no cheese (perhaps I should have been braver being partial lactose intolerant and just risked the bathroom run during my 2 hr drive back).  

The sandwich itself was LARGE I mean when you are paying $9.50 it better be an EFFING appropriated sized.  Pat's definitely packed it on with the steak.  They stuffed that bad boy like Thanksgiving dinner.  Food baby anyone?  

The flavor was a bit bland as I expected well more peppery flavor and ONIONS (I don't know if it was just an off night or just an off build on the particular sandwich I got but I'm pretty sure the onions are supposed to be on BOTH sides of the sandwich and not just one side which is what I got).  The other side...the BETTER side it was flavorful.  The onions gave the steak a real nice contrast with its tangy-ness and it was peppered well.  

A random thought.  Did my sandwich not come with napkins? Was it an extra charge? Was I suppose to take slabs of wood and make my own napkins?  Was it powdered into my sandwich?  It was nowhere to be found and I didn't see on the outside tables neither.
I was curious as if there was a sauce for it other than the obvious CHEESE in Philly CHEESE steak.  But I'd gladly try them again as it did fill my belly and the latter parts of the sandwich was what I envisioned the sandwich to be.

If Philly Cheese Steak joints are states, Pat's is definitely NEW YORK as the outside decor has a gritty feel to it.  Geno's Cheese Steak across from them had all these flashing lights, definitely LAS VEGAS.  More on that comparison next time when I visit Geno's as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bun was rubbery as was the meat and not what I expected from the famous stop. It was edible and had more meat than Geno's but just not that good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3.5 stars, rounded up.

Yeah, I actually, probably would not come back here again. There's really nothing wrong with the cheesesteak here, but it's just that this place is so out of the way, relative to where I would normally be hanging out in Philadelphia. There doesn't seem to be much to do in this neighborhood, and, and the septa doesn't get you super close either.

Still, the cheesesteak here is enjoyable. The price is okay for the amount of food you get (it's $11 for a cheesesteak with onions), and I opted for the cheese whiz, which is really a must. I kind of agree with the others when they say that there isn't much taste to the beef, but I honestly think I wouldn't have been able to taste it too well even if the quality was higher, on account of the cheese whiz taste. The bun is fine, and I enjoyed the outdoor seating- it was surprisingly clean given how popular this place seems to be. It's kind of annoying that this place is cash only, so it limited the amount of things I actually had money for- as a result, the cheesesteak is the only thing I got. I came at around 1:00 am, and this place is open 24 hours, so that is a pretty cool feature..

They seem to want to make a big deal about how long they've been doing this cheesesteak biz, or how they were the first ones, but I imagine most of that stuff matters very little to people. This isn't even the best cheesesteak in Philadelphia, so I don't think they should talk such a big game. If I happen to be in the neighborhood I'd come back- otherwise not sure if I'd go out of my way.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Because we tried both Pat's and Geno's we know for sure....Pat's cheesesteaks are the way to go. 100% better....there was a perfect number of onions and they were caramelized so perfectly....and the cheese was melted so wonderfully into the steak slices which we were also able to bite through without troubles. This is probably the best cheesesteak I've ever had.

Be sure to have cash because it is cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here all the way from New York. We tried both Pat's and Geno's the exact same day. Honestly was not worth it and you could definitely find something exactly the same or better at a place closer. What I can say is that this place is WAY better than Geno's but it's still bland meat with cheese. Oh and by the way they refuse to cut your sandwich on half.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite of the all the touristy cheesesteak joints in the city. Wiz wit hits the spot like nothing else at 2 am. Don't waste your time with any of the others (Genos).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This historic landmark is a must see when visiting Philadelphia.  Bring cash, your patience and be in decisive mode.  How many walk up counter style restaurants have rules posted for you to follow before you order!  Read your cheesesteak options, get your cash out and speak up at the register to order your sandwiches.  Then step up to the next counter and order your drinks (soft).  Fair warning....if you don't offer quickly and speak up, prepare to be yelled at!!!!  The guy selling the drinks was downright nasty, but hey I'm from Jersey I can handle it.  You'll sit outside in a cool area that is quite crowded.  Lots of people watching!  My cheesesteak was yummy, albeit with tons of grease and some long human hairs mixed in, but pretty good until I bit into the hair.  Price is inexpensive.  Fun to eat a cheesesteak in its original birthplace.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is fine. The cheesesteak is an ok sandwich of its own merit, but far from the best, and it's tough to really differentiate one from another. Geno's is fine. Jim's is fine. If I had to pick, I'd say Jim's is the best. But back to Pat's. It's touristy and overrated and expensive. $20 for a steak and wiz plus a birch beer and fries. The sandwich, as I said, was fine. Bread was fresh - crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The wiz was flavorful and gave the moistness needed. The meat was not particularly juicy, but not overly dry - I do wish there was some more grease/fat though. The staff was friendly enough - but you better know what you want and how to order when you get to the register. There are better places than Pat's - but at the end of the day the cheesesteak is a mediocre sandwich anyway so you're probably fine picking any of the places a Philly local tells you to go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Soo if you're going to Philadelphia you have to hit either pats or Geno's right? I decided to go with Pats just because I had heard from many people that the overall sub is just better. So I got here decided what I wanted fast since the service wants you to choose what you want without messing up and keep it trucking. I got the cheesesteak "wit" wiz and some wiz cheese fries. Both of which were very good. They have a few tables outside that you can sit at and eat quickly and go about your day. The reason I'll give it 3 stars it because 1: of the service and 2: the lack of wiz. I would have liked more wiz on the cheesesteak and then on top of that I didn't even notice the hot sauce and hot pepper station until I was about 2 bites in. All in all it's a good cheesesteak but I'm sure there are far better ones in philly that I'll have to try.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My husband and i drove here today from new york to find out if its really the best cheese steak..
I have to agree that its one of the best cheese steak compare to genos (was just across the street, very flashy and fancy)

We got the cheese steak with wiz. There was enough meat and wiz, very generous with cheese, the beef was sooooooo good that we even had extra sandwhiches to go. 

Ita $10 for the cheese steak and CASH ONLY.

If we ever come back.. we will definitely stop by at
 pat's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had to try it, was super excited, ended up being severely disappointed. It was gross. Fatty, cold, and they were very rude. Glad I went but will never return. 

Ps: go to White House subs! 
Best cheese steak around!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We were in town for a meeting so we had to stop by and get a pair of cheesesteaks from the corner competitors.  They were ok, but cash only spoils it for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Philly cheesesteak tour! This was the 3rd location and fortunately was not packed on a Monday 3pm. Sandwich came out fast. Cash only of course. Wiz with. Moment of truth....mixed bag with my party. Some of us enjoyed the "other location", I personally liked Pat's better. This place had full slices of steak, which I really liked. I did feel the cheese was saltier at this location than at my other places. Sandwich bun was warm, which I liked, but really I prefer it toasted but I guess PHL is not about that toasted bread life? 

Life changing? No. 
Satisfied? Yes.
Would I return? Probably, simply because it's a landmark location and tourist thing to do in PHL.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My wife and I have
Lived in Philly all our lives and never been to Pat's steak. So we decided to go there on our 37. Wedding anniversary . I ordered an extra cheese steak, it did even fill the roll.. My wife order a mushroom pepper cheese steak.. She was not happy.. there are 2 windows, one or order and pay for your steak and one to order fries and soda.. the person who took the order seemed a little mad at us.. the steak was greasy and over cooked. Not going there again..
I can imagine the server cursing about this post..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Getting a Philly Cheesesteak with cheese whiz is a must when in Philly. After trying a few around the city, Pats was definitely the best. Geno's right down the street looks flashy, but the sandwiches looked dry. Something about being greasy actually helps the sandwich taste better. Plus Pats is the original. Their fries were good as well. I'd recommend take an uber or taxi over to Pats, as it's not in the best part of town. 
Definitely worth the stop!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Excellent meal, just a short walk from the downtown Marriott.  Cheesesteak was tender and the ordering process was smooth.  Geno says he is the the best but Pat is King.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A Classic Cheesesteak Sandwich :) My girlfriend and I went here to our first stop for the title of "Philadelphia's best cheesesteak" in our opinion. The ambiance looks like a mom/pops food joint and I am liking the classic old school, fast food feel in it. It is not glamorous than the establishment across the street. The employees seems happy working in here, which makes the experience even more memorable. Oh yes the cheesesteak :)....

One of the famous Cheesesteak joint in Philly. A lot of tourist flocked this establishment because of its popularity shown in various medias. The meat was chopped and the onions were golden caramelized. The cheesewhiz did not overpowered the meat, which is outstanding. My only knocked on them is.., it does taste like an ordinary cheesesteak that you can get somewhere else, so it doesn't stand out, it just happened the name just carried the quality of this sandwich. However, I do like this place and will go here again, whenever I'm around the City of Brotherly Love :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The sandwich itself is decent, but does not deserve to be called one of the best sandwiches in the city. It is slightly better than the caddy-corner Geno's, but it is still a very basic sandwich at a tourist trap. If you want a real "philly" cheese steak without the hassle of the line, don't go here. There are better quality cheese steaks at most pizza shops in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you are visiting and absolutely need to hit up one of the "big" (those being Pat's, Geno's, and Jim's) spots in Philly, this is the one you want...while they are all terrible in their own unique way, Pat's is the least-worst mix of terrible-ness. 

They all have awful meat and bread, but for some reason's Pats is just a bit better...its kinda like that episode of The Simpsons where Mr. Burns had every disease on the planet, and they somehow balanced eachother out so he didn't die. That's Pat's. Show up drunk, get your Whiz wit, and just dive in. Just make sure you go to a better place before you leave town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
5stars.     
     I ordered a steak with cheese whiz and there was no waiting. Just order and go. 
   My first bite into the steak was very juicy and tender the cheez wasn't too cheesy and the steak was cooked to perfection
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to go the tourist route and get a cheese streak while in Philly. The hype is well deserved. I loved the sandwich and I'm not a cheese whiz fan but I didn't want to alter the meal. I was not disappointed at all. The food was good, service was quick, price was reasonable and I left there stuffed. I had a mushroom cheese steak and a bottle of water because it was a hot day. I'll try the fries next time because I plan to go back with no hesitation. The area was clean, parking is a challenge but if u get off the beaten path and park in the residential area and walk a block or two you'll be fine. Car was safe no issues or alarming concerns. I love the way both legendary restaurants are in the same area and they are both prosperous. A little friendly competition goes a long way and they have it down to an art. Just think they need to accept credit and debit cards in this day and age. The sandwich was $12 and that's a reasonable amount to use a card for your purchase.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Okay, so this place is pretty famous and is well recommended to tourists and people wanting to try Philly Cheesesteaks.
These were the reasons why I visited here the two times I have been in Philly.
So there is a tradition to this place... but that about it for me. I have had better cheese  steaks in local joints in CA, NJ, and AZ and the service was all better than here. Yes, I understand this place isn't a sit-down restaurant and is more of a quick eat and leave place, but the people who work here are rude at times. 
Not bad steaks, but definitely does not live up to the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not sure why this is on here as my "next review awaits"

I have to take 1 star because 0 start is not an option.

I have never checked in here, nor will I. 

Pats/Genos is nothing than tourist food slop. 

Wiz does NOT belong on a cheese steak.

A cheese steak should NOT cost $9

These places have the greesy, most disgusting steaks around. You get a better cheese steak at most pizza places. Talk of the Town, on Broad St, under the 76 bridge. Go there, and you can get a Choc Shake as well. And on seeded rolls.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't suggest this place. I respect its history and decor but that is about it. While business is great for the owners... the quality almost inevitably goes down because of the volume and concern to save money. Also this is now a tourist trap and I Probally won't ever go here again. There are way to many local spots within driving distance to go and not wait on a line for a skimped cheese steak. You want a history lesson and bragging rights to say you ate here definitely go and take the infamous picture ... you want a real cheesesteak go deeper in south philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Terrible customer service, they treat you like a number, no manners, food has no taste, 5$ cups of fries 5$ soda... never coming back
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We chose Pat's over Geno's due to the other establishment posting racist signs at their business. Regardless of which tastes better, Pat's will always be the right choice because of that.

But, I'm going to assume Pat's does tastes better because it's hard to beat. About an hour in line on a Sunday evening, which was honestly, less than we expected. We kept an eye on the flow of people eating and leaving their tables and I sat to grab one toward the end of the line while my friends placed our orders.

I went for the provolone and my sandwich was perfection. Everyone else chose cheese wiz, which made it a watery mess, but was still wonderful and allowed us to dip our fries in all the run-off. (It sounds gross, but don't knock it, you know.) The sandwiches were not as big as I expected given the hype, so I'd recommend planning to eat at least a half order of fries, too.

Parking was also not nearly as bad as we expected. We parked off in the residential neighborhood nearby less than a 5 minute walk away. 

I'd certainly eat here again. Yummmm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tried the cheesesteak with onions and 3 different kind of cheese in it. One word: scrumptious!!!!!
The end.....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been to both Geno's and Pat's. They both tasted...kinda the same. I was told that the locals in Philly like Pat's better.  The good thing about the two is that they are both opened late so that is where we headed after a night of drinking at the bars.

I'd recommend Fat's Sandwich over at Rutgers if you get the chance. They are about 5000 calories per sandwich...but well worth it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered cheese fries, wouldn't let me put the cheese for the fries on the side instead of doused on top because the wife doesn't do cheese fries. Won't customize for anything expect to pay for a second order if you want it special
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Being first time in Philly and only sampled three steak shops, Pat's King of Steaks is the king of cheesesteak. We went to Pat's and Geno's specifically to see who is truly has the best cheesesteak sandwich. I ordered the same for the two restaurants: wit wiz, onions, mushroom. I first tried Pat's and then later, also tried half of Geno's
I could discern the difference.

It took me later after we were back to our Airbnb that I felt Pat's is ahead. I took a bite of Pat's then immediately took a bite of Geno's:

-Geno's has bigger (portion) meat and bigger bun. But the bigger bun I am afraid takes some away from the meat. Pat's thinner bun is 'collapsible' and compliments the beef better.
-Pat's chopped beef (along with my extras) tasted better than Geno's. It is truly indiscernible if you finish one sandwich after the other. But eaten alternately, the difference is very much present with Pat's flavor and taste moving ahead. 
-French Fries is moot as both are mediocre at best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My friends and I road-tripped up to NYC from Baltimore, and decided to detour to Philly for dinner. Naturally, since I've never tried a Philly cheesesteak, it was only logical to try one at the original restaurant!

We got two cheesesteaks with cheese whiz, for $10 each. There was virtually no line when we went, and they pretty much handed over the sandwich a minute (maybe less) after the order went in since all the components were pre-made. 

Original or not, I thought the food itself was pretty mediocre. The bread tasted quite processed (oddly chewy), the meat was a bit fatty and dry, and it's kind of hard to mess up cheese whiz. I liked how they had a pickle bar on the side, but did not like how they didn't have utensils (wanted to try cutting the sandwich in half). 

Especially with the $10 price tag, I don't think this is ever a place I'd go out of my way to return to. But it was cool to be able to say that I've eaten at THE original Philly cheesesteak restaurant. I think one day I'll try Gino's across the street as a point of comparison, but that'll be for another day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was the first person in The United States to Order from Pat's King of Steaks through Goldbelly.com I Love Pat's King of Steak they are without a doubt The Best on the Planet!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Found myself in the area this past weekend, and although the bright lights from Geno's was calling me, we decided to try Pat's instead. 
Got the normal philly cheesesteak w/cheese wiz... it' was alright. Nothing spectacular, but also could be that I am not a fan of meaty sammiches. My sister's bf that I was with, who LIVES for sammiches, devoured the whole thing in no time. It passed in his book.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
hmm i wonder why only 3 stars. maybe cuz it's a lot of pressure to order the right way and the people aren't the nicest

BUT... i mean... you gotta go expecting the right things... and a friendly pleasant service is NOT one of them. just keep it chill, order a cheesesteak (WHIZ WIT! the best) and then move on. 

the meat and bread are delicious. get those peppers too!

i like this more than geno's. geno's is a bit "cleaner" with their cheesesteak, but pat's does it better. 
if you are with your friends and wanna try both, eat one then go to the other one. don't try to bring one to the other place and eat together. both pat's or geno's will yell at you and try to kill you. 



cash only. parking can be tough. 


best cheesesteak in philly = dalessandro's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I visited Philly and decided to buy a cheesesteak with my dad. So we went to this joint. A few hours later, my father and I begin to feel incredibly nauseous, weak -just horrible. We made our way back home and the symptoms began to get worse and we were miserable. Night comes and then the FOOD POISONING hits us. We threw up violently multiple times, experienced bad bowel movements, had the chills, and just overall pain- even our fingers hurt. FOR  DAYS STRAIGHT. We know that this place poisoned us because we had not eaten anything before or after. DO NOT GO HERE- the food is definitely dangerous and not consumable. The meat was most likely tainted or undercooked, please do not come here and spare yourself the chance of experiencing the horrors we did. This seriously should be reported to the health inspector! Not only this, but the place was dirty and unsanitary, and everything was overpriced.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love the cheese steaks but very expensive. Know your order before you get to the front of the line because they do not wait for you. Food was great though my whole family enjoyed our trip here. The lines seem long but they move quickly and the tables turnover quickly as well so you do have a chance at finding a table.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Got our cheesesteak with whiz super quick!  The meat tasted boiled and the cheese whiz congealed quick.  This was the only place that didn't cut our cheesesteak.  Not bad but not sure I'd come back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I can't say I'm a cheesesteak conneisseur, so take this review with a grain of salt.  What I can say is that I rediscovered my love of Cheez Wiz.  I ordered the mushroom cheesesteak with onions & Cheez Wiz (I think I was supposed to say "mushroom Wiz wit" but I completely screwed that up).

Good, solid food.  My friends said that they preferred Geno's for their softer bread & tastier onions.  I was too full to try both.

Did I mention Cheez Wiz is awesome?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Born and raised here, and never had a cheesesteak. Shocker! Then why am I bothering to review? 

We were already over this way, and I remember we chose Pat's because the line was shorter at the time. This place was a bit more gloomy in appearance, while the bright colorful lights of Geno's across the way beckoned. However, who cares what the outside looks like, we're here to talk food. 

I DID order fries, and they were damn good. Since it was past 1am, all the freaks were out, which made an accommodating sideshow to the dining experience. You couldn't turn around without having someone in Eagles gear within your view.* 

All the girls who had cheesesteaks (we actually eat meat over on this coast) were satisfied, and I don't believe it was because they were more than partially inebriated. One had the your basic cheesesteak, while 2 tried out the pizza steak (this one looked really good to me), and another tried the mushroom pepper steak. There are plenty of choices for veteran cheesesteak eaters and then the simple choices for the newbies. I guess I went for the remedial since I only had those fries, but for some reason, they were memorable. Everyone-even a couple of the freaks-helped themselves, but I didn't mind one bit.  

Thankfully, no fights occurred while we were there, and as for that shorter line, it was 'street-long' as we went skipping back to our cars.

*NOT saying everyone who wears Eagles gear is a freak...stress on 'every'...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Dry meat, hard bun and not enough steak in the bun.  Maybe if they took a little more time making the sandwich it would taste better, I'm just saying! Go to Ishkabibble's instead!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm basically writing the same review for Pat's as I am for Geno's because they're basically the same restaurant.  Only the photos are different.  What's more, I was fairly unimpressed with either place.

I was introduced to Pat's and Geno's in Rick Sebak's 2002 PBS documentary, Sandwiches That You Will Like.  Well, the cheesesteak at these two places I can't really say I liked.

I had a "provolone wit" (i.e., cheesesteak sandwich with provolone cheese and grilled onions).  The bread was stale and the cheese not melted.  Frankly, I've had better cheesesteaks at the mall in Albuquerque (seriously!).  For a better cheesesteak in the Philly area, try Dalessandro's.  Or skip the cheesesteak and get a fantastic hoagie at Primo's!!! .... Maybe I should've had it with whiz.

Of all the Rick Sebak documented sandwiches, Pat's and Geno's have been the only disappointments as of yet.  Still, these are both institutions in their own right, so I'm glad I came --- only because now I can say I've been here.

Oh, and be prepared for ridiculously long lines and a long walk to find parking.  There is no indoor seating.  Tables outside only (if you can find a free table).  Also (and I don't mean this as a criticism) if you're not from the area, you may perceive employees' manner as rude.  It really isn't.  It's just part of the South Philly 'tude.  Just roll wit it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Its a tourist trap. Every true blue Philly resident knows where to go
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I took a big leap of faith and trusted my fellow yelpers to try this place out with MY BOSS - but it was a hit. All of us loved the cheese steak and definitely get the whiz on top - don't worry about the calories, that's not the kind of place to be thinking such horrible thoughts :)
It's a cool place to just stand and eat, I like that kind of casual dining when traveling or on the way back to the airport.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Service was terrible! Rude staff who made my steak wrong when I ordered and wouldn't remake it after I called them on their mistake, "it's already made" they said! I asked for provolone and got whiz...that's a huge mistake! Customer service gone terribly wrong! I'm sad Leo's is currently out of service, now there are no places for a genuine Philly cheesesteak :(
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is the same review as what I gave for Geno's. We stopped by and got one from each Pat's and Geno's.

Long story short: If you gave me sliced beef, cheese, and some long bread, I can make a cheesesteak as good as Pat's. I'm not kidding at all.

There are some basic, simple foods that various restaurants have proclaimed to have the "best" or "original" and, whenever I have tried, I have responded with a big "meh". The reality is the gap between "good" and "world's best" for relatively simple foods like burgers, cheesesteaks, ramen, grilled cheese sandwich, mac and cheese, etc. is just not that huge.

Sure, someone can use USDA prime aged ribeye for the sliced meat in their cheesesteak and it would be better, but why would you slice $15-20/lb prime aged ribeye to use in a cheesesteak? Why wouldn't you eat it as a ribeye steak? Likewise, you can use prime aged ribeye ground up for a burger, but what kind of nutbag would you be to do that?

As another reviewer noted, the generic cheesesteak chain you see in the food courts offer cheesesteak that's as good as Pat's, and maybe better in many cases. Don't buy the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went today and it was awful.  I don't remember this place being that bad.  If this place was located in any other city it would be out of business.  Dry meat, absolutely nothing special. Sorry....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
She Said...." Definitely the best cheese steak I've ever had. I don't think I will be able to order a cheese steak in MD or any other state. If you go here just be ready to know what you want, or else they will pass over you. They have the cheese wiz which is amazing and real steak, not the stringy fake steak. The fries are really good too. We will def make a pit stop here again...only problem was they didn't have coke but we went across the street to their competition Geno's to get a coke, we might have to try that place too."

He Said...."So this place was really, really good. The best cheese steak I've ever had. They quick and efficient with the ordering so be prepared. I had a cheese whiz with onions and its was really good, I had the juices of the cheese steak dripping down to the paper wrapping, that's when you know its done right. I like how you order the drinks and fries in the second window, so that those tourists don't get in the way of regular people. Now driving to this place was interesting; it looked like a trash truck emptied their trash in the middle of the street.
