Onto the other things, just like everyone else mentioned parking can be difficult. Fries are OK. Area smells like urine...This place did not amaze me one bit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had came to philly just to eat at Pat's. It was unfortunately not as delicious as I was expecting. Overall I had felt like the sandwich was missing something and the ingredients did not combine as well as it looks. I had gotten the pepper steak with mushrooms. There was barely any mushrooms and I barely tasted any pepper. Overall if I would come to philly I would want to try a different place to see if I was right about my critique.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here super excited to get an original Philly Cheesesteak to recieve a lukewarm Cheesesteak with unmelted cheese and what was undoubtedly canned mushrooms.  Not impressed at all, something must of gone wrong that is definitely not the Cheesesteak I was expecting.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: had it years ago .  fun characters behind the counter, got mine wit  and it was really good , may never be a fan of philly but the cheesesteak rules
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Going to Philadelphia for the first time, you had to try the two biggest philly cheese steak rivals so I did. Pats vs Geno's. I personally prefer Pat's, the meat was more moist, it was diced, and the wiz was a good consistency. For a super popular tourist spot, the line moved very quickly, it only took about 30 seconds for them to make my sandwhich. They had a little sign with instructions on how to order for "rookies" which I thought was funny. 3 stars because I do feel like this place is over hyped.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I went here with the same reverence I have for Nathan's on Coney Island - a legend. But maybe I just don't 'get' Philly cheesesteaks in general. This was my first time having a cheesesteak - I may have been expecting something like a gyro or Turkish street food - but it was too oily and kind of bland. Still, I enjoyed the scene.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Think it's crazy people gave this anything below 4 stars. This should be (may be) a national landmark! Great cheesesteak that all cheesesteaks should be compared to. We went and had a pats and Genos, preferred the Genos but not because the pats wasn't amazing. I recommend a double taste test as we did!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We should have listened to our Lyft driver and skipped this place. The cheesesteaks were flavorless and the meat was tough and chewy. The cheese fries were over salted.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was there today. I guess you have try it at least once and this was my first. Overpriced as any other tourist trap so that was not a surprise.
The cheesesteak is not bad, but nothing special. The beef is mostly bland and chewy, but if you add some salt and ketchup is not bad. Bread is decent.

By the way, they have the process down to a science. It literally took 10 seconds between order and getting two cheesesteaks. These folks make a true fortune judging by the line. Not easy to get a table when its busy.
If you have not tried it i guess you should get it out of your system, but i've had cheesesteaks which where way better than this place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Super disappointed. After coming out from California and hearing that pats and genos were the best cheesesteaks ever I was super excited to try both out. I had  to make the decision myself. While I do think pats was better I can't say it's the best cheesesteak I've ever had. The bread was stale, meat and cheese were sparse, and the overall taste was pretty bland. I'm happy I tried both places but I will never come back! :/
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We were hoping to try several different Philly cheesesteak sandwiches while we were in the area. But we didn't get the chance to go, so we decided we had to try the originator of the Philly cheesesteak. Because Other people seem to say that Geno's was just as good if not better, we decided to try both, Especially because they were across the street from each other. I must say that the guy at Geno's was awesome, friendly and even gave us souvenir pens :), but the meat from Geno's was a bit tougher and drier, and less flavorful :(. Not sure if they may have added less cheese whiz? Whereas pats  seemed to have better meat and was tastier. We got the Philly cheesesteak with onions and cheese whiz at both places because it seemed like the reviews said that cheese whiz was traditional. It definitely was delicious and i suggest getting it w cheese whiz. We ended up getting a couple of more sandwiches from Pats and even got some for the plane ride home the next day. We were afraid that the cheesesteak sandwiches would get soggy for the plane ride. But even cold and sitting for hours, it was almost as tasty as it was fresh and not soggy at all. They were not stingy on the meat. The only thing is that it is a bit pricey. Of course it was sooo much better than the Bay Area cheesesteak factory ones I'm used to and the ones in restaurants. 

We came around 730 and there was no line, got the sandwiches immediately! Warning: parking is pretty limited (tight spots and it's a busy location.) but thankfully we ended up getting one right in front as people quickly got their sandwiches and left.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Very basic cheese steak. My wife and I came down for the "famous Philadelphia cheesesteaks". This place is extremely famous at least in the immediate area. We were disappointed in this place and the place across the street. First and foremost you never put cheese whiz on a steak sub, that is just plan lazy! It just tastes terrible and when it cools it turns into glue ABSOLUTELY terrible!!!!
I'm in complete shock these places are famous for their cheesesteaks. There are plenty of places in the Philadelphia area that have much much better cheesesteak subs.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Where should I begin.. should it be on the burnt onions that were so burnt they were bitter or the giant unchopped pieces of steak that fell out everytime I took a bite, I felt like I was having a steakems. I've been coming here for years and the last couple of times I've come they have all been disappointments. The meat can be so fatty at times all you feel is a mouth full of gristle. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone until they get their shit together.  The fries are still great that hasn't changed YET.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's wasn't bad at all. Not the greatest, but not the worst either. Service was fast and efficient. Friendly service and food was good. I tried both Pats and Geno's and I don't think one is any better than the other. Geno's meat I think was better, but I like Pat's whiz much better. Geno's was too salty. I did enjoy both places very much.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Philadelphia in 2010 and love that city. Had to come and try both Pat's and Geno's Steaks. Pat's the one, the meat was better and over all you can taste everything and not just the chesse as Geno covers the whole thing in, so you don't know the meat has no flavor.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As I sit here watching game 2 of the Phillies/Rockies NLDS series I think back fondly of trips to Pat's. I like Pat's better than I ever would Geno's if only on the fact that I would never spend any of my money at a place that's boasts about serving "Freedom Fries". I mean, hello, welcome to 2003. Also if you have to distract people with bright Vegas lights and all kinds of shiny signs you must be hiding something. I know, I've heard Pat's and Geno's are basically the same thing but whatever, this aggression will not stand, man. I usually order one wit Whiz. Some people may be grossed out by Cheez Whiz but for me it's a cheesy salty treat. The real star of the show is the bread, wow is it good, and fresh. The line can be long sometimes but it moves mainly because of the ordering system. 1-0 Rockies in the 2nd.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's beats Geno's.
Hands down.

That being said, my most recent trip to Pat's was not as memorable as my first trip, now that I have had a fair bit of experience in the wide world of cheesesteaks.

Don't get me wrong, you gotta give respect where respect is due! 
Pat's is the originator, right? Pat's is the standard by which all other cheesesteaks should be held. And it is the best place for every "beginner" to start. You will probably find better steaks in other places in the city, but this one is guaranteed to still be damn good and give you a starting point for what to expect when you're talking cheesesteak.

"Whiz wit" is the only way to go. Actually, scratch that; I have never tried American at Pat's (so I can't say for sure), but whiz is so much better than provolone, that I cannot imagine a better alternative. But in my opinion, no matter what, you HAVE to get it "wit" onions. Delicious.

Not only does the STYLE of the cheesesteak at Pat's create an important compass for the cheesesteak virgin, but it also is the process of ordering that is a necessary experience. The workers are still the real deal, unphased by hype or tourism. They're just there to crank out the steaks.

My biggest "dropped star" in this review is the price. I don't MIND paying $9.50 for a cheesesteak, but maybe because just a couple days before, I got a better cheesesteak for almost half the price, I have become slightly embittered. It's not that I don't love Pat's, or that I can't pay the price, I just can't see myself needing to come back here again after finding more fortunate chartered waters elsewhere. 
But I can't imagine a more deserving place for me to write my 100th Yelp review.

Thank you Pat's. You have mentored this padawan well, and I will never forget all that I have learned from you ...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overpriced.  It is a tourist trap.  I would recommend trying out other cheese steak joints in Philly.  The less famous ones are often better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: sorry. it's fuckin gross. inferior cow flesh and chemical cheese. yeah yum.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteak was done in 10 seconds, meaning it was clearly OLD and tasted the same. workers were rude when asked simple questions about the menu. Way over priced for trash food!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came to Philly to try Genos and Pat's to see who was the king of ring. The winner on my book is Pats. Pats steaks had more much flavor. However, I don't think they are the king of the steaks @raulvsfood
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I don't understand why people coming to this place to eat
The employees are rude and obnoxious. They have no patience and care about their guest.
And yet, people lining up to eat their cheese steak.
This place is a tourist place and only tourist eat here.
The cheese steak is dry and has no any flavor.
I think the cheese steak is over price for 6" long cheese steak.
Will I go the again? No way !!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So usually is obviously everyone's heard of Geno's and Pat's right across the street from each other in Philadelphia. We got a sandwich from each. There is a night and day difference in the sandwich the line and the staff. Geno's has a much shorter line about half the size but its employees are tremendously nice and courteous. The sandwich wasn't as good nor did it have the same amount of meat and cheese as Pat's. The Pat's line is much longer than Geno's and it moves really slowly while Gino's lines moves really quickly they have someone doing each job. The staff are just rude I guess I could say that's kind of typical for Philadelphia a place that throws snowballs and boo Santa and their sports teams constantly. The sandwich however was definitely Superior for more meat a lot more cheese and tons of nicely grilled peppers and onions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Genos, but Oakland's cheese steaks are better! If your ever in oakland, find Mills Hoagies. About $7 will get u a hoagie, steak fries, and a drink. Pats n Genos had the nerve to charge $15 - $17 got all of that!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I actually tried both and Pat's was the best. The bread was fresher, the meat was moist, the whiz was gooey.  oh, and can't forget the peppers for a little tang!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Three o'clock in the morning may not be an ideal time to make judgements on anything let alone a cheesesteak, but this was actually my second time there so I'm going to anyways.
The Pats steak is average at best. Kind of dry. Not all that much meat. Can't beat the entertainment though. The topless transexual singing "with or without you" bought them an extra star. 
All in all if you're out in the middle of the night and nothing else is open then go for it. Otherwise hit up Tony Luke's instead.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very Small Greasy cheese steaks. If you live in philly you don't eat here. This is a tourist trap
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap. over priced chewy rubber. everyone in philly knows how awful this is. the only reason they're still in business is from one time tourist patrons.  a disgrace to Philadelphia & cheesesteaks all over, do ur self a favor & don't
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You need to know how to order when you get to Pat's.  They even have some guidelines to help you (see pic).  Originally, I was going to go try Jim's Steak but when we drove by, the line was just insanely wrapped around the block.  We decided to go with another recommendation from a local so headed to Pat's.  There was also a line but bearable.  It's speedy and the staff counts on you to know what you want before you get up to the window to order.  "With or without" (onioins) and what type of cheese.... and any other toppings.  They have one window/line for the philly cheese steak and another for fries and sodas.  The hot peppers are free but I only tried a bite of one and couldn't handle the heat so left it alone.  

The philly cheese steak sandwich was huge! Luckily I was just sharing one.  The bread loaf was soft and the steak cut was thin, small slices of juicy tenderness.  There were some diced caramelized onions and of course a bit of melty provolone.  Their fresh cut fries were nice and not too starchy tasting.  There was no room to sit on the benches so we stood across the street with other cheese steak customers and ate there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The SETTING: One (1) visit to each Geno's and Pat's during a weekend stayover in Philly.

The VIBE: 1.5 Stars (Pat's) and 3 Stars (Geno's) - The weather was overcast, so I'm guessing sunny weather would have made the covered patio seating (although extremely old and uncomfortable tables/benches) more appealing.  Geno's has a slightly fancier and cleaner vibe, but nothing special.

The SERVICE: 2.5 Stars - Obviously it's Philly and these places are kind of legendary tourist spots that aren't desperate for my business.  Nonetheless, I was still surprised at the rudeness since I stood out of line and patiently researched beforehand in order to not ask "rookie" questions.  The food was ready very quickly, almost too quick for me to question the freshness.

The FOOD:  2.5 Stars (Pat's) and 2 Stars (Geno's) - Obviously both were underwhelming.  Pat's had the slight edge because I liked the Provolone instead of the CheezWhiz but in both cases, the meat was drier than expected and the bread didn't seem fresh.

The Bottom Line - A disappointing result that was more bucket list than anything else, I now regret passing up on Jim's, which all of my foodie friends recommended.  There's always next visit to downtown...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
same as Geno's .. tourist trap..  Go to Steve's !!!!!  

These two are not bad, but definitely not the best...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheese whiz is the way to go!  Line can be long, but it goes fast. Be prepared to stand and eat as seating is limited.  Make sure you know how to order before get to the window!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As usual, a great steak. Customer service was extremely friendly and I would never betray this restaurant to go across the street!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The first time I ever went to Pats I wasn't even hungry but once I took a bite of my first Philly cheesesteak I was in heaven! I finished the entire thing! They also have amazing cheese fries! Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is really a tourist spot more than anything else.  It's not that there's anything especially wrong with being a tourist spot, but Pat's is not someplace to go for a special meal.  Most people want to compare it to Geno's, which is another tourist spot.  Comparatively, Pat's has better bread, the meat and cheese are the same, and Pat's fries are not as good.  They offer the basics: cheesesteak, pizzasteak, fries, etc.  
If you are visiting Philadelphia and you're in the Italian market, I say go for the experience.  You're not going to get a sandwich made with any heart or soul, but you can say you did it.  If you're not in the Italian Market area, it's not worth the drive.
Please keep in mind, Pat's and Geno's (and most of the italian Market) are all Cash Only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Obv you can't go wrong with Pat's! Pretty good cheesesteak, (though Steve's is still better in my opinion) Wiz without!!! Love the sliced beef and the wiz is obviously amazing. A bit over priced, but there's something to be said that you're going to the most well known cheesesteak spot in Philadelphia. Go when it's freezing out or at off hours so that you don't have to wait in an insanely long line.. Also, make sure you get the Cherry Soda, goes nice with that delish sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had a good experience here. And the sandwich does not stand out as an amazing one... but rather the entire trip out to Pats, waiting in line, and grubbing with my family in the street. There are better steak sandwiches in the city... but I guess everyone has to try for either a Pat or Geno's sandwich and keep the rivaled story alive.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheese steaks! Drive to Philly just to try the whiz with! :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Much better than the flashy geno's. They had better bread and there was more cheese whiz to enjoy. I like how they poured the cheese whiz all over the steak and not just on the bun.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I lived in Philadelphia for about 7 years, and only came here a handful of times.  However, I returned this year, after moving to the West Coast and decided to partake in a head to head competition of Pat's versus Geno's.  

We ordered a steak sandwich from each, identical wit Wiz and Onions, and then split each one in half and shared.

We agreed that we enjoyed Pat's just a bit better.  Both had redeeming qualities; however, we thought that Pat's flavor profile was just a bit better than Geno's.  

Our opinion; however, both produced a quality steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: food was good. unfortunately i am not a cheesesteak connoisseur but it was pretty good. staff was super friendly and fast as hell.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's certainly ain't all that and a bag of chipes (as the Brits would say).  After waiting in line for about 10 minutes, we ordered a couple of provie wits (onions) and fries.

The steak sandwiches were okay, but definitely not worth all the buzz. They were served luke warm and so were the fries. I will say that the bread was soft and fresh and the grilled onions definitely added a little something something to the sandwich.

But let's put it this way.  A box of Steak-Ums and some grocery rolls would give this joint a run for its money.  And you can take dat to the bank, wit or witout cheese ... as they'd say at this shack.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have gone here probably 6 times over the last 10 years never had a good experience here. I have had better ones at Geno's but not by much. The bread is better at Geno's and i prefer where Geno's slaps the Cheese on. 

I use to find the attitude of the workers there funny but not any more since they are are charging $8-10 for a plain cheese steak. And even if you don't want fried onions you will get some on your sub. These people either need to lower their prices or be friendlier. 

The sad thing is i can get better more consistant cheesesteaks at the mall I live near, which serves them consistently hot and with better cheeses. I would say that even a cheese steak without cheese from a mall place, would taste better then a cheesesteak from either of Pats or Genos with everything on it. 
If it is day time and you have option go to Jims on South Street or Wendy's or any where else $8 is too much money for either of those cheesesteaks and the wait in line is insane. Go  to a restaurant and spend $12 and tip you will be more satisfaction from that then going and getting one of these greasy cheesesteaks with slimy cheese and soggy bread.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went here yesterday for the first time. The line was long but moved quickly. Had a philly steak with onions and provolone. Delicious. The cheesesteaks are $11 each. Ordered fries at the next stand. $5 for a cup is too much in my opinion. They didn't even taste that great. Didn't like that they only accept cash.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Beat the Geno man by one half of a  star. I guess it comes down to the cheese for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have always been a fan of Pats, but I got really annoyed this past week when I was there because of the rudeness of an employee.  There is a woman who works the Drink/Fry window with black hair who is absolutely rude.  A young man ordered Cheese Fries in front of me, and she gave him a sprite.  When he told her that he did not order a sprite but rather cheese fries, she yelled at him and told him that he ordered a sprite and don't accuse her of lying.  I jumped in because he absolutely ordered cheese fries.  She was so rude and a low life.  Come on Pats, I know you have a reputation for being tough, but it is part of your allure.  But this miserable lady was completely out of line and would be better off cleaning  tables outside of your store rather than being in it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This (along with Geno's) is probably the biggest food related tourist trap in all of America. The cheesesteak is truly a great American invention, and without a doubt both establishments must have had great cheesesteaks back in the day, but this is no longer the case.

The line is long, but thankfully it moves very quickly. The ordering system is refined down to a science here to increase efficiency, which I appreciate, but at the same time it just goes to show how they only care about maximizing revenue and the amount of sandwiches sold without great care to the quality itself. The bread was overly soft like for babies to chew better, and the meat was tough and dry. The cheese was alright, but nothing interesting.

Not accepting credit in this day and age is also pretty annoying for many people, and just shows how cheap management is if they won't install a credit reader. They already have such a high turnover and are even open 24/7, so not being able to process credit is a bit strange to say the least.

I like visiting Philly, and I think it's one of the greatest sandwich cities ever, but don't let Pat's and Geno's be a representation of that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'll start off by saying that coming to pat's for a cheesesteak isn't supposed to be some fancy gourmet experience. But with that being said.... if I have a craving for a cheesesteak, pat's ALWAYS hits the spot. The bread is just right it holds everything together and soaks up the cheese perfectly. Between this and the competition across the street (geno's), pat's wins hands down
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3 stars for the nostalgia element and the whiz.  

Otherwise, I've had better cheesesteaks just about everywhere else I've had one.  Notably: Carl's Steaks in NYC = YUM
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Drove over an hour to get there yesterday, only to be disappointed.  The cheese steak was ok, but the reason I won't go back is because the service was awful. The guy who took my order was so rude, I was blown away. A big turn off.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Slightly better than Geno's in my opinion.  This is because this version had more meat for the same price.  However, hugely disappointed in how bland cheesesteaks taste.  I regret not going on Yelp and finding a joint that it known for something that more flavor and dimension for the same price.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap, don't do it. I grew up in South Philly and even as a kid I wasn't impressed by these cheesesteaks. Not to mention the price for a "whiz-wit" has doubled in the last 10 years.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I avoided this place like the plague, but I just had to check it out when a friend was visiting because of god knows why.

I'm going to go back to avoiding this place like the plague. It's crap. don't go here. Yes, I'm going to use this same review for the place across the street, because they both suck.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Don't bother going! Steak was bland, tasteless and extremely fatty! From Chicago and didn't know how to order their way and they were extremely rude and ignorant! Go to GENO'S, the steaks are better and so is the service!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's Vs. Geno's is always the game for tourists when visiting Philly and I was no different. If you have already read my review of Geno's you could gather unless I'm half goat I was not impressed with the "cardboard with cheese" I had there... so to save you the suspense... Pat's wins in the one on one showdown of the tourist traps.

I went to Pat's second of the two, yes I was drawn to all the pretty colors at Genos and after eating there I figured out why they were needed to attract business.

Pat's service is mixed, the interactions with their staff and reading some of there signs can be taken as witty or rude. I guess you just need to have a sense of humor to enjoy their customer service, and afterall people are coming there for a show, i just dont know if they figured out comedy isn't their specialty.

Now on to the food... well it was not the best I have ever had but it was leaps and bounds over Geno's. To start it tasted like meat and not cardboard, I didn't need a small bucket to catch the grease and most importantly the word "steak-umm" never entered my mind.

It was good, was it worth $9, no, I'd say a fiver would be fair, maybe a six if you throw them a buck for the poor comedy routines. 

Its a slight improvemet over Wawa, but hey if your main compeition is Geno's I can see the lack of motivation to truly be the king of steaks.

Another good point is that Pat's is always open, so when you have that 3am craving, they will be there to satisfy it. Outside of vampire hours though you may want to find a 4 or 5 star cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have never had an authentic chilly pheesesteak before in my life.  So my first night in Philly, had the option of either Geno's or Pats.  We went with Pats.  The bread was real tough, i'm not sure if that is normal of a cheesesteak but it tasted real gamey.  

The meat was delicious and I loved the chilly peppers.  It was just the hard bread that made it a bit difficult for me to give it 4 stars.  Nonetheless, not a bad experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As an out of towner, I was excited to try both Pat's and Geno's. Man was I let down . We've all seen them on tv and we all come here to put our 2 cents in this "Best Philly Cheesesteak" war. Well, I'll say this, out of these 2, Pat's was better. That's not saying much cuz it was very underwhelming. The bread was nice and buttery but the meat was bland and the cheese (I ordered it with provolone) was almost nonexistent. We did add mushrooms and peppers but even then that didn't help much. The Philly cheesesteak at the chain Jersey Mike's is way more delicious than this. Every Uber/Lyft driver told us not to go there, it's a tourist trap. Well, now I can at least say I came to Pat's and tried their sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Food and service is poor.  Cashier was extremely rude. It is not worth falling in line and being treated rudely by inconsiderate staff.  Not worth the money. This is a tourist trap. Definitely not coming back or recommending this place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is so overrated, long lines, and most importantly TERRIBLE SERVICE. The workers are so rude for no absolute reason. I asked where I could get a container to put the condiments in and the worker looked at me like I was stupid and said "what do you mean container" and so I asked "do I have to hold it in my hands then?" And he rudely handed me the ketchup containers I was looking for! Food is also pretty mediocre.  Bleh will not be returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We know now but ordering our first time was a rushed experience requiring you to keep an eye on which sandwich is which and only accepting cash. At least we knew that we wanted onions. I knew that the cheese-wiz was the best option but you can't tell people what they want, sometimes they just have to learn the hard way. There are peppers  if you want a complete experience, fries are not necessary. Just bring your own water or buy a drink.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
BEST CHEESESTEAK HANDS-DOWN. Classic, original, favorite.

The rivalry is like Coke vs. Pepsi. There is no competition for Coke.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Always a treat to stop by Pat's when I'm home for the holidays. Great cheesesteak, good price, no hassles, boom!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Fine, yelp, I'll write a review for Pat's.  Get off my back!

It's good.  

I'm a provolone wit' man myself.  Once, I ate a misteak: they accidentally put wiz and provolone on my sandwich.  That was the best.  

Cream soda, no fries, use the cherry peppers.  I won't judge you if you get more than one sandwich.

Geno's is bright and gaudy and stupid.  The only reason to eat at Geno's is so you don't have to look at it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Sorry to have to say this but I don't know what all the hype is all about. I've had better cheesesteak sandwiches elsewhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overrated artery clogger! Long lines for Cheese Steak in subpar bread. It looks like they don't even use different grills for non onions steak meat.

For some people, I am sure this is fine but by Odin, I am not down with the long lines for subpar food. To make matters worse, there is a separate window for Fries. Jeez, really? It is annoying as heck having to get over to another window just to order Fries. Someone needs to review that production line setup.

Last but most important. Come on people show a little more personality. You are representing the city of "Brotherly Love," act like it!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in Philly and trying cheesesteaks. Got one from here and one from Geno's. This was the clear winner, but I'm not a fan of the sandwich in general.
It's a fun, touristy experience and cool that you can eat them in the bar nearby. BYOC (bring your own cheesesteak!)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not sure why the mix reviews...maybe because I'm not a cheesesteak connoisseur but I really liked what I got. I got the cheesesteak with the wiz and the onions...soooo good! Simple, flavorful, and hot just all around great! $10 for a cheesesteak and $4 for small fries is kinda pricey in my book. Regardless I thought it was delicious and will definitely be back for more. PS. Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Went to Philly this weekend to see Syracuse get trounced by Villanova in Basketball. Waited in line for about forty minutes to get my first authentic Philly Cheesesteak and it was as good as I had hoped. 

Had mine with wiz and onions . Juicy and delicious.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Even though it's the original. We think it's too much of a hype. You can definitely get a better cheesesteak elsewhere in Philly. If you're not ready, go back of the line and start over. Also it's CASH ONLY!!! For people aren't from the area. Don't get us wrong. It's worth a try but we just think we can get something better with the price. 

Food: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Price worth: 2/5
Atmosphere/Vibe: 3/5
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not what they used to be. They charge high end prices for a mid range cheesesteak. Far from the best and it's shoty food.        

Sometimes it's good sometimes it's horrible . There are much better places that are consistently great. 

Trust me I'm tired of pats service and mediocre steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The first time I ate here, I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of meat on the cheesesteak and cheese fries are so good! Well I only ate a half of sandwich since I ate 2 chicken sandwiches from Chick-fil-a earlier. haha

The reason why it tastes so good, is the bread is fresh and so is the meat. And the cheese sauce just tastes so damn good.  

Well I like it so much I went back 2 more times while in Philly. Once you go there you get the hang of ordering. And I like the fact you get your food fast.  Like another yelper said, they are like the soup nazi, but if you know what you want and order it right, there are no issues.  I've yet to get sick from eating there, but every since coming back to Cali I've yet to eat anything called a Philly cheesesteak here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came here last December on the way back from Philly to Jersey City. Being from San Francisco, I was excited to grab a real philly cheese steak form Philadelphia. It was freezing cold for me, so I didn't get the chance to enjoy the outdoor dining experience. Don't expect immaculately clean quarters, it's not that type of spot, but it's authentic (to me) so kudos. The staff, don't expect  Hellos and Goodbyes. These people are in the business of cheese steaks and cheese steaks only.  Follow the ordering instructions and you should be fine.  On to the taste test, I had the philly cheese steak wit cheez wiz...it was pretty good and greasy. I expected it to be more tastier. I'm a hot sauce type of person so problem fixed. Maybe I'll try another combination next time. 

What I'm trying to say is, when you're mad starving and roaming the hood in Philly, a cheesesteak will definitely do you right.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I ordered from both Pat's and Geno's steak shops for dinner. Both the food and experience was good at both shops, but I liked Pat's better.

Before ordering, it is a good idea to look over the menus for options, and remember to say yes to onions!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tried it for the first time while visiting this week. Was really looking forward to it. 
Sandwich was not great & the meat was tough.  Geno's next time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I grew up on passyunk ave but Jesus christ... Pats gets more revolting every year. I probably visit pats once a year(and that's usually because friends enjoy it). I ate here less than 4 hours ago and our group of 4 AGAIN has stomach pain and/or diarrhea. My butt is on fire!! So disgusting!! DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR GALLBLADDER REMOVED!!! Instead of buying laxatives just eat a pats steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I moved to the East Coast, one of the first road trips I had planned was to drive to Philly just for cheese steaks.  Last weekend, I did just that. 

First, we sampled Pat's. Word to the wise: Pat's and Geno's are literally right across the street from each other. So you might as well try both if you're in the area.

I prefer Pat's cheese steak to Geno's, and here's why:
- The beef is thinly chopped. Not particular flavorful, but that's okay b/c the cheese whiz is where the real flavor is. 
- The onions are finely sliced, and you can barely tell they're in the sandwich. This gives the cheese steak a very subtle onion flavor, and quite the opposite of the "in y0 face" onion taste you'll find at Geno's. 
- Cheese Whiz is very cheesy. It's almost too sharp and over-powering. And, I almost wish that I had sampled the provolone instead. 
- The hoagie bread is longer and toastier on the outside, and softer on the inside than Geno's. 
- Less about marketing. Look at Geno's, and that flashing billboard makes you at first wonder if it's a strip club that actually belongs in Reno, NV. There are photos of celebrities everywhere posing with Joey Vento (RIP) and even the sandwich wrappers say Geno's "the best" 

All in all, it was a fun experience. The cheesesteak was good, but not something I would crave. I could definitely tell that Pat's and Geno's are targeted towards tourists and have been thriving on reputation for a long time. The cheesesteak was good, but nothing mind-blowing. And, compared to cheesesteaks I've had in California (yes-- I just did go there), there wasn't any distinction as to why one should come to Philly for the cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Very happy that my husband and I stopped by during our stay in Philly. The cheesesteak I had was delicious, although it could have been better had it had a bit more seasoning. The amount of meat and cheese was satisfactory and I also loved the fries, although they wouldn't give us a side a cheese vs the cheese being drizzled on the fries, which was a no-no for me, as I prefer crunchy fries dipped in sauce instead of eating them soggy.

I also didn't like that they only take cash, which is a bit inconvenient for some people, but thankfully there was a place across the street with an ATM. 

Overall, I think the place is okay. If I'm ever in the area again, I will probably go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steaks est une institution à Philadelphie, et sert ses sandwiches steak et fromage (cheddar fondu) depuis 70 ans ! De la vraie junk food, mais qu'on adore ! Après l'avoir goûté, j'en bavais encore !
Je vous conseille d'essayer, car c'est vraiment à faire !
Il y a des variations au Steak and Cheese, notamment le Steak & Cheese avec des champignons, ou avec du poivre. Le Steak pizza est à essayer également ! :)
Un régal :
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not as good as I remember as a kid growing up in Wilmington and coming to philly for pats once a month but still come by for a cheese steak (cheese wiz) whenever I'm in town for business religiously
Seems rushed through now
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Do what we did when we were in Philly we went to Pat's and Geno's. Both steak's are tasty. That is why both are still open and can be right across the street from one another.

But when you are online for Pat's you better know what to order. The line is long and the workers want you to move quickly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steaks was opened by brothers Pat & Harry Olivieri in 1930 and is credited to be the creator of Philadelphia's iconic cheesesteak that you know today. 

A little after 2 am on a Friday morning, my husband, our little girl dog and I decided to check out this place after eating half of our cheesesteak at Geno's. If you come here, I guess you might as well try both and see which you may like better. But I also highly recommend that you check out other cheesesteaks that are in this city to give you a better comparison on what is all the fuss about these sandwiches. 

Just like Geno's, this place is open 24 hours and is CASH ONLY. They also have outdoor, dog friendly seating. 

We ended up ordering: Steak With American Cheese, $10 after tax- The meat here is chopped instead of sliced at Geno's. Also the meat is seasoned, which to me is already a step up from Geno's. But they serve the onions raw (I prefer mine cooked) and Geno's cooks their onions. The  Italian roll used was pretty good but I thought this cheesesteak was average too. 

Please note that there is a sign that says to have your order ready when you get to the window. If you don't you should go back in line until you are ready. It isn't that hard to figure that out. Just let the employee know if you want onions, the type of sandwich and what kind of cheese. And wait for your order at the window. 

After the guy made his order, he left and sat down with his friend at a small table. The lady had his sandwich ready and seemed rather annoyed that he didn't pick it up. She just left it at the counter while we ordered at the window. We got our sandwich right away and eventually, that guy got up and got his sandwich. 

In the Rocky Movie, if you recall, the loan shark, Tony Gazzo brought Rocky to grab a bite to eat at Pat's. There is a plaque that is placed exactly where that happened, in case you movie buffs wanted to know that (and am sure you are also aware of the Rocky Statue and the steps from the movie he ran up at the Philadelphia Museum of Art). That is kind of neat to see while you are here. 

Overall, we were rather disappointed with both sandwiches from Pat's & Geno's. If you feel the same, be sure to try another cheesesteak place that is in this city and maybe you will change your mind about these sandwiches.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Enjoyed touring and searching for the best Philly Cheese Steak sandwich in Philadelphia.

We have toured 3 yes 3 locations and found our winner.   Dalessandro's steaks!  We enjoyed Pats as a strong 2nd and Geno's a good 3rd.  Wow we're full but what a fun afternoon!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bangin! If you're like me and you like your steak thinly sliced and in small pieces, then definitely go to Pat's! Cheese steak WIT (means with onions) get it, you won't regret it. You're welcome
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in Philly and first time having a Philly Steak. I got the ordering from my customer I was visiting so that was no issue. I'm not saying it was bad but I wasn't impressed. Good amount of meat and whiz but the meat was a little tuff and bland in my opinion. Service was nice. I also don't feel 9.50 for a sandwich is anywhere near fair. Thrown in a soda and a side of fries and that'd be a deal.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great to try if in Philadelphia. Good basic steaks. No frills fast and easy in and out. With all the hype and tourist experience it is a must see....but only once. Better steaks are across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Growing up my family was always a Geno's family so therefore i never had a Pat's steak until i was in college, i have to say their hate on this place was misguided as i actually prefer the chopped up nature of the meat to Geno's. However for the price, this place is just not worth it anymore. As a native of the area i really feel that these two establishments have become tourist lures, and while Pat's still hits the spot with the best of them, i cannot justify the price though. But if you are visiting Philly, and want to see the Italian market, this is the best Steak you can get without driving all over the city to to the local favorites.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
PAT's = Juicier, tastier meat, but the bread is way better at GENOS. Also, the hot sauce offered at GENOS is exceptional to spice up the steak and cannot even be compared with the hot sauce available at PAT's.

Can someone please open up a new store in between these two venus and call it PANOS or GET.

If someone was to ask me... Would you drive all the way to Philly just for a cheese steak? My answer would be yes.

$20 for tolls and $30 for gas and ($10 x 2 steaks, fries and soda = $30)

NET $80 for two philly cheese steak? Yes it's worth it.

Please note: There is no bathroom.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The fame of the Philly cheese steak led me into a conversation between a rivalry debate- which one is better? Pat's or Geno's?  

And Pat's definitely wins. 

Hopped over from Genos after a disappointed experience. With the wider selection here at Pat's, I ordered the American Mushroom WIT. The beef is juicier and more tender than Genos- yet for both cases the bun was never toasted.

and the bun was never toasted. 

never toasted. 

it sucked.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was told this was a tourist trap before I had to come to try it for myself. The cheesesteaks themselves are average at beast, the portion is pretty small. This place is just something to go to so you can post on your Instagram, not to have a GOOD cheesesteak IMO. 
On a side note parking and seating is absolutely horrible.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
MJ's Star : 3

Price : Cheese Steak Sandwich 7.50 (including tax)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cash only! Very fast. Limited street parking. Covered seating outside. Order sandwich and pay at one window- order and pay for fries and/or drink at another window. I got the steak, "wit", and whiz. The sandwich was outstanding. The steak was thick sliced and the cheese whiz melted into the sandwich in the best way possible. The assorted peppers at the condiment bar were a luxury I wasn't expecting. Loved everything about it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite! I love how they cook and slice up their steak.  They keep things simple. No flashing lights needed here. The focus on their product. The bread they use is amazing!!! Wiz Wit!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Is this place a tourist trap? Yeah, probably. But being a tourist, I have to stop by whenever I get the chance because I just love this place.

Very simple order "wit provy". When my wife and I went here we both had the same thing. I enjoyed it more than she did, but we both did love it.

We did go for a side of fries which can be improved upon.

If you're a tourist, you owe it to yourself to stop by. And keep in mind - it's cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats vs. Geno's?  Its like a Philidelphian's religion, you pick one and stick to it!  Never cross over to the other side!  My side.... PATS.

PATS... don't eat a mis-steak!   I love Pats.  Nothing beats 3am oozy "Whiz Wit" after an Eagles or Flyers game.  Better yet, get the "Heat Attack Wit" if you want all 3 cheeses w/ onions.   The line wraps around the building, but you still get your steak quick because the line moves so fast!  Why does the line move that fast?  1) Have your cash ready in hand.  2)  Cash Only  3) steaks are already cooking awaiting your order, they just slap it in the roll, add cheese, and you're done!  4) Get your soda & cheese fries in a different line.

Pats vs. Genos:  Its like a religion.  If you go to Pats, park near Pats.  If you go to Genos, park near Genos.  Once, I was in line at Pats, late night, and someone (alcohol involved I'm sure) love-tapped the car in front of them trying to parallel park.  The customers in line at Pats in front of me says to the driver "Its OK, the guy in that car went to Genos!"  So the driver, still in the car, says "Oh he did!?? In that case...."  SMASH!  He literally hit the gas pedal and rear-ended the car parallel parked in front of him on purpose!  It was the most entertaining line-wait I've ever experienced.  The entire line was cheering and clapping!

I once did a "Cheesesteak Challenge" with my friends.  We went to several cheesesteak shops around philly in one day, and ranked our favorites:
1.  Pats  -- Fast service, down home Philly attitude, lots and lots and lots of cheese whiz
1.  Tony Luke's  (tied 1st place) -- better steak quality, less gritty fat in the meat, but much longer wait time 
3.  Jims -- Good quality meat, fine shaven, but I asked for xtra cheese whiz, and still got less cheese than a normal steak at Pats.  Size of Jims steaks are smaller too.
X.  Genos -  N/A.  Never eaten here, never will!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was so excited about eating a Philly cheesesteak IN Philly.  Sadly, this place was only OK.  Maybe this is how it is supposed to taste? A friend of mine from Philadelphia claims that Pennsylvania food lacks flavor and seasoning.  As far as that goes, I've had better cheesesteaks with more flavor in Texas and California.  I ordered the steak with provolone, peppers and onions.  Maybe I went wrong in not ordering the cheez wiz? I just couldn't bring myself to do it.  I guess if you were raised on Pats then there is nothing better.  However, as an outsider, I can't quite understand why this flavorless sandwich cost me $10?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The Worst customer service I've received for my first time in Philadelphia. Don't get me wrong the food was alright but the fries lady gives the biggest attitude to serve you. This lady told me to go to the back of the line to get my fires when there was only one person on line and they were leaving. They even slam the food in front of you. They're not polite in any way I will not be returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You must be kidding.  This is what Philly calls the best cheese steak sub?
We waited in line for over an hour behind a huge crowd of drunk Flyers fans 
to try this mediocre food.  Fries were mush and tasteless.  The sub, which I got with "cheese whiz," had practically no taste and took hours to digest.
In Boston, where I live, any corner sub shop can make a better cheese steak sub than this place.  King of Steaks?  I guess in Philly they don't know any better.  Come to Boston for a really good sub.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I prefer pats over genos. Personally I think they both aren't great but if I had to choose it'd be pats the way they prepare the meat and it's texture rather then genos steak em style. Pats is juicy and normally steak is still warm to melt cheese a little. I've had better cheesesteaks from street vendors.

Cash only
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak was just okay. But the guys that worked there were complete assholes. Yelling at every customer. Was shocked. Won't be going to this place again but definitely want to try Geno's right across the street next time I'm in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You know what you're coming for when you go to Pat's or Geno's. The answer is usually not a superior cheese steak unlike any other. With those expectations in mind, I quite like Pat's provolone cheese steak. Perhaps I'm keeping it on the healthy side. I tried a similar steak at Geno's and that one was a bit too healthy tasting. Pat's wins for the flavor, though I've known for a long time I was team Pat's.

As the sign says... #since1930 #southphilly #delicious #pioneer #yo #theinventor #theheartattack #originator
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here two years back. Tried Geno as well. The cheesesteaks are simple and delicious! Love the sandwich and will return!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Still not sure if I took a breath between the first and last bite? 

Perfect balance between meat, bread, cheese & onions.

Also, the onions were not too onion-y.

Fairly confident they handed me a my cheesesteak before I finished my order. 

Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On vacation in Philadelphia, this famous cheesesteak place was a must-visit for my wife and I.  Unfortunately, we were both very disappointed by both Pat's and Geno's.  

We ate at Pat's first, got one with provolone and one with "whiz."  Surprisingly, the whiz was actually better than provolone.  Overall, though, both sandwiches were completely mediocre.  The bread was unremarkable, the meat was tough and flavorless.  The fries were quite soggy.  I was very pumped for this, so the experience was a huge letdown.  

With lowered expectations, we next ventured to Geno's.  My wife and I opted to just split a sandwich with "whiz."  Geno's was slightly better, mostly due to somewhat more flavorful steak.  Otherwise, the experience was almost identical.  The steak is cut a bit thicker at Geno's, but the sandwich is similarly mediocre.  

Sad fact: I have had better Philly Cheesesteaks at Texadelphia in Texas.  Also, Silver Dinner in Maryland has better cheesesteaks.  

Side note:  While at Geno's, they were filming an interview with a guy who was presumably the owner/manager.  My wife and I were sitting behind him, likely on camera.  I literally laughed as the interviewer was asking, "what's your secret to making the best cheesesteak blah blah blah."  I was also prominently drinking a soda from a Pat's cup.  Oops!  I'm a jerk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As soon as I was finished with Geno's. I went right over to pat's and I had a much better experience eating cheesesteaks. The staff are professional on taking your order but you can't wait around once it's ready, you have to take your food away from the counter immediately because of the flow of customers. The sandwiches were much bigger, had more cheesewiz and the meat was chopped. It was so good that I did not want to stop eating. The fries were also good too. When it's competition with Geno's, pat's is definitely the best. When I go back to philly I'm going to pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What a disappointment. Open since 1930? Really? This place is a tourist trap. $25 for a philly, coke and fries. Also, Cash Only. 

The mushrooms, clearly canned, the peppers and onions were gross (possibly canned as well). To put it frankly the quantity and quality of ingredients, and care for preparation was simply not there.  

The staff didn't seem to care one way or another... Geno's across the street didn't seem to be much better, but the peppers looked fresher. But there was a huge sign that said "No Refunds" ... makes you wonder... 

Anyway, I do not recommend Pat's "King of cheese steaks" it was gross and expensive for no good reason.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm in love with a cheesesteak. There. I said it. I confess.

Other loves have come and gone in my life, but my love for this cheesesteak stands true.

Yes, I'm fully aware that Pat's is a tourist place. I'm aware that Tony Luke's and John's Roast Pork have "better" cheese steaks. I realize that some of my foodie friends will disown me. But I don't care. Pat's is the cheesesteak for me

The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) should define Pat's as the standard for cheesesteaks for which all other cheesesteaks should be measured against.

Pat's is 61.5 miles from my house. If I drive fast and the traffic isn't bad, I could be there in an hour and 10 minutes. If I leave now...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is one of Philly's local gem cheesesteak places. Since I moved to Philly 7 years ago, I've visited Pat's at least once a month for an authentic Philly cheesesteak. Every time I go, I get a pepper, onion, and mushroom cheesesteak smothered with whiz. The condiments stand is right behind the ordering section, so don't miss out on the hot sauce if you need an extra kick! They chop the steak much better than most, if not all cheesesteak places and serve more meat as well. The lunch crowd may be a little tough to get through on a weekday, but I recommend going a little early (around 11:30) for the optimal time to get a cheesesteak in under 20 seconds.  If you are in Philly for even just a day, this is a must visit spot for an authentic cheesesteak in the cheesesteak capital.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible cheesesteak! I came here simply because it was the only place open at 1 am... big mistake! I ordered the cheesesteak with onions, mushrooms and peppers, with provolone cheese. My sandwich was so cold, cheese was not melted at all, and I couldn't even determine if the meat was good at all. This was my first time in philly and I really wished this wasn't my first meal here. Will be trying dinics and tonys tomorrow, hopefully I won't be as dissapointed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hot fresh. Simple but very good. Made the trip from dc for he first time. Better than genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yummy. How many calories does this thing have again? Holy Shit!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Steak wit whiz FTW!  First, I am not going to make any claims to be some kind of cheese steak connoisseur but I always enjoy their steaks here.  Secondly, I've only had Geno's and Pat's many times, so between the two I prefer Pat's.  Just add a little hot sauce, a order of fries, and a Pepsi equals a tasty meal in South Philly anytime!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was my second time in Philadelphia and the first time I tried...I'm gonna say it...Geno's. I don't remember liking Geno's like I did here. We went to eat after a Phillies game. They're open late which is awesome! We didn't get enough, so we went back the next day. I travelled with three picky kids and each one loved it! It's def a must to have lunch or dinner here!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The first time I came to Philly it was just to have a cheesesteak while passing through, it was cold out so I just grabbed one from Geno's and kept moving and since I didn't have much time to be in the area I only tried theirs, this time around I decided to give Pats a try and I wasn't disappointed, as you may probably already know these places are right across the street from each other and there a few local bars in the area that will let you bring food in so that's what we did, I stood on a long line outside of Pats but I was glad that it moved faster than it seemed it would move, this place is cash only with a few seats outside so really it is a take out place, at the first window you order and pay for your cheesesteak only while the second line is for fries, drinks etc, there are a few options, but I went with one cheesesteak with onions and provolone, one cheesesteak with onions and cheese wiz, I also got fries, everything was really good, it was put together as soon as ordered and I was surprised by how quickly I was finished on that line, the food itself was really good, fries were crispy and not over salted, the cheesesteaks were good, I'm sure I could find a better cheesesteak elsewhere and I've had some really good ones here in NY but going to the original spot was well worth it and I do recommend it
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Today is a sad day. Today I ate a Pat's King of Steaks Philly Cheesesteak with Provolone and Fried Onions. And I am sad because I was excited, salivating, and in the end disappointed.

Okay, people will say, its because I didn't get cheese wiz, or because I didn't slather it in hot sauce, or a myriad of other excuses. But at the end of the day, I was saddened because I expected a life changing experience. What I got was something very average. Although I will admit I will definitely try it again (and maybe go to Jim's) 

The meat was very average. I didn't taste any variety of special spices or sauces that its cooked in, just average ground steak pieces. The cheese probably didn't help - I'd say skip provolone because it doesn't add much flavor. The greasy onions just provided some texture, but had obviously been cooking so long on the grill that they had lost all the aroma they could have added to the meats. The bread, on the bright side, was fresh and pretty good, but alas, could not make up for everything else.

What do I wish? I wish I could have had butter spread on the bread. I wish the meat had been seasoned. I wish I had gotten cheese wiz. I wish a bunch of things. But most of all, I wish it would have delivered or at least tried to deliver the high expectations I had for it.

BUT. I will definitely give it a try again. This time, with cheese wiz, mushrooms, onions, hot sauce...all the works - maybe I just need a sensory overload to really experience it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have never had a bad steak here. It's definitely my preference over Geno's, and the best in South Philly by far. It's got just the right amount of wiz and onions without being too weighed down or worse, soggy and goopy like Geno's. It's not too fatty but still tasty. 

The employees here are actually NICE, and don't yell at out-of-towners who don't order in the exact way that you're "supposed" to. Once the entire hockey team from the Navy Academy was in line behind me, and so nervous I ended up helping all the team and their coaches order. Pat's had a good time with it, and no one left offended or put-off by rudeness, unlike at Geno's. Pat's is awesome in my book, and I will continue to give them my hard-earned money for a  yummy steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
NEXT!

When you are in line at Pat's, you will hear this. A lot. This South Philly landmark does not bother with pleasantries. They don't have to.

Read the instructions for ordering. Get in line. Have your money ready. When it came to be our turn, I was sure I would be sent back to the end of the line for using too many words like 'please' and 'thank you' so I left the task of ordering to the expert.  I learned that 'wit wiz' loosely translates to 'hi, can I please have a cheesesteak with grilled onions and cheez wiz?'

And like magic, there it was...  the original cheesesteak I was craving. Soft bread, ample meat & grilled onions and the all-important cheez wiz. It was big. And juicy. Almost too juicy - multiple napkins couldn't help me. Was it the onions?  We will never know. 

I probably horrified those around me with how quickly I finished that sandwich. Don't judge - I was hungry! While it was not the best cheesesteak I have ever enjoyed (believe it or not, that honor resides in Arizona!) it was warm, cheesy and just what I wanted. A perfect end to my Philadelphia weekend.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: To be fair I was stoned when I ordered from the window at Pats last night. That being said, two staff members yelled at me for asking where I order fries. When it's not busy, it's just confusing why you have to order at two different windows. the old lady at the counter legit screamed at me when I asked  and then the guy at the fry counter also through a fit when I was confused. Everyone who works here are assholes, and their food is trash. I went for hotdogs, would never waste my money on a steak. They randomly tow people and pretty sure they use to have a sign that stated if you don't speak English we refuse to serve you. Very nice. Go anywhere else, can't believe this place still has a following.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Let me preface this with that I've become determined to travel the US with my husband and do all the things they do on Food Fueds (except Barberton chicken because it's nasty and I can't stomach it.) Philly cheesesteaks has been high on the list and was the main reason we decided to get to Philly. We've done the ones in Cincy and St. Louis, and Philadelphia was next.

After eating Geno's, we googled the results of the Food Fueds, and since Pat's won, decided to grab one to eat on the drive home. We ordered with provolone and onions and cheez wiz and ran back to the warmth of the car because we didn't want to eat outside again.

Upon taking a bite into the sandwich, we both made a face. This was inedible. The meat was really chewy - like chewy to the point I couldn't actually rip through it and spit it out. It lingered in my teeth annoyingly until I got back home two hours later to floss it out. The cheese wasn't melted, the onions were barely there, and the meat was disgusting with way too much fat. But, I wanted to use the 10 dollar sandwiches, so I brought it home to my dogs. My basset hound actually wouldn't eat it, and stared at it for about 10 minutes before the fat corgi tried to steal it from her, in which she ate in one gulp out of fear for losing it. That's how bad it was. My dog didn't even really want to eat it.

Needless to say, not coming back but at least worth it in my food fueds tour.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Look, do yourself a favor and eat here. You will not be disappointed. While this place is very touristy, it's worth it. The steaks are perfect, the toppings are great, and you will be supporting a local landmark. A+++
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The most overrated, underwhelming crud I've eaten. Subway competes head on with them and that's an insult. I was all excited to go to Pat's. I took a field trip with some friends, we waited for an hour with building anticipation, placed our order according to protocol and waited again. We practically ran over to the picnic tables with our armful of grub. 

We threw it all down on the table and tore into the bag. We each grabbed our order and took a huge bite. Chewed, thought, and each in turn said, "this is it?" We were crushed. Like getting coal in your christmas stocking. I've had better cheesesteaks in NYC by far. We didn't even finish them. The whiz tastes and looks like plastic. The "steak" was chewy and tough. The fries were soggy. No wonder they are angry in Philly. The bread was okay. Their only claim to fame and it stinks. Now they only have the Liberty Bell to chime about. DON'T waste your time. 

The pictures in these reviews are more ghastly than crime scene photos. They should draw chalk outlines around the sandwiches. The only thing I can say that we may have done wrong, we weren't falldown drunk when we went. That may be the problem.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Always great cheesesteaks. I get provolone wit. Amazing quality every time. I went to Geno's once and couldn't believe how skimpy they were with their steak. I've had a steak um that is better. Pat's truly is the king of steaks! Another cool thing about Pat's is if your into authentic throwback jerseys, you will usually find a few people on line wearing vintage Mitchell & Ness jerseys. I usually wear my 1977 Philadelphia 76ers road blue jersey. Everyone loves Doctor J there. I have to go back soon for my cheesesteak fix! Chinks and Delasandro's are great too but there's nothing like a Pat's Cheese steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So you brave the South Philly traffic, drive around and around looking for a parking space, stand in a long line forever, but you don't mind a bit because this is going to be an awesome cheesesteak, right?  WRONG!  I could overlook the rudeness of the guy behind the counter, chalking it up to South Philly ambiance, but I can't overlook the fact that I didn't get the extra cheese I ordered and paid for, on a mediocre assembly-line sandwich.  Frankly, I've had better cheesesteaks at chain restaurants in Michigan!  Next time I'll go where the locals go -- to Sonny's, on Market.
