categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I hate this place. Even when it's 3am and I'm absolutely plastered, and somebody else is buying, these are still the worst cheesesteaks I've ever tasted. Or maybe they're the second worst. Between them and Geno's, I don't know which is the worst.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I took a long drive from Virginia to get some Philly cheese steak. Parking was crazy on Saturday night but luckily I found a spot after circling a few times. I tried both Geno's and Pat's cheesesteak. I got the cheese steak whiz at Pat's. It was better than Geno's in my opinion. The cheese was melting just right. The steak was juicy and seasoned well. The peppers in the condiment section went really well with the cheesesteak. The seats were limited. Also, they only accept CASH. There is an ATM but it looks shady so I would recommend to bring your own cash. I would definitely come back for another cheesesteak from Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best cheese steak in Philadelphia. Full of meat, cheese , onions and hot peppers. Plus you never know who you will bump into when you are there. It seems that every time i go there I meet someone from the old neighborhood and even people I went to Central High School with or Temple University. You might even meet a celebrity there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
With all the buzz around having to try a Philly Cheese steak with a side by comparison of Pat's and Geno's I really had much higher expectations.  

To be honest I've had better cheese steaks not in Philly so the only big difference which people who live in this area seem to really love is the wit wiz option which is basically that nacho cheese whiz filling which you can get at places like 7-Eleven on your nachos or by melting that Velveeta cheese.  Prepare to put on the calories though.

The one thing I really enjoyed about this place over Geno's was their meat, it was more tender and flavorful than Geno's but they could use some better bread.  I think if they took the bread from over at Geno's then they'd put Geno's out of business over time with their quality.

I wouldn't return here in the future, I've had my side by side comparison and satisfied my earning to see what the buzz was/is all about so my experience is complete.

Everything here is ala carte as well, you gotta buy your cheese steak apart from your fries.  It's all cash too so at the end of the day for a combo meal you're paying more than $20 for fast food which is ridiculous.

While sitting here to eat we met some elderly couple from New Jersey that have been coming there for over 50 years, they used to live in Philadelphia a while back but every trip they make to Philly always includes stopping at this place.  This makes me believe this place is like going home to having a home cooked meal, you know the one thing your mom or family member makes which beats everything else.  So in this case Pat's was like eating a home cooked meal by mom for them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Second time here, love this place. It's all Old Philadelphia mixed with the new inhabitants. Sure, it's touristy, it's also been open for over 50 years for a reason. Order "steak with" for what we know as Philly cheesesteak. I prefer pat's over gene's, but I like geno's bread better. You have to visit at least once, but try both spots.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I had a friend from out of town who insisted on going here.  I warned him this is just a tourist trap.  He said he didn't care just wanted to go for the experience.  Luckily it was the middle of a weekday so we didn't have to wait in line for his completely bone dry nothing of a cheesesteak sandwich.  He was extremely disappointed.  I was nice and didn't say, "I told you so."

I am not a diehard cheesesteak fan, but do suggest the place in Reading Terminal Market.  Cannot remember their name, but the good one.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It didn't knock my socks off, but it was a solid sandwich with better meat than Geno's. 
After ordering and grabbing your food from the window, you can load up on condiments and peppers at a separate self-serve section, which was a nice touch.

Parking is extremely limited in the neighborhood, so it'd be easiest to have a friend hop out of the car and order the cheesesteaks to-go while you or the driver loops around or makes a temporary stop somewhere. Alternatively, you can just uber here, but there's not much else to do in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I got a cheesesteak wit cheese whiz and I enjoyed it. It wasn't bad but I'm not sure if all this hype between pats and genos fool people into believing they are all as good as they make it out to be. I make this stuff at home all the time and it feel like I make it better. I guess people grow up eating a certain one and have an allegiance to it and it's a fun tradition to have a cheesesteak in Philly. People should try it but the hype makes it more disapointing if anything
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You have to go....but I dont think its the best steak sandwhich in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: gross, dude. i've managed to avoid any brushes with E. Coli thus far, and i'd love to keep it that way. that said, i'll stay across the street, where i can see what's going into my cheese fries, thanks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have lived only 15 min outside of Philly for 19 years and it took me 29 years to actually go to Pat's and experience what the world calls a "true philly cheesesteak" - I have to say, it WAS an experience.

Overall, I was a bit overwhelmed.  I have been to Jim's about a million times and I was never overwhelmed.  I was with my cousin who frequents both Pat's and Genos.  Apparently out of the two, Pat's was the one who "cut up the meat" like I like it, more like shredded.  Eh.  It was not really shredded compared to my Philly Phave, Jim's.  It was more like large slices of beef.  The roll, of course, was amazing.  The provolone cheese was not melted, it was literally just placed on the roll, they put the meat on and hand it to you... eh.  The onions were somewhat cold too, like they were cooked, moved to the side of the grill and they took the ones on top that had time to chill.  Eh.

It did not disappoint with the amount of grease though =) The experience is what you have to go here for but I don't see an immediate repeat in my near future.  

The thing that struck me by surprise was the steps to order a cheesesteak.  Who knew?  I know you order what you want but I didn't know there was a specific order to do so.  They were extremely pushy and forward here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place was...ok at best. I was down in Philly for a sales meeting for my company and they surprised us by taking us to the famous Pats/Genos. Half of us went to Pat's, half went to Genos. Now, I have had the authentic "Philly steak/cheese" at other places throughout my life in Philly. I was REALLY excited to try the ones that have been on every sandwich show known to man. But it was...mediocre at best. I get it. It's famous, the lines will be long, people will be rushing you, etc. I'm from New England, home of the entitled snobs and people who think the world revolves around them. But the staff at Pat's was very rude. I knew what I wanted, so getting to the window and ordering wasn't a huge deal. But when I went to say my order, instead of listening they did everything else but. So I had to keep repeating my order to them which made them more mad. Well, if you paid attention the first time I wouldn't have to continue to say what I want. So service was terrible. We did get our food quick considering we had about 20 people or so in our party so that wasn't bad. The food itself? Eh. Living in CT, I've had wayyyyy better Philly cheese steaks. There was really no taste to it, I like my bread to have that "toasted" taste and it didn't have that at all, it was more on the soggy/soft side. I was very dissapointed. I didn't get  a chance to try any of my co-workers sandwiches that went to Geno's, but I'll try the next time I'm in the area. Honestly, from my experience, this place is WAY to hyped up. I know it's "famous" and all but famous doesn't mean it's amazing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great steak sandwiches, better then their rival across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I refuse to bash Geno's steaks. They are delicious. How ever PAT'S its great also. they have pretty legit fries. Also the fact you can add jalapenos really makes a difference. The steaks are a bit dry, and the cheese isn't really melted. (I've eaten a lot of pat's sandwiches) every time consistently the cheese steaks are dry. The service is slow! How ever it's still a staple in the community. Go ahead and grab a cheese steak for yourself!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yes, I realize I need to go to Tony Luke's for "real cheesesteak", but as a tourist, I have been dying to do a head-to-head comparison of Pat's and Geno's cheesesteaks.  Got the Wit Cheez Whiz.  The steak and onions are finely chopped here and the Cheez Whiz is definitely plentiful.  Bread is nicely toasted.  I give the sandwich only 3 stars because the beef is flavorless.  Next time, I will try Tony Luke's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My husband and I did a split & compared both establishments. If you like the plain taste of meat without any seasoning, then you will like Pat's. I personally like robust flavors, bland is not for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
One of the most iconic places for the cheesesteaks in Philly. The line is long, but is moving quickly - just have your money ready. 

Despite the service being quasi-instantaneous, and the place not having any props whatsoever compared to Geno's steaks, the quality is actually good. 

The bread is fresh and crunchy, the steak is actually delicious and the cheese spread is adding quite a lot to the steak.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place compared to Geno's across the street and a couple of other touristy places that serve cheesesteaks around the town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So if you are from New York City one will ask if you are a Yankees/Mets fan or root for the Jets/Giants.  But if you are from Philly you are asked "Pat's or Geno's".

Well I have had both countless times and decided on my last trip back east to give each a try.

Once you get sixty miles away from Philly, a cheesesteak is hardly a cheesesteak and it is rarely ever duplicated in Virginia, Iowa, Illinois, Wisconsin, or Minnesota.  I have tried numerous places (I actually hit rock bottom when I went to a Subway for theirs and it was total garbage).

What makes Pat's (and Geno's) are several things.  First is the bun which is made from a local Philadelphia bakery and is tasteful and fresh.  Second is the beef they use which is top quality.  Third is the cheese wiz and onions and you top it with catsup.

The place (well the kitchen area) is very clean and the food is sanitary and of high quality.  The line moves very quick and even if you have to stand in line awhile, it is well worth it.

Many reviewers get it right when they say that you cannot tell the difference between Pat's and Geno's.  But I prefer Pat's for one simple reason.  It was the first place I tried on the Triangle and it never let me down.

If you EVER visit Philly, go to Pat's, Geno's, and if you are in the Italian Market section, stop by Jim's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have been to Philly once, and had only one chance for a cheesesteak, and I'm glad it was Pat's.  It was phenomenal, and a memory I've carried with me for the 12 years it has been since I've been.  I hope to be able to go back for an encore soon.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Compared to other cheesteak spots out here I think it is not all it is hyped up to be. It's not bad though. I just find it to be very average and overpriced. If one is in this vicinity I recommend going to Cosmi's for cheesesteaks and other hoagies.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: been here a couple of times, im never taking a philly visitor here ro anywhere near the commercialized steak joints. the first time i ate here was way back when i came to philly I thought it was good, my friends meh...it didnt taste like a cheesesteak as i knew it then so much as a roastbeef sandwich as they didnt chop it up much and I recall the visit as it was cold as balls and there was portions of meat cooking individually then. been back a few times since and it really is no bettter than most steak shops in town with or without a rep, the curse of these tourist traps is teh pile-o-meat. they got a line, gotta get that money but its basically a boiled/steamed chopped beef by then which makes it flavorless and stringy, the bread has no texture or snap, chese is bulk block from restaurant depot else whatever wiz is made of... i got tired of steaks as it was regular cheap eats during school(really great lunch trucks on campus then), but "John's Roast Pork" and Georges Sandwich shop fill my cravings when they come up.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Only gripe about pats is the size of the cheese steak but after trying pats and Geno's I'm a  pats guy for sure !!! The whiz onion and pepper steak ! Had me with the first bite
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I do not like cheeseteak, and not only did this place change my mind but it let me have 2 cheeses for no extra cost. I recently moved to Philadelphia and as a new local it is a rule to got to Pats, but i do have to do the pats genos challenge...Maybe next time
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Well, I'm glad we had  Geno's first because Pat's blows it out of the water!  Much better steak, MORE steak, and all around better experience!  Pat's is the king!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I hadn't had a 2AM cheesesteak in a LONG time.  Had a friend downtown for the night so we went ahead.  Man, is that a great sandwich when your hammered on Tecate...  That's the only reason for the 3 stars.  As usual it was expensive and the service was rude.  And had I been in my right mind, and fully aware of the mess that I was shoving in my face, there's no way i could have given it above 1 star...  But, I was drunk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This was the first stop in my cheese steak tour of Philly (Pat's-Geno's-Jim's in one night).  I made the mistake of fumbling my order and got called out by the cashier.  Maybe I over-prepared for the moment.  But the ribbing was in good fun - just part of the experience.  

The cheese steak with wiz was delicious.  It's easy to see why this place spawned so many imitators.  As good as it was though, I'd have to rank it 2nd on the list to Jim's that night.  But if you're actually on Passyunk deciding between Pat's and Geno's - go to Pat's.  Geno's comes a distant 3rd - not even close.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I wanted this to be more than just the experience, but alas everyone is right. The sandwhich is fine, but definitely not great. It sat in my stomach for quite a few hours. We barely waited at all, which was nice, and I can at least say I have been there.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: While on vacation I surveyed locals to receive their local recommendations for Steak Sandwiches. Oh my! Was I beyond happy they recommended Pat's. Service was quick, staff was witty and funny. I love that they have a plaque telling you were Rocky once stood. Mostly the food was delicious! I often think about this place when I'm wanting a steak sandwich and cheese fries. Wish I could teleport there! Yum!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you're not from the East Coast (as I am not) this cheesesteak may surprise you, since you've probably never had a "real" cheesesteak.

I've been here 3 times now, so know what to expect: long lines any time of day, limited seating, and no containers for ketchup for the fries. You order and pay for your steak at one window (get it "wit onions") and get your fries and drink at the next window.

It's just fun to bring new people here just so they can say they ate here. Parking can be a bit of a chore, but that's just Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The same as Genos. I wish Pat's had more flashy lights and propaganda. The line here is sometimes shorter than Genos. I wish they gave you more meat. But its ok.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time ever. Did the Pat's Geno's challenge. Pat's wins
Here is why
The bead was great
The meat was tender and chopped up nicely. 
Just the right amount of wiz
Food handlers wore gloves
Looked cleaner.

Next time it's Pat's vs. Jim's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteak EVER! This place is the best, old school, very cozy. Hot peppers on the side , was an awesome idea. Highly recommended.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love the cheesesteaks here! The steak is not dry and everything is just absolutely perfect!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The sandwich was cold with a slice of unmelted provolone cheese. Quite a disappointment.  It was also very dry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm going to give it a solid 4, order it right and Damn it's good. Add the ketchup, mayo, salt and pepper and that red sauce if you like spicy. I ordered an extra, wit provolone and added the goods. Also had it side by side with geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So, apparently I've been eating Philly cheesesteaks all wrong my entire life. It was good! We got the basic cheese whiz and it was delicious! You HAVE to eat it fresh. We tried saving some for our plane ride and it was a no go just FYI for all of my travel bugs
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time here, so we decided to compare Geno's and Pat's.  We ordered a mushroom steak with wiz from both places and did a direct comparison.  Overall, I preferred Pat's but it was pretty close.  I thought Pat's had a much nicer roll, and the meat was cooked much better than the one at Geno's.  My main critique is that I wish there was more cheese, because overall it was pretty dry and I didn't get cheese with every bite.  Oh and btw their cheese fries are bomb here so I highly recommend you get those.  And just a tip, be sure you know what you're ordering when you get to the window, cause they ain't waiting for ya haha.  But dag are they efficient here, as soon as you get your change back your cheesesteak is waiting for you fresh off the grill.  So to sum it up, I give Pat's the old town crown over Geno's.  But they're so close might as well try both!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The thing I looked forward to most when moving to Philly for grad school was the cheesesteaks. And what better place to go than to the "King of Steaks." On our little tour, they told us that this is the home of the cheesesteak. And I must admit, I am quite disappointed. 

The cheesesteak has everything I love...steak, cheese, grilled onions, bread. And I usually love my cheesesteaks. What can go wrong? Pat's cheesesteak tastes...okay. It wasn't amazing. Very greasy. The bread was also a little chewy? Luckily, I split one with a friend or else I would have felt terrible afterwards. I think it was so overhyped that it only led me to disappointment. I do love the fast and efficient service although a bit overwhelming.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I visted Pat's King of Steaks after reading and hearing about the hype from friends who have been there. The place is accross the steak from their competitor Geno's. Both places had long lines but because I heard Pat's was better, i lined up. I waited in line for 5 minutes. I missed the crowd by fives minutes. I was there around 1 pm. Once you order, It reminded me of the Soup Nazi scene from Seinfeld. You have to get your cash ready (they only accept cash and tell you to borrow from friends if you don't have any) and know what you want. If you want to take your time, don't get in line. Then you get your cheesesteak instantly after you pay. Maybe because I had high expectations but the cheesesteak was not that good. The meat was dry and over-cooked. The soda I ordered was water down. I was lucky enough to find seats after a few minutes but for most people, there was no place to sit down and enjoy your cheesesteak. Overall, I have experienced better cheesesteak in nyc. It was a good first experience but not a cheesesteak I would drive from nyc to philadelphia to try. In fact, I like Carl's Steak and Charley's better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
DON'T BELIEVE ALL THESE 1 AND 2 STAR REVIEWS!!! 

It's worth the hype. It's what a cheese steak is supposed to taste like. For all  you WIMPS out there - Do you have a cell phone??? Then you can look up the proper way to order the goddamn thing so it won't be so "stressful." It's very simple: you tell them what you want, you pay, they get it for you. They don't give a shit if you don't use the correct "wiz-wit, wiz-witout" lingo. If you want an amazing authentic Philly cheese steak then go to Pat's. It's better than Geno's, but they're very similar. Pat's has more meat. Open 24 hours, you can't beat it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I consider myself to not be as picky and critical when it comes to food, but for a spot that's gotten a lot of visits/reviews... I didn't think this was very good.

My party ordered off uber eats, and they FORGOT putting the cheese on all the cheesesteaks we ordered with cheese, except the Pizza Steak. Unfortunately, the meat didn't seem to be very good quality, and didn't have the flavor I was expecting from such a well-known place. The bread also seemed like it was hastily prepared. 

It's really unfortunate that I couldn't find a good quality cheesesteak during my visit to Philly. And dare I say, I'm not sure that one even exists with the atmosphere and lack of attention to detail with a lot of cheesesteak places I've passed by here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I took a Friend there who wanted to try the Philly cheesesteak. We got a few mushroom steaks with cheese. The line was pretty short that day, the cashier just wants you to pay for your order and move on to the other customer. You need to know what you need in advance before ordering. The location was not too crowded that day.
I ate a lot of cheesesteak from the various vendors in Philly and frankly I was not impress by the sandwiches. It didn't have that cheesy flavor I was looking for, and the mushroom didn't look so fresh and their fries were acceptable. There is no free parking, but street parking, so plans accordingly. I wish I could give them 3-4 stars but when it comes to food or product quality that where my 2 stars go in this case I was not impressed by the food, I will give it another try and see.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's over Geno's by a small crapy margin!!!!
FML for having to taste Geno's then to Pat's!!!
The meat had more falvor than Geno's but really by not much.  Same cardboard texture with a bit more spices..  If I were to be deserted in Philly and Pat's and Geno's were then only two places open (what a nightmare), I would have to eat at Pat's...
Btw, if you ever need a plastic knife to cut your sandwich into smaller pieces for whatever reason, make sure to take your own from home because the idiot cashier will not help you out..  
The point:  avoid this place just like you avoided Geno's; they both suck big time and their fake so called rivalry has added to their good for nothing fame.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: During our road trip (east coast) we chose to stop by Philladelphia PA for a BIG BUS TOUR, as a tradition we have to do lunch on a famous dinner. We asked to officer where is the best place for a philly cheese-steak ! to places were recommended but as we arrived the Pat's was the most clean and nice place. Not the best for experience for rockie customer -cashier was rushing us. BUT the food, was DAMN WOW ! the pizza fries spectacular !!! The sandwich (3 different ones) We ordered and the split in 3 to try it all.  Sadly no restroom for customer. Two separates window to order (one for sandwiches / other one for sides). Only Cash (funny sign).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is ok but not everything its cracked up to be. This is a tourist spot but not good quality cheesesteaks in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Its more hype than anything else. Workers kinda rude like you're bothering them when ordering. Speed is key, I absolutely agree and understand that, but at the same time I heard them be not so friendly to several customers like they were being bothered by people ordering. Its just a freakin cheesesteak.....stop acting like its life or death.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I think something is seriously wrong with anyone that gave this place more than 1 or 2 stars.  The men behind the counter are very nice and the bread was nice, soft and chewy, just the way I like it.  That's really the only good things I can say.  I wanted to like Pats, I really did.  I came down from NYC with a friend for a quick getaway to Philly and couldn't wait to go Pats to try the original and boy was I disappointed.  Both cheesesteaks (my friend's and mine) were fatty, and dry to the point that no amount of cheese whiz could save.  This is what everyone's ranting and raving about!!! Dry meat in good bread!!!  I make a better cheesesteak at home!!!  Total waste of time and money!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm sorry to be so blunt and negative to start out, but--Pat's is trash. This was my third visit to Philadelphia and my first time trying Pat's. I usually go with Geno's, but this time I decided to try Pat's to see how the two compare.

It's not even close. I ordered a cheesesteak with whiz without onions (a whiz without). It might not have had the chunks of onions the cheesesteaks with onions have, but there was definitely a strong taste of onions in the meat. It was vile. Apparently, they don't use separate grills or clean the grills very well. When I say without, I mean WITHOUT! The quality of meat and bread was also subpar to Geno's. 

I also got an order of cheese fries. Again, they were incredibly lackluster compared to Geno's. They give you almost half the amount of fries as Geno's and the quality is not nearly as good.

If all of that wasn't enough, their prices are also $1.00 higher than Geno's! It was $11.00 instead of $10.00 for the cheesesteak and $6.00 instead of $5.00 for the cheese fries. Now, I typically wouldn't blink an eye at a dollar, but it makes a big deal when I'm paying more for a lot less quality. In the future, it will ONLY be Geno's for me!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: had my first pat's about 25 years ago and I still love it every time I eat it.  I took away a star because the last time I was there they changed their ice from delicious crushed to cubes.  not a fan of the change.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The service sucks. The guy that took my order the past 2 times acted like he was too good for anyone.

The meat isn't good. The bread isn't good. The cheese is okay. The fries were hard..

People only eat here for the name.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: shit steaks, total tourist trap.  go anywhere else literally any food truck can do a solid one they're really not that hard. if you buy steakums,cheese and long rolls from any supermarket add your desired toppings and already youre more qualified to sell WHAT IS APPARENTLY THE ONLY CULTURAL EXPORT OF THIS GREAT CITY!!!! then those assholes.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Trashy tourist fun, but it's an interesting neighborhood with history and good nearby bars and you get a good sloppy sandwich out of it. Ignore the haters and head on down at least once.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Sure it's a tourist trap and there are better steaks in Philly but Pats still make a helluva good cheesesteak. The ordering process is obnoxious if you're not from the order so pay close attention to others as they order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I just couldn't leave Philly without a cheesesteak! I heard this was the place to go and it sure was. Got a CheeseSteak wit (onions), mushrooms, and provolone cheese. Everything was perfect except for the mushrooms - honestly they tasted canned. While I'm no cheesesteak connoisseur, I generally know food. Meat had just the right amount of grease, cheese was melty, roll was super fresh and the onions had great flavor.

The best part? We went for an early lunch and beat the crowd. Found a spot right in front and got our food in literally 60 seconds! Must visit while in Philly.

*They're open 24/7, CASH ONLY
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very rude and gave me a sandwich with whiz before I even specified which type of cheese I wanted. When I asked if this was the only type of cheese available they lied to my face and said yes. Overall the sandwich was alright but I definitely prefer the service and sandwiches at Genos's across the street
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For an outdoor cheesesteak dive, I'm absolutely 100% impressed. Fast service and delicious products. A little pricey, but it's Philadelphia, so that's kind of expected. The cheesesteaks are dynamite, the best I've ever eaten.

Be advised that the only places to sit are outside picnic tables. The location isn't bad though, and you're right next to the Italian Market!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's or Geno's? Of course I had to do the Cheesesteak challenge. I have to go with Geno's! Pat's was great, lots of meat, just right on the Whiz... sadly not enough onions (could barely taste them) and bread was soggy. Pat's was a little more on the the salty side and the meat, well tasted like meat. It was a hit or miss for me, but I had to see what all the hype was about!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We went here late night after a concert and it hit the spot!!  Who doesn't love a cheesesteak?  Being from NY, we asked our PA/South Jersey friends should we do Geno's or Pat's and we got a unanimous Pat's because of their bread. I was totally stressed out about ordering because everyone before me (mind you it was all guys and I was the only girl) had the lingo down "pat." Wiz Wit, blah blah blah so when I got up there and stumbled on my words and then forgot to tell them I wanted them to go I got some stares.  BUT the cheesesteak was absolutely delish!  Best one in Philly that we had by far!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Drove from New York just for some Pat's and worth every minute.

Will definitely be back soon. 

Of all the spots, this is it. Most locals will agree.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My Husband went across the street from Geno's after I was disappointed on the hype of the "Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich", well I was so happy he thought to buy another sandwich at "Pat's King of steaks" Yummy!!!!! Finally, I knew what everyone was taking about! this place is the KING. I LOVE IT. This California girl recommends this place to anyone who is visiting philly.

**parking is tough and sitting is outdoors**

worth it!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you buy a Pat's Cheesesteak, expect to get overcooked pieces of flavourless meat in a soggy bun.  I'm glad I came with a friend -- we shared one sandwich between us, so I didn't have to eat more than half the steak.  (I feel bad about wasting food.)

If you're looking for an overpriced cheesesteak for the sake of doing the tourist thing in Philly, this is THE place to go, assuming you'd rather not support overtly racist establishments (which you can find across the street).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak here is phenomenal. I couldn't believe how different it was from every other cheesesteak I've ever had. Also, being that I haven't had a cheesesteak in a while, it made it hit the spot even more. The line was really long, but we did get fed with 20 minutes or so, and standing out in the street on the line was pretty neat too. The historical sign out front makes this place the clear choice. They also give free cherry peppers with the condiments, so be sure to try a few of those too on the house. I'd drive out here from NY just for that any time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Tourist trap for sure.

Food is mediore at best.  I can find a better philly cheesesteak at the mall.  

I would strongly suggest not going here or to Geno's across the street.  

It's uber expensive.  Not enough meat.  Too much bread.  Lacked flavor.

If you must go, definitely go to Pat's, skip Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So we tried Geno's and Pat's. Pat's is marginally better just because they give a tiny bit more meat (or maybe the bread is just smaller). Either way, the meat is still flavorless and the bread tastes day old. These two restaurants are meant to be rivals but it taste like they get their meat and bread from the same frozen food distributor. Don't fall into the trap. Go elsewhere....and I don't mean Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Order it right.... dont hold up the line... people will get pissed.... it's a landmark for years....so you have to go... but I know a better place for steaks on South....read the review....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A BIT OVER HYPED..AND GENO'S..BUT IF YOUR IN PHILLY..I GUESS THESE ARE THE PLACES TO COME AND SEE for tourist..MY BAD.wasn't that good..my philly friends laughed at us when i told then that we went to try pat's and geno's...lololol..just was not good!! sorry.
OVER HYPED BY TV (FOOD NET)...ONE MORE THING MAKE SURE YOU CAN READ AND SPEAK ENGLISH!!!lololololoolololollol TO ORDER.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's steaks are good and honestly all are starting to taste the same to me, but I'm going to have to favor the racist Geno's steaks over Pat's because Geno's isn't chopped up the way Pat's is. Same order format... Whiz wit for me please.

I definitely choose the northeast's location of Steve's Prince of Steaks. The center city location needs to perfect theirs. Seriously.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When i went there was a very short line luckily! Waited for about 5 minutes and ended up ordering a cheesesteak with american cheese (yum!). Fries were good ($5) and they have coke products. Overall, a must do while in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So Pats runs number 3 in the Cheesesteak world in my book, definitely much better than their main competitor across the street!  The meat I think is much more leaner and tender than most of the competitors.  Its one of those places that if your visiting the Philly area you gotta check out at least once.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's cheesesteaks are really delicious (coming from someone who doesn't really like cheesesteaks thats saying something)

I've come here on many occasion, may it be after a long night of drinking or just for dinner with a group of friends. i have also stood in line while wearing flip flops during the dead of winter because my friends dragged me out of bed to grab something to eat.

this is definitely a place that i tell people who are visiting from out of town to go to if they haven't had a real philly cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First trip ever to Philly, so we had to try the cheesesteaks! We tried both Pat's and Geno's, and got fries from both as well. I ordered a cheesesteak without onions. I LOVED the cheese, it was like a sauce and had such a good flavor. However, I preferred the steak in the Geno's sandwich, it had less gristle and fat than the Pat's sandwich. But the Oat's sandwich had the best flavor with the cheese sauce, which I did not get in my Geno's cheesesteak. The fries were super tasty, I preferred them over the Geno's fries (although the portion is smaller than Geno's and more expensive). Luckily when we went the line was short and the service was quick! Keep in mind they only take cash!! Overall a good experience and I'm not a steak lover!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On my recent trip to Philly, after hearing all the hype about Pat's vs. Genos, I decided I would have my own taste test. I wanted to get the most out of both meals, so I had Pat's one night and then Geno's the following night. 

Frankly, I can't believe there is a controversy here. Pat's is hands down the best of these two Philly icons. The deciding factor - the chopped meat. It was not only easier to eat, but had better flavor and taste. 

Sorry Geno's, Pat's is the tops in my book.

As an aside, what a tourist trap. For all the lights and glitter at both of these place, the service is mediocre at best and they make you feel like an ass with the whole Wit and Wiz nonsense. If you're going to charge me $10 for a sandwich, at least make me feel like you're happy I'm there to give you my hard earned money.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They're not bad at all, but, even when it comes to cheesefries...I prefer Geno's. That's just me though; take it or leave it,
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For such a famous place there's nothing to write home about. Personally, I rather stay in Princeton and get Hoagie Haven's cheese steak. The meat is not as good as Pat's. But if you think about it, I drove this far, waited in a line that wrapped around the block. It better be good. The food is plain. No taste at all. 

The people there were not that friendly. I do understand that the reason is because line is so long. 

Haven't gone to the place across the street. Someone mention to try the Chicken Cheese Steak. Might try it when I pass this place next time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I got the cheese steak wit wiz.  Haven't eaten at Geno's yet so can't compare the two.  But, I would say this was a pretty good cheese steak.  Compared to Jim's on 4th street, which is also one of the more well known cheese steak places, I noticed Pat's uses more cheese.  Who doesn't like more cheese?  Wasn't able to taste the onions as much though.  The meat was cut up into manageable slices which was also good.  Went at 10 PM on a Tuesday and had not line which was great.  Also appreciate the pepper bar that they have available.  In my opinion I'd have to say possibly the best cheese steak I've had in Philly so far.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great area and pretty good cheesesteaks! I got a steak with American cheese and without onions. The lines move fast, and you get your food quick. The only problem is that the steaks are a bit greasy, but overall I believe Pat's steaks are better then Geno's. Good steaks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've been going to Pat's since I was a kid.  There's really no need to even bother trying Geno's.  The ONLY way to get a proper Philly cheesesteak from Pat's is with Whiz... none of that provolone nonsense.  Can't wait to have one on my visit to Philly.  I've been in California for way too long!  Oh, and the cheese fries are amazing along with a hot chocolate in the winter to keep your hands warm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you are looking for the best philly around, then you must check Pat's out. The parking is near impossible to find so you may need to plan on doing some walking, but it will be worth it. 

The bread is perfect and combined with great tasting meat and cheese you can not go wrong. This is not the type of sandwich you can eat in your car on the go. It is filled up so much that it will fall everywhere. 

They also have some cherry peppers on the condiment stand, but be careful because some of them can be extremely spicy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I like it a lot better than Gino's! Steak was tastier!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I tried the other place across the street, so it was time to give this one a try and it was a whole lot better. No nonsense and to the frigin' point with Pat's. Again, a late night venture that had me standing in a super long line, but I had my beer with me to keep me company. I got to the window, place my order and got it PDQ. The meat was tender and juicy, whiz is just what it is; Whiz but the grilled onions and peppers really makes it pop. There isn't a place to sit since it was so packed, so I sat on the curb like everyone else, popped open another beer and enjoyed my night. I'll opt to come back here next time in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I will be the first to admit that tourists suck, and generally so do the places they go to, but this place rocked. 

When visiting Philadelphia one must have a cheesesteak.  A friend who lives nearby suggested Pat's over Geno's.  We went on a Saturday night after a Phillie's game which may have been part of the issue, because the line stretched around 3 of the 4 blocks that Pat's encompasses.  The back of the line was dangerously close to touching the front of the line.  But most people were in Phillie's gear, and if its good enough for locals, its good enough for me.

The ordering system is no nonsense, like the soup nazi of sandwiches, which I happened to like because it kept things moving.  My sandwich was in my hand about 2.1 seconds after I finished ordering.  Really the only problem was that the seating is really hard to come by.  The only bench we could find sat amongst the hoards of hungry people behind us in line and we had to consume messy sandwiches while people stared at our food, mouths watering (just as we had done before them).

Also, its super small so there's no bathroom and my gf had to sneak into a bar and me into a shady laundromat nearby.  

But the meat was perfectly seasoned, the bread was delicious, but I should have gone with the cheese-whiz.  In situations like this it is best to release all pretensions.  Onions also added flavor.  Overall a great sandwich and a night well spent.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is all hype. After hearing so much about the famous Pat's and Geno's, our group of out-of-towners trudged to this dirty and dodgy part of Philly for some reputedly delicious cheese steaks. And it is convenient if you'd like to sample them both at the same time to see which is better, cos they are right across from one another.

The cheesesteaks are huge. But they just taste average. NOT WORTH our trouble looking for this place- it;s quite far from everything else.
Seriously, just go to Jim's Steak on South Street.

And the people here are not friendly. And NO BATHROOMS! I needed to go pretty badly and NONE of the shops around here would let me use theirs. how rude. (hence the 1 star)NEVER coming back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The food is unremarkable. I'm not sure it even qualifies as iconic. If this is Philadelphia's version of a Tommy Burger, you'd be better off saving your craving for a Tommy Burger (Beverly and Rampart in Los Angeles) or a French dip from Philippe's also in Los Angeles. Two clearly better iconic food stops on the American national scene. 

If the drive is too far to Los Angeles, just drive to Conshohocken to Ponti's steaks. The carbone cheesesteak is drool-worthy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pretty good cheesesteaks.... It's a little dirtier on the outside than Geno's but had more traffic it seemed... Well at 1120pm at least.  Cheese wiz fries and cheesesteaks were actually tasty but 2 bucks for a water was hella steep, especially since it was off brand water... Oh well service was ok the young folks there were quick to get orders out.  It's more of a 3.5 than 3 though.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is very overrated! I have had many cheesesteaks in my life and this is probably one of the most weakest one of all. The ones the sell at the California malls taste better than this stuff. Cheese whiz really? For a city that claims to be the home of cheesesteaks this was a pretty disappointing experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Of the 2 Im a Pat's fan, I usually eat pizza steak's and geno's doesn't have any variety.  Other places are higher on the list for cheesesteak's but will walk over to get one of these when people are visiting
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We decided to pit the two cheese steaks against each other! Pats was first. Be advised it's CASH ONLY. After coming from NYC we walked around the corner to a bank to retrieve cash and back to the window to get a sandwich with onions and cheese wiz!  
The bread is toasty but soft. The meat chopped. Just enough cheese. It's gonna be tough to beat this!! 


(By the way this was our winner)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Touristy, but I was a tourist, so that was OK. Great cheesesteak, with cheez-wiz, and I'd go there again. The neighborhood looks a little run down, but finding a cab there and back from our downtown hotel was not a problem, and it was perfectly safe.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Totally over rated. Nothing special about this cheesesteak. People behind the counter were pushy and impatient. I was anxious by the time I got my over priced steak sandwich and fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philly steak was average, nothing special to it. Horrible customer service. Cashier was extremely rude...I was looking forward to it so much and sadly was disappointed because of the cashier's negative behavior. Will never go there again. Their competitor Geno's had surprisingly better customer service and their philly steak was much better in taste.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Much better than Geno's.

Order an Extra with Wiz and Mushrooms.

No credit cards and no frills.  Come in winter and freeze your balls off.

In all honesty I've had better cheesesteaks before but you need to come and try the original just so you can call yourself an enlightened human being.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not surprised that one of the most iconic single-location food destinations in America has garnered three stars.

Here's the logic: We're the locals, and you're a buncha stupid tourists. This gives us license to be enormous fucking douchebags, charge way too much for our food, and give you a pretty freakin' small, not particularly amazing cheesesteak.

I've seriously had better cheesesteaks in Norwich, Connecticut.

Boom. Said it. Come at me.

Pizza fries were whatever. Great, so you took some SYSCO fries, poured wiz and lousy tomato sauce on it, and charged $6 or something.

Philly has some nice things. Lots of history, some GREAT pubs, sports teams that get beaten by the New York teams constantly. But this whole cheesesteak battle is nonsense. A white elephant, an albatross... a dud.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I ate Pats and Genos back to back within 10 minutes for lunch and definitely prefer the Pats vibe and grub.

The smaller of the two, they focused on making the meats so tender they fell apart and added plenty of cheese wiz. They also had these little black peppers that went perfectly to add a kick and the cherry peppers helped cut through some of the richness of the cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm sad to say that Holly Moore's updated review was spot on. Pats has gone down hill. I was there on Sat. night 11/9 and even though there was a line, I noticed that the line at Geno's was much longer. Anyway my buddy and I decided to stay at Pat's, what a mistake. We ordered our sandwiches and I ordered two to bring back to Brooklyn. The one I ate there was just alright and had much less meat than the sandwich I had 4 months ago, one of those that I took home was full of gristle and not the small pieces that you sometimes find but big chunks of it throughout the sandwich. So much so that I had to disassemble the sandwich to eat it . Sorry Pat's but you get a big fail.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better than Geno's! Same price same type of service but the cheesesteak had more flavor and came with more cheese whiz.  Hooray for Pat's King of Steak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak was pretty delicious despite the fact it took a quick minute to make it. Make sure to ask them for some melted yellow cheese and go to the condiments table and grab those big red chili peppers because it brings an even better taste to the cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best Cheesesteak in Philly hands down (and WAAAY better than Geno's in my opinion). In my 10 days in Philly for "work" i tried cheesesteak from about 10 different locations. THe first place I went to when I arrived in PHilly was Pat's and the last place I went to before flying back from PHilly was Pat's. I can't wait until my next business trip. I haven't had a cheesesteak in cali since.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As epic cheesesteak quests go, Pat's is definitely a prime destination.  No, the subs are not life-altering.  A big part of the appeal is in the "I've eaten there" experience.  But as famous cheesesteak places go, Pat's is top-notch.  The meat is as good or better than what you'll get across the street at Gino's or wherever else.  The cheese whiz is delicious whether slathered over meat or fries.  Etc.

Depending on when you go, there may be a line, but not for lack of effort on their part to keep things moving.  Don't get cute with your order, or even fumble around with your wallet.  Just be ready when you step up to complete the transaction, or you'll get a glare or, even worse, a sarcastic zinger.  Like I said, it's an experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Sooooo good. I really like their philly cheese stake sandwich!! juicy and cheap :D

There is a long line to get, but it didn't take much time to be my turn. It was kind of hard to get a seat because there were so many people waiting for seats to be opened. 

Actually, it's not a healthy food. But if you don't care about it, here is one of the places to try when you visit to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There is no doubt that the best philly cheesesteaks come from Philly. It was hard trying to decide which one to go to but we decided on this one. How amazing is this place. It just mouth-watering.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Every time I watch some travel channel show that lists Pats as "The" place to go in Philadelphia to get a cheesesteak, wait.... let me re-phrase that, to get the best cheesesteak, I want to laugh. I remember the first time I ever had one. My father took me there when I was 14. Even at that young age I knew that this was something greasy and disgusting. The only reason I choked it down and smiled is because my dad thought that he was doing something really nice for me. 

So, ok it's been a lot of years since then and since my husband and I just happened to be in the area we thought, well why not. My best advice is, don't go. Save yourself and just don't do it. It's actually worse than I remember it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Wasn't hot Cheese didn't  melt
Dry
No seasoning 
New to Philly cheese stakes but had better
Far from being the king
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the real deal.  The very best in Philadelphia.  Don't go anywhere near Geno's for a "Taste Test" comparison--Geno's is awful and management is bigoted.  Go straight to the less flashier corner for the true First Cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great steak sandwich! Visited on October 9, 2018. If your looking for an authentic philly steak sandwich this is the place to go. If you're picky and want to compare buy 1 here and look across the street and get 1 from Genos and do a taste test yourself. Outdoor seating. Parking is limited but we were able to find a spot to park for 20 minutes while we ate.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: You must be kidding me.  THE famous cheese steak I've always heard about?  I've had better at most pizza joints in central Pa.  I hate to say it, being a lifelong Pa. resident, but I've had much better cheese steaks at at least 5 places in Manhattan.  I love cheese steaks, and this was a dry disappointment.  I had a cheese steak with provolone and "wit" onions.  I've made better with Steak Ums.  I was going to compare to Geno's across the street but I lost my appetite.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Worst cheesesteak I've ever had. Cold sandwich. Canned mushrooms. Long line. Not worth the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Almost as bad as Geno's.  Again, I don't get how aplace like this is popular.

Meat is dry and bland.  Not as dry as geno's, but still dry.  The bread is bad.  Almost stale.  Knda cheap with meat.  Not friendly at all and you walk up afraid of messing up your order.  Seriously?  Afraid to order?  Come on guys.

I guess it's a tourist trap -- and it's working for them.  Somehow people are still coming here to eat.  For what reason, I'm not sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Stopped at Pat's on my way out of Philly this past weekend. Parking is scarce so plan to spend a few minutes finding a spot. 

There were only a few people in line because it was like 11:00am.  Got right up and ordered a Wiz wit out aka my favorite.  It's $11 which is a little high but I rarely ever get to Philly post college days so it's worth it. 

The steak is very tasty and not fatty, and although I find it gross in other ways... cheese wiz complements the steak so well. 

Pat's is always solid, although I did have an issue with a soda being $3.50 despite the sign saying thank so and so for raising the price on sodas. I had just gotten one for $2 at the Reading Terminal Market the day before so $3.50 is a bit of a stretch but they can do it because you're gonna buy it. 

Pro tip: you order your sandwich at the first window and fries/drinks at the second window. You pay separately and CASH ONLY!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible staff.   My cheesesteak was cold and had no flavor.  When I said something the skinny guy with the horrible beard became rude and obnoxious.   I will NEVER EVER go there again.   Plus they don't use gloves, hair nets or beard nets.  Go elsewhere. Over priced and super rude staff.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was the original Philly cheesesteak we expected. Great flavor of the beef, lots of cheese whiz, great soft bread and  lots of sweet onions that gave the sandwich a great flavor and crunch. It was awesome! We will definetly return and recommend this place to all our family and friends.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Mediocre at best! Everyone knows Tony's beats it out! But for tourists...why not? A little competition never hurt anyone...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I thought this place was great! I've only been to Philadelphia once for less than a day, so I didn't get to try as many cheesesteak places as I wanted (but that just gives me a reason to go back). 
CHEESE WHIZ. It's a must. Don't mess up and order a different kind of cheese. You'll not be happy, and go back up to order the whiz on it. A little pricey, but I guess it's due to it having a name behind the restaurant. 
No inside seating. 
Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: better than eurocentric geno's, but still ehh
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's Vs. Geno's, Geno's Vs. Pat's, Both of them suck, go somewhere else.

Well considering that these two places are right next to each other as well as having the most air time out of the cheesesteak shops in Philly, I was compelled to finally have a taste-test showdown between the two. 

[Anyone who has read my previous review for Geno's Steaks already knows how this ends up].

Service at both venues was surprisingly quick.  In under 10 - 15 seconds, you're ready to chow-down on a hot cheesesteak sandwich.  Both places are about equal in price, Geno's being only slightly more expensive by under a dollar margin [$0.00 - 0.99].  

As far as taste goes, Geno's steak is more tender and the bread is fresher and tastier overall.  Pat's gives you more steak, but the bread is a bit tough and when left plain [non-cheesesteak] the steak is bland.  If I had to choose between the two from the sandwiches I had, I would go with Geno's.  Nothing wrong with Pat's but there isn't anything special either.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Made a one day stop in Philly during our NYC trip and definitely had to swing by one of the cheese steak joints.  We decided to go by Pat's and I thought it was pretty good.  What was really good at first was that they make cheese steak as fast if not faster than when you order from a fast-food place. I expected a bit better cheese steak considering that Philly's expertise are the steaks.  Next time I'll check out the competition of Geno's and Jim's and see which is the king of cheese steaks in Philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I had Pat's when a friend was visting while I was doing a stint in Philly.  I kept hearing how Pat's was featured and thought it was be good to test it out.  

I learned not to trust food network on that day.

I had a cheesesteak with provolone cheese.  The meat was dry, the cheese did not help and the hype was definitely way too high.  

I spoke with a couple of native Philadelphians and their comment was: "no one that lives in Philly would actually go to those two places."

Lesson learned.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Again, I have been told to try both Pat's and Geno's. For me personally, Geno's was better because of the bread. However, Pat's was still good. I wouldn't return to Pat's but I would return to Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best cheesesteaks in soutphilly, a little greasy n u might be waiting a few mins but worth the wait!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There's always a line but its well worth it. My friends and I do road trips from NYC to Philly just for cheese steaks. I know you probably think we are crazy, but its so good. The meat is tender, the pepper and onions adds great flavor and the bread is perfect and you top it off with cheese whiz and its party time.!! There's also Gino's across the street. but I prefer Pats. Great cheese steak and I will continue to go here.!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Oh no, Pat's does not deserve two stars.  I gave two stars to Geno's, and Pat's is worse, so one star it is.

The meat doesn't taste like anything.  Nor does the cheese, the onions, or peppers.  It's just a spongy roll filled with wet greasy ingredients of unknown provenance.

WTF, Philly?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
AVOID THIS TOURIST SCAM; COLD CHEESESTEAK; RUDE STAFF
First visit to Philly this past weekend and decided to try out this place for lunch after hearing about its reputation about being the "best/oldest." There were some tourists eating out there, but no line. Because we were a party of 5, we wanted to order a variety of thing including the famous cheesesteak. When I asked the staff if he has anything else to recommend, he became inpatient and told us that this place is only famous for its cheesesteak and I should just go read the menu if I want anything else. Before I could ask another question, he was like"if you want it, then pay now. If not, next." I was turned off by him for sure but since we were already there, decided to go ahead and buy 2 cheesesteaks anyway.  To my disappointment, I was handed two pre-wrapped cheesesteak that were COLD.  there was no pepper, no onion.  Just two pieces of bread with bunch of dry-tasting meat and 2 slabs of hard cheese.  I could have gotten a better deal from Charlie's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Pats and Genos today.....The good: Pats wins between the two with me but man was I disappointed...second trip here and last time was far better.We have a similar chain in Houston called Pappa Genos....and it is 10x better than both. Sorry. My kids were like why are the people so rude...Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best thing on the menu is a $2.5 coke.  Poor quality of beef covered with lard of cheese is not what I was expecting for $10. Very disappointed with my first Philly cheese steak in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hands down the best! Wit whiz for days!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Waiting in a long line with high expectations only to be disappointed.  For the $10.00 price of a sub I would expect to receive a sandwich where the steak and cheese filled the roll.  There are plenty of sandwich shops in Mass. & N.Y. that make far superior cheese-steaks, don't waste your time or your money.  Additionally if Pat's continues to skimp on those ingredients I don't think they will have to worry about those long lines for long!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible experience. A perfect definition of a tourist trap. The cheesteak was so dry that I could hardly finish it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I can say I at least tried it. I ordered the pizza cheesesteak with provolone from the first window and cheese fries from the second. The sandwich lacked flavor, the provolone wasn't melted, and instead of putting the pizza sauce inside the roll, it was somehow only outside. Secondly, the cheese fries were too cheesy and were completely soggy after just a few mins. 

I appreciated how fast the lines moved. I even tried to read ahead on how to order so I wouldn't be the hold up. Unfortunately, there were 2 girls in line who didn't see the large "cash only" sign or realize they make the sandwiches as you're ordering and you shouldn't step far away from the window. They weren't treated too kindly by the workers or regulars in line LOL. 

It was fun to experience the famous Pat's King of Steaks, but I don't need to go back next time I'm in town for an Eagles game. I plan to try a steak place thats less stressful and actually has bathrooms for customers!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Eh...I just don't get it! 
I've oficially now had Pat's, Geno's and Jim's all once now...yes..I know there are more..BUT
Pat's=Geno's and Geno's = Pat's
Same greasy, too soft bun with loads of cheese...
I was slightly day drinking at the Italian market festival and decided I'll give Pat's a go since I haven't had it yet (the line was much shorter than Geno's), my neighbor's daughter wanted fries, and I needed to walk past to get to the auto shop.

Super quick service I ordered, and my sandwich was already waiting for me while I paid!
I get the novelty of just meat cheese and onions and "ordering properly" but some customization would be nice. However I did order my sandwich "togo" but it wasn't wrapped or in a bag...once I saw some people with bags I decided to go back..get a bag and some extra papers and wrap up my own sandwich. 

And whats with the separate windows for the sandwich, fries and a drink? Are these two separate lines? Do you have to pay separately? So confused..

Honestly...I think I can make a better cheesesteak with some steak-ums, provolone and a crusty roll.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You know back in my day, I remember when I could get one of these cheesesteaks for $7!  You know, like a few years ago - literally?

I went here last week on a visit to Philadelphia and found that the price of a regular cheesesteak was $10 now.  What kind of inflation are they running here?  The place known for their cheese whiz had me going gee-whiz when I took out a $10 bill.  BTW, I hate how these places make all this money, yet can't afford to get with the credit card acceptance program.

Anyways, if you were unaware, this place is right across the street from Genos.  Wish I checked the prices at Genos while I was there.  Didn't even bother ordering a drink or fries.  Just because the word 'steak' is in 'cheesesteak' doesn't mean I should be paying steak prices!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We drove for an hour to get here. WORST PHILLY CHEESE STEAK EVER. I am not sure how and why they are famous. Meat was not good. It was chewy and tasted weird. The cheese was disgusting. The onion was not even caramelized it was something else. It's a poor sandwich. What a waste of time to drive all the way up to try this indigent sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Fan of both Pats and Genos.  Pats roll is on the dryer side and both places chop their steak up differently.
Bring cash an your order for a quick transaction.   

If you are a tourist watch out during the high traffic times and just sit and eat your cheesiest where you bought it.  Freshness is key.  

Free peppers are sweet and spicy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes it's a tourist trap.

Yes it's overpriced at $8.50 a steak

But dammit with sliced steak that was tender and seasoned, some whiz and a little hot sauce it was sooooo good!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It is too commercial... yea.. but it is still very good!  I have plenty of Philly Friends that LOVE and HATE this place.  I happen to be one that loves it.  Anyone that hates this place is just from another neighborhood.  Sure Jim's is great, Dalessandro's is legit, but Pat's is as good as both of them.
I love this place.  The sandwiches are very  good and the service sucks... what more can you ask for!  Anyone that says it sucks and only tourists come here... explain the line around the corner at 2 AM on a Saturday.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my favorite spot to hit late night. Anytime I am away for a while, the first thing I do when I land is go straight to Pat's to get welcomed home. Really quick service, fantastic meat-- and of course the cheese wiz! Across the street is the bright light tourist trap Geno's, but this spot is worth the wait if theres a little line. Wiz Wit!
