The only good thing about this were the onions. If you're thinking about coming to this place- DON'T! You can find a way better cheesesteak at Subway. Super disappointed and will never come here or recommend it to anyone. Also the people preparing the sandwiches weren't wearing any gloves when making them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's Steaks were damn good.

As a tourist, I did the rounds of several major cheesesteak spots and can say I thoroughly enjoyed Pat's. Their cheesesteaks were packed! The meat was chopped and packed thick- and it was dripping cheesy goodness! I'm not from Philly, so I can say this without any bias- Pat's was legit.

I'm aware that Pat's is considered a tourist cheesesteak shop, but this is one tourist shop I'll keep coming back to. Out of all the cheesesteaks I tried in Philly, this one was the fattest and cheesiest- I loved it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
For a number of years I was down on Pat's.  I think it's because it became the place to be.  I tend t shun the "in" places.

Here's the thing, after a disappointing day doing things north of the city, I decided to pop in the city on the way home for a quick bite.  I found a place to park right out front.  I was fortunate, of course.  South Philly parking is for professionals.

Anyhow, I ordered a mushroom cheessteak wit.  It really doesn't get any better than this.  The sandwich is handed to you immediately as they are efficient as can be.  The cherry peppers on the condiment bar are fabulous!

I really can't think how a cheessteak can be better.  This is full of meat.  If you're in Philly, you're getting whiz.  The roll is very good.  What more is there?

Yes, I am once again a Pat's fan!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After a 7 hour drive, this was everything I had hoped for.  Tasty steak in a very fresh roll, topped with onions and cheese wiz.   Had the cheese fries, too.  Better than I expected, as I'm not a fan of battered fries, but these were really good.

Came in on a Sunday afternoon and only had to wait a few minutes.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Shortest line won, pretty good steak sammy but the fries were cold and sucked. Nothing else to say but my review is tooooo short to post
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hey, this bit of Pat's Steaks history is on eBay, and I thought I'd share it here for fun!       http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=171106503689
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't get the hype to be honest. Maybe I'm just not crazy about philly cheesesteak. The flavor was just ok, maybe needs more seasoning on the meat? The portion is huge for 1 person since the bread is pretty thick and long. One thing i really liked was the large pickled peppers (goes really well with the cheesesteak). Line was long but moves quickly. You need to know what you want and talk fast when you're in the counter. You don't have time to think when they are getting your orders. Only CASH here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to this spot with 7 friends, it was pouring rain and there was no line, we all decided together to go here rather than Geno's across the street which also didn't have a line.  I ordered my sandwich and before I can even order a drink or fries my sandwich was in front of me which is disgusting because that means it wasn't fresh and again there was no one there besides my friends and I . I came all the way from New York to have the famous sandwich that was freezing cold and beyond mediocre, the only thing hot was the cheese but it tasted old, the fries were AIGHT but mad cold. Again, no line, this place apparently rings bells but rang all the wrong ones for me. OH AMD THE PEOPLE WORKING THERE WERE NOT POLITE AT ALL- I'll go to Jim's any day
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best cheesesteak I've had to date in Philly! The steak had a great flavor and the combination of all the ingredients just made it better than Geno's in my opinion. They don't have to try to be flashy to grab their customers. Their simplicity and ties to their originality show why they are the king of steaks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's and Geno's are right next to each other and I am sure most have heard of the legendary rivalry. I would not call either place the best in Philly or even in the top ten. Pat's however makes an alright classic cheese steak and has become a tourist destination.

For the most part the lines move quickly so don't be worried about a long line. The guys who work there are focused on moving people through.

I have tried the beef, pork, fries and various topping combinations. Some times if I order something that isn't a classic cheese steak the guy I order from is super rude about it. I had a friend who can't eat beef. I got pork and the guy looked at me and said, "Really? Are you serious?!" He then clicked his tongue and motioned me along. Other times they are simply professional and trying to get the line moving quickly.

The bread is usually lightly toasted and they give you a decent amount of meat. I would recommend the provolone unless you want to give the classic cheese wiz a shot. They do an alright job and the food is a little better then fast food. As for the fries, I could take it or leave it. I have sometimes gotten a steak where my onions are almost raw and I am not super into that. they are usually a little more consistent. If the prices were any higher I would give this place a two. It is okay food for the price. It is not a terrible introduction to Philly cheese steaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My absolute favorite Philly cheesesteak place. I always get the cheesesteak with cheese whiz and onions. The prices are around $10 which isn't bad. There's two windows you can order. One window is just cheesesteak and other cheesesteak like things and the other window is just for drinks and fries. There's a counter where you choose from the different types of peppers as well, free of charge. It's kind of in the middle of nowhere but there's still a lot of people and not far from Chinatown and the city center. There are also seats and benches with covering. 

Tip: you have to eat it right away because once it gets cold or if you get it take out, it taste different, still good but not as good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The lines are always long for Pat's famous steaks and it's definitely fun and exciting for a first timer. The food is good but it's not amazing! Wouldn't say it's the best cheesesteak but they do well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wow, Pat's lived up to its name.  The succulent meat with the cheese and the onion on the hoagie.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I just noticed I never wrote a review for Pat's when I was in Philly in April...  I don't know how I missed this one!


I did the touristy thing in Philly... a cheese steak from Pats... and a cheese steak from Geno's. Side by side... ready... go.

I realize this is a touchy subject in this area... when you like your cheese steak... you LOVE your cheese steak... and I think I like Geno's better.

I'm ready for the hate mail...

Pat's is good.  Don't get me wrong.  It's better than anything I would get in Northern Virginia  - pretending to be a sub... but I like the meat, and the bread better across the street.

Sorry Pat.  I still love you!  xoxo
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Rude staff, no hygiene and very ordinary cheese steak. Jim's is much better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Such an Over Rated place!!!! Their meat was not cooked well and we definitely like out meat well done! Very crowded place, they take ONLY CASH and you have to know beforehand what you want. Save your money for some other place, believe me. My husband is a Cheese Steak lover and he wanted to try this place after hearing so much about this place but no way we are going here again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Lots of juicy steak on a chewy roll, just enough Whiz.  Don't forget to get a birch beer and god to the fixin's bar to add cherry peppers.  This is the world's best cheesesteak, period!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Where to begin ... my boyfriend and I waited on a line to get some real deal Philly cheesesteaks ... and I feel like for 10 dollars, there wasn't enough steak in between those buns (kind of upsetting) I feel because this establishment has been there for so many years (all cash business) they can get away with not packing your cheesesteak with a lot of meat. 
Thank you for disappointing me, 
a true meat lover 

Will try Geno's across the street next time!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely better than Geno's.  Fries were better than expected.  But, honestly, the line between good/mediocre cheese steaks in Philly is pretty slim.  So, I'm not sure why everyone is so up in arms about whose is better.  You're more or less going to get the same thing everywhere (which is a good thing).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place sucks. Don't let them make you think that this is what a philly cheese steak is, because it is not burnt dry steak served by someone who is rude and does not care. Any other place  is better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I was the basic tourist and had to try both Pat's and Geno's. Honestly they're both about equal, basic cheese steak & kind of rude staff, everything I hoped it would be. Not my favorite steak in the city but one of those places you have to try before you leave.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: As a foodie, I was so excited to try a cheesesteak in Philly that I wasn't prepared for the disappointment of realizing that it may be one of those tastes you have to grow up on to appreciated (like Kraft Mac N Cheese or In N Out). I didn't realize what I was getting into, that it would be cheap cuts of meat with cheese whiz on it and sub-par bread. There's nothing gourmet about the place or Geno's across the street (we tried both). The real win was finding the food stalls a short walk away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Omg just don't go here and with go to jims or Steve's.    This is the worst cheesesteak. Even after washing my hands.  They continue to smell a racoons a** .   It was actually making me and my friend gang how bad it was.    Terrible.  Tourist trap!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So i compared Pat's philly cheese steak with Geno's across the island and i found i liked Pat's cheese steak a lot more. I think i like the ribbons of steak more as it captured the cheese in its ribbons. The bread was very soft and easy to hold. Super warm to the touch. Lots of condiments, but we really didn't need any for this delicious sandwich. Not as much seating space as Geno's though.

CASH ONLY ENTERPRISE! $10 for a sub!

Careful, there are quite a handful of homeless people that mutter and come towards you to interrupt your meal!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I give this place one star. I'm originally from Florida and was down visiting in New Jersey. I always wanted to try a Philly Cheesesteak, so I drove down to Philly (1 hour 30 min drive), because of the reviews on Google.

Let me just say "Total Disappointment". The meat lacked flavor no salt or pepper. The provolone cheese was like one slice, over powerd by hard mushrooms and soggy bread....

Totally not worth the $12 also they charge $3.50 for a small coke.

Take my advice and find somewhere else. I have had way better Philly steaks from out of my own kitchen.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
They get three stars for failure to read and follow instructions. 

Ordered via Doordash, ordered two cheese steaks with mayo and ketchup both had neither. Cheese fries with cheese on top received it on the side. SMH... So irritating!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Helloooooo Yelp!,

Hi everyone, this is my numero uno review eva!  Whatttttt up?!?

Not to say that I'm a cheesesteak pro or anything, but! I did go on an all cheesesteak diet for a day while visiting Philly to truly determine FOR MYself, which cheesesteak is........ the KING OF CHEESESTEAKS!  When I say ALL cheesesteak diet, I mean breakfast, lunch, dinner, and midnight snack! (Don't judge me... =\)

After trying Pat's, Jim's, Geno's and Pat's again, by unanimous decision... still!.... king of cheesesteaks!...... "Pats!...  King of Steaks! since 1930."

To describe how bombtastic this sandwich is, you gotta imagine the feeling of a hot summer day.... you're looking for a place to cool down, a place to relax and just enjoy yourself, like a nice cool swimming pool. That hot summer day is HUNGER, and that oh so refreshing pool is CHEESE WHIZZ!!!!

Pat's just knows what they're doing "wit" the whizzz, it just has the most perfect consistency.  Not too watery, not to thick, but just oh so right....  So good, you can fill a cup with and drink it.  And that's what they did!  They fill a cup with cheese whiz, throw some fries in there, and there you have it.  A cup filled wit whiz or you can call them cheese fries.  But who in their right mind would order that?  Certainly not me.... maybe....  Mmmmm whizzz.....

Besides the oh so great cheese whiz, the steak is just heavenly and those pickled round peppers and crisp chili's are no joke.  Those lil extras take Pat's to a whole nother level.  Those peppers are what makes Pat's.... Pat's!  I couldn't find better from any other place.  

With that said, yes I'm on the Pat's bandwagon, but it's well deserved.  Me and Pat's are one now.... or should I say were one...  Now go get yourself a cheesesteak wit onions and whiz!  Don't get too fancy!

Until next time peoples!
Keep on, eatin on!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The taste is not that great as expected or advertised. Drove long way just to break heart.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Delicious sandwich but the bread was stale. The ordering was easy and worth the wait in line.  Cash only and ensure to be aware of what you want unless you want to be sent to the back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know why this has so many crap reviews, maybe I have to try more cheesesteaks haha. But in my opinion, nothing beat this sandwich at 3AM... So hot you can get with onions or without. It was everything I expected it would be. Would recommend it over Genos
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Got a cheesesteak (with whiz) and honestly, was not that surprised or please about it.

The bun felt greasy and yet didn't taste that good and clearly was just a medium to consume the rest of the ingredients, didn't really bring anything else to the dish. I could've just ate this in a bowl without the bun and I would've enjoyed it just as much and save the carbs.

The steak itself, maybe just a personal preference, I would've preferred it to be more shredded so you can get more surface area for the cheese and for easier bites. Enjoyed the mushrooms and onions with it, but honesty I didn't feel like I had a phili cheesesteak in phili when I came here. Just meh
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm 36 and this was my first cheesesteak...in my life...ever! What better place to go to than the place that created the sandwich. 

Ordering is simple but you have to be quick! I went all in and got Wit Wiz. The sandwich was huge! I probably shouldn't have eaten it all by myself but I did. And I ate fries as well. And had a soda. All were delicious. My belly was happy and I'm glad I got the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Still missing a little something from the cheesesteaks. Still really good and definitely better than the India across the streets. But would definitely go there again
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteaks here are ok I guess, but certainly not deserving of the hype they get. However, the thing that sticks out about this place is the piss-poor service. Are all new hires required to take a course on how to be the biggest pricks they can possibly be to customers?

The asshole taking orders had a real attitude and refused to give me the change I was owed. He didn't even count the money before putting it in the register, and kept trying to move right on to the next person and insisting I gave him the exact amount. I figured it wasn't worth holding up others from ordering their overrated cheesesteaks to keep arguing with that douchebag.

Oh yeah and God forbid you don't place your order using their stupid lingo. Seeing how it is more of a tourist attraction than a place for locals, they might want to try not giving people who are unfamiliar with their lingo a dickish attitude if they're not perfect at ordering. They're obsessed with keeping the line moving fast, yet it probably moves slower because of the confusion created by requiring people to order using their pointless, made-up lingo.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I really don't get what all they hype is about? I can get this kind of cheese steak any where! I went to both places and split it with my husband nothing to be amazed about ppl
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So we came to Philadelphia pretty much specifically to try Philly Cheesesteak sandwiches. Asking several locals of course got several answers.... After all the hoopla we made it to Pat's and found it was truly the best of all.

The meat was properly cooked, seasoned and cut... cheese was poured on top on a soft bun anid it really was good.

To compare we also tried the competition across the street and found it was not nearly as tasty.

If you're looking for Philly Cheesesteak sandwich you'll be very satisfied with Pat's. Only thing is it's a little away from downtown but worth it
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was in town for the Army-Navy game and of course, everyone says go to Geno's and Pat's. I was surprised that Pat's only has 3 stars for being such a popular place (and Geno's has 2.5 yikes). 

My boyfriend wanted to grab one last cheese steak before heading back home, so we stopped by on a Sunday morning around 10:30a.m. There was still a good couple few eating already, so we each grabbed a sandwich, both with mushrooms, cheese and peppers. 

The food came out super fast which is a pro, but compared to John's Pork Roast Pork (which makes everything to order), the quality didn't cut it. The bread was pretty soggy in some parts of the sandwich, the onions weren't grilled enough to be soft. I did, however, like the peppers at Pat's a lot more. And I loved the huge heap of whole peppers they have on the stand -- spicy but delicious. Overall, the sandwich was a little bland for me and I had to eat a few of those peppers to get through. 

Definitely seems more of a drunk food spot , esp. since it's open 24 hours. For a quality cheese steak, I'd go back to John's Pork Roast!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
--- Short Synopsis ---

Pats and Geno's are a must stop (tourist) destination for any Philly visitor! Pats more so because it is better and the original!

Pats cheesesteaks are about the steak! In terms of proportions of meat to bread, Pats seems to have a nice good amount of steak. This is both a blessing and a curse. 

--- Detailed Review ---

For parking, there is street parking nearby as people come and go from Pats and Geno's. Pats has specific instructions on how to order, which is placed right before the ordering window. Just read and follow instructions. You can practice while you're waiting in line. For example, a cheesesteak with onions and cheese whiz would be "one wiz with." Pats, like Geno's, is cash only and a normal cheesesteak is (currently) $10. This price range seems to be the norm around Philly.

My favorite part of Pats cheesesteaks is the meat! They put a nice portion on the cheesesteak and it oozes out juices and grease! With this in mind, make sure you eat it over a table, so the juices and grease don't get on your clothes. 

With the large amount of meat, the (soft) bread and onions can fade into the background of the cheesesteak, which some would enjoy. Personally, I wish the onions and bread had a more prominent role. Also, the cheese and onions are put on top of meat/cheesesteak. This allows for a greater visual appeal, but makes it less practical to eat. The onions and melted cheese can easily fall off the sandwich onto your hands, face, table, etc. As stated before, make sure you eat over a table to avoid the drippings getting on your clothes. 

Nonetheless, still a delicious cheesesteak!

Pats is definitely something to try if you're visiting Philly!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've had three cheesesteaks in Philly and this is my favorite one. Why? I like a sandwich that is NOT dry. I got a cheesesteak with cheez wiz and cooked onions and mushrooms and I thought it was delicious (by delicious I mean fatty, hurts my stomach, and makes me want to hit the gym as soon as my food digests). Lots of outdoor seating. I did not spy a bathroom. Cheesesteak and a drink will run you $12.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On my recent trip to Philadelphia I had to have a Cheesesteak and Pat's was the first place we decided to try.

There was a line but these folk have it down in terms of moving people through quickly. All your hear as your get closer to the window is multiple people yelling: "Next!" "Next!" But no complaints from me, as it was pushing over 90 degrees the day I was there so the sooner I was out of the sun the better.

In terms of the Cheesesteak- It was ok. I certainly wasn't blown away. I loved the bread it was served on. Fresh and tasty. We went with the steak, cheese whiz and onions. Together they made nice combination. However, the meat by itself was a little flavorless. No seasoning what so ever.

Overall, a good sandwich but I don't see myself rushing back the next time I'm in Philly.

Note: Cash only
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came here to try their famous Philly cheesesteak and I arrived here around midnight on October 20th. The sandwich was a tad bit dry for my liking, each Philly came up about 11$! This is a cash only place, but there is atms around the area. The location was pretty nice because there was a bunch of bars around. They're also open 24/7 so when i arrived there wasn't a line and no wait for your sandwich
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bought a sandwich from both spots. The cheesesteak tastes better than Geno's, but the fries and building needs work. Truly a tourist sandwich. I don't have to go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Gino's or Pat's,,, decided on Pat's this morning. And, taking a bit of a risk, instead of the usual provolone, gonna finally try the Whiz.

Got the  cheesesteak, Whiz, wit. I guess the best way to describe the cheese wiz is, if you like the cheese in Kraft Macaroni & Cheese, you will probably like this cheesesteak. 

I'd have to say the cheesesteak was pretty good,  about a 7. But, now that I've tried it,  will probably go back to my old way, a mixture of provolone and sharp provolone "wit"their grilled onions.
.
Made for a great breakfast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Now I know why the name King of Steaks! This was the winner of the Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich. We got the whiz with onions and let me tell you every bite was perfect, perfect balance of onions, cheese and steak. This was my ultimate favorite Philly cheesesteak sandwich. 

We also order some fries but they weren't fresh or hot, seems like they were sitting out for a while (not ideal for me) but they had a good crunchy to them. 

I didn't like the sitting or the fact that the sandwich is not wrap when served (compared to Geno's across the street) 

But overall this is the place to get your Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is pretty good.  It's right across the street from Geno's and since the line looked really long at Geno's, I thought I'd try Pat's instead.  There are clear instructions at the side of the ordering window so you know how it works.  

Step 1: Wit or witout onions.
Step 2: add ons/ type of sandwich
Step 3: pay

Next window is for sides, drink, etc.  

Tables are outside and fairly clean when I was there.  You're pretty much surrounded by neighborhood traffic.  There's a pepper and condiment bar that consists of big, yummy pickled peppers, ketchup, mustard, and black pepper.  

My sandwich of choice: provolone wit onions.  Pretty good.  I've actually had better in California, though I'm excited to try some Philly Yelp recommends for better cheese steak.  I know that Pat's and Geno's are more for tourist and there are better finds elsewhere in the city.  

Pat's was good for a lazy afternoon after the Italian Market. Cheap, fast, filling, and yummy.  Worth a try.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is a very sloppy sandwich but it's so delicious and not greasy. Heads up please make sure you know what to order. The line is long but it moves super fast. Everything is delicious
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Why are they considered the "King of Steaks"? They are the worst!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The Best Cheesesteak in the United States!! Since 1930 that says it all. The People that work there are Great Hard working people and the food is AWESOME!!! Thank you Chef Frank for carry on the Family Tradition
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'll summarize this place as horse meat on a soggy 
Roll with something that is suppose to be cheese but
Is more like a yellow chemical, service is vulgar and annoying!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
[Pt 2 of 2]

As it was my first visit to Philly this summer, how could I not try Pat's & Geno's?  I know it's a tourist trap and the line takes about 15-20mins during weekend lunch hours.

The cheese steaks at Pat's looks appealing, with a huge pile of chopped rib eye beef overflowing out of the roll.  With grease dripping down your hand with each bite, it's a greasy mess to eat.  It requires at least 3 napkins to eat.  I also got a huge chunk of meat that wouldn't break and I almost choked on it.  The tendon wouldn't break so I had to spit it out.

I prefer Geno's just because it seems like the healthier option.  5 out of 5 people in my little road trip agreed.  The flavors were very similar.  They must use the same seasoning (salt & pepper).

Service was unfriendly and we were treated like cattle.  We were rushed to order and they moved onto the next cow.  There is a ridiculous 2nd line for drinks & fries.  However I prefer the fries from Pat's.  They had a good crispy exterior, as if they were thickly battered.  

I got the cheese steak with the provolone cheese & onions.  Food Feuds with Chef Michael Symon from the Food Network came here and they won the giant trophy on the show but only cuz Pat's had whiz on their steak.  I don't think it was a fair match since they compare apples to apples (or provolone to provolone) like I did.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: By far one of the best tasting cheese fries I've ever had in my life.... can't figure out if it ranks first or second but without a doubt it's in the top 3... after I left I wish I got two order... sooo much delicious cheeeeese. Was wondering what if I had gotten extra cheese OMGGGGGG
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Got to this place in a good time as there was zero line. It is a good cheesesteak, but cannot say it was anything amazing or worth any better than a 3 star. Would i go back? maybe, but there are definitely better spots out there for cheesesteaks. I had the wiz/wit (cheese wiz and onions). Again, good, but can't say I would recommend this spot due to great food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place has the worst customer service. I bought the philly cheesesteak and I brought it back to my car. Because of the oil, I put the sandwich in a plastic bag and I decided I wanted more cheese. So i went back and they said I could pay a dollar more so I said sure and gave them the sandwich. They said they cant because it doesnt look like their sandwich. I literally bought it a few minutes ago but they still refused. Wtf is this service?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Extremely casual place...in a little corner and busy al the time: that's how good the cheesesteak is! In my opinion, this is the best Philly cheesesteak...cheese with onions...they even have a sign that teaches you how to order the steak. It's no big deal if you order the wrong way at all for newbies like me the first time I tried it. Employees are super friendly even at their busiest time which is I think in the afternoon. The line moves quick though and watching them prepare the cheesesteak is awesome...and they're fast! Some people prefer Geno's ...I'm not a fan of their steak...stick to Pat's and you won't go wrong! I swear and I love food! 
This is a must for any visitor in Philadelphia...if you have a long layover at the airport, uber or lyft is about $10 maybe one way so you can try the best Philly cheesesteak in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I grew up in Northeast PA and I was told, "You only go to Pat's." Don't tell my friends but yesterday I tried both Pat's and Geno's side by side. I am thrilled to say that the winner was...Pat's!

I'll be honest, the cheese steaks are very similar in taste. Pat's has a creamier and more flavorful cheese. Geno's was a bit greasier, which affected the taste. 

Yes it is all unhealthy, but yes it is delicious. Go to Pat's - you won't be disappointed. They don't need the flashy colors or lights, it is just good food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had the cheesesteak wit onions, wit provolone, and fries.  Had the souvenir soda, but I was thinking the souvenir soda was just a cup, but it is one of the souvenir type cups from an amusement park, with the bendy straws and cap on the top of the straw.  The cheesesteak was a bit dry, the fries were good, and so was the cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had the cheesesteak whiz wit (with onions), and it was the worst cheesesteak sandwich I've ever had. The meat was not chopped, which is not a big deal except that it was tough to chew and had absolutely zero flavor. The bread was a soggy mess, and the cheese whiz didn't have much flavor either.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Better than geone's because there's more meat, it's less salty and has better flavor! 

However keep in mind it's $2-$3 more expensive. 
BUT net net, both were pretty bad cheesesteaks. But if I had to pick between the two (pats vs geone) id pick here. 

Am I ever going back to Pats? No. 
I'd give Geone like one star. 

Go to Sonny's for a better cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is pretty much a tourist trap along with Geno's across the street.  Ordered a cheesesteak wit and onions and a regular cheesesteak and they were bad.   My son said the sandwich wit tasted like a hot pocket ha ha.  Very little meat inside and stale bread.  If you ask me I think they paid to be on tv shows (food network etc.) Save your money and go to one of the other cheesesteak places in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bottom line of the story that I had with this place, I ordered a Cheesesteak Sandwich but what i got when i opened the wrapper is that there's no cheese on top. So I went back to the cashier to ask for cheese on top, and that i'll even pay extra if anything. What I got in return was rude attitude "That steak does not look like ours, so we can't add cheese on top. You probably got this across the street and came here for cheese, we can't help you". This response is outrageous and disappointing. Never coming back here again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Steak was good not the best i had  , very fast service and great customer service
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Simply stated: No self-respecting Philadelphia native would ever eat here. What you will find here are tourists, Rangers fans, "bros" from South Jersey, and people who just plain don't know any better. The meat and cheese are always cold, the rolls soggy, onions undercooked, and there is hardly any meat on the sandwich at all. It's not the impression you want to get of a cheesesteak.

Do yourself a favor and go to John's Roast Pork, Gooey Louie's, or pretty much anywhere else in South Philly that isn't on that tourist trap corner.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
While we are talking about a cheesesteak spot, this place is heavily hyped.  Bright lights, features on the Food and Travel channels....the whole nine.  How can you not think that you're in for an amazing Philly cheesesteak experience?  One that makes you want to start running up the steps of the Philadelphia Museum of Art and jumping around in victory like Rocky Balboa.

Yeaaaaaaaaaa.......NO!  I came on a Sunday evening to check out and compare Philly's finest in comfort food.  I realize that nothing could match up to my beloved chicken finger sub but I'm an open minded person when it comes to deciding what would finish in 2nd place.  

Service was shoddy.  Order taker was very nonchalant and disinterested.  I'm a city boy myself so I get it in terms of the blue collar attitude for a blue collar meal but still.....etiquette?

The cheesesteak itself was pathetic in terms of appearance.  It looked haphazardly tossed together, cheese whiz slopped onto it.  Another glaring thing was it was missing.....the rest of the meat!!!  Cheesesteaks are known for being packed with meat are they not?  Did a badger manage to get to mine before it reached my hands?  If I had a voice like the narrator from "Unsolved Mysteries" we could sho' nuff figure this thing out. 

Alas, I took my measly little sub and ate.  Meh....meh.......MEH!  It was ok and I'm probably being generous.  Very bland and not very fulfilling.  Relatively inexpensive ($6-$7).  Good thing I had other spots to check out because otherwise I would've left Philly a sad and hungry person.  So much for brotherly love!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrated... hot sauce states weird, don't waste your money!! Jersey makes better cheesesteaks... :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I get the Wit Wiz!!!! It's so good!!!! Better than Geno's in my opinion. I love the wiz and the cooked onions with the steak. It's really simple but so good. Worth the experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The first time I went to Philadelphia for cheesesteaks I try both Genos and Pats. Since that day I never looked back and stuck with Pat's King of Steaks! So don't eat a miSTEAK!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in Philadelphia so I wanted to try the original (don't @ me)! I got a whiz wit peppers/mushrooms. It was solid! After a day of traveling, it was what I wanted: quick comfort food. Pat's/Uber Eats had it to my hotel in 20 mins. It's not going to blow your mind. In fact, the way you're imagining that it tastes is exactly how it tastes. I'd definitely recommend it as an alternative to chain fast food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Phil Gattuso punched his Lunch Bucket List here at Pat's.  For this, and the excellent food, 5 stars.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After watching YouTube Videos for Reviews, my husband and I were actually afraid to try Pat's because the people we watched on YouTube didn't list Pat's as one of their favorites out of all the cheesesteak places they tried. BUT.. we went to a highly recommended/favorite spot (which I will keep unnamed) and was highly disappointed. My husband and I decided that we should eat another cheesesteak elsewhere to redeem the cheesesteak glory and we decided to come here. We were very surprised on how good it actually was!!

This is a cash only establishment I believe, so make sure you have cash on hand. You order your cheesesteak from one window and fries/soda from another window. They are 24/7 and we came at like 9:30AM. Haha. 

We ordered a cheesesteak with whiz, onions, and peppers. Side of fries and soda. The cheesesteak was literally done in like 10 seconds, which concerned me since it may be a bit old, but whatever. I already bought it. Fries took about 3-5mins.

Cheesesteak was DELICIOUS!! Not too wet or dry. Had lots of cheese and I love cheese!! I don't think their meats are seasoned, but the cheese and peppers give it flavor. We were shocked on how good it was. They do have pickled hot peppers on the side, which was a great compliment to the cheesesteak. The bread held everything together nicely. The fries were good. Nothing special. I wished they cooked it a bit longer. 

Overall, we would totally recommend this place way way way before we would recommend the other place we've eaten. We were happy to eat this cheesesteak right before we left Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's the best Philly Cheese Steak in town, a must go when in South Philadelphia, located by the Italian Market. I never had them better, just almost as good, or worst. 

Don't feel intimidated when you come here for the first time, and before ordering you are reading the 'Rules of Ordering PCS'. Just order and when you get it wrong, well just get another one after you finish the first. My motto at Pat's is; eat two and then one to go.

 '3 is the Magic Number'
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is just a place for true Philadelphians to take tourists as real Philadelphians don't frequent Pat's or Geno's... they go to Tony Luke's, John's Roast Beef or Jim's!

This is merely a tourist attraction for those who are truly not in the know as to what is the best and where to go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simple you want the Best you go to the Best Pat's King of Steaks! Now they have delivery all over United States!! I was the first to order in the USA! Hey Philly Michigan says Hello
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I just moved to Philly and wanted to see what a cheesesteak is to locals, so I came here with some friends who said they like Pat's. I've always loved getting Philly cheesesteaks whenever it was on the menu when I was living out of state...but I really don't like Cheese Whiz and I'm probably going to get stoned for this. I wasn't impressed. Okay, I got the Pizza Steak, not the original...but I don't know what the hype is about besides the history. Also not that friendly of staff...the line was long and they only accept cash and were about to give us the boot in line for not knowing what we wanted when we got up to order lol.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I personally love it here even though it's a tourist spot, it just has that special taste. The fact that it's open 24 hours is also a plus.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ok our family from Los Angeles decides to visit both places for the show down.   Being from LA, we don't believe in cheese wiz as we have a more refine taste.   We ordered the cheesesteak with Provolone and onions ($11) from both.   We sat down to try both.  Looking at both cheesesteak, initially they look exactly alike, except Pat's seems to be juicier as we unwrap both.

The meat in Pat's was a bit more tender than Gino and definitely more juicy.
Gino was too dry and chewy.  Both buns appears to be the same but with the juices flowing out of Pat's, it made it easier to chew through the buns.

We decided to go back to Pat's for another cheesesteak but with mushrooms and onions($12j, again nice and juicy but the meat seems to be more chewier this time.   The mushroom appears to be like those canned button mushrooms which I really don't care for.   

Overall they are not too bad. Skip the fries with cheese($6j small cup.  They are awful.

Back in LA, I rather eat a good roast beef sandwich or pastrami sandwich from The Hat with chili fries, for the same price.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Recently move to the Philly area and you better believe I get asked about how many Philly Cheese Steaks I eat a week. Well Pat's has definitely helped to keep my numbers respectable and keep my LA friends jelly.

I have had cheese whiz and white cheese and I can't believe I would say this, but when at Pat's go cheese whiz, it delicious. 

Quick tips, CASH ONLY, nothing worse than coming here starving after a late night and not having cash, luckily there are ATMs a couple minutes away that will be happy to charge you $3 for a withdrawal.  They have 2 lines one for food one for drinks. Also when you're in Philly people want you to order fast, so make sure you know what you want before its your turn, don't be a noob.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great fries and according to my fiancé better than Genos. We tried both while we were visiting and being a vegetarian I can at least vouch for the fries being way superior to Genos. Sorry Genos! Pats is the original and is the way to go. I also love their cheeky signage.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: While in Philadelphia we had our own challenge of which is better. My opinion is Pat's for the win. The bread was very fresh and had a great flavor. The staff was quick to take our order and our sandwich was ready in minutes. Plenty of seating. Very clean area. If you are going to choose only one, pick Pat's for your cheesesteak sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Where's the meat?  This is a cross between a tourist novelty and a profit mill. Definitely not for the serious foodie! In my opinion the people that give this high marks have either never had a cheesesteak proper,  have minimal taste in food, or they just think they're supposed to like it because they come here with other people who also think that they're supposed to like it - kind of reminds me of pet rocks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nothing to write home about don't get the hype. But since we were in Philadelphia we had to compare both Pats and Genos neither were great. But our family leans more towards Genos
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is one of the stands that really put the Philly Cheesesteak on the map.   It's definitely the most famous, but I would say it is not the best.   It's good, but not great.   The meat jsut didn't seem as tender or flavorful as some of the other fine purveyers of cheesesteaks in this city.   But if you're just visiting, you have to come to Pat's because everyone back home will ask if you went there.

I prefer my steaks "provolone with", as in "provolone cheese, with onions".   However, this time, I got at "whiz with" (cheese whiz with onions) because my wife wanted to split a Pat's steak and a Geno's (across the street) steak with me and taste them head-to-head.

I have to say that Pat's came in second best.

P.S.  Pat's is open 24 hours and it's cash-only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have no idea what everyone is talking about. Got a cheesesteak with cheez whiz as recommended. It was not great. Not the worst ever but not what I expected atall. The meat had a weird flavor although there was a ton of meat. I personally did not like it. My fiance would rate his as a 1 star also and he had his with onions. Pain in the ass to find parking only to be disappointed and didn't even finish 1/2 of my sub. I've had much better in DC. Wouldn't go again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hands down the best steaks! They are juicy, flavorful and delicious. Load'em up with the peppers and grab some napkins. You are gonna need them! The fries are good, but nothing special. Parking can get crazy around that area, but be patient. People come and go all the time. Be sure you rehearse your order before you get to the front of the line. 1 with, whiz!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I first experienced Pat's, this was the cheesesteak that others strived to beat in terms of taste and quality. It was sandwich heaven. 

Unfortunately, the passage of time has not been good to Pat's. I now recommend that you go to Pat's only when you are forced to take a tourist or you've had way, way, way too much beer to drink.  

The beef is dry, not well seasoned and i'm guessing it's USDA select grade. The provolone is tasty but the bread is barely average.  

Unfortunately, Pat's had turned into a caricature of its own old self.  maybe with the gentrification of South Philly, Pat's will up its game

I miss the old days!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had never heard of this place until we pulled up in front of it. I knew I was coming to Philly to sample cheesesteaks but had no idea there were options outside of a plain cheesesteaks. Service was prompt. As I went to record the workers fixing the cheesesteak, my order was already prepared. The cheesesteak was great to say the least, but I plan to visit other spots to compare across Philly for a more accurate account of who to crown the best-stay tuned!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took a friend for a true Philly cheesesteak and he was wowed. He got the mushroom and it was loaded with them. The fries are awesome. Sodas are $3.50 for a small. The sign says to blame the city for the cost.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Stopped in Philly for the legit cheesesteak and I must admit I was disappointed. I got the steak with onions, peppers and wiz and it was just ok, surely nothing for me to make a point in stopping in Philly for. You can probably find a better one locally or at some of the less fancy places around town.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came here with a close friend back in September '17. It's a great place to go to but make sure you're ready to order right away. I ordered the cheesesteak with provolone, onions, and peppers along with fries and a large soda. It was awesome.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's was a great experience.. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the way to order. Made you feel like you were a regular. However, comparing to Geno's, I gotta give the nod to Geno's. Pat's was very good and you can't go wrong with either spot.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Solid 4 star overall. Kevin loves this place, much more than I did... Messy sub and all! In my opinion, the fries are the best part of Pat's. They are seasoned fries - the best type of French fry. Thing is, for 5$ they should at least match the amount of fries you get from Geno's 4$ fries. The sub was dry, both of our opinions. And I didnt like that the onions were just on the top of the sub and not spread out or even alot of them on the sub. I didnt like the bun here cuz it was chewy. We both liked that the steak was actually chopped instead of just sliced like at geno's. It's a 1 and done place just like geno's.
Jake n kev
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite cheesesteak in Philly, hands down. A must stop if you're coming into town. Fresh bread. Perfectly seasoned and cooked steak. Sautéed onions and cheese. There's lots of good cheesesteaks in Philly, but none better than the original, Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Forget what the locals say. Pat's was the best cheesesteak I had in Philly so far. It's exactly the gooey cheesy one your looking for. They all have good steak, but it's really about the wiz they use. Pats cheese is the best. Go here and don't share
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Was taking a road trip down to Maryland for the long weekend. My boyfriend and I decided to stop here for dinner after constantly hearing about Pats (and Gino's) on Food Network. Really wish we didn't make the stop...

A complete waste of time and money. You wait on this long absurd line for crap food. When you get to the first window you order wit or witout (onions) and chose your cheese. Plain, American, provolone or cheese wiz. Then you pay. The worker gets your sandwich out in under 60 seconds. The next window is for fries and beverages. Kind of a waste of time in my opinion for two windows doing different things. If both windows had everything, things would be quicker. 

My boyfriend got a philly steak wit American. He said it was dry and the bread was nasty. I ordered a roasted pork witout provolone. Driest pork I've ever had. 

Fries were super ..meh. 

Everything lacked flavor. 

Don't believe the hype! 

Pat's??? More like Crap's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Talk about the ITIS!

For $9-9.50, you get a big sub piled high with thinly shaved steak, (wit) onions if you want, and a choice of cheeze whiz, prov, or American. Great stuff!

Don't let the line fool you though...it moves fast!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was my favorite cheesesteak place when I worked in the Philly area years ago, and I haven't been back in over 10 years. When I saw a deal to have it delivered to my home via Goldbelly, I could not resist. It was a blast from the past, and very nostalgic. The steaks arrived packaged and frozen, so you can keep them frozen until you want to eat them. When heated up in the oven, they were were good, real good. But nothing is quite the same as standing in that line, smelling the steaks cooking and getting your fresh cheesesteak right off the grill. Can't wait to get there in person again and have a fresh cheesesteak off the grill.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you just came here and ate, and then flew home, I think this is a 4 star sandwich. However, and it's a big however, if you go elsewhere (Jims) you'll see there's little competition. The bun is actually tastier than it looks, but the fact that the meat isn't 'chopped' is a big red flag for me.
If you like Whiz, this is solid... no complaints there.
Unless you happen to just walk by, I would Recommend trying elsewhere for your fix.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Can't go to Philly and not get a Philly cheese steak! Service is great and fast. Fries are amazing! Not too soggy not crispy. The fries are just right! It only got 3 stars because as a repetitive customer they are not as favorable as they used to be. But it's definitely one of my Philly faves.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Maybe I am just not into cheesesteaks but this one was extremely bland.  I ordered a Mushroom/ Onions with Provolone Cheese and overall it had really no flavor.  The mushrooms were boiled There is a stand with black hot peppers ( black?) and large whole green and red peppers but there really wasn't a way to slice them to add to the sandwich.  The fries had a crispy texture outside which was tasty.  Overall, I was dissappointed.  Will not be returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ok so I went to Pats the other day I've been there before. I ask for a steak sandwich the guy who takes the order and the money very nice. The  guy next to him who is making the sandwiches I tell him nicely can you cut it in half He just rolls it up Looks at me as if I just killed his mother and hands me the sandwich Guy get a life you couldn't cut the sandwich in half what a d......  I won't be going there ever again when I'm back in Philadelphia I went to Geno's next door. Very nice people and they cut the sandwich in half such an easy task.I think Geno's is better any way. By the way I was there yesterday Saturday July 20 at around 12 noon. If the owners of Pats are reading this maybe you should school this asshole on manners and to please the public especially with someone something so simple
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place has good cheesesteaks and the french fries are cooked perfect and there honestly is nothing bad to say about this place.  The food comes out fast and the line moves quick and its worth the wait if its busy before or after a sporting event.  However, Oh Brother Philly in Old City has an excellent cheesesteak and their variety of french fries are better. You can even get cheesesteak fries!!

That aside, you won't regret hitting up this cheesesteak hot spot but beware, there is a new comer who is putting up quite a good fight for king of steaks!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Cheesesteak is alright. The meat was a little too chewy. I think Dealesandros is better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm a Philly native. I grew up as a Geno's fan and never had Pat's until today. My boyfriend (a non-Philly native and has no loyalty to any steak place) and I wanted to do a side-by-side comparison of the two steaks with the same ingredients: "Whiz Wit" (AKA cheese whiz with onions) with ketchup and hot peppers. We came to the conclusion that Geno's was far superior to Pat's. Pat's had an incredibly long line (about a 30-minute wait). The wait for Genos was much quicker, about 10-15 minutes. Pat's had a nice, balanced sandwich (perfect amount of meat to roll to cheese), but found that the bread was slightly stale and fell apart with meat and cheese going everywhere! My first bite was without any ketchup or hot peppers, and the meat was quite bland...and so were the onions. The hot peppers aren't hot at all, and I definitely felt disappointed. But, what do I know? I already have my loyalty to Genos.  My boyfriend did feel similar where he preferred the meat and bun from Genos but liked the balanced sandwich from Pat's since there was definitely more meat and cheese in it. Both sandwiches are $11 and at the end of the day, I would rather have good, less meat than more of it and the sandwich being bland.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After years of seeing Pat's featured on Food Network, I knew that I had to come by to pick up a cheesesteak during my trip to Philadelphia.  When I first landed at the airport (after a redeye flight from across the country), I knew that my first stop would be Pat's.  I got a cheesesteak with cheeze wiz and onions.  It tasted pretty good at the time.  But, about 30 minutes after I finished eating (as I was driving back to my hotel), I became severely nauseated.  When I arrived at my hotel, I was pretty much ready to pass out - I proceeded to fall asleep for a good three hours.  After waking up, I had the pleasure of dealing with other symptoms associated with food poisoning (I will spare you the details) for the rest of the day and night.  It was the most horrendous night I have ever had while on vacation.  Right now, I am in my hotel room writing this review as I try to handle day 2 of this food poisoning mess.  

I really wanted to love Pat's, I really did.  But if a sandwich is going to put me out for 2 whole days, I really will never come back.  I am scarred for life and am pretty sure that I will never eat a Philly cheesesteak again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hands down the best steak and cheese subs!! I believe it's better than the competition. Prepare for the long wait! Make sure to have cash! It's cash only! And read the sign before ordering to prepare yourself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Underwhelming. Came at peak lunchtime on a weekend and got dry, chewy, unseasoned steak. Bread was very chewy also. Fries are mediocre at best. Only upside was the cheese wiz and jaw workout.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's serve their beef "chopped" whereas Geno's do theirs "sliced". Taste wise, they are very close. 
If you're thinking of doing the same taste test, I recommend sharing the 2 cheesesteaks with 2 or 3 people. 

Overall, my preference leans towards Pat's as the bread had a better bite. Geno's bread was rather sloppy in comparison.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is definitely overhyped. I've been to Philly many times but the person who took me was hung-go about Pat's. It was good, but not the best cheesesteak I ever had. I've even had better ones in NYC! 

The good part of Pat's is we didn't have to wait long and there was a lot of seating. We got there around 7pm on a Thursday night. Wouldn't go again, but glad I got to experience it at least once!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
TEAM PAT'S KING OF STEAKS ALL THE WAY!

So a couple of friends and I were visiting from Las Vegas and was told we needed to have a Philly cheesesteak while visiting Philadelphia. The locals told us we had to either try Geno's Steaks or Pat's King of Steaks. We didn't know which one to go to so we tried BOTH! Yup you heard it right, we ate at both spots and let me tell you, Pat's King of Steaks was wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy better than Geno's Steaks.   

They gave more meat, cheese was well melted, steak was moist and full of flavor and the bread was nice and soft. Put that all together and you get a fan like me! I highly recommend this place. Both steakhouses are located across the street from one another. 

TIPS: 
*They only take cash so make sure you bring cash (ATM is located in the area but fee is high) 
*Parking isn't easy, it took us about 20-30mins to find a parking but it was totally worth it. 
*Location is really run down so I don't recommend going at night. 
*Separate lines for Philly, separate line for fries and drinks. 
*Not a lot of seating area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Preferred over the other guy across the street, extra Whiz is the move. If I'm in Philly I still find myself coming even if I try another place also
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Philly cheese steak is so messy but tastes so good!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I remain loyal to this place because this is where Mom used to take me when I was a kid some 30 years ago.  Although since then I have come to prefer other Philly cheesesteak places over Pat's, they're still quite good most of the time.  I will admit there have been times I was disappointed by a Pat's steak, but they are rare, and it hasn't happened in years. Unlike the place across the street I've tried many times, which has never held a candle to Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist post alert: we, like so many others, did the Genos and Pat's comparison. Verdict was Pat's came out slightly ahead based on fractionally better bread (for my preference) and they're a little more generous on the meat.  I appreciate the history at Pat's, as they are credited by many as the inventor of the cheesesteak sandwich, for which to will ever be grateful.  I've had better cheesesteaks in my life, but you still owe it to yourself to try the original.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I guess all the hype didn't measure up, meat wasn't season is was blend. Love the fries and the environment is awesome seen the place get pack and everyone lineup to get their order correct is hilarious and trying to get parking was a challenge itself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you are a tourist who wants crappy food and to be abused go there. 
IT IS A TOURIST TRAP
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We were on the fence about Pat's versus Geno's. Our Uber driver, a Philly native, recommended Pat's. There was no line when we got there during the day on Thursday. Sadly, the experience did not live up to the hype. My stepdaughter and I got the cheesesteak with provolone and my husband got the cheese whiz. Our cheesesteaks were pretty flavorless even though we got them "wit" (onions) and the meat was dry. I've had better cheesesteaks all over the US. Pat's may be the original cheesesteak, but certainly not the best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There are better cheese steaks in Jersey.. Yes, I said it. This place has gotten to big for itself. Just the attitude of the employees makes you just want to stay away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheese steak is worth the drive from Center City which is most likely where you will be touring in Philadelphia. The neighborhood is save and very Italian. This place does a lot of business and is open 24/7. 

The cheese steak is amazing. I recommend getting the onions and surprisingly the cheese Wiz. So it is ordered "Wiz Wit". The "wit" is the with onions.  The bread is amazing. 

The fries are a little too batter fried for me but may be better for people that are out late partying. 

A must go to Philadelphia. It's a USA landmark and does not disappoint.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Okay, everyone has a bucket list right? This was the only reason I traveled to Philly from NYC....so I could eat a phillycheese steak IN Philly. One of the most disappointing experiences of my life, other than trying to walk around in the humidity. This place is a complete tourist trap, because the only people you see here and across the street are tourist. Everyone's shoving a soggy roll of bread with some flavorless meat into their mouths. Dry or juicy, they'll take it. I even saw a table that brought their own Pringles and drinks. It's really that serious....

$11 for a Cheese Steak. I took 2 bites and tossed the rest into the trash. I can't justify ever eating another one in this life time. You literally walk up to the window, tell them what you want, and they hand it to you. That's how big of a trap it is, lol. It's also cash only! The number of tourists coming here, and it's cash only. Now, THAT'S how you avoid paying taxes :-) Just saying...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Crowning yourself a King is a pretty bold move...even if it's just: 'Lord of Meat'. 

So I went to Pat's King of Steaks expecting a 'royal' treatment.  To my dismay, they do not even speak The King's English here.  Instead, you'll have to get by on Philly street slang when ordering.  If you're not well versed in cheese lingo, then you may want to know that getting 'whiz' on your steak is a good thing (and not in the R. Kelly sense). 

I ordered a plain cheesesteak...which means, salted beef drizzled with American cheese on a long roll.  That may seem like a bland description but once that salty beef enters your mouth and you feel the creamy cheese sliding down your throat....,ummmm, maybe I should stop typing for a minute.  

.......
.......
.......Ok, I'm better now.  Let me try that again. 

That may seem like a bland description but that sandwich is anything but bland.  Each bite may cut your lifespan by a week...but, seriously, is there anything you could do in a week that would be better than those ten glorious seconds each bite lasts?  I think not.  

There really wasn't anything 'royal' about the interior of the place.  Well, unless you were comparing the sanitation efforts to those of a medieval dungeon.  

One other point to note is that there are a lot of characters in and around this place...and I'd say most appropriately classified as 'jesters'.  Some of them were ordering sandwiches, some of them were making the sandwiches...but most of them were standing around outside asking for free change (sadly, none of them were willing to dance or juggle for it).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's touristy but I love it! I take all first timers to the city to experience this iconic location along with Genos for the cheesesteak challenge. I love explaining to them the proper way to order and then having them nervously order themselves. I love that you can come at any hour...and we have. I recommend after dark so you get to experience the neon lights and hustle. We always leave with a smile and fun memories they talk about until the next visit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is completely overrated! I went there for the first time about 4 years ago. I was a cheesesteak virgin! I waited until I went to Philly to try my first cheesesteak ever ( I'm from Cali currently living in Texas ). We drove from D.C to New York, stopped in Philly ONLY for the cheesesteak, I was so excited, popping my cheesesteak cherry in Philly! We got one from Pats and one from Genos!! Both were crap!! Nasty boiled meat! No flavor at all!! We took a few bites and continued our drive to New York with such disappointment! I cannot believe these places are recognized, recommended or advertised on major TV stations. We were told these are the places to go for a cheesesteak, don't waste your time or money. We found better Philly cheesesteaks at the Truck Yard in Dallas which are made by Philly natives. Definitely not a place I would ever go to again. After eating at Pats and Genos, I didn't eat another cheesesteak for over 4 years because I thought it was disgusting!! AND YES, I'm posting the same review at Genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Well if I was going to be in Philadelphia, this had to be one of my stops.  I've been hearing about Pat's cheese steaks for years so I was very excited to try one.  I did my research on yelp so I know exactly what I wanted, a "mushroom cheesesteak wit onions".  I've read many a review talking about how rude the people were here; however, when I went up to order my cheesesteak, I said what I wanted, they took my cash, and less than a minute later my cheesesteak was in front of me.  They seem to have a very efficient system going doing booming business all these years, and they were not rude at all.

As for the cheesesteak itself, it was pretty darn tasty.  Pat's sells some legit stuff, and if I had to choose between here and Geno's across the street, my choice would be Pat's every time.  I feel that anybody who is visiting Philly needs to grab a Pat's cheesesteak for the novelty.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have now tried most of the cheese steaks in Philly and this is by far my favorite. Worth the wait!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Very good cheese steaks and cheese fries. I personally like them better than ginos  
Always get fried onions, mayo, & ketchup.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
These are GOOD...  Look if you want the best Philly has to offer well then you found it...  This is one of the best out there.

If you can't appreciate a great cheesesteak wit whiz then don't go to Philly stay in your lame little town and get that crap that you call a philly cheesesteak....

You can walk down to DiBruno Bros and get some awesome cheese as well...  

I can't wait for the summer and our trips to Philly....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I tried three cheesesteaks side by side. Geno's, Pat's, and Jim's. All three were good. Pat's had good flavor. Amount of cheese was on the lighter side. Not my top choice but a solid choice nonetheless. See my reviews on the other two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came out here to try some famous cheese steaks (also because everyone said it was so much better than Geno's). 

Man..... I have to admit I was a bit disappointed (maybe my expectations were too high and I was just expecting something to be mind blowing amazing). The steak was a bit bland and dry (didn't have a whole lot of flavor here and it wasn't as tender/juicy as I've had from other Cheesesteak places), and the only thing that made my meal tolerable to get through was the cheese whiz.
