Thank god for Cheese Whiz because otherwise I wouldn't have been able to finish this. My friend ended up getting the cheesesteak with the provolone and she pretty much experienced the same disappointment I did haha. 

Now it's not an awful cheesesteak joint, but it's also not great or good enough for me to want to come back. 

Oddly enough, my favorite cheesesteaks remain in New York and California (Phil's Steak Truck and St John's respectively)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My family and I went to both Pat's and Geno's across the street to compare which one is better.  We got 3 different cheesesteaks: cheese wiz, provolone cheese, and white American cheese.  All 3 with wit.

Unfortunately, neither was the winner.  They were quite disappointing.  We felt that they were not at the same caliber as Dalessandro's or Joe's.  Overly hyped.  Meats were not as fresh or flavorful.  Onions were either undercooked or overcooked.  

If you still feel like you want to try them, I would recommend:
At Pat's - get it with white American cheese.
At Geno's - get it with cheese wiz.  

I would avoid one with provolone cheese from either places.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Oil:water::indoor seating:Philly steak joints.

-A brief recounting of how your gentle correspondent came to eat hot cheesesteak whilest shivering in frigid cold and cursing the gods of weather-

In all my time in San Francisco, I have never lost my absolute contempt for the wimpyness my fellow citizens express at the slightest hint of actual weather.  Temps below 58 degrees, rainfall beyond a slight misting, and even the slightest hint of wind drive people into a Chicken Little-esque panic.  Meanwhile, I've lived places where the high was occasionally -10, and I've watched a tornado make its way through a valley while on horseback, wearing only a t-shirt.  Am I saying I'm better than my neighbors?  Not necessarily.  But maybe.

Right about the time I was sinking my teeth into 6 inches of hot cheesy steak, this attitude was coming back to haunt me.  See, I had accidentally journeyed back into the land of real weather (and real cheesesteak), in the form of Philly in October.  And, apparently, the gods of wind and rain had missed kicking my ass for the last several years, and attempted to make up for it by visiting upon the greater Eastern Seaboard a fall storm of truly epic proportions.  And all I had brought with me was some long sleeve shirts and my rain jacket.  Plenty enough protection for San Francisco winter, but sadly inadequate for a Philly Phall storm.

You simply cannot visit Philly without devouring a cheesesteak or 2 or 12, and so a group of us headed out to the Great Corner, wherein Pat's King of Steak faces off against another cheesesteak legend.  I opted for Pat's, because both restaurants were equally devoid of any kind of real shelter or heat.  It can safely be said that few visitors attacked their cheesesteak and fries with greater ferocity than I, if only because I knew I had to get that cheesesteak up in me before I could escape to the artificial heat of the nearby sports bar.

Lasting impressions: be authentic and go for the Velveeta cheese; fries aren't great; the hot peppers would be more enjoyable if they were sliced rather than served whole; I'm glad the bell peppers were optional, because I'm very allergic and I was nervous.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Receive a shipment on my birthday of 3 Pat's cheesesteaks even though I live 8 miles from Philly. Box came with directions to heat them up and add the cheeeze whiz. Phenomenal! Crunchy bread, great tasting steak and peppers and onions topped with the cheese whiz. I'm not a cheesesteak person, but with Pat's I'm now a convert!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I took the taste test and I prefer Pat's. The roll was nicely toasted and the meat in my "wit with whiz" (aka with onions and Cheeze Whiz) was shredded. The other place's roll was spongy and the meat was whole slices.

I also like that Pat's has other things they'll mix into the cheesesteak, like peppers and mushrooms and suchlike.

Parking is a pain. Sandwiches and drinks and fries are CASH ONLY. Good luck.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Stop reading and pick Pats over Genos!  I had both and Pats is better hands down. Extra  cheese Steak with! . Yummy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Nope.

I know Pat's is one of the most frequented places in Philly, but as much as I want to be excited about that, it's a big Nope for me. Incredibly greasy (the oil seeped through two layers of wrapping paper), poor service, low-quality meat, and a $0.25 bottle of water for $2.50. I just can't get myself to give it more than 2 stars.

I won't be back. Any other suggestions for getting a great cheesesteak, fellow Yelpers?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Props for being the reported inventor of the cheesesteak, and for being better than Geno's (across the street).  I've had much better luck finding a table here, and the general experience is better; less attitude, an impression of better cleanliness.  The beef is better seasoned, has less gristle (still more than it should) and is much moister.  If this moistness is described as "grease," then yes, the Pat's cheesesteak is greasier than the Geno's version.  I've never experienced so much grease that the bread was saturated, unless the sandwich was left in its foil wrapper for an extended period.  Not as good as Jim's or Dalessandro's, but better than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Geno's is better and Dalessandro's in Roxborough blows them both out of the water. Convenience and late hours are what makes it almost tolerable.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Loved it. Never had a "real" Philly Cheesesteak and this place did not disappoint! Several places to choose from and without a recommendation, Pat's  was a winner!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Rudest window staff who yelled "show me your phone" when I ordered on Grubhub and said the name I was picking up for. Then asked me my name anyway. Get a better system? Food ok.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The King of Steaks indeed!  Every time I fly into Philadelphia, it doesn't matter what time of day it is, I drive straigh to Pat's for a cheese steak.  My family is from Pennsylvania so it's a staple and a tradition to get a Pat's steak no matter what.  Make sure you know what you want when you step up to the window to avoid a delay in ordering or getting skipped for not being prepared.  I ordered the steak with onions and whiz and it is still my favorite cheesecake I've ever had.  They have a ton of these amazing large red peppers to add on top if you like spice on your cheese steak.  I added a couple on one side and they were spicy but added a great extra flavor to the already delicious cheese steak.  I can't wait to go back next summer for another family wedding and will be heading here as my first stop!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
OK another disappointment!! It tasted just a bit better than gino,but just above trash! Over priced and over rated. OMG the  scum level of all food. 
The steak was  not good at all so was the nasty microwave cheese. I rather have frozen food than ever going to these two steak places
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My boyfriend and our friends decided to explore Philly for a weekend. They decided to stop by lunch at Pat's. For those who are not familiar with Pat's, it's an outdoor establishment. You'll have to walk up to the counter and make your order. 

My advice is to check out the menu beforehand or be prepared to get your order. They do not like the waiting game. You order and pay kind of speed. I ordered the wiz and onions. It wasn't bad nor it was great in my personal taste. I thought it was dry and the beef had no flavor. It was chewy. Overall, if we were to come back and somone wanted to go here...I wouldn't oppose.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ever since I was a cheese steak I dreamed about being served from the king of steaks, but after one visit I rather roll off the table. 

The whole sandwich is bland and that's it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I don't get the appeal of this place. Visiting Philadelphia for 48 hours, a cheese steak was at the top of my to do list. For $10, I was underwhelmed. Yea, the cheese whiz is interesting and complements the meat with the saltiness but other than that, I didn't think the sandwich itself had much flavor. 

Ohhh for those not in the know, this place isn't in the best of neighborhoods in South Philly. Walking there from downtown by myself at 11 pm at night with no working cell phone was probably a bad idea...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We did the Cheesesteak taste test, starting at Pat's I had the steak "wit" & provolone. ( added hot sauce ). The meat was good, but the bread was not fresh. Gino's, across the street, was a little better. The roll was fresh, and I liked the cheese wiz. I recommend doing your own taste test, because as you can see, opinions differ widely. Either way you've made it to the "Mecca" of cheesesteaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been to Pat's multiple times and it's absolutely the REAL king of steaks! I have yet to try Tony Luke's, as I hear it's also very good, but compared with regards to Pat's compared to Geno's there is absolutely no competition. First, they do not need any type of over the top promotional decor to attract customers because once you try their cheesesteaks you know who to go to for your next one.

I'll do my best to describe their "Cheesesteak Wit". Once you receive the cheesesteak, you can head left to the condiments where you can add hot sauce, ketchup, whatever you want onto it, but I prefer to keep it the way it is because adding anything else would just interfere with the original taste. Once you take a look at the cheesesteak you immediately notice that it IS greasy, oily and full of steak juices. The bread just soaks up all those juices and softens up quickly so you have to dig right into the cheesesteak ASAP. However, the moistened bread goes fantastic with the juicy steak and abundance of cheese they put on it. The bread is not hard, so it's very easy to digest with bites of the steak.

The flavors of soft slices of juicy, hot steak with the cheese wiz are blended so perfectly here. The juices incorporated into the bread make chewing and digestion very easy. That is why Pat's is the King of Steaks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist trap, overrated! I am sorry but if I am in South Philly for a sandwich, I am going across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Honestly if it was possible to give the place (-) STARS I would.

First off, If you are going to be an asshole to your customers please make sure your food is good enough to make us forget about it . God forbid somebody asks for fried onions instead of saying "Wit" like a fucking illiterate neanderthal.

Second off, Is it thin sliced ribeye or thin sliced rubber?
Do you guys use seasoning? I can assure you salad oil does not add flavor it just makes it greasier so you can swallow without chewing so you don't have to go through the agony of actually tasting the food. 

What a fucking horrible place.
I wish Rocky would have ran past Dalessandros so out of towner's dont waste there time.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Even though I am NOT a cheese steak lover (I rarley eat them - maybe 1-2 times a year), and I like Jim's better than Pat's, I prefer Pat's to Geno's.

I am also friends with a member of the Olivieri family - so I have to like Pat's better,

I order (quickly) a chicken cheessteak 'wit provolone and 'shrooms.

Too bad it's always so packed there's nowhere to eat. What a greasy mess!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I am convinced beyond a shadow of a doubt, that Pat's put something in the Whiz.  I know it.  How else can I explain my manic addiction to these things?  That insane ordering system and the punishment of being thrown to the back of the line is some miscreant's way of demanding perfection in exchange for partaking in a *plain steak wit'* which for you neophytes means *no cheese, with onions*.  Pat's unassuming, slightly dilapidated storefront pales in comparison to the glitz of Geno's flashy, whorish neon establishment across the street.  But Pat's emerges victorious in the cheese steak battle of battles: a blind taste experiment conducted by me, cheese steak neophyte.  I tell you, between that and the fries slathered in Whiz, Pat's may be the only reason I would venture into South Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Loved. My husband and I drove to philly from New York just for cheesesteaks. There was a line when we got here but it goes super fast. They have two windows, one for cheesesteaks and the other for fries and drinks. Cash only. The cheesesteaks came out right away, the meat is cooked perfectly, with just the right amount of cheese. The cheese fries are great, we didn't even order extra cheese and it comes pretty heavily coated in cheese. My husband likes geno's but I prefer pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The food was pretty good.  Our family decided we didn't live cheese whiz, but that was our fault not ordering the provolone. The bread and steak were really good though.  

Pat's is in a very urban part of Philly right past little Italy (the street where Rocky ran in Rocky 1, 2 and it was in Rocky V as well).  I don't know what it would be like at night, but lunch was fine. 

I'd go again, just get the steak with provolone.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time ever at Pats and have to admit I was underwhelmed with my cheesesteak. Isn't this place supposed to be the best in PA? My sandwich was made in record speed though but the meat was dry. Went with whiz and onions which was the only thing making this cheesesteak work.

Too bad I read the reviews after the fact and realized I went to tourist trap and could've gone to a number of better places. 

Next!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The picture doesn't do it justice. 
This cheesesteak was delicious! I ate half and had the other half for lunch the following day. (And even reheated it was still great!) They are heavy handed when to comes to the steak so that's a great thing!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheesesteak I just had is not only the worst I have ever had, it is among the worst items of food I have ever paid for at a restaurant in my life.  It was served barely lukewarm,  with unmelted cheese, stale bread, and  seemingly unheated canned mushrooms on top.  It was also served about 30 seconds after ordering it, which probably tells you everything you need to know about the method of preparation. 

On top of that, it was ridiculously overpriced.  I don't know how this place enjoys the fame it has.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is amazing. I sit to write a review on a place that has already been Yelped over a thousand times. There isn't much I can add to what hasn't previously been said, but I had one of the best tasting Philadelphia Cheese Steaks ever. It's a local institution, late night gathering place and the rivalry between Geno's and Pat's just adds to the fun, the excitment and the competition over which street joint (yes, both of them are dive-y street joints), in Philadelphia, has the best Cheese Steak. Though I fear assassination from one of the follower's of Geno's, I'll have to cast my vote and lot with Pat's. I'm sure some of the one star ratings for Pat's are undercover Geno's fans and I'm sure that some of the one star rates for Geno's are likewise Pat's fans; but don't tell anybody I said so. I'm sure that no self respecting Yelpite would stoop to such cowardly low life tactics, but then again, this is Philadelphia, isn't it?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: WHY DOES PATS THE CREATOR OF CHEESTEAKS HAVE 3 stars ?!!!!! That's BS . Probably a bunch of yuppies tourist rates this place. The started the CHEESTEAKS ! The steaks are always consistent
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm not a cheese whiz fan, but I went with the flow and had the cheesesteak with onions, cheese whiz & mushrooms. It was so delicious!  You order your sandwich in one line and then order your drinks and fries in another line.  Line goes fast as they have it down!  Don't ask any questions as they are very short with you and kinda rude. Maybe that's the Philly cheesesteak originators attitude?!?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's was said to be the place where the "Philly Cheesesteak" or "Steak Sandwich" was created, so you just had to go there. Our first time in Philly we did just that and stopped here to eat and grab the original cheesesteak. 

There was a line but it went pretty fast. The guys running the place were pretty rude and basically, yell at you to take your order and move on. I ordered the original with fries and a drink. We all sat out on the picnic benches they have and ate our food. Yes, it was good. No, it wasn't anything special. I guess a Philly Cheesesteak is the same pretty much everywhere. 

It was a cool place to go to and eat at just to say we have been and done that. I guess you could go here once for the same reasons but it's not a place you're going to rush back to every time you're in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very good steak. Much better than Geno's I must say.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When your drunk there great. Sober the meat is tough & grossly fatty. 
Do yourselves a favor, look actors street. 
Everybody goes to "GENOS " !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Terrible service, the lady who took our order actually yelled at us for 3 minutes because she didn't hear us say no onions on one and onions on another. I get that it's a quick grab for food but she was extremely rude. Then proceeded to talk on the phone about how many people called out and ridiculous the place was. Cheesesteak was also not great, dry meat, cold cheese and tough bread. Overall bad experience which is disappointing after traveling so far to come here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went because I had to see for myself. I'm no foodie but this really is a tourist trap. Guys working seem totally uninterested in what they are doing and it shows in the cheese steaks just slapped together. I'm used to talking if i've got to wait in line. Everyone in line was out-of-town which was good since I'm new but bad since it really let me know that it's for tourists. Will try the other place everyone's talking about.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I loved my cheesesteak here!!! It came out super fast and was seriously amazing! Get extra napkins, lol! 

The only bad thing is a small soda is $4. The restaurant has a sign up though calling out the local government for passing some law that makes the soda so expensive
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrated tourist trap. Go there as a check the box exercise only. Better cheesesteaks found at your corner pizza place....& yes, same with Gino's across the street. (Pat's is marginally better)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We really went here for the experience - what claims to be the 1st place for Philly cheese steaks while we were in Philly? Sure! We were going to go to Geno's across the street because we were told it's the best but it was busier & we were hungry. 

I can be a bit weird about meat & quite frankly there was too much fat on my meat for me to enjoy the sandwich. The fries were good and I tried Birch Beer (a type of root beer) which was fun. I don't think it was a meal worth $16 though!

Be prepared to order when you walk up or they will tell you to step aside and let the next person go. You order & pay for your sandwich at 1 window & if you want fries and/or a drink you order & pay for those at a different window.

The other people I was with are less picky than I am & they all really liked it. Some of the kids got hot dogs too which one of the workers said they started out with hot dogs there so I guess it was ok. :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The steak was bland and shaved! Nothing special unless your  looking for a quick lunch on the go and of course was inn South Philly already!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not that good more hype and fame then a good cheese steak! Canned mushrooms who puts that on a cheese steak!!  I'm more disappointed then anything I've heard all the hype about them.

 I guess it's cause people watched a movie so it made this place famous! they have a lot to be thank for for "rocky" cause with out that few monuments of fame this place wouldn't even be a mark on the map let alone still in business!!  

Don't waste your time and time you will waste parking doesn't exist, tour buses of Chinese one after another!! 

I don't personally have a recommendation to a replacement but a friend said to me not to waste my time and go to johns roast pork"
14 East Snyder Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19148

I should have listen to him!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Umm...YUM! The bread, the cheese, the meat  I had my own cheesesteak taste testing competition and Pat's for sure won. I even went back and told them. Can't believe I even tried anywhere else. Look forward to my next trip to Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Don't waste your money. Way too overpriced & the meat has no flavor. The bread is alright but wouldn't recommend this place. Fries were good though
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When it comes to ticketing and delivery of food, I've never a place exceed so much. However, there are a few problems with Pat's King of Steaks. There is virtually zero parking around the area, customer service feels rushed for newcomers to the restaurant, and overall the actual steak taste unseasoned.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When you hear about Philly, one of the main things you hear about is the rivalry between Pat's and Geno's.

I ordered my cheesesteak with onions and Cheez Whiz.  It came out in a flash as the line moved fast.  The guy in the window was very impersonal and businesslike as he kept saying "Next!" as the line proceeded.

The cheesesteak itself was attractive and good, but I can't say it had a real "wow" factor.  It's one of those tourist things you just feel you need to experience.  Two locals had warned me that Pat's and Geno's are overpriced and nothing special.  Both shared another place to go for better cheesesteaks.

When in Philly, visit both places, but be forewarned that you probably won't be blown away by either place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is better than Geno's, but worse than Jim's. I like the way their chop their onions smaller here, but they don't mix the cheese in as well and their rolls are usually a little bit more stale than Jim's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Grease

Next is Pat's.  The Philly staple.  I have actually been here 3 times and all 3 visits resulted in the same dilemma.  Pure grease basically pouring out of the sandwich.  One time I was completely wasted and I think I actually enjoyed this grease stream.  The other big problem here is that Pats doesn't put much of this greasy horse meat on the sandwich so it's another Philly cheese steak that is loaded with cheap cheese wiz.  

I won't be back to Pats, sorry another fail.  

Thanks
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Compared to Geno's the steaks here are smaller and they cost the same.    Another star off for cash only business. 

Geno's accepts charge cards and their steaks are larger. 

There is also a much smaller seating area compared to Geno's.  More lighting on Geno's makes it easier to see your food when you are drunk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The original. It was great went wit and whiz and provolone for the cheese and did not disappoint. The onion to steak ratio was impeccable and the cheese whiz really tied it all together. Would go again if I lived in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Everyone's gotta have the "famous" one, but there are many better steaks around the city. There's no heart in the food just quantity. Asked for American, got wiz slapped on and it thrown in my face. Meat wasn't even hot, just warm at best from sitting in a pile on the grill.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
X marks the spot. One of the most well known/infamous, albeit coolest and interesting "food fights" is Pat's vs. Genos

Who has the better cheese steak?

A question that cannot be simple to answer, for everyone has their own choice, and theory as to why...

I wont go into who has the best, because so many like to mention the less popular places that claim them to be more delicious.
  Keeping it between these two spots, there is indeed a bit more life at Geno's, and is clearly more flashy than Pat's; but, in this food feud, it certainly isn't equivalent to a decision one way or another.

You will truly have to take the trip to E Passyunk Ave and prepare your ordering method as you wait on line to see for yourself, and become the next professor of perfect Phillies. 
  I took the drive from NY, and got there at 3 am, the lines for both Geno's and Pat's were around the corner; At Geno's, the people waiting on the line were more fun and friendly, more outgoing, than those at Pat's.

All that said, X truly marks this treasured spot with the road crossing in the middle of these two steak stands; Both open 24hrs and both drawing their loyal fanatics, Hold your own taste test and see for yourself. Let me know what you think too!

My opinion of Pat's is on par with their running mate across the street, but my heart goes to Geno's since they were my very first.  

Love of cheese steaks was new for me and it was a confusing time in life, how could a guy choose just one meat?

All this being said I've run rampit around philly, knocking up all the pretty phillies I could wrangle.   They all have their own shine and their own down sides, but that's just the crazy game of love... I'm still talking cheese-steaks if you've gotten lost.    

okay, my time is up, go try everywhere you possibly can and message me your favorites!

Here @ Pats if the lines short I'd suggest grabbing a provolone cheesesteak wit onion
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came down to finally try one of these "amazing" cheesesteaks from philly. First stop Pats. I ordered the American mushroom cheese steak. The guy was rude, the bread was cold, the sandwich was dry, the meat had no flavor or taste. No wonder it had the shortest line for cheese steaks in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took a Lyft to the famous Pats with Geno's just across the street. Ordered a cheesesteak sandwich "wit" with onions and provolone cheese. It was ok. Nothing super great about it. It needed some dressing of some type and more cheese. The fries were yummy tho. Cash only!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Definitely a good cheesesteak but didn't come close to the one I had from Dalessandro's! 

Meat to bread ratio was good. The flavor of the meat just needed some love.. more salt or seasonings would do it. The roll was delicious as always! 

I ordered a mushroom cheesesteak with grilled onions and whiz.....wished it had for grilled onions for flavor. 

Not a horrible cheesesteak but not the best.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely not the king of cheesesteaks. This is my first time in Philly so I wanted to try this because it was one of the original cheese steaks apparently. My mistake. This is the worst cheesesteaks I've ever eaten. Meat had no flavor. Bread did not taste fresh. The food was dry and small. I spent $20 on it due to cavier fees. It should have been $4.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came to Philly on vacation and had to try out Pat's. Seating is very limited compared to the crowd and the line moves so so so fast. They were literally asking for my order before I made it to the window. You order cheesesteaks at one window and then sides and drinks at the next. I got a cheesesteak with mushrooms, peppers and onions and the cheese wiz. It was so good! But I did have to stand up to eat it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Enjoy my Two visits to Pats in November. Sandwich was loaded with steak.  First visit I had one With Provolone, second visit was with Whiz

I preferred With Whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Although Pat's and Geno's are the most popular cheesesteaks, I don't think they are the best. Tourists and locals alike swarm the intersection of 12th and Passyunk, day and night, and the service and line move quick at machine like efficiency. However, the cheesesteaks are just not that good. If I had to pick, I would say the bun at Pat's is better and they chop their steaks instead of sliced. (In my opinion, chopped has more flavor because it has more surface area.) Overall, I feel like this is mostly a tourist trap, but come for the experience and check out the mayhem at least once. If you want to try the most famous cheesesteaks, get Pat and Geno. Check out my other reviews for better cheesesteaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Disgusting service! asked for a Philly cheese steak with no onions, was given one with plenty of onions. Requested that I have one with no onions and the worker proceeded to open up my steak with his hands and pin point that there are "two onions" and gives it back to me (sanitary issue). In disbelief I go back to try and eat it unfortunately there are at least 10 onions in the steak which completely changed the flavor. I take my half back as I made a trip all of the way from New York to enjoy this steak and this was ruining my entire experience. An older man proceeds to yell at me, grabs my sandwich throws it on the floor and throws my money back while cursing at me. Extremely disgusted and in disbelief, how does an establishment stay open with such vulgar people working here. Please make sure you look into your customer service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Drove down from nyc just to see what pat's was all about..
There's a different window to order steaks another window to order fries & soda.

This place only serves beef, no chicken which we wanted originally however I got a steak cheese with onions & provolone cheese.
We added a few condiments they didn't have jalapeños but they did have other peppers & let me tell you this made me entire experience so much better! 
I loved it! 

Definitely would come back!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's hasn't been good since the early 90's and I know this cause being born and raised in this city I know a lot of people are getting their heads overly piped up about when you come to Philly try Pats and their not even competition too across the street Geno's. The last time I even bothered to have their sandwich was around '07 and nope it was bad. Just throw steak mmm frozen meat on a hoagie roll and there's your Pat's steak. No flavor because it's not even seasoned like a traditional cheesesteak.

  Pat's need to be dropped to NOT top any cheesesteaks in Philly right with them other supposed to be king of cheesesteaks across the street, them days has been long gone. Ask any person born and raised from Philly would they ever eat from here or Geno's and they'd be like "They don't even cross my mind and their the 2 top tourist spots of the whole city that's all, NO!" To the people who do actually enjoy Pat's maybe you just enjoy no tasting, unseasoned steak but don't go back to yall hometowns or where ever your from telling people Pat's and Geno's are the best cheesesteaks in this city, your giving false information.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here on a friend's friend's recommendation. Their cash-only policy was a bit annoying but luckily there was an ATM across the street. For $11 I got a simple foot-long sub with just steak & American cheese (nothing else). My order was completed as soon as I told the staff what I wanted and it was phenomenal; from the tender cuts of juicy steak smothered in all-American liquid gold to the quality bread that enveloped it all. Before I knew it, my sandwich was gone and my stomach full. Was not disappointed to say the least.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's Steak 

I tried this spot 7 years ago and I thought why not give it another try since it's right next to Geno's. There was a line but it was quick. Got the same thing cheesesteak wiz price was $11 same as Geno's. The steak tasted dried. Didn't seem like they added flavor. I thought for 3,000 reviews they would bump it up a notch but this will be out of my list if you have this place mark down for Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
CASH ONLY/ FREE STREET PARKING

Oh man, I loved Pat's! Okay, I'll be honest, I was nervous placing my order because of how long the line was when we came, how freezing cold it was and with Pat's being outdoors only there was no escape from the outdoor elements (well there's a roof) and the style orders needed to be placed in 'wit' or 'witout' (onions that is) and the barrage of pigeons watching my every move!

Luckily, the hubby and I were successful in getting our cheesesteak wiz wit and an order of cheese fries without a scratch. It was so cool to see the exact place where Sly Stallone stood while filming Rocky and looking up and all over at the celebrity love from famous patrons of the past and present. 

So, the service at Pat's was like this: Finger snap! The worker in the window would say "next" and the customer who had been rehearsing the order would provide it, also while handing out the exact total due for the food. Then the worker would yell out the short hand to the crew workinging the flat tops and then the customer would blink and then BAM! The sandwich would be there... Amazing, right? 

I guess the service at Pat's isn't too much more than this, but really, what more is needed? It seemed like diners would clean off their tables (or maybe the pigeons would help in that matter) and the napkins, peppers, utensils dispensers were full.

Okay, Pat's was the cheesiest, and I loved every bite of my piping hot cheese steak. The meat was succulent and flavorful. The onions were not at all overpowering (which would have upset me, but did not) and the crusty and chewy bread did a great job of holding it all together. There is a seperate line for fries and drinks, which I found to be helpful. The cheese fries were awesome! They were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The cheese sauce was fantastic, as expected and we devoured the fires so quickly that they were not at all soggy. Thanks Pat's!

PS There is a church a block or so away in case you need to use the restroom: Emmanuel Chapel :) Just be sure to donate, if you can!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Going on record to say that I prefer Pats cheesesteaks over Genos. Give me whiz wit! Pats has a nice meat to bread ratio with excess gravy and lots of whiz. I did prefer Genos fries over Pats. Please know the terminology before you order. Cash only. Order your steak at one window, fries and drink at the other. 

There's a bar of toppings like hot peppers, ketchup, mustard, mayo you can dress your steak with. Seating is all outdoor. It's not the most glamorous place to dine but when in Philly, this is a right of passage.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's good when ur drunk, and if ur not use to a good steak, other then that I really wouldn't go here to eat a steak....take it from someone that has eaten from this place for 30+ yrs, it was good maybe back n the early 90s, horrible now. Like really bad, U actually can't get a good steak n Philadelphia which claims to be the home of the cheesesteak , there r maybe .....maybe 2/3 places that offer a good steak, they r Johns Roast Pork, Jims, Steves n a pinch and Tony Luke's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Too Greasy - poor quality meat.  Tony Luke's much, much better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Can't come to Philly and not have a steak sandwich. We decided to try out the two rivals that are literally right across the street from each other. 

People were very nice, good came out quick, steak was good but it was so hard to get past all the cheese. It had sooooo much cheese the taste of the meat for lost. I had to get a piece at the bottom to try it. 

Bucket list
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visiting Philly and had to do the tourist thing, especially after all the food and travel channels making a big deal of it.  It is fun the way they are across from each other and lots of good energy.  After checking both out, ended at Pat's for no better reason than my wife's name is Pat.  Service is fast and unfriendly, which I guess is their thing.  You order cheesesteak and pay for it at first window and fries and drink at second, where you pay a second time.  After Yelp reviews, was not expecting much and was sadly not wrong.  Disappointing.  Roll was too chewy for me.  Beef was bland and dry.  Provolone cheese was not melted.  Fries were actually very good, as were the peppers from the condiment bar.  It was fun but would not go back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So good it's worth sitting out in the cold to eat.  The meat is so tender and the Cheez Wiz poured over it is actually better than the regular cheese most places use.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Clearly if you are going here you know the deal! Pats? Genos? So cant go wrong with either in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's good but not as good as genos bought two from each place. This place just had less flavor but definitely wasn't bad.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ordered 2 subs and fries, ordered one with cheese whiz and one with white cheese with mushrooms. Subs were ok, they were a lot better than Genos. It was not dried. Fries were really crispy and delicious. 

Definitely a must try when in Philly! This is considered one of the OG's place to get subs, so it's a good benchmark to judge other subs.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have to say I was a little disappointed in Pats King of Steaks if they really created the cheesesteak.  The steak part was great - nice and hot, and a little greasy. And I do love provolone cheese.  But the cheese was taken straight from the frig and wasn't even melted.  It definitely beat cheesesteaks in Georgia, and I do love their signage.  No real gluten free options here either - had to eat the layer that didn't touch the bread.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm from San Diego, ca... I was visiting fam in VA... went on a road trip to try this sandwhich... cheesesteak with grilled onions...  o m g... this angel is in food coma heaven.... it was a yummy freak of beautiful creamy meaty goodness that had me licking my mittens just so I wouldnt waste the bounty ... yes sir, this was worth the stop... wait till I come back with my buddies
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats is da bom! The line goes on forever and parking....what parking?!?! Worth the wait for one of the best sandwiches in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best in town, never disappoints always get excited eating their food keep up the great work !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We went around 8;30am on Father's Day for the 1st time and was excited to try both Pat's & Geno's famous cheesesteak subs.  There was a couple outside eating and nobody in line.  Was checking out the menu & the guy yelled something out the window & slammed it shut.  I asked him what did he say & he re-opened the window & said he's cleaning the grill.  Then, he shut the window & went back to watching the tv.  I asked him if they were closed & he opens the window & yelled he's cleaning the grill.  Funny, because he was watching tv.  Guess he didn't feel like cooking for Asian Americans that day.  Racist mofo was too busy watching tv.  Next time, we'll eat where the locals recommend.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So good! The original and the best. Seating outside was easy as was takeaway. Highly recommend!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I save the fifth star for Steve's. Still, this is the best South Philly steak. The best, Jerry.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is one-half of the draw to Passyunk Square.  Tourists want to experience the infamous cheesesteak rivalry between Pat's and their counterpart across the street.  Personally, I don't believe either are the best in town.  However, it was a fun experience that I'd recommend for those visiting the city.  While in the area, check out the historic brownstones and vintage shops.  Don't be deterred by the line, it moves quickly.  Know what you want, order it correctly.  It's cash only and outdoor seating. Between the two, Pat's is my preference.  The meat is seasoned more and there was more of it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The famous Pat's and Gino's, across from each other..1st cheese steak in Philly, rib eye meat,cheese wiz, same recipe from 1940 and for me in my personal quest to figure out who has the better Philly Cheese Steak in Philly is now finally over. I gotta give it to Pat's! Although Gino's was delicious too pat's was just more to my liking. It was fun to go to both spots and buy one of each cheese steaks and take pictures there and experience the whole Philly vibe thing while at the same time grubbing down on some good Philly cheese steaks. I can't wait to go back and try other Philly Cheese Steak spots, maybe there's a place that's better than Pat's but for now Pat's is the King.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's over Geno's. 

'nuff said!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went here last summer with my family. The place was pretty slow surprisingly. Drive all the way from N.Y to try the famous Pat's steak. I gotta say there's nothing famous about this place. Some old guy behind the counter wearing his 12k Rolex rushed us without letting us choose our toppings or anything. Threw our sandwiches together on dry hero bread with little to no meat at all and some cheap yellow cheese. The sandwich's alone cost me about $10 each! That's without fries and a drink. I couldn't believe I took this drive for a sandwich I seen on t.v and read about in the paper and heard about through family and friends just to be this disappointed. I'll never come back to Pat's.I went over to Geno's down the block and felt much better.  Better atmosphere, better hospitality, better pricing and better food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What is the definition of a Philly Cheese Steak. Ask Will Smith, ask Rocky Balboa. They'll both tell ya. It's Pat's. Geno's crap steak thinks they can attract people with brighter neon signs - it's because they sell an inferior sandwich. I'm a Midwesterner - from Chicago/Detroit and had been waiting to have Philly's real cheesesteaks. I stomached one from Pat's and Geno's both the same night to be the judge. Bought a sandwich from each place and took a few bites of each first so as to judge without being full.


Pat's is the way to go. 

At Pat's the bread is warm and soft. The steak pieces are perfectly sliced and grilled with a nice blend of onions in it too. The Cheez Whiz is the best and classic cheese with it and it has the texture of real cheese whiz.

At Geno's the bread is hard, the steak seems to be some soy blend that reminds me of White Castle patties, and the "cheese whiz" was watery like it was blended with water and kept sitting out for the whole day. Terrible.

If you want authentic cheesesteak heaven and speak 5 words, here's the order you want to make:

"Whiz Whit and Cheese Fries"
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When you are in Philly how can you pass up getting cheese steaks. When we tried Pat's on a Sunday night the line was small and moved quickly which made us go here first. We ordered almost every sandwich possible and my favorite was the pork with all the fixings. Wouldn't really do it again but I'm glad we tried it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This spot was everything I expected it to be. The food was a tad bit pricey (or at least pricier than before with the cheesesteak being $12), but it was definitely worth it. The bread was soft, the steak was perfectly cooked, and they did not skimp on the cheese and onions. The staff were super friendly and we got our food within seconds. (Tip: if you want the roast pork sandwich and the cheese steak, eat the roast pork first or else it will taste bland compared to the cheese steak)
P.S. I also went to their "competition" Geno's and Pat's is so much better. If you only have the stomach for one, go here.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Eat here and you might get murdered. All this area is is a hot zone for drunks. I would not recommend taking your child here anywhere past 7 PM
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Fun and a Philly must do experience. Really not amazing food and the place is gritty and over priced, but it is worth it. Do it.  Eat one at Genos and Pats both within 30 min, THE GUT CHALLENGE!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm a vegetarian 99% of the time, but I make an exception for Pat's every once in a while (usually when out-of-town friends come to visit). Pat's is simply the best. Anyone who says go to Geno's is wrong.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ask any Philadelphian and they will tell you there are much better cheesesteaks to be had in the city and that both Pat's and Geno's are just tourist stops.  While this may or may not be true, I have eaten a lot of cheesesteaks and have done a back-to-back taste test with Geno's in the past and I like Pat's the best, hands down.  It's meat, cheese, and onions on a good sub roll, and I enjoy it for its simplicity.  I've been here about 5 or 6 times now and always try to stop here when I'm nearby.  Definitely better than 3 stars but stop and decide for yourself whether they earn their King of Steaks reputation.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ahh pats is definitely the king of the game. A little messy but it's juicy and full of flavor. The establishment has been open forever and is a legendary staple to Philly so It's no wonder it's a fan favorite. I opted for provolone but there was so little I forgot I even ordered it w provolone ): will definitely try the cheese whiz if I'm ever back in the area. 
Mushroom provolone steak 7.5/10
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place is all hype, Lots of tourists and sandwiches were not that great. I was disappointed.  It was extremely hard to find parking as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I know, I know...tourist trap, yada yada yada...

But here's the deal - I've been coming to Philly for years now and when we do we always try to stop for a cheesesteak somewhere-Pat's, Geno's, or Jim's have been the standards, and I've been to Pat's more than any other.  I like Pat's...I really do.  For all the whining about cleanliness and rudeness-please, reach out and grab a clue.  It's a cheesesteak place in South Philly, in an area that just isn't conducive to being 100% clean 100% of the time-get over it or just don't eat at one of these places.

My wife and I always get the same when we come to Philly - regardless of the place - Whiz, wit onions and mushrooms.  The kids get American without...is American cheese even really cheese?  I mean I KNOW Cheez Whiz isn't, but I'm not looking for a filet with gorgonzola here!  Anyway, even though Pat's may not be the go-to place for Philly folks, it's probably going to remain our go-to place for the forseeable future.  We've tried Geno's on multiple occasions and the HAVEN'T perfected the cheesesteak that Pat's introduced on this corner in 1930.  

In a nutshell, for Pat's 2728th review I will say Pat's beats Geno's.  Prices are the same, seating is the same, service is the same, cheesesteaks are better.  There, I said it...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A must stop if you are in Philly. The service at both Pat's and Geno's is pretty much  nonexistent.... But that's part of the Philly Charm!  Speak English of go home!  Order correctly or go to the end of the line!  

At this point there are already well over 2000 reviews but here is my take on the Pat"s vs. Geno's battle.  

Pat's fries are way better than Geno's,  but Geno's wins the Cheesesteak battle by a nose.   Geno's just seem to be juicier.  

The real truth is that I have had better cheesesteaks at other locations, but you are a true foodie, you have got come to the hallow spot at least one in your life!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is my first review with no picture. I will explain later. I was in Phili and was told my multiple people to have a phili cheese steak. I'm from NY so i took the locals advice. I remembered seeing something on TV about Pat's and Geno's being across the street from each other and it is TRUE. you can be at Pat's and be looking at Geno's. The biggest difference between Pat's and Geno's. pat uses a Melted cheese wiz with chopped up meat and Geno's uses slices of cheese and does not chop there meat. I was told by a bunch of different people Pat's was better but they said it is personal prefrence. I went with pats! 

Parking was a B****. I had to park 6 blocks away in a grocery store parking lot. Due to all one way narrow streets. I'm not street parking my Vehicle in a area im unfamiliar with the crime situation it is too attractive to a criminal. being a non- Local im not taking a chance. It looked like a lot of people were walking to this location.

I went at lunch time on a saturday, which was a huge mistake. The line was about 1.5- 2 blocks long i'm not joking ether.The history of this place was cool there was a bunch of pictures of all of the famous people who have eaten at Pat's. I noticed a lot of people standing and eating. There was red picnic tables but everyone was filled. It smelled so good waiting on the line.

Once i got to the window there is a ordering routine at this place. i skrewed it up. I just wanted meat and cheese and i said cheese wit. i asked itf that was was just meat and cheese and the guy was like GET IT RIGHT! and then yelled to the rest of the line MAKE SURE YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE GETTING BEFORE THE WINDOW. I handed him my debit card and he said read the sign cash only. This is a CASH ONLY! business  smart by pat's for tax purp and swipe fees.

 I handed the guy a $100 bill said they cant take the $100. he starts taking other peoples cash that ordered already. I wanted to leave The turn over rate for this place was amazing. i gave him a $50 and he took it. I said i'm sorry i'm from NY you guys do it different around here. He said You should be able to read signs. I got super pissed i told him to keep the change i only ordered 2 cheese steaks. The signs he was talking about were right above the cash register. the line wrapped around the building. I coulden't see the menu until i was at the window.  I just felt annoyed. It was cool that i could see the staff making my food.

I ran into some people i knew eating there sandwiches. They told me there cheese steaks were good. I brought mine back to my Hotel and ate it there. The cheese steak was really good. everything was moist and juicy. If i went back to ether Pat's or Geno's again. I would send someone else to get my food for me and pay them $50 just so i woulden't have to deal with the crazyness again. I dont know if it led up to all of the Hype.

PROS:
- Food was Really Good
- The history
-Watch them make your food

CONS
- Location
- Parking sucks
-Ordering system (If you are a non- Local)
- Cash only (do not take cards)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When in Philly try a "real" cheese steak right? I looked up the most popular ones, and read about Genos VS. Pats, right across the street from each other. So we figured we'd try one from each. We tried Genos first, and then went over to Pats. You definitely need to know exactly what you want when you get up to the window. These guys don't play around. No one was rude, they are just very to the point, and all about getting the food out quick. I preferred Pats as far as the meat, I like the more "chopped up" steak. Genos meat was more like thick slices. Pats bread wasn't as soft though, so I mostly just ate the filling out of the steak. The cheese wiz was really good though on these Philly steaks, I had never tried that before. So between Pats and Genos, I'd say I preferred Pats overall. Just be sure to order correctly- I was listening to other people order before and after us, and you can tell the locals from the tourists for sure. The locals simply for a "wiz wit onions".  Really funny.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very mediocre sandwich. Steak was hard and without taste. Too little cheese. Fries were soggy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteak in Philly and the world! Staff is helpful, fun and professional! People that have bad comments are angry and jealous! It's beyond delicious!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The food is disgusting. The steaks have way too much gristle and fat. I do not understand why people claim the food is good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Order the pizza wit.     Trust me they have the best pizza steak anywhere.





Been coming here for 50 years the one and only original.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Definitely not the best cheese steak in the area, but it's a fun touristy place to stop. Just bring gobs of cash.

Basically, you walk up to one window where you order your steak (my fave is whiz with onions). You fork over $8.50 - then you wait on line at the next window and order fries and a drink - and fork over another 8 bucks or so. Then you try and hold the steak, cup of fries and soda while wandering around looking for a free table or loitering in front of people that appear to be finishing up. It is a bit of a juggling act. There is no indoor seating or bathroom to speak of.

They do take credit cards, but it takes longer to process and you get lots of dirty looks from the cashier and people in line behind you. Tip: Have your cash out and ready for when you step to the window.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Hands down the best in philly. I don't know why this place is so poorly rated. It's incredible! Best cheesesteak I've ever had. Plus they have large sweet peppers outside to add on top.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great area and pretty good cheesesteaks! I got a steak with American cheese and without onionsThe lines move fast, and you get your food quick. The only problem is that the steaks are a bit greasy, but overall I believe Pat's steaks are better then Geno's. Good steaks!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Everyone told me I couldn't go to Philly without trying a cheesesteak sandwich. I chose Pat's since it looked to be a more humble establishment and in my experience the glitz and glamour don't equal good food. The young guy taking my order must've had a hangover from the night before because he was just plain rude and obnoxiously arrogant while I placed my order. When I paused to ask him if there's a problem he told me to hurry up and "spit it out" as if to embarrass me. Huh? WTH?!? Wrong girl on a Sunday am buddy. I ended up ordering one sandwich despite being hungry and got a beverage instead. The one taking the order needs some customer service classes - especially in these COVID times. People can just cross the street and get a better sandwich from a racist bum. I asked for provolone cheese and he gave me wiz instead! Overall a bad experience for me. I could've gotten the same sandwich in NYC, better tasting with way less attitude and aggravation and not travel 2 hours for Millennial Entitlement!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After watching numerous shows and documentaries about the rivalry between Geno's Steaks and Pat's King of Steaks, my BF and I decided to do our own comparison (http://aprilsims.com/philly-food-review-pats-vs-genos).

Both places are located across from one another in South Philly at the crossroads of South 9th Street and East Passyunk Avenue.  In the middle of the "x" on one side is Pat's and across the street in the middle of the "x" is Geno's. It is a strange configuration, however it has been working for this neighborhood since the 60's and as the saying goes "if it ain't broke, then don't fix it."

From Pat's we ordered  a mushroom steak wiz wit. (wiz=Cheese Whiz, wit=with onions) .

From Geno's we ordered a steak provolone wit.

We sat down at a table halved the subs and began our comparison.

In this food challenge Pat's beat Geno's hands down. The bread from Pat's was soft and warm and the meat was sliced thin, seasoned, juicy and tender. We did not think we would be fans of canned/jar cheese (Cheese Whiz) on a sandwich, however it worked and it was a pleasure to eat. On the other hand the bread from Geno's was a little tough and chewy. Their meat was sliced thicker than Pat's and did not seem to have any flavor even though we had onions and cheese added to our cheesesteaks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was fun for the "experience" of going to Pat's, but the cheesesteaks were not very good!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
*Overrated.
*located directly across the street from Geno's.
*NO bathrooms!
*eat here just to say you ate here. But the food is nothing to brag about.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bread is so delicious.   We love so many places I. Philly but Pat's' wins our hearts every time.   It also helps that the family is so precious and after talking they gave me a Pat's ma
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered 3 Cheese Steaks wit onions and provolone. Would it kill ya to use a little flavoring on the steak? Some salt and pepper? Very bland. The cheese was sliced so thin, I thought they left it out, and the ratio of filling to bread - mostly bread. Also $5 for a cup of fries? Come on! This was not a good experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We walked 24 blocks to this place from the Liberty Bell. I was looking forward to having a real Philly cheesesteak from Pat's. They claim to be the first and all.

Waited forever in a huge line that wrapped around the block onto the street. I had my order all ready. Got mine with cheese wiz. Not enough cheese on it. The sandwich was bland and left a lot to be desired. Nothing I would ever want to eat again. I've had better cheesesteak sandwiches in LA.

We also got fries with extra cheese and that tasted okay. We had to get in a different but shorter line to get that and the soda. The cheesesteak line is just for cheesesteak.

Seating is hard to find and pretty dirty. The employees are rude and you see and hear them joking around and cussing at each other.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I used to Come here all the time, from south Jersey. I seen the app to Oder on Yelp and pay from cash app. I first went to check because I new this was always a cash place. The old guy yelled man yelled at me and said he never heard of this cash only. Very rude . Outside very dirty. Never again. Went to Geno's so pleasant so clean. So good
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Nothing beats living next to 24 hour cheesesteak heavens! Like when your really hungry just get up take a walk and grab yourself a cheese steak from Pat's Steak. Lived here forever and eaten at both. I just like the taste of the steak at Pat's much more that I completely forgot what Geno's steak taste like! Haha. Pour the condiments on my onion whiz cheesesteak please: relish, ketchup and mustard! ;-) Add my cherry coke and my small cheese fries. Don't forget to head to the gym later because all that food you just ingested! Lol. No wait! Maybe just starve the next day to balance this meal you just had. Either way, it was definitely worth it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Lena and I ate lunch here the other day while driving through Philly. I have eaten at both Pat's and Geno's before, and thought it would be fun to do so again. The actual sandwich is very tasty. I like the cheese wiz and onions, however, my complaint about this place does not stem from the quality of the sandwich. 
It's this: I HATE the fact That they compete with a cheese steak place across the street. I also hate that they have barely any seating, and That they only accept cash. Seriously? Why? Why not accept cards too? 
And is 11 bucks the going rate for a cheese steak? Maybe if you served it with fries.....and 3.50 for a soda? It's almost like they are turning this place into  a gimmick tourist attraction. So this is my reason for leaving a neutral review. I likely won't go out of my  way again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My favorite cheesesteak of the three we tried in Philly. Being that cheesesteaks are a supremely uncomplicated food, it's difficult to pinpoint exactly why THIS one impressed over others, but I think it was the proportion of onions, amount of whiz, and the moistness and particular method of chopping the meat.  It all just added up for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So, made a quick visit to Philly and took the Geno's vs Pat's challenge. The ordering process seemed to be pretty similar. Both were cash only. Pats claims to be the originator of the cheesesteak. So I order one with provolone cheese. The bread was basic. The meat was shredded and had some flavor. The provolone cheese was melted but stuck to the side of the bread. Not mixed I. Which would have made it better. Still liked it better than Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's or Genos? Genos or Pat's? Its like asking me if I am team Edward or team Jacob?
Well, I prefer Pat's- the bread is better. I will have to say that eating one of these can get messy, I had cheese whizz drop everywhere.
Pat's is good, but its not really worth the hype to be honest. I came here after dinner, and there was no line!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
OK, you go here for the greasy, beefy, cheesy, onion-y steak sandwiches only.  Everything else on the menu is moot.  Here is where you go to experience the famous, if not notorious, Philly Cheesesteak.  The bread is warm and soft to the touch.  And when you bite into this you taste the whole gamut of flavors all at the same time working in harmony together in one convenient masterpiece right in the palm of your hand.  

First timers beware.  I was scared to order at the window.  In fact I don't remember the last time I ordered.  I get the hubby to handle the grueling task of ordering.  By that, I do mean the hurried, rushed feeling that you get when approaching the window.  You need to follow the rules of ordering; think of Soup Nazi for you Seinfeld fans.  This is Philly for ya, but I love coming here.  But, seriously, Pat's people have personality and I would not change a thing about it.

We usually take out and drive off because parking is challenging and the streets are narrow.

This is the place I definitely take my visitors to fulfill the Philly Cheesesteak curiosity.  I've been visiting for more than 10 years now and I can always rely on it to be exactly the same almost to the point of calling it comfort food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When we visited Philadelphia, I had to go to the two famous Philly Cheesesteak places.  Are they tourist traps?   Maybe, but I enjoyed going to both places.  Pat's King of Steaks was our second stop.  Found street parking right next door to the competition. Our timing was perfect for both places because there was no line of people at either restaurant!!

We wanted to do our own taste test competition so we ordered the Cheesesteak with cheese wiz and onions from both places. We both agreed that both sandwiches were delicious.  We also both agreed that Pat's King of Steaks sandwich was the best of the two!!!  The meat just tasted better!

Pat's may not be as bright looking as the competition across the street, but they are the champs in my book.

Would I like either place, if I was not a tourist?  Did I fall trap to the nostalgia of it all?  I don't really care.  All I know, is that both wifey and I thoroughly enjoyed our Cheesesteak sandwiches wit and with the wiz!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Being the staple that Pat's is, it was the first place that I ate at when I visited Philly.  I stopped by at around 9:30 am.  Yeah, sort of an odd time to go for a steak sandwich but I wanted to avoid the long lines and be able to find parking.  And I managed to do both.  

As of now, there are almost 4,000 reviews on Yelp and Pat's is currently at 3 stars.  I'd say that's about right (I'm giving it three stars as well).  My sandwich was fine but it wasn't amazing.  I probably didn't have the freshest meat in my sandwich as I went really early in the morning.  It was fairly dry and didn't taste like a whole lot.  But the fries were fresh and I put some hot sauce on my sandwich so it all worked out.  

There is some outside seating in case you want to dine on location.  You also need to know that it is cash only.  The staff was friendly enough. 
 
I feel like eating at Pat's is much more about saying that you've eaten at Pat's because it's an institution as opposed to eating there because it's the steak sandwich in town.  I mean come on, Rocky ate here.  And it's marked by an engraved tile on the floor.  All of this being said, you've got to eat here at least once.  I think I'll check out some other sandwich shops around the city for the sake of comparison.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came down to Philly recently, and decided to do the big Pat's vs Geno's tasting.  I much prefer the look of Pat's at a glance; it's a simple stand with a few picnic tables, no flashy lights or gift shops.  I found the guys behind the counter to be gruff to the point of being rude; I'm from Brooklyn so I'm used to brusqueness, however watching them with several customers this was beyond that.  You order quickly and simply, Soup Nazi style.  On the bright side prices were reasonable even thoug it's cash only.

Meat was flavorful but on the dry side like it had been sitting out.  The bread really dominated the sandwich, and while it was good bread, this definitely needed more meat.  On the other hand the provolone was nice and sharp and the onions were perfect, however the sum was a really good--but not great--cheesesteak.  Worth comparing to Geno's etc, but not worth a special trip.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in Philly and even though we've tried other lesser known cheesesteak at Reading Terminal we still wanted to try Pat's.  It was a let down. Steak was bland. Provolone was not melted. Steak was warm but not enough to melt the cheese. They seemed to be pre made as we got them as I was going through my order. 

Glad we tried it though as I prefer to find out for myself and make my own opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
