This was one of the better cheesesteaks we had on our Philly tour. I really love the bun here. However this place is cash only. So make sure you bring cash.

Came here one afternoon on our tour of Philly to try as many cheesesteak as we possibly can. This one was actually a pretty good one. The bun was actually quite tasty, it was toasted and a bit crispy which I really liked and had a really good consistency and texture. There could be a little bit more meat inside the sandwich but that was OK. They also had unlimited amount of sauces and all you can eat pickled peppers. That was a really nice feature.

Do you watch out for the little birds and pigeons that tries to come in and steal your food. Outdoor patio seating is great.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As over-hyped and bland as a tourist trap can get.

All the grease, price, and wait without the flavor, character, nor experience.

I've had way more tasty cheesesteaks (with cheez-wiz) at random NYC diners than Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of those must try things in Philly. Honestly, it was okay but you should try it once. Have exact cash ready to pay and order with the right lingo! If you're going the classic route (and you should) - say "one wit wiz". You'll get a cheesesteak with grilled onions and cheesewhiz. I also tried Geno's across the street and I can't say there's a ton of difference.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm giving this four stars bc I don't want to cheat on genos. First time ever having a cheesesteak . I felt like a virgin who just discovered an orgasm. The cheese wiz was hot and messy and I loved the grilled onions . Why not more cheese on my fries ? Maybe a size up for my pants while I'm at it. The cooks were friendly and it came out super quick.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The steak sandwich wit the wiz was terrible. The meat must have been on the grill for 1/2 an hour. It was truely shoe leather. I would have rather had a steak ummm sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Double wiz wit + Pizza wiz wit = One happy little Drewgins (who reeks of onions).

You've all heard of a Philly Cheese Steak.  Well, these are arguably the best ones out there.  Are you in Philly?  Go the extra mile and come to Pat's.  Don't judge this wonderful sammie from anywhere else.  Go to directly to the source!  IMHO Pat's has the best combo of tender steak, fresh bread and tons of wiz from a large can. 

The routine is annoying the first time you order, but it's really not that difficult of a concept.  A few times I have gone to the window and ordered chicken wit broccoli. I laughed.  They did not.  I still got an awesome steak.  Take that Pat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was the worst cheesesteak I've ever had. It was served like warm, the cheese wasn't melted and they used canned mushrooms. The steak had no seasoning or flavor. The fries were decent.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: These cheesesteaks are so good! Make sure to get all the toppings and cheese wiz. Plenty of outdoor tables and they literally make it for you in 10 seconds.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: love, love, love. The meat was thinly sliced and oh so flavorful. The "whiz"  is truly something special (perfect for a cheesesteak, that is). I tried out Gino's too and it just does not compare.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very disappointed. Dry with no seasonings. My cheesesteak wasn't even hot and my cheese was not melted. Save yourself the trip and head over to Dalessandro's if you're looking for a better cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Most of the people who gave these Philly Cheesesteak places 4-5 stars must be tourists in Philly.  It's truly disappointing experiences for me as I have tried many cheesesteak shops in Philly, over many occasions, and none is worth my time and money.  
It's definitely better than Gino's (right across from it)
but to have a real cheesesteak you really have to come down to Al's Steak House in Alexandria VA.

2.5 stars for this Pats
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bread was soggy, Meat was boiled or something, Clearly didn't give no F**** at the trash they decided to serve me. Fries were okay but their prices are outrages for the trash they sell. Bucket list for my friend, only reason I came in here. Will NEVER be back!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The worst cheese steak ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just do yourself the favor and don't even try it !!!!!!!!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A bit overrated, whiz and onions on steak are good, steak has nice flavor, portion was weak though and its overpriced. Jims is much better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've been here two or three times and honestly each time I remember why I don't come back. It's actually just a tourist trap... there are much better cheesesteaks in town (see Sonny's Famous Steaks). Before I went to Sonny's, I thought cheesesteaks were just bad because of my time at Pat and Genos. I might sound harsh, but if you look at my reviews I rarely give out anything below 3 stars. The bread is rubbery, meat is to chewy... wow. I agree that it's fun to try out both cheesesteaks and compare them, so props to their marketing I guess.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A friend convinced me to try this place instead of Geno's, and I don't regret it. My first ever philly cheesesteak was heavenly. I got a "whiz wit", which was stuffed with greasy steak, cheez whiz and onions. My order was ready before I even had the chance to pull out money. Also, this place is CASH ONLY.

The description sounded kind of gross. Seriously, cheez whiz? Don't be all bougie and pre-judge though. This is one of those "don't knock til you've tried it" situation. It's actually a pretty wholesome meal if you think outside the box. There's protein (steak), carbs (bread), dairy (cheez whiz), vegetable (onions) and of course plenty of essential oils. I will definitely be returning!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I prefer Tony Luke's.
Parking sucks.
The line is usually always long but it moves fast.
Cheese steak is good.
Can sometimes suck to find a table.
If it's cold it sucks to eat outside.
Best when visited after a night of drunk madness.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First visit to Pat's, it's the originator of Philly Cheesesteaks so this was a no brainer.

Ordered the wit onions and cheese wiz which I could be totally butchering. I really do require the instruction sheet or a 101 on ordering these things.

I liked this cheesesteak second best to the three I tried on a short weekend trip.

I liked the bread and the meat but I think I'd order extra cheese wiz next time.

The meat is chopped which definitely seems to be the way I prefer it vs sliced.

Service is top notch, arrived to no line, ordered and was handed the cheesesteak in less than a minute. Serious 5 STAR service, the cashier was also wearing a really cut cheesesteak hat. I may need to Google it, I don't even really eat meat, or white bread but yet I want a cheesesteak hat (i don't even bother trying to understand my thought process anymore).

I'd return but there's another spot I did like better than this one.

CASH ONLY.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
5 friends and I couldn't decide on Pat's or Geno's. So we decided to split up in 3s to order 1 cheesesteak each and we'll share it and compare which one is better.

So 2 friends and I came to Pat's and ordered a cheesesteak with wit and provolone cheese. We 3 ate our portion first since the rest of our friends were still on line to order at Geno's.

Honestly, Pat's cheesesteak tasted amazing! Super flavorful! When our other 3 friends came with Geno's, they also ordered a coke and cheese fries. We couldn't compare the fries(all wells...) but omg.... I gotta say, Pat's win!!! My other friends agreed too. Geno's cheesesteak was a bit dry. Maybe it's because they didn't order it with wits... lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely overhyped. Order the mushroom cheese steak on Uber eats when I needed a late night meal. The meat was flavorless so that was disappointing. It also came with grilled onions, which I didn't mind, not sure if it came that way or if they made a mistake. I had provolone cheese on mine and I feel like they didn't put enough cheese. I actually had to pour a salt packet on my sandwich because it lacked flavor, so I would say this was disappointing for my first Philly cheesesteak experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's one of those places everyone either loves or hates so I had to try it. I held my cheese steak five inches above the table and watched the grease just run out of it.  I haven't been back since.

If you are hungry for junk get McDonalds it's cheaper and will stay in your body for an hour as opposed to Pat's which evacuates in less than 30 minutes.  Hope you parked close bro!  You don't want to get caught unaware on the walk back to the car.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bottom Line: I prefer Pat's cheesesteaks over Geno's but once was enough for me given the lack of parking and lack of a leisurely dining experience.

For a long time I've been curious about Pat's and Geno's, probably thanks to features on TV.  I finally made it to Philly and tried them both.  I definitely like Pat's cheese wiz without better than Geno's because Pat's bread is soft while Geno's bread is chewy.  Another differentiator is that Pat's steak is chopped up while Geno's is more intact slices.  Both cheesesteak stands are located in a cramped and dirty part of Philly where parking is hard to come by.  You order at the window and then if you're lucky, can a score a spot at a picnic table.  I was at Pat's in the dead of winter so there wasn't a line and our order came up immediately.    I would have enjoyed my experience better if I could have eaten the $10 cheesesteak in a more temperate location with access to a bathroom.

(As Seen on TV:  Food Network's Food Feuds, Travel Channel's Food Wars and Travel Channel's Food Paradise.)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place sucks ! The cheesesteaks has no flavor and no seasoning whatsoever. Very bland meat and the cheese wasn't melted enough for satisfaction. They are very expensive for food that isn't quality enough for me or the people that I ate with. The customer service was also very inadequate and I didn't feel welcome. The tables were disgusting and there were flies swarming on food under the seats. Never coming back to this place, one of the worst sandwiches I've ever had!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been a fan of Pat's since I was a little girl. And since moving away from Philly there's just no other place in the world that comes close. So whenever I visit home we always make a trip to Pat's. 

Service is.. well... it's Philly! We ain't got time for slow folks so make sure you know what you want when it's your time to other.  And a true Philly cheesesteak is wit whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Simply delicious. Get cheese wiz on your cheesesteak...even if you think you dont like it you need to add that. I got my original sandwich with extra cheese and my husband went across the street and wished he would've got one at Pat's. Ha! Told him!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The world famous cheesesteak spot is a must visit when you are in Philly due to the iconic nature of the restaurant. But, compared to other cheesesteak places, Pat's is far from the top, and can sometimes be dirty on the outside. Overall, average place but is elevated by its iconic status.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've only been to Pat's just one time, so this review is solely based on what I had that day.  I had a Mushroom Steak Whiz Wit'out and while it was very meaty, probably more meaty than any cheesesteak I've ever had before, it was sorely lacking in Cheez Whiz.  Well, there was a ballgame going on that day, so they were really busy and I could vouch for that.  It was still great regardless.  I'll have to come back here again maybe when it's not so super busy so I can get a cheesesteak that's not rushed.  Hopefully sometime soon!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Amazing cheesesteak! Ordered it from Gruhhub and it was still warm and delicious. It was also quick. Only thing is they forgot to add my onions and peppers, which I paid for. Besides that, definitely recommend!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Honestly I haven't been to Pat's in a few years. I went to Saint Joseph's University and this was always the late night run to spot for cheesesteaks. Nothing like standing on line and freezing your ass off for a great cheesesteak. 
When i was there a few years ago, it was as good as I remembered. Wiz Whit! it was juicy, tasty and cheesy. A great thing that was made out of simple ingredients. I understand that it now costs about $9 bucks, but worth it for the nostalgia for me at least. 
Yes there is a certain way to order and there are multiple signs and instructions on how to do it. You should know how to order when you get to the guy. The reason is to keep the line moving. 
I have never been to the place across the street. Actually not even sure they are still in business?
Philadelphia, Rocky and Pat's!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I stopped in Philly for the day, I prefer more of Dalessandro's because its chopped, but depends if you want to wait. But Pat's wit whiz is really good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good steak sandwich but not the best by any means.  Worth stopping by to check out and check off the bucket list.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was the first place we went after getting off the plane. Parking is crazy in this area, so grab whatever you can find. The best thing about Pat's is the older man who is outside the building and gives the place some character. The cheesesteak sandwich was fresh and I loved the bread. We had mushrooms, onions and cheez whiz on the sandwich. Know what you want before you get to the window.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Loved Pats!! Loved the workers (who were so friendly, welcoming and funny) as well as the food. Got the steak sandwich with onions and whIz. No wait and once ordered I got the sandwich in less than a minute. The steak was your typically shredded beef for Philly cheesesteaks, which was delicious. The whiz didn't overwhelm the sandwich at all and the bread was very good. Not too soft and not too hard. Can't wait to come back soon.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Despite the bitter rivalry and committed fanbases, I thought both Pat's and Geno's were amazing! Trying both was definitely getting the best of both worlds ;)

At first bite, Geno's seemed to be the winner for me since I liked the texture of their bread more, and the fillings for both seemed comparable. However, the more and more I ate, the more Pat's grew on me! The juices from the meat were overflowing and the chopped up bits just went so well with everything.

My verdict? Pat's was the winner for me :) Can't wait to try more amazing Philly cheesesteaks in the future!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've had lots of cheese steaks, some in recent years when visiting the Philly area, but most of them from the Chester and Media areas where I lived in the 60's and 70's.  They were to die for.. Fast forward to today when my 15 year old and I ordered with provolone and onions at Pat's while visiting our eldest son who lives in Philly.  I was so excited to introduce my hoagie/sub-loving teen to my favorite childhood take-out (well besides pizza).   Well he ate his in about 1 minute and said it was ok.  Clearly, I had built this up too much.  When I got two bites into mine, I found just a big bunch of gristle that I could not bite through.  It was gross and definitely not like the meat I remember having at any other place.  The prov was not melted, there was more gristle than meat, and the sandwich was too dry.   They obviously don't care about repeat customers if they serve such grisly meat.  I don't care how famous they are!  For $9 it should   SO sorry that I bothered going there.  I could have had and definitely have had a cheaper better cheesesteak at the Reading Terminal Mkt. or lots of other places.  Will never go to Pat's again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I told him not to, but my good buddy and fellow Yelper Tom E (https://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=g8j2ci2FcvmocszcO6ypNw) drove from the suburbs of Atlanta to my place in the city, during rush hour, to deliver a birthday gift that included one Pat's Original Philly Cheeesesteak. The cheesesteak had been flown in that same morning. Thank you, Tom.

For those who don't know, Pat's and Geno's are the most popular places to get a cheesesteak sandwich in Philadelphia. They are old and they are competitors. "Pat's King of Steaks" is the "inventor and originator of the cheesesteak sandwich." They've been in business since 1930. During one of my visits to Philadelphia, friends and locals steered me away from Pat's and Geno's, both of which are popular with tourists. Instead, I went to Jim's Steaks South Street: https://www.yelp.com/biz/jims-south-st-philadelphia.

It would not be fair to make a comparison of my experiences with Pat's and Jim's since I had to reheat Pat's cheesesteak at home while I had Jim's cheesesteaks fresh at the restaurant.

You can purchase Pat's cheesesteaks by mail-order through Goldbelly: https://www.goldbelly.com/pats-king-of-steaks. The cheesesteaks were shipped frozen with dry ice packs and reheating instructions. The cheesesteaks were already assembled and wrapped in Pat's signature logo'd white paper wrappers. The Cheez Whiz was packed in separate containers. At the time of writing this review, Goldbelly offered Pat's Original Philly Cheesesteaks in sets of four ($79 or $19.75 per sandwich), eight ($129 or $16.13 per sandwich), and 12 ($169 or $14.08 per sandwich). Shipping was included in the quoted prices.

Reheating was quick and easy. Instructions were to bake at 300 degrees for 10-14 minutes until the bread was lightly-crisped and the meat heated through. The Cheez Whiz could be reheated in the microwave or in a saucepan. I reheated the sandwich in my old toaster oven so it took a little longer than 14 minutes. I used the microwave to melt the Cheez Whiz.

I was impressed with how the sandwich turned out. It looked just like the cheesesteaks I saw of Pat's online. I had the "Wit" onions and Whiz version, but you can get "Wit-Out" onions and change the cheese to Provolone or American if you want. I think I may have baked the sandwich a little too long because the outside of the hoagie roll started to crack and it was extra crispy. That was okay, though, because the inside was warm, soft, and delectably chewy. The bread was good. There were plenty of tender morsels of quality ribeye, but what brought everything together was the melted Cheez Whiz. Mmm... That melted cheese coated the steak and eventually found its way to the bottom of the sandwich, soaking into the bread. This made each bite rich, flavorful, and really satisfying.

There aren't many ingredients - bread, meat, onion, cheese. Pat's found the right combination of quality, taste, and texture. If you're considering purchasing some of Pat's cheesesteaks via mail order, let this review be a vote of confidence. At the time of writing this, you can only get the Original Philly Cheesesteak via Goldbelly. The Mushroom Steak, Pepper Steak, Mushroom Pepper Steak, Pizza Steak, Fish Cake, Hot Dog, and Fries are not available online.

Enjoy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have heard from the locals in South Philly that this place was a tourist trap, but I wanted to be the critic. I would almost give 4-5 stars for the vibe at this place because it's pretty busy with plenty of outdoor benches. Even has a stone  by the order booth that shows that "Rocky" was filmed at this spot. The cheesesteak with provolone I bought for $11 was a difference story. Bread was too chewey and the steak was also dry and chewey. Not even close to the quality of Ishkabibbles up the road.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's oh Pat's.... my #2 cheesesteak in Philly. (Second only to Tony Luke's)

This is the archetype of the cheesesteak, it's classic form. 

Not as robust or hearty a sandwich as a Tony Luke's, but authentic South Philly just the same. The meat and cheese are scraped off the griddle and slid onto the bread. Served to you with the roll agape, its contents oozing & steaming. 

Pat's is THE place to go late night after the bar. 

Upon arrival at Pat's you will notice the interesting juxtaposition of rival sandwich shops at that intersection. Much has been said of both. Fierce allegiances exist on both sides. Pat's has the character & consistency. 

That other place is just a neon caricature owned by an outspoken xenophobe.

Where do your allegiances lie, noble Philadelphian?

Mine are with PAT'S. 

My advice: Provolone with, after midnight.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Only slightly more edible than Geno's. This tourist trap doesn't even taste good at 4 am. Now that's saying something! Both Pat's and Geno's are cheap, fatty cuts of flavorless meat, served on stale rolls at a premium and shoveled out by the dozens by rude staff to tourists that are just don't know any better.

The only people in Philly that will tell you Pat's or Geno's are the best cheesesteaks in Philly are people that are CLEARLY not from Philly. 

Sorry but I wouldn't feed these to my dog.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best steak sandwich! I love this place. So I was introduced to this place around 2012 when visiting Philadelphia. I automatically knew this was the best steak sandwich I have ever tasted. Me and my boyfriend drive from New York City to Philadelphia every few months just to get a sandwich and go back home. Everyone says we crazy but it's BOMB & Worth every trip all the time! Can't wait to go again!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered cheese fries from this iconic Philly stand. I do not eat meat, otherwise I most certainly would have indulged in a phily cheesesteak. I love these fries. They were perfectly cooked on the outside and soft in the side. The cheese was not too salty. My only qualm with this store was that it was a little overpriced for cheese fries. However, I guess since its so famous it has the rights to overcharge for fries. Def give this place a try especially if you're not a native Philly goer.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great hoagies fast service and good food that you'll enjoy! The line gets long but it moves very fast.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good, reliable cheesesteak with no frills plus delicious French fries. A little out of the way for a tourist, but worth the trip. I was worried about the COVID set-up and the hot peppers but thankfully they give it to you in a plastic bag. I'll always come here when I'm in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wowwwwwwwwww!!!! I've been researching for weeks to determine where I was going to have a famous cheese steak on my one day trip to philly. After days of analyzing the data, researching photographs, making pros and cons list I decided on Pats. The research paid off. Everything was perfect. Yes they are assholes here but you are in philly and that's to be expected. My girlfriend was licking cheese wiz off the paper wrapper. That's how you know it's good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been to Philly a bunch of times and in all my visits, haven't noshed on a Philly cheesesteak. The group I was with on this occasion unanimously agreed that it would have to be from Pat's as we weren't hungry enough to get ones from each to compare. Plus, I don't each red meat that much anymore and didn't want a total stomach upset for the 2-hour ride back home. Pat's was good, we got ours witout but with wiz. Make sure you get the lingo down before ordering and heaven's to Betsy, you don't need to preface the sandwich with Philly - you're in Philly. It's like saying chai tea or ATM machine when you're there. While no one in our group dislikes onions, we figured if we're sharing it's easiest to get witout. That's an intentional drop of the H, don't @ me.

The meat itself was good, not as greasy as I had mentally prepared myself and the cheeze wiz, while normally I would classify it as an aberration of the American cuisine, fit in perfectly. The bread was meh, a bit on the stale side. It didn't soak in the grease at all which was, interesting? Now that I can answer 'Yes!' to the 'Omg you were just in Philly, DID YOU GET A CHEESESTEAK?!' question that is so often tossed my way, I'll be happy to venture forth and try the more gastronomically adventurous ones in the city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Everyone visiting Philly has to have a Philly Cheesesteak and I did not pass up the opportunity. What better place than Pat's, the creators of the original cheesesteak. 

After researching the correct terminology to properly order, I got a "wit w/ whiz" (aka Grilled steak with onions, and Cheez Whiz). Also make note this place is CASH ONLY and you order cheesesteaks at the first window, then fries and drinks at the second window. Don't mess up the flow or I hear they will bump you to the back of the line.

Overall the flavor of the sandwich was very good. The hoagie roll was incredible; one of the best I have ever had. They chopped and almost diced the meat up which made for easier eating. I just wish there was more of the meat as pieces of it were far and few between in some bites. The grilled onions were heartily chunked and cooked perfectly, and just the right amount of Cheez Whiz.

Honestly at the end of the day, this place is a bit of a tourist trap as the locals I spoke with said there are far better places for a legit Cheesesteak in Philly, but for a tourist like me, it was a fun experience to at least do once!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's Pats.  It's the original cheesesteak.  What else do you want?  You want a cannoli, go somewhere else.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Any trip to Philadelphia would not be complete without at least eating one cheesesteak sandwich so on this occasion had a few hours before my flight I decided why not try both at once. 

I went with the cheese steak with onions, mushrooms and provolone cheese and have to say that Pats compared to Gino's had the upper hand on multiple levels as well as it seemed like it was a crowd favorite as the line that I had to wait in for Gino's was not as long is the line for Pats.

Overall I think it is a good experience, but not necessarily worth five stars I think it's really merely a tourist adventure or way for people to feel as if it's the same place they can come back to you and know what you're going to get each time. 

The biggest thing that stands out to me is the steak quality and taste. It's good to see the steak being cooked right in front of you and then moments after that it being placed in the hoagie. The onions are cooked properly with the mushrooms and not just thrown in the mix. All this with some provolone and it is with the 10 bucks!

My only real complaint about the cheesesteak was the bread I felt as if the bread was a little bit lacking, but the other items overshadowed it at the end of the day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: king of cheese steaks.. I don't think so.. #1 attitude of the order taker is typical Philly rude and maybe I didn't order right..(and i'm from Philly) I ordered 4 wiz steaks w/ onions and mushrooms on the sidewalk with snow blazing around me and asked to order fries.. and told to move to another window 3 feet your the left.. the steak had no taste and fat content was at a max.. should have gone to Geno's across the street... or better yet BIG JIM'S on south street... the parking is just as bad but the Steaks are so much better...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is just a mediocre tourist trap. Definitely not worth $12. Bread is chewy. The meat tasted like reheated boiled steak. I gave the second star because of how they slathered the cheez whiz. Go to Sonny's if you're able to. More inviting atmosphere, more customizable sandwich, more variety in the menu.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had a group of friends visiting California and had to show them the Pat's vs Geno's rivalry. We got lucky and got parking right next to the restaurant. Got a cheesesteak with provolone (usually get cheez whiz). The meat was a bit dry and needed some more salt and pepper. Overall, not the best cheesesteak I've ever had but have to go once for the history behind it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
PAT'S vs GENO's

My grandma lives a couple blocks from Pat's, so I've been going here every so often for most of my life. I would have to say that nothing has changed at this famous, classic eatery. The place has always been CASH ONLY and open 24/7, 365 days a year. Lines would wrap around the block, even in the cold. People have come from far and near for a Philly cheesesteak. 

I have always preferred Pat's for cheesesteaks, since it has more flavor and is less dry. My favorite has always been the mushroom cheesesteak wit whiz. If you're not gonna get whiz cheese on your hoagie, then what are you even doing?

If you're in Philadelphia for the first time, I definitely recommending stopping by the famous sandwich in its birth place. I bet you won't be able to eat a cheesesteak in another other state.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Super meh. I flew from Minnesota to Philly for one day just to eat cheesesteaks. (Great deal on airfare). I went to Pat's, Geno's and Tony Luke's. I thought a yard of cheesesteaks in 10 hours was probably enough. At Pat's I got a mushroom pepper cheesesteak wit with provolone. The mushrooms were canned and the peppers with pretty uneventful. The ribeye was tender but bland as hell. Yeah I'm from the Midwest, but I actually like flavor. The bread was chewy and held the sandwich together well. That was really a highlight of the sandwich. Service fast and friendly enough. When I go back to Philly, I don't need to rush back here. Pat, I'm sure you used to have a great product, but those days must be in the past.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know how you feel but I don't care just want to share my opinion THIS PLACE SUCKS steak taste plain no vegetables no cheese I guess the management change since last time I went but never the last there better more reasonable places then this NON king of steaks
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When in Philly ...

It was time I went and found out what all the hype was about, so I made it a point to also try Geno's, which I did before I hit Pat's, only because I was feeling lazy and hungry and my car was parked slightly closer to Geno's. 

I left my experience from each place giving a narrow edge to Pat's. It seemed the steak was a tad more seasoned here, or perhaps it was the fact that this place seemed slightly grimier than Geno's and whatever lack of deep cleaning gives a little more character to their cheesesteaks. In fairness, however, I ordered provolone versus whiz at both places, which I'm sure is a violation of the rules according to most cheesesteak experts. 

I hate that they're cash only in 2016, but I see they have no problem getting away with it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Whether your drunk or sober, a cheesesteak from Pat's "King of Steaks" is not a good idea. The corner of 9th and Passyunk is the cheesesteak mecca. Tourists travel near and far to get a sample of an authentic Philly cheesesteak. Expect to see people with cameras and fanny packs. Spoiler alert: locals DON'T eat Pat's or Geno's....well unless they're in the neighborhood and have the drunk hunger pangs, but I'll digress.

My brother came to see me from out of state and said that a friend of his said "you gotta try Pat's", so I begrudgingly did even though it was my first time here too. Looking at the prices, I thought it was incredibly overpriced for what you're getting. You better follow their order guidelines to tee or expect some serious man sass. A woman in front of us asked if she can get the cheesesteak cut in half. He raised his voice and was still working robotically "no, we will not cut in half" she asked again and this went on for a good 30 seconds. I was surprised to see him raise his voice at a woman that looked like he could be his grandmother. It was awful!

The cheeseteak: Nope. Nope. Nope. Bland, unappetizing. Even fake cheese (wiz) couldn't even save this sorry excuse for a sandwich. You're probably thinking "well why don't you put some ketchup or mustard on this?" My response: Get outta town! That's not authentic cheesesteakness! The mildly redeeming part of the meal were the fries, which would be pretty tough to screw up.

I didn't particularly like the homeless people basically playing the role of busser and hoping that they would get some type of donation from a patron. I like to eat in peace, thank you very much. So this place is a no go for me, now and forever more.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So its probably been about 5 years and I was craving for a juicy cheese steak.  So I opted for Pats famous Steaks in Philly.  As I arrive in had to drive around a couple of times to find a parking spot but I did shortly after.  Walking up I see the line is about 20 deep but don't worry this is normal and it goes fast.  Within minutes in order " wiz, wit"  which means a steak with wiz cheese and wit which means cooked onions. So cheese steak with wiz cheese and onion.  3 seconds later its in front of you.  Walk 10 paces to left and order your drink and fries of you wish.  Remember PATS is CASH only.  I was then lucky to find a seat and then I dug in to soft bread, dripping wiz and large amounts of steak.  Yummy.  After about 30 napkins the steak was done and all I needed was a recliner and remote lol.  My steak was $12 and well worth it.  Keep up the great job Pats I will return.  Dont let picture fool you the steak was 12-14 inches long.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Is it the greatest cheesesteak in the world? could be. What it does, is give you a nice cheesesteak with really good service out great place to sit back in Philly and absorb the feeling of being in a good working class philly neighborhood. I would definitely recommend coming out and enjoying a cheesesteak..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We stopped here on the way back from Boston to Washington DC to enjoy an authentic Philadelphia cheesesteak.  My wife discovered Pat's after some Google research of some of the best places to eat.  We tried Geno's and Pat's the same evening and all seemed to enjoy Geno's more.  We ordered cheesesteak, wit, wiz....aka a cheesesteak with onion and Cheese Whiz which we understand to be the definition of a cheesesteak.  We also ordered regular and cheesefries.  

Despite enjoying Geno's more, none of the five of us were impressed with  Philadelphia cheesesteaks.  They lacked flavor.  It was like eating unmarinated meat, onion, and bread covered in cheese.  I've had better cheesesteaks at other places around the country so it was a bit disappointing this was the standard that everyone references for cheesesteaks.  My son said if we ever return to Philadelphia, that he doesn't want a cheesesteak...and I think the rest of the family agrees.

Parking was problematic as there is nothing besides street parking and it was chaotic when we arrived.  There was a guy trying to make a few bucks who was directing traffic and said he would watch our car.  We returned and he was nowhere to be found but we sat nearby to watch the car as we didn't park in a proper spot.  A cop passed talking on his cell phone and didn't blink an eye so we figured we were alright.  

Pat's seemed to be about the speed.  Cheesesteaks were ready within seconds of ordering.  The cashier had attitude which I didn't appreciate and even my kids commented afterwards but I guess the attitude is normal for Pat's from what we've read.  I ordered two cheesesteaks, he gave me one, so then I asked about the second as another rep put one out, and he counted them for me...1...2.  I decided not to rip his head off and moved to the next window to order fries and drinks, also paid separately.  I made the mistake of asking the guy if he had a drink carrier, he looked at me, and then walked away.  Lovely people at Pat's.  It was a bit challenging to carry multiple drinks and fries.

In comparison to Geno's across the street, Pat's is a bit primitive and inefficient.  It's something you have to see for yourself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The Mecca of Philly cheesesteaks!!! This is where the story of creating a Philly cheesesteak started!! These cheesesteaks are some of the best I've ever had!! I like my Cheesesteak with onions and cheese whiz! The provolone is a popular pick too! The fries are better at Pats than Geno's! There are two lines; one for ordering a cheesesteak and the other for ordering drinks or french fries. This is one of my favorite things to hit in Philly everytime I am there!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Three stars for some pretty freaking bomb cheese fries other then that..... MEH

Long line after a T Swift concert naturally. 

Was Impressed by the cool sign and history behind the place 

Two stars for a subpar cheesesteak which I broke my vegetarianism for because yolo (and I heard good things.) Not worth it. Flavorless and stingy on the cheese. 

Appreciated the whole numbers for pricing because of the CASH ONLY factor. 

And I must say I like the street side ambiance for sheer touristy attraction vibes.

All in all I might love this place after like 8 beers as a drunk Taco Bell binge substitute.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Alright so this was a must for me before we left! I wanted to go to south Philly for the best cheesesteak! 

We stopped in at Pat's King Of Steaks!
So first off it is a cash only location, which is ok with me. I ordered the cheesesteak with Whiz, and I will tell you this! It was amazing! 

While sitting there this man comes up while sweeping and asks us if this is our first time there, then starts to tell us the history of the place. Come to find out this man was Frank the owner, and his daughter was also sitting there. He explained that his father and uncle started the business. 

Got to see all of the photos and signatures of all the famous people that have been there. I even got to take a photo with Frank. This was a great moment, always nice to meet the owner of an establishment that has been around since before my time

Side note his daughter also thanked me for visiting even though I was a Yankees fan lol gotta love it! Also she took the photo
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pros: Lots of meat! 
Cons: Didn't meet my expectations of a really Philly cheese steak. 

I live in Jersey so my prime purpose to visit Philly was to get a delicious Philly cheese steak. This sandwich was good but I felt like I could've gone anywhere in Jersey and gotten a same or even better tasting cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I get this is for fast food cheesesteaks, locals love it, seems to always be a line regardless of which time I go, I think I prefer Geno's though, I went for a late night visit mid August and the meat was just way too salty, same with the fries.

Maybe I'm just getting older who knows.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This "King of Steaks" is a Philly institution, albeit famous more due to history and incumbency, rather than genuine food quality.

You'll request and pay for your cheesesteak from a grumpy staff member managing the order window. They only take cash, so make sure you have some. A traditional order would be a cheesesteak "wit" onions and with cheese whiz. Once you pay, they'll whip it up for you and have it out in less than a minute.

The sandwiches themselves are so-so. The meat is a bit dry, the cheese is pretty weak, the bread is quite bland, and the overall flavor experience is lackluster. Compared to Geno's across the street, Pat's has shredded beef (vs. sliced) and much less cheese flavor impact, but the sandwiches here are less messy and easier to eat.

Pay a visit if you want to try a Philly classic. But one visit will probably be enough - if you want a good cheesesteak normally, there are better places to look.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is well worth the hype.
So much that in fact we went twice in one week, driving completly out of the way back from NY to Ohio adding an hour of driving time just to eat another cheesesteak.
Ok 5, since we were pissed that we just got one to share the first time.
We wern't hungry and got one at Genos and one at Pats just to compare, but as soon as we bit into a bite of Pats we were all over it, talking about it the whole week and finally gave in, drove back and got 5 more with wiz, peppers, mushrooms and onions and some of the awesome green and red peppers they have at the cart out front which rounded it off perfectly.
Lines are a mine long but the guys are quick, yes $9 per sandwich is steep but it will stay on your mind forever.
About once a year I get a craving for meat but if I lived closer to pat's I'd eat it daily.
Usually there is no way I touch beef or god forbid cheese wiz, but this is so f*cking good there is just no way around it.
No words can discribe just how good this is, just thinking about it makes me want some again right now.
Nothing can compare, if you are anywhere in a 1000 mile radius, do yourself the favor and go to Pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not one who travels all of Philly, looking for the best cheesesteak. I'll be honest- I haven't even tried Geno's. I was born into a Pat's family so that's where I go and I have no complaints!

My mom and I go to Philly every couple months for an appointment of mine and it is always a tradition to sit down to cheesesteaks and cheese fries after. My mom taught me that a Hi-C goes best with this combo and I've come to learn that it is delicious!

We always get cheesesteaks wiz wit! I'm personally not the type of person to get anything besides cheese wiz because it ends up being too dry for me. The onions and mushrooms top it off! Their fries are always so warm and delicious and there is cheese throughout! I love that there is cheese on the bottom and that you don't run out of cheese and have dry fries!! 

I've only been here about 20 times in my life but every single time I'm in damn heaven! It is my favorite treat ever when we travel to Philly to get cheesesteak and fries! 

I cannot wait to be back and cannot express my love for this messy delicious sandwich!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It's legendary and you have to go to say you were in philly, however don't expect much more. The food was ok at best, seating is limited, the experience was rushed, but it is what it is so enjoy it for the philly experience once
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
King of cheesesteaks.

I have had many cheesesteaks in my day. Many. This has a flavor, a texture, and an old school experience you can't get in most places anymore. The sandwich was nice, tight and complete, the cheese came together with the texture of the steak. I drizzled a little hot pepper juice on top. It's worth it. People making their comments have had things LIKE cheesesteaks and forming opinions based on what is only similar, this however is the OG, what a cheesesteak sandwich is supposed to be like.

The battle is over in my book. 

Will return to Pat's, easy pick for an amazing sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Steaks were great.  

I had been to Geno's twice and never to pats. So this time it had to be Pat's.  

It was a long line, but a very quick one.  Got near the front of the line and I only started reading the 'how to order' sign which had hilarious comments and it was already my turn.  The order went smoothly and I was off to the fries and drinlks window.  The steak meat looked great where you could see them frying it up through the window as I passed. After I got all the food, I was glad my girlfriend was there to help me cause it was a lot of stuff to evacuate.  

We thought we'd have to leave with the food and eat it in the car because all the seats were occupied on the way in.  Fortunately one opened up as we headed for the car.  

First let me say the fries were excellent.  Kind of a crispy flavored fry.  Definitely a nice surprise.  After we sat down a guy who cleans the tables came around and offered us some napkins.  He was quite a character and engaged many of the patrons in conversation.  I think he is a great ambassador for the place, really liked his demeanor.  The steaks were great we had ours 'wiz wit'.  Good stuff, nice rolls.  There was a little bit of gristle in the meat we didn't care for, but you'll have that with real meat.

The place was clean and nice looking.  The staff were courteous, industrious and efficient. I would definitely go back.

As for Geno's I think it is just as good.  There is something to be said about going to the source and ';rockin it from the cradle', but there are great steak shops all over Philly and in the surrounding areas as well.  

Gotta do it if you're there, but some local shops are just as good.

Enjoy!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak was very chewy. Very fatty. The bread and everything was good, but Probably won't be back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I say depending on your preference on how you like your cheesesteaks will determine whether you like Pat's or Geno's better. I ate pats first then genos back to back to judge for myself. All i can say is........ I'm team Pat's alllllllll the way!!!! My first reaction taking a bite of Pat's was a mini orgasm in my mouth hahah. The bread is soft but still maintains structue to absorb the oils and cheese mixture from the onions, cheese whiz, and steak. It can get messy, but there is so much flavorr. Pat's has the perfect mix of oil to cheese to onions on the shredded steak. It's a party in your mouth. Ugh my mouth is watering just thinking of it. If you like flavor and oils, go to Pat's. I took off one star because compared to Geno's the establishment wasn't as clean as Geno's. But I say the shadier the establishment looks, the better the food!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Totally overrated. Ok at best and I have had better cheese steaks.

I wanted to go here mainly for the experience but that was probably the "best" part. The cheese steak was alright. There was some weird ass ordering system and the signs were kind of amusing. But I guess the whole "Hey we're a bunch of grumpy ass dudes making cheese steaks" schtick isn't really that funny in real life.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We wanted to try famous Philly cheese steak while in town so we picked this one based on the popularity. We decided to get one from Pat's and one from Geno across the street to compare. Prices were same at both places.

Verdict: Pat's won over Geno's based on taste and customer service 

Although the line was long, it moved quickly. Once you place your order, you get your sandwich within minutes. You don't even need to ask them to slice the sandwich in half...they do it automatically (unlike Geno's). The employees were friendly and didn't give you an attitude (unlike Geno's). We had the mushroom Philly cheese steak with provolone cheese. But surprisingly the cherry peppers were so good and made this place the winner in our books.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So I enjoyed Pat's for the experience more than anything else. I liked how the restaurant was later out and being able to see the chefs prepare the sandwiches. The pepper steak sandwich was pretty good. I will say the fries are much better than the fries from the place across the street. Good eats.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not the best cheesesteak in the land. I was thinking of if your in philly you have to try one correct? Perhaps, but the hot and readiness of the food to accommodate the masses also lowers the quality. The ingredients arent as fresh as they could be and the bread wasnt that great either.

The prices were crazy. Im a out of towner so when i saw the prices I was thinking geeze lousie. A cheese steak and an order of fries totaled 20 bucks? At home we could go out and get a nice plate... maybe even a real steak and a potato for that much. But hey who am I and what do i know? Oh yea only cash as well.

In philly and your visiting.... save a little money find something more high quality and that takes longer than 3 minutes to make!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I rated 5 stars back in 2016 when I first started visiting Philadelphia. I won't have a cheesesteak anywhere else but in Philly. Lately, it's been a hit or a miss. On some trips when I come out it's good, sometimes, not so good. I even brought friends from California and boasted the whole time that Pat's was iconic and the best. After having it for the first time, they weren't thrilled about it and neither was I. I came out in August 2020 and explained at the window that I was taking some back home and needed the cheese separate. They actually did it for me and I put in the freezer and ate it a couple of weeks later. I then came out for New Years' 2021, and the dude at the window wearings a 76ers mask was being a dick and said they don't do that, never have, and never will. So I ended up bringing home some soggy ass cheesesteaks. Anywho... later that night, I drove to Delassandros and I was actually surprised that the price was close to Pat's except they had a ton of meat and cheese on their steaks! All these years being loyal to Pat's only to be treated like shit at the window, telling all of my friends about it, bringing friends to the Inventor of the cheesesteak, I was wrong. I guess I was blinded by the hype of it all. These cheesesteaks are not as good anymore.. people are right, it is a tourist spot..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's versus Geno's...the dice versus the slice!

We stopped by Pat's first since the overall trusty Yelp rating was so much higher.  The three of us split two: the cheesesteak wit whiz and onions, mushrooms, and peppers and a cheesesteak wit whiz and onions.

The two main differences between the infamous rivalries: 1) Pat's has a more extensive menu, 2) Pat's dices while Geno's slices their meat.

Of the two we ordered here, I liked the cheesesteak wit whiz, onions, mushrooms and peppers.  The peppers added a really nice tangy element to the cheesesteak.

The cheesesteak wit whiz and onions sorely lacked flavor.  I was disappointed...so of course we had to go across the way to Geno's for comparisons sake and ordered the same thing.  Geno's was much more cheesy, juicy and overall flavorful!  Perfectly seasoned!

So, if you love the extras like I do, go to Pat's and order the cheesesteak with all the extras.  If you're a purist, go to Geno's for a flavorful cheesy-meat explosion in a bun.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my second time trying their food. I reaffirm my opinion that it's just okay. The meat is a bit on the greasy side. And $9.50 for one cheese is not exactly cheap. There are many other places in Philadelphia I found to serve the same food, only tastier. I think this is just an example of good marketing; a combination of food network and rivalry resulting in a tourist attraction. Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came here on a recommendation from a few friends, I don't have too much cheesesteak experience so I'm basing my judgment on everything all around. Putting away the only negative of cash only, I ordered a Pizza Steak, having the sandwich coming out immediately after I said my order. This place does not only have fast service, but the steaks with the sauce are much better than any other cheesesteak place that I have gone to.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You want an au-thentic Philly cheesesteak?  Everyone will tell ya Pats or their competitors across the street, Genos.

Both places do sell cheesesteaks, and neither place is close to the best in the city.

Why go to Pats or Genos?  They are worth a miss but the 9th street market is worth a long look if you are a foodie.  

Fantes is a must for serious cooks, cooking equipment fetishists and a look back 30 years to when there were stores specializing in just one category rather then the current pluthera of big box stores with the finest products from China and India on sale 365 days a year.   

Isgro's has some of the best pastry you will find anywhere in the USA.

Anastasi's seafood is a good place if you want to buy good fish and seafood to bring home and carefully make - not much to look at though...

Spice corner will sell ya just a pinch of this or that hard to find spice.

There is a place called DiBruno's.  They have all kinds of meats and cheeses, olives, oils etc.  I am a big guy and one time the guy was getting my order and I was looking.  With fine urban salesmanship the guy who FWIW looked more Irish then Italian to m, said something else catch your eye, my friend?  I said look at me, pal - everything here catches my eye!

If you want to explore the Italian market and say you have been to Pats then go.  If you are reading this, however, you likely know how to use Yelp and will be able to find a better cheesesteak...with no trouble.  Not bad but...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Today I just performed my Pat's vs Geno's assessment.  1st - Pat's is an average cheesesteak.  While in Philly the last few days, I've had a cheesesteak everyday.  And I've had cheesesteaks outside of Philly...so I consider myself an expert.

But comparing Pat's and Geno's, Pat's is more flavorful.  Pat's gives you more meat.  Lastly, I liked Pat's bread better.

However, the next time I'm in Philly, I will not come to Pat's (nor Geno's), as I think you can get better cheesesteaks elsewhere in this great city.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I think this is such a cool place to visit!  It's just such a part of the Philadelphia vibe, and makes for a nice compliment to the day if attending a Phillies or Eagles game.  I've just tried Geno's and Pat's in Philly, so I'm not the person to ask if there are better cheese steaks in town, but I always enjoy a Pat's steak, much better than Geno's in my opinion.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Promised my little girl I'd bring her a real Philly steak, then I ended up side tripping to Jersey for a couple of days and ate it. So I find myself staring down a non-stop drive to Ft Lauderdale sans the promised grease bomb. Did some yelping as I head south above Lo! Pats really is the , open 24 hrs and 15 min (late night) hop off 95. I got 3, she received hers and I remain Big Daddy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've lived in the suburbs of Philly for over a decade and it's now, when I came back to visit family that I was willing to try the hyped up Cheesesteak from Pat's.

The BF and I were driving around downtown reminiscing about memories and decided to take the 13 minute drive and get a cheesesteak from Pat's.  Don't ask me how we snagged a parking spot two feet from Pat's, we totally did.  

Ordering is simple, for me, pepper cheesesteak wit with provolone (I'm not a cheese wiz girl).  Food was ready before we finished paying.  Separate window for drinks and fries.  

We grabbed one of the many tables surrounding Pat's and started eating.  I loved the peppers, onions, and provolone with mine, it was a wonderful combination and the peppers gave a sweet note with every bite.  It was a little greasy, but what cheesesteak isn't?  We both devoured our cheesesteaks and enjoyed every morsel.  The bowling ball that hits the bottom of your stomach afterwards is a completely different review.  It tastes so wonderful going down that you're willing to put up with the discomfort afterwards.  

I was pleasantly surprised by the tastiness of the cheesesteak at Pat's.  I can't say it's the best I've ever had but it's certainly a winner.

*Cash only to all those newbies.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not what I was expecting ... this is the definition of fast food. This is what it feels like cheesesteak is supposed to taste like.

I only tried the classic cheesesteak without anything else. The fries are kinda breaded and go really well with the sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible meat, unseasoned and all around dry sandwich.  I am soooo disappointed in the cheesesteaks around town.  I need a real hidden gem the next time I am in Philly.  I hate the fact that you have to stand outside and eat your meal as well.  The benches are never cleaned and condiments juices are everywhere.  I will be trying any other cheesesteak spot in the city next time other than this one..smh.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Did a taste-test with the hubby: Geno's vs Pat's.  Pat's wit (onions), peppers, whiz was hands down the best.  Also tried provolone, but nothing beats the whiz.  Eat. The. Whiz.  Guys working at Pat's were friendlier and funny.  Don't miss this experience!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Honestly a the cheese fries are the only reason I am tempted to round up to 4 stars... but the steak itself really wasn't all that great. At least it's a step above Geno's but that really isn't saying too much either. Just kinda dry meat, not quite enough of it or grease for my taste, and a decent selection of sodas - birch beer is a fav for sure
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Upon landing in Philly, my cousins and I decided that it was wise to hit up some iconic cheesesteak spots for my first meal in the city. In doing my research, Pat's seemed to be the destined place to visit. The spot was nestled in an Italian neighborhood of Philly with parking being a bitch. We literally went around in circles for 20 minutes and finally walked our way to this joint. 

 Pat's was busy. Across from Pat's was another cheesesteak joint known as Geno's that seemed to be equally busy. Obviously, we knew we had to visit Geno's right after to do a comparison of the two. 

 Pat's had some seating al fresco. The menu was pretty simple...cheesesteaks and hot dogs and fish cakes...and cash only.

CHEESESTEAK WITH PROVOLONE ($11.00): This was just ok for me. I liked the steak but the cheese didn't really do anything for me. I thought the flavor of the meat with the onions went well together, but it just needed more sauce and flavor.  

MY FAVORITE DISH. CHEESESTEAK ($11.00): Cheesesteak wit whiz. This was my favorite. I love the steak with whiz. I think that's how the Phillys do it and the only way to do it. The cheese seasons the steak and makes it creamy and luscious. I love it and its the only way to do it. Onions and all and the bread held up to all the meat.  

Overall, I thought Pat's was pretty good. It's a simple menu of cheesesteaks with the type of cheese of your choice. I personally think its advised to order the steaks with whiz. I could eat multiple of these. We didn't bother with the hot dogs or the fish cakes cause our focus was on the cheesesteaks. Be prepared to wait. There is always a line but it goes by pretty quickly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Hold on wait a minute
Pat 'put her foot in it'
Where do I begin.
Let's start at the 'Proper'
Way to order. There is 
A Sign telling you the 
Rules and Regs. 
Get it Right because as
Soon as the words leave 
Your mouth the Cheesesteak
Is Ready! Literally!
I went with the PepperWizSteak.
This is for me the perfect
Combination of Sweet Hot
and Cheesy. With the Meat
Perfectly Cooked Juicy 
Yet firm and then there is
The sesame seed Bun.
Forget About It!
No not literally it's just
An Italian slang.
This Bread was baked this
Morning! Not yesterday!
So Fresh and Capable it 
Held what could have been
A catastrophe for my 'outfit'
At Bay and then some.
Nothing on my gear,
And wanted to lick the
Wiz off the paper.
LEGENDARY.
'Pat' yourselves on your
Backs!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats is a great greasy spot for classic chopped cheesesteaks. I got the cheesesteak with American cheese and onions. They are generous with their steak and the bread is excellent. It's also super fast- I hadn't even told them my order and my sandwiches were already ready. My only criticism is that they were skimpy with the cheese for a cheesesteak-- you have to order extra cheese. They were a bit dry too but overall super delicious.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Through out my life Cheese Steaks have always been my one of, if not, my favorite food. So I had to come to Philly to finally taste the real thing.  And you know the first stops were. Pat's and Geno's.

So I can finally put the debate over. Pats is the better steak by a slim margine. It just felt like the quality of the meat was slightly better, or at least the taste. But it was very close. I understand that most Philadelphians say that both aren't that good compared to the other places around. But it was plenty tasty to me. Pat's takes the it vs Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know why people lose their nuts over Pat's and Gino's. You pay a shit ton of money (cash only, which really grinds my gears) to someone who truly acts like an ASSHOLE behind the register just so you can get some junky, greasy "steak" slapped onto a white doughy mess of bread. My biggest peeve about Pats is the attitude and impatient eye rolling that comes from the employees while you place your order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best steak sandwich I have ever had by far in Philly and beyond. It's the original for a reason!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's won the cheesesteak challenge agains Geno's by a hair. The meat was very overcooked but at least it wasn't greasy and the sandwich was not all bread.

We had:

Cheesesteak with whiz and onions - good but not great

Cheesesteak with whiz - my kids thought it was okay at best

Cheese fries - swimming in whiz

If given a choice, I would not go back to either establishment. Jim's beats both by miles!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Bland. Worst Philly cheesesteak I have ever tasted. Spent $50 door dashing 2 steaks & fries, neither of us could even finish the horrible sandwich. Go to Jim's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'd say the philly steak is better than genos of course they have that but the customer service needs some work. Idk what's up with people but a smile will get u a long way with people if you just showed some teeth but all in all the philly was good it's diffidently holding its name as king of steaks but the customer service needs some improvement.

I would also like to add they would of got a 4th star from me if the customer service was better both genos and pats have really bad customer service so if ur going there expecting someone to say hi welcome to pats how may I take ur order they won't they don't care about your day they just want your money and it's messed up cause I'm a very nice guy and customer service goes along way with me I like feeling welcomed when it comes to a place I've never been too and want to try so all and all I hope they improve there customer service if not I won't be returning.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This used to be my favorite place for cheesesteaks when visiting Philly. This time, I was so disappointed. The steak was dry and lacking seasoning, and the bread was a little stale. I've eaten here before and they were great but things have changed for sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I know this place is a religion for natives. So given that, we took  two busses, a train and walked about a mile to get to,  supposedly, the two most raved about cheesesteak establishments. 
I really wanted to experience the chez whiz but my daughter felt that was just nasty. So we got provolone. Honestly, there was nothing spectacular about this place. It is all hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Esquina mítica de Philadelphia si es que las hay, onda que el cheesesteak es sinónimo de esta ciudad y este es uno de los más famosos.

Pero vamos al sandwich en sí: obvio que es rico, no lo voy a negar, pero la verdad qué hay otros mucho mejores en la ciudad.

La esquina y el lugar en sí son súper pintorescos. Se pide y se come en las mesitas de afuera. La mala es que solo aceptan cash.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Always amazing when I go here, we drive all the way from NY to have these cheesesteaks & they never disappoint! Will be coming back soon!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Went to Pat's King of Steaks with my wife, sis, and brother-in-law, and had his famous Philly cheesesteak with mushroom, onions, and cheesewiz, which was delicious! And did you know it is kosher, with the cheesewiz put on the bread, invented by Frank, the owner. I was stoked to meet Frank, the owner, and his wife. Both very friendly and humorous. It's rare you get to meet the owners of a famous establishment. What an experience! Will definitely come back. May God continue to bless you.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I live in Philadelphia and therefore, I have tasted a real cheesesteak. Several, I have even lazily made one at home it's a simple formula a fresh amoroso long roll, cheese of your choice I prefer provolone as the cheese steak gods intended, as "whiz" is not a real food and therefore is not going to be acknowledged as cheese moving forward in this conversation. You then add meat, specifically thin sliced juicy ribeye. Some people like onions and peppers I like fried onions on top. The rest is up to you.

Pats and Genos share this review. Look at the formula! A hot dog roll?! Dry meat?! Your cook can't fry onions PATS!! your kidding me?! My bodega on 4th and Jefferson makes better cheesesteaks than you and that's on the Birds . I gave you your five stars to keep tourists out of the North but I couldn't let it be left unsaid.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The meat was dry and flavorless. Genos is much better...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
From Hawaii and always wanted to try a Philly cheesesteak and where better than at Pat's.  
We were disappointed. Overpriced, rude workers, greesy and tasteless. Charlie's sub  sandwiches here at home is way better. Again, just the hype. Never going back and I would never  recommended to my family and friends.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: HORRIBLE!!!! over priced and dry no seasoning just meat and cheese. For small fries and drink which was mostly ice it will run you $9 I couldn't believe it. Welp, I learned my lesson.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After all of my visits to Philly, I can now FINALLY say that I've had an authentic Philly cheesesteak! When driving down the block, Geno's is definitely more eye-catching, but I've never been one to judge a restaurant by the number of flashing lights it has -- almost over-compensating, with how much the lights blind you. 

I will be honest and say that I don't have any basis of comparison as this was my first ever cheesesteak, but I really enjoyed my meal here, and the experience as a whole. The line moves scarily fast, leaving you almost no time to prepare yourself to say "Whiz wit" (with onions) or "Whiz wit-out" (without onions) and to get your money ready (CASH ONLY). You get your sandwich within 5 seconds, and then you're on your way to pick up napkins, hot peppers, utensils, etc. 

As for the cheesesteak itself, the meat was a liiiittle on the dry side, but the slathering of warm gooey CheezWhiz makes up for it. I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the hot peppers, but my friends swear by them. I really liked the texture of the bread and the fact that it wasn't soggy, but actually still had a slight crisp to it. The cheesesteak is also just the right size -- enough to make me plenty full, but not to the point of bursting at my seams. 

I'd like to come back and try Geno's out JUST so I can compare the two, but Pat's has definitely made an awesome impression in my books.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not much of a cheese steak place. Food is bland and service is slow. That shouldn't surprise anyone though since they are flamboyant liberals.
