Go across the street to Geno's- better food, better service and better atmosphere. Lower prices too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Walk up tell them what you want and the make it super quick I got my steak in less than a minute. I got the cheesesteak with onions and wiz, The bun was fresh they give a generous amount of meat and cheese. Parking is scarce, it's cash only they have a bar across the street that has a ATM, and last thing don't get intimidated by the line it goes quick.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I won't bore you with some long winded review about this place, it has 1,400 others if you care for the details. Pat's wins, Gino's is good but, my homemade cheese steak is better than both.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came here because of such high ratings on yelp and i needed to try this while i'm in philly. Geno's cheesesteak was right next to this one. Waited around 10 minutes and was up for order. 

You have to choose wit or without onions and the kind of cheese you want, either American, Provolone or Wiz. The order came out fast, you then slide your steak to the next window where you order your drink. The cheesesteak was around 9+ and the soda was 2.25. You will be lucky if you can find a seat here. It was in the 90s when I came here so i do not prefer the outside seating. 

The meat was really dried and rough. There wasn't enough cheese mixed in there. The soda doesn't have any gas, tasted like water. This place is overrated, I've had better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
what's a trip to philly without a stop at pat's (and then at geno's) for a cheesesteak eat-off. but for me, a philly cheesesteak is really more of a bucket list type of activity since ultimately, they really aren't that great (fully expect to get some blow back from the city of brotherly love).

but for the cheesesteak itself, i'm all about the whiz. i LOVE whiz. it moistens up the bread, complements the 'spiciness' (not much here since the added peppers didn't really add too much heat), and clogs arteries. what's not to love?

ultimately, bucket list checked. as for the competition, i'd have to give a slight edge to pat's if for no other reason than it seemed a bit more whizzy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The best cheesesteaks by far in the country. They invented it, they perfected it, they are the reason Philadelphia has a cheesesteak. The best I've ever had! Delicious!!!!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pros: If Geno's busy and line is long then you can come here. You can also compare philly cheesesteak sandwiches with Geno's. 

Cons: lots of flies by the seating area. Cost a $1 more for philly cheesesteak sandwich than Geno's. Not flavorful.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I couldn't go to Philadelphia and not have a cheesesteak. With that said we made our way over to Pat's. With a long line that moved quickly and a decent amount of outdoor seating, we decided to eat. There is a special method to ordering your sandwich. I had mine with cheese and grilled onions. I'm not entirely sure on the quality of meat they use but overall my sandwich was good. Between my cheesesteak, side of fries, and an ice tea, I was straight for the rest of the night!!! Pat's may not be the best cheesesteak but I would certainly eat here again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Awesome Cheese Steak Sandwich and Fries.....! 

I ordered a cheese steak sandwich and fries having no expectations of quality.  I was just hungry and looked them up on Yelp.  They were close to were I lived, 1.6 miles. 

I have only been here once and will return again.  If you have ever been to Philly.  You know that the two most popular tourist locations to visit for a cheese steak is either Pat's or Genos.  Ironically, they are located directly across the street from one another. I have been to both and this place made me a cheese steak that was the closest to either one of these Philly establishments.  However, to all of you that do not know.  There is a way to order a cheese steak sandwich (not a steak and cheese).  Please see the attached photo from Pat's Famous Cheese Steaks!  Thank you!

And they're much cheaper that Pat's too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What else would I get while in Philly? 

I am in town visiting and the only thing I wanted in Philly was a Philly Cheesesteak. I've heard great things about Pat's and decided this was a must-do on the trip. 

The Philly cheesesteak was delicious, I got it topped with provolone cheese and a side of fries. It definitely hit the spot. 

However, parking was very hard to find, the line was long, and once I got to the window I felt very rushed and overwhelmed as I have never been before. It is also cash only so be prepared!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is my first trip to Philadelphia and I went over to Pat's to find out what all the hoopla was about with the cheesesteaks. Now initially I intended to try them and the other guys across the street. But after what my Uber driver told me, I decided to take a break and also make a post on FB hands down everyone agreed Pats is better. I was very happy with my cheesesteak wit onions and provolone though I know I'm supposed to get cheese wiz. The service was fast and the sandwich was great. Maybe next time. Check it out if you are in the area. If you have a group maybe do both spots, see what you think.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wow!! What an experience! Pat's never fails to deliver the goods with the yummy goodness. Haven't been here in months. That will definitely change. The cheesesteaks and fries are still to die for.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What's not to love? A historic walk up cheesesteak joint in a residential Italian neighborhood, open 24 hours and cheap. These steamy meat sandwiches are fantastic, soft hoagie rolls and deli wrapped so well. You gotta decide, Witwiz or Witout. There's a pickled peppers bar and outdoor seating.
Put this place on your list.

Taste ****
Quality/Freshness *****
Presentation/Uniqueness ****
Service *****
Atmosphere *****
Bar
Cleanliness ****
Price $$
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
There's a reason why Pat's calls themselves the King.  
This was our final stop of our Cheesesteak tour before going to the game at Citizens Bank Park.   

Parking is a pure nightmare.  It's wedged in a triangle with Geno's, a huge park and then houses and apartments.  I circled four times before we finally got lucky. 

REHEARSE TO YOURSELF WHAT YOU WANT. There's a big board telling you how to order and where to order.  Steaks at the first window and fries and drinks at the next window.  They have zero tolerance for us tourists.  Hahahahaha.

I got a wiz wit for my wife and I to share and a wiz witout for the kids.  Only gripe is they didn't cut it in half.  I had to rip it in half like a caveman in the car.  Did I had to ask for it to be cut? I honestly don't know...

It's part of the Philly atmosphere that we all love. 

Now the sandwich.  By far the cheesiest, which I love.  The steak quality was great and the way it was chopped was actually perfect.  Just enough... not super fine like some places.  Onions complimented this sandwich perfectly and as I already stated,  the cheese wiz was flowing. 

Make sure you eat your sandwich around back where Gazzo gave Rocky the money to train.  Great history with a great sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourists are the only people who think this place is good.  So many outsiders who have no clue about what a great cheesesteak tastes like.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Food was great in taste and size. Cashier who was skinny, with beard was extremely rude. He had no manners in regards to how he spoke to me and what he said. I am out of town and I was having  a bit of a hard time ordering and I told him this and he told me that he didn't care if I was out of town or not and that I should know what I am getting. So food was good and service was bad. On the other hand the cook at Pat's was real nice and helped me out with my order.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Iconic yes. Great cheesesteaks no! Don't even bother. Better than Geno's across the street though. 
We did a road trip from DC to Philly for a cheesesteak tour and Pat's was suggested. Maybe at some point before they got so popular they may have been good...well they lost their touch.
Their fries were good though!
Oh and it's cash only...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The snake casserole is a tasty treat. Barely has that snake bite after taste that you get with most snake. The cow muscle is especially good with cheese wiz. We had the udder milk with cheese wiz and it was the highlight of our trip to philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I knew what to expect when came here and I got exactly that. A greasy ass cheesesteak (this one covered in provolone). I came for the experience. I did not like it and was assured that there are actually really good cheesesteak places nearby, but I just couldn't eat anything else. Come here for the history and be prepared to get covered in grease. Glad I went, but I have no intention of returning when back in PA.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I expect great things here but prefer Geno's accross the street. PS: check out The Garage Bar next to Geno's! It's B.Y.O. Cheesesteak!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I enjoyed my cheesesteak with wiz $11. Super fast and made to order. Only outside seating but there was a bunch of tables. Parking was sooo annoying though, if you drive around long enough you'll find something, hopefully. We parked about half a mile away and walked. Not in the best area. We did feel like the pats cheesesteak was the best, the meat tasted good and the cheese wiz was nice and hot. Good ratio of meat to wiz. Cash only!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Always good. Easy to order for pickup. Consistently delish!!! 

I get mine with American cheese, peppers and onions !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came around 10pmish. My boyfriend and I flew in from California and wanted to try this place. The line was quick and the service was fast. We got our Philly cheesesteak and it was the moment of truth. My boyfriend wanted to come to this place for his birthday from CA to try the famous Philly cheesesteak. Let me tell you--this place did not disappoint. The bread was nice and toasty, the cheese was warm, the meat was tasty, and the overall experience a memorable one. Highly recommend!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Horrible!!! Worst cheesesteak place ever!!!!!!!!!!! I what is it supposed to be King of because it's definitely not the cheesesteaks.  ABSOLUTELY gross!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Solid cheese steak! You order at a window (and you must order quick) and it's cash only. I got regular cheese steak wit wiz and onions. Tasted really good. I wanted to order with provolone but the guy at the cashier was speaking so fast I couldn't change it. (Hence the: please know your order and say it quick). They literally give it to you in seconds which I thought was absurd (but must be nice granted the volume of customers they get). 

Bread was really nice. Cheese complimented the steak nice and the cut of steak & marination was good too! Lots of seating which was a plus. Overall, for my first in Philly cheese steak, I was satisfied!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Umm, I've had better cheesesteaks in California. It was greasy and expensive. The cashier was rude and frustrated by customers. Too expensive. Best thing about it was bread. I do not understand why this is "famous".
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: They were super nice BUT my provolone wasn't even melted and the steak was cold... fries were good but that's it. We drove from NY to try a Philly cheesesteak and with Geno's across the street  we choose wrong
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I visited today, since Pat's is literally right across from Geno's. We wanted to try a variety. Pat's is a CASH only establishment and all prices include the tax already. We ordered a philly cheese steak no onions, but with whiz cheese. The cost of our sandwich was $11. We also order a small cup of french fries which was $5 dollars. I forgot to take a picture, but the appearance was not too kosher. I liked the fact that the bag where it was packaged was in a wax paper like bag and you couldn't see the grease seep through.  We took our sandwich back to the hotel to make the comparisons. We cut the sandwich in three  equal pieces and split the fries. My first bite was from Pat's. Pat's philly sandwich, the thin slices of meat were seasoned and very tender, bread soft and chewy in texture, cheese gooey making the sandwich a perfect combination. Let's talk about the fries, the fries were not very crunchy, somewhat soggy. I really didn't eat them only had 3 pieces. 
At the end, my kids and I made a unanimous vote and the clear winner was Pat's. I believe that the wiz cheese  was the winner ingredient and the glue to the sandwich. If you come to Philly no doubt visit Pat's. (I want another sandwich!!) Lol
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Visiting Philly for the first time and decided to try out some cheesesteaks. Pat's hands down beats out Geno's. Flavor is on point.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've been here several times and Pat's always takes the prize as far as I'm concerned. 


Pat's! Pat's! Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Greatest cheesteak ever . I love stopping here on my way to the Jersey shore. I live in central PA and have taken a few trips to Philly just for pats. Cool staff always . Best cheesesteak and fries by far !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yesterday I had a half of each a Geno's & a Pat's cheese steak, and split it with my brother.

We ordered a Wiz without at both places. Now I have been a loyal Geno's guy for years but my loyalty is wavering.

Pat's was chopped up and I could taste the flavor! The rolls and the whiz were both a wash, both tasting just as good. Pat's Wiz without cost $9.50, I  guess the 50 cents was worth the flavor, when in the area the next time I am gonna go to Pat's King of Steak's to try a whole Wiz with and then I will make my final decision.

Geno's is not chopped and had more fat on it. It was also not as meaty! It was also kind of blah!  Price of a Geno's Wiz Without $9.00, for me I would rather spend the 50 cents and be satisfied.  

Both have outside seating, so make sure to dress according to the weather. Also at both places you order your steak at the first window and your drinks and fries at the second window.  Also make sure you have cash because both places do not accept plastic.

I must add that John's Roast Pork makes a far superior cheese steak, and that you should try theirs instead. Both Pat's & Geno's are riding on their reputation and is really just a big tourist trap.

I will give Pat's 4 Stars & Geno's 3!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
After reading horror stories about irate Italians driving people away for placing a cheesesteak order incorrectly (I kept thinking of Seinfeld's soup-Nazi), I was mildly apprehensive. As I was nearing the end of the 30 minute line, my pulse quickened as I tried to remember whether I was supposed to proclaim my cheese preference before or after stating that onions should be included. But apparently it was extremely overblown, because all of the self-proclaimed cheesesteak experts (and there are a lot of these idiots out there on the world wide interwebs) made a bigger deal out of ordering a cheesesteak than was necessary. I yelled "1 WHIZ WIT, AND 1 PROVOLONE WIT!" at a higher octave than planned in my head, handed over $20, got my change, and within 10 seconds, was left holding two sandwiches while looking around stupidly for my friend to pull up with his car. 

But I digress from what really matters: the cheesesteak. I always thought that if Chester the Cheetah had diarrhea, it would look like cheese whiz, so I'd always take the safe (albeit delicious) route of Provolone. But I figured, "what the hell, let's see what the big deal is." I was pleasantly surprised. The whiz worked nicely with the sandwich, oozing in all its neon glory into the meat, and adding the right amount of cheesiness without overpowering it. The meat was hot, flavorful, but somewhat tough when compared to other cheesesteak establishments that I've been to. The bread; honestly, I don't remember anything about it. Overall, my impressions were that the sandwich was filling, warm, and delicious, although the chewy meat, long wait time, and somewhat steep price for what is effectively a medium sized sandwich geared toward tourists from New Jersey (everyone in front of me had the accent) keeps it from being perfect. I know there's better out there, but I left Pat's feeling satisfied and if that doesn't deserve some stars I'm not sure what does.

I didn't do a side by side comparison with Geno's, as recommended by so many people. I refuse to try Geno's because: (1) Geno's looks incredibly garish (like the worst of what Vegas has to offer), (2) Yelpers (Yelpees? Yelps? What are they called?) on average think it's crap compared to Pat's, and (3) the incredible ignorance of the establishment refusing to serve anyone who doesn't speak in English annoys me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Giving 4 stars for the the whole experience not the sandwich alone.  Got the rude "hurry up and order" service I was expecting being a tourist.  Ordered the steak wit Whiz and onions.  Sandwich was a 3/5.  A little dry and bread was kind of tough.  I've made better myself (thanks YouTube!) Definitely more of a tourist destination.  Want a better Philly then head over to South St.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's isn't great. But it is DEFINITELY better than Geno's. The steak has more flavor and it isn't dry, unlike its competitor. I ordered the cheese whiz wit, and it was fine. However, for a place that's supposedly known for its cheesesteaks, they need to step up their game. Maybe it's the bread - it's pretty chewy. That could also be due to the fact that we visited at midnight and maybe the bread was stale by then. But if you're going to be a 24 hour establishment, you better make sure to find away to keep that bread fresh. The quality should be consistent. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if I was in the area, I wouldn't mind grabbing a sammie from here.

*Tip - cash only
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Over Rated. There are some much better cheesesteaks around Philly (Steve's Prince of steaks, Jim's, Wit or Wit-Out).
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 20 bucks gets you 2 lukewarm steak sandwiches with flavorless dry meat. I guess I fell for the tourist trap. I've had way better steak sandwiches in Los Angeles for less money. The place is open 24/7, cash only, street parking.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Absolutely best cheese steak, fast service, you see a line but don't be worried moves super fast!  This place has master the science of pleasing there customers.. oh and don't be afraid of the wiz
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Keeping it Simple...
Steak with onion and whiz- 2.5 stars.  I've had much better, even in South Florida
Service- 0.000 stars.  When the hot sauce dispenser got clogged and then shot out over my wife's shirt (was not a pretty site).  My wife asked for a cup of water or ice to help with the staining and some punk a__  kid behind the counter refused her and wanted to charge her $4.  Way to go on the service side!!!  I'm a foodie, take my word for this -There are better Philly subs around town and in other states, and for service this place gets a BIG FAT ZERO.   Look out for my article in the paper soon.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It was ok... Me and a coworker/friend went to the Green Hills for a business trip and decided to stop here after our flight landed before we went to our hotel about an hour out for the night. The guy at the airport recommended Pat's and said it's the best in Philly. Not too sure about that.

The line was pretty long which was too be expected, Geno's was as well. The Eagles Cowboys game had just finished and of course the Eagles lost... so the fans were on edge while waiting in line. I would say we got to the order window in about 25 to 30 minutes. They have a pretty strict policy about knowing how to order and knowing what you want when you get to the front.. obviously.. they want the line to stay moving. I get it. 

The particular time we went they were out of nacho cheese which was a disappointment. The cheesesteak tasted just average. It looked average. To wait 30 minutes a cold, long line, it just didn't really live up to the hype for me. Maybe nacho cheese and something else on it would have gotten me to a 4 star but just wasn't to be. And if you're looking for seating then forget about it, you'll be eating it standing up. Or in our case, the parking lot of a CVS on the back of our rental car. Idk if Geno's would have been any different but next time it would be my stop for sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The meat is better than Genos. The cheese is less thicker than Genos. The bread was beyond mediocre. I've had a whole lot better. Don't believe the hype. Jersey mikes FTW.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The original but not the best. I got the mushroom cheesesteak wiz wit. I'm neither a big fan of cheese wiz nor onions, but apparently this is the only way to do it in Philly. Pat's hoagie was big, but the beef was skimping and the mushrooms were from the can. I also had a couple bites of inedible tendon. Maybe they saw I was a tourist and wanted to punk me silly. Not worth the $20 round trip cab ride from downtown.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bland, plain, overpriced, overhyped. Don't waste your time. You can do better in your kitchen. 
There are better, FAR better places to go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I enjoyed it. 

1) Apparently, this is the spot that came up with the Philly cheese-steak.  
2) I enjoyed the fact they are open 24/7. 
3) Parking is not difficult if you come early.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I only go here if I'm drunk and desperate. The food is average at best and the price is higher than most other places. Genos is just as bad, both (as Pats would say) a MISTEAK!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Came here with my girlfriend during quarantine and it was worth the ride 
Although the menu was limited, the philly was great and packed with flavor 
What a great trip up here !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Terribly disappointing. I already had tempered expectations for Pat's and knew there was going to be a big potential for letdown based on what I've heard from my foodie friends, but being in Philly for the first time, I had to try either Pat's or Geno's solely based on how long they've been around and how much I see them on food specials.

I came on a Friday around 2pm, and luckily street parking wasn't too hard to find within a block of Pat's. There was also no line, which took a lot of the pressure off from ordering. Being my first time here, I made it a point to read all the instructions BEFORE ordering. But even then, the guy at the counter was rushing me to get my order. First of all, I'm reading the directions as it says to do so I don't mess up. Secondly, and more importantly, THERE'S NOBODY BEHIND ME. Chill out. There's no need to be rude as I'm not holding up the line. I am the only person in line! Ended up ordering a mushroom cheesesteak with provolone (I'm not a fan of wiz) and a side of fries.

The fries were actually pretty good, but the cheesesteak was rather disappointing. I don't understand why it costs $10. The bun is soggy. The mushrooms were sliced canned mushrooms that were rubbery and flavorless. The steak wasn't generously portioned, and it was overcooked to the point where it was chewy and there wasn't much flavor.

Sometimes even when you feel like you're making a mistake, it's a mistake you have to make for yourself to learn. That was me before coming here. Don't let it be you! Just goes to show you that just because they've been around since 1930 and claim to be one of the first cheesesteaks doesn't mean they're the best. Pat's is nothing more than a foodie tourist trap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The eternal battle between who has the best Philly Cheesesteak rages on.  Pat's vs. Geno's.  The only 2 contenders.  The rest is just a fake copy.  I personally like Pat's better but like I said it's a personal opinion. Both places have a loyal following that would fight to the death to prove one is better than the other.  Just note, best fast in ordering, extensive lines in the summer and CASH ONLY.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The FIRST Philly thing we did:  Pat's vs Geno's

We tried both.
We both agreed on Pat's.
(Geno's ain't bad though)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Hubs wanted to introduce me to the Philly Cheesesteak sandwich so this was our first stop.  Pat's, as well as their across the street rival, have been showcased on the Food Network. On this late evening, there were plenty of patrons getting their cheesesteak fix.  With almost 4,000 reviews, much has been said!
Pat's sandwich has a gracious amount of chopped beef and drippy cheesey goodness, served on a fresh sub roll, served hot!  Delicious!  There piping hot fries are good, too!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Amazing as always. I have been in a quest fir YEARS outside of Philly. It was like Goldilocks...lots were ok, but not JUST RIGHT.  We shipped to Texas through Goodbelly and they were amazing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
They have steaks on grill all the time and they are tough chewy and so black from that heat n grease ........but i understnd why cause of huge lines like people stand in the streets omg.

Way better steaks in Campos 214 market Tone n lukes south philly  Oregon steaks 10th st orgegon ave open 24 hrs.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Great tasting Philly Cheesestake, however:
1- They are cash only 
2- We requested a knife to cut the sandwich in half but they told us "No use your hands" which was very messy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My first real Philly cheesesteak in Philly (the only one I've actually had in Philly was in an airport hotel so that didn't count). After researching several reviews and articles about where to get the best cheesesteak, I scoped this place out. Finding a place to park is a pain, but there's a reason for that. If you're going to cheat on your diet, this is the place to do it. I got a mushroom cheesesteak "wit", fries, and a Dr. Pepper.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So while we were in Philadelphia we had to do the cheesesteak challenge between Pats and Gino's next door so I looked up some things it's a cash only place I had to go to ATM and pay a fee and do all that I hope my bank reimbursement but we'll see what happens anyway with the Pats second with genos Forest genos I am not giving a three I'm gonna get packs of four because I like the taste of it a little better and the guy that waited on me with a little nicer than the other ones but that's OK you know just got it so hot summer day reset the shade wife and I both agree that we like Pats better than Gino's so both were good sandwiches but overall I'm gonna give it to Pat
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: 3 stars my ass. This place is great. Sunday morning breakfast no line and front parking.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ahh, Pat's King of Steaks--the originator and birthplace of the Philly cheesesteak. I actually kickstarted my Philly trip by stopping by Geno's first, but there was no way I was driving home without eating here. My review compares Pat's to Geno's, so read my review of the latter if you'd like a better idea.

LINE/ORDERING:
Pat's system is the same as Geno's (...or is Geno's the same as Pat's?)--line up at the first window to order your cheesesteak, then walk a few feet to your left for drinks and fries. Sandwiches fly out the window within seconds, so don't leave the line until you get your order.

The classic cheesesteak (Cheese Whiz and onions) is called a "Cheese Wit," which is what Tommy (the manager/cashier) relays to the staff. You could also say "Whiz Wit." 

FOOD:
x3 Cheese Wit/Whiz Wit ($10/ea): The sandwiches here are the same size and price, while the ratio of meat-cheese-onions is on point (and perhaps better than Geno's). The main differences, however, are as follows: The bread here is softer, the steak is chopped, you get more steak in your sandwich, the cheese whiz is (for some reason) not as salty, and the sandwich isn't greasy. Taste wise, both places are similar, but I taste more of the (unseasoned) rib-eye here.

We also ordered x2 drinks and an order of fries for $12. The fries here, compared to Geno's, are thicker, larger, and crispier. Good, but again, nothing special about them.

SERVICE: 
Tommy was the one who took my order. He's one of the famous faces at Pat's, and chances are you've seen him on Travel Channel or Food Network episodes featuring this place. He's a cool dude, but don't hold up the line. Learn how to order or at least know what you want by the time you get to the window.

THE BIG QUESTION:
Is Pat's truly the King of Steaks or did Geno's usurp the throne? As much as I'd like to say one is better than the other, I can't. Pat's is famous for many reasons, and Geno's is great in its own right and holds its weight. The sandwiches have their differences with one another, but both are good. All I can say is that the media has done an amazing job building up this fabled cheesesteak rivalry in South Philly. It's done wonders for both Pat's and Geno's and, most importantly, for the popularity of the cheesesteak itself.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: My family and I were staying in Philly and had heard about Pat's so wanted to try it.  One in our party was sick so we ordered through Uber Eats and our order came quick and was still hot.  I had the traditional "whiz with."  I had never tried a cheesesteak with cheese whiz before though have eaten lots of cheesesteaks.  The sandwich was large with lots of meat.  It's messy to eat so good idea to have a fork for what falls out.  I thought it was pretty good.  Wouldn't say it was really special but did enjoy it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have been here once and will never go back. Its just for the experience. There are better cheesesteaks other places. If you want a cheesesteak thats actually worth talking about go to Phil and Jims in Brookhaven. And this place is way overpriced.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
STEP UP YOUR GAME! 
I wish I would of known you dropped the ball prior to bringing my friends from out of state there!   Dry and bland.  I got x provolone this sandwich was not cheesy it was dry dry dry!!!!  I literally could of done better ordering from local pizza shop!   Your name keeps you busy so please standby your name!! Your feeding people visiting our city nasty cheese steaks your suppose to be famous for.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If it wasn't for the service, location or smell this would be 7 stars. The location makes it an experience in urban travel. And while we found parking, it is not conducive to a non resident visiting the location. The smell is not one would associate with a place of eating, however there were many people who did not seem to care.  Luckily other experienced patrons assisted with the ordering rules. Not cheap, but the sandwich was superb. This is an experience in Philadelphia dining that makes you appreciate the food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We purposely went to Philadelphia just to try Pat's King of Steaks and Geno's Steaks. Both are walking distance from each other. My SO and I bought Philly Cheesesteaks from both restaurant and split it up so we can try both.

Pat's is more lowkey and a little bit outdated compared to Geno's. They do not take credit cards so make sure you brought cash with you. Ordering food is easy. Just order your sub on one window then go to the other window for your sides and drinks.

The service was fast. They already prepped our sandwich within seconds after we ordered it (I'm not kidding). When it comes to presentation, you can tell that it was rushed because of the way they packed the sub. 

The cheez wiz makes Pat's more flavorful compared to Geno's. However I didn't get to taste the steak because the cheez wiz overpowers the subs. The sub was tasty and delicious, but I expected more flavor other than the cheez wiz. 

Overall, we enjoyed our meal. If you are a big fan of cheeze, Pat's will be the perfect fit for you. As for me, I think both are good cheese steaks and it depends on your preference in deciding which one is better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Loved the cheesesteak and the fries were delicious. I appreciated the fact that they took all necessary safety precautions. They even directed people off or away from the line if they didn't have on masks. Enjoyed the food and the quick service. Two thumbs up from me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I got into Philly and came straight here. After standing in line for 20 minutes, I ordered the sandwich and before I could finish, the guy slathered a layer of cheddar cheese sauce on there. I said but I wanted Provolone. The guy who puts the sandwich together says in a bored voice "it's already done" and the cashier just says it's too late. So I had to eat a Philly, not the way I wanted. But in the end the sandwich was just "meh"

Charlie's Steakery chain is even better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Sweet mother of pearl. My hunger has been solved. After leaving Geno's Steaks because they threw together the worlds worst cheesesteak. I needed redemption.  I tossed Geno's in the trash and marched over to Pats. By the Gods I was granted a fulfilling meat and cheese filed wonder wrapped in bread. Filing and satisfying.  Hakuna matata !!  Eat here. Not at Geno's where they look at you like a piece of meat.. a piece of meat just made of money for their terrible cheesesteak making pockets.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place sucks!! A genuine tourist trap. $11.00 for a cheesesteak that has barely any steak meat and another cheesesteak ordered with fried onions and American cheese. The onions were raw and the steak was so cold it didn't even melt the cheese. $4.00 for a regular size fountain soda. The area were you sit and eat is filthy and stinks like garbage. It's a tourist trap and they only accept cash...very interesting. Stay away from this place and you'll miss the extreme disappointment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the best place I have ever had a cheese steak in my life! I make the 30 minute drive down there about once a month, and everytime it is consistent and fantastic. It is a little on the pricy side, but at the same time it is worth every penny!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This experience was heartbreaking. I was anxious to try Pat's based on a referral from my Uber driver. The line moves very quickly because they don't really give you time to articulate your order lol however this can probably be pretty intimidating for out of towners. I was pretty disappointed in the cheesesteak to say the least. The meat was unseasoned and the sandwich was pretty bland. There is a self serve station near the register that you can fix your sandwich to your preference, but I actually bought a better cheesesteak at the Reading Market. Such a let down for a long anticipated visit.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not from Philly so of course you go to the most popular places you know and hear about. I don't know of any better places to go for a cheesesteak besides Pats and Genos so kiss my ass!

I thought it was a good cheesesteak. Onions with wiz. Bread was solid. Fries were good. Eagles suck.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you want a authentic philly cheese steak, stay away from this tourist trap. You will get a better sandwich at a mom and pop store, or any other place. Any Philadelphian will tell you to steer clear from this place for a decent cheese steak. Same goes for the place across the street from them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This is a Philadelphia classic and we go here almost every time that my family visits Philadelphia.

The cheesesteaks are great, my mother and I always get the cheesesteak with cheese wiz and onions.

The lines can get a bit long, but that is expected with a popular tourist destination. They do a good job at making the lines go quickly.

We will definitely be returning!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is one of those places that is so famous that it is hard for it to live up to people's expectations.  I'm not sure what most people are expecting, but it is chopped steak on bread with cheese wiz and onions, period.  It's greasy.  It' ain't gourmet or fine dining.  But it's not supposed to be.  For what it is, this is a great, iconic dining experience. I had a blast here.  The service was great, and when we went (around 9pm) it was pretty slow so we got to chat a little with the staff which was great.  I had a "wiz wit" and enjoyed every bite of it.  The meat is good tasting, but I added some hot peppers to it which I felt helped kick up the flavor a bit.  It's cash only and parking is terrible around there so keep both those things in mind.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We got this as our monthly item from Goldbelly and we were super happy with how tasty it was. The only catch is in the directions you have to put the whole thing in the oven except the meat doesn't get hit. For our second two weeks just baked the delicious bread and then cooked the meat with some water and oil and onions and peppers. The cheese whiz was kind of weird but we didn't get to pick the type of cheese. It was pretty tasty and we were happy to get some authentic Philly food here in Houston.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm a born and raised New Yorker, so I can't say I've trekked to all reaches of Philadelphia for a cheesesteak. But from the ones I've tried, Pat's is my favorite, hands down. It might be a little tourist-y to come down to Pat's, but if you've never been, it's worth a try (and in my opinion a re-visit whenever you're in Philadelphia). I was there in Philly yesterday, taking my girlfriend to a few important food spots and started here. An iconic location, at Pat's there's a sign exclaiming its part in the history of the city. Beyond that, walk up and order your cheesesteak, but do it the right way (follow the rules, even though you'll probably survive if you don't). I always get a cheesesteak wit whiz (which means with onions and cheese wiz). I found yesterday's meal just as good as it has been in the past if not better. The steak was tender, the bread soft, and the cheese and onions were hot and juicy creating an overall tasty experience. There are tons of cheesesteak choices in Philadelphia, but I advise you try Pat's at least once because you won't be disappointed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: given that there are a few other cheesesteaks in the area that are better, i can't rightly give this place anything more than 2 stars. there's nothing about pat's steaks that stand out to me. the meat, cheese, and bread were all subpar compared to their competitors. the only thing i like about this place is that they have the option of a mushroom cheesesteak. +1 for having a mushroom option, but -1 for not tasting better even with the shrooms.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Here's the thing, I have had better cheese steaks, I have had better fries, I have had better everything that Pat's offers on their menu, but the place has been there forever, it is said that they invented the steak sandwich--on a long roll with grilled steak inside. So go there and share a steak sandwich with a friend. Don't get stuffed there, there are so many better places for later.

Pat's is super cool looking, it is a place where you order outside, there is no inside seating. There is outside seating but not a lot, there is no bathroom and parking is a bear. But you can walk to Citizen's Bank Park for a baseball game from there if you want. The building is all silver metal, like a silver lined trailer, sort of. The menu is on the outside and they don't take credit cards so have cash ready. The service is very nice.

Some people order their steak with Cheese Wiz. Now, that is some junk that comes from a can and is put on your sandwich. If you have never had it, I would not even bother to try it. I find it just gross. I don't want cheese out of a spray can. I don't even know if it is real cheese. So, just don't. Yuk. Also, their American cheese is not great. Play it safe and get your steak with Provolone Cheese. That is real.

The meat is cooked well done, which I find boring and it is not great, but it is fine. So, I guess I just told you this place is not very good. It is fine. It is fun. For what it is, and for the adventure of it all, you should go there. It is good and you will be able to say been there done that, moving on. Have fun. It is a cool area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is pretty good.  There is no denying that.  You can be around for as long as they have been without being good.  Despite this, I don't think I will be back.

It is expensive.  For a sandwich, drink, and fries it cost me $18.50.  The sandwich was good but nothing special.  The fries were terrible and the drink was just a fountain drink.  Not a value play here at all.

Also, make sure you know your order.  They move very quickly and if your order is not ready they will send you to the back of the line.  

Overall, go once for the experience.  It is something you can you did.  There is no reason to go again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When in Philadelphia...getting a cheesesteak is a MUST!  But then its the all-time debate of who has the best cheesesteaks...and my pick is always Pat's!  

Upon arrival, there was one barely a line which was great!  There are 2 windows to order from.  One window is to order the cheesesteaks and then the other window to order fries and drinks.  I've been here many times before and already knew my order--whiz wit!  My usual is cheez whiz with grilled onions.  Btw it is cash only so have cash on hand if you plan on grabbing a cheesesteak here.  My cheesesteaks were made in minutes and then moved to the next line to order drinks and cheese fries.  

The cheesesteak tasted great.  The meat was cooked perfectly and was very juicy and that cheez whiz was covered throughout the entire sandwich.  With each bite you can taste the meat, cheese, and grilled onions.  Delicious!  And the cheese fries were covered in cheese....yassss! It was not just a few fries covered in cheese but all of them has cheese!  And you know that never happens at any other restaurant.  

They do have some outdoor seating so you can enjoy eating outdoors.  There is only street parking so just be on the lookout for parking as you approach Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I loved the steaks from Pats! I am usually a stickler for tradition but the pizza steaks were amazing! They only take cash, so beware when you go - but if you don't have cash on you there is an atm nearby.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This was probably the most disappointing food I have ever eaten.  Pats came highly recommended as the place with the best cheesesteaks.  I got there and was so excited to taste them and I felt so let down.  The meat tasted like it was boiled in water without adding any spices or seasoning.  What a waste of time and money.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Popped in here for the first time in my life after a night of drinking to see what the craze was about and I left neither satisfied or unsatisfied. This is truly the definition of a tourist spot known for its cULtuRE and quite frankly, it's not a fun one. It is Philly, after all.

Onto the food itself, the cheesesteak is a soggy, messy bundle of fatty, steak-filled (but not exactly steak-flavored) goodness that'll hit you the right way after a solid night out. Looking back and reflecting on that memory made me realize there is really nothing special about this place's cheesesteaks, and as I venture across Philly in search of the perfect one, I'll add it to the bottom echelon of my list.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: CASH ONLY!! Average cheesesteak- kind of dry and the bun is tough. Nice that it's 24/7 though.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came to Philly doe the day and couldn't leave without seeking this place out.  It's located in a neighborhood.  Parking is a bit difficult but so long as you don't show up at exactly 12 noon, you'll be fine.  Large red metal pick mic tables outside. You order your sub at one window and the rest of tour items at another. Pay them separately.  Cash only.  There is an ATM on the premises. We got a standard steak sub with provolone and onions.  The bun was the best part.  The sub was delicious.  French fries and soda were ordered as well.  There are lots of places in town but we hit this one because it's iconic and oh so good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We were in Philly for the weekend.  Stopped by Pats for a Cheesesteak.  Believe me when I tell you, "Any New Jersey diner can make a better Cheesesteak Sandwich than Pats".  Nothing to write home about.  Cheese Wiz, what the hell are they thinking ?????
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love these guys for everything, almost fast on time and amazing folks. Especially Jon the man! He always take care of the kids when I'm in town
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's sells a good steak. Went down for the first time in two years w my aunt to do a little comparison between the two staple cheesesteak spots. I think that's probably the best way to enjoy coming down to Pat's and Geno's.

Pat's is by no means the best steak in Philly, but it slides into my top 10 for now. The roll was excellent and the seasoning of the chopped ribeye enhanced the flavors nicely.

A knock against the steak that I would say is that is got colder more quickly than Geno's. I like when a steak stays thoroughly warm, and the sandwiches heat only lasted so long.

For all the hate both of these spots get, neither are as bad as you hear. Pats reminds me of a how a good Philly cheesesteak should taste: lots of meat, good presentation, strong flavors. For future reference, I'd recommend Pat's over Geno's, but it's really closer than I thought.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good late night grinds after dranks. Know what you want before you order. Good with provolone or cheese wiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered the cheese steak & fries via Uber Eats. The order was fast being prepared and leaving the store. However, my order was not correct. They left off the mushrooms. This may not seem like a big deal. But, they cost extra.  The sandwich wasn't bad, but  unremarkable. Kind of dry. There was evidence of cheese on part of the sandwich, but a lot of it had no cheese. The bread was very good!  Fries were cold. BUT I expected this due to it being delivery. Not everything can be helped and I honestly got what I expected with the fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A recent trip to Pat's has reinforced my long time impression of the place as a tourist trap.  Growing up in Philly, we usually avoided Pat's but was in town recently on a trip with friends and they had never been to this establishment. Unfortunately, while eating (with children) we encountered a drunk man selling chocolates and harassing the patrons.  After spending $20 for a cheesesteak and a drink, you should be able to sit down and enjoy it without being berated.  If Pat's doesn't care about the safety of its patron's then they don't serve your money.  Hit up Jim's, Tony Luke's or another establishment.  The food is better, less expensive and much safer environment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The classic cheesesteak with onions, hot peppers, and wiz cheese was delicious, and I highly recommend it. The line flies and there's plenty of outdoor seating as well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came here to pick up a cheese steak sandwich before I had to trek back NYC. So I got one with cheese whiz and onions. It was good but with the cheese whiz it is way better. The bread is super fresh and soft. The prices were reasonable about $9.50 for my sandwich. They take cash only. The service is fast. I was lucky I caught at a time there was no line. I definitely want try other cheese steak spots on my next visit to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats was my favorite sandwich this trip. I had Jimmy's and Genos. Genos was actually the worst of them all I definitely won't be back. Pats had a lot of wiz and put it on top rather than inside which I apparently prefer. The staff is also nicer as well and the fastest by far. I am definitely coming here next time. Pats is my place!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is probably the cheesiest, juiciest, delicious cheesesteak I've ever had. I ordered the cheesesteak wiz wit and boy was it delicious. The beef was so tender it reminded me of an Italian beef sandwich. The cheese was ooey, gooey, messy, and tasty. The bread was soft and had the right amount of chew. I have no complaints, my sandwich was cooked to perfection. Do keep in mind Pats is cash only. Furthermore, you order your cheesesteaks from one window and any drinks and fries from the other window. I highly recommend this place if in the South Philly area. My vote goes to Pats in the war of Pat's vs Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Lived right outside of Philly my whole life but just had my first cheesesteak EVER and it did not disappoint!!! I was super intimidated going up to order but luckily I had someone to tell me the "proper way" to order. It was definitely a major tourist trap and I'm not sure how long I'd be willing to wait for it when I'm sure there's better spots in the city, but it was still delicious!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Alright, alright. I finally had a famous Philly Cheesesteak, much to my resistance. Apparently this place was on some Food Network show and is famous? Not why I came - came because this is my boyfriend's favorite cheesesteak place. There's another place across the street that looks more lively, Geno's, but I was told this one is better. I was going to give this a 2 star, but I'll be nice and give it a 3.

It's a 'Dick's Drive-In' kind of vibe (for those familiar with that Seattle staple). 

Basically, you walk up to the window stand, order your cheesesteak ('wit' or 'witout' meaning with or without onions), grab and pay, then you go to the second window if you want to order fries (again, 'wit wiz'... this cheese wiz stuff everyone's obsessed with out here). There's a place to grab condiments, napkins and straws behind, and there's tons of outdoor seating.

CON: if you come here late at night, during winter, like I did, be prepared to freeze and eat fast!!!! 

I'll say this. I'm not a huge cheesesteak person in general. They're good, but I never really crave them. I ate them a lot in high school when my boyfriend at the time worked at a East Coast Sub place. I was persecuted at the window (not by the people who work there) when I 'horrifically' ordered the cheesesteak with peppers, mushrooms and onions and 'WITOUT' the cheese wiz. MISTAKE. As much as I'm not a fan of this cheese wiz stuff, I get why people order it. The meat is SO damn dry you NEED the cheese wiz to moisten it up a bit!

I also (eating with people from Philly) was persecuted for wanting to put ketchup on my cheesesteak, again, because it was so dry! I guess there's a right way to eat them and I wasn't playing into it. The fries were good. Nothing special.

Philly people, don't kill me. I'm sure there are plenty of other phenomenal cheesesteak places in this town. But this one isn't one of them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have a sister who attends a boarding school in Philadelphia suburbs, so I visit her occasionally. However, I never ate at Pat's or Geno's. So over the summer, my boyfriend, my sister, and I decided to do "The Ultimate Philly Cheese steak Challenge."

At the time we went, there were a lot more people, waiting in line to get their cheese steak at Pat's, which gave me the notion that people might like Pat's a little, tiny bit more. Also, the place looked a little bit more.. antique, or simply older than Geno's. So I thought, 'Hm, this place might be the original Philly cheese steak place!'

After waiting in the line for 5 minutes or so (Yes, it was a very looong line), we got our cheese steak - with Whiz and onions - and fries.  I must say, I didn't like Pat's cheese steak too much.  Personally, I thought the steak was a bit dry. I enjoy onion in my sandwiches, but I could hardly taste the onion. And I absolutely hate the ordering system there! Granted, it's quite hilarious, but totally unnecessary. (Talk about waiting in line for 5 more minutes when I'm starving!) I actually got so freaked out, that I begged my sister to order for me.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is the famous cheesesteak place in Philly, across the street from Geno's. I usually grab one from each place then share with a friend. One has better meat, one has better cheese. I always forgot which! However, it's not about the cheese, it's the experience. The service is awesome & like one of those old TV shows where the whole gang gets in on the act. Love the old photos & memorabilia lining the storefront!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Naturally, I went to Philly and had to check out the OG Philly cheesesteak join and I was not disappointed! They made the cheesesteak crazy quick. I got a mushroom wit and it was amazinggggg. I would come back 100 times. Next time I would also like to try the cheese fries! I like the original feel to his place. Nothing crazy and high tech. Really good vibe.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm sure everyone has their opinion on which Cheese steak they prefer the best in Philadelphia. Mine happens to be Pats. 

I would say their meat is better than everyone else's. Their onions and bread are decent, but I'm here for the meat which is what matters. I would say Genos has the best onions and Tony Luke's has the best bread.

I've been coming here for the last 4 years and it's great that it's 24 hours. As a result, I've been able to make a trip here at all times of the day. Service has always been quick and good to me. There one window to order your steak and another to order frieds and drink. Also keep in mind that this place is Cash Only. 

Come here to get a true Philadelphia staple: The Cheese steak
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: What a sad experience this was... the only reason I'm even giving it 2 stars is because all I had is the french fries and a bottle of water, so I can't comment on their cheese steak. The fries were not fresh and they came a tiny cup... but somehow they had the nerve to charge me $7.50 for those two things. I'm sorry, but that is beyond expensive. Not worth the money.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Another well marketed restaurant. Worth going to like a tourist attraction. The bread was a little tough. It was soft, but just hard to rip off. The meat here is better than Geno's across the street. We just got it to go so I can't comment on the atmosphere. But people sit outside. 

Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm not sure how much I would love this place if I ate there when I was sober (I'd probably love it even more than I do now), but I stumbled over to this place after seeing my friend in a play, then getting some drinks together. I got a "wiz wit" and it was simply phenomenal. He got the pizza fries which were flavorful as well. Pats is a great place, the service may poke fun at you in the wee hours of the morning, don't take it personally. If you play along with them and laugh with them, they will love you forever. And isn't that classic Philadelphian? No culture lost here, and thank God. Prices were a bit high ($8.15 for a half wiz wit) but altogether worth every penny.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had Pat's like a decade later! Was in town and felt like having that authentic cheesesteak of Philly. They are pretty good sized, but still a bit pricey. I ordered two cheesesteaks and a mushroom cheesesteak and it was $34. I love the way they make the beef and love how melted the cheese is. Overall, a tasty cheesesteak. Things to keep in mind: the restaurant is located in the heart of downtown Philly, so parking is difficult, and the only seating is outdoor seating on bench tables. Be sure to also take cash with you as they do not accept other forms of payment.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Over rated.  Traveled to Philly to get this sandwich that is in a lot of movies and everyone says you need to get when in Philly. The meat has no flavor,  the cheese tastes watered-down. I guess I went for the experience, but I wouldn't do it again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
During our visit to Philly was decided to do our own Cheesesteak taste test with the 2 best in town.

We went to the place across the street first, and then came over to Pats to try the other. 

Sandwich was very tasty! Every bite was amazing.

There is no question why these 2 places are historic!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Historic spot, came here when I was visiting my buddy at Temple. Food was great and a fun atmosphere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Had to try the classic! There was no wait. I ordered through grub hub but it said there was a 30 min wait. I went up to Pat's and they made my sandwich right there so no need to wait. 

PROS: 
- good amount of meat 
- flavorful 

CON:
- very messy

If I had to choose between Pat's and Geno.. I'd have to go with Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came for the history but quite disappointed with how incohesive this sandwich was: unmelted cheese and large pieces of onion. At least you can watch the basketball games at the park while eating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is worst than Geno's. Again they give you a sliver of meat all minced up and the cost is ridiculous. Do not believe the hype that this place and Geno's has the best cheesesteaks. It is false... Better off going to the local deli.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Okay, I'm guilty. I did it. I paid the insane prices for absolutely abominable food. I'm part of the problem. Don't make the same mistake. Don't give in to the propaganda.

I've been to Philly several times and have yet to find a cheesesteak that's better than I have had at my local Jersey Mike's. After finally succumbing to the hype, I finally broke down and tried Pat's. Needless to say, my one-star rating means I'm still searching.

As with all of the other places I've tried in Philly, there must be some appeal to slapping a flavorless hunk of shaved meat and onions on a dry roll. Not even Cheez Whiz could help this 8" long piece of the Sahara Desert. I mean seriously, a little salt and pepper would help immensely because it's a sad commentary when the fries and Coke are what make the meal palatable, not the signature item on the menu.

I think what irks me the most is the glaringly obvious, complete and total lack of care that goes into the food. For $70 to get 4 cheesesteaks, 3 fries, and 4 drinks, at least put SOME effort into it.

I won't try Geno's across the street because it's more of the same hype that keeps it and Pat's in business. Avoid Pat's and let's put an end the scourge of this overhyped monstrosity.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When you invent an absolute legendary food item, something known the world over and copied by many but never duplicated, you are Pat's King of Steaks.  As far as the steak, no one beats Pat's.  The bread is good, but it does have a tendency to fall apart.  The sandwich itself isn't as salty as most other places which allows the flavors to blend and dance in your mouth.  The steak has some bite to it and a great rich flavor.  I ordered the mushroom pizza cheesesteak wit onion and cheese wiz.  The flavor is subtle but wonderful.  Hot, juicy and wonderful.  It goes down so quickly I was actually was more hungry after I ate then when I started.  One of the draw backs is they only take cash.  But, just like many other places they have one window for sandwiches and another for fries and drinks.  This helps things move along quickly, but, follow the rules.  Pat's doesn't have time for people to think about their order.  Know what you want before you get to the window.  It doesn't matter, everything is awesome!

Since this is a historical landmark, it is covered with pictures and memorabilia.  It's worth the trip to just see it, but, if you don't get a Pat's cheesesteak, it would be like going to the Caribbean and not scuba dive.  It a MUST eat place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat' or Geno's? How ' bout NEITHER! Both suck. If you want a real cheesesteak, try Barry's or Chubby's in Roxborough. Don't waste your time in line at Delassndros.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Now this is PHILLY CHEESESTEAK!  Delicious!  Get it with Wiz!  Yummmmmmy!  It's messy, so grab some napkins!  Fries are delicious too!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I ordered a mushroom pepper steak with american cheese. I have one word.. DISGUSTING! The meat was dry without and seasoning or flavor. My cousin's and I drove two hours from NYC. Two of my cousins have visited Pat's multiple times. This was my first time but my cousin said she surprised.  She didn't like her cheese steak either. I won't be back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Of all the Philly cheesesteaks, I think Pat's wins as the classic and most ideal philly cheesesteaks yet. The prevalence of oil in every bite was not an issue in Pat's meal as it was in other cheesesteaks. And their cheese wiz was better than most simply cause it was warm and seemed most fresh. The bread was soft and absorbed all flavors. But the beef was outstanding and outdid everything! Each mouthful was delectable and, seemingly, levels better than the beef in other philly cheesesteaks. Really well done!! Even though the spot is thoroughly advertised, I thought the cheesesteak completely lived up to the hype. So while you mull on the elusive "Is a cheesesteak a sandwich?" question, stop by Pat's and pick up a hearty meal. 4.5 out of 5 stars. KC approved
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Overrated tourist trap. Go there as a check the box exercise only. Better cheesesteaks found at your corner pizza place....& yes, same with Gino's across the street. (Pat's is marginally better)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: High prices, crowded corner, nothing special. The rivalry keeps people coming, but I wouldn't say the best cheesesteak in the city is on that corner. A little greasy and not my favorite texture meat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is the TRUE King of Steaks in Philly.  BAR NONE.

The taste of a Pat's Steak is everything you want in a South Philly cheesesteak.  Quality products from bread to meat to cheese... Pat's delivers.   Also, if you're a fan of peppers... or want to try to go out on the edge once or twice... try their cherry peppers on your steak sandwich.  You can have as many or as little as you want and you will NOT be disappointed!

Let's face it, though.  Lots of folks complain about the price.  I just tell those complainers, "You get what you pay for."  While a Pat's sandwich may be just a little more than the other guys... they deliver in quality.  Why settle for less if you're going to treat yourself to a cheesesteak?

And those guys across the street with their flashy signs, their bright colors, and their PacMan video games (well.... i don't think they have pac man...) THEY DON'T COME CLOSE.  

I haven't lived in Philadelphia since I was a kid.  Yet I will literally go back over the bridge JUST to have a Pat's steak.  If the line wraps around the building, FEAR NOT!  The service is quick and the wait is well worth it!

Going to Pat's reminds me of my grandfather.  He used to take me there all the time when I was a wee cheesesteak lover.  Make visiting Pat's a tradition in your family and your kin will NOT be disappointed!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If i could give them a 0 for customer service i would. I went to buy cheesesteaks with my uncle and my smaller cousins , and I asked the guy at the front if it was possible to cut it into 6 pieces. But the guy cutting the cheesesteak answered me with a big attitude, saying:" ARE YOU KIDDING ME!? HOW AM I CUT IT INTO 6 PIECES!? AM GONNA CUT MY FINGER!". So yeah instead of a yes or no answer, if you ask them something expect them to answer you back with a tone and attitude, so rude . Not worth the experience. Just got 1 cheesesteak from them and then went to GENO's to buy the rest.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overrated, but had to try it as a bucketlist item! I remember eating a Philly Cheesesteak in the 5th grade and it still remains a fond memory... for my tastebuds. Pat's was not good as I had remembered a "philly cheesesteak in my memory", but it was still worth the visit.

Recommend the Wiz Whit. Cash only. No bathrooms around.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Still the BEST Philly cheese steak anywhere. I'm from California and we have nothing like it
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This Philly and everything about they're food was top notch . Everything was quick, fresh and way better than across the street . I was in town for 3 days and went here twice . The ingredients were fresh and they load u up . Go here now
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yeah, it's touristy. And apparently it's cool to hate on it. But after staying in Philly for seven days and trying four different cheesesteaks, including some lesser known "better" places, Pat's was my favorite. 

Soft roll, real steak, and plenty of whiz. Best of all, it's served piping hot, so the whole thing turns into that melty, gooey mess that you look for in a good cheeseteak. Worth the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The meat seemed tougher as opposed to the last time I had a cheesesteak from here. I always make sure to stop by if it's been a while. Whiz with only. Craving satisfied
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
