Come here for the Cheesesteak not the customer service!  These are not only the best Cheesesteaks in Philly, but the home of the original. This is where this sandwich was invented in 1930 and continues service to this day. However, i imagine Back in the day they had better customer service, now they almost rudely yell at you for coming there to eat! Ha 

No smiles, no small talk, just pay and 30 seconds later have a delicious cheesesteak slapped in your hands. 

Then go to a separate window for cheese drenched French fries. 

However, at the end of the day you don't come to this location for small talk, you come for AWESOME CHEESESTEAK... and it delivers. Time and time again. Also, i recommend the cheese wiz, that makes all the difference in the world!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Rude service with mediocre cheesesteaks. The cheesesteaks were somewhat dry with little cheese. Plenty of other places to try.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Extra Cheesesteak Wit Whiz

Tips for Ordering at Pat's

The line at Pat's King of Steaks moves quickly, so it's best to be prepared -- know what you want, and how to order it by the time you get to the front of the line!

Step 1
Specify if you want your steak with (wit) or without (wit-out) onions

Step 2
Specify Plain, Cheez Whiz, Provolone, American or Pizza Steak

Step 3
Have your money ready. We are cash only.

Step 4
Order just your steak at the first window. The second window is for fries and drinks.

Step 5
Eat up while it's hot! Honestly, when it comes to Pat's, I figured it would be best to "borrow" their Tips for Ordering (pasted above). That's really all you need to know.... Whether you want a Steak, a Hot Dog, a Pork or a Fish Cake, the most important aspect of Pat's is knowing how to order. The food? Well, it's in the title..."King of Steaks" No, seriously, every bite is complete Cheesesteak Bliss and you SHOULD believe the hype!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am tourist from Florida. I admit this outright. 

I did the challenge on Monday July 7th at 3:00pm. I headed to Geno's and Boyfriend grabbed Pat's. He had only ever had pat's and I said this was unacceptable. He also didn't want to get whiz and I said we had to get whiz at both to have a comparison. He reluctantly agreed. Because of this, I have to idea what the process was like at Pat's all I know is the their birch beer fountain soda was 50 cents more than Geno's. 

We got one wit whiz. It was not what I was expecting. The chopped meat had a meaty flavor but more like standard pot roast tasting beef. The onions were great all carmelized and buttery. Their bread was weirdly soft and bland. From the looks of it I expected more in both taste and texture. It is a good sponge but I think we got a slightly dry steak than usual. I looked at yelp pictures of soaking buns and juicy meat and ours didn't seem that way. There wasn't as much whiz as I would like. I didn't think their whiz tasted as good as Geno's. In Short, Geno's won in the whiz category.

Now, because the boyfriend always got a provolone steak at Pat's he was craving his favorite. We skipped french fries and ordered another steak from pats, this time one wit provolone. Wow, what a difference the cheese made. I think our meat was a fresher batch that was juicier as well. The onions were once again great. The chopped meat flavor was complemented by the generous provolone serving. This was what you think of when you think "cheese steak". 

So Geno's for Whiz and Pat's for Provolone. That is my contribution to the challenge.

I will add that if pat's used the bread at geno's that they may have won both categories but unless they are serving up super juicy meat and not being stingy with the whiz there is no way that bread makes sense. It is merely a vehicle and in such a simple sandwich is really should be more than that.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Best cheesesteak I've ever had, I've lived in Philadelphia my entire left. The original!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak was great and this was my first time ordering as I live out of state. I felt it was worth the money, and worth the drive into the old neighborhood to eat there. My hangups were that they don't accept cards and that ordering is intense. Its like if you don't know exactly how they expect you to order expect to get the looks and attitude of, 'learn to order, and hurry it up'. It was my first time there keep in mind. The food was great enough to likely come back if I'm in Philly but the customer service and restaurant atmosphere was too intense and I could see it keeping people away. There bread is from Jersey btw. It tasted good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Classic Philly cheesesteak.  Meet is well seasoned, bread is crunchy on the outside and soft inside, must get with wiz.  Onions added a beautiful touch to complete the whole meal.  Add some cheese fries if you're still hungry.  Cash only and can be really hard to find parking.  Must try as it's one of Philly's food landmarks.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We did the Pat's and Geno's comparison. Pat's had a harder roll, more cheese wiz, softer onions and drier meat. Geno's had a softer roll, less cheese, crispier onions and meat juice that dripped out. So, I'd say that in my opinion, Geno's wins, but we still think Jim's on South Street is the best. Also -- and it's really important -- our server did not wear his mask properly; it did not cover his nose and we saw his upper lip. Not good! In addition, the outdoor seating is very crowded and not COVID-friendly -- the back of one person in my group was touching the back of the person at the adjoining table.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Very disappointed in the cheesesteak, it was dry and the cheesesteak was not seasoned AT ALL. The sandwich was made in 5 seconds and it was tasteless, very disappointed, this is a tourist trap along with the place directly across the street! Thumbs down!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Used to be great. Now, not so much. Had about 4 tablespoons of grease, meat not seasoned with any salt or pepper. Onions cooked separately and thrown in at end. Less than mediocre.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Trying several while in town, and I have come to the conclusion it may not be taste as a preference, but rather if you like your meat chopped or more in strands. Flavor comes from the cheese/ toppings added, meat in general is not flavored as it relies on the whiz or provolone. 
I prefer the longer strands vs chopped. Also whiz def makes the entire experience on the saltier/ flavorful side. Cheese fries at the bottom were def saltier than expected. 
Pay in one window, pick up in other, def good ordering system. Has bench seating, first come first serve, but did not have any issues getting a seat
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Long lines but it moves quick so don't be discouraged.   I got the provolone which was a little dry, I think Wiz is the way to go.   There are 2 separate windows, one for cheesesteaks and one for everything else which was confusing but it helps the line move.  The fries were great.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I have not been back to Pat's in over seven years. There was a short line but they move quick. Much quicker than Geno's across the street. The cashier has no patience with you asking questions and looking at the menu. They want to take your order and move on.


I ordered the cheese steak with whiz cheese. I tried Jim's steak and Geno's before this. This was by far the worst of the 3. The cheese steak had very little onions and cheese. It felt like I was just eating a plain steak sandwich. I was disappointed yet again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I'm a tourist in Philly. It's only natural (and obligatory for that matter) that I try THE PHILLY CHEESESTEAK. 
Now, I love a good drama so learning about the battle of bests between Pat's & Geno's made it even more exciting to try this local staple. 
Pat's King of Steaks® was founded by Pat Olivieri in 1930. Pat had a modest hot-dog stand at the base of the famous Italian Market in South Philadelphia. While it seems Pat's was the original, I think there needs to be some updating. The place itself seems very old. You better know what you want and have your money ready when you get to the window. There is a zero tolerance here which made me so anxious. There is also a way to order. Wit (with) or wit out (without) cheese. Specify Plain, Cheez Whiz, Provolone, American or Pizza Steak. Cash only & have it ready! Window #1 is just for the steak with window #2 being for fries and drinks. 
Again, everyone raves about the whiz. But when I saw it on someone else's sandwich it seems really runny. I decided to be adventurous and get the cheese steak with provolone instead. It was a mistake. The cheese was not melted and the texture hindered me from enjoying the steak. Once I took off the cheese it was a much better experience. The steak was a little greasier than the competition but it was still good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just ordered a cheesesteak with fried onions and just got this super small steak hoagie with barely any meat in it. Check out the photos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The cheese steak was sooo delicious. Especially after I ate Genos. 
I went to Genos first because it was closer than Pats. When I saw the cheese steak at Genos I was pretty disappointed and then I took my first bite, and I was sooooo disappointed to the point that I didn't want to waste my money on another cheese steak. Luckily, last minute I decided that I should at least give pats a try since I probably would never have an opportunity like that again and I was so glad I did. 
The meat was good and had a slight sweetness that tasted perfect with the salty cheese. They also had these delicious pickled peppers that made the cheese steak even better. 
It was a good experience and when I go back to Philly, I know where I will get my cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Can't decide between Pat's and Geno's? Neither could I until I actually showed up to the famed intersection.

Geno's is really in your face about everything. It has loud billboard signs, brightly lit interiors, and even a gift shop next door. Nearby, workers hype up the rivalry between Pat's and Geno's with a Godzilla vs. King Kong photo opp. 

On the contrary, Pat's is really low-key. It doesn't have brightly lit signs, the workers appear to be more laid back, and the menu isn't electronic. I elected to go to Pat's over Geno's because it felt less like a tourist trap than Geno's. 

Pat's is cash only, so make sure to bring cash! If you forget, there is also a brand new Chase ATM right next to the store.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My family and I drove all the way from the Bronx here because we heard that Pat's King Steaks was the best place to get a Philly cheese steak sandwich.  Unfortunately we were disappointed,  the meat was bland and the bread soggy.  I've had better "Philly cheese steaks" in New York.

Maybe next time I'm in Philly I'll try Geno's...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Yes, it's a touristy spot.

I still wanted to try Pat's out. We've been to Geno's before but finally got a chance to try out Pat's, which is right across the street. Stood in the long line. There is a sign before you get to the ordering counter guiding you in how you should order. It's helpful because this allows the line to move quickly. The cashier was super quick and direct. I'd say in under a minute, he took our cash and handed us our sandwiches. 

There is some outdoor seating available, but it does get packed here. Condiments, peppers, napkins are within reach. We really enjoyed our cheesesteak sandwiches. They were packed with juicy meat, gooey cheese, and diced sautéed onions. The bread was fresh and held the sandwich together well. 

So glad we finally got a chance to try Pat's. We definitely enjoyed Pat's more than Geno's. However, Geno's will always have a special place in my heart because it was the first cheesesteak I ever tried in Philly. Both are worth trying at least once. 

Cash Only! There is an ATM nearby if you forget.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Every now and then I have to try the tourist traps just to see how they're doing. 

I don't come here often anymore. Pat's was the first cheesesteak place I ever came to as a kid. It was a mainstay for me into my 20s. Then I learned that the city actually has other cheesesteaks. 

I've had a lot of those other cheesesteaks. My tastebuds have reset. How would those tastebuds react to the Pat's of today. 

They're ok. 

They're just ok now. 

It's still a good amount of juicy meat. It's still a half decent roll. 

But it's no longer special to me. 

Now it's just an overpriced sandwich that I can get better at 13 different places in the city now.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steaks reminds of the fable, The Emperor's New Clothes. 
After picking up my California friend at 30th Street Station, we wove our way down to  South 9th Street for a taste of Philadelphia - the renowned, Pat's.  My 12 year old son came along when he heard we would go for cheesesteaks.  

The environment around Pat's is terrific.  People all over the place.  The queue to order.  The Rules for Ordering.  The smack in the puss aroma of burning grease and onions.  The whole migila.  I felt my own excitement rise the closer I came to the ordering window.  I felt the vicarious thrill as my son ordered his first Cheesesteak Witout and Provolone, and a Birch Beer.  Truly, a right of passage. 

Yet, when we sat down at a red metal grate table and began to devour our sandwiches, I noted my son's displeasure with the amount of fat and gristle he had to  spit out.  I, too, was surprised to find red meat in my tumultuous pile of steak, onions, mushrooms and cheese.  Uncooked.  It felt careless. I did not mind that each time I picked up the load to have a bite, and equal amount fell out the back end of the 'wich. That was to be expected from an unfortunate roll incapable of holding its load.  Still, I did not feel like picking up the canned shrooms  and steak pieces to eat them.  

5 Stars for the institution and historic icon that is Pat's King of Steaks. 
2 Stars for the actual product generated from this amazing operation.  

3 Stars for the King who needs to look in the mirror and realize he may be wearing only his reputation.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Mehh. This was my first time getting a Philly cheesesteak in Philly and it was okay. My boyfriend and I were on our way to New York from Virginia and decided to do a pitstop along the way so it was like an early grub for us at like maybe 7:30AM. 

I do like how the location looked with the lights and everything but the food itself wasn't anything spectacular. We ordered the Philly with steak, onions and cheese wiz. I don't know if it's because the bread was just cold and I'm sure that's the way to eat a cheesesteak but I wasn't into that. 

Maybe I need to try another one next time I'm there or at another location.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Thought it'd be cool to have a "battle of the cheesesteaks," as Geno's Steaks and Pat's King of Steaks is directly across from each other. 

We ordered a cheesesteak with provolone and onions. I preferred the cheesesteak from Pat's over Geno's, but still disappointed. The cheesesteak wasn't as dry, but still not flavorful (maybe it was fat juices). The bread got soggy as well. 

This place is cash only. Prices are listed to the nearest dollar with tax already included (no need for coin change). 

Not sure why Pat's neon signs weren't on at night on the day that I went.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Surprisingly, there were only 6 people in front of us when we came here!! My cousin parked his car illegally, we hopped out, got in line, ordered, got our food all in 7 minutes!!! 

You pick what kind of cheesesteak you want-- cheese, onions, order... pay. Ca$h only.
The condiments station is right behind you from where you placed your order. You have to get into a different line if you want french fries, which we didn't try.

Outdoor seating. Very vintage haha. Geno's is literally right across the street. Talk about competition. They are very generous with the amount of meat they put into your sandwich. It gets pretty greasy so load up on napkins. The bottom part of the bread gets soggy too, so it'll just make you want to inhale the sandwich before it gets too soggy.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Ordered 4 "steaks wit" delivered from Goldbelly and could not have been more disappointed.   Arrived frozen as expected.  Packaging was good but product quality was awful.  Bread was tasty but that's about all that can be said.   Meat was very dry and of limited portion.   It was difficult to find the "wit".   Maybe one thin slice of provolone cheese and a few onion bits.   Bad experience for a premium price.   Tanks for nuttin Pat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Was nice. Much better than their competitors across the street! Excellent amount of cheese wiz along with good steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was truly impressed, we ordered the original Phily cheese steak and it was so good! The bread was fresh, the steak flavorful and the "cheese whiz"(I was VERY hesitant about) was delicious!

I have to thank our Uber driver, we where headed to the airport when he asked if we had tried the Phily cheesesteak, we hadn't. He drove us over to pats and even offered to buy us a cheesesteak! So sweet, we bought him one and got one for us. Great experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: "Pat's King of Steaks" was good. The building has no inside dining, so dress warm in the winter. The building is older and The you line up on the side and the have two windows. One for the famous cheese steaks and the other for fries and drinks. After heading to both windows you find seating located around the restaurant. They don't take credit so remember cash. It was time to find out if they were king. They give you a ton of cheese and onions on the hero. The steaks are chopped up small. It does have a lot of flavor and the bread was soft. I was disappointed in the fries. They were thick and delicious, but they don't give you a lot. I would say I liked Pat's, but king is a lofty expectations. I would go back, but  I definitely wouldn't recommend it as a goto.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Greasy cheesesteak. Smelled like white castles. A tad dry. Needed salt. But despite that it was GOOD and TASTY!! the bread was perfect and so soft. The French fries stole the show honestly. They were really good!!! Idk what kind of fruit punch they serve, nothing like back home in Indiana, but it was yummy. Workers were polite! Didn't get to compare to geno's tho we just had pats! Bf says the hot dog was really good!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know how this place doesn't have more stars, I loved it! It's tempting to go to Geno's with all the flashing lights and decor but Pat's has the best cheesesteak, between the two and debatably, the best in town! I've had the cheesesteak with whiz cheese and onions (side note - just say "with" and that means with onions!) and the cheesesteak with american cheese "with." Both were great! Good bread, good meat, good cheese, can't complain! Only negatives - the fries weren't my favorite and it gets crowded on the weekends so it's hard to get seating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
CHEESESTEAK WAR - Geno's vs Pat's 

We took a long road trip from Atlanta to Maine, making stops all along the way at places I've been wanting to try for years. Everything from authentic NY pizza and pastrami to authentic Maine lobster rolls were preset into my GPS navigation.  Well, I don't know how I could call myself a food lover and not have an authentic Philadelphia cheesesteak from the two originals, so on this trip I rectified that!

I've never been to any of the states north of the Carolina's on the East coast and decided last year we are going to curtail our preferred mode of vacationing (cruises), to spend more time touring all the great places we've been missing around our own country. After all, our boys are getting older and there is only so much time we have left before they might not think it's cool to hang out with us... LOL

~~~~~~~~~~

THE EXPERIENCE
I was a total tourist during my visit to Pat's. Taking pictures, laughing with locals and hamming it up with the kitchen staff. It may just be my personality, but we don't generally have problems with people. I've read a lot of reviews about the staff both here and across the street @ Geno's being rude, even saw it on a Food Network show. However, they were fantastic with us. My excitement to be there must have been infectious because they even came out to take pics and cracked a few jokes. 

As usual with touristy places, you are bound to run into others who came a long distance just to try them. We ran into one couple also doing a steak comparison and had just finished their first steaks @ Geno's. They made for an enjoyable conversation as we shared our crazy food adventures. It always make me feel better to know that I'm not the only person in this world that travels for food !

~~~~~~~~~~

THE CHEESESTEAK
I HATE Cheese Whiz. It is a violation of basic food decency and have been repelled from any establishment that even suggests putting it on my food. So when I found out Philadelphians prefer it, I made it up in my mind I would give it a try so as to have the most authentic experience possible. Under protest of course, because the backup plan was to throw it away if I didn't like it and order another with provolone, the cheese of the food gods!!!

I was stupefied at just how amazing whiz can taste on a Philly cheesesteak. Not in a million years would I have guessed I would love it as much as I did. But then again it could simply be the way Pat's blends it with the meat. It's not just poured on top as I expected. No, it's mixed into the blend of beef and onions during the cooking process, setting of an orgy of deliciousness.

I'm a Chicago native. The meat in our cheesesteaks is much more finely diced, almost to the point of looking like ground beef, which is how I prefer my cheese steaks.  Pat's does not chop their beef up nearly as much, but it is certainly more finely chopped than its rival Geno's for sure. It make the sandwich easier to eat, more tender and in my opinion, creates a more balance flavor between all the ingredients. Most people mistake the finer chop for a lesser quality meat, but nothing could be further from the truth. I'd be willing to bet the meat each uses probably comes from the same vendor. They just slice and season it differently.

~~~~~~~~~~

FINAL THOUGHTS
Food is a personal experience not always based on how good something actually is, but how good it is in comparison to other life experiences. It may be tied to memories with loved ones or a bad experience with a past relationship. Whatever subjective feeling you have, no one can really take away how the inner you reacts to it. 

As for me, Pat's was probably the singular most soul satisfying meal I had during my entire three week vacation up the East coast. Took me back, way back to simpler days. I love food (all food) but you should know by now I'm not fancy. If I were food, this sandwich is truly me on a plate. My eyes rolled back in my head as my taste buds screamed 'Don't stop, git it, git it!'   Winner - Pat's.




SIDENOTE: See my review for Geno's to get the comparison between the two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
One word.... TERRIBLE!!! 
You should be ashamed. If you don't care, don't keep fucking people with glory day's marketing. You have clearly checked out
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pro:  This simply is what it's supposed to be: a no-frills helping of meat, bread, cheese, and onions. It's a suitable meal for late-night barflies and non-calorie counters. The historic reputation makes it a stopping point for out-of-towners that want the bragging rights of a cheesesteak in Philly. And for those who don't know how to order one "like a local", a large instructional sign is placed near the service window for your reference. #betterthangenos

Con:  If you scroll through the reviews of Pat's, you will find that many of the better ones are written by non-Philadelphians. This illustrates two points...1) Pat's is a bit of a tourist trap, and 2) Locals know that a better cheesesteak can be found in Philly. Ladies and gents, both points are right! Though adequate for what it is, I expected better...

Bottom Line: Try it for the experience, search elsewhere for the superiority.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I actually have a hatred for this place. It is due to the fact there cheesesteak has large amounts of gristle on it and is quite repugnant. Mountains and mountains of grease.

This saddens me greatly as this used to be a staple in the Philadelphia region and a rite of passage to try Pat's Steak.

I may wait for one more time to order a cheesesteak here to lower my rating to one star as this place was so iconic back in the day and open 24 hours smh.

Buyer beware lower your expectations.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's and Geno's are must visits when in Philly for the night, or after you've had (more than) a few drinks.  We really like Pat's but steaks just as good can be had elsewhere, for less money, and for less of a ride.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just a regular cheesesteak with wiz cheese, Not the best. And lines can be very long during the weekends or after a event. I prefer to come here as a late night grub option.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We wanted to try the home that "invented" the cheesesteak, so naturally we went here (knowing that other cheesesteak places were rated higher). We got a few provolone mushroom steaks and some with American cheese. Despite the hype and lines, the sandwiches were pretty bad and tasteless, I am sorry to say...

The buns did not taste like anything and were soggy, the steak had no seasoning, and the cheese was pretty bad. Pretty sure the mushrooms were canned, which is pointless as they don't add any flavors to the overall sandwich. Even my brother who will eat any junk food and who isn't usually too picky deemed this place "unforgettable." Well, at least we checked it off our list of touristy things to do, and next time, we can get the real deal elsewhere. Honestly, the cheesesteaks I've had in mall food courts have been way better. The only thing that redeems this place is the fries, I guess.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I came to Pat's before trying Geno's across the street.  Big mistake.  Geno's sucked and the entire time I was eating their sandwich, I was kicking myself.  I knew I should have ate at Pat's and leave it at that (hey, that rhymes!).  Moral of the story:  if you must try Pat's or Geno's, stick to Pat's!!!  

Got the "cheesesteak wit onions and cheese whiz"!  The meat by itself is kind of bland, but when mixed with cheese and onions, it was pretty tasty. The bread was soft and chewy. I've had better cheesesteaks outside of Philly, but I would much rather spend my money here than across the street.  I wouldn't rule out a future visit here if I came to Philly again.  However, I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here unless I was in the area.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ugh.. where do I begin? As an out of towner the first time I was introduced to a Cheesesteak I was brought to Geno's so for years I only went to Geno's then I was told that Pats & Genos werent even the best and I needed to go to South Street and find other places, so then I found Ishkabibbles and for years that was my only place to go. 

THEN... I happened to be visiting with my Sister in law and she wanted to get one from everywhere, so I took her to Geno's and she was like, "What about Pat's" and I was like Ooh no I dont go there, but we did, and OMG IM SO GLAD...  First off, WAY BETTER than Geno's and almost if not better than Ishkabibble, Im shocked, because In my mind I was always a Geno's person, but who needs all the lights & signs (well I guess they do because their sandwich is garbage)  

So now Pat's will be my forever stop, No drama, no lights, just a REALLY GOOD Cheesesteak!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This place just doesnt get it. Pat's has died. Geno's had a nice long line and Pat's had no line yesterday at 6pm. We wanted to give Pat's another go to see if they pulled their heads out of their arses. Nope. They skimped out on the steak and hardly put any cheese on it. Next time we're going to John's Roast Pork or Tony Luke's.  RIP Pat's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I went to Pat's while in Philly so i can try some of the best Philly Cheesesteak sandwich and I was very impressed. I'm not from Philly but all those flavors were hitting. We stopped at 2 cheesesteak establishments and we voted Pat's to be better tasting. 

Let's talk the size. The Sandwich is skinny but packs a lot of meat, they also don't cut it in half unless you ask. It's not sloppy or greasy, it's actually tucked into the hero nicely. I love that there was some sort of added pickled peppers, that gave the cheesesteak that umf and extra kick to it. Overall I loved it and so did my family. We all chose Pat's as the best. I guess tourist have different taste? I will definitely come here again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Got the classic cheese streak with onions and cheese whiz it was very good. Surprisingly a lot of steak
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: There is a lot of controversy of what is better genos or pat's personally I think genos is better. First off I have a strong bond with their cheesesteak it is amazing. Anyways when I got to Pat's there was many people but the line moved very fast. I got a famous cheesesteak and they made it in 20 seconds then I got fries I asked for cheese on the side but the guy got mad at me because that is what genos does and genos are their competitor. After I got the fires I went to get the peppers too they were very good and sweet. Not going to lie when I first bit into the cheesesteak it was great but not as good as genos the reason they are different is because genos makes their steak in strips not like pat's their steak is minced. But when I go back to the area I will go to genos not pat's but pat's is pretty good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had this delivered at about 10:30 last night and it was probably one of the worst cheesesteaks I have ever tasted. I got the extra cheese (provolone) and it seemed like there was only two slices cheese on the whole thing and then the steak was super dry and tasted like cardboard. This was my first time to Philly and really hopped to find a good cheesesteak so I will try again tonight at another shop and hopefully find something better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I came to NY from Cali on vacation and had to make a stop here in Philly, I had to practice and make sure I had it down on the ordering process. I ordered 1 whiz wit, and had a delicious cheese steak! While I was eating, there were some loud mouth guy from Philly ordering his steaks and I thought that was the topper of the evening. I went to Geno's right after and ate their steak sandwich and gave them 4 Stars because Pat's was better. 5 Stars for Pat's, for "being the best..it's the best" ( in my philly thug accent)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Lived in Philly most of my life. So excited to come back for a steak sandwich at Pats. Literally the worst steak sandwich I have ever had. If I could've given a zero I would have. We threw out 5 sandwiches. The meat was tough and grizzly. Flavor sucks. Rolls were awful. Just bad!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When in Philly you got to have a Cheesesteak from Pat's King of Steaks.  Last time it was Geno's:  Decision time Pat's is the winner.  Very Good will definitely visit again next time I am in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats vs genos, let me help you out. as a recent newbie to philly visits, pats has so far been my favorite cheesesteak. The meat is tasty, cheese is gooey & fries have the perfect crunch. #dontmakeamisteak
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is really Philadelphia cheesesteaks! The meat is so tasty and it was supper quick to get our sandwiches!! Will be back again when in town!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I prefer Geno's for Whiz-Wit but if you are in the area you need to try Pat's as well. Pat started the cheesesteak business and founded Pat's King of Steaks in 1930 so for food I would give them three stars at best. With the historic value, however, bump it up a notch to four. Come here to take a part in history, come back if you happen to find the food worthwhile.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So i stopped in last sunday after a Phillies game.  My first time in Philadelphia, i had to try a cheesesteak.  After a bit of a search, seems like it came down to pats v genos.  I decided on pats for no reason in particular.
when i drove into the area at 5:30 on a sunday, it took me a few laps around the block to find a parking space.  Parked about a block away, started my walk.
go in line, probably 20 people ahead of me.  The line seemed to move pretty fast i thought.  I'm thinking i waited between 10-15 minutes to place my order.  I noticed that genos was right across the street from pats, thought that was interesting.
soooo, there are signs directing you on how to order.  Sammies at the first window, fries and drinks at the second.  No problems for me in ordering.  Got to the window.  I was greeted with "next,step up".  Guy taking my order didnt seem that friendly.  Didnt really matter to me, i just wanted to eat.
I ordered the extra cheese steak wit whiz.  Everything is already prepared.  They had my Sammy assembled in about 30 seconds.  Onto the next window for a coke to wash it down with
they do have some seating around the bldg.  i just so happened to catch a group leaving and grabbed a table.  Opened it up, thought ok this looks great!.  HOWEVER, the steak was bland, it needed some help.  The whiz was good, as you can see by the pic, they loaded the whiz.  The bun was fresh, whiz was hot, but that steak was pretty bland.  I ate about half, wrapped it up for my 4 hour drive home.  So let me say, after the 4 hour drive i was hungry when i got home.  They bread was not mushy or greasy, tasted pretty good after the road trip.  I believe my total was right around $17 for the Sammy and drink.
i do believe that I have 2 places near where i live that are better than pats.  Next time I'm in philly, i shall check out another place.  My advice, give that steak some love pats.  Enjoy the pics
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in philly. Had to get one. I'm glad I chose here. The line was long but it went fast. Wish I would of gone with the cheese wiz. They have two windows. One for sandwiches and another for drinks and fries. When in philly you eat a philly cheese stake
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Of the famous cheesesteak duo, this is my favorite. I enjoy the rolls, there is enough meat, it is not too fatty. However, it is just average to me. Nothing about it really stands out as special.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3.4 out of 5
The steak sandwiches were very good as expected. I am surprised that neither Geno's or Pats seasons the meat. You get beef flavor but if you order the pepper steak you get mostly the pickled pepper kicks along with the salty cheese sauce. I add lots of pepper and no salt is need with the yellow cheese. If you get a provsteak then salt and pepper are a must. A splash of pepper sauce is good however, no added mustard or sauce is necessary. Very friendly staff but be ready to order and don't fu@£ around. They serve how and fast and cash only. If you can't parallel park please walk or get a real driver to drop your a$$ off. It's a bust X intersection and no one appreciates waiting on amateurs to park or order when it's busy. I've learned it's not personal but the more you hold the line the longer people have to wait. Today I had mushroom pepper steak wit onions xtra steak and J had the mushroom provsteak wit onions and we shared cheese fries with refreshing crisp cokes!

3.4 is a great rating for a sandwich IMO.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I wasn't what I expected because the food was pretty common actually, nothing outstanding and the seller man was quite bothered by our visit there. I really hope they can figure out how to give a good service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
BIG Shouts go out to John, the black dude that dude that works in the back who goes by the one letter hook, I think it's G, or D. BIG shout"s to Nate (March 22, 2021 night, you already know) and Mike. Mike always make my Steak Sandwich the way I like it, Greasy!...Whiz Wit. 

I travel 90 miles out from Baltimore just to eat there. Everyone else get on me for going to the "tourist spot" they call it, but I love it!! Peace to all who continue to make that a great joint.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Disappointed. After ordering, hero was pushed out not wrapped. Presentation was awful but this place has such a historical reputation I thought it might taste better than it looks. It didn't. It was luke warm. Not hot enough to melt the provolone cheese.  Definitely would have scored 1 or more stars if it was hot and the bread was warm.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The original Philly cheesteak is hard to beat!  This is a must stop on a visit to Philly.  There are newer, more nuanced versions these days with highet quality ingredients, but there is a certain charm to the true version for me.  Sometimes simple is better.  Certainly for a cheesteak.  What you want to order is the whiz steak with onions.  It's the classic version, thinly sliced ribeye cooked on the flatop grill, along with diced onions, scooped into an Italian roll and topped with a ladle of melted cheese whiz (I know its normally disgusting, but it's perfect on a cheesesteak).  This a true American classic!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: First time in Philly. Ubered straight here right out of the airport. Very disappointed to say the least! Bun was cold, meat was, eh! The lady at the register was rude, they know it...they don't care. I don't get why this place is so famous. I won't give up finding a good Philly cheesesteak joint, I'm sure it's in Philly but this one is def not it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It probably would have been sacrilege to leave Philly without trying a cheesesteak, so I made a 2:30 am, post-karaoke-at-Ray's-Happy-Birthday-Bar visit with friends. 

I was already aware (gratis Food Network) of Pat's ordering lingo ("wit / witout" for your onion preference), but there was a helpful if longwinded sign to remind me as well. 

The guy ahead of us had just stepped off from the ordering window and the hard-bitten old dude was already barking at me to get up there. Geez, 'tude. I successfully ordered my "provie wit", but he was still giving me the stink eye, so I figured WTF and called him on it. He said, "No, If I was giving you the stink eye you'd know it" and kinda grinned. I said, "Okay, just checking." We got my order and left, but my friend (who lives around the block) said, "Wow, that's the nicest I've ever seen him!" 

As to the steak itself, it was okay. Gotta say, I've had better tasting sandwiches. (Sorry, it's true.) But now I can say I've had the genuine article, with the genuine experience to go with it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Well during Covid19 what is there to do not much but you can take road trip and grab a great Philly cheesesteak. This one was my sons favorite and mine too the original. Quick to take you please 
bring your cash, it's cash only but there's an ATM. I got one with onions my son without but both are so good. Since 1930 it's been around and I can see why. Be prepared to search for parking and I'd go in a group but enjoy it it's so worth it!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I saw all the hypes from the YouTubers and stopped by on my recent trip to Philly. 

I got there on a late Saturday afternoon and it was impossible to find a parking spot nearby. I parked about 4 blocks away.  

There was a vey short line and I order 4 cheesesteaks. They brought them out instantly even before I was able to take the cash out of my wallet.  I asked the cashier if those cheesesteaks were mine and the guy behind him said "are you stupid or just dumb!"  

Despite the insults, I did not argue and moved to the soft drink and fried order line. Those guys were a lot more professional. 

Overall, the cheesesteaks were small relative to the ones at Reading Market but tasty. But we all liked the food. 

However, I won't go back nor recommend others to go because:
- the sandwiches were pre-made - not sure if they are fresh
- the staff hated the customers and treated us badly
- it was out of the way from central Philly and a hassle to get back onto the Turnpike (bad local traffic)

I wished I had my GoPro out capturing the staff with attitude- I just may have gotten a viral video on TikTok or YouTube!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
When I opened my cheesesteak there was no meat on the front end of the sandwich so I had to pull off the top of the sandwich.. not a fan of the condiments sitting at the curb anyone can put something in it .. a bit unsanitary for me.   The meat was very bland... 
Picked up my son from Philly Airport and he wanted a cheesesteak.. I have eaten better cheesesteaks in New Jersey  Juniors Cheesesteak in Verona NJ best Cheesesteaks ever... will have to try Geno's or Sonny's next time.. Definitely overrated... they just don't care... you need to step up your game.. a lot of competition out there.. 

Very very disappointed!  Worse Cheesesteak ever... I heard Sonny's was better then Pat's and Geno's But the best Cheesesteak I have ever had is Junior in Verona, NJ.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: At first it was a chilly day so it took away from the flavor a bit, but this place is phenomenal, make sure you know your order when going to the front. Gotta try it.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's sucks. It's overrated and not even in the top 10 best cheesesteaks in Philly. The staff was rude and messed up our order. Do yourself a favor and go to the real king of steaks, Geno's across the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Definitely the bottom of the list for Philly Cheesesteaks! They may have been the innovators but most other places have improved upon the original. That can of Cheese Whiz sitting on the grill that they ladle over their grisly steak on a soggy roll appeals to some but I've had better. They are good at marketing and it seems as though the tourists think that Pat's is the place to go.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Visiting the city for the first time we had to stop by to do the taste test between Pats & Genos to fulfil our food network dreams. Both are farther from the city so we ended up taking a car here and in a tourist spot so parking isn't the most ideal. I'd recommend some other type of public transportation if you want to get to the area. 

As for when we arrived Pats is a simple place with picnic tables outside where you will enjoy your meal. We ended up getting two cheesesteaks - one with wiz and the other with American to test out the different options. Fresh & hot I enjoyed the meat portion that came with Pat's subs. Since the meat was a little more chopped up it allowed the cheese to flow in between the crevices of the cheesesteak. Was it extraordinary? Not really but for a tourist spot it was filling and was a size we were able to share between our group. Thoroughly enjoyed the wiz option over the American so might need to add that to my future orders.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I am starting my review while standing in a line that is in the middle of the street (no one said tourist were smart). I've been here before and I'm proud to say I'm a Pat's Guy. Years ago I did my own taste test of Pat's vs Geno's and I liked Pat's better.  Geno's location is too flashy and clean for me. I know Geno is not hurting because the end of his line is also in the middle of street almost touching Pat's. Yes there is a lot of horn honking from the angry Sunday Drivers!!!

There is so much action here.  I waited in line and ordered my sandwich with ease...10 years ago when I first ordered a sandwich I was so nervous because there is a warning that says if you screw up you go to the back of line.  And I did not want that to happen.

I ordered my sandwich...Wiz Cheese Steak with Onions...and not a problem with the counter...guy had my sandwich before I got my change...oh yeah cash only...I would love to collect the money here.  9 bucks get you one sandwich...it is probably more of a 6 buck sandwich but it has become an institution...I blame those damn food network shows for driving the price up and people here.

Pat's keep up the good work and remember you are an institution...never for get that!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Because it's been around for so long, Pat's earns its business through its rich heritage, earning it a culture of its own. Because of its big name and the story of its rivalry with the place across it, Pat's draws patrons from different corners of the globe including those from the City of Brotherly Love. As a result of a huge volume of business that usually results in long lines, it earns a reputation from its utilitarian service. 

To streamline ordering, Pat's has two different areas for ordering, one exclusively for sandwiches, and the other is for fries and drinks. There's an area where you can load up on condiments, such as pepper and ketchup. They do not give you any napkins, even though there is a fresh stack of napkins clearly behind the window. They expect you therefore to get them yourself. 

They also expect you to know the proper lingo in order to order a steak. There's a sign by the front that tells you how to order a steak there. It includes a warning that if you mess your order, you're obliged to head to the end of the line to try all over again. If you want a cheesesteak, you're supposed to state what type of cheese you want. You're getting a choice of provolone, Cheese Whiz, American. Don't be fancy and attempt to order Swiss, feta cheese, camembert, or roquefort. Next, you're given a choice of onions (wit) or without onions (witout). Mushrooms are 50 cents extra after tax.

Even when we arrived at 10am when there were no lines, they expected us to get up to speed with what's going on. Know the lingo. Know where things were. 

I ordered a mushroom provolone wit (mushroom cheesesteak with provolone and onions) for $10.50. After I placed my order, my meal was ready in less than a minute. That was how quick the whole thing was. The bread came a little soggy, but the steak was pretty good. They chop the steak here and serve it with cheese. If you want sliced meat, you should go to Geno's. 

In my previous times of visiting Philadelphia, I never went to either Pat's or Geno's, knowing of the lines. But because it was Crystal's first time, we decided to go. We came here for the experience, but I can say surely that there are other places to have lunch (or a cheesesteak) aside from the two joints on Passayunk Avenue.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
A must stop if you are in Philly. Pat's King of Steaks and their rival (across the street) have had a long running competition of who is best.

I was lucky when I came here that there wasn't too much of a crowd. Make sure you know how to order before you get to the front of the line.

The food is ready fast so be prepared for a delicious cheesesteak and a good sized portion.

I also went across the street to try the other guys. I can tell you....I am a Pat's guy. 

They were both good, but I would vote Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It was 2009 when I went. 2:30 am after clubbing. Was with several friends. I am from Oregon and Philadelphia was quite an experience. 

As we waited forever in line, it was worth it. And the entertainment we witnessed was crazy. This poor fella was sitting in his Mercedes eating his cheesesteak, right next to the window. And these guys were just harassing him. One had the audacity to whip his penis out and rub it in the guys window. Mind blown. And not a cop around. Driver just kept eating his cheesesteak. 

I went to Genoa's across the street two days later before I flew back to Portland. 

Both places are equally badass.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If this is what cheesesteaks are supposed to taste like, I am NOT a fan. The meat was tough, chewy and flavorless, the cheese was gross and the bread was hard to chew. Overall, just not good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Will never go back. The customer service I received was so poor. The sandwich was dry and flavorless. Go to Geno's across the street. Better service better taste! And to the man at the counter, just a reminder I'm the customer, you better get that attitude and wipe it off your face at the window. You don't talk to me the customer like I'm an idiot and start yelling how to form a line and then yell out next means who's up next to order a sandwich. As the customer we pay your bills and make you rich and by the look of it Geno's line pisses all over your line. There was no line to form because no one was on it. You work so fast you don't even know how to properly wrap the sandwich never mind put it in a bag. Your business should be embarrassed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Never disappointing even after years- wish the normal cheesesteak comes with more cheese. Not the best way to represent the legacy for the visitors.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
It's not like it used to. It gave me too little meat and was disappointed with my husband and me.
I've been driving three hours in New York This is not really the meat is much smaller!! 


It's not the taste I always expected. They're saving meat!! 
-.,-
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Wins the cheesesteak challenge every time. 

We brought my niece to try the famous Pats and Genos and it was delicious as always. There was so much wiz it was all over us by the time
We were done but so worth it!

Outside seating is available and there is a pepper bar to spruce up your steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: When I came here for the first time I realized just how delicious a cheesesteak sandwichcan really be. I had their classic cheesesteak "wit wiz " , my fave ! I'm not the biggest cheesesteak lover,  but this one was one for the books.  Although I must say that my first time versus my second time here was a little different, I noticed that the meat was not as tasty vs my first time here , but still very tasty ! Will always stop by here when I go to Philly !
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Less ugly then Geno's. Better wiz. Will only go if it's 3am and I'm drunk. Still just a damn sandwich. Go somewhere else if it's a normal hour of the day.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The original rivalry - Pat's vs Geno's. I stopped at both one night to do a side by side comparison of the two. And Pat's came out the winner. 

The main difference in the two sandwiches is the steak. Pat's chops their steaks up and then pours the cheese on top and then the toppings. So everything melds together and it's great. Geno's has a slab of meat that they then pour everything on top - and it's just not as good. So if you find yourself between the two one day and the lines are about the same - I'd go for Pat's.

One complaint I have, and this is probably about Philly and/or cheesesteaks in general. The term 'wit' sounds a lot like the word 'whiz'. So if you're trying to get a cheesesteak with whiz only, it's possible that you will wind up 'wit' which means "add onions to my sandwich, please." And anyone who knows me knows that phrase will never come out of my mouth - ever. So I wound up going home with a whiz wit, instead of a whiz witout. Not the end of the world, I was able to scrape the onions off, but I feel like I sacrificed some whiz in the process and therefore didn't get the full effect. 

Even so, even with the order snafu, Pat's won out over Geno's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Worth trying once because it's an iconic Philly place, but I wouldn't go back again. We ordered 3 cheesesteaks. 

Bread: too chewy and hard to eat, especially with the equally chewy meat.
Meat: really grisly, tough, chewy
Whiz: bland

The cheesesteaks were good but not great. We then walked across the street to Geno's and ordered the exact same thing. Geno's is SO MUCH BETTER. I'm writing a review on Geno's now...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's vs Geno's a tale as old as time a song as old as rhyme. My wife and I visited both these fine establishments got one cheesesteak from each and then cut them in half and split them so we could decide which was better unfortunately we forgot which half was from which cheesesteakaria and thus kuldnt come to a final decision. We were going to try to get too more steaks but trust me we were FULL. Whichever half was Pat's was very good 4 sure.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Many of my friends recommended this place and Its so simple, and so right. You walk up to the counter; order your sandwich and hand It right back to you. The other side is for fries and drinks. 

The fries were so good that I went back to get a second one. I also made a 20 minute detour on the way to the airport to grab another one on my way out.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good cheese steak but not great. It was really messy for me, steak was bland, cheese was bland, bread was average. I had to add mushrooms to make it intresting.   Tip: cash only
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Brought some out of town friends to see "a philly establishment". Walked away disappointed and embarrassed. The staff bullied a young family that asked for no bread and just steak (their son was allergic to bread). The plump little man and his odd looking staff didn't hesitate to call the family as$holes and tell them to move along. I thought that was the worst of it. The worst was the 3rd world fast-good quality meat and flavorless cheese. This "establishment" wouldn't last a month in any other city, but for some reason Philly enjoys being stuck in the mud, held back by swamp rats with faded tattoos, flipping pisspoor processed meats. I'll be having a roast beef at Cherry Street next time..
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This definitely seems like a very touristy place, so you can expect long lines! But the service is fast, so the line moves quickly!

Get ready for some greasy goodness! The Philly way of eating the cheesesteak is with Cheese Whiz, which my not sound very appetizing, but I promise it's good! And for those who like eating it the good old fashioned way without Cheese Whiz, you can go for that too! But don't forget to order a side of fries and a drink! Just don't count your calories afterward.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place is a legend, and actually preceded neighboring Geno's.  So it's 'the original.'

And it's a darn good cheesesteak, it really is.  And it's big.  Get it wit cheese whiz, don't get one of the other cheeses. 

We had to get a cheeseteak because we were in Philly, but the real winner was the neighboring bar where you could BYOC (Bring Your Own Cheesesteak) and have a craft beer.  No restrooms at Pat's or Geno's so it's a great place for that too. 

In summary, it's a touristy spot you kinda have to go to at some point if you've never been to Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Fast moving great food.    Line was semi long but really moved fast. One window for just ordering cheesesteaks and the next window to order fries and drinks.   Guy at the second window is very hard to understand and when another customer didn't get the right change back the guy didn't understand what he was asking.   Quite pricey but for once in an extreme blue moon what the heck. 

I got the Cheesesteak 'wit' onions and cheese whiz.  Love how it's not slabs of meat and instead more chopped.   Pretty greasy but delicious. Fries I could have done without.   Wasn't a big fan of them. Overall great experience.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Just ate my first cheesesteaks ever for a Philadelphia Fourth of July visit with some friends, and we decided there was nowhere better to start than with a Pat's and Geno's sampler.

The rivalry lived up to it's name, as the two places are directly across form each other. 

Between four of us, we split up and got a Wiz Wit and Wiz Witout from each place.  Pat's was noticably faster service (by about two minutes of waiting time) from end-of-line to steak-in-hand.  I will admit that I was partial to Geno's taste when all was said and done, but Pat's cheesesteaks were just fine and tastey. 

For parking, we cheated a bit and stopped in at the ample Acme lot a block or so down, which worked great.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Delicious, but, and please don't kill me, I liked Tony Luke's better.

This place is super fast.  When you get to the front of the line it takes maybe 5 seconds after you order for them to shoot out your sandwich.  Therefore, even if the line looks long, it moves fast.

They have a sign showing you how to order the cheesesteak.  I got mine with American cheese and wit (meaning with onions).  I should have tried the cheese wiz.  

Even though it was in the high 90s and all the seating is outside, all the tables were still full.  Therefore, we had to creepily stand by tables until someone left.

The only reason I liked Tony Luke's better, is they melt their cheese.  Even though this sandwich was really good, it would have been better with melted cheese.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats and Geno's are both a waste of money.... There's nothing special about a guy putting an unseasoned, overcooked, and overpriced piece of meat on a roll and tossing it in the customers direction...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Hummmm what can I say about my 1st experience about the Infamous Geno's & Pat's (unfortunately you can't speak about one without speaking about the other [it not my fault yall set up that way] so please note that my comments will be the exact same on Geno's yelp page) 

Well my wife and arrive in Philly about 11ish and this was our first stop.....1st time in Philly why not stop at the Infamous "Tourist Trap - Pat & Geno's (I'm starting to think they should squash the rivalry and just combine the two...it's not like they both are any better then the other).....Ok I'm getting ahead of myself. 

So we find parking (and yes we had to search near and far to park) after finding a parking spot over and around the Mulberry bush we then walked several blocks till we found ourselves in the crossfire of the two PAT'S & GENO'S..... My wife and I came up with a game -plan she would get a Cheese Steaks from Pat's and I would get one from Geno's and we would see who's the best. 
After standing in line for about 20 min a piece we met back up in the middle of the street (because I overheard some folks saying that the two places do not allow each others food and products over in their respective areas) A bunch a nonsense if you ask me...... 

So in the middle of the street on top of a mail box we have the two Cheese Steaks sitting there side by side....I take half of the Geno's and my wife takes half of Pat's so we bite into each half expecting and thinking that we are about to taste heaven itself...........WOMP WOMP WOMP!!!!!!!!!!!!! A total disappointment..... 

In my mind I was thinking..."if this is the best that Philly has to offer then Philly may want to rethink what food they want to add there name too." 

Pat's & Geno's both: 
- Had VERY bland Cheese Steaks (hardly NO flavor to either one) 
- Not enough Steak 
- Very rude (as if I the customer owe them something in addition to my 8 dollars) I have never met a group of individuals that have a well-known establishment treat and look at there customers as if they are mad that we choose to stop here. 

Bottom line....coming to Pat & Geno's was worth the trip here ONLY to say that I have been there but the food is not worth bragging about or even coming back too if I am in desperate need or craving for a true Philly Cheese Steak. 

Too conclude or trip in Philly 8 hours later....I called a buddy of mine who is a Native Philly Residents and he informed me about a spot in North Philly called "Paganos".....we stop here on our way leaving Philly and if you want to know the rest about this GOD SENT PLACE....then you have to read about its page.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/paganos-steaks-and-hoagies-philadelphia#hrid:PLWl2w8WgwYOueR_A2hXrQ
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I've been here one too many times because it's a classic. Getting a wiz wit (for non philly ppl, it means whiz cheesesteak with onions) is my late night munchies addiction. Depending on when you get here, lines will be long enough where you'll get close to the street, then it could be completely empty. Normally if it's a game day or late at night when the after party dwellers go, this place becomes a mad house. I'd give it a try to say you've been here and given it a try. Would I say it's the best in the city? Prob not, but it's just like saying who visits NYC and doesn't try a slice of $1 buck pizza? Again, prob not the best but you get that flavor of the city and that's something you won't forget.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Been there on a couple of occasions, and like what natives of the area say, it is a tourist trap. I am not a native of the area, but a tourist; therefore, I went there. My first trip there was in 2007 and I took the bus from Center City on my way to the Phillies game, and I missed my stop and had to walk a few blocks in an area that I had never been in before. When I finally made it there, I perused the menu and got a cheesesteak wit, All in all, it was good; however, there are better in the area that I have been to in Philly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'm driving down to Florida and had to stop by. It has been years since I was here. Basically the same. Nothing to write home about. Your basic cheesesteak. Nothing great. Nothing bad. Basic. After I started eating it I went back to the window and purchased a side of pizza sauce & sliced provolone to add to it. It kicked the flavor profile up a bit. Better than I started with. Good for a Sunday late night 1:00 a.m. snack. It did its job.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Hey. It's PAT'S. What do you want? One of the things I miss and crave the most from home, and one of my guaranteed stops when I'm home for a visit.

As many have mentioned, it's right across the street from Genos, and those of us from Philly are pretty loyal to one or the other. For me, Pat's steaks are just more flavorful, better made and more delicious. I also think their fries are better. And they serve Coke. And, when you look at the two businesses, it should be apparent which one is better. Genos must need all that neon for a reason. #Justsayin.

One note to all of the reviews about rude behavior: It's part of the thing. Call it ambiance or whatever, it's part of the experience of getting a cheesesteak in South Philly. At Pat's you are expected to be ready to order, to know HOW to order and to not hold the line up. If you can do those three things, you will get what you ordered lickety split and enjoy a delicious meal. It aint fancy, but it's not supposed to be. If you don't like it, go to the Four Seasons and leave the rest of us alone.

If you are new or just visiting and are nervous, that's understandable. We're not unreasonable. So ask the people around you while you wait in line. Or follow my handy guide for newbies...

1. There are TWO lines. One for cheesesteaks and one for fries/sodas. You can't get fries in the cheesesteak line. You can't get steaks in the fries line. It is best to bring at least two people. The cheesesteak line is almost always longer, so the person in charge of fry ordering should wait until their partner is fairly well along in the cheesesteak line before stepping up to the window so that you both come out with food at the same time. 

2. Fries. You can and should get cheese fries. They are drenched in Cheez Wiz and are AWESOME.... the type you have to eat with a fork and the type where there's a big pool of cheese down in the bottom of the cup.

3. CASH only. Don't ask about credit cards. You'll look stupid. Like the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld, it's best to have your cash out when you order.

4. Ordering. Do it right. They have gotten a bit more lenient in recent years, but there was a time in which a bad orderer would be sent to the back of the line. You say two words and two words only: the type of cheese followed by WIT or WITOUT (ie, with or without fried onions). Yes, you can get other cheese and other stuff but I highly recommend Wiz Wit for your first time out (see next point below). The only other words you need are numbers (as in "TWO Wiz Wits").

5. Wanna be branded as an outsider? Order something other than Wiz on your steak. Yes, there are other cheese options, but orders with Provolone are like announcing you're not from around here. You traveled all the way to an odd corner in South Philly to sample a REAL Philly cheesesteak. So suck it up and order a REAL steak -- WIZ WIT is all you need to say.

6. Tables. Red picnic tables line the sidewalk all the way around Pat's. Ideally you should bring a third person whose job it will be to troll the area for an available table and snag it while your other two people do the line thing in point #1. I've gone to Pat's at all hours of the day -- steaks for midnight snacks, steaks for breakfast, and it's extremely rare to go there and find a bunch of empty tables. At the very best, it's not jam-packed. So having a table scout can pay off big time during busy times.

7. Parking. Pat's and Genos are located pretty much right in the middle of a neighborhood, separated by a neighborhood baseball field. The only option is street parking. It's tight and hard to find sometimes. If you suck at parallel parking, bring someone who knows what they're doing. Not the place for rookies. Or take a cab from a safer locale.

That's it! Good luck and happy cheesesteak!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Most overrated subs I have ever had.  Fake cheese, hot dog rolls and more fat on the beef than actual meat.  Their sub is perfect match with the city Pats is located, Philadelphia, disgusting and gross.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Took a spontaneous trip to Philly with the parents today. We were between this one and Genos. Never really had many cheesesteaks, but i ordered one from here. Overall, not too bad. Taste was good and bread was good. I feel like maybe it lacked a little bit of flavor? But that could be just me. Overall good experience and fast service.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
No no no no no no no. No.

I remember the first time I went to Pat's and Geno's during Spring Break (this is before I discovered Yelp); my friend and I were coming from Myrtle Beach,SC to Brooklyn, NY and decided to stop here for a 'midnight snack'. I ordered a cheese steak with provolone from Pat's and one with Cheese Whiz from Geno's, onions in both. After eating both of them , I decided that Geno's is the King of Steaks and doused my friend with his soda as an official declaration . Okay that didn't happen, but I was thinking it.

Enough reminiscing, though. It has been nearly six months and Caleb P. is back in Philadelphia and it's official: the only thing keeping Pat's and Geno's alive is pure publicity. 

The simple fact is this: These two places serve the most delicious cheese steaks ever made. Delicious? Actually, a better word would be: horrendous, disgusting, grotesque, disturbing. Rather, any combination of the previously listed words would be more appropriate than 'delicious'.

After coming here the second time, I realize that the Cheese Whiz masks how poor this cheese steak is. Order everything and have provolone instead of Cheese Whiz and you will discover how unbelievably tough, dry, and lacking the meat is. I won't say any more, rather I will let you find out yourself.

The thing is about Geno's and Pat's is summarized in the last sentence of the previous paragraph: "....rather I will let you find out yourself." I can continue on how tough the meat is, how limp the bread is, or how overcooked the onions are. I can rant, throw a tantrum, scream to the world, but that won't stop anyone. Curiosity and skepticism will continue to bring wave upon wave of people to these joints and nothing will stop them. Their popularity has reached Paris Hilton-esque proportions where any publicity is good publicity.

What bothers me is the fact that people differentiate Pat's and Geno's as two separate entities, when it is clear that they both are equal establishments. What angers me the most is that Pat's and Geno's are famous for how delicious their cheese steaks are rather than notorious for how atrociously terrible they really are.
