$7.50 for this? You must be joking. I rather have my tongue cut off.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tried Pat's while in Philly and loved the cheese steak! Close to Geno's in the type of sandwich (not as oily and the bread is less carved out). The bread was fresh, meat tasty and we loaded it up with extras from the condiments section. Its a cash only place! Must try when in Philly!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm a philly native so I know to stay away from places like this. But also as a Philly native, I decided to finally give them a shot. I ordered twice two weekends in a row. I feel as though there was an inconsistency with both orders. The first time, the roll and whiz were fine for the most part but the sirloin was too chewy.  The second time, the provolone wasn't even melted and the role was spongy and drippy having absorbed so much grease. There was a layer of grease covering the inside of the wrappper as I removed the sandwich.  There was no flavor to the sandwich at all. Both times I walked away disappointed. There was no magic invloved in the making. 

The experience left a lot to be desired. Management needs to step up its game. 

I wouldn't recommend Pat's to anyone and likely wont be going there again unless I hear there's new and improved management.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Given the reviews, I thought this place was going to be pretty bad, but honestly would say that it's a pretty solid Philly cheesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is a fun distraction for tourists who are interested in checking the sites and taking photographs of cheesesteak rivalry. However, if you're looking for high quality cheese steaks, I'd look elsewhere. The steak at Pat's is dull, borderline soggy and not much different than a cafeteria meat. The bread was also dry and flaky, but all in the wrong way. If you like good steak or roast pork, try John's Roast pork for award winning sandwiches.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is ok. Generous amount of steak which has good flavor. Bread bun is good.
This place is always busy so seating is on a first come basis. 
Not much else to say really.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great time. No lines today. Can never go wrong with a WIT WHIZ. Now I'm in a cheesesteak coma.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's King of Steak or their rival, Geno's Steak? Each across the street from one another, I had both and the consensus with my two other companions made this one a clear cut WINNER!! The super tender and juicy steak is more chopped up. We added mushrooms, onions, green peppers and provolone. For me, the green peppers and the chopped steak did it for me. I also think the steak was a bit more juicier than the one at Geno's.

I think it's just a matter of preference. Both of these places deserves to be named Best Philly Cheesesteaks. How else would you explain people coming from around the world just to try it. It's been in many Food Network's shows. 

Come, enjoy and judge for yourself. It's worth a visit in the heart of Philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We tried both Pat's and Geno's side by side, and they were both quite tasty. I ordered a mushroom cheesesteak whiz wit. I loved that it was super cheesy, the onions were cooked a bit more, and that they loaded it up with (canned) mushrooms. I don't mind the mushrooms being from a can, but I would have liked them to been grilled. The bread is a bit soft, which makes for a messy eating experience. Please be aware that it is cash only. There is an ATM across the street, but it's a $3 fee. I'm sure there are better and cheaper cheesesteaks in Philly, but we had to try the touristy places first.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I don't know what all the hype is but I don't see it. The food is expensive and not spectacular. I don't know maybe I should have gone across the street to Geno's but oh well. It's also cash only and not cheap.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I actually would give this another 1/2 star for 4.5 stars.  Ate here over the Labor Day weekend.  Since I am having weight loss surgery soon, I wanted to try "authentic" philly cheese steaks from the two icons as part of my pre-surgery "bucket list".  My wife stood on line at Pat's for me while I was at Geno's.  Her line moved slightly quicker and the staff was very accommodating and let her wait for me as they took people ahead of her and then allowed us to order when I was able to get over there, without having to wait on line all over again.  I think I read reviews saying they were rude, this proved to me they are not rude.  I ordered a cheese steak wit onions, whiz and mushrooms.  All I can say is, after eating only 1/2 of the sandwich right there (had to save room for 1/2 of the Geno's for a head-to-head), it was hands down one of the best I have ever had.  I have had equal to it, outside of philly, but it only disappointed in that I had hoped it was better than what I have had before.  I only gave 4 stars (again, I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could) because I am holding out hope that there is a better cheese steak sandwich out there, but this is as good as I have had anywhere.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I going to say this, since I moved to the area I have been picking off one by one 'THE BEST PHILLY STEAK' and Pat's was the 1st to make me want one again for dinner ( I didnt) but me and my friend visiting in town mouths were watering at 8 pm  after our 2 o'clock meeting with Pat's.  This was her first 'steak' so her opinion is biased, but she definitely loved it...

I love the challenge of finding a seat in the outside eating area.  I literally watched someone dive to a table, stalk someone for their table, and just eat really close to the restaurant while sitting in the car.  My friend asked the one question...What happens in the winter time?

Pat only got 4 stars because the bed of flies on the wall while we were eating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not entirely sure how to rate a cheesesteak since this was my first one. I just knew I couldn't leave Philly without having one.

Apparently a South Philly staple. The neighborhood reminded me so much of Brooklyn. I enjoyed the murals everywhere.

I suppose I should rate the food. There was a hefty lump of beef on some amazing bread. Can I rate this on bread alone? As good as a baguette. Asked for onions and provolone. Is that normal? Can someone tell me?

Anyway. Don't know if I just don't love cheesesteaks or this was just mediocre. Help.

Cash only.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If I come to Philly and want a cheesesteak and see this spot claiming to be the inventor and originator of it... it better stack up to the claims. And Pat's didn't do that. The service was blah. Try a little at least. They handed us the sandwich unwrapped and uncovered. This is why Geno's across the street had double the crowd. They work on their presentation, both of the locale and the food, and it goes a long way. Pat's has a better Cheesesteak than Geno's, but it takes no pride in its product. Shame.

On this same day, my friends and I tried out Larry's, Geno's, and Dalessandro's as a little ranking experiment and this was unanimously in second place, but not because it was the second best. It was simply the best of the worst. The first place went to Larry's because it has an amazing cheesesteak that far surpasses the other three we tasted, it had great presentation and neatly rolled up the cheesesteak, and the staff actually cracked a smile once in a while.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Heard all the hype and wanted to see for myself. Made sure to rehearse the order so I wouldn't be sent to the back of the line. Luckily for me there wasn't anyone else in line so they would have to deal with me either way. 

I go over to the counter with the line just o make sure I got the order down pat Wit (with onions) Wiz (with cheese whiz... Honestly can't understand why that's even an option. You BETTER get the whiz, lol). I stammer out "wit wiz" and brace for impact cause I'm not sure if they are just gruff here, or mean like Wieners Circle in Chicago. The lady says to me "you want onions on it?" AAAAAAGGGGHHHHH! I spend all this time making sure I got it PERFECT and SHE got it wrong. Oh well.

As far as the sandwich, it's pretty good. That bread is doughy and soft, yet firm so it can't rip (like Phillippe's French dip in LA). There's hot peppers, hot sauce, ketchup, relish and mustard, though I assume most of that is for other menu items. I wish they had some mayo haha! 

I'm gonna try Geno's on the way back to my Airbnb and I hear Jim's also is the shizz. So many food spots, so little time....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not what I expected. Definitely over rated over hyped.  I prefer dellesandros, ishkabbibbles, Max's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have been going to Pat's since a little girl with my whole family. We would eat on the benches. I still go there today, although the prices have risen a lot, but the amount of steak remains the same. You have to get the hot sauce on the side.  It hott, bur good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Yeah!!! My Cheesesteak with wiz finally came in the mail!!! I love GoldBelly. The fact I can support a local business during this nasty COVID19 is great! I got 4 Cheesesteak with onions and wiz on the side. Came nicely packed and ready to eat!!! Can't wait to have it for dinner tonight. My husband and I were there last year and damn, they were the best Cheesesteak sandwiches ever. I'm so glad they are on GoldBelly so I can order these delicious sandwiches.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: This is the original Philly Cheese steak! I love coming up here every couple of years to get the Cheese steak wit wiz, wit pepper, and wit onion.  Their fries are really good too. Right now with Covid we didn't have to wait at all! Normally it would take 30+ minutes to get a sub. This place is a Philadelphia gem.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I live in Florida but originate from Philly. Our kids ordered cheese steaks for us shipped via UPS. I'm skeptical but they arrived and we warmed as instructed the next evening and, wow, they were really good. A bit of home enjoyed for sure, good job.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
This place I would say a classic spot, you should visit while you are in Philadelphia. 
The cheesesteaks are pretty good, there are a variety of pickles like pickled cucumbers and peppers and jalapeños. 
The lines are insane though. When we were there in November it was like 40 minutes wait. But we came to this place specifically, so we waited. There were outside  tables last time, where you can eat.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What an absolute shitty cheesesteak! This is pure and simply a tourist trap. They are using their reputation as a way to serve mediocre, dry, tasteless meat covered in salty cheesewhiz on an okay bun. The portion is skimpy ... the price is insanely high for what you get and the staff is rude. I honestly would put this on par with Subway. Yet, each time I find myself in Philly, it's usually at a time where this is the only option for a cheesesteak and I forget how bad it was until I order it again.

The day before I ate here this time, there was a shooting outside the restaurant. While the neighborhood is MUCH improved from even 5 years ago, it's still nowhere you want to wander around in alone after dark. There are lots of scammers outside as well. Kids will come up to you asking you to buy a candy bar for their football team. You give them a buck or two and they pretty much tell you to fuck off. Don't fall for it. They'll wait until you have your wallet out after paying and then hit you up for the donation.

The parking situation is insane. I'd suggest parking in the nearby CVS lot, which is somewhat protected, and walking over if you must go here. The street parking spots are amazingly tight and most of the cars have pretty good amounts of 'battle wounds'. Even if you can parallel park like a champ, you may come out and find your car worse for the wear.

So what exactly is a cheesesteak here like? A dry, overcooked and void of seasoning or taste pile of meat. Melted cheap American cheese or orange salty Cheez Whiz. The dry roll is the best part of the sandwich but there is so few meat in it that all you'll taste is roll and melted cheese. You'll likely be full after and can walk across the street to Geno's, which is another tourist trap serving below mediocre cheesesteaks.

There are far better places in Philly to grab a cheesesteak. The local spots are likely the best ... Campos in Reading Market also does a decent one. Unless you want to say you've been here or there's no place else open, you'd likely do better in your hometown at a pizza or sub shoppe than at this tourist trap. No credit cards in 2021 as well. There's really no reason to go here other than the fact this is where people used to go in order to get a good sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I reviewed Pat's back in 2013 so I'm not sure where my review went? (so annoyed). Anyway I will re-create this review from what I remembered. Between Pat's and Genos, Pat's was better to me. The steak here is chopped a bit more so the cheese is coated around more. I liked mine with just onions and no peppers. I remember being hurried while ordering because they wanted to keep the lines moving but there was a specific way of ordering and I just kind of froze lol. Anyway I liked this cheesesteak a lot. So to me, it's Pat's all day over Genos.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I have spent the last 18 years going to Pat's. Used to live on the corner of 10th & Federal and my old neighbor worked there for years. I was loyal, sent every friend and family member that came into Philly to get a Pat's steak. After a hiatus and now being on keto, I thought a steak sans roll would keep me totally on plan. So I stop at Pats and ask for a steak no roll and the guy says he can't do that. I say you can't just put it on paper and he says "no, I'm not allowed". Big guy in the background yells "eat it off the roll". What they don't get is that you put the cheese on the roll first, by the time I unwrap the sandwich, it's impossible to even get any bites of cheese because it's totally stuck to the bread. So I tell them nevermind and I walk across the street to Geno's and ask the lady if I can get a steak no roll and she says "no problem, hon, I'll put it on paper". No snarky attitude, no "I'm not allowed to", no problems whatsoever. Considering the money I've given to Pat's over the years, to be told they can't give me a steak sans roll is ridiculous. Never again. I will never spend another cent of my hard earned money at this joint.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's was awesome! Be ready to order once you get to the window, they don't mess around! Only 4 stars because they put a TON of cheese on (if you get cheese wiz). However, it was delicious.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
There's always a debate...Pat's or Geno's...and I'm a Pat's fan!!!  Doesn't matter how long the line is, that's the one I'll be in.  Plus if you're smart, you'll get yourself some cheese fries or a soda first THEN get in line so you don't pass out from starvation...The line for the fries/soda is separate and usually non-existent.

I usually get my cheesesteak as "provolone wit".  Make sure you know what you want and order it right, otherwise you ain't getting fed!!
Haven't taken my bf yet cuz he doesn't eat cheese...and what's a cheesesteak w.o the cheese?!?!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I always feel so nostalgic about Pat's!  It was my first cheese steak in philly when I first started traveling for work. I remember researching how to order and what to order. And it was the best experience of my traveling experience!  Fast forward to today, almost twenty years later and I still love to eat here. It's  definitely changed over the years, but still hits the spot. I will definitely be back again and again and again.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Went to Pats around 5:30 on a Saturday the line was wrapped around the block and it took approximately 24 minutes to get to the window which seems normal for the time we got there. Before the actual window there are signs to help people order which definitely is a huge help for people who don't know what's on the sandwiches. 

Once actually getting to the window it literally took 30 seconds to get the sandwiches and pay which was awesome! This place is super well organized and the cheesesteak was awesome. I would definitely recommend and absolutely don't let the wait deter you.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's gets one more star than the notorious Geno's because it's slightly less xenophobic. And the owner isn't as much of an ass clown. 

Otherwise see my review for Geno's and you'll get the idea.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Undecided on Pats vs Genos so i went with Pats. Parking was very easy and no line so i ordered and my order was ready immediately went to my car and demolished it very good so much meat and bread was very soft and fresh. When i went back to dump my trash the line was forming ai looked across the street and crickets.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Good Cheesesteak. I have had better cheesesteaks though. A good touristy place and the food wasn't horrible. a Fun place to watch all the people too.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
if i could give this place zero stars i would, this place did not pass my low standards. the bread was soggy, the steak was unseasoned and didn't taste like anything it was also hard to chew. there were flys everywhere and half of the time i lost interest of the sandwich because it was so bland. if you are coming to Pittsburgh as a tourist to try the "famous philly cheesesteak" try going to some better place because i would never come here again! the employees were also very rude to the customers when asking questions about the menu. this place is 
H O R R I B I L E !!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pats is open 7 days a week 24 hours a day. Whenever you go there will always be someone in front of you. Always. But the line moves very fast. Let's be honest. The only reason to eat these processed cheese whiz, slimey processed "steak" sandwiches is because they are an iconic Philadelphia food. Celebrities, politicians and tourists from all over the world flock here to try either Pat's or Geno's or both.... 

The food itself? Meh. We tried Geno's, Sonny's, Lorenzo's and Pats. Pat's was the least favorite of all. 
Pats had the friendliest staff but the worst tasting meat. 

Read this about health infractions: http://m.wgal.com/news/pats-cheesesteaks-in-philly-gets-11-health-violations/37716570

That says it all.....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pat's is known for their cheesesteaks. Get their cheesesteak with whiz cheese and onions. They're generous with their meat portions. They're thinly sliced. Only thing is ask for more cheese bc they go lightly on the cheese compared to Geno's. If you want fries, go to Geno's for better tasting fries.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I did my research before visiting Philly for the weekend.  And I knew I had to check out THE Pat's King of Steaks, the OG of the Philly Cheesesteak.  I made a list and checked it twice, I was to come here, then cross the street and try Geno's and eventually visit a few other places to triangulate the cheesesteak data.

My control sandwich at all FOUR places (that's right, I went to 4 places in two days), was a cheesesteak with whiz and onions.  Pure and simple.

Since I felt a deft sense of respect for Pat's, I wanted to like this sandwich a lot more than I actually did.  By no means was it bad or a total disappointment, but I also didn't feel like I had to travel 99 miles from New York to eat this thing.  It was good, don't get me wrong, but did it blow my socks off?  Not in the least.  And to be honest, I really WAS wearing socks.

The setup is a bit uncouth.  The sidewalk red tables and benches remind me of  Coney Island -- when it was dirtier (think back to the 90's).  The few piegons loitering around also added to that visual rendition.  The guys here don't really want to crack a smile at you, they're not exactly rude, but they also don't appear to care that you've come a long way to try their famed cheesesteak.  Whatever.  Kill my fairytale.  

If the cheesesteak itself was amazeballs, I don't care how dumpy the place, or the surrounding neighborhood was, I would have gleefully embraced it all.  But the meat was chewy, there wasn't enough whiz & onions on my steak, and it just wasn't memorable.  And we had to pay $8.00 for that.  

In my grand tally of the four cheesesteak joints we went to (Pat's, Geno's, Ishkabibble's, and Jim's Steaks), I would place Pat's tied for 3rd place.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Philly Cheese Steaks. If a city is tagged onto a food, it has to be amazing right?! When you google cheesesteaks in Philly the age old war of Genos vs Pats comes up. More blogs say Pats is best so I had to try! 

Pat's King of Steaks was a very underwhelming experience. Where do I start? There was nothing amazing about this. The unoriginal beef flavor, the average bun, the lack of seasoning. This cheesesteak started okay but tasted worse with each bite. Ive never hated meat but by the end of this sandwich I felt like throwing up a little bit. My girlfriend felt the same way to. I imagine this is food tailored for drunk college kids at 3am on a friday night. 

The amount of cheese is generous and the sandwich was the largest of any cheesesteak I ate in the city.Staff is super nice as well. Standard cheesesteak prices, about $10 but not worth it. Food is solid 1.5 but other perks bumped it up

The staff is super nice but I won't be back and don't recommend it. Unlike the name suggests, this sandwich is not king.

Food: 1.5/5
Bang:Buck ratio: 2.5/5
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
In my opinion the reviews are spot on for this place.  This place is full of contradictions.  It is a tourist trap, however, it is in the middle of a residential neighborhood that is full of locals.  It is the original, but has been surpassed by other places.  In my opinion, Pats is worth the visit due to the nostalgia.   To get here you have to drive thorough one way streets with cars parked on both sides of the street.  Parking is a nightmare here, no parking garages, strictly street parking.  I highly suggest you come at odd hours like we did at 10:00am, it is open for 24hrs.  We had to drive around and wait until someone moves, you have to be quick and really know how to parallel park.  Otherwise, I highly recommend taking a cab.  Near where you order is a walk of fame for Rocky Balboa where he stood.  The neighborhood is quite quaint and the art work is on the buildings is very authentic, again one of the few spots that, I have been to that draws tourists but is located in the heart of where the locals live.  

We ordered a mushroom cheesesteak and a regular cheesesteak.  The proper way to order a cheesesteak is you first designate the number of sandwiches along with the type of cheese.  For us it was two whiz.  Than you specify whether you would like onions or not, so our order was "two whiz, one wit, one wit out."  Place is cash only and again lines are long, have your order ready and cash ready.  The cheesesteaks themselves were good, good quality meat, and melted cheese whiz speaks for itself.  The bread they use is a white hoagie, and is a lot more chewy than John's bread, and John's has a much better selection of cheeses'.  That being said, if you can you should take time to visit the original.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I visited this because I was in Philadelphia for the first time in my life, and I've  always wanted to try a Philly Cheesesteak in the city instead of elsewhere. My friends and I had to come here because well, it's a tourist trap and we're tourists. 

If I were you, I'd only come here once, just to say that I came here. After eating this abomination of a sandwich, which was unflavored and as dry as Arizona, I can confidently say that this is the worst sandwich I've ever had in my life. Overcooked and unflavored meat, the bread was mediocre, and you needed to pay extra for like the peppers? Jesus christ. For the price, I expected something edible. 

Also, the tables that they have are pretty gross, so I would wipe them down with a napkin and stuff. There were also tons of flies. Yuck. 

Come here once for the charm and never again after.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Horrible and disgusting greasy abhorrent sandwich !!!! 

Do not buy from this place its not worth a one dollar bill !!!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bro. No.

Horrible. Glorified 7 Eleven steak sandwich. PLEASE GO TO ANGELO'S, DELASSANDROS, OR JIMS....

I used to eat this steak after work 7-8 years ago working bar shift in Philly. It has lost SO MUCH quality since then. Just go elsewhere. $36 for 2 steaks and 2 waters. Cmon.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Wasn't how I remember from a few years ago. The meat was dry, there wasnt really any flavor. The cheese was mostly all over the wrapper and not actually on the cheesesteak. Probably why the meat tasted dry and flavorless. Disappointed but was still filling I guess.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I'm not sure if the verdict is out yet, but in the war between Pat's and Geno's for your Philly cheesesteak, Pat's is the clear winner for me. First, I usually don't venture to either Pat's or Geno's unless someone is visiting me from somewhere afar. And many-a-time, these same people would want to try both Pat's and Geno's, so I've definitely had both plenty of times.

I always get the mushroom steak with whiz and onions (yes I know there's a Philly way of ordering but seriously? I refuse). 

The meat at Pat's is better. The steak is more tender and juicy. I like the juices that run down your arm as you eat the sandwich. It's salty, it's warm, it's great after-drinking food. 

I almost always also get an order of cheese fries (just because the whiz on my sandwich isn't quite enough whiz yet) and an order of Birch Beer (kind of like root beer) which goes oh-so-well with the cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Why 4 stars?  Because it's the best Cheese Steak sandwich I've ever had.

   ---   ---   ---

What can I say that hasn't already been said?  If you visit Philadelphia, this is a requirement.

If you are expecting your life to be transformed based on the taste alone, you will be disappointed.  That being said, I've never had a better Cheese Steak.  

The entire Philadelphia culture is engulfed at Pat's, and I mean that in the most affectionate way.  Here is the routine:

1) Stand in line.

2) Use this time to decide on your order.

3) Practice reciting your order under your breath.

4) Arrive at the front of the line where someone behind the counter will barely acknowledge your presence.

5) Proclaim, "Whiz Wit, fries and a drink" within the first second and a half of said vague acknowledgment.

6) Hunt for a table like a needle in a haystack.

7) Enjoy the goodness.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My second visit to Pat's, this time with my boyfriend! So happy I was able to share a REAL cheesesteak with him!! 
Nothing but good things to say about this Philly staple! 
Aside from out of this WORLD cheesesteaks, the cheese fires with cheese wiz is just insane. For some reason these cheese fries hit the spot harder than any other cheese fry concoction I've had before. 
Every-time I am in Philly, I am making my Pat's pit stop!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was a decent Philly Cheese steak, first time out and wanted to see what all the buzz was about. Maybe I just had it overhyped and set my expectations too high, overall, still a decent cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
We spent a day in Philly on our way home to Syracuse. Cheesesteaks are our favorite sandwich, and we've had the best of what Syracuse has to offer. (Spoiler alert: None of them are in the same league.) Through our visit, we had marked five places to get cheesesteaks while in town. Genos and Pats were more for their history and relevance than anything else, but it was nice starting here and working our way up.

We had stopped by Geno's the night before since all the other places were closed. The next morning we came to Pats, since none of the places were open yet. I love that they have the food ready less than 20 seconds after you've placed the order. Wrapped and everything, but still assembled fresh. We also appreciated that they broke down the cheesesteak jargon on posters for us ignorant outsiders. We got our cheesesteak "wiz wit". Wiz for the cheese, which we had never heard of until coming to Philly. "Wit" meaning "wit onions", as opposed to "wit out". We loved it in Philly.

The bread was soft, and the onions were cooked all the way. The meat was in full, thin chewy slices. They don't cut the sandwiches in half, which was unfortunate for us because we ate this one in the car outside of Swann Memorial Fountain. The sandwich was messy to the touch, it took some serious doing to get this thing into two pieces and eat it without cheesing up the whole car. But we managed, and we'd do it again.

We voted Genos over Pats, and all other places over both. There's a lot of Kitsch surrounding both "original" locations, and it's made them both soft. Still though, absolutely no complaint coming from out of town. My rating of 3/5 is based on context. I'd go out of my way to eat at Pat's any day if it were in Syracuse, but I'll never come back now that I know what else is available in Philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If I could give this place ZERO stars I would. Long lines for no reason besides the excellent marketing skills both Pat's and Geno's has regarding rivalry or who was the originator of the sandwich.

Anyway, my husband and I got 2 cheese steaks: one with cheese whiz and the other with provolone. We also got french fries and a soda.

PROS: Food comes out quick 
CONS: Quick food has its consequences. Our cheese steaks barely had any cheese!!! Our onions were slapped on one side of the sandwich. Also, the steak is just really bland!! No taste whatsoever. Hurry up and eat your sandwich quick because it wont taste any better cold! The fries literally had nooo taste! Most likely ccooked in really old batter. Youre definitely going to have a hard time finding a place to sit. The concession area where they have their peppers, ketchup, mustard, etc. looks very unsanitary with flies. Definitely overpriced: we spent $24 on 2 sandwiches and $13.50 on 1 soda and 2 fries. 

Genos wasnt any better but if i had to pick between the 2 it would definitely be Genos just because it looks much cleaner and presentable.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Full disclosure: I came as a tourist. I was told NOT to go to Pats and Genos because they are considered trash cheesesteak sandwiches. I went to both, and honestly enjoyed them both. I tried the "Whiz Wit" style where they put the cheese whiz on, and understood why that's so popular (at first sight I thought that was disgusting).

Honestly, you can't go wrong with Pats or Genos. Pro tip: if you're lactose intolerant double up on the lactaid (take 2). No stomachache, just food coma.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I had been dying to go to Philly to have a cheese stake.... Finally, this week, while driving to New York from Florida, I convinced my husband to detour and stop in Philly so we could get an authentic sandwich.  I did my google research and since Pat's and their competitor were in the same area, we thought great. We can try both!  Pat's disappointed.  The meat was cold, and lacked flavor. The bun was hard.  Overall I have had better at places outside of Philly.   The competition across the street tasted better. but still, neither place was worth the stop over.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So know this is outside only.  But boy do they whip up the cheese steaks so fast.  Big windows so you can watch them prepare the food.  We ordered with provolone and and the original cheese wiz.  Soooo delicious.  And the condiment stand... the hot peppers are amazing. 

There's a few places right in the area.  This is the only one we went to do and we'd say the food was good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I got the mushroom cheese steak no onions, it was ok. Whiz cheese is a must, steak was dry cause they make it and just heat it up when you order, mushrooms were ok. Fountain Coke was delicious lol. Fries were also really good, had some breaded seasoning that made it crispy, minus one star for I've had a better sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Well, when you're in Philly for the first time you might want to visit one of the "beat" Philly cheesesteak places in town. However, I normally don't partake in these places for fear of "the hype" being overrated but this time we decided to try it out.

Pats and Genos are claimed to be the top places to get original Philly cheesesteaks and they are literally across the street from one another. We decided to go to the one with the biggest line (although neither had much of a line at the time we went) so nevertheless we went to Pats

We ordered a Philly cheesesteak and we both were underwhelmed. The fries are already made and are sitting on a stand already in a cup so as you can imagine they were cold. The cheesesteak wasn't very cheesy or flavorful. Overall, I think I ate a few disappointing bites and then called it quits. Tossed it in the trash and headed to go get something good to eat. Also, the staff wasn't friendly or helpful and maybe that is what is to be expected, I'm not sure but it was pretty disappointing. My takeaway from the experience is you can't win them all, I guess I can say I tried the "famous" Pats King of Cheesesteaks. ‍
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: & the Winner is... Pats!!! Kinda rude at the window... But steak sandwich was good, Cheese fries were the Bomb!  We had an awesome time having our own little taste battle.  Pats was the clear winner, 6 out of 6 voted for Pats. Keep up the good work guys, and thanks for the delicious food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Oh ya! Came here to try the king of steaks...and I knew I made the right f*c*ing decision lol...found parking right on the sidewalk of this establishment. ...just hearing the people talk made me feel at home, a lot of yelling and bad mouth...5 stars right off the back...now to the ordering...you have two windows, weird as shit but okay feed me...one window to order your cheesesteak and the other for fries and drinks lol...had my cheese steak with wiz and onions and I effed it all up with there skinny fries....met a magician this day and the dude at the register window asked what he was...a magician ...asked if he knew this trick...make himself disappear lmaoooo...I died laughing...coming from a jersey city guy, pats made me feel at home with the way they act and simple order just to get my meal to me asap
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not a bad place to do the tourist version of getting a cheesesteak of you are visiting Philly.  It is almost a right pf passage to come here and compare to Geno's across the street.  Definitely more of a tourist type place, its a fun experience.  My favorite thing to do when I have friends visit is to get a cheese steak here and at Geno's (especially since a lot of out of towners insist on going to these two places since it is so hyped up for visitors) and split with friends...this way you can do the whole "taste test" thing and decide which place you like better.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Speak any language you want and come over to Pat's for a real cheese steak!  

Screw Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Blows Geno's out of the water. My fiance shared a cheese steak with onions and cheese wiz at both Pat's and Geno's. Pat's uses the chopped method when it comes to their meat. Pat's is cheaper by 50 cents than Geno's and you get way, way more meat. The bread is also a little chewier and you can actually taste the cheese on this sandwich. Definitely beats out Geno's any day for us Wisconsinites! Just make sure to bring cash!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Looking for a cure for constipation? Look no further!

Sometimes people just keep coming back to places because that's where they've always gone or they're new in town and rely on advice from strangers. Here's how to tell what kind of cheesteak you will like:

1. Meat sliced or chopped? Pat's is chopped, which I find to be a cover-up for a poorer quality beef.

2. Cheese or whiz? You can order provolone, but they use Whiz, which is about as close to cheese as Coffeemate is to milk.

3. A good roll. Nuf said.

4. Grease factor. My sandwich was unbelievably greasy; I used 10 napkins just to keep grease from spilling from the table onto my lap.

5. How clean is the restaurant?
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was ok. The meat was sweetened with the red and orange peppers, and I enjoyed the fries. But the bread was spiffy immediately upon receiving the sandwich. No parking, and seating was extremely limited.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
So I'm walking home after an awesome night of karaoke.   Its midnight, which I guess technically makes it Monday morning, I have to leave for work in 7 hours, and I'm effing starving.  Oh, and by the way, its the middle of a blizzard.  So I get close to home, and there, shining like a beacon, are the two cheesesteak battleships of Passyunk Ave, Pat's and Geno's.
I round the corner, and the decision is before me.  Under the most inhospitable conditions, Geno's stands alone, bright lights and neon, but only employees in sight.  Through the whiteout haze, I can see that Pats has half a dozen people in line.  If waiting in line during a driving snowstorm while a competing neighbour is line-free doesn't make for a ringing endorsement, I can't think of what does.
I order a whiz wit, and then add the ketchup and hotsauce.  Perfection.  Of course, my brain and my palette know it's a vile, grease drenched pile of chuck on a sponge like roll, but for the time and place, thats the point.  I've had way better steaks, but those aren't an option right now.  In the here and now, Pat's is exactly what I needed.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I was given a chance at the 'cheesesteak' challenge (Pat's vs Geno's) and had to take it.  

We were passing through and thought, 'Hey, let's stop for cheesesteaks'!

I ordered a cheesesteak 'wit' (which means with onions), and added mushrooms, and provolone.

The service was very quick here and the employees don't mess around.  If you start asking questions, in their mind...you are just holding up the line....it's pretty funny to sit and watch people order....

I opened the wrapper and....no magic fairys flew out.....it looked like a regular cheesesteak....I was a little bummed, but I ate it anyway.

In all honesty, it was just ok.  I have had better cheesesteaks in SoCal...
The bun was soft, the meat was nice, and the veggies too, but there was no binding ingredient to make it come together.  The provolone slices were thick and cold, and that also hurt the sandwich score.  Normally, I am a 'contrast of textures and multi temperature' guy, but in this case, melty cheese would have been better.....should have gotten the whiz?

Just ok sandwich but fun experience.....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Better then Geno's but still disappointed.. both does need lead up to the hype.. overrated!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is one of the few food destinations in America that deserves a pilgrimage -- so we made one, on the way back home to Illinois from the D.C. area. We were lucky enough to get there during off-peak hours so we didn't have to wait in a long line. As a non-Philadelphian, I wanted to make sure I knew how to order the famous cheesesteak. They've got a handy guide next to the window, and I did my best. They seemed to understand what I wanted so I think I succeeded, but I suspect there was probably something I fumbled there. 

I ordered a "cheese wit," a cheesesteak with onions. Not wanting to mess with tradition, I got it with Cheez Whiz. That sandwich sure validated the extra travel time home. I love simple sandwiches, especially with the basics I love and none of the things I don't. That said, a sandwich with delicious thinly sliced ribeye, gooey "cheese," and sauteed onions goes straight to my heart (and definitely to my stomach). The bread did well to hold everything in and was waxed with a nice layer of grease, a mark of a good sandwich, so says the Fresh Prince at least. (He counts as a Philadelphian, no?) 

Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches, though my girlfriend and her dad are still partial to Chicago's Italian Beef. Nevertheless, the sandwiches were so good that we didn't even venture across the street to Geno's, even with all of its glitzy glory.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Just a tad bit better than Genos. The cheesesteak was warmer but still bland. No flavor at all. There's a bunch of places where you can get much better cheesesteaks that take credit cards, nicer, and have parking. Pats and Genos are just tourist attractions.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
On our stops during our trip to the East Coast, we stopped by this place to try. We read about Pat's and Geno's, so we tried both. The sandwiches were good but the cheese whiz tasted watered down and was missing quite a bit of flavor. The fries were good. It was a bit odd that fries are ordered at a different window. Also, keep in mind if visiting, this place is cash only. Have cash ready to pay for your food as there is no ATM on site. There is an ATM across the street at the bar/pub entrance. 
I tried the original steak sandwich with cheese whiz.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Overall fantastic experience! We parked in central Philly and ubered here. We tried both Geno's and Pat's and I must say Pat's is better! Pat's has more cheese and the bread really absorbed the juicy flavors. The wrapping was great and contained the oils whereas Geno's leaked through and actually burned me through my shirt. Yikes... 
Pats's has a delicious onion and pepper blend and the meat tastes authentic and not cookie cutter. TIP: when ordering just say "with" after your order to imply that you want onions. That's what the locals seemed to do. 
Also, JUST CASH is accepted. The aesthetic is very traditional and you really feel like a true philly goer when eating this sub! Highly recommend, but try them both for your own judgments!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Awful.  The steak was greasy, grizzly, and flavorless.  The woman who took our order was a pushy bitch.  The place was filthy.  It has gone significantly downhill since we were here two years ago.  With so many great steak places in Philly, I doubt we'll be back.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
You better talk the lingo or get back in line. Good thing we had someone in our crew from Philly and took us to good ol' Pats. There's a line no matter what time you go. Prices are good but you better know the lingo.
  Parking is all around. Philly cheesesteak was good. Very cheesy obviously. So if you're a fan of cheese definitely try the whiz cheese. It is pretty fulfilling. I was in Philadelphia and just had to try it... no regrets at 3am in the morning but Cali time Midnight so I was good!! Lol. Make sure you know what you want or get back in line
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
There have been battles and brawls won and lost over which house of Cheese Steak is best in Philly. After watching a recent Anthony Bourdain show which featured the two Philly Cheese Steak giants, I knew I wanted to come see the battle myself. On my most recent weekend trip to Philly, my friends and I drove over to partake in some cheese steak tasting.

If you're in the vicinity of these two Cheese Steak palaces, all you have to do is sniff the air to know you're nearby. The smell of cheese, onions, steak, and oil is very distinct. You might even feel your mouth start to water. Since this is Pat's, you don't have the neon lights blazing in your face. The way the menu is set up, you need to glance at the big words on the wall... pick your stuff and quickly order once you're at the window. Pat's basically puts up a "how to order" guide and makes it quite easy for you to put together your options... wit (out) onions... then wit what cheese, pay and then wait for like a few seconds before your sandwich quickly appears. Pat's is no joke, they have this cheese steak making process down to a science. 

I feel like this type of food is best reserved for eating after a night of boozing. However, if you are like me, and want to see which is the better of the two, I prefer Pat's for sure. My friends Kelly C., her bf and I each shared cheese steaks from both places so that we could have a comparison... hands down we all love Pat's and believe his is the king of steaks! I don't think it's the best in the whole world.. but for the Pat's vs. Geno's  battle, come see for yourself firsthand, but we stand by Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I just moved here from Miami, and I didn't know cheese steaks could be this good!!!

They taste even better when you are leaving a bar at 2am, although the lines are long this time at night, its worth the wait!!!

A trip to Philly isn't complete without coming to Pats!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
South Philadelphia born and raised, at pat's king of steaks is where I spent most of my days.
Sure people will tell you it's a favorite of tourists, but there is a reason! It's delicious!
Bring your appetite and a Philadelphia attitude and know if you want it wit or witout before you get to the line. 
Load up on the deliciousness before you get sent to live with your auntie and uncle in bel air.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The original! 

Pack the steaks less tight, golly. A bit on the greasy side but it's Phila bro. Order with cheese, or onions. Bring a flask of booze..

Rebel review: 3
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Normally the presence of grease, cheez-wiz, provolone and surly service in the same sentence dooms the offending establishment to the Yelpian oblivion of zero stars. However, when you're navigating Philadelphia's famous quadrangle of Passyunk Avenue where Pat's and Geno's cheesesteaks ladle their magic out by the ton, they easily become your favorite meal of the month. 

Normally, you wouldn't get me near canned mushrooms much less the science experiment they call cheez-wiz but together they conspire to delight my pleasure center even though they bring more greasy ooze to Philly than a convention of Elvis impersonators.

I prefer Pat's but just barely. Truth is I love them both. I'm just waiting for McDonald's or Wendy's to discover the Cheesesteak and turn it into a test kitchen abomination wolfed down with gusto in flyover country. Am I the only one who thinks the McRib sucks. Besides, I still haven't forgiven Sarah Lee for ripping the soul out of the humble bagel. An easy five stars when only the original will do.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
YO Geno, in the battle of the cheese steak on "E Passyunk Ave" I command you to kneel before THE KING!, 

ALL HAIL KING PAT!

Pat's offers you a mouth watering sauteed meat in bun, smothered in onions & provolone. OK, I know some of you fools like WIZ, but hey its my review not yours and I dig provolone! Grab a coke & some fries with that order and BANG your set! 

I'm sure you would need OBAMA CARE if you ate here more that once a week but then again OBAMA CARE is "FREE" so you should have some spare change for 2 of them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've always loved Cheese Steaks sandwiches so imagine my anticipation of what was to be my first official Philly Cheese steak! My friend who was going to Uni in Philly at the time brought me to Pat's and all I recall is her coaching me while we were in line to ensure I ordered the right thing as to not piss off the folks who work there. She told me to either order a Whiz-wit or a whiz-wit-out. Uh...how come I couldn't order a provolone-wit? I was told Whiz is the way to go so I went with the whiz and that would have been a fine choice if the meat tasted better. The meat tasted too bland and too much like meat. i prefer my meat seasoned. 

Next time, I'm getting a provolone-wit or trying out Geno's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: By far, best cheesesteak in Philly....or America. The first. The original. The only. Tradition tastes better at Pat's!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: So far Pats Reigns Supreme! Their sandwiches are juicy and succulent! Geno's tend to have a drier sandwich. What else can I say!!! ??
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bring some cash and get ready for an awesome cheese steak. There is an ordering code posted before you order. I use it, never seen someone not use it and them say anything but go with the lingo. 

Service is fast, about as fast as you pay the man he hands you your order. But is about 10 bucks for a cheese steak so make sure you have the cash!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's is my favorite cheesesteak place in all of Philly. I know that so many people have such varying, strong opinions on which place has the best cheesesteak in Philly, which just means that it's a very personal choice--and I guess this review gives me the opportunity to explain mine.

First off is the food - which is the real reason why we are here, right? To me, Pat's steaks are perfection - it's meaty and pretty lean and flavorful, the bread roll is delicious, the cheese is always on point, and those bursting red cherry peppers seal the deal for a great sandwich. The fries remind me of crispy, thicker Burger King fries, which is awesome in my book (they seem to be coated with some kind of sparse batter that adds to their crispness). 

My own particular "pièce de résistance' is the basic cheesesteak wit onions and provolone. It's a testament to how good this item is when I don't need to order it as a pizza steak (which is my typically favorite cheesesteak sandwich). Sorry Philly diehards, I'm just not a cheese wiz kinda guy, and never will be. 

Which leads me to point #2 - my mind is stimulated, my tastebuds are happy, and my tummy is full when I leave Pats. IMHO $11 is getting pricey for a cheesesteak, but at least I'm content when I'm done with my meal here. You just can't underestimate how much that particular mix means to a consumer. If you feel more fulfilled after shelling out your hard-earned dollars, then it's a great place to be. As I sit in the outdoors seating with friends, basking in our glow of grease digesting through our arteries, we have great chats through the energy of tons of people that swirl around us.

And point #3 being that Pat's location is vibrant and energetic. Sure, Pat's is a tourist trap; but it's easy to deal with when you've enjoyed the food and it's a fun to place to be with happy tourists abound. I guess this is why Pat's has a long history here in the City - because it's genuine and people are drawn to it because of that. Even Pat's building is much more modest than Geno's neon-clad pretentiousness (I don't mean to start a civil war here!). Pat's may be a tourist trap, other places may arguably have better quality ingredients overall, but there aren't many places left in the city to get a fun cheesesteak experience for under $11. 

There are very few spots in this City that I think of as my 'happy places' - places that balance delicious food with reasonable prices and great surroundings - but Pat's does happen to be one of them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Place is dope, definitely more user-friendly than Gino's. I felt like Pat's has been doing Steaks consistently classic forever and that's why I chose them.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Not a Philly native. My first and last time here. Ordered my cheesesteak with extra American cheese. Meat was flavorless. Was disappointed to say the least. I will definitely be sticking to a Dalessandro's (worth the drive & line.)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Out of all the icons serving Cheesesteak in the Brotherly Love mecca we were taken here as guests. Tuesday early dinner. Line was only 6 or so long at the the time. 

Got one wit wiz and an orange soda. Grabbed a picnic table and sat down to eat.

Bread was very good. Steak with onions and wiz were just ok. Table of girls next to us had split up and tried Pat and also Geno's ones and declared Geno the "winner". 

Fries ok, hot and crunchy. Cash only so leave credit card in your wallet.

Would return once I hit the rest of the places with supposed best in Philly. Jim's would be next.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Another 3000 yelp restaurant!

I'm a firm believer that Pat's deserves 5 stars. The cheesesteak is that good. Fries are also amazing. The reason this is a 4 star review is simply because of price - fries cost $5! I'm sorry but we're not in NY. Clearly overpriced banking on this tourist attraction. Also there is limited seating because of its popularity. 

Definitely would recommend, and definitely will visit again. However only for take out!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My family and I were visiting Philly to see my cousin graduate. We figured that having a Philly cheese steak was essential to any visit here. So after a fun day of exploring we stopped at Pat's King of Steaks!
They were fast and effective. Not the most hospitable, but that can be neccessary at some of these busy places... and it was busy. 
We had 3 hot dogs and a philly cheese steak with the works (I added some spicy peppers. It was great! I do recommend getting extra cheese, because the standard left me wanting more.

I would recommend this restaurant.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Part 1 of the Pat's vs. Geno's challenge. Yes, very touristy. I had the provolone cheesesteak with onions. This was the winner. The initial eye test did not favor Pat's. The bread was thinner and the steak pieces were smaller. The price was $1.50 more expensive. Good thing the visual is just the first thing. The taste was incredible. The steak had better seasoning. The bread was the right size as a carrier without filling you up. The onions were caramelized to perfection. If you need to choose just one go with the original...Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I visited here while I was in Philly on business, because everyone said that it was a "must visit" experience. I have to admit, the food was great - the ultimate comfort/treat food, and really affordable too. The only problem is, the noise. I visited during lunch time on a weekday and the place was packed, so it was hard to find a seat. It was really noisy too.

Service was quick, and the food was filling and tasty. I would have preferred eating somewhere quieter, though.

If you're in the area and fancy an authentic fast-food experience, this is a nice place to eat, but it's not somewhere you'd go for a formal meal. Maybe I just had the place described to me badly since I'm not from the area, but I'd just like to emphasize that it IS fast food.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I know Pat's and Geno's are tourist traps, which I usually hate and avoid at all costs. But I've always wanted to try them both. So I pushed the tourist trap embarrassment aside and went all in. 

Pat's bread is as expected. Nothing spectacular but soft yet hearty. The meat isn't super flavorful. Better than Geno's, but still very little seasoning. This won't go down as the best cheesesteak of my life, but it's fine enough. 

Pat's wins the battle for me between these two.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
What's the difference between Pat's King of Steaks and Seinfeld's The Soup Nazi? Well, at least one is led to believe that the Soup Nazi's venerable restaurant offers good soup. Pat's King of Steaks most certainly offers mediocre food with Soup Naziesque service that is as unnecessary as it is uncharming. Being barked at in a line of 50 at 3 AM when half the line is drunk? Understandable! But being barked at--like my party and I were--at 1:30 PM when the line was never more than two deep? Unacceptable.

Could Philadelphia host one of the world's greatest dining tourist traps? Yes, Sir!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: One of my fav for a philly cheese steak- must order with onions and wiz cheese....if you haven't been here, it's outdoor seating and no public rest room and across from Gino's...place it pretty iconic...you have to park on the street.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Soo .... Infamous Philly cheese steak sammiches were a complete letdown.  I suppose I shouldn't have expected too much from a sandwich drizzled in cheese whiz but I just had to know what the hype was all about.  Long lines, cash only, hot weather, and less then ideal sanitized condiments seem to be the name of the game.  Find some seating with a random person to enjoy your $10 sandwich and now i can say that I have enjoyed a Philly cheese steak sandwich in Philadelphia.  Bragging rights aside I probably wouldn't return, but still recommend one goes if one would also like said bragging rights.   Cheese whiz on anything should be outlawed.  Am curious if the provolone would taste any better?  It was an experience :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Today was my first time in Philadelphia, and the first thing my boyfriend and I did was fall into some tourist traps. I had back-to-back cheesesteaks wit whiz from Pat's and Geno's. Sure, I've had better cheesesteaks elsewhere. If I'm just comparing the OG's though, Pat's was hands down the clear winner for me.

I ate Pat's first, but I knew instantly after one bite of Geno's that I liked Pat's much better. The cheese whiz was salty and flavorful. I honestly didn't think that Pat's cheesesteak had much seasoning to begin with, but the cheese whiz was the saving grace of the sandwich. Pat's has my vote for the great cheesesteak debate.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tried both Pat and Geno's. Both of us agreed the cheese and bread is better at Pat's. Do the taste test and try one of each. You really can't go wrong with either one.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Fiancé was so hyped about Pat's, he was raving about it all day while driving. Although I was annoyed by it, I actually held a reasonably high expectation after hearing, oh it was on tv, oh it's so popular, blah blah blah. We made it finally and got lucky scoring a parking spot right in front. He was super duper stoked by then. His eyes lite up like a little kid. We got in line and ordered the usual. 2 cheesesteaks and a side order of fries. 

WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!!! It is totally overrated. The cheesesteaks are mediocre, and it is definitely all about the hype, not taste. We both agreed it didn't even tasted as good as the ones from home (Los Angeles) I didn't even finish mine simply because I didn't want to eat it anymore. We got our orders literally right after we paid, which stated everything was pre-made, the meat wasn't even hot, and there's barely any cheese. The fries was total garbage, one word, soggy. The table behind my fiancé was completely mesmerized, I was thinking and wondering to myself if his tastebuds were dead. The only reason why I'm giving it 2 stars is the AYCE jalapeños and salsas. 

I hear Geno is even worse so don't even bother. Just check out their reviews. These 2 joints are definitely all about the hype. If you want real good cheesesteak, hit the Reading Terminal, Carmen's is the way to go. I'd say best cheesesteaks in Philly that we've tried.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Great cheesesteak! Line moved quickly and efficiently. It was $11 for my cheesesteak with onions and cheese. Also tried Geno's which was comparable. There are tables to sit outside and enjoy your sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: It was okay meat needed more seasoning, best thing to me was the cheese fries. I guess I expected more for all the hype.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The rivalry between Geno's and Pat's has been going on for quite some time from what I understand and on my trip to Philly this past weekend I made it my mission to try both and determine a winner. Unfortunately for Pat's... Geno's won but let me explain why ill sum it up in three main categories meat cheese and bread.

Meat:
Pat's: The meat at Pat's is shredded and there is a bountiful amount 
Geno's: The meat is sliced and extremely tender

Cheese:
Pat's: way to much cheese wiz on the sandwich almost a full on cheese sandwich 
Geno's: cheese wiz wiped on the sides of the bread and just a little added to the meat

Bread:
Pat's: Soft but not as good as Geno's in my opinion
Geno's: Soft and soaked up all the juices from the meat creating a soft luxurious sandwich 

The fries here at Pat's were delicious I must say and had a great flavor over all. I also really liked their choices of soft drinks. Any place that serves birch beer is a winner in my book. Parking around here can be a bit of a bitch but that's not Pat's fault.. I just wish it was easier to find parking in the area. But hey it's all worth it in the end once you bite into that cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: If you're visiting Philly, I believe everyone must come here to at least taste where it supposedly all began.  There are better cheesesteaks in the area, but none can claim that they were the first.  Because of this, they get 4 stars from me.  And don't let the sign in front fool you, they don't send you to the back of the line if you're unsure how to order properly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Long lines for an overprice mediocre product, made and served assembly-line style are not my thing.  The meat is slathered in some gross and gooey neon-orange sauce (that is about as much cheese as I am Cherokee*) and placed into a roll-shaped piece of white bread.  It's got all the ambiance of gas-station McDonalds that got dropped into a bad frat party.  But at least there's some entertaining people-watching.  And I didn't get ill eating here.

*I am, alas, zero percent Cherokee, which is unfortunate.  But not as unfortunate as that whiz sauce.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Your boy from Philly right here! This is not a Philly cheesesteak. It is solely a tourist attraction but if thats what you're looking for, Pat's and Geno's are your main men. 
The only reason this doesn't have one star, is because they are open 24/7... huge plus when you're drunk at 3 a.m. Any cheesesteak can appear good at 3 a.m.
(Notice how most reviewers visiting from outside of Philly give it 4 or more stars, but most people from Philly give it 3 or less.. hurts our reputation of a truly good cheesesteak)
Overall not from Philly, test it out, realistically its better than whatever nastiest you call a cheesesteak back home #steak-ums
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
As a first time tourist in philly, I knew I had to come here! 

I will base my rating off of comparing Pats to Genos since they're right next to each other.
Pats bread had the perfect crunch. The ratio of meat, cheese, and bread was amazing as well. Overall, each bite was evenly distributed with deliciousness. 
The meat used much more stingy and cut up compared to Genos and had a similar consistency to bulgogi. 
Also less cheese was used.

Pat's a close 2nd compared to Genos. Some of my group liked Pats more. Overall had a good experience and would recommend it to other tourists as well
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Apparently I'm a glutton for cheese steaks and I didn't even know it.  If you've ever had a cheese steak anywhere in Chicago, you'll know they just don't compare to the original from Philly.  Now, I had never sampled a cheese steak here in Chicago, but I can tell you that I sampled four different restaurants in Philly and Pat's was by far the best.

As you can read in my review of Geno's, the establishment kiddy corner from Pat's, the xenophobic bigotry was a turn off enough to not even want to eat there, but the food was also bad.  Pat's was just higher quality, period.

The service was great.  The guy that takes your steak order is a little hard to understand, but he totally gets the job done if you make sure to read the sign that says "How to Order."  If you're ready when you get to the window, he'll mumble what he needs to and ask for your money.  Definitely not rude service and ordering is really, really quick.  Your sandwich comes out the same window, so don't walk away without it!

Proceed down to the next window to order sides and drinks.  These people were very friendly (not like the people at window #2 at Geno's) and they were interested in where I was from and that other kind of stuff.  Prices were a bit less expensive and the service is friendlier.  I'll take that (even with higher prices) over rude jerks any day.  

There's no bathroom at either establishment, so beware.  We took a cab down here and back (about $15 total), so it was worth it to go to this part of town for lunch.  There's nothing else to do here, anyway, so you may as well hold it and just go back to wherever you came from.  Definitely worth a bus/cab ride down here just to get a delicious cheese steak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The Original home of the cheesesteak, invented the steak sandwich in 1930.

Pat's King of Steaks is still owned and operated by the Olivieri family. 

The Fresh Roll, Grilled Steak, Peppers & Onions.

Eating on the street adds to the experience too.

Geno's Cheese Steaks just across the street, must have both.  Be careful choosing one over the other as your favorite, this has been known to drive a wedge between family members.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
3.25 to be exact.

Looking for a Philly Cheesesteak? Well this one is your typical Philly Cheesesteak.  Between this place and the one next to it, Geno's I'd go with Pat's. 

Pat's is known to be one of the famous Philly Cheesesteak spots, and while the cheesesteaks are not bad and a good size, there have been many other cheesesteak spots in Philly that have popped up which in my opinion serve superior cheesesteaks.  However, do not get me wrong, with all the lights and glamor here, a tourist will not be disappointed.  

As a tourist tip, make sure you order this way for prompt service:

Step 1: Mention if you want onions on your steak
Step 2: Specify type of cheese (plain, Cheez Wiz, Provolone, American, or Pizza-style) Step 3: Pay (CASH ONLY!) 
Step 4: First window is for ordering your steak only, while the second window is for fries and drinks.

My favorite steak here would have Provolone, and I like the fries here too!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
The classic, the iconic, the king... of steaks.

I've lived in Philly now for six years, and everything you've heard about Pat's is true. They are the original and they are fantastic. The service is speedy-speedy, especially because there are two windows: one for your steak sandwich, and the other is your drinks/fries. You just walk right up and order (for me, it's a whiz witout), the steak is fresh and ready to go, he slaps the whiz on the roll and in maybe ten seconds or less you're ready to go.

Something people never talk about, though, is the price... It's a little way pricey, like over $9.00 for a cheese steak, but for a taste of classic Philadelphia, it's definitely worth trying if you're in the area. The way I figure, you're not just paying for the steak sandwich, you're also paying for the right to say "I've had a true Philly cheese steak". You're paying for the ambiance, the experience... But don't get me wrong, the cheese steak itself is certainly worthy of the price.

It's definitely a little tourist-y, especially because of just how famous it is, but that's not really a problem. There's plenty of seating, and it's relatively easy to get to. If you're driving in, odds are you won't find a parking spot, but that's generally true no matter where you are in the city. But the Broad Street Line stops right nearby, so it's a nice place to have lunch if you're already out.

I don't know what else I can say that hasn't already been said among the hundreds of other reviews. Though my one review is merely a drop in the bucket relative to the total amount there are, that in itself speaks to the sheer quality of Pat's Steaks.

Be sure to join the league of people who can say they've had a taste of history and get your steak sandwich today!
