categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
OMG. I've never really had a real Philly cheesesteak before. I've been to some spots in California, and other spots, but never from where the legit stuff is at. So where do I go when I finally get to Philly? Pat's of course. Now why Pat's and not Geno's? I honestly just went with my friends' recommendation. Geno's looks pretty flashy with all them lights around it, while Pat's looks like it hasn't changed forever.

If you're coming for a quick snack, be prepared to wait in line for about half and hour, but just rest assured. It's well worth the wait. One thing that your should note is that there are two lines. The long one is JUST for cheesesteaks, while the other, shorter line is for drinks and french fries. 

Wiz Wit. Just remember those two words and you're set. Cheese wiz on a sandwich makes ALL the difference. I've had cheesesteaks with provolone and other cheeses, but cheese wiz is definitely the way to go. The guys here literally just slap the wiz onto your cheesesteak. One of these babies will run you around $9, which is so worth the money. By the time you finish waiting in line, you're ready to scarf this thing down. The meat is both juicy and loose. Because the meat is chopped up, it's easy to eat and bit into. I think I ended up killing off my cheesesteak in less than 5 minutes. I don't have much that I can compare Pat's to, but shoot, this is definitely the best cheesesteak that I've ever had. If you're coming to Philly, then this place is a must. 

Cash only here, so be prepared to come with at least $10 a person. Parking is all street parking, so be prepared to search for a spot like a hawk.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: While I was extremely disappointed by Geno's Cheesteak across the street, Pat's Cheesesteak was quite simply the bomb!   In fact, I was so enamored with my sandwich that I went ahead and ordered a second one even though I was completely full.   I figuratively stuffed my face with this bready meat & cheese goodness.   I'm salivating just thinking about it...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Walked to this infamous Philly cheesesteak joint with my bestie after the rock n roll expo. We both were hungry and ready to devour Philadelphia's staple sandwich. We both ordered a Philly cheese with provolone and onions. Then walked over to where the condiments were with mustard, hot sauce and peppers. I happily loaded my cheesesteak with every hot pepper. I immediately took a bite and it was DELICIOUS!!! Meat was tender, cheese melted, onions buttery with the right amount of grease. The peppers complimented well with this ingenious concoction. We both finished it while walking back to the apartment. I gave it 4 stars due to the soft bread. I'm a sesame hero fan with a crunch. People try it!!! don't listen to the bad reviews! Form your own opinion once you take a bite out of meat heaven!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
First time in Philly. First stop is this place!

The Line: Just make your decision in line because you will be grilled if you don't know what you want by the time its your turn. Learn the jargon! 

Food: I love cheesesteak so I love this place. The cheese wiz sauce is awesome and thats really all you need to know because thats all you should get first time here!

Overall: Tourists welcome please come here bc I know you will anyways.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Love the sandwich  philly wit came to pick up after a Philly Sox game.Bring cash and trying to park was crazy a native a from Houston .Didnt get Pa no beer from a convenient store was okay had a good time in Pa.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Given that this is definitely one of those tourist spots, I don't go outta my way to grab a steak from Pats but when I am in the area, I don't venture out here unless it's like 1:30 am on a Tuesday night just to avoid a crowd of sorts. 

But like I said, Pat's is a tourist spot as is Genos but I'd highly recommend anyone to grab a steak from Pats before they swing onto Genos for the sole reason that Pat's steaks are chopped oh-so finely and is full of flavor whereas Genos gives you a legit slab of meat plus cheese.  

I'm not saying that Pat's is the be all, end all of cheesesteaks but it does live up to it's rep and it's pretty much melt in your mouth goodness. 

Whatever you heard about the staff is probably true. The staff's pretty intimidating but it's probably for show.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The cheesesteak is great. Make sure to get lots of cheese whiz. The only problem is the safety of the location. But it's worth it if you are ordering off GoldBelly.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Tourist attraction, but rightfully so, these guys technically invented the Philly Cheesesteak. This place is much more classic and simple (nothing like Geno's). But like Geno's their seating is covered picnic tables wrapping around the building. Although the rolls at Geno's across the street may be a little better the sandwich and the steak is better here at Pats. So come here so you can say you've been to the birthplace of the sandwich but if you want shorter lines and more food for the money go to a better cheesesteak place like Tony Lukes.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Eh...

I could honestly just end the review there. Pat's, the King of Steaks? Perhaps more like a naked Prince Harry? That works. 

Being that its notoriety spans the globe, I suppose I just expected more. It wasn't awful, but it definitely ranks in the bottom percentile among other cheese steaks I've had everywhere outside of Philly. 

On the plus side, it was as fast as a greased pig getting my order, even though the line spanned about 20 deep. For a quick bite, their execution was flawless. As for the taste, not so much....
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: A tourist trap 100%. I came from San Diego in hopes to find some good cheesesteaks, San Diego has way better cheese steak than this place. Very bland food with pats, it's so bland that's why there's ketchup station
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Had to come as a tourist. Over hyped. Cheesesteak was dry and average taste. Get the fries! Those were delicious. Wait time in like is about 10 mins but you get your food right away. There's outdoor seating around the entire locations.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
If you're going to order the standard, classic Philly cheesesteak you can only order it one way: wiz with.

I was staying in Philly for the weekend and got in a little late so my friend and I decided to grab cheesesteaks from Pat's and Geno's. Honestly not my first choice, but they are both open 24/7 so it was the first that came to mind so late at night. 

I was surprised to find that a cheesesteak was $10, but shrugged it off. Pat's is most certainly a tourist spot, but it's not a trap. These cheesesteak are most definitely original Philly-style cheesesteaks and won't shatter any dreams. 

Are they the best? Probably not. Do they satisfy my cheesesteak craving? Yes. 

That being said, Pat's is much better late at night than during the day. There is almost no line and, more importantly, the steak is chopped to order. This makes for a less-dry and tenderer steak. The onion's aren't too overwhelming and mingles well with the wiz. Some complain that there is too much wiz and not enough onion; they should try Geno's. 

Pat's is better in my book, but only marginally.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Unfortunately, not the best cheesesteak I've had during my time in Philly (See my favorite at By George! in the Reading Terminal Market). But I'm a Pat (my bf is a Geno). 

I liked the shredded beef and onions. Got with provolone but definitely get the cheese whiz since it adds flavor and salt to the sandwich.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Bring your cash!!!! Cash only. 
Awesome cheesesteaks! My favorite place for some unhealthy food in philly! The meat is juicy and sooo flavorful. Every bite was a good bite that I wanted more and more. The classic cheese whiz was just as amazing as the mushroom-pepper cheesesteak. 

The people here ate not as nice as at Geno's because they didn't cut the cheesesteaks into smaller portions for us when asked. 

Ay, good food but not so nice service hmmmm...Geno's or Pat's for future visits???! decision decision!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Be ready to order when you get to the window, or else.....
As for the cheesesteak , it is really fresh and the bread is perfect.  The steaks get cold fast but still taste great. Don't expect indoor seating or even a bathroom, but be prepared for a long line which can wrap around the building on occasion.  If it 's you first time to Philly you must make this iconic restaurant a stop.
Oh... and they are open all night!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Occasion: Touristing it with the husband

Eat Geno's first and get it out of the way. Pat's is better, there shouldn't even be a competition. I enjoyed the sandwich for what it is. Definitely liked the way they chopped up the meat and preferred their bread (crunchy on the outside but soft without being too chewy inside). Also I am a fan of the cheez wiz. You must also get a side of fries wit wiz. Might as well.

Also we walked from Old City to South Philly round trip and recommend it. It might help you feel less sh*tty later.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
My girlfriend and I took a three day trip to Philly - our first time, so why not try cheesesteaks.  I tried Campos - very, very meh - so on a friend's recommendation I decided that we should try Pat's the next day.  

What can I say?  I've been to Philly and had a cheesesteak and I never have to again - I can make better with frozen steak-ums and rolls at home.  They don't season or marinate anything - onions are in little bits, so you get an occasional chunk here and there - should be in half-rounds and carmelized - they are not.

I'm astounded that people give these incredibly mediocre sandwiches 5 stars -- and yes, their attitude at the counter sucks...
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We stopped in Philly for a quick lunch and decided to do a taste test of sorts. Pat's vs Geno's. I got a Pizza Cheesesteak w/ provolone and Mushroom, Pepper wit Cheesesteak, coupled w/ cheese fries. I had high hopes that Pat's would win. Here's what I liked - the bread hands down better than Geno's but the steak lacked flavor, however, plentiful and tender. Now their cheese fries were by far amazing.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Pat's was our first stop during this quick weekend getaway.  Our goal was to eat at most of the recommended cheese steak venues.   Once we exited off the highway, we googled our way to the competing corner of Pat's and Geno's cheese steak houses.

Parking was easy to obtain via side streets.   We had read about the 'ordering process' wanted to get with the game.  Thanks to fellow yelpers, I did oblige and order with wiz.   Cheese Wiz is not exactly on my list of 'must try', but it sounded like the thing to do.   AND, I must say, these cheese steaks are not cheese steaks without that WIZ.   I was an immediate fan, in fact, I often thought I did not get enough wiz.   

Pat's is my #1 choice for this weekend.   The plus side was the dry bun.  The others places had wet buns which made it difficult to enjoy.  Pat's had a good ratio of meat to bun.   The onions were extremely large and the wiz was quite flavorful.  

They have outdoor seating but it was too windy and cold so enjoying the sandwich in the car was our only option.   Ordering and food delivery was very quick.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Ordered wit wiz = cheesesteak with onions and cheese wiz. The only way to order in philly from a guy not from philly. Pat's bread is softer and fresher than Geno's. Pat's uses more cheese wiz - a good thing. 

Pat's is the winner - higher cheese content And fresher bread. Steak is a draw. Both are excellent. Order one then the other.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The original? Yes. However it is not the best!! If you are craving a cheese steak after a night of drinking, my choice out of all the tourist spots...Jim's. If Gino's and Pat's are your only two options then go with Pat's.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I say neither, but given the choice, Pat beats Geno's everyday. 
there are a number of reasons. 

1. Pats has the dope fiends
i watched a woman nod out, each time so close to a sip of soda, only to have her head snap back, and nod out again, for my entire visit

2. ?uestlove
i was at Pat's and thought "that looks like the guy from the roots" only to realize, "that IS the guy from the roots" 

3. Booooo Geno's
neon lights? this isn't Reno. 
angry Italians? no thanks. you came over on a boat too. 
lose the attitude 

4. My middle name is Pat
and I don't know any Geno's
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Came here recently and thought it was pretty decent! Line wasn't too bad (line at Geno's was actually longer) and parking was a little annoying but we managed to find a lot somewhat nearby. The cheesesteaks were prepared instantly (and I do mean within ~5 seconds) and were a little overpriced, but that's not too surprising. They were pretty greasy but not bad! Is it the best cheesesteak I've ever had? Probably not, but I didn't regret eating it either. Importantly, there's no indoor seating, so I'd plan to bundle up if you want to eat there around this time of year :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Pats is obviously famous for cheesesteaks. It's a great place to go for food. I'd like to be able to try many places and compare them all, but for now pats is a great starting point for diving into the land of cheesesteaks in Philadelphia.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Here's how to order:

1) Wait in line with at least several of your friends (so they can help secure a table while someone else orders)

2) When you're getting close to the window, send out a friend to secure a table outside for you so you can sit and eat (the parties rotate pretty quickly after eating)

3) Place your order, saying type of cheese "Cheez Whiz/Provoline/American/etc." and "WIT" or "WITOUT" which means with/without onions.

4) Go down to the second window to order fries and drinks

5) Grab your piping hot, delicious, melty gooey cheesesteak and go to the condiments bar outside to get your ketchup on, plus your spicy red peppers, mustard, onions, etc.

6) Go and join your friends and EAT with a napkin in your hand!!

I waited about 45 minutes (the line wrapped around the building, and then some) since my tourist family was in town for Thanksgiving.

I like this place especially because of their bread, it's served toasty crispy and warm and chewy on the inside, and also their meat- they don't chop it up (like Geno's) but give it to you in big, thin slabs in the roll.  I got mine with cheez whiz, peppers and onions- SO GOOD!  Some of my family who got provolone cheese were complaining that the cheese wasn't melted at all.

The fries are good here (super crispy coated) and the red peppers they give you for free outside is spicy and good.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I am hardcore a Pats girl... Have always been, will always be. I like mine WIz-Witout. The prices are high-because its a tourist attraction but it is ALWAYS worth it. The best part is that is open late night. :)
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I'd give it a 0 if I could, or even suggest that Pat's give me a star for taking the effort to write about the sloppy low grade sandwiches they make. Very low quality with a very high price. Not sure why anyone makes a trip here. Lots of great and quality sandwiches in Phila. Pat's is not on this list.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
There are better reviews below, so keep scrolling.  My 2 cents is that:

1)  I am so glad that I live nowhere near this place.  This is THE perfect hangover food, replacing pho in my book.

2)  Omfg, my mouth waters just thinking about it.

I had the whiz..  It was good.  I inhaled it.  My tummy hurt.  

The end.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: I need to go back here and try a few more to be able to give them more than 3 stars,  but for the culinary experience, historical significance and cheese steak sandwiches we had, 3 stars for now.  Just to note: the line and way you order is important so be ready for this.  The great debate over who has the best Philly Cheese Steak sandwich, Geno's or Pat's, is not over.  Check out my review of Geno's because we tried them both at the same time.  Fear None, Love All, and Eat Well.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We are doing a cross country trip so you have to do cheesesteaks, when in Philly! The more research we did, we were inspired to do a taste test. We were told Pat's and Geno's. I love the cheesiness and peppers of Pat's. My wife didn't like the gristle of the steak and she says it can be toothsome. I feel it adds to the flavor. Geno's for me, I felt the meat was dry and not enough cheese. My wife loved it to include the cut of steak; however, she agreed it needed to be seasoned. We tried the hot sauce and it was phenomenal bringing it home to Texas. All in all we would recommend both locations they make Philly proud.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Taking a trip up to Maine, I made it a point to stop in Philly and get a cheesesteak & I thought, what better than the original, Pat's King of Steaks. I'm not a local, so I don't care about (probably fictional) rivalry between them and the other across the street. I chose this one; and I'm glad I did. Love the fact that it's open 24 hours, because my drive put me there at 7:30 am, so I had the best breakfast ever. I ordered mine the way I think every one should, cheese whiz & wit onions. AMAZING. The steak was cooked fresh right in front of me with plenty of griddled onions and a healthy amount of cheese whiz. The bread was soft and delicious; the sandwich was absolutely perfect! Craving it even now, again in the morning. I might even make it back on my trip down! (Just don't ever want to have to drive thru New York or New Jersey ever again) thanks again for the creation & keep doing what you're doing!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Can we say tourist trap?  Yeah...but it's kind of an obligatory tourist trap you have to go anyway.  

The sandwich itself was good...but thrown together so fast since the line was already in the middle of the street, by the time i sat down to eat (no more than 2 minutes) the bread was totally soaked through with oil, cheese and onion juice it fell apart.  

So why a 3 star rating?  Because it tasted delicious!  The flavor was there, even if the juices were scalding my hands and dripping on my pants.  It could have been better if it held together just a little longer.  

Now at least i can say i had a genuine Philly Cheesesteak
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We gave into the hype of the infamous rivalry of Pat's and Geno's and got a Philly cheesesteak. Mine was a regular old cheesesteak with cheese whiz. T got a mushroom and pepper cheesesteak with provolone. To my surprise, it was just 'meh'. The only thing that made it taste okay was the cheese whiz. If I had gotten regular cheese, I don't think it would've had any flavor at all. The meat was dry and nothing special. T's was a little better since he had the extra toppings. He had to add some of my cheese whiz though since the provolone wasn't doing it. Maybe it's because we were expecting a flavor explosion and didn't get it. Maybe this is how real Philly cheesesteaks are supposed to taste, unseasoned meat with cheese whiz. At least I get to mark off my list that I got to taste a so called 'authentic' cheesesteak.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: The real deal. The best cheese steaks in Philly. Sooo good! I got mine with onions and white cheddar cheese. They also have peppers and other toppings. It's cash only! And no inside seating.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Welcome to Philly! Pats has been a longtime favorite for a Cheesesteak for decades. The Steak Sandwiches here are good, with lots of meat and the roll is sturdy and delicious. The condiments are plenty to dress up your sandwich. This is the late night and after the ballgame and after the clubs close at 2 am hangout. Every Celebrity has had a Cheesesteak here at one time or another. There used to be a competition between Pat's and Geno's, 2 Cheesesteak Mongols facing each other down directly across the street from one another. Well Pat's wins hands down, not mentioning the racial controversy surrounding Geno's. GO TO PAT'S!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
I've worked in Philadelphia for 25 years and have never gone to Pat's. Today at lunch I grabbed an Indego bike and pedaled off to South Philly. On a Thursday at 1:00, there was hardly a line, and it moved efficiently, what with the cut-and-dry ordering process. 

My "whiz wit" slid toward me, pushed by an apathetic older guy who was already on to the next customer, and I took it to one of the red metal tables on the shady side of the shop. It was smaller than expected, especially for $10. (And not cut in half, to the disappointment of anyone planning to send someone to Geno's and then do a half-and-half comparison.) 

It tasted good. Not great, but decent. It was sloppily made, with the meat scarce in spots. The cheese whiz just disappeared into it. The onions were a bit...oniony. Almost raw, but not terrible. I pulled several bits of unchewable beef out of my mouth--hard fatty stuff. As cheesesteaks go, I've had better. But now I've done it at least.

Most of the people eating there seemed like tourists. Lots of photos being snapped. Across the intersection sat Geno's, no line, lots of open seats. Next time, I guess.

My cheesesteak was gone before I knew it. I considered getting cheese fries too, but that would make my lunch $16, and I can have a decent dinner at a restaurant for that, so I just hopped back on my city bike and pedaled back to work, 2 miles away.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: We went here as tourists and it was as expected.  Lines are long and a bit pricey fur what it is.  You're pressured to make quick decisions on what you want which can lead to disappointment.  It's worth noting their default cheese is cheese whiz which is disgusting. The steak was incredibly greasy and there's almost no seating.  We walked around the fenced in park and found nowhere to sit around there either so this is probably best enjoyed if you can stand and eat at the same time.  Overall bland but I'm sure it hits the spot  if you are hung over.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text: Recommend over Geno's if your still undecided and you don't know who to listen to. Even though the cooking is a bit different. I still wait theirs! My normal preferred options are the simple with onion & Provolone cheese. Both missing mozzarella though!! Adding their banana peppers if you like it spiced is good option too! No ketchup!!
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks

name: Pat's King of Steaks
text:
Not worth the time and gas it took to get there....well if we could have only ordered the bread but I digress.

After spending $53 for the "steaks" and another $32 for three french fries and four drinks I felt like my family got robbed. The meat had ZERO flavor and the peppers and onions were just grilled peppers and onions. Not sure what people love about these mediocre at best sandwiches.
categories: Italian, American (Traditional), Sandwiches, Fast Food, Restaurants, Local Flavor, Cheesesteaks
